review_content: Stayed here with a group of family members. Our room was spacious and well-equipped. Comfortable and clean in our room as well as common areas.Enjoyed sitting out by the pool with a few drinks that we were allowed to take out there. Sadly didn't get a chance to try the pool out but it looked clean and tidy.Breakfast was good, free parking and wifi. Would return if was in the area again, though it's a bit of a drive to downtown Nashville.This 4 story hotel that is of the interior atrium design is a nice hotel. I stayed here for 3 nights last week and enjoyed my stay. Check in was easy and courteous. The atrium is very nice with an inside restaurant and bar. My 2 room suite was very good and up to the standards I expect when staying at a Hilton Suites. Parking availability was adequate. I only ate breakfast one morning and the buffet was good and plentiful with several choices. They also have an indoor pool. There are also several restaurant options nearby.When I return to Nashville I will stay here again.This weekend may have been the best sleep I have ever received in a hotel! When you get 8 hours of sleep on a Friday night and 10 on a Saturday night, that's when you know you are relaxing. I didn't think I was tired or sleep deprived when I got to Nashville, so I'm blaming (more like complementing) my stay at this hotel. A standard room includes a living room area, bedroom, and big restroom. You've got an iron, hair dryer, microwave, fridge, and coffee maker. You never need to touch that coffee maker, however, because the first floor offers fresher coffee for you to enjoy. The hotel has a pool, fitness center, and pool table, and I took advantage of all of those. If you need to host an event or party, this is a great place to do it. They have several rooms available and your guests shouldn't have a hard time booking a room, since they've got so many. For those who love to have breakfast, lunch or dinner at the hotel, they have that option. Breakfast is not complimentary, so maybe you'll want to explore one of the many cute establishments in Brentwood, about a few blocks away. I truly enjoyed my stay here and wish my bed was just as comfortable.I have to say the only pain was making reservations since they talked my husband into signing up for their "rewards" program (which is a joke) but our stay and experience here was excellent. My husband and I have five kids between us and we thought this would be a fun way to be together and exchange presents for Christmas. We had two adjoining suites which was more than enough room for all of us between the beds and pull out sofas. We ate junk, watched Elf, and enjoyed the pool and hot tub downstairs. My stepson used the fitness room which he said was really good. We had the breakfast buffet and that was wonderful!! Definitely not the nasty continental breakfast you see at cheaper places. We had to go to the front desk because we were missing two breakfast vouchers bit that was quickly resolved. The servers were very sweet and attentive. I can see us wanting to make this a holiday tradition. We enjoyed our stay so much my husband and I came here for our honeymoon. We both said we have to make this place a getaway for us along with a holiday tradition with the kids. :) When we were on our honeymoon (we stayed three nights) we had to call the front desk for housekeeping because our room wasn't tended to even though we were gone all day. But they were quick to send someone up with fresh towels and such.The hotel is clean and the staff is very friendly. Rooms seem to have been recently updated and the decor is tasteful. The bathrooms are larger than most hotels I've stayed in. I had 2 nice flat screen televisions - one in the bedroom and one in the living room. Nice desk/workspace, but the wifi was spotty. I kept getting kicked off the network so I gave up trying. The shuttle service is unreliable, but it seems to be a problem with their scheduling software. They overlooked us two days in a row after we had pre-booked and confirmed our ride to meetings across town. Luckily, we were able to track down the drivers who then saw that we were, in fact, on the schedule. We ended up being late both times, but we made it there safely. Our driver on the way back to the hotel on the first day was excellent and even arranged for a cab to pick us up and take us to downtown Nashville. Aside from the schedule confusion, the experience was great. One suggestion, please have some sort of complimentary continental breakfast for your guests. $14 (plus tip) for a mediocre buffet is a little high.This is my second time staying at this hotel. The staff is extremely friendly and the room service food was really good. I love the gym and inside pool area, plus free wifi & parking makes it all worth the stay. It's close to the interstate and downtown Nashville so that makes getting around really easy.They're currently doing renovations so it's been a little noisy but otherwise a great value whether you're on a business trip or a vacation with the family. I'll definitely be back.My husband and I worked with this hotel to get a block of rooms for guests staying in our town for our wedding last month. They were so nice to us each time we visited. The rooms are very spacious, perfect for several people to sleep in if they wanted to. I was able to get ready for my wedding in the same room that some of the guests stayed in, and everything went smoothly for me and my friends, who also got ready for the wedding in the room as well.I definitely recommend this hotel for anyone looking for accommodations for an event!We had no water for most of our stay. We were told that it was a water pressure problem in Brentwood and that it could not be helped. We later found out that this was not true and that it has happened several times during the past several months. It seems to be a unique problem to this hotel. We also had a fire alarm during the night that was a "prank" and we again heard that this also occurs quite frequently. There was never anyone at the front desk and the hotel seemed to be somewhat vacant. The rooms were not clean, nor did they clean our room during the day while we were out. I guess others had read the reviews on trip adviser before us. Do not stay here.Nice clean hotel. Room was great - spacious, clean and good layout. Bathroom was large. I didn't see any of the quality issues experienced by other reviewers. The hotel is currently being renovated. Only disappointment was we couldn't stay an additional night (last minute plans), but understandable seeing it was a last second request all of the rooms were booked. Didn't partake in the food, but it smelled good enough and $13 for a breakfast buffet is reasonable. Saw a pool table and bar. Looked nice, didn't get to use those either. Will definitely stay here again. Especially since I'm about to work near there. Will be a good transition residence. It is a little hard to find. Use GPS.very nice place. We had a good stay.  We arrived at the same time as a baseball team and we had to wait for a while to get an elevator.  we were also offered the opportunity to have snacks ready when we arrived. This was a nice touch.The first room I checked into had a bathroom that was disgusting. It had peeled paint in the shower, white goo all over the soap tray and the towels had brown marks on them. I went to the front desk and asked for a new room and the room was much better. Staff and hotel is very nice just a bad experience with the bathroom.  Being that the hotel was not at full occupancy, they could have checked people in to rooms that had upgraded bathrooms.Nothing bad to stay about this hotel. Spent 3 nights here for business mtg. Suites were spacious and clean. The hotel staff was friendly and professional. Wifi was free which is a true luxury these days and the BLT with avocado I ordered from room service was spot on. Would come back to this hotel over and over again.In my travels I always stay at Hilton properties, but I try my best to avoid full-service Hiltons and Doubletrees when possible. In most cases they are old, outdated and, while decent, just not for me. I like sparkly and new. This property may be older, but you'd never know it. Everything is updated and very nice, and the room service dinners are better than pretty much every other I've had (we're talking room service, so never great, but this one is a step up). I had a problem with my lock freezing on my door and had to switch rooms on my 2nd day, which was a pain in the ass but they handled it quickly and efficiently as someone could handle such a thing.The staff is very friendly and the price was low - $99/night for a king suite, which is well below my corporate maximum. I was skeptical based on the price (and also knowing I'd get less points than if I spent more), but it was more than worth it.Let me just say, I really do like the facilities.  The customer service...not so much...This place is clean, spacious, and well-decorated.  It was a lovely hotel, and one of the best rooms I have stayed in in a while.  We love to stay at Hilton/Hamptons.  They are really good, usually.  This trip was just...off :(The problem was, I was searching for a room for Friday/Saturday night.  We booked a double room (handicapped) because that's all that was left and we needed two beds.  THIS is where it gets bad.  We get there, and it's a gorgeous, clean suite (YAY!) but...there's one bed.  Where was my daughter supposed to sleep?So I call down to the front desk, and after a little bit of searching, she comes back on the phone and said that I must have made a mistake and booked a "double BED room" not a room with two beds.  I am 99% sure I didn't, but even if I did, they should make that WAY more clear on their website.  I never would have booked a handicapped room in the first place if I didn't think it came with two beds.She said that they could *try* and see if there was an extra roll-away bed somewhere.  Whatever, don't do me any favors.So the first night, THREE people slept in a full-sized bed.  Not comfy.  The second night, I volunteered to sleep on the couch.  Again, NOT comfy.  It sucked.  For paying well over $300 for two nights, and getting crappy customer service on top of not fulfilling our needs?  Yeah, no thanks...I am not sure I would ever stay here again.  I hear there is a fabulous Hilton right down the street I can check out.  Or maybe go with a different hotel chain altogether next time.  Hilton, you have let me down :(I stayed here the night before my wedding thanks to my awesome bestman, and this was also the hotel our guests for the wedding stayed at. Overall it is a very nice hotel and the rooms are extremely spacious. So much so they would be a con goer's dream. Sadly their event space is not big enough to support large conventions. That being said it was an amazing bargain and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for guest accommodations for an event.Newly remodeled. Stop by the bar and if Mark is working tell him Ron and Angie from Cicero Il sent you. Mark makes you feel very welcome. Mark recommended an Irish restaurant in Franklin and it was great!Love the new LG televisions, and the staff is excellent. Wifi is very reliable. Temperature was perfect.This gorgeous hotel is located on a hill in the suburbs of Nashville.  The view is spectacular.  The hotel suites are large, clean, modern and well appointed .  Staff is very friendly and helpful.  Ample parking is available.  Several shops and restaurants within short driving distance.  Fantastic option for a romantic getaway.Higher end business hotel. Room and spacious and central located. Just minutes away from Nashville, depending on traffic. Clean environment and well kept. The staff is friendly and attentive to your needs.  They have a fridge and micro wave in the rooms and a huge bathroom.We stopped here for a night on our way to Florida. We were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the hotel considering the low price ($120 for a king suite).  The room was recently renovated, well appointed, clean and spacious. Ample room for us and our three children (one in a pack n play). Super comfortable beds and great water pressure.The worst possible Hilton you can stay at. The rooms are worn out. There is paint coming off. The staff here is the worst I have ever encountered. It's just huge nothing else. I would give it a negative rating if it was allowed.
review_content_20: The rigamarole of check-in is incredibly unaccommodating for guests in multiple parties. Even though we were part of a group of rooms purchased under one family member, despite having proof of ID and the family member having purchased the rooms already having shown proof of payment, we were unable to sufficiently prove our identity, despite providing a confirmation code, and this were made to wait in the lobby for the ticket purchaser to make their way across the city to allow us entrance to the room. I understand methodical verification, honestly. But to sit and watch a couple sit awkwardly in the lobby for half an hour, bags in tote, waiting on someone to arrive with a credit card that has already been charged is poor form and counter intuitive.Part of customer service is, in my opinion, requires one to ignore the rigidity of protocol every once in awhile when it presents an unnecessary and illogical frustration for the guests and patrons.It was very clean, lovely,  had lots of space and comfortable. The customer service was good too. I had a broken iron and it was replaced in less than 2 minutes after I called to complain. I had a bourbon cocktail at the bar that costs only $5.50!!! There was free parking and free wi-fi too. I definitely recommend and will return to stay.Can not understand the poor reviews this is a very nice hotel clean great staff this is my second stay this month I travel quite a bit for business and this is a notch above what I expectNice place for the money and location. Lots of kid noise at times. Pool is small. Wireless is unreliable.This is a gem of a hotel. A home away from home. Clean and comfortable, great service and a good price. Make sure to stop and se Mark the bartender, he is a great guy and a pleasure to deal with!It's really a nice hotel, great amenities at a great price.  The breakfast buffet is expansive and quite good, but half a point lost for having tube TVs (blasphemy in this HD age!) and another half a point off for not telling me about the graveyards surrounding the property!It's in a great location, but it's not all that it's hyped to be.  The A/C in the room was horrible, it never really cooled down.  Let kids run up and down the halls.  Didn't use the pool because it was literally full of kids.  The staff was great, but not very knowledgeable.  Lighting was also an issue.  It was very dark in the bedroom and bathroom.  The shower was small and mine leaked water from the shower head.Great place to stay if you're in the Brentwood area. It is conveniently located close to everything you could need. They offer fast dry cleaning services. The place was nice and clean. It is a bit far from the entertainment of downtown Nashville, but that is not what I was there for on this trip. I recommend.

review_content: Stayed here for 5 nightsMixed review here:Pros: Cheap, Quiet, Free Breakfast (7-9) and Wi-Fi, a mile from Broadway.Cons: Bedboard was broken (couldn't sleep on left side without falling off), phantom noises from the plumbing at all hours of the day/night, a piece from the drain of the shower has been sitting on the tub for the duration of my stay (didn't effect showering though), random times for housekeeping, the walk to Broadway is sketchy (especially at night), and it's kinda in the middle of nowhere without much to do within a mile.Bottom line, this is a budget hotel. If you don't want to spend a fortune, this place isn't half bad. Feels completely safe within walls and on Broadway, but the between is pretty sketchy day or night. I would recommend getting an Uber/Lyft/Taxi, about $5 ride to Broadway or back.We booked this room because it was convenient to downtown, under $100, and offered a safe place to sleep and shower for the night. I had few expectations, which is probably a good thing.Pros:-Not too expensive-Conveniently located-friendly staff-The WIFI was free and good enough to let me stream Netflix (which is great because TV reception was piss poor)-police stationed in the parking lot (probably a good thing, given the area)Cons:-The lobby smelled awful. I couldn't wait to get out. -The room smelled strange- like a clean diaper-There was a strange brown stain on the top blanket. We just removed it- there were no problems with the other blankets or sheets.-The area is really sketchy.-The walls are very thin- I was awakened multiple times throughout the night by the sound of arguing and yelling, and once by the unmistakable sound of sexual intimacy.For one night it was fine, but if I were staying in Nashville for 2+ nights, I'd probably look elsewhere.Good value for money! Our room was clean, quiet and no disturbances. The swimming pool was also clean, and a great relief to have in this heat!Staff was kind to us, helpful and friendly. Greet them with a smile!Breakfast was not very good, when we arrived five minutes before nine there was nothing left. However, you are able to make your own waffles!Where do I even begin...Check in for our 4 night stay was smooth... Until we got to our room. We noticed a very peculiar smell in the air. Checked out the air conditioning unit and found copious mold spores which can be found in the picture attached to this review. Went to front desk and showed the attendant the mold. Didn't say a word, just gave a blank stare and begrudgingly gave us a different room... Except...We got to the second room, which looked nice at first... only to lift the lid of the toilet to find some sort of stain from a bodily fluid of sorts. Source: unknown. Went back to the front desk and informed the attendant once again of an issue, and we reasonably asked that someone clean it. He responded by telling me that he's never heard someone complain so much in their life. He also proceeded to tell me that he had just placed another couple in our original moldy room and that they had no complaints. Great customer service response right there. The only positive note was a very nice security guard named Jesse. He not only went to find supplies and cleaned the toilet, which was not his job, but gave recommendations of restaurants and bars to go to. Once we got all that sorted out, it was alright. Cheap cab ride into the city, which was our priority, and the only reason this review receives 2 stars instead of 1. However, looking back, we would definitely pay the extra $$ to stay in the city somewhere with a hotel that does not cut corners on cleanliness and hygiene. We will NOT be staying here again.The area is grim, but it's walking distance to Broadway. The hotel itself is fine but really needs a coat of paint and a bit of a sprucing up because from the outside and afar it really looks very grim and depressing. It's not an incredible hotel but the rooms are not bad. There's a sad breakfast you can get as well. The prices are high for what it is, I was surprised how much it cost, but being downtown Nashville there aren't many options. It's okay and if there's nothing else in the area, it's fine but it's not the best of the line, obviously.This place looked abandoned from the road and the neighborhood was sketchy; we were glad we could drive anywhere we needed to go. WiFi was fine, room was clean enough, bed frame on one bed was unstable but workable for one night. We missed the 6-9am free breakfast because the desk clerk hadn't told us the breakfast hours during check-in. We chose this motel partially due to its proximity to Broadway, and it was close, but it was a drive through an industrial area. We would not stay again if we were passing through Nashville. And it did also smell a little weird.DO NOT STAY HERE!!  You know when you're looking for a cheap hotel and you just hope you don't sacrifice everything for price? That's that happens when you book here.  Say goodbye to any sense of self worth you had when you pulled into the parking lot. This place is the slums. To me it looks like former section 8 housing "converted" to a "hotel". Walk in room and do our inspect..  dirt all over the place, clearly not thoroughly cleaned. Bathroom has been flooded more than a few times as the tiles were coming apart and smelled awful. The A/C did NOT work and the fan smelled like mold. The floor is sticky, there is fluids all over the walls, the tv reception is bad, there are people pissing outside your door, and here is the best part.. tried calling the office at least 5 different times and NO ANSWER!   NoNE! This has never happened to me..  based on other reviews, I'm sure this is the managers way of avoiding issues. Do yourself a favor, spend the extra money and go elsewhere! Or plan to be taken advantage of.. $85 is simply too much to pay for this kind of experience.You get what you pay for at the Knight's Inn. Yes the room smelled weird, yes the carpet and furniture weren't in the best condition, yes the service at the hotel/motel was bad. But what can you expect when you're paying $70-$100 a night at this location. I didn't spend too much time in the room besides power napping from 3 AM till 8 AM and mixing up whiskey and cokes. If you're coming to Nashville you probably shouldn't be spending too much time in your anyway whether it's the Sheraton downtown or here you should be enjoying the atmosphere downtown, chowing on some BBQ and southern goodness, and drinking a few brews.This location could use a renovation but for the price and location not to mention $6 lift downtown it's hard to beat.Do NOT stay here. The Indian manager kicked us out at 5am l. no warning, no second  chances he just called the police straight away and we had to go.  They take your money then kick you to da curbPROS: $7 cab ride to downtown NashvilleCONS: Heavily soiled carpet, extremely strong odor of mold/mildew, dirty sheets and pillow cases, towels half the size of any normal shower towel, toilet leak with standing water in the bathroom, old worn garage sale looking furniture, fridge and microbe sitting on floor, no iron or ironing board in room, two light bulbs were burned out, and of all the wall plugs, only one was tight enough to hold my cell phone charger.Quick review:This hotel should be shut down. I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy. Dead serious! The hotel lobby smells like a dog grooming building. Just a funky/dirty smell. The attendant behind the counter was very brash. But, whatever...I just wanted my key so I could shower and head out on the town.I open the door to my room and BOOM, the smell of mold/mildew smacked me right in the face. It. Was. Strong! But again, I just wanted a place to shower and lay my head down for a few hours after a night downtown. I walk in, and immediately notice the dark soiled carpet. It felt and looked like you'd expect a carpet in an auto repair shop. Just filthy. I pulled the comforter off (like I do in every hotel) and checked out the sheets. Both pillow cases had hair on them, and one still had some odd colored stain on it. Clearly these sheets hadn't been washed after the last guest. I immediately called the front desk and asked if he could have someone bring some clean sheets up. His reply was "no, you can come get them yourself." What?! Seriously? So I walk to the front desk and he reaches down below the desk area and hands me some sheets. I took a quick look at them and noticed a bunch of dust on them like they'd been sitting on a dirty shelf for a while. I then asked for a couple extra pillow cases, and he walked away into the back office (if that's what you would call it) and grabbed two more from behind the door. I went back to the room, walked into the bathroom that had standing water all over the floor. I dried it up using a towel and finally saw that it was coming from the toilet. Their best attempt at fixing it was a ton of caulk. Anyway...I could go on and on about this place being my worst hotel experience, by far, of my entire life. My nine month deployment sleeping in a tent was more pleasant than this.Hotels are tough to review... That being said, this place fulfilled our two requirements: cheap and a short cab ride to downtown. You get what you pay for and $40 will get you a bed to sleep in, as opposed to the $100+ places you'll find downtown. There was a bit of confusion due to the incredibly rude/quiet-talker that was working at the front desk. We called on our way to ask about a AAA discount and even after asking him to speak up, he was barely audible. We decided that this would still be the cheapest/most convenient place to stay, so we went anyway. When we arrived, the incredibly rude/quiet-talker said that they could not offer us the price I thought I heard on the phone or the price online. He was incredibly unhelpful and we were becoming increasing frustrated. About to take our business elsewhere, the manager came out and took great care of us. He explained that the room were cheaper if you booked in advance online, but because of the confusion, he gave us the room for the discounted rate. He was extremely friendly, apologized for the confusion and we could tell that he genuinely cared about having our business.The room was clean and just what we needed after spending the evening checking out the town. The cab was about 5 or 6 dollars and arrived in no time. If you want to see Nashville and you're on a budget, the savings are worth it to stay a little bit out of town.DO NOT STAY HERE! This place is a total dump and that is not the worst part of my disturbing stay here. Booked this place for myself and 2 friends for 3 nights. Upon checking in, they asked for total payment of all nights. Should have known then what a scam we were getting into. Didn't pay the total upfront since no other decent hotel in history has ever had a similar policy.  We were woken up at 2:30am by the lunatic night manager screaming that we needed to pay him. Told him we would pay in the am since it was the middle of the night and was pouring rain outside and you have to walk outside to get to the front desk. Plus he already had my credit card to run on file so I asked him to simply run it. He would not. Then comes banging on our door, jars it with his foot and literally scared the shit out of us 3 girls who were in bed. Threatens to call the cops because we were "disrespectful and refused to pay". As a female in a city I have never been to this was a very disturbing experience. He proceeded to call the cops and evict us from the room. At 3am. In the pouring rain. During an NRA conversion weekend and almost all hotels booked up in the city. The cops were sympathetic towards us but said "there was nothing they could do" and would drive us to whatever hotel we could find. At 3am. In the pouring rain. Cops said this was not the first time this lunatic, non-professional, aggressive and clearly deranged night manager had pulled this same stunt with other customers. Will be blowing up social media, BBB and the owner of the hotel incessantly with my experience and to fight the 1st nights fee the night manager already charged to my cc. This place sucks. You should literally stay anywhere else then here. I had to give 1 star in order to post this warning- but they deserve zero stars.Shit hole. Charged us for 2 queens and got 2 doubles. There is s power strip on the floor! The mini fridge wasn't even plugged in. Fuck this indian shit hole. I'll be checking into the Hilton just cause of this bullshit room! DO NOT COME HERE! Plus I saw some pimps outside our room.I don't even want to waste my time reviewing this overpriced smelly motel but here is my quick feedback. The guy at the front desk was nice enough and personable. The room itself was smelly, the bathroom flooded because the shower curtain didn't function, the carpets were disgusting and the beds have bed-bugs because I'm now covered in bites all over my arms. The access to Bridgestone and Titans Stadium is decent enough, but maybe bring your own sleeping bags...Absolutely HORRIFIC customer service. Do not stay here. There is a Clarion next door. The gentlemen behind the desk was rude and off putting from the moment I checked in. Aside from a non draining tub and stains on the sheets and towels, when we called the front desk no one answered. Went down to address the issue, and the man said he ignored our call because he was speaking with a customer, and that we were passed our "30 minute" check in where I suppose you're allowed to make complaints(?). He tried calling the woman who cleaned our room, and when she didn't answer he walked us around the property (we presumed he was going to address the problem)... But he took us to find her. When he did, he reprimanded her in front of us, asked why she didn't answer her phone (she was working???), listed the complaints about our room to her... In front of my party and other mortified guests. We asked him to please stop because we were so uncomfortable with the situation. He asked why because it was her fault. When we apologized to the house keeper he turned and walked away, ignoring us when we asked why he was walking away from his customers. He turned and said he didn't want to deal with us. He also refused us any refunds or apologies. I have traveled across the country and around the world and I have never encountered such horrible customer service. If he had simply addressed the problems and not had such an accusatory demeanor, we wouldn't have minded.Thankfully when we called cooperate, they were receptive and profusely apologized for him. They intended to investigate the property, and while they cannot guarantee a refund (yes I was charged for the full nights stay leaving 40 min after we got there), to hopefully prevent this from happening to anyone in the future.Do. Not. Stay. Here.If you're looking for cheap, near downtown and clean, this is your place. The cost was around $40. There is a mini fridge and microwave, and flat screen TV. There is no coffee pot, but there is a gas station around the corner. Can fare to downtown is about $5.Great bargin if youre lookijg to be near the parties and stay cheap. Hotel is an 8 dollar cab ride from downtown and a little less than a mile walk. We used hotwire to book and we were pleasantly surprised. Rooms were clean and came with a microwave and fridge. Out tv didnt work but for this trip we didnt care. We didnt make it to breakfast because it goes from 6 to 9. Air conditioned worked great and the pool was nice. Would recommend bringing your own shampoo and conditioner though theirs is the super cheap stuff. Would totally stay again!Cheap and really close to downtown by car--that's it. If that's all you need to be happy, then you're all set! Don't expect anything more or you will be sorely disappointed. A convenient place to lay down your head with money left over to blow around town.I have definitely experienced better, but we were able to walk downtown and get a cab back cheaply. The breakfast was better than expected, the parking was plenty. It is a motel. The comforters had cigarette stains and there weren't enough towels. I also tried to tell the woman cleaning that she didn't have to change the sheets and she didn't speak English (my failed attempt at being green).Please do not stay here. We got to our room and immediately left and got another room at a different hotel - I've never had to do this before. The only good reviews on here are suspicious, as if written by the employees themselves. When we got to our room there were people who clearly had been living out of their rooms for some time. The fron desk tried to get us to double pay for the room - be aware of this, they have down this to others as well. The room it self was awful, stains on the sheets and one bed was broken. If you stay here please be safe. To be honest I would feel better sleeping in my car in a better part of town.
review_content_20: 3:00 am - Stroll in to meet the rudest human being at a front desk I've ever had the pleasure to encounter.3:01 am - Get keys to a room with no idea how to get there. Asking directions was treated with a strange eye roll and "eh". I guess it's time to wing it.3:06 am - Drunkenly staggering around the property trying to figure out how to get in. Find a Gate that is climbable. I perform a move that should have been filmed for try outs on American Gladiators and land impressively on the other side.3:07 am - My friend stabs his chest on the Gate and will complain about this for at least the next two months.3:09 am - Pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness of the room and overall layout for $45. Even in my extremely inebriated state I can appreciate a good value on my dollar. 3:30 am - Fall asleep on the floor because I don't want to sleep in the one bed with my friend and the couch is too small. Used scratchy comforter for warmth, not impressed.10:04 am - WHAT IS ALL THAT NOISE OUTSIDE THE ROOM?!10:05 am - Friend goes to investigate10:10 am - Friend comes back and tells me to look out the Window.10:11 am - Find out the motel is completely flooded and everyone in the first floor has taken shelter on the second floor where we are located.10:30 am - We decide we are leaving hotel by foot. Use the plastic bags they put the coffee cups in to wrap our electronics and stop them from getting wet in the rain and or death water.10:32 am - Entrance/Exit to the motel rooms is flooded. Gate that was hopped last night could be unlocked to let people out of the motel but the staff will not unlock it. Maintenance guy is walking around lost on the other side of the flood waters.10:33 am - Not fearing, polluted, diseased water, I walk through it to the lobby to complain. Friend decides he's going to risk impaling himself again and chooses the Gate route.10:36 am - I enter lobby to find that the office manager walked away from someone while they were in mid-sentence and has locked himself in the office unsure of what to do about the flood waters.10:38 am - I talk to a few guests in the lobby about their ruined cars in the parking lot that are now under water and decide I don't care and can't wait to leave.10:40 am - Friend doesn't accidentally mutilate himself on Hell's Gate; comes to the lobby and we start walking back downtown to Nashville.9 Months Later - Was never charged for the room. The only decent part of service in the whole thing.Staff is very rude! I was in town the same day there was a few conventions so pretty much everything was booked. I rented a smoke free room that smelled like stale cigarettes. Being severely allergic to cigarettes I'm very sensitive to it. No big deal I went and purchased fabreeze. I come back in the evening and I stared coughing uncontrollably couldn't breathe and my eyes were killing me. I went down the hall to get a pop and the machine wasn't working which annoyed me even more. I call office and the front desk was extremely rude and said nothing was open but 20 miles away. Unfortunately in the rush I forgot to pack my allergy medication. I asked the front desk if this room if smoking free he said yes but people can smoke outside the balcony. So what's the point of smoke free if it comes through the vent. Maybe the should advertise smoke free with an occasional second hand smoke that come through the vents. I had to sleep with the a/c off so I didn't smell the chain smoke (who happen to be right next door) cigarettes smoke. Maybe they should have, no smoking 30 feet away from the building or a smoke free area They do have security guards outside so that made it safer.So I never even made it out of my car to checkin. I decided to book this because of the awesome price and location based strictly off of the reviews. However once I drove up and got eyes on the place I realized I had made a terrible mistake. Unless u and whoever you're staying with has concealed carry licenses and are in fact strapped I wouldn't get out of my car. Trust me I've stayed in some shady places to try and be cheap and get the "steal/discount". This place is so ghetto and unsafe I wouldn't stay there if they told me it was free. Luckily they do have nice staff because after calling the booking.com sales associate, who then called the hotel, they agreed to refund me fully. Just spend the extra 75$ and stay somewhere close to broadway and fun/safe. Holiday Inn Express has been awesome and within walking distance down Broadway.Horrible!!!!! Dirty and ghetto!!!!! Found pubic hair in the sheets and WARNING : there is bed bugs!!!!!!!! A lot of shady activity happening around this place!There was hair on our pillows. Yuck!!!The only good thing about this place was the price. When I checked in, the guy at the front desk acted as if it was an inconvenience that I was going to be a guest there. I stood there as he told me to wait a minute as I watched him organize some papers, clean the counter off, organize some more papers, then finally hand me a paper and said, "fill this out." Wow, wish I could have been filling that out instead of just watching him take care of his daily routine. He did not seem knowledgeable about anything. The room was clean but smelled like smoke even though it was a nonsmoking room. The area was not somewhere you want to hang out after dark. After spending a night out I took taxi back and was dropped off out front. The problem is that all the rooms are around the block and not connected to the front office. By the time I get halfway to my room this guy appears out of nowhere and starts following me, walking quickly. He was clearly not a guest. I made it to my room and he broke off pursuit. The area is definitely not safe at night but the price is right for being a mile from downtown Nashville. Makes for a cheap taxi, next time I'll have him drop me at the door.Clean but dated is a good description of the rooms. It had a very odd assortment of people staying here. My view was the city skyline but within the same view, a truck storage area with random abandoned furniture. We stayed here at the last minute because everything was booked or double the price. I would not stay here again and rather pay more. My bed was comfortable but it had a wooden protrusion where I kept knocking my shin. Annoying.I walked in the breakfast room and came immediately back out because it was gloomy and lacked anything I wanted to eat.I stayed here on 11/23 & 11/24. Reading other peoples reviews made me expect the worst but I was on a tight budget and this was the cheapest I could find close to the Bridgestone. The area is not the greatest but it was too cold to walk anywhere anyway so I didn't feel like I was in danger of being mugged or anything. The room was much cleaner than I expected. It was a non-smoking room and it actually did not smell like smoke like a lot of cheaper hotels do. I checked for bugs (bed and otherwise) and no traces of them. The bathroom was immaculately clean which really surprised me. I'm a sticker on that. The only weird thing was that when I pulled my tucked sheets out, an Advil pill was in my bedding. The sheets were clean so maybe it fell out of the pocket of the maid? Anyway, no biggie. The "continental breakfast" was a joke so plan on eating out. Waffles and bread for toast but no butter and pre-peeled boiled eggs. Ummmm, I don't want anybody touching my eggs. The coffee was o.k. Yes the hotel needs a lot of updates and softer pillows but you get what you pay for.The outside of the building is above average but the room itself is pretty decent for $45. You wont find the best family friendly crowds out here but the location is only a mile away from downtown. What I was surprised to find was the EXTREMELY fast wifi. 23-25 Mbps of Wifi for the 2nd and 3rd floor. Haven't seen too many cheap hotels with that kind of wifi signal in most rooms. Have to give them a thumbs up for the wifi achievementHonestly I booked this hotel because it was one of the cheapest on hotels.com but it was a great place to stay. Budget friendly but not a sketchy place to stay at all. The room was clean and modern, the bed was comfortable. Easy check in, even late at night. Felt safe and it's close to downtown.DO NOT STAY HERE! Splurge a little and stay closer to downtown in a much cleaner and safer hotel. I had planned on staying here two nights with my girlfriend but once I saw the area, the parking lot and the room we found another hotel. Its in a bad part of town, NOT within walking distance of downtown. I booked through Hotels.com so when I went to check-out they said I had to go through them. So I called Hotels.com and they called the Knights Inn and for confirmation that I checked out and the staff at Knights Inn said I was still checked in. We were already out of Nashville by the time I knew this and it wasnt worth our time to drive back to argue with the staff at Knights Inn to try and get my money back. All in all I paid for two nights and didn't stay there more than 5 minutes. The staff isn't too bad, friendly to a point but the rooms aren't kept up and ours reeked of cleaning chemicals. Also, word of the wise...dont book through Hotels.com.Cheap hotel. What do you expect at this price? The Hyatt? Not terrible, decently clean, short cab ride to downtown. If looking for cheap and reasonable close to downtown by cab I'd recommend.Cheap place. Close to downtown. It's a no frills place but good enough for a couple of nights.OK, so I guess my expectation of a hotel for less than $50/night that is within walking distance to LP field and short cab ride to downtown isn't too high compared to others. Yes, the restaurant is closed, yes the people around were kind of sketchy, yes the front desk staff wasn't all that friendly, but for $50 we got a decent, clean room, with a good shower, and the TV worked. The furniture even seemed to be pretty new. I don't know about the other rooms, but room 101 was fine.BED BUGS ALERT. I stayed at this hotel last week and developed a terrible case of bed bugs. The staff appeared unsurprised about the infestation, and I have little hope that it was dealt with-- DO NOT STAY HERE!I would give this motel 2 stars for quality/amenities, but am adding the third star because of its location/overall value. Staff were decent but not overly-friendly. The floor wasn't very clean, but otherwise we got decent housekeeping daily. Lots of hot water in shower and sink, and it wasn't over-softened as in some places). Beds were ok but had some spots where the mattress springs were worn out. It is an older building, and you have to go outdoors to get to the front desk, etc. but I would consider that more a mark of when it was built than its quality. There was a microwave and fridge, and a decent TV. Wi-fi was really slow to connect, with no apparent reason. There was a continental breakfast but we skipped it one morning and the other morning didn't get there in time (it ends at 9). I didn't feel unsafe or bothered by other guests (no noises from the next room, etc.). The main problem in our room was with the shower - curtain didn't prevent water from getting out of the shower, so water pooled significantly on the floor, and there was some "give" under the tub at that end of the room, so water damage is a possibility (but I didn't fall through so it didn't bother me!). It is in an industrial neighborhood right on a highway, but only a mile from downtown. Very walkable during daylight hours, and I never felt unsafe, but I wouldn't recommend it at night (though it's a cheap cab ride back). That said, if I had stayed out by the airport I definitely wouldn't have been able to walk down there, and I wasn't willing to pay 3 times more just to stay a little closer, across the bridge. I grew up in a city so it just seemed "urban" to me; it is definitely not the "ghetto" that I have seen in some reviews but if you are not familiar with urban areas you may be uncomfortable. If you want to be near downtown and plan to spend most of your time enjoying what the city has to offer, this place will be fine, but if you want to hang out in the hotel playing on the internet, you'll be disappointed.Deleted prior review

hotel_name: Homewood Suites by Hilton Nashville Vanderbilt
review_content: The staff is so sweet and just always smiling!! That says a lot! Location is Great but I recommend preparing to just use their valet service at $28 a night! Extra touches in the room were so nice.... Love that there was a ceiling fan! I will be booking with this chain again!Location: conveniently located to many places to eat that are walking distance. A 24hour rite aid, the Vanderbilt university and the centinnel park. About 5-10mins away from downtown. Def pick this place if you want to avoid the noise of downtown.There's a free shuttle (don't forget to tip!) and free breakfast. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was so spacious and the bed is very comfortable. Parking is a bit pricey. The only con was that you can easily hear everything happening in the hallways from your room. I was awaken at 6am to a family talking very loudly. Unfortunately, my room was near the laundry room and I could hear the workers taking very loudly to each other. It made for an unpleasant morning. Other than that, I think this is a wonderful place to stay but try to avoid the room near the elevator/laundry room.WOW this hotel is awesome. I love the fact that all the rooms are suites and quite honestly they might be bigger than the apartment I live in. The public areas are expansive and modern. The rooms themselves are well furnished with a desk, couch, ottoman, extra chairs, full sized fridge, stove, the list goes on. The bathroom is spacious and the neutrogena bath products are a nice touch. Pretty much any time a hotel gives body wash instead of bar soup I'm a happy guy. You get both here (woo!!).The location for this place is great as there are tons of food joints around and you are very close to Vanderbilt.I would definitely stay here again if the opportunity presents itself!Great suites.  We stayed in a room with two rooms and 2 baths (1 King, 2 queens, a pull out bed in the living room).  Pull out couch mattress was surprisingly comfy.  The room had a little kitchen with a full size fridge and microwave, etc.It's basically on the Vanderbilt campus and about 10 min drive to downtown. There's also I think a Rite Aid and liquor store nearby.They offer free shuttle service to downtown but not the airport.  They have luggage storage as well. Continental breakfast has good waffles.  They try to offer a variety like it would be a different bread/pastry, egg, meat (either sausage or bacon), potato on different days.I just don't know where the loud party/ dance music was coming from on our first night there. Good thing I had ear plugs.One of the best places to stay in Nashville. Hotel is new and modern and staff is so friendly! Suites are great with full kitchen, fridge. Bed is so comfy! Mon-Thursday they serve dinner complete with beer and wine. Breakfast is always hot and delicious too. This hotel is located across the street from Vandy campus. And a short drive to Belmont. Main disadvantage is the $25 fee for parking (self; valet for $28) per day. But your car is in a protected underground parking garage. Best things: location, staff, free food and drinks, extremely clean and comfortable rooms.Right across the street from Vanderbilt itself!When you stay near a college, you are bound to be in a lively area.Close to numerous bars and restaurants (walking distance) and not even 10 minutes from the heart of Nashville.The hotel staff was amazing. Especially the valet boys. Remembered our names and always had a smile on their faces.The check in was a breeze.We stayed in a suite. Super spacious. Separate living and sleeping area.Kitchen area had a stove, full fridge, and dishwasher with plenty of dishware.(All stainless steel appliances too)The room was spotless.The shower didn't even gross me out. Nice white/clean tub.1 TV in each room as well which gave me a break from ESPN that is constantly on everywhere we go.The breakfast wasn't your typical "continental breakfast".They had cereal, oatmeal, eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuits, toast, bagels, yogurt, fruit and even a waffle maker!I loved everything about this hotel. And when I'm back in Nashville, i'll definitely  stay here again! Close and convenient to everything!Hands down 5 stars mostly thanks to the shuttle drivers/supervisors. Logan, Keith, Michael, Rich, Olman, and Matthew were great and handled our 6 girl party awesomely. Made some good recommendations to pick up supplies and places to try. The front desk staff Armani, Denzil, and Chelsea, were also great they even ordered our pizza for us! Great service overall, clean rooms, and the breakfast buffet plus the happy hour during week were perfect for us girls. Had a smashing time in Nashville and the staff played a big part. Hotel was worth every penny for the service alone.This was hands-down the nicest hotel we stayed in during our two-week road trip. It is a newer hotel in a fantastic location. It is across the street from Vanderbilt University and just a couple blocks (a short walk) from Centennial Park and the Parthenon. We checked in late so we didn't get to take advantage of many of the hotel facilities but we did have their breakfast in the morning, which was really good. The only problem was that it was very crowded. We had a bit of a line to go through the breakfast area, but it was OK. Once we had our food we had trouble finding a table. There was plenty of seating, but many of the larger tables were occupied by just one or two people. The only place we could find to sit all together was on the couches, which isn't really the best for eating. I hate it when hotels charge for parking but we avoided the fee and found street parking on the street right behind the hotel. The woman at the desk advised me that Nashville can be strict about ticketing and towing but that spot was fine, and really convenient. We left the car there overnight with no issues.A little pricey, but another great example of Hilton quality. We were in Nashville for the Rifftrax - Sharknado 2 live show. I wanted something near the Belcourt  theater. We had a very clean, well-appointed spacious 2 room, 2 bed suite. We didn't use The kitchen,  but it was clean and well-stocked. The beds were incredibly comfortable; if it weren't for Rifftrax, we would have stayed in bed the whole time!The entire staff was friendly and attentive...the Hilton treatment is the best...and worth it. If you're ever in Nashville, give this  Homewood Suites a shot!Awesome place to stay. Great staff. Great amenities, very clean. Delicious free breakfast. The staff was going the extra mile to make our stay awesome. Loved it!!This is a newer hotel that is ideal for VU campus events. It is right across from the Towers and within easy walking distance to all points on campus. It is also minutes (when traffic isn't backed up) to downtown and is surrounded by restaurants and shops within walking distance.The hotel has contemporary decor. The lobby is spacious with ample seating in a variety of set ups--tables (hi tops and regular), living/lounge areas with sofas and TVs and comfy chairs. The suites are equally as nice and spacious. Large living room with sectional sofa (sleeper) and chaise lounge; dining room table, plus counter bar off the kitchen, which had a mini cooktop, full size refrigerator and dishwasher. Bedrooms were equally as spacious. The lighting could have been better, but that was my only gripe. Ample number of plugs including bedside plugs.The staff, from front desk to housekeeping to kitchen staff to shuttle driver, all provided top notch service. They were friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. They greeted us with smiles and seemed to seek ways to make our stay enjoyable.The breakfast buffet was also great with a wide food assortment including make your own waffles, egg scrambles, sausage, fruit, muffins, pastry and the absolutely best apple turnovers! The food was hot and fresh.This will definitely be my spot when in Nashville.I had a room block at this hotel for my wedding (including dropping off welcome bags that the hotel handed out as our guests checked in), the rehearsal dinner was there, and I stayed there for 3 nights over the wedding weekend, and everything was wonderful!  There were a few small snafus (as there are bound to be with that much going on), but each time something came up it was handled promptly and professionally.The free happy hour is amazing, parking is convenient, the beds are insanely comfortable, and the staff was great to work with! The location is great, and the free shuttle is a very nice touch, though some of my wedding guests that tried to use it said it was often a long wait. Free wifi, breakfast, happy hour, shuttle - a great deal for that close to downtown!Stayed here for a night and the suite was very nice. The TV is mounted to the wall so that you can rotate it to whichever room you're watching TV in. Security seemed good. You need a room key to take the elevator to any of the guest levels. The hotel is pet friendly, but there is only a small patch of grass/landscaping in front of the hotel within an immediate distance for the dog to use. Parking was also $25 for self park, $28 for valet. Overall, very nice. Several restaurants within walking distance. I'd stay here again.Every single detail of this hotel has been thought through. From the full kitchen in the rooms, night lights in the bathrooms and grocery delivery. It's all been meticulously thought out and well planned. The bed.....oh my gawd the bed. One of the best beds I've ever slept in. I wanted to pack it in my suitcase. From the mattress to the linens, all PERFECT. Security was well thought out with room cards needed to activate the elevator and to access the hotel late at night, with a night guard standing watch. Breakfast AND dinner with beer and wine is included Monday - Thursday, I believe. There's also a free shuttle that will take you within a 2-mile distance - well within reach of all the action. Staff is friendly and warm. Everything is kept very, very clean. I wish all hotels were like this.I would highly recommend this hotel on west end ave. They took good care of us even after we had a little check in problem.Besides the wonderful breakfast that most hotels server, the have a evening receptionFrom 5-7 that is just like going to dinner.The staff was very nice and helpful when needed.What a fantastic hotel! I've been to Homewood Suites before but this one is above and beyond. The staff is excellent, everyone from the Managers to the housekeeping staff are all lovely people, very friendly AND proactively handed out little trinkets to me children AND the dogs! Small rubber ducks from the manager during breakfast 1 morning,  waterproof footballs from housekeeping to play with while in the pool, and treats for the dogs one day when we took them out for a walk. It's these little touches on top of the fantastic facility that make this hotel great.It is located across from Vanderbilt University, so close to everything.  The rooms are very spacious and well decorated, there is a updated fitness room and beautiful salt water pool.  The food during the free breakfast is delicious, much more than continental breakfast.Scrambled eggs, cherry turnovers, hash browns, sausages, waffles plus the usual cereal,  juice, coffee, pastries, etc. The staff during breakfast was really efficient and on top of everything, so nothing was ever out of stock even when busy. The hotel also offers a free shuttle to anywhere within 2 miles.Great option! So glad we choose this place for our long weekend in Nashville.I take it back, I must have had the meal on an off day -- the dinner has been terrific the last two evenings. Wonderful work everyone!Great service, great attention to detail.    I enjoyed the service staff, they were friendly and conversational.  Can't complain about anything, valet awesome, front desk staff awesome.  I'll be back at my next visit.Great hotel!  I was surprised with how much it was per night (stayed 5 nights) - and thought it was pricey but I was pleasantly surprised with all of the amenities!  Free wifi.  Free shuttle service to anywhere within 2 mile radius - NOTE - it is first come first serve and, they only have one that can seat only about 10 people comfortably.  They serve a nice buffet style hot breakfast everyday and a hot buffet dinner Monday-Thursday evenings with free beer and wine.  (Nothing high end but if you are on a budget - it helps).  Parking and Valet is not free and not cheap!  We opted to walk and Uber when we had to!They have a nice gym with tv's.  Also an indoor pool, and washer and dryer room on-site (however I used them - and I think they could use some service - washer doesn't spin properly and I needed to run the clothes in the dryer a few times to get them dry (when on high).The customer service is great - everyone is so hospitable and they aim to please.  (They will even grocery shop for you). The rooms are very comfortable and spacious and clean!  Great security too!  It has everything a small studio apartment would have.  Wish there were more room in the toilet/shower area - hard to close the door.  Great location - near great food spots and a short Uber ride to certain attractions.  I would be open to stay at a Homewood Suites again after my experience.This brand new hotel across the street from Vanderbilt promises to be a busy hotel.My wife and I were guests in this hotel for 9 nights, and were very pleased to be here.Rooms are spacious.  Breakfast buffet is filling; hours are: M-F: 6-9, and Sa/Su 6-10am.  Complete evening meals, wine and beer are also available, and also complimentary.Free wifi throughout the hotel. Complimentary shuttle service within 2 miles is a great amenity. Parking, both valet or self-park, is an additional charge.Fitness center is properly outfitted. Large indoor heated pool. Very good laundry facilities on site.Good security: Need key to access each floor & after 11pm need key to enter front door/lobby.Staff and management are very interested in accommodating guests.Only downside, which likely is a temporary one, is that being a new hotel, like any establishment, the hotel is still in the checklist status.  As a result, systems and procedures are still being worked on and being implemented.  Staff is still grappling with how best to effect customer satisfaction. However, any personal issue brought to top management was immediately addressed.Bottom line: I will look forward to returning here!!
review_content_20: Homewoods tend to be hit or miss, usually based on how new they are, and this one is a hit. It's also pretty newly built, so that's to be expected. I had a king one bedroom suite with a huge patio on the 4th floor while staying here for business, and the patio was the absolute best part (see pic). It had a lounge area with comfortable seating and a table and chairs for four.  Awesome.The room was nice and clean, and when I declined service for the day the hotel staff left me a basket containing extra towels, toiletries and coffee.  Great service!I would definitely stay here again if in Nashville on business or fun.When you don't want your most expensive souvenir from a trip to be bed bugs, stay here. Super duper clean. Pricey, but worth every penny. A block from the Parthenon. Pretty modern to make you feel snooty, but staff is not snooty at all. They let our wild beast dog stay in there! Amazing location, very secure and parking is in attached garage. I've stayed places where accessing your car is more of a hassle, so this was very convenient. In the near 100 degree Tennessee heat of early August our room was ice cold. Giant ass bed for wife and pooch to sprawl out. And booked on the fly as we drove down same day! Loved it.Superb customer service!!! We stayed two nights close to Christmas and it was wonderful! The two rooms (we had a king and 2 queens) were very big and so clean. The sheets were the softest I've ever felt!Breakfasts were good and the dinner option was great for a glass of wine. We saw the general manager working one morning and was picking up Cheerios off the floor. Everyone working was so nice! This is a great place!Nice place...good location...I have stayed here before and will again.They need a another staff person for valet...the breakfast staff is very good..they should have a better place for dirty dish work than the hallway?For its category & price , 4-5 stars. The suite w 2 bedrooms included full kitchenette including full size fridge/freezer, tv's in all the rooms, decent beds w white linens, very clean. Hotel has a shuttle van that can be called for drop off to restaurants or venues. Proximity to downtown & Ryman decent by car, about 10-15 minutes. This hotel is across from Vandy and within walking distance to J. Alexanders, Starbucks, Barnes & Noble and a few other amenities.The hotel was great and the staff was exceptionally friendly.  The manager, named Michael was so friendly and patient.  The woman that was over the housekeeping was over the top with guests and especially children, making us feel so relaxed and welcome even with an "active" toddler.  The breakfast was great, very quality and clean.  I have stayed in many hotels in this area including some more expensive and from now on I will not stay anywhere else thanks to such a good experience at this hotel.Great value and service for this location across from Vanderbilt and just two miles from downtown . Pleasant free shuttle to downtown. FREE wifi FREE breakfast . The room was spacious and inviting. Staff was very friendly . We loved this hotel and I will be back.Two experiences out of the 3 we have experienced have been poor.  The room was not ready (after check -in hour) and upon inquiring, we were told a few minutes more.  An hour later....the room was finally ready.  We missed our BlueBird Cafe opportunity that evening. The next stay we booked MONTHS in advance, were asked for a deposit and the day before we got a call from the manager stating that there was a problem with our room.  At that point, they had our deposit for over a month and our reservation for over 3 months.  We are Hilton Honors Gold members and resolved the issue with the HH customer service rep and manager.  The rooms are comfy and for the most part, clean.  There was a dirty towel on the back of a door in one bathroom on  one of our stays.  Beds are really comfy though and we slept well.I stayed here for a couple for nights. I the whole time that I was there, the staff made me feel important and were extremely helpful. They even drove us the the Bridgestone Arena for a Predator's game.  I didn't need my car the two days I was there. Rooms were very clean and there was nothing left lacking. I would not hesitate recommending there to anyone and everyone. This would be my first choice next time I need accommodations in Nashville.Fabulous hotel. Beautiful lobby. Great breakfast. Very friendly and helpful staff. My top pick in Nashville.good position at the beginning of the magnificent mile. Charm of the structure. Beautiful lifts "historic" with a bench to sit on. Hall classic with amazing floral arrangements. I had a free upgrade to junior suite overlooking the lake: huge and atmospheric. Decent breakfast and expensive. Executive lounge insufficient. Service to the rooms "distracted". I recommend it as well as the Nashville, TN Board: BEAUTIFULWas great for our bachelorette party! We had a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom suite (1 king and 2 queens). It fit the 8 of us VERY comfortably with tons of room to all be together in the living room. Staff was extremely nice and accommodating. They let us add everyone onto the room in case anyone lost their key.THis place is beautiful.  From the front lobby with water feature,relaxing gathering areas, breakfast area and especially the staff! Katie at the front desk and everyone else!  We were amazed at the new hotel. The pool was welcoming and relaxing.  We loved the free shuttle to downtown and Wade our driver was a personal tour guide.  He was both friendly and informative.  the room was modern/warm extremely clean and comfortable.  we heard no noise with a fully booked hotel.  WAIT!  WAIT! WHY?  be aware that there are very few (5?) rooms with tubs....no where does the hotel say this on their description and it is important to know that...after a long day of walking around Nashville it would have made the trip.  The staff said that was the "new" way for hotels...maybe but they should inform you!I had surgery Wednesday at the VA Hospital and was blessed that I was provided a room here to stay. I was blown away by the hospitality. The rooms were so quite and comfortable.Great stay with the family.  Breakfast was better than Hampton and most others!  Spacious lobby and seating.Had a wonderful stay here. Great location: very convenient to Vanderbilt, and lots of restaurants and shops nearby. My suite was large, roomy, and very nice. Pretty modern (maybe it was newly renovated) and felt more upscale than most Homewood Suites. I have to say the thing that really stood out was the service, so friendly and welcoming. Especially Gavin at the front desk, but all the staff made me feel at home, I just can't remember the rest of their names. At first I was a little skeptical because the rate was a little hefty, but it was worth it and I would stay here again if visiting the area.Excellent hotel. Came down for spring break. Checked in and the hotel gave us a room with an amazing balcony for being hilton members. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good. Didn't do the week night dinner they serve. Great indoor pool for kids to play in.Loved this hotel. Very new and clean. Rooms are beautiful. Had a kitchen with refrigerator, dishwasher, 2 burner stove. Staff is very nice and helpful. Workout room is enough for a quick workout. Breakfast buffet is good. Parking garage is right under the building. Great restaurants in the area.

review_content: I don't really do Yelp reviews on hotels but this place deserves it. The price is right, the location is nice, free parking, free WiFi very nice modern rooms with comfortable beds and great pressure in the showers. The staff is super friendly too. I'm typing this as I enjoy my complementary breakfast in the lobby which is far better than I expected. Pretty much everything you'd want for breakfast (fresh made waffles, eggs, BACON, cereal, fruit, pastries, oatmeal, coffee, juice, I'm sure I forgot a few things)I will definitely be looking at Hampton Inn more when I travel.Our visit here was great - nice location just outside of the downtown area, the room was nice and clean, and we got a great rate. The bed was very comfortable as well, which I really liked. And we were close to restaurants and just a short drive from the freeway. Plus it was just a few minutes down the road from downtown. If you are looking for a less expensive option (with free parking!) in town, check this place out!I had a great stay at the Hampton Inn. The rooms are very nice and clean and the staff was great to deal with. Our rooms had a fridge and outlets almost everywhere (I find this accommodation rare to find in some hotels). Perks of this hotel are the free parking, free wifi, complimentary breakfast, gym, and big outdoor pool. They also have a coffee and tea stand available for all guests in the lobby. I made use of the gym and pool during my stay and they were always well-kept and stocked with towels. The gym consists of 2 treadmills, 1 elliptical, 1 yoga ball, medicine balls and dumbbell rack, 1 bench and 1 mat. The pool has about 20 lounge chairs and 3 tables with umbrellas.Overall, I had a great stay and would consider coming here again.My husband and I travel constantly and stay in Marriott hotels all over the country. This particular stay at the Hampton Inn on Elliston place in Nashville was a very nice stay. We where in the process of moving out of Nashville with a crazy schedule, tired from moving around boxes all day, this Hampton was a nice place to call 'home' for a few nights. It is very conveniently located, there is great parking right on the lot, not in a parking garage a block away like some of the other hotels in mid-town. Their pool is outdoors and well kept. And the hotel is over all clean and very welcoming. Most of all, I had to wake up early in the morning and get some food in me before my long day..(it's not typical to have a good breakfast at a hotel without a restaurant) granted, I only got oatmeal, toast and some banana bread to snack on later, the oatmeal was actually cooked great, (not thick slop) the area was clean AND Richard who possibly manages the breakfast hours was an absolute pleasure. It's early, I'm tired, don't particularly want to talk to anyone early and he greeted me, asked me how everything was with our stay, talked about old Nashville before all of the new bullshit being built. He got me a tray when he noticed my attempt to haul my husband's breakfast back to the room. He hummed and sang while straightening up which was endearing. It was a sweet way to start the day. Also, the music that was playing throughout the hotel was incredible old old blues including Elmore James. Great stay!I really liked this Hampton Inn.  All of the staff members we encountered were polite, accommodating, and willing to help.  The bed was super comfy, and there was a microwave and fridge available too.  The bath towels could have been thicker, but at least they give you plenty of 'em.  The toiletries are Neutrogena, in case you were wondering.  The water pressure was terrific, and there was no shortage of hot water.  Ahhhh. There are two free wireless networks available, so when one wasn't working that well, I just switched to the other one.I was rather impressed by the free breakfast buffet that runs from 6-10, I believe.  I was expecting pastries and boxed cereal, but HI went all out, with oatmeal, make-your-own waffles, biscuits, muffins, omelets, hardboiled eggs, yogurt, bacon, sausage, fruit, juice, and other things.  Popcorn, tea, and coffee are always available in the lobby.Free parking too!  There are restaurant options within walking distance, and downtown is a short drive away.  A solid choice for your hotel needs in Nashville.We went here recently to visit and I will tell you the experience was top notch. From the moment we entered the door and were promptly greeted by the first staff member to the last when we left they were always asking how they could help you and how they could help make your stay more enjoyable with a smile on their face. Rooms were very clean, large and beds very comfortable. One might think they were a bit pricey, but for downtown Nashville and you throw in all you get from the amazing service from the staff, excellent FREE breakfast and FREE wifi and you can't beat it. We were actually within walking distance to several excellent restaurants and bars if you wanted to get out. I would definitely stay again when revisiting Nashville.Stayed again at the Hamtpon near Vanderbuilt. Although we did have a room that had a weird-sounding air conditioner, it was 2 in the morning when we rolled in and at that point you just go with it. This place is just CLEAN and nice. It's updated... The staff literally whistles while they work... And the breakfast. It's so good. Also, the location is so great! There are some really cute spots right around the hotel for meals. Check this place out of you need a reliable stay!!Hampton Inn had so much to offer while staying in Nashville. Walking distance to multiple restaurants, bars, and beautiful sites. The room was comfortable and included a refrigerator and microwave, perfect to having those leftovers from many of the nearby restaurants. A delicious full breakfast was included which offered eggs, crispy bacon, sausage and biscuits with gravy, plus really great fresh fruit and overall more options than we could try in the two days we were there. The employees were super friendly and accommodating. We asked for a high room with a view of the nearby Parthenon and they were able to meet this request. My only reason for not going the full 5 stars is returning to our room for a rest at almost 5 p.m. to have it not yet cleaned for the day, and feather pillows that were not that simple to get replaced with non-allergen pillows. The free wi-fi is a plus and the lobby area is a nice enough place to hang out when not in the room.  I would definitely recommend staying and and book my room here next time I am in town.This is an excellent place to stay.  The people that work there are all into customer service.  The housekeeping is the best I have experiencedThe lobby is super even by Hampton Inn standards.  The rooms were large and well laid outBest in the Vandy areaWow, ok I just came from the worst hotel experience of my life which I would never wish upon anyone. Thank god I found the Hampton inn Elliston. It was huge, desperate living room and kitchen, more like a 1 bedroom appt! Breakfast was a fun nice treat and the staff was fantastic. Sheets and everything was clean. On issue was housekeeping missed a few things, but very minor. In a city where hotels are limited and overpriced I was more then satisfied.Great staff and VERY friendly and accommodating! We usually stay at the Homewood Inn and Suites across the road but this Hampton Inn far exceeds expectations! Good job!I really enjoyed my stay at this Hampton Inn.  I was in town for the RockNRoll Nashville Half Marathon and they could not have been more accommodating.  All of the staff members I encountered were polite, accommodating, and willing to help.  They were helpful with recommendations and made a point wish all of us runners good luck!  I was really impressed by the free breakfast buffet.  I was expecting packaged pastries and boxed cereal, but there was oatmeal, waffle iron, banana bread (yum!), muffins, omelets, eggs, hard-boiled eggs, yogurt, cereal, fresh fruit and other things.  The morning of the race they opened breakfast early for runners and I think all of my running friends could agree that that all of the above food items are perfect pre-race fuel.  The hotel also put out bottles of water and energy bars on race morning.  Popcorn, tea, and coffee are always available in the lobby which is great.They hotel also offered a free-shuttle service to the start line which helped keep the entire race day stress-free (and cost effective, considering the race organizers were charging about $20 for a shuttle.)  The bed was comfortable and the rooms are clean.  The only issue with the rooms is the paper-thin walls.  We literally heard every conversation, shower and television in a 3-room radius.  Free parking, restaurant options within walking distance, neighboring, beautiful park to spend the afternoon, and downtown a short drive away.  Hampton Inn is a great choice for Nashville.Great complimentary breakfast.  Very well kept and clean.  Rooms were a little tightly packed, and the coffee maker was in the bathroom which kinda grossed me out a little.  Staff was friendly.  Would stay again.Very impressed! We got a great price for this hotel after looking at a lot of options in Nashville. Good location. $7-10 cab fare to bars/restaurants on Broadway. Clean, modern, and updated. Though I did not try it, my friends told me the breakfast was good. They called us a cab as requested. We asked for additional towels and received them within approximately one minute.  Less than 15 minute drive to Green Hills mall. Free parking!This review is way overdue. But since I'm semi new on yelp I felt it deserved to get a review even if it was almost a year ago! Last year me and my friend had booked a hotel on Nashville for the weekend through priceline. When we got there not only was it not a hotel but the staff was amazingly rude and we had to switch rooms 3 times before saying we could NOT stay there. It was late in the night and made a few calls to nearby hotels but everyone was "booked up"  finally I just went into the next one I saw. Which was Hampton Inn and Suites. After explaining our situation the front desk lady quickly found us a room and told us SHE was sorry for out bad experience in Nashville! Lol since it was so early in the morning gave us a little discount for our first night and was super sweet and helpful. Along with the rest of the staff ! Checked up on us the second day and really treated us kindly. I'll definitely stay here again if I'm in Nashville. Thank you for my great experience!!I read in a previous entry that this hotel is a little on the worn side. I guess that explains the not as fresh air that I felt and the small stain on my couch. The whole room gave me a not so new feeling. Otherwise, the service was wonderful. There was a great outdoor pool but the trick was getting to it. The gym was small and had 4 machines. Only the necessities. They did have a water cooler though!The complimentary breakfast was satisfying and there is always tea and coffee available for you.We had a group of 5 and this was a great place to stay because we had a Queen Suite that fit 2 queen beds and a couch in the common area (2 TVs), a small stove top, dishwasher, a fridge, and free wifi. This place also serves continental breakfast from 6a-10a. The room was nice, "wood" floor and area rug in the common areas and carpets in the bedroom. We stayed here for the Nashville Country Music Marathon and it was great because the start line was within walking distance at Centennial Park. They served breakfast early (5am) on race day so that the runners could get some carbs in before the big race. Free parking available as well. Pool is located outside, but we didn't go in because it was cold and rainy all weekend.The only downside is the THIN walls. We had an adjoining room with an adjoining door, and next door to us was a rowdy group of guys celebrating a bachelor party. I was sleeping on the couch in the common room and could hear everything from next door because they were LOUD, DRUNK BOYS. I actually had to call security on them because they knocked on our adjoining door 3times at 3:50am. Not the greatest night sleep, but the boys finally passed out at 4:30am! The security came by very quickly to remedy the situation, so was pleased with that.Queen suite for marathon weekend ran me $489/night, but not bad if you split it between 5 people! :)I liked this hotel!  We stayed here because it was close to the Parthenon, and we were in a block of rooms reserved for guests of the wedding we attended.I thought the rooms were spacious, clean, and comfortable.  The staff at the front desk was really nice to us.Apparently they have fresh baked cookies during the week.  (I could smell them on Friday, but I never found them.  I think they were gone before I located them).The hotel has a reasonable sized outdoor pool.  It looks out onto the parking lot, but I guess that is better than facing a busy street.  At least at the back of the parking lot, there aren't a lot of people around.The complimentary breakfast was better than I expected.  There were a couple of hot dishes, hard boiled eggs, fruit salad, whole fruit, assorted pastries, make your own waffles, cereal, oatmeal, and yogurt.
