I thought that was really impressive!CONSTRUCTION ALERT!!!  as of mid June 2012 there is a huge construction project taking place across the street from this hotel! Prepare to be woken  up anywhere from  545 to 630am Monday thru SATURDAY ( yes Saturday too). I was worried when I saw the earplugs they were giving out at the front desk , but with festivals and such there was no other place available. Much construction in the general vandy area...  You takes your chances with this place Its a decent hotel , with a gym , pool and overall room quality , and close to some cool restaurants , but I'll pass next time im in the area till the condos are builtCould not have been any nicer say. Great staff and management with attention to every detail.  Great breakfast with large area, tv, and complimentary newspapers.  I just feel it is a bit expensive for what you get.  The nearby construction was not a bother at all to us during our 4 night stay.
review_content_20: Of all the hotels we've stayed at in Nashville, this is the best.  Clean, spacious rooms (and lobby).  Wonderful pool.  Great sleep.  Great location.  Worth a stay if you get a chance.Still undergoing some renovation, but seems like most of the place has been made over, judging from what I've read in reviews around the web.  Our room was in good condition, clean.  Bed was extremely comfortable.  As another reviewer mentioned on TripAdvisor, there is a mini-refrigerator and microwave oven in the room!  Very nice convenience.  Free high-speed internet was fast enough to watch movies.  Free breakfasts were extremely convenient.  Convenient location next to Vanderbilt, 2 miles from downtown, centrally located to most attractions, but much cheaper than staying downton.  Next door to a number of restaurants.  We walked a block over to Calypso and had some pretty good and very inexpensive food.Would recommend.Very nice hotel!  Stayed here recently during a busy football weekend.  The rooms were clean, spacious and newly renovated.  The hotel staff were extremely friendly too.  The only reason why I am not giving five stars is because of the bed.  It was lumpy and low on one side, but bearable. Our friends said their room mattress was great, so it could've just been our room.  Will definitely stay here again.Four of us in our 30s from Chicago stayed at this Hampton Inn this past weekend.  I must say, this hotel has the most friendly and pleasent staff I have ever had staying at a hotel.  Everyone said hello, good morning, asked how we were, Robert even came by this morning to ask how our breakfast was and thanked us for staying with them as he was cleaning up.  Every housekeeper, desk clerk, and everyone we saw was so sincerely nice.  Unfortunately that isn't always the case today.  It was so wonderful.  Our room was big, excellently located by the fun part of Division Street and a quick, cheap taxi ride to downtown..oh and I loved the complementary popcorn and the breakfast that is included in the room fee was very good.  Thank you for making our trip to Nashville very pleasant!Convenient but pricey. Clean, quiet, and with staff that is courteous.  The iron in the room was weak and nearly broken, and the ironing board was broken. I probably could have had it replaced had I had time to tell the staff, but there you go. You pay for the convenience to be somewhat near Vanderbilt campus.Clean, spacious rooms in a convenient location made for a pleasant stay. The suite arrangement with two queen beds and a sofa was perfect for us with two adults and one teenager. The beds are very comfortable. While I thought it was a bit weird to have little post-it notes on the headboards saying that the duvet covers had been washed, I was glad to know that information, given it is not a top-end hotel.And the room was surprisingly quiet. Next to our room was a family party of three rooms and 5 or 6 young boys playing in the hall. We could hear them a bit in the outer room of the suite, but not at all in the bedroom.Being a weekend, there was no noisy construction, but that could be a problem during the week. It's just a booming area of town.Overall, better than I'd have expected from a Hampton Inn.Absolutely the worst hotel I have stayed in...and I have stayed from the best of the best to the bottom of the barrel. The staff is rude. The rooms are smokey and old (they are in the middle of a much needed renovation). We asked for a King room, non smoking. Got a 2 double bed, smoking  room with NO sofa or anything in the room besides an old desk and chair. The carpet smelled terrible. There must have been a church and a youth group retreat taking place that weekend as well. (7/21/-22). I am glad we only stayed one night. WE asked for a late check out and when the other manager did not relay that to the manager on duty, we were yelled at for "Staying" later. Took 45 mins to get continental breakfast with all the kids in the lobby. There were many "working" guys walking around the hotel all day and night and the front desk staff was horrible to my Mother in Law (to be) when she came to meet us at the hotel. NEVER AGAIN! This place is disgusting and the people are equally as disgusting! Stay at the other Hampton Inn on West End...BEST in town!This is probably my least favorite hotel I've stayed at in Nashville.  It is not really that this place is altogether that terrible, if it were some random hotel along the interstate somewhere, it'd suit perfectly well.  However when you compare the price, location and quality, there are plenty of better options in the area.Its location on Elliston means it is within a block or two of quite a few restaurants and bars, which makes walking pretty feasible.  You're also just a couple blocks down from Centennial Park which is a great place to explore on a nice day.  Its proximity to Vanderbilt University makes it popular for visiting family which also means that for Vanderbilt events, you're going to need to book a room far in advance.The rooms are clean but plain, not really a great hotel to spend a lot of time in.  The lobby is large and colorful and also pretty loud so hope you don't get a room on the first floor.They have their own parking lot but traffic in the area can get pretty bad during peak hours.My fiance and I stayed here and got food poisoning from the scrambled eggs served at breakfast.  We let the staff know but they didn't seem concerned.This place is pretty old. The rooms are incredibly bland and tasteless. It looks like 1992 up in here. The staff never went out of there way to appear helpful. The wireless internet did not work in my room. I had to go to the lobby to even connect for an extended period of time, and even then I had to endure incredibly slow speeds. Do not come here if internet is a must. The only reason to come here is for an inexpensive room near the university. I would not stay here again.

review_content: I don't stay at Hyatt properties because I try to stick with one chain to maximize my elite benefits. But Hyatt has sent a few reminders lately that I need to have some activity in order to keep the few points that I have in my Hyatt account. So when a Hyatt showed up in the right area and the right price range, I gave it a try.Hyatt Place is probably on par with the Marriott Courtyard or the Hilton Hampton brands though it does have a free breakfast in the morning, free wifi and a small bistro in the lobby area.I had a very comfortable room with a large king-sized bed, large flat panel television, a good walk-in shower with a small closet, sitting area and coffee service. Interesting, the coffee service had actual ceramic coffee mugs not plastic wrapped paper ones.It was a good stay. If Hyatt's were in the places I wanted to be, they'd probably be in my regular repertiote. But they're not.I am slightly disappointed with my stay in the Hyatt Place. I was hoping it would be the best stay due to the fact that I spent a nice amount of money on a room to enjoy.The main issue that I had was cleanliness!! I found stray hairs all of the sheets, dirty wash clothes, and to prove that they did not do what they were supposed to do, I left a note in the bed sheets for housekeeping to change them. When it was time for bed, I pulled back the sheets and the note that I placed in the bed remained there. After learning the fact that they did not even bother to completely pull back the bed sheets, it made me feel uncomfortable wondering what else they did not clean. I am not pleased whatsoever about this.The living area was decent and spacious and the mini refrigerator was convenient.A solid Hyatt.  I got a little bit of a bad vibe when I called them to pick us up from the airport on Wednesday at 11pm, but I think the personality of the desk lady was just less warm and more matter of fact.  When we got to the hotel to check in she was nice enough.  The location isn't crazy awesome except that it's right next to the airport and walking distance to some fast food, so if you're coming in late or trying to catch an early flight it's perfect.  It's maybe 20 minutes from downtown Nashville, so may want to consider another option if your trip has reason for you to be down there often.Their breakfast layout was great.  A lot of options and a lot of good tasting food.  We slept in, so missed out on a lot of it, but still grabbed a few items that hit the spot.It's less than 5 minutes from the airport to the hotel once the shuttle gets you, and the overall ease of getting to the hotel is wonderful.Room was huge and very nice.  Looking more closely I found some areas that didn't quite get clean or needed maintenance attention, but nothing that bothered me during my stay (more like if I sat somewhere for a long period of times I started to notice very minor things).Hyatt place always keeps its looks very consistent.  Even the smell of the lobby is the same regardless of where you go.  I haven't stayed at a Hyatt Place for over 5 years now.  Coming in to another one brings me memories of my previous stays.  Whenever you are looking for a clean, spacious room, and pleasant stay, always come to Hyatt Place.  I always enjoy it whenever I stay at one of these places.  You will love the room.A nice last minute weekend option at an affordable price!Itching to visit some POIs in Nashville months ago at the last minute, we chose this Hyatt Place hotel for the price and since I'm a Hyatt Gold Passport member.Without a doubt, Hyatt is consistent when it comes to decor and service. This location was no different. *Reasonable [last minute] rates*Convenient location*Clean and spacious room*Comfortable beds*Separate living-room area*Work desk*Kitchenette*Small closet (check before settling in)*Delicious hot breakfast options*Friendly staff*Small gym*Modern (clean lines) decor*Adequate & free parkingInitially, I was concerned about noise when I made the reservation since it has the airport in its name. Thankfully, the hotel and our room was quiet.My usual hotel special requests include: highest floor, non-smoking room, quiet & away from elevators. Not much to ask, right?! This Hyatt disappointingly gave us a room on the furthest end of the hall near the stairways. Too tired from our drive to complain and in a rush to play as tourists, we settled for it. Thankfully it wasn't noisy. But gosh(!!), we had the smallest closet ever!! Had we been there more than 1 night, a small closet would be unacceptable as I always overpack. Always.Aside from that, our overall experience was pleasant. We'd recommend this Hyatt Place location. Just be sure to check the size of your closet and all the other things that matter in your stay. ;DWe stayed over the Christmas holiday. I stay at Hyatt Place hotels around the country as I am a Platinum Passport member. We prepurchased four nights via the Hyatt site. First the interaction with every employee was top notch.  Hyatt does something right with training.  But the room. The carpet was dirry, the sofa stained and overused, our room was cleaned but new coffee cups and glasses were not changed out. All pretty gross. Also the shower had a regulator on the handle which would not allow to turn to the point which would allow us to take a hot shower! Several times I washed out of the sink with a washcloth so I could have hot water. The sink did not have a regulator. Manager apologized for condition of room and said reno at ions were happening. Stay out of room 404. It was gross.Room wasn't filthy but wasn't the cleanest either. There was a clear plastic wrapper, the type that go around the top of a pill bottle clearly visable on the back of the couch as soon as we entered the room.  The linens seemed clean enough, like they'd been washed and replaced, but I don't trust the cups.  The couch seems in good enough condition but since they didn't notice the wrapper, I question whether or not they inspected it for cleanliness before our arrival.Shower doesn't get hot, and the nob frequently hangs loose and floppy like it's broke.  Where the shower head meets the wall, no caulking and the piece just hangs loose, letting you look into the darkness of the wall.There is no place to set things down in the restroom, just a toliet and a shower- the sink is out in the bedroom area.  The clean towels, are on a wire shelf inside of the shower stall.  Literally the only place to store clean and dry items is inside the shower stall.  WTF?There is no trash can in the restroom.  God forbid you should be female and "that time of the month" in this place.  What is the hotel owners suggestion here?  Set your feminine hygiene products on the floor?  Both the unused you may need later, and the used until you can get out to the unlined metal mesh garbage can over by the desk?  Do they literally never have female guests? For that matter, what do you want men to do with condoms should they get lucky in your hotel?  Flush 'em and clog the toilet?  Toss it in that unlined mesh basket in the middle of the room by the desk?  Seriously- the fact that this hotel fails on something as basic as a garbage can drives me nuts.Food waste should probably go in a trash can with a liner.  So should any restroom trash.  God hopes they spray that metal mesh basket with Lysol.  My inner germ-a-phobe goes crazy about this particular detail as soon as I floss my teeth and go looking for a place to dump my now used piece of floss, and realize I have no choice but to put it in the metal mesh can.  Then I start thinking of all the other things that belong in a more appropriate trash can, in a more appropriate place, and what people did when they didn't have the option...I don't want to set any of my things on a hotel bathroom floor to get folks athlete foot germs all over my belongings.  Add some hooks to hang things that aren't inside the shower, add a small shelf, and a bathroom trash can with a liner and my inner germ-a-phobe might shut up.  Small fixes to make for a much less skin crawling stay.Speaking of skin crawling, every time we turned on the TV the default screen was an advertisment for on demand porn- it also if you scroll up through options, has the on demand movie information and things of that nature, but every single time we turned on the TV, half the screen was dedicated to various almost naked folks.  And not with some surreptitious title, the ones with really rauchy titles.  For some odd reason, the remote didn't work very well from this station to go to the standard TV options, so you had to get up and manually change it on the TV set off the "on demand" screen, and then the remote worked fine.  Thank God we don't have kids to be staying at this hotel with us, or they may have got to learn about Blackzilla or Barely Legal 3 ways before we could get the TV changed to a more appropriate station.  The fact that you can use parental controls (we discovered on the last day there) doesn't make up for the fact that it defaults to that spot every time the TV turns on.  This issue with the TV, along with the less than perfectly clean elements made the hotel seem really seedy and scummy, when it has all the potential of coming off as a reasonable business class hotel. The lobby was great, and our first impulse, aside from the wrapper on the couch- was to say we actually liked this room as well as we liked our room in the Gaylord Opryland hotel we'd stayed at earlier in the week.  15 minutes later however, after we start seeing all the little ways it was awful, really altered that perception. On our 2nd day, housekeeping never showed up to our room.   We didn't have anything in the door to say not to come in, it would seem they just didn't bother.  We didn't need much, but the one trash can could have used to be emptied.If they want that hotel room to be nice, they only have to do a few things.  Clean and do it well.  Add a few minor details to give the place better function.  Default screen anywhere other than porn.  But without those few things done, I don't know that I'd stay here again.It's OK. Definitely an older hotel that was renovated. Some of it was well done, some of it not so much. The room was spacious at the sacrifice of having even a decent sized closet. I walked into the room and the only cup I found was a coffee cup stored with the coffee maker on the counter but it had red lip stick all over it. Not just a little... A lot.... Gross. Hence the reason everyone says not to use cups in a hotel anyway I guess.I've stayed in better hotels though this is my first time in Nashville. If given the choice, I'd try a different hotel on my next visit.EDIT: This morning I needed some toothpaste so I called down to see if they could bring some up, as I would at any hotel. I was told that they do have it but I'd have to come and get it. Not a big deal by itself but just adds to the 2 star experience here.I came to Nashville on business and the Hyatt was wonderful. My second day in the city I broke my ankle downtown and had to go to the hospital. Once I arrived back at the hotel the staff did their best to help me. They brought up my meals (they have a 24/7 gallery menu for purchase but you need to pick-up your food in the cafe area) and even brought ice to help ice my ankle down. The room was great for me as a business traveler but big enough to bring my family (the sofa has a pull out). Overall room was clean, food was good and the customer service was excellent.The hotel room was a standard Hyatt Place room. Nothing special to report. I would mention though that the hotel pool is towards the right rear of the hotel so if you will be spending any of the day trying to work in your room you might want to request a room in another place. It was noisy on Saturday, but I didn't notice it Sunday - Tuesday. As an aside, access to the outdoor pool requires going outside the hotel. For the room, 4-5 stars. The gym was a huge let down. There was 1 recumbent bike, 2 treadmills and 1 elliptical. There was a good set of dumbbells, but NO bench or mat?!?! There were towels and water provided. 1-2 stars. The free breakfasts were just ok. I had a hard time consistently finding clean plates. Nothing horribly dirty, just 'baked' on food from the heat of the dishwasher. There were hot items each day which were fine though one morning the plain scrambled eggs tasted way too salty. I liked the pepper/onion scramble better and the egg sandwiches on subsequent days. And from all of my Hyatt Place stays combined - I still think the fruit mix has an odd taste. I ate the whole fruit instead. They had it 2-3 stars.Very friendly staff however. I arrived very early in the morning. No rooms were ready - not a surprise or disappointment. The man at the desk, Russ, despite a full house at breakfast showed me into a back office and gave me a spot to put my bag. I think this was him thinking quick on his feet because this space was clearly not bag storage usually - it was I think the manager's office. When I returned to the hotel about 8 hours later the same man was there - but now he knew my name! However he knew (maybe he looked at my luggage tag that morning), it was still impressive. When he checked me out 4 days later he still remembered who I was. 5 stars for service.I Really liked the rooms.  The layout is really nice and spacious for the price with a nice sofa sitting area, and desk.  With the larger mini fridge and wet bar, you could stay a little longer more comfortable if you needed to.  The bed was comfortable but the water pressure in the shower was very low, almost a trickle. The breakfast is not bad but not great. Overall we would stay there again.Tip - Ask for extra pillows and get to breakfast early.  This place was 4+ stars all day. The staff especially Jessica were great to us. We enjoyed so much of our vacation because of the lack of risk and trouble with our stay. The hotel is clean. I will stay there again. They have all the amenities and don't break the bank.We have had other great Hyatt place experiences - but not here.  It does appear updated but the rooms are not thoroughly cleaned and the updates aren't enough (outdated light fixtures in the rooms contrast the other room updates). We had a late breakfast at the food counter in the lobby.  It took 25 minutes for our food to arrive (a cheese plate and egg sandwich).  The cheese plate included 4 slices of cheese...we asked for and received more.  The egg sandwich included a little piece of deli paper (it was included with the cheese as the cook forgot to take it off).  We were done at that point.  The staff was friendly (although kitchen staff not very competent) and the manager did comp our 1-night stay to make up for everything.  But next time, we'll choose the Courtyard by Marriott down the road.This was my second stay at a Hyatt brand hotel and I was impressed again. I booked this room last minute and it was a lot less expensive than a room in the downtown area. The taxi fare from and from the hotel to downtown costs around $20 each way and the lady at the front desk called the taxi company and set everything up, which made that process just as easy as the check in process. They offer complimentary toiletries that you usually have to purchase at other hotels, such as razors and shaving cream. The room was immaculate and very spacious and included a kitchenette and couch. The complimentary breakfast was above your average hotel breakfast. I just recommended this hotel to a friend today and remembered that I hadn't posted a Yelp review...I don't think I should keep this place a secret any longer.Really like this hotel. Crisp white sheets, newer furniture and a freshly cleaned shower. Cleanliness is the most important feature next to safety to me when I'm choosing a hotel. Very comfortable. Two big pluses for my fiance and myself were the generous continental breakfast full of (good) fresh fruit, teas, juices, oatmeal and such and their later checkout (12 p.m) which afforded us the ability to stay out late on Easter Sunday listening to music downtown. So good! It makes a big difference. It's close to the airport but I didn't hear a sound. Two notes is that Nashville has two strange taxes, the 'Privilege Tax' and the 'Lodgig Tax' which brought our Tax total along with state tax to seventeen dollars and some change I believe. I would absolutely stay here again if ever I'm in Nashville.Very modern, swanky hotel. Staff very friendly. It's a little pricey and there is no room service.I love this hotel. It was a home away from home. Once you enter the building, there's a good feeling you get when you see the lobby that looks like a really big living room, the big kitchen to the left, and the smiling concierge who's awaiting to help anyone who walks in. The room itself looked and felt comfortable. The first half of the room had an "L" shaped couch, mini fridge, a kitchen sink, and an office table. The second half of the room had two mini queen sized beds, the bathroom, a long counter with the sink, a closet, a heater, and a nice huge plasma TV. Overall, had an amazing stay here. It was clean, all of the staff members were really nice, and they have reasonably priced food that's available 24/7 which is beneficial for the really late nights. When I go back to Nashville, this is where I'll be staying. It's comfortable, safe, and located a short walk away from The Waffle House.The Hyatt was clean, with spacious nice rooms, free wifi and a big screen tv. I also used the fitness center, which is a decent size and has very nice equipment. But what made my stay truly exceptional was the staff. The weather was bad and I had an early morning flight. The cab I ordered the night before called in the morning to say they would be very very late and the Hyatt had the shuttle service start early for me. You don't find this kind of service often -- I am definitely a Hyatt convert.We stayed here on a recent trip to Nashville and selected the location because of the proximity to the airport (less than 1 mile away) and price compared to hotels in downtown.First glance, it's a very new property. The entry/lobby area is going for the whole trendy look with a crecent shaped desk in the middle of the room, open on one end, not your standard hotel check in counter. There's apparently a 24 hour bar and "restaurant" connected to the desk, which means it's 2 feet away. We didn't test the bar and I think the restaurant is just mainly some pre-packaged foods that you can order, but I guess it's nice to have there if you're ever in need.Lobby area is small, and there is a lot of furniture. It seemed like at all times there were masses of people camped out with their shoes off, laying on the couches, etc.The room was clean, and spacious, but it seemed overly designed. It had a big sectional couch and an ottoman that jutted awkwardly into the middle of the room - we kept it up against the couch the whole time. There is a sink and refrigerator off by themselves in one corner, then a small desk across from it. The sitting area and bed are seperated by a half wall thing which just looked out of place. The sink was outside of the bathroom. Shower was big. However, the shower and toliet area was up against the wall where the window was, and left very little room between the bathroom wall and end of the bed. Maybe about 18 inches at the most. The whole thing just seemed very poorly designed - a lot of wasted space but at the same time cramped in areas that didn't need to be cramped.No outlets next to the bed. Had to charge my cell phone across the room. Bathroom didn't have a fan. Stay here alone and leave the door open when you shower. No wall mounted or automatic temperature control on the thermostat, so I had to get up and adjust the heater three or four times during the night - one of those big loud fan units under the window.Closet is a joke. It's jammed behind the tv and next to the sink in one of the fake walls in the middle of the room. I was able to fit about 2 jackets and a couple of shirts in there, anything else would be out of reach.The bed and pillows were comfortable, I will admit to that. And the room had a 42" plasma TV, so that was a nice touch. Other than that, it was very mediocre. I think Hyatt is taking a stab at the "middle of the road" type hotel...this wasn't a Hyatt, just a Holiday Inn Express or a Hampton Inn with some newer furniture. Staff was pleasant, it's in a good area, lots of parking. There are about 20 other chain hotels within walking distance. I would stay here again if the price was the same, but if it was any higher, then I'd probably try somewhere else.Lobby is super sheek. Desk staff was really quick, friendly and personable. Neat to have a 24/7 cafe. The rooms are clean. Huge LCD TV. The bed was so comfortable. Free wifi, breakfast and parking...We would stay here again.
review_content_20: I like the Hyatt Place. Their service is consistent. The rooms are clean, and the beds are comfortable. I really like the continental breakfast: your choice of fruit, yogurt, cereal, biscuits and gravy, oatmeal, biscuits, muffins, english muffins, bagles, and toast, and several types of juice. They have a new "green" approach, that if you don't put your towels on the ground, they won't pick them up until the 3rd day. But if you want fresh towels, simply put them on the ground. Also, the hotel is fairly quiet. The staff is friendly and the locations are great. They are also happy to help with driving directions.Hyatt Place is my hotel of choice. Having stayed at quite a few of them all across the country, one of the things I appreciate is their consistency in service and quality. Hyatt Place had kept a clean record with me, until my stay at the Hyatt Place Nashville Airport.My stay wasn't bad, but it just wasn't the great that I'm used to. To start, when I arrived at the gallery, the gallery hosts were goofing off and joking around with each other. It took a little while until a young man came over and greeted my wife and I. I cannot remember his name, but he was a very nice gentleman. Once we received our room keys and headed upstairs to get some sleep. When we walked into the room, there was just a "wet" smell. Sort of like a wet dog. It was very unpleasant. After running the air a little bit, the smell went away (or we just got used to it). I went to open the room door to air the room out a little bit and that is when I noticed the door was "warped" at the bottom. The door apparently did not fit in the frame and if someone was wanting to, they could look at the seam anywhere below the handle and see into our room. Finally, I love the breakfast at the Hyatt Place. And breakfast was great at the Hyatt Place Nashville Airport with one exception: dirty coffee mug. A minor thing, but it just seemed to add to the letdown of what is normally a great experience at a Hyatt Place property.Since there seem to be quite a few choices for Hyatt Places and other Hyatt properties in the Nashville area, I will definitely be choosing to stay elsewhere in the future.I have just had great experiences with this hotel chain, try not to stay elsewhere. Complimentary shuttle service from airport is on call only. Hot breakfast as always. Their executive suite looks exactly like a normal suite so don't waste your money unless you need the computer hookups in the room. They booked my room after I prepaid weeks earlier, so after complaining about the situation, they set me up appropriately. Bottom line, all members and prepaid customers should get their exact room, no exceptions.Best hotel I have ever rested in //I am under the impression that most Hyatt Place Hotels are perfect home away from homes due to many reviews I have heard and read. However, this particular Hotel can stand alone in my judgement. I was blown away the moment I walked into the doors. Their redone interior and very respectable staff makes this the hotel I would recommend. The rooms feel refreshing and smell amazing ( I have to include this because I have had some horrible experiences, haha). Every detail is top-notch from the contemporary couch to the cozy bed. Even though I live in Nashville, I would drive 2 exits down just to get a room... it is that great.Decent hotel. Not the greatest I've been to. If your staying for a long time this place is for you. It's considered an extended stay. Lobby, hallways, elevators suck! I'd give it 2 stars.Clean, comfy, and cheap. My three favorite things in a hotel. Bonus: the rooms are gigantic.I felt totally at home here and was able to get a lot of work done in my room thanks to the free and easy wi-fi and the comfortable desk with ample lighting. This hotel is less than 10 miles from downtown and they offer a free mini breakfast with yogurt, fruit, and pastries. If you have to be somewhere early, you can make a cup o' Joe to go and be on your merry way at no extra cost. The pillows are almost as awesome as my pillow at home, and that's saying a lot. Don't come here if you want a fancy hotel with a restaurant, but come here if you want the basics done expertly with professional service. They do offer lunch and dinner plates, but I didn't try any of them so I cannot comment on the quality.Nice, modern, clean. Great staff. I had a late flight out so I camped out in the lobby and worked from there. Nice place to work from. Lots of light and electrical outlets were easy to locate and access.Not too expensive to include a fridge and breakfast. We were disppointed that they did not provide plastic tongs everyday to get bagels out of the toaster without getting burned or risking the metal tongs. This was the only time I have ever experienced entering a hotel room and finding a toilet full of urine. It made the whole room smell. My son had a nosebleed on the sheets  and we left the room available for maid service and they came in and provided clean towels but made the beds up with the dirty sheets. Next time we'll call the front desk and just ask for sheets specifically. The room temperature controls were very nice. It was overall not too noisy, mcdonalds across the street, walgreens very close. No laundry. You have to drive 10 minutes to 24 hour laundry and I recommend you go for a large front loader because their normal looking washers are actually more like compact in their water levels. I might go there again but I would not look forward to spending time in the room more than just sleeping and getting ready for the day. Things look relatively clean but after getting maid service it smelled worse and that is just suspicious. You have to really flush the toilet right away or it will also smell up the  room so that is awkward in the middle of the night when you don't want to wake up everyone. Oh the pool is unheated and in very shaded location so even thought it got hot while we were there the water was too cold to use. We will probably make sure we look for indoor pools next time unless it's July or August.We stayed here one night and downtown Nashville the next night. The Hyatt was half the price and twice as nice as the downtown hotel. It's definitely worth it to stay out there and cab it. The hotel is recently redone and very nice: pool, fitness center, bar area, 24-hour food. The rooms are cozy and have mini fridges, and the beds are nice. Sleek modern decor.Nice, courteous an professional team. Accommodations are nice and clean. My only gripe is the channel selection is not good and no microwaves in the rooms.

review_content: Friendly staff-clean rooms-good food and beverage. We always stay here. It's near the airport. There's restaurants and shopping near by.                                                     They will call a shuttle that will take you to downtown Nashville for 10.00 dollars round trip. It is well worth it no chance of a DWI.                                                   There pool is half inside and outside the kids love swimming under and being outside in the cold then coming back. Free breakfast and dinner always a big hit. We always sit at a table for four so we can ask a couple sit with us. You can meet the nicest people that way.I had to change hotels for my last night in Nashville, so I ended up staying closer to the airport.  While the hotel was a little older, it was beautiful and clean. The staff were extremely friendly.  The location is very close to the airport and they offer a complimentary shuttle.They offer a "happy hour" with cocktails and a light meal.  They offered hot dogs, pasta, salad, baked potatoes, and nachos.  They also offered breakfast with sausage and biscuits, fruit, eggs, etc.  There is also a Wendy's and KFC within close proximity as well as a gas station, Ruby Tuesday's, Panera and Waffle House.The mattress was a little too soft for me, but I slept well.  I had a room on the first floor and it was extremely quiet.I would highly recommend if you want to stay at a nice hotel near the airport!This place not only gives you a free breakfast buffet every morning but also a free dinner buffet every evening from 5pm-7pm (plus 3 free alcoholic drinks, soda & popcorn machine access every night). Pretty good deal in my opinion. Nice hotel with nice enough rooms.We LOVE Drury! We even vacay around them. We didn't book ahead though. Lesson learned! The NRA is having a conference in Nashville leaving us with only a Suite to stay in! Alas, that's what we got. It's Awesome! Dear Son said he felt like a Redneck Millionaire!! Enjoy!The staff made the stay so so pleasant. Omg. The only reason for the 4 starts were the hall noises and the business of the airport.I was in town for a hair and beauty trade show and sought out this particular hotel. It's a short commune into downtown but half the price of the downtown hotels. I wish I could stay longer.The Drury Hotel / Airport in Nashville has been, consistently, the hotel  where I have received the best value and the warmest welcome. They are doing everything right, the staff is perfect, the service is superb, the performance/price value is, without a doubt, the very best  I have seen  in this class of hotels in North America, Europa and Asia. I do mean it. Love the snacks & drinks early evening. Superb staff & crew at the Drury Airport in Nashville.This is a really nice hotel! I stayed here with my two dogs, and we had such a great time! They only allow two dogs per room, but the dogs are allowed anywhere in the hotel. The staff was extremely friendly, and the room was clean. Besides a few kids running down the hallway screaming in the middle of the night, it was generally a great experience. I would recommend staying here, especially if you're passing through with pets!We booked our trip last minute to Nashville and were very lucky to book this hotel. This was out first time staying in a Drury Inn.Pros:-Very friendly and accommodating staff-Clean rooms-Decent price-Very close to the airport(If you care about that)-About a 10 minute drive from downtown -Good breakfast-Kickback hour which includes 3 drinks per person/per night and  heavy snacks -Indoor pool and outdoor pool and indoor hot tub-Comfortable beds-Easy access to highway-Pet-friendly (if you want to bring your pet)-Many restaurants to choose from surrounding the hotel-Hotel guest only parking lot-Plenty of outlets in the room-Safe areaCons:-Some rooms smell like smoke even though it's a non-smoking hotel-10 minute drive from downtown(if you plan on spending most of your time downtown)-Pet-friendly ( if you don't like the idea of animals being in the hotel)-Very close to airport( you hear airplanes fly over quite frequently)-Only two elevators and there are 6 floorsWe definitely would not mind staying here again.$10 pet fee in an incredible hotel.  Staff extremely polite and professional.  Love the Drury inn chain only issue is there are not more of them.I have never heard of this brand of hotels but was able to stay here for a conference while in Nashville. This was one of the best customer service experiences I have had all year... super friendly, knowledgeable, and accommodating staff. The room was clean, bed was comfy, and experience was great. I joined their membership program on the spot as I checked out and will definitely be looking to stay at these hotels again!We booked hotel by phone on Thanksgiving Day. We were given a nice discount, as the military discount was blocked-out for the holiday weekend. When we arrived (too late for drinks and dinner:( we were very impressed with the security gates and the updated room keys. No swiping of room keys- you just need to wave it. The hotel was fully booked, there were a lot of pets, and the pool was packed (inside/outside pool seemed very cool). We stayed with our dog ($10.00 fee) on the pet floor, and only heard a bark twice during our stay. The room was clean and did not smell of pet or harsh deodorizer. There was even a few grassy areas with dog bags in the parking lot. In all, we had a great experience and will stop there again next time.After a great stay at Drury hotel in Orlando I thought I would search them out on my most resent trip. It was ok but not great friendly and had all the benefits that Drury offers just small and cold. I would stay there again. And recommend it to you. They are good and worth the money.I'm not one to usually write reviews, although I always research reviews before visiting anywhere and appreciate those who take the time to give honest feedback.  So, I'm making it a point now to try and write reviews myself to help assist others as well.  With that being said, we have stayed at this particular Drury Inn on a few different occasions now while in Nashville.  We've always had a very pleasant experience.  Rooms are clean and comfortable.  We feel safe staying at this hotel and the gated parking lot is a nice touch.  Great breakfast and light dinner/snacks served in the evening, as well as popcorn and free drinks. I love that it's a pet friendly hotel as we usually bring our dogs with us.  The $15 pet fee is fair. Room rates seem fair compared to other hotels in the area.  Book the Drury Inn Nashville... You won't be disappointed!This hotel is amazing! Great pet fee. Amazing rooms that are clean and beautiful. VERY good hot breakfast. Loved the staff. Even the manager was out there helping his guests. The kids loved the indoor/outdoor pool & hot tub. We will be back! Thank you for a great stay here in Nashville.I'm really pleased to be writing a positive review about a hotel for a change. Seems I have the worst of luck when traveling irregardless of the price. This is truly an exceptionally clean, well maintained and managed hotel close to the Nashville Airport.Thank you for providing enough electrical outlets. Seems about 2/3 of the places one stays when traveling you have to unplug a floor lamp or some other appliance in order to charge a phone or laptop.Love the magnetic key system and the ability to park behind a security gate.Was in town for a two-night stay. Didn't need an elaborate bar or restaurant in-house as I was in a rental car with all of my business downtown. $300+ for two nights, everything was to my satisfaction. Would most definitely recommend this venue and will likely stay here again in the future.1st timer for Drury...Wow what a good deal, and nice for the price ..The staff was very helpful, and even gave my wife a goodie bag because it was her birthday ( thanks Sherry). Great service !Rooms nice & clean,  free breakfast, snack/dinner. Free drinks alsoJust be aware abouth the hordes of kids on bus tours and other bus tours that apparently mob the placeI didn't see or hear any pets, but it is nice to know a pet friendly placeMy husband and I stayed here after flight cancellations kept us in the area for an additional night. We chose this hotel partly because of it's location in regard to the airport but MOSTLY because we were traveling with our dog. It was nice to have a safe, pleasant place we could go with our companion.The accommodations are wonderful, the drinks and popcorn in the lobby make it that much easier to relax after the frustrations of travel complications. The dinner in the evening is a thoughtful addition as well. My husband and I are vegetarian so we didn't partake in the hot dogs but the salad and pasta worked well for us. Not to mention there's plenty of food in walking distance.The only thing we wished we knew was the timing of the morning breakfast (we probably should have verified this with the front desk) in the lobby. We read the start time in the paperwork inside the room and realized that due to our flight we were going to leave nearly an hour before it began that Sunday. To our amazement when we got downstairs the next morning, there was food available. Unfortunately for us we had to leave immediately to catch the flight so we only had time to quickly snag a few items as the shuttle driver took care of our bags. We were bummed to see we could have made time to start our day with what appeared to be a great spread.  - Therefore I recommend asking about times for the food just to be sure!So, we 100% recommend staying here if you are in the area. As frequent European travelers we often comment how the hotels over seas seem to make more of an effort to provide small things like a decent breakfast, which really mean a lot to a traveler, well this hotel was above and beyond! Loved it!We travel with our dog and we try to stay exclusively at Drury Inn's. We always enjoy our stays. I wish I could give 4 and 1/2 stars as my only issues were that they were more expensive than the other 5 we stayed at this trip and they were in a less desireable neighborhood than most Drury Inn's.We came with two bulldogs and two kids, traveling with another family with 5 kids.  We fed everyone well at he free dinner and breakfast the following morning.  The kids thought the indoor/outdoor pool was the coolest!  The manager was awesome, very accommodating and eager to help two moms traveling with a zillion kids.Great for families!  Rooms were updated and the bedding was nice.Kudos for being very family and pet friendly!  We stopped at the Drury Inn & Suites in Nashville to break up a long drive from Florida to Chicago, with two large (75 and 90 lbs.) dogs.  Dogs are welcome and there is no extra fee! On top of that, the hotel is clean, the staff is friendly, and they have a great dinner and breakfast buffet!  Upon arrival, we were each given a ticket for three free drinks at the bar!  A glass of wine (or two, or three) and a free buffet meant that we didnt have to venture out for dinner (even though several places to eat are w/in walking distance) after a long drive.This will be our regular stop as we make this trip twice year.
review_content_20: I am so disappointed in this hotel. I booked a room for one night after reading all the great reviews. When we arrived too late for the finger food and drinks, they just said I am sorry. The bed and pillows in the room were the worst I have ever slept on. The transportation provided by hotel was a reasonable price at 10.00 pp roundtrip downtown but they also pick up other people at other locations so you get there and come back later than you think. We had a full load going back and the person sitting up front turned the radion up all the way and was a miserable ride back. The breakfast is not good at all down to the coffee. You are better off going to a fast food restaurant. There is no bar or alcohol available. I will never go back. I rate this place a 0 and don't believe everything you read.Love this motel. Good breakfast and free dinner and drinks. Will and all front desk employees are the best. Very helpful.Free beerEnough saidThe Pros: This hotel is very conveniently located to the airport - about a 5 minute drive away.  The folks at the front desk were very friendly and helpful.  They recommended a restaurant nearby that turned out to be a great experience.  The rooms were clean and the decor was nice enough.  We were on the sixth floor and it was pretty quiet. The downsides were that the AC in our room could never get the room cool enough and I woke up in a sweat twice, despite eventually setting the thermostat at 62! The hotel had only one elevator to serve six floors of rooms. While most hotels have queen size beds in their two-bed rooms, these guys use only double beds which totally sucked since my husband and I are used to sleeping on a queen.  The breakfast offered a lot of different items but the gravy tasted like it was made from a powdered gravy mix - pretty gross.  Also, the sliding door leading into the lobby was rather narrow, especially if you are dragging a suitcase or two behind you. Very awkward.This is a great spot to stay for a visit to Nashville.  It's well located, the rooms are clean and roomy plus they have so many free amenities, I'm sure I can't even name them all!  I especially enjoyed the breakfast and the Kick-back hour.  They had much better food selections than I'd imagined plus, for KBH you get three free alcoholic drinks!!  For breakfast, I loved the sausage biscuits, eggs with ham and waffles.  For KBH I had chicken strips, some soup, nachos and salad.  There are plenty of things to do in Nashville, but it's nice to have a little down time.  After this experience, I'll be sure to stay at a Drury for my next visit.This is my first time staying at a Drury Inn and I was very impressed.  The lobby was very cleanly decorated and welcoming.  The staff was friendly throughout our stay.  The rooms were clean and there was a free gym and indoor pool.Most impressive were the free hot breakfast, the free food in the evenings, and free snacks throughout the evening and nights.  The breakfast was actually good - eggs, biscuits, sausage, and gravy, in addition to the normal continental breakfast items, plus waffle irons where you can make your own waffles.  I can't speak for the free "kickback" and snacks in the evening because I got in late, but I've heard great things and I saw them clearing up the popcorn just as I checked in, so I'm sure it was a good time.The staff was extremely courteous and helpful.  We stayed for $100 per night, which is a good deal when you look at the surrounding area and especially considering what they have to offer.I've heard good things about Drury Inn in general, and would recommend anyone to check them out as a hotel option throughout the US.This hotel is awesome! They have a friendly and very accommodating staff. Our suite was huge and VERY clean (I'm talking grout lines and bathroom tile corners clean) it was like the place was brand new. My kids LOVED the pool. The free breakfast and dinners were freshly made and very good, not at all what we expected for it being free. Oh, and the bonus three free drinks per guest per day was pretty sweet too! Oh oh! And they have free soft drinks/water/coffee AND popcorn almost all day!! This place was great. We'll only be staying at drury hotels from now on...we actually kept saying that during our stay. :)Good rate for a pretty nice suite.  I trusted the Yelp reviews and they didn't fail me here.  I had to find a last minute place to stay and found a winner.The suite ($125 or less with military discount) was clean and modern.  A tv in the room and living area.  The only knock in this was that the tvs were using coax/analog for some reason so the picture quality wasn't that great for those techno heads out there.  There was plenty of space overall.  The bathroom area had all the stuff you'd expect from a nice place including marble counters and flooring.Wired LAN and wifi net service free and fast.Another plus was that it was super close to the airport.This place is awesome! Free drinks, dinner, and breakfast! Plus, pets are free! It's very clean, too! I would absolutely recommend this hotel!Very clean lobby and rooms. Breakfast and evening food bars exceptional. Staff goes over and above to be friendly, helpful and accommodating. Best Drury I've stayed in yet. I highly recommend this location.Dogs barking at night. Not very restful. At $146.00 for the two of us. We won't stay at another Drury Inn.Beware pets are on same floor as non-pet customers.  Hearing dogs barking is not what we signed up for.We LOVED our stay at the Drury Inn!!I came to Nashville for a girls weekend, and we picked Drury since it was inexpensive, right off the interstate, and had tons of perks. In addition to a free hot breakfast, it also has a "kick back" hour with things like free chili, loaded potatoes, pigs in a blanket, and chips. When we checked in, we also got a card for free alcohol each night! How can you go wrong with two free hot meals AND drinks? Other than that, everything was great - rooms were clean and had enormous TVs, and all of the staff we encountered were super responsive and helpful. Also, for an airport hotel, we never noticed any noise. For the price, this hotel really can't be beat!Pet friendly. Free cocktails and hot appetizers. Free hot breakfast. Clean and spacious rooms. Wil definitely come back on our roadtrips from chicago to Georgia.Do not be fooled by any effusive praise you may have seen for this property.  I wanted to give the Drury name a chance, as I usually stay at Hamptons whenever traveling for business.  I could not have been more disappointed.  First, I had to kill a large tentacled insect within the first 10 minutes in my room.  Also, upon my arrival, I was disgusted to find that my room toilet had not been flushed after having been presumably used by the housekeeper.   Things only went downhill from here.  The fire alarm sounded twice later that evening. I politely inquired with the front desk attendant "Mike" as to the nature of the problem.  He was outrageously rude, stating repeatedly that "if there had been a fire sir, it would have stayed on."  Translation? "Are you stupid, pal?"  He also volunteered that kids play with the fire alarm a lot, and he even bickered with me that it wasn't at all embarrassing to the hotel.   The next day, I spoke with the General Manager "Tim" who did nothing but defend his employee and offer no apology for my bad experience.  All he offered was "I understand you thought Mike spoke rudely, but we've never heard anyone say that before."  Translation?  "We're not all that interested in customer feedback."  Message received loud and clear.  I will never stay there again.  By the way,   breakfast consisted of flavorless scrambled eggs and sub-par coffee.  The windows in the room resemble something one might see in a jail cell.  The nightly nibbles consisted of hot dogs, industrial strength chicken nuggets, and other unhealthful fare.  The decor is old and the lobby is terribly cramped.It is just 15 minutes away from the airport to this hotel/suite. I have heard a lot of positive feedback about this nice and affordable hotel. This southern-based hotel chain has the exquisite and breathtaking ambience of a hotel should feature. It is quite possibly the best looking and nicest hotel in Nashville. Sorry, If I had to compare to the hotel in SF, it will be Hotel Nikko,which is also my favorite.They have a special on a suite for $109.00 a night. The room has one large bed for my linebacker's frame body, a whirlpool and a satellite dish. We requested two rooms,because I'm a huge snorer. (Strong-advisory, never sleep with me,because I snore like a bear). The suite was cheap enough, why not two rooms.The hotel employees were nice and helpful,also they request to carry our bags,but we are young we can do it. They also valet my rentral-Corolla. I would definitely stay here again, if I come back to Nashville.You kidding! It's a Drury. Rooms have been redone, great location to visit all the Nashville hotspots.This was my first time staying at a Drury Inn and based on my experience I plan to stay at this chain whenever possible.  I'd compare Drury Inns to the Hampton Inn of the Hilton brand...except Drury's are a little better in terms of extras (and more of them let pets stay free!).  They have free internet, free parking (which is accessed by a room key card), an expansive breakfast, some snacks and free drinks in the evenings.  They had a combination indoor/outdoor pool and a small gym.  There are some nice sidewalks along the main road there for walking the pooch.  There are several other hotels and restaurants along the pike, so you should be able to find anything you need within a block or two.  There's a Waffle House across the street and a McDonalds and Wendy's next door.  It was very easy to get on and off the freeway.  With all these free amenities, a decent price, clean rooms and no pet fee, I'd definitely stay here again when I visit Nashville.

review_content: The staff was extremely nice and accommodating. Room was large and clean. Came with free water. I also stayed at the Marriott near here, and this was much nicer and cleaner.Absolutely pleased with Nashville's hospitality and hotel quality. For what I paid, I received service that I would only expect if I paid at least twice as much. Front desk staff were all polite and quick, the hotel location was perfect, and in a nice enough area (I didn't get to explore all that much - just a quick business trip.) my room was super clean, the bed was amazingly comfortable, and the massive desk/tv in the room was too cool: it's the little things that matter. Bottles of water in the room, a bath robe, body wash loofah thing, oh and SLIPPERS! haha. I also liked how there was a bottle opener on the bathroom door frame. A great feature after a long day. I did not get to experience the breakfast unfortunately, I slept in and enjoyed my room as long as possible. I'll be back, hopefully pretty soon.The rooms were fine. The customer service however was atrocious. Every employee there made me feel like I was a huge inconvenience to talk to. There was a lot of trouble at check-in. They couldn't find my reservation and it took over 30 minutes to get checked in. After a 9 hour drive a you want to do is get to a bed and relax. But yet again it felt like that was my fault for them not having my information. And to top it off, I left my expensive pillows in the room (yes. I know.  That was dumb). But they're nowhere to be found, nor did they really want to spend the time looking for them. Or bother to take my description of them both when I called and when I showed up at the front desk. There was one guy who was pretty nice and tried to be accommodating, but everyone else there was pretty lacking in the customer service department. Awful. The only reason I gave two stars is because the rooms were nice and clean and everything worked in them... Except the wifi... Super slow.This hotel sucks. With much better places on the same campus (The 2 Holiday Inns here are great), do not stay here. My colleague booked this dump and compared to other nearby places, its amenities are terrible. The rooms are outdated, have very few electrical outlets and the wallpaper is peeling. There is no self-service coffee in the lobby after 6:30 am and if you get down there after 6:30, expect to wait at the restaurant for a long time AND pay Starbucks prices for a very common cup of coffee.We told the receptionist that we had to leave for the airport at 1pm and he promised us that there would be a shuttle for us at that time. It's currently 1:28pm and there is no shuttle. Not to mention there was one guest ahead of us and they "lost their information" and it's New Year's Eve and there is no room for the guest. There's one desk guy and a huge line behind us. Very poor experience.Turned out to be a great choice for a recent visit to Nashville. It was a less expensive option than staying in the main part of the city and by using Uber to get around, we saved quite a bit of money for the lower rates and not renting a car.The complimentary shuttle service picked us up within 10 minutes after arriving in Nashville and was also prompt when it was time to take us back. The printers were beneficial to print off boarding passes and other itinerary materials. Also, free WiFi, which is awesome and every hotel should have that. We didn't use the gym, but did fill up our complimentary bottles of water with the cooler in there! Note: The weather was hot and humid, those free bottles of water were a blessing and more hotels should think about providing this small benefit for their guests!Check-in and check-our were both a breeze and my friend and I were more than pleased with the service we had in the restaurant. The first day we had a sit down breakfast there with prices being very reasonable and a server who was super sweet. The next day we were more in a hurry and decided to grab a bagel to go. Not only did our sweet server give us a bagel (two each!), he also put in a small fruit salad and coffee in a convenient to-go carton at no extra charge. The only drawbacks were that the bathroom wallpaper was peeling and our tub drained so slowly, as in standing in shallow water by the end of the shower. The beds were comfy though and the room a good size. For the price and convenience, would definitely recommend.Decent hotel. Nothing impressive. Small beds and no refrigerator in the room. There's a shuttle bus that brings you dt every hour which was nice. Since it is close to the airport you can hear the planes but it's not that loud where it bothersome. Most likely will not stay here again.Friendly staff and free wifi couldn't overcome the sad room that was desperately in need of renovation and overpriced for $160 / night.Hotel is dated and not maintained to the typical Radisson standards.  Restrutant poorly run - staff was disinterested in service to the customer.  Too many other choices in Nashville to book this one.Two girlfriends and I just got back from a spur of the moment trip to Nashville. We booked our trip through AAA and got an awesome deal! Our room was very nice, clean and exactly what we were expecting. The staff was incredibly nice! Huge thanks to Matt for letting us check in super early! We took a red eye on a Wednesday night which meant we arrived at 5:15am in Nashville. But that's 3am in California time for us. And who really gets any sleep on planes!? Also, Janice at the front desk was incredibly sweet and attentive to us during our stay. Any time I called the front desk requesting towels, spoons, coffee pods...it was brought to our room instantly! This hotel does offer a free shuttle to and from the airport and within a 3 mile radius. And is about a 10-15 minute drive to downtown. We just used lyft while we were there and it worked out great.A fairly typical Radisson that is far away from everything (other than the airport) and not very memorable. That being said, the staff was lovely and the room was comfortable and in the end, if you picked a Radisson, that's what you were looking for anyway, right?Very nice people. Very scary physical plant as evidenced by the post apocalyptic deterioration outside my window.So this is the last morning of our 3 night stay and overall I'm disappointed.Location is great, and the Staff is friendly. First the continental breakfast is a joke, super  8 has a better spread for 1/3rd the cost. It goes from 4AM to 6AM. That's it. It is a tiny table with coffee, hot water and tea bags, only a handful of coffee creamers, 6 trail mix breakfast bars, bruised bananas and a few apples. Now the reason for this crumby breakfast is because they want you to eat breakfast at the restaurant which is awfully overcharged. We paid over $5 to get 2 coffees, $2 for 3 small pieces of bacon, almost $8 for 2 servings of oatmeal, and almost $4 for a bagel. To make this worse my coffee was refilled only once and I had to chase the waitress down to get it. It was slow and she clearly didn't want to work hard for a tip. Here's a tip, work harder!Next, the sleep number beds was a selling point for me to come here, until I got here and found my bed to be slightly busted. The control would light up but the bed didn't seem to change from soft to firm. When you call down to the desk, they suggest you push hard on the remote. Very dissatisfying since that was a factor in having me come here. Seeing as how I'm not the only sleep number complaint on here maybe you should look into that.What hotel doesn't come with a microwave in the room, and they charge a ridiculous $10 to rent one.Parking is great in proximity to doors, rooms, and elevators. Bedding, bathroom and surfaces are clean but the carpet is gross, there were someone's toe nail clippings on the floor in front of the nightstand, I stepped on one and it stuck to my sock, when I realized what I picked up I was disgusted!Not that this matters to me much but they don't vacuum the elevators either, at least not in the 3 days I've been here.Pool open from 7am-10pm according to the sign on the door, not true they locked it early and I was unable to use it by the time the front desk dealt  with it.Valeria and Jeremy greeted us as we arrived and they were amazing! We were tired from driving and asked if we could check in early. Valerie and Jeremy were so nice and accommodating, they found us a room that was ready and let us check in! We were thrilled! We had such a exhausting week, it was nice to get in early! The next day we ask for a late check out and again Valerie and Jeremy came to the rescue. They gave us a late checkout and we did not have to rush. I just want to say thank you Radisson Nashville, we have stayed here before and we always enjoy our stay with you! I always leave your hotel "HAPPY" you have a nice hotel with clean rooms, a good breakfast, great front dest associates, a nice bar, it's close to the airport, I also enjoy the indoor pool!I had a great stay. This is what Radisson is supposed to be! Unlike the on by Disneyland. I would stay here anytime.After my initial review, the manager surprisingly called me and offered to change me to a new room.  He mentioned that the 5th floor is close to a building fan and it can be loud.  So avoid the 5th floor.  He set me up on the 7th floor and included a hand written note and complimentary breakfast ticket (classy). BUT, later that evening the room next to me was having a raucous party.  10 years ago I would have been the one having the noisy party, but I am old and cranky now.  I need my damn sleep! It is the airport radison, for ppl with early flights.  So as much as I felt like a tattle tale, I called the front desk asking them to ask the room next to me to quiet down.  After an hour, it was still loud AF.  I called again and the girl at the front desk said they tried to contact the room but had no answer.  Kinda a lame response.  How about send someone up there.  They were partying with their door open.  She then offered to change me back to the 5th floor.  I was so tired and annoyed, I agreed to it.  despite the manager's effort to clear things up for me initially, I still would not return here.  I hate writing crappy reviews, but I cant front.  Again on the plus side, the beds are AMAZING.  So if you do stay, stear clear of the 5th floor and hope you are not next to party.While I did not actually stay the night as a guest here, I spent my entire day in your restaurant and lobby instead of my own hotel's lack of accommodations. We were all  iced in! The staff was very short today (due to the terrible road conditions) but they handled it very well. The restaurant service was VERY slow but the 3 waitresses that were there were working their tails off! Good food, good environment. I recommend staying here/eating here or anything! The pool was also very nice.We stayed here a few weeks ago for the CMA Fest... at first we were a little annoyed about not being able to stay downtown, but honestly, I'd stay out near the airport again anytime. The drive to get downtown was no more than 10-15 minutes, even when the traffic was "heavy". I use quotes b/c what you Nashvillians consider "heavy traffic" is nothing compared to where I'm from! The trip to & from the fest was a breeze, no matter the time of day.I knock off 1 star for a few reasons... Sleep Number beds. This, dear Radisson, is NOT a selling point. These beds suck. Mine was broken, first of all, so I couldn't even see the number on the little dial-gadget-thingie, but honestly I think these beds are just really freaking expensive air mattresses. I tried a bunch of different settings and never did find one that was comfortable. Granted, I couldn't see the setting I was on, but I could feel the air going up & down and it was never, ever soft.Lack of toilet paper. Seems like a weird thing to complain about. But, 2 girls staying in 1 hotel room for 3 days, yeah, we need some TP. I had to go steal some off of the maid carts every morning, because for some reason, whenever the maids would make up our room, they wouldn't leave us any TP. Weird.Overall I'd definitely stay here again, but I'd rather they not have those Sleep Number beds. All the staff that we dealt with was friendly, rooms were clean, it was really quiet, etc. ... Free wi-fi is a bonus as apparently my cell phone and Nashville do not get along at all. Not much else you can ask from a hotel except for the basics and they did that part well!The Radisson Nashville Airport is exactly what you hope an airport hotel to be.  Which is generally a good thing, if you know what to expect.  A quick breakdown of the hotel experience:The Good:+ Very prompt shuttle service to the airport (which is 5 minutes away).+ Friendly staff.+ Sleep number beds don't really do much for me.  But if you're into that kind of thing, they have 'em.+ Can't hear the planes flying by.+ Reasonable walking distance (if you don't have a rental car) to fast food (KFC, McDonald's) or a K-Mart (which does not have fresh food, but is a place you can buy some water to save a few bucks).+ Approximately 15 minute drive to Opryland, and downtown Nashville.+ Free WiFi was relatively fast, and didn't make you re-login every 5 minutes.+ Nice flatscreen TV with a decent selection of channels.The Bad:- Why can't hotels do the soundproof door thing right?  This hotel clearly figured out how to keep the outside noise out (see "The Good").  Why then can I hear every single noise from the hallway?  Like every single noise.  I could hear conversations going on 50 feet away from my door.  That's not okay.  Since you're in an airport hotel, this means you will inevitably hear someone opening/shutting their door for their 5AM flight, when you're trying to squeeze in a little more sleep.- Charging $7.75 for a breakfast buffet when you can get a free version (granted, which sucks more) at a sister property just down the street (Country Inn & Suites).- Piss poor recognition of Club Carlson elite members.  I don't expect you to roll out the red carpet, but giving me a bottle of water, and some weird candy that wasn't sealed is not enough.- Computers that are so slow that I wondered if: a) someone watched a lot of porno on them and now they are full of viruses, or b) they bought the computers in 1986 and never updated.Clean, nice amenities, big pool, large fitness area. My room had a sectioned-off work space. The bed is large and comfortable. The TV was NOT HD. Bummer. Friendly staff. Bar and grill/room service prices were a bit high, but not unusually so.
review_content_20: Stayed here for New Years Eve events and had a very enjoyable stay.  Couldn't beat it for the price.  Very clean, nice rooms and every time we needed something from the front desk, the employees were beyond helpful and friendly.  They went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed.  If you're staying here to visit the downtown area frequently, I do not recommend it.  It was at least a $25 cab ride every time we went downtown and back.  Same with going to Opry Land.  It's only a 15 minute drive but the cab fares add up.  However, there was a free shuttle to and from the airport.  Not a fan of the sleep number beds.  Ours was difficult to work and we couldn't get them so that it was comfortable.  However, free WIFI, microwave and fridge in the room and good service!This place earns 5 stars for service, 5 stars for cleanliness in rooms and common areas, and 5 stars for affordability. I think that's about 15 stars. Too bad Yelp only has a 5 star limit.Their free shuttle service to/from the airport also drives anywhere within about 3 miles of the hotel and gives rides to the airport every half hour. Unfortunately for us, the shuttle left early and we weren't super pleased - however moments later the manager came out and personally gave us a ride to the airport in his car. This is above and beyond service!!!!!! We'll be back just because of this hospitality.A few hints:The breakfast buffet is surprisingly good and about $7.The place is right across the street from Waffle House and Shoney's if hotel food isn't your thing.Save money staying here and cab it downtown, just make sure they use the meter instead of the flat rate. It's about $25 each way including tip.They have an indoor pool and outdoor deck. Not bad.They have a hotel bar. It's not huge, but it's there. Having a bar is always a plus.Great rates for USAA (military) members.Rooms & Lobby areas were clean and nice. It looks like they've recently renovated.$1 snacks & meds at the front desk. Midnight snack, anyone?FREE WiFi. I could stream Hulu on it even.I'd definitely recommend this spot. Try it out!I have only stayed here a couple of times, but have been pleased each time. It's a great place to stay when flying out of Nashville. I have used their parking/shuttle service numerous times. It is cheap and efficient. This service is the reason for the 5 star review! On my last trip I lost my watch somewhere along the way. It was not expensive, but had belonged to my grandmother, so very, very special to me. I called the hotel and the shuttle driver had found it. They not only had kept it, but then mailed it to me at no charge. How great was that?!!  In my book.... these guys rock!!!This is a nice hotel very close to the airport.....and fortunately only 5 minute drive to Opryland.  They also have the sleep number beds - mine's a 30.  They have all the traditional Radisson amenities, there was a hockey tournament on the weekend we were there, so unfortunately there were 16 - 18 year old kids running around like crazy, management did a pretty good job of shutting them up though.Basic room. A little worn. My room opened to a roof with klieg lights shining bright. Still filtered through the curtains. Small but functional workout room. Cardio and weight bench with rack of dumbbells and cable machine. Breakfast until 11:00am on Sunday. Basic. Eggs, bacon, potatoes, grits, biscuits and gravy, cereal, toast and muffins. Best employee in the hotel is a waiter I have seen several times. Asian man who goes overboard to help. Don't have his name but he has been there every time I have. Hotel 5 min from airport.----see update below----Dirty, Outdated, and Sleep Number beds that do not work.  I'm sleeping on a hard air mattress.  I am here on business, the room is direct billed.  For some reason direct bill seems to be a hit or miss but it seems that this hotel missed COMPLETELY.  Also, tried to be on the ball and send my cc auth form in the day prior to be prepared and of course it wasn't processed and neither was the direct bill.  Took me more than 45 minutes to get checked in. The girls at the front desk were super friendly though and that makes up for everything.  Customer Service goes a long way. Tea in the room, but its all decaffeinated and in the morning for someone who does not drink coffee, caffeine would be appreciated.  The AC was set at 68 so I turned it up to 75 as I was freezing!! The heat came on....?!?!  So I turned it back down and of course it was too cold.  Decided to just put a sweater on.  Thank goodness I brought one! There is a 37in Flat Screen TV which is nice.  The Sleep number bed is set on VERY FIRM- the remote wont even turn on to change it to something SOFTER.  I HATE SLEEP NUMBER BEDS! If I wanted to sleep on an air mattress I wouldn't be in a hotel. :) But then again I'm not paying for this room....but I have to be here for a week so this could be a long week! WiFi is very spotty, but its FREE!!! Daydreaming of sleeping on a WONDERFUL bed in the Hyatt Place that I get to stare at from out my window!!! There is a nice swimming pool though. *******Radisson also has a Yelp Deal at Check In for an extra 500 Gold Points Plus Points, but its been forever since I've stayed in a Radisson and I certainly do not subscribe to their rewards program.  But its great they offer that to Yelp Members!-----------------UPDATE-----------------OK, so I'm editing my earlier review of the Radisson here in Nashville Airport.  I am blown away by the response I have received from the hotel since I posted this review.  They pay attention and its very evident that Customer Service and Guest Satisfaction is important. This morning I went to have a complimentary continental breakfast- it was good. The service was great! I left and went on with my work day- I had no idea that I would have such a fantastic response from the hotel to rectify my experience when I posted my review last night, but its much appreciated!  I got back to my hotel this evening to a very nice note from the Manager, Connie. She wanted to be sure that anything wrong was addressed and that I was satisfied!  She also extended a phone call to me and asked me if there was anything specific she could make right for me.  The sleep number bed isn't something that can change, but I let her know about my tea preference and also let her know that while I was gone today, tea was not replaced by housekeeping.  I left my room briefly and came back and a platter of assorted teas along with a fruit and cheese platter was delivered within just a few minutes of me arriving back to my room.  To me this is ABOVE and BEYOND and I could not be more appreciative of the manager here for making my satisfaction a priority. She also addressed the direct bill issue, and that issue is a two way street, but she assured me that she will be working with my company to be sure that everything is done correctly in the future!  We have a very good rate with the Radisson and I know that we use them when others come in to town.  I'm completely impressed by the Customer Service I have received and I have changed my rating to reflect my satisfaction. From the beginning the Customer Service and the friendliness of the staff have been great- I would be happy to stay here again for this fact alone. Thank you Radisson for being so very concerned about your Customers' needs and expectations.Very comfy room, clean, free wifi cable tvFriendly staff. Not a lot of 'style'here but a great hotel nonetheless. Easy access to highway. Love the sleep # beds nice surprise there. The hallway was a little dingy but the room was lovely . Great location too.At first, it seemed like a no-frills room. Very clean. No fridge or microwave. BUT... They do have sleep number beds. I've never seen those in a hotel before.I was very pleased with my stay at this hotel. We arrived at 4:30 AM and, remarkably, they were able to give us an available room! That alone made me really happy, but the room was also clean and comfortable with free wifi (always a plus). I wasn't a big fan of the sleep number bed, but I don't know if it was because there was actually something wrong with the bed, or if my husband just set it to "deflated balloon" on purpose. Overall, a satisfying experience.As hotels go, and this is an airport hotel, this one is vgood. CLEAN, quiet and friendly staff. Even the TV worked.What more do you need. I am not a fan of sleep number beds and I think this would be the only negative. Did not try the food and went out early in the morning. They had good hot coffee and grab and go for us V early people. A place well run.Nice room, not a place I would usually stay. Probably stay closer to downtown, but the sleep# bed will make up for it later. See if it's better than our temperpedic ergo cloud. The remote for the bed was hard to use, didn't wanna work. Got to push the buttons way down. Okay, finishing this review, our bed was better. Free wi-fi and breakfast for 2 was nice. Hotel is right by I-40 and the airport  and only 7-8 mi. From downtown. Considering it's location, outside noise was minimal. Didn't use the pool or weight room, but peeked in and both seemed nice. All the staff we encountered were nice. Booked on priceline for the sleep# bed, but had us for a double on arrival, desk clerk changed with no problems.
