Overall I'd say this is a great place to stay, no matter where you are going in the Nashville area.This hotel was really nice.  The rooms were really clean and the bed super comfortable.  The complimentary breakfast was delicious and the waitress was really nice.  The shuttle to the airport was really convenient.  My only complaint is that they didn't have any movies available for purchase on the tvs - I really wanted to watch a comedy or action movie but was stuck watching whatever was running on a really limited number of channels.Nice room, pleasant staff...not a thing wrong w/ this place.  Make sure to check out the continental breakfast in their restaurant (free w/ room...ask for coupon at front desk...unless you booked via Priceline, etc...in that case, just tell your server that you weren't given a coupon, no problem).Hmm...now why a hotel near the hospital would decide to under staff during the evening check in shift was a bit mind boggling.  The best part about my stay: They had sleep number beds!  The worst part about my stay: I realized I didn't really like the sleep number bed.Between the bed, the nice chairs, and the free wifi, this was almost the perfect hotel for the all functions no frills road warrior trip.

review_content: The staff (especially Porter) is so wonderful and helpful and gracious in making your stay exactly as you want it to be! We did exactly everything that Porter recommended based on what we told him our crew liked and he tailored everything to us. Cheryl was so sweet in checking us in and making sure we had everything we needed. The hotel manager (?) Cecilia sat back and let them do their work without micro managing and was sweet about Porter taking extra time talking to us. We are very happy campers here!This was a one-night stop for us on a road trip. We spent very little time at the hotel, in full transparency. After checking in, we dropped our bags off at the room and then went to the front desk to ask about a local bar and its proximity to the hotel. I think we got a little snowed -- we asked about walking; the hotel clerk said we should take a taxi and then connected us with one who happened to be in the lobby. Regardless, the room was nice enough and the included breakfast was satisfactory.Location can be sketchy at night. Parking is tough even if you valet. The rooms are oversized which is nice. Hotel is nice. Staff is very friendly. Carpet in our room was torn as if an animal had chewed it?Seemed a little rough. Food and drinks in the evening is nice.My wife and I checked in for a long weekend and we were very happy with the hotel,location and the staff who were all great. I didn't encounter one negative employee from the hotel the entire weekend in fact everyone went out of their way to be friendly. The people at the front desk, the valet drivers as well as the cleaners were great.My family stayed here the weekend of the Nashville marathon and were in a standard room with one king size bed.  I selected Homewood Suites based off my stay at their airport location which is brand new and very nice and spacious.  Unlike this location which is older and much much smaller. Our room might have been 400 sq feet.  Also no bathtub only a shower and after a 1:2 marathon I wanted to soak in a tub! Pros: The room and hotel are very clean with good linens, mattress and pillows. Homelike set up with kitchen- great to cook up a meal or heat up leftovers. Free breakfast that is top notch - waffles, biscuits, potatoes, gravy, sausage along with cereal- fresh fruit and many pastries.  They even had a special breakfast set up for us running the race - very thoughtful! Location: right downtown and can easily walk to everythingFriendly staff - easy check inCons: $336 a night- usually at this price point the hotel will have more amenities such as a spa and restaurants and larger rooms. Fridge made loud noise all night long No free parking / $29 a day to parkNo restaurant inside hotelWe've never had a bad experience at Homewood Suites, but the staff at this one went above & beyond when it came to flexibility, being courteous & those 'little touches' that made us feel very welcome & comfortable. The one bdrm had plenty of space, and the free breakfast had lots to choose from, including hot items. Fast, convenient valet parking & Morton's next door. This will always be our hotel choice in Nashville.We were very pleased with this hotel. We got a great price on a suite with a king bed and fold out couch. The complementary breakfast was very good with real eggs, bacon and other health choices. Most impressive was the staff. A woman from Toronto, who was in Nashville for her birthday had had numerous problems with her visa and flights. The staff brought her mimosa and sang happy birthday. Everyone, staff and guests posed for selfies with the birthday girl. Location is good, rooms are comfortable and the staff are friendly... what more can one ask for.The rooms are pretty standard for what you would expect from any decent hotel room except they have upgraded features like a pull out couch and full kitchen. I started having issues with this long ordeal from the minute I made my reservation. I set up an HH Honors account because I didn't have one at the time of reservation. I called a few days later to a hotel in Boston that I needed to reserve which was also a Hilton. They couldn't find me in the system and had to re-create my account. When I checked in, they still didn't have my account on file and I said just forget it.Then about a month before arriving, I happened to be looking at my email and realized that they booked me for a King Suite instead of Double Queens as requested. After numerous calls to the hotel, central booking, and different managers (total runaround) I was finally told that all they have is 5 rooms with 2 beds in them (that's insane) and that they were all booked. After countless time arguing, they agreed that I would be upgraded if one became available at no additional charge. Otherwise we would be stuck with a King bed and a pullout couch for the 4 guests. Not the end of the world but, not the ideal sleeping arrangements I had in mind for the money.They day of arrival, I call ahead to see what was going on. They had no idea what I was talking about and had to scramble and call me back after speaking with a manager. They said there was no double room available but one would be the next morning and that they would move us. I then arrived at the hotel a few hours later to check in. My other guests had arrived before me due to a flight delay and I asked that they be let into the room. Once they checked in, I instantly had a hold on my debit card for the entire amount of the stay plus my guests parking for the entire stay... What! First of all, they should have waited for me to arrive to authorize anything on MY card because I would have gladly given them a credit card for incidentals instead of putting an $850 hold on my debit card. I've also never heard of a hotel charging the entire fee upfront for a hotel stay instead of just incidentals and I've stayed at hundreds of hotels.Gabrielle at the desk apologized for all the mistakes and assured me that the manager would be notified and that we would be well taken care of after all this. he implied we would definitely be moved to a larger room in the morning and even said he would be my "personal concierge for the weekend if anything else went wrong or for anything I needed". I thought that was a nice touch and felt assured that things would get better from here.The next morning I called down to see about us moving rooms. Again, nobody had any idea what was going on. I asked for Gabe, my new personal concierge as of the day before, and was told he was working the night shift and would be in from 11pm-7am... not so helpful. I ended up back on the phone with Miguel, the manager who I spoke to initially upon realizing the room issue a month before checking in. He let me know that Gabe was mistaken and that he should not have said we would be moving rooms because nothing else was available.At this point I was furious and we went back and forth about terrible communication amongst staff and how he needed to make this right. Eventually he called me back with a solution. The moment he said "upcharge" I told him absolutely not but, he recommended I hear him out. He said the fee would only be $20 extra per night, and he would put us in two adjoining King Suites for basically an additional $40 (two more nights of our stay). My party and I all agreed this would be a much better situation compared to cramming into one room and having two people sleep on a pull-out. From here on out, our stay was great. We had plenty of room to spread out and no other issues. The location is perfect for getting around downtown. Breakfast was unimpressive but it's free so.... no biggie. One day we came back to the room at 3:30pm and had been gone all day only to find that they were still servicing our rooms. Had to wait in the hall for ten minutes while they finished up. Lastly, everyone is right about there being no whirlpool even though it says there is.Miguel did finally take care of us and made our stay enjoyable. Unfortunately, it took so much teeth pulling and  too many aggravating conversations. The whole situation should have been handled better from the start. We all knew in advance that there was an issue but instead of being proactive and trying to resolve the problem before I arrived, they put it on hold to figure it out when I got there. Reactive customer service is never the best option. Imagine my excitement to check in to my room only to find out that they gave us the same situation without all the arguing. I would probably be writing a 5 star review saying how thoughtful they were. They had the ability to do this but instead, opted to turn the whole thing into a negative experience.Had a great stay here. After cancelling a reservation at the Sheraton Downtown Nashville (see previous review), for not being able to guarantee a refrigerator for me (I am a nursing mom), Homewood Suites provided an exceptional customer experience, complete with a fridge!!Staff was awesome - night manager was super sweet, helping my friends and I order a pizza when we came in..uh..late. Hotel lobby is so beautiful and the rooms themselves were clean and spacious; cleaning staff were exceptionally friendly! Finally, the complimentary breakfast was delicious. If ever back in Nashville, there is no question where I will be staying.I liked the little Yoda towel they made on the counter for us to find. Plenty of room to fit four people. Breakfast here was okay.Clean hotel with nice lobby, dining area, and hot food available for breakfast and dinner. It is only a few blocks from the Broadway area, although there isn't much in the immediate blocks for dining and entertainment. There is a free WiFi option, expensive valet parking, and an exercise room. The staff was very polite and helpful!The suite was in three sections (bedroom, bathroom, lounge/study) as opposed to an open plan. This is good for not disturbing others, but makes the rooms small. The heating / cooling ran constantly. And I didn't like having my window facing the lobby 'cause even on the second floor there was no privacy, no natural light, and I had to keep the shades closed.I would stay here again (on business only) but want a window to the outside world.Good locating downtown. The staff on the front desk were first rate. Breakfast is included. There is also free wifi. My only beef is the noise from the front street so get an inside room.My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel 3 weeks ago. The suites were comfortable and clean. The front desk staff provided fantastic service and made great recommendations for dinner and things to do during our stay. Your stay during the week includes decent meals and a cocktail hour. While it isn't fine dining it is great for catching a quick bite. The first room we checked in to needed a/c repairs so we had no choice but to move (after unpacking of course). This was disappointing but they discounted our stay each night by $50 which was more than generous.The location of this hotel is fantastic for a tourist. It is in walking distance of the "Honky Tonk" bars and a short cab ride to the trendy "Gulch" area. I would recommend this hotel and I would stay again. I had exceptional service from 2 employees in particular, but unfortunately I did not write down their names!PROS--Room was huge, had a living room and pullout couch.--All the amenities in the room: coffee pot, full sized fridge, stove, dishes, tupperware, even a toaster oven!--Free Breakfast! --Great location: short walk to Broadway and all the Honky Tonk bars, Ryman Auditorium, etc.CONS--Breakfast ends kind of early and the food offerings are nothing to write home about (bagels, toast, yogurt, eggs, bacon, potatoes, etc.).--Customer service was not great, once had to wait about 10 minutes for someone to come out, it's literally your job to stand there. YOU HAD ONE JOB.--OH HEY WHERE'S THE WHIRPOOL? Maybe you SAW THE WHIRLPOOL ADVERTISED ON THE WEBSITE, brought a bathing suit, and after a long day of walking around, you put it on and wrap a towel around your waist, and FOLLOW THE SIGNS TO THE WHIRLPOOL, and you can't find it. So you wait 10 minutes for the hotel concierge to remember it's his job to come out and help you, and when you ask where the whirlpool is, he just says, oh yea we don't have one. And when we tell you it's kind of not a great idea to have a sign for a whirlpool and information about it on your website, you just shrug and are no help at all. That's cool. Maybe you should just ride the elevator back up to your room in your bathing suit and towel.For how expensive this place is, I'd expect better customer service. We only stayed here because we had points.For the price, having the refrigerator and stove was totally NOT worth it. I would suggesting AIR BnB if you really needed it. This hotel is locate pretty centrally inside of downtown Nashville, but it still requires you to drive all around the city if you are interested in doing lots of sight seeing. At $24/day for valet parking, I would highly suggesting just staying outside of downtown and paying for parking for a day inside downtown. You will save yourself HUNDREDS, if you paid my rate at over 200/day :-(. stay at the hilton garden inn for about 50/less and eat the difference!Issues at this hotel 1.The Parking situation was HORRIBLE, to say the least. Valet was not always available to take your car and I had to call the front desk 3 different times during my stay to see where the valet was, which leads me to my next two issues.2. Valet person is NOT AVAILABLE from past 12 midnight - 6am. You will need to call the front desk to make arrangements. If you are out late and come back, gosh I don't know what you would do.3. Front desk is slow/unresponsive. 2 of the times I had called, the front desk it was faster for my friend to walk to the front desk to ask than it was for them to pick up the phone. This also happened as we called down to request for our car to be pulled up.4. I found 3 ants in my room..... man if it weren't for the fact that we were leaving early the next morning and had too much to move around, I would have requested for a room change. Ants... really??5. You can hear lots of trains and sirens at night-4th floor6. The alarm went off in the building at 1 in the morning - false alarm that went on for 3-5 mins... It was deafening.then sirens for our building b/c the FD came....If you do choose to stay here regardless, I would say it is pretty shady looking outside at night. There is a mortons one block down an downtown is pretty walkable from where you are at. Pucketts is a good option, and Frothy monkey is just around the corner. You can also walk to the Tenesee State Museum which is free admission and you are also in walking distance of many other landmarks. Again, I recommend you pay the $12 for public parking for one day in downtown and save your money!Silverlining in that the MOD was very kind and really aplogetic, but I still paid over $700 for the hotel due to parking and taxes!!!! I recommend the Hyatt Place near Opryland, or the Hilton Garden Inn down the street if you are an HHonors member. The breakfast is better and the locations are newer.My girlfriends and I met up in Nashville for 5 days of fun and country music. Not knowing that we were going to be amongst snow and ice for days, nearly EVERYTHING in Nashville was closed. Despite this, we were SO lucky we stayed at the Homewood Suites. The staff and manager were BEYOND accommodating and went above and beyond to make our experience something to remember. I have never met such courteous staff in my life!The rooms were great and the breakfast was awesome!I have and would recommend this place to anyone looking to stay in downtown Nashville!For the price, this may be my new favorite downtown hotel.  I was here on business the weekend before the 4th of July.  Right smack dab in the middle of a heat wave.  That Friday was actually the hottest day on record in Nashville - ever.  There were times when even walking a few blocks to a restaurant seemed like too much in the heat.  This would have been a major bummer if I was in Nashville for the first time wanting to see the sights, but I come often.  The heat made me truly appreciate the fact that my room had a kitchenette and a couch.  After picking up some groceries (there's a neighborhood grocery store a few blocks down) I could hole up in my room and be just dandy.  I have no complaints about the room at all.  It was smaller than other Homewood Suites rooms I've stayed in, but that's to be expected with a downtown hotel.  The layout was very nice, the bed was good, tv was great with lots of channels, and everything was clean.  As mentioned in a previous review, I think your experience will be better if you get a room with a view, which I had.  The hotel is set up as a square, so the rooms on the inside of the square must not have any windows.  That could drive me batty.  But, I was able to see outside and get some nice light in the room.  And, everyone I encountered was helpful - even the poor valets who were outside in the heat.Breakfast is free every day and they had some pretty good options.  They also do free dinner (set menu) and drinks Sun-Thu I believe.  I was there Thu-Sat nights and didn't partake of dinner on Thu, so can't comment on quality.  The fitness room is small, but nice.I was on government business, so switched to another hotel for Sun & Mon nights because of a better rate.  But, when it comes to regular rates, I believe this hotel is cheaper than most others downtown.  And, for what you get, it's totally worth walking a couple more blocks to get to the hubbub of downtown.  In fact, for sleeping it's even better as it's harder to hear the people down on the street carrying on at all hours. Well done, Homewood.  Hopefully I'll see you again.The hotel staff at the front desk were extremely helpful, accommodating & went above & beyond to ensure our stay was a good one. Brent & Kiera were extremely helpful when there was a snafu with our room reservation ~ very appreciative for their assistance!!! Brent was also very helpful with information on downtown area ~ Thanks so much Brent!!! Room was a king suite with a sleeper sofa ~ nice size CLEAN room with everything we needed at our finger tips! Would definitely recommend this location for a stay in Nashville ~This place was great!  Minus the $28 a night for parking.  They should be ashamed!  That's just rude, inconsiderate and ripping off your customers.  Putting that aside, they do do things to "kind of " offset that!  They have free beer & wine every night and full breakfast AND a FULL dinner is offered every day!!!!  ALL the staff was VERY nice!!!  The room did the trick!  It was very clean, had a king bed, pull out couch and FULL kitchen.  Dishwasher & everything!  Made it nice to bring leftovers back to the room & stick in the fridge.  This hotel does not have a bar!  Fyi.  It's walking distance to Broadway street, Bridgestone arena, the Ryman Auditorium etc.  About 4-5 blocks.  The state Capitol bldg is about 2 blocks.  Grand Ole Opry is 12 miles away.  Titans stadium is about a 15-20 minute easy walk! 4 stars and not 5 because of the parking charge.  Just absurd & gouging!My family stayed for two days in the middle of the week. My husband and I live within a few hours of Nashville but we had our daughter and friend who wanted to experience Broadway. This was convenient for walking to touristy downtown. We were in a king suite which slept four people. The room, while small, was comfortable enough. We were happy with the hot breakfast and the dinner and refreshments that were served in the evening. All in all we were happy with the room. My reason for less stars was two issues that we had at check in and check out. First, when we checked in (I had made these reservations at least a month ago), my husband asked if by chance they gave a military discount. We don't expect it and it never hurts to ask. The clerk asked the manager that was standing next to her, who answered curtly "Not this week" Not this week??  Okay, we didn't even ask what that meant and left it alone, as I said, we don't expect it...we just thought that was a strange answer. Then, at checkout, I asked if they would adjust my rate according to the rate I saw on their website the night before for the same exact room with the same amount of guests. It was a difference of twenty dollars a night. The first clerk (who was so pleasant) turned us over to the next clerk, as she was going on her break, with the apology to the 2nd clerk, "I'm sorry to do this to you"   I was told 1) It wasn't the same amount of guests (yes, it was I explained)   2) It was a different time of the year  (that I didn't understand, as it was the night before) 3) That perhaps it's because the hotel wasn't at capacity.  The 2nd clerk then turned it to the manager who told us that he could not adjust the price. It was set. I know that is not true. We were not satisfied with the answers but stay was over and we left it at that. The 1st clerk who was outside on her break, was VERY surprised the our request wasn't approved and apologized. Any way, we enjoyed our few days taking in downtown. We will looking at the many other options to stay downtown on our next visit.
review_content_20: A group of 15 stayed here this past weekend and they were excellent. We booked 3 suites and it was ample enough space for everyone split up. I worked with a woman named Jessica in arranging the rooms and check in and she was great. She called us cabs, had wake up calls, etc. She made the experience wonderful. The night person was great as well. He checked us out Sunday morning and helped store our bags so we could walk around a bit before we had to head to the airport.Definitely a good hotel for a big group of people. They were great!8 girls stayed in Nashville on a Friday and Saturday for a bachelorette weekend 2 weeks ago.Negatives:When you arrive at the hotel there is no round about or anywhere to pull your car up while you unload your belongings. They did have valet parking but it was really confusing because there was no where to actually pull your car up and there was no one out there to take your car. We ended up having to park across the street and carry all of our belongings inside. We also asked for a cart to carry all of our things and they simply said they are in the front and if there aren't any then they are all in use and there was nothing they could do. We arrived shortly after 4pm our room was still not ready and check in was at 3pm so we had to wait in the lobby with all of our stuff everywhere since we had no cart. I don't really understand why the room wasn't ready when check in was at 3. The line to check in was really long too. There were multiple people trying to check in or ask a question at the desk. There were two people working at the desk but only one of them was helping customers. I am not sure what the other person was actually doing. After awhile we did get a guy to help us take our stuff to the room. Another negative is there is no view outside in the room. We had two big windows in our room but when you opened them all your could see what the lobby where you check in. It is kind of weird because they are right by the beds too so you would for sure want to keep them closed most of the time.Positives:The complmentary breakfast was very nice. I know one of the girls that stayed with us was sad there was no waffle mix one morning. I enjoyed that the breakfast was free though. As far as how many people you can fit in a room we had 8 girls in the queen queen with pull out sofa. We brought a queen sized air matress too so everyone had a place to sleep. I don't think you would be able to fit very many more people though. You might be able to fit a twin sized air matress if you needed to. The other downside of having that many girls in one room is there are hardly any mirrors to get ready. There is a small sliding mirror where the closet is but its not full size like most are. There was also a mirror over the sink and thats it. We got lucky and the guy that helped with our luggage brought us an extra tall mirror and one of our friends brought a mirror too. Overall our main issues were when we were checking in. Other than that everything went okay and was fine. It was nice to have a full sized fridge to hold all of our beverages and leftover food. There is a microwave too so that was nice! The location was pretty close to broadway. The first night we walked there and it was okay. The second night we ended up taking a taxi just because but we didn't need to. I would stay there again if I was going with a group of friends. The rooms hold alot of people and its nice because then you can split the bill. The cost of this room was very similar to other hotels but you can't fit as many people in one room at the other hotels. If you are going with a big group I would stay at homewood suites.I am an HH member and love Homewood; this was my third stay at a HW hotel. My room was immaculate and had a great view (older building with lots of charm and  close to Nashville attractions). The guy at the desk (Gabriel) was polite and friendly and suggested I go to Puckett's for dinner. By the time I unpacked (I did not get to check in until 7:30), I realized how tired I was. I went back to the desk and asked him if he knew of another place; he gave me some info on restaurants that deliver. He then asked if I wanted a glass of wine (which I did!). Another guest service member chatted with me in the meantime and was friendly. When the desk clerk went to get the wine,  he discovered the dinner buffet was still open and invited me in. Happy as a clam! Really great customer service makes a difference to me. He could clearly see I was beat and went the extra mile to make me feel "at home". Thanks, Gabriel!The hotel was A-ok... the parking was terrible.  As most of those who visit Nashville the parking situation is horrible for not that big of a city.  The valet was 24 bucks and their was no attendant as we did a few loops to figure out if their was any self parking.  The entrance to the hotel which is weired smelled terrible the entire first day there, but was cleaned up the following morning.It is pretty expensive for what you receive but having a suite with a kitchen was nice and the location is pretty... walking distance... if your in decent shape from a lot of the hot spots.Also the treadmill and spa were both out of service which was a bummer for us.I wouldn't stay again as Hilton has much better locations normally, but better than a lot of hotels I've stayed at over the years.First off let me say I love Homewood Suites, they are my first choice. I was disappointed with a lot of little things...easy things to fix.  Nothing that a little "Customer Service" training couldn't fix. Here is the list of issues...1. Parking, they offer Valet but after waiting 20 minutes we parked our self2. Multiple calls to front desk with no answer3. Taking a reservation on the phone while waiting to check in4. Not telling us we would be in a "Handicap" room.5. Not telling us the AC had broken earlier and that the rooms may be a little warm6. Staff members blocking customers pathsNow for the good stuff...1. Room and building are very clean and charming (built in 1928)2. Breakfast was good (stay away from 5 day old gravy)3. Location (very close to many restaurants)4. Beautiful LobbyWe do live in Nashville but wanted to take a mini vacation downtown, catch a Preds game and dinning downtown without having to drive home. This hotel served the purpose but as stated above it could have easily been a four star rating if the staff had been trained properly. I wrote the manager a email about our stay (requested a reply), it's been well over 2 weeks and no email. I have down graded this hotel to a one star due to the lack of management.Our experience with this hotel started out very rough. We were given a room that we did not book and it was a smoking room. We had specifically requested a non smoking room due to 2 girls in our group having asthma. They let us know that they had over booked. We tried to make due and spray the room and open the windows, but when we pulled down the mattress it was dirty. We were very frustrated but I am giving it 3 stars because of their customer services and willingness to rectify the situation. MITCHELL who was on duty that evening was extremely helpful with helping us find another hotel that was available to take us. He was very kind, understanding, and apologetic. He is a great example of what customer service should be.The next morning we spoke with Kevin the GM and he help fix the situation for the rest of the weekend. Even though it started out rough I was very pleased with the hotels ability to uphold the 5 star service of a Hilton brand and correct the mistakes that they made.Not a bad place at all! Downtown Nashville. I only stayed here one night. Rooms are clean and up-to-date. Free parking. Free internet. Free breakfast. What more can I say? I highly recommend this place if you want a safe, comfortable, clean, and good quality hotel to stay.Enjoyed the stay and hospitality.  Total presentation of room and cleanliness were great.  Packaged included breakfast and light diner with choice of complimentary beer and wine.  Access to downtown was walking distance.  Overall would recommend.Located in a great location in downtown Nashville, walking distance to many attractions and local bars.  Only compliants: when we arrived in our room, housekeeping was still cleaning and we had to bring all our things back to the lobby for a 20 minute wait.  We were a later check in, and the front desk had no idea housekeeping wasn't done yet.  Other than the delay, everything else was great.  Breakfast is ok, standard for a hotel, nothing fancy.Gives Downtown a bad name!Worst Nashville Hotel experience ever when it comes to manners, ease of communication or respect in general.   I'm not even speaking of an individual traveling for leasure but for a corporate account that has given this specific location steady business for years!Last fall some visitor who stayed at this location were accosted on their way home.  At gun point.The staff has a "don't bother me" attitude and ZERO communication.  Talk about bad business.  I'll make sure everyone I speak to about hotels never gives them the time of day; although they're doing a great job of reflecting that themselves.Two thumbs down!Can't really fault it, stayed only one weekend nite, it was quiet, rooms were spacious and clean, was reasonably close to the downtown attractions.  Very low key, good breakfast in the morning, friendly valet staff.  Only thing was we were driving a rental car in from the airport, and had never been to Nashville before.  Traffic inbound on the Nashville Interstates for a Saturday, sucked unbelievably, and if we had not had a SAT-NAV, it would have taken us a long time for us to eventually find it.I've stayed in far worse downtown metropolitan hotels.  If we ever came back to Nashville, we'd likely stay again.....I was a little iffy on the location of this place. We walked outside after checking in and there were quite a few homeless people and the distinct smell of urine outside. But, hey, it's a city, what do you expect? The location is very close to the main drag of bars and honky tonks on Broadway, which was very convenient. The valet guy was super friendly, and the front desk staff were nice too. While we didn't utilize it, the kitchen area would be nice to have for longer stays. Will definitely check out this Homewood Suites in the future.Horrible hotel!  This hotel is not consistent with the whole experience I'm accustomed to at a Homewood Suites. I was gravely disappointed from moment I arrived.  Parking is inconvenient as it's around the corner from the front door.  The first room I was assigned was already occupied (yes, I almost walked in on someone).  The second room was a handicap room (not my preference but ok), and the heat didn't work in this unusual 16 degree Nashville weather.  The third room (yes in the same night) was descent until the next morning.  My shower was delayed by the fact that the shower handle came totally off when I attempted to turn it on!  Of course I decided to speak to front desk, and the staff person was nice enough and took down my concerns.  After being gone for a work meeting/dinner from 8am-8:30pm, I came back to the room only to find that it had NOT been cleaned all day!  I expected far more from a Hilton property.  I come to Nashville monthly on business, and I will never stay here again.We travel extensively throughout the country and this is the first hotel we've ever stayed at that I can find a single positive thing to say.From the sleeping valet parking attendants  ($20 a day) to the incompetent in-house staff, this place is a real dog. We arrived to check in (two rooms, total of 14 nights) and were informed at check in that the air conditioning wasn't working in the rooms. We were given a voucher to a hotel across the freeway and told we could make one free call! The next day we returned to Homewood and were told our rooms weren't yet ready. I asked why, if the air conditioning was fixed, was our room not ready? Stuttering ensued a we got our rooms a half hour later. Apparently air wasn't the issue; overbooking was. They lied to us. The rooms were small and unremarkable as was the entire facility. There were more homeless hanging around outside the hotel than there were guest inside. A rotten experience at a rotten hotel. General Manger doesn't care and we didn't see him out on the floor ever. Probably hiding from a the unhappy guests. Don't even consider this place---never again for us!A group of four girls and one guy stayed at the Homewood Suites in downtown Nashville while in town for the Country Music Marathon in April 2011. The hotel wasn't fabulous, but it was fine, especially for the location. We were able to walk everywhere. Plus, they don't charge for wi-fi and there's a continental breakfast! I heard they have free dinner and drinks during the week, but we were only there Friday and Saturday nights. I can't comment on the price too much though, just because we were lucky enough to get a pretty decent military discount. I'm not sure how much the hotel normally goes for.The room itself was satisfactory. All the rooms are suites, so ours came with a bedroom (two queen-sized beds), a vanity area, a teeny tiny bathroom and a small living area with a TV, pull-out sleeper couch, desk & chair, and kitchenette. Kind of tight with five people, but hey, it was cheap! There were bathrooms on the floor too (plus!), so we never really had a problem with that.The only issue I want to bring up is that we took out the extra pillows and blankets for the pull-out couch, and they reeked of smoke! I knew we had a smoking room (there were no non-smoking rooms left when we booked) but thought the hotel would have washed the sheets between guests! Gross! Made me wonder what else hadn't been washed... although everything else seemed clean. A hotel employee came upstairs right away with new linens though. The room itself did not smell of smoke, thankfully.Overall, a decent stay. I would stay again if they had non-smoking rooms available.This hotel was good for the price, especially being so close to downtown, having free wi-fi, free breakfast, and some nights free dinner with beer/wine!I didn't have to deal with the parking situation since I took a cab so I can't really comment on that.Some of the rooms are slightly bizarro mishapen (I was in one) but they're still fairly large and very comfortable.For all the free things they throw in, this hotel will definitely get my return business.Room is OK, no real complaints there I really would give it 2 1/2 stars but we can't give 1/2 stars. I love a tub and only have a shower. Not keen on their breakfast offerings, didn't eat it. It is tough eating at a lot of those types of things being lactose intolerant. Typically safer just not to eat it - plus I don't care for all the processed stuff anyway. But really I travel a ton and a gym is important to me and this one is horrible. Treadmill wasn't working, neither was the hot tub, and they don't have any free weights ---- really!?!?!? I have been a loyal Hilton Diamond member for years, but starting to stay at more and more Hyatt hotels because they tend to be better at all levels and brands. Actually, I had to swap hotels mid-stay this trip and I am staying at the Sheraton. They have one of the largest gym facilities I have ever seen at a hotel - saving my workout for tomorrow afternoon/evening and sleeping in now - will hit the gym after work and changing hotels.The rooms were nice, very spacious, clean, and had two nice TV's. But... I don't think I'd stay here again.  The guy at the check-in desk was not very friendly.  I was expecting some southern hospitality.  Parking was off site, about three blocks away.  Normally this wouldn't bother me, but it was COLD, temps in the 30's and I didn't want to walk.  We could have used the valet service for $20 a day, but it doesn't run between midnight and 6 am, we had a flight at 7 am and needed to drop off a rental car.  If I were to return to Nashville, I would have stayed one of the hotels closer to Broadway or come back in the summer.  The parking in Nashville is ample, so staying a little outside of downtown would work too.   The night before we left, we parked in a lot next to the hotel for $5 and we were able to get the car.  Another issue with the offsite parking garage is that it also closes between midnight and 6 am.  So, if you don' t having your car locked up for the night then you'll probably enjoy this hotel.  Otherwise explore other options.Excellent hotel worth every pennyStayed at this hotel when I went to Nashville to see the Ravens vs. Titans playoff game. This hotel was right downtown and was a very easy walk to restaurants and bars. I was just dropped off at the hotel and did not have to worry about parking, but parking seemed a bit tricky and I'm not sure what the situation was or where you were to park. I think there was a parking garage that our room actually was looking out on. I thought this room was fantastic. We had our own kitchen, a sofa, a desk, a flat screen, and a huge COMFY king bed. The best part about it was that the sink and vanity were OUTSIDE the bathroom. One thing I dislike about some hotels is having to get ready on a vanity that is INSIDE a hot steamy bathroom, Everyone we encountered that worked there was friendly and there was a continental breakfast in the morning. This was one of the nicest hotels I have been stayed in, very modern. If you want a place in downtown Nashville with a short walk to restaurants and bars, this could be a place to look into. Very comfy, clean, and convenient.
review_content_40: The hotel is three years old and located in a great part of town, accessible to many venues. Ask for an EXTERIOR room as interior rooms do not have a view of the city.  We had a room which faced Church Street, it was fabulous. Plus with the exterior rooms, you have windows which allow the light in.  Rooms were clean and well appointed.  Staff was friendly and helpful, even when asking to be moved from interior to exterior room. I would stay here again.  We used Hilton Honors points so only paid for self parking which was $9 per day.

review_content: Stayed here on a few different occasions while friends/family were visiting. I love Holiday Inn's. Great wifi, clean rooms, comfy beds, friendly staff = win win win! There's also a great bar downstairs that often has live music, which is a bonus. It's right next to Vandy so it can get a bit crowded during game days but they have a massive parking lot in the back so parking really is never an issue!This hotel had all of the potential to be a really great hotel, but a few poorly trained employees are really holding them back.  As someone who travels for work a lot, I usually see more of my hotel room or my work site than the sites of a city. So I got a pretty good look at this hotel over three days.First, I don't know the name of the girl who checked me in, but she was awesome. I had a flight that arrived at 6:35 AM, and when I originally called ahead to see if I could check in early, the front desk told me to call in the morning for a more accurate answer. Cool.  I would rather honesty than a made up story. I called as soon as I landed, and the girl on the phone and who checked me in told me  my room was ready. Score.  I got a quick nap before my 11 AM meeting, and I would have been miserable otherwise.The actual room was fine, and it was located on a nice and quiet corner room. I had a king-size bed with king pillows. The pillows were supposedly soft and firm, but I would refer to them as thin and lumpy and no filling at all.  While the pillows definitely needed some work, the actual bed was really comfortable. There was a balcony overlooking the pool, but it would have been really nice if there had been a chair outside to enjoy the balcony more. Last, the bathroom was an OK size with a big mirror and very updated looking.  Unfortunately, my shower seemed to be installed improperly, as the water kept puddling and wouldn't go to the drain.  But I love the Bath and Body Works shampoo and conditioner that Holiday Inns utilize!Wifi was painfully slow and not good for a business traveler.The hotel does have a restaurant that serves breakfast, but it is normally not included with a room. Mine was paid for, but I think it is normally $11.99. It was so not worth that amount, and you should go somewhere else for breakfast if it is not free.Let's move onto the issues with the front desk that began to arise throughout my trip.  While at the beginning they were very attentive, I quickly found that if I wasn't standing at the front desk, I couldn't get anything.  First, the phone is my room did not work.  So I tried using my cell phone at one point.  After sitting on hold for 15 minutes, I walked downstairs. Not 1, not 2, but 3 people at the front desk were standing and doing nothing.  Everyone was very nice and helpful in person so I passed this off as a one time thing. But this was an ongoing problem for the remainder of my 3 day stay.The biggest issue was the hotel shuttle.  I had two exceptional shuttle drivers, one good one, and one that was so bad that he should be fired immediately.  The exceptional and good drivers gave me a hand in and out of the van, immediately passed over their cards, and opened the door for me. I was so impressed!  However, the driver that worked the closing shift on October 30 was appalling.  I was dropped off for work around 6:45. This driver did not introduce himself, didn't get out of the van to acknowledge me, and was rude. Period. When I asked for his name and card, he refused to give it to me. I told him that I would need to be picked up at 10:30 PM but would call.  No acknowledgement. So I called at 10:20, and he told me he would be there in 10-15 minutes. At 10:50 PM I called him again. He told me it would be another 15 minutes. So clearly this guy was out partying or eating and not working.  So I say fine. At 11:05 PM a RANDOM guy offered to walk with me back to the hotel. I ran into a colleague on this walk who walked me the rest of the way. At 11:13 PM, I received a call from the bus driver asking where I was. HA.  What an idiot. I finally made it back to my hotel at 11:24 PM.I tried to call the front desk multiple times throughout this ordeal. Guess who never answered the phone?  So when I got back, I filled them in. The offer to resolve this was a free breakfast (Which I already had but couldn't even use) or a free snack.  While the gesture was nice, the issue was the shuttle driver needs to be resolved.  Your shuttle driver cannot take an hour long hiatus and lie to customers, and the front desk cannot ignore the phone for an hour. Sorry.Would I stay here again?  Depends on the price.  The parking was severely over-priced, and the shuttle was pretty dysfunctional as well.  If you are here 100% recreationally without any firm plans, this hotel will be fine.EDIT:  So I tried to follow up with this incompetent employee Nancy and her supposed Guest Service Manager, Britney Zanders.  Guess what?  No response.  This review has been lowered from 3 to 2 stars.  Thank you, SO MUCH, for wasting even more of my time.The hotel itself is okay, my review really for the restaurant downstairs. We waited about 20 minutes for a server to help us, not one did. 5 different waiters walked right by us, including the manager. I got tired of waiting and asked the bartender to please send us a waiter as we've been waiting a long time. She said yes, but never sent a waiter over. After wasting a half hour literally just waiting for someone to ask me what I'd like to drink, we left. Won't be going back there at all, ATROCIOUS service.Booked via an Expedia secret deals for a last minute 2 night trip. Excellent service, clean rooms, great location. Loved the free shuttle for easy Broadway access, and Uber/cab was super inexpensive to get downtown as well. Would definitely return here for any future trips!This is the third stay I've had at the Holiday Inn Vandy. The renovations are finally done and they are great. The rooms are remodeled and very modern. The lobby and Commodore Grill are also remodeled with a modern feel to it. They offer a shuttle service within a few miles radius. It gets you into downtown ;) The pool area is decent but not spectacular. The size is fair but seating is limited. I am not a fan of the food in the restaurant in the lobby (Commodore Grill). The menu could be spruced up a bit. However, the entertainment that comes through is excellent! Liver performers and song writers on an intimate stage while you dine. Very casual atmosphere.Looks renovated. All very new and clean. Value all depends on the price you paid. We booked using hotwire and got a pretty average price. Parking is a complete rip off for $20 a day when you can park on the street 2 seconds away for free. Buffet is average but not expensive. Staff friendly. Shuttle is slow and infrequent. The hotel is nice and new and squeeky clean and there is outdoor seating and a decent outdoor pool. Not worth more than $150 a night but if you can do $100 its a steal!It was average for a holiday inn.  The rooms were nice and clean.  However, the restaurant is only open 6:00 am- 10:00 am and 5pm-11 pm.  Their "market" for snacks and necessities was out of stock on almost everything - so you pretty much have to leave if you need any snacks, drinks, or Advil.It's been a long time since I've stayed at a Holiday Inn. If this is location is a representation of what other Holiday Inns are like, I'm in on the INN! It is clean, the staff are friendly, the rooms are large and the closets have lots of hangers! Plus HBO and a restaurant/bar that actually serves really good food! Quite impressed!!!Another good experience. The only complaint I have is that I was in a room that was handicap accessible meaning I didn't have a couch/coffee table so not great for a business traveler and the door was an automatic open so I had to wait for it to close. I was near an elevator again but it wasn't nearly as loud as my previous stay. Would stay again.Stayed here during an interview at nearby Vandy, and I was pleasantly surprised.  Although there's no airport shuttle, the Holiday Inn provides a free shuttle within a 3 mile radius, so you can go to Vanderbilt, check out the music and food scenes, or visit a nearby museum.  My room was obviously newly-refurbished, with comfortable luxury linens and a big bathtub (one of my hotel requirements).  Service-wise, this place is spectacular.  Although the shuttle technically wasn't supposed to go to my pre-interview dinner site, the workers at the front desk made special arrangements for me with profuse apologies for not having a mechanism already in place.  You can definitely feel the "Southern hospitality."  If you're an IHG member, don't forget to give them your number!  You might be able to score a room upgrade or a free drink certificate for either the bar or the in-hotel coffee stand.Hotel does not honor reservations! I reserved a room here through TripAdvisor, and I reserved a room with a king size bed. When we arrived, we found that they gave us a room with 2 full size beds instead. When we confronted them about it, they said they had ran out. Why say you have a room available when you don't? Although, it was a nice hotel with a nice pool in a nice part of town, there were some downsides - room included - we had some issues with parking. There had been an event at the Vanderbilt during one of our last nights there, and apparently the stadium guests had parked in the hotel's parking lot so there was no parking and it was beyond pouring rain. One of the hotel employees saved our night by coming out in the rain and moving her car. I give it a solid 4.We stayed here for my bachelorette party weekend. The hotels rooms have been updated and everyone at the establishment was beyond friendly and helpful. This was my second time at this Holiday Inn and I will definitely be staying here again.Stayed here for a business trip. Free parking, near other food options (PF Changs, McDonalds, fancier fare, etc.), room was clean, bathroom was fine, and Wifi signal was pretty strong. They have a little breakfast/coffee bar downstairs, a little snack bar, and a full restaurant. I didn't do the last one, but the other two were fine.Biggest downside I would say is the air conditioning system. It was cold when I was there, and since some of the room have those tiny patios where it is a big sliding window door, it got cold some nights. They have the older style heating systems, where it was kind of loud if I had left the hot air on at night.Overall, would certainly consider staying here again. It is a little bit of a walk if you walk downtown (like to Bridgestone Arena). They also have a free shuttle service, but I didn't use it on my trip. The location overall was centrally located.Love this hotel! I've travelled a lot (well, for a college student at least) and stayed in a lot of hotels, and this is the one I use as a benchmark to judge all other hotels by. I've stayed here many, many times.Free breakfast buffet and drinks (which now include an option of coffee too, yay for us non-drinkers) if you're a Priority Club member. Bonus! And the buffet is really nice, it's not just a continental breakfast. It's got the fruit, cereal, yoghurt, etc., but there's also eggs, home fries, bacon, sausage, even make-your-own Belgian waffles!There's free parking, too, and also a free shuttle that takes you within a few miles - it takes you downtown, that's the important thing. Plus it runs until 11 pm so you have plenty of time to do whatever you want and still catch the shuttle back, rather than rely on a cab. The WiFi is free as well and works pretty well. Nice and fast, it's only been sluggish when I'm there when a convention or some huge business thing is there.The rooms are awesome! I like staying on the executive floor, though the rooms aren't any different on that floor so if you don't want to shell out the extra cash, you can just book a standard room. It's nice and clean (I've never had any problems with dirty carpets or dirty anything else). You get a balcony no matter what, with either a view of the Parthenon on the even numbered rooms, or the stadium on the odd numbered rooms. The bathrooms are great, too. All I'd change is some extra shelving in the shower area as there just isn't enough room in there to put much of anything. But I love the shower itself! Nice water pressure and temperature, and the shower head is awesome. And I love having a shower and not a shower/bath.The pool is nice, too. It's outdoors so it's only open in the summer, but it's clean and big enough to accommodate everyone. If you wait to go in the evening, by then everyone will be leaving to go to dinner and you'll basically have the pool to yourself, if you don't want to deal with kids.The only downside is the parking. They stay so busy all the time that it can be really hard to find a parking space here. Be prepared to walk! Tip: the handicapped spots fill up (even the ones in the back) so if you have problems walking distances, make sure you get to the hotel in the early afternoon to get a better spot, and just rely on the shuttle or cabs. There's always cabs hanging around too so you'll never have to wait for one. Another plus is if you have a hybrid or electric vehicle, they have two charging stations in the back of the hotel! I only just noticed it this time and don't drive one so I'm not sure what the pricing is, but if you need to charge your battery while staying there, you don't have to drive around finding a charging station.It's just an all-around great hotel with a nice mixture of affordability and amenities.What a great hotel and hotel staff. Admittedly I rarely need much special attention, but little things make me pretty happy. Being called darlin, extra soap and towels in the hotel room, ac kept on before I check in. Ophelia took care of me when I first checked in and was very sweet.My friend and I were traveling for business, and stumbled into this hotel after being treated very rudely by a concierge at a different hotel. The two experiences were like night and day. Larry at the front desk took great care of us. All of the customer service at the hotel was phenomenal. I felt that the hotel staff really made an effort to go above and beyond. The room was very clean, the bed was very comfortable, and I personally really appreciated the large, well-lit shower.  The breakfast offerings in the morning were excellent. I have some dietary restrictions, but there were still plenty of food options that I could eat, which was a pleasant surprise. I will definitely stay at this hotel again next time I pass through Nashville.I have stayed at this hotel about 10 years in a row, about 40 nights. I have never had 1 bad night here. From the great location on Westend Avenue, Plenty of complimentary parking available. Small "snack/sandwich" area, like a small coffee and snack bar. But you are in Nashville, why eat at the hotel. there is a killer bbq joint open right across the street.the Bar/lounge is very good also, open mike nite usually every night. Nice place to chat or listen to some "new" county music.I like the location of this Place, walk in any direction and you will find entertainment or food.The duplicate of the  Parthenon is across the street. The park is, Centennial park Where a nice running path is. As well as coy ponds and open space. An art fair is held here 3 times a year as well as family movie nights and concerts.Close to the interstate also.Beautiful hotel, nice pool, awesome customer service, and a free shuttle available every 15 minutes with the nicest drivers. Great location being walking distance from restaurants and a liquor store! I couldn't have asked for a better experience for my first time in Nashville.The Holiday Inn - Vandy - has great views that overlook the Parthenon and the Commodore's stadium. This is a well-run hotel with a spacious lobby and nice amenities such as a sundries shop, a coffee bar, a lounge, business center, pool, etc.Rooms were clean and large.The bathroom though is tiny! Wow - you have to enter and get past the toilet to close the door. Breakfast was not impressive - service was outstanding - but the food just didn't seem very fresh; I understand this place does a large crowd for breakfast, but I just found it kind of overly steamed and not fresh. Still, great hotel - shuttle service is a major bonus.+ There's a "Renovation Award November 2009" plaque by the front desk which makes you feel like you're in a new-ish/updated hotel. Be warned that that illusion will end as soon as you leave the lobby.- The hallway on the 3rd floor had a big fan blowing, making one wonder if the floor was flooded or if they were trying to remedy a mildew problem. Either way, bad.+ Bathroom hand towels were folded into 2 swans whose necks made a heart shape. Yes you know the one. Little things like that get me =)+ Refrigerator and microwave in room.- Low-tech air conditioning system with low/high warm, low/high fan, and low/high cool settings. I'd assume that a 2009 renovation would include digital thermostats in this day and age...- The pillows on each bed were labeled with "soft" and "firm", which looked promising. Unfortunately, both were lumpy and crappy.+ Free wireless internet.+ The bathroom has a tiled stand-up shower (no tub) with floor to ceiling glass doors. A 15-setting Moen showerhead made it feel extra fancy (but I would guess 12 of those 15 settings aren't really practical).- The carpet was a color that looked like it was hiding nastiness. I decided against inspecting it any closer to confirm one way or the other.
review_content_20: While it's not the Loews Vanderbilt, it is a nice hotel with a friendly staff, a shuttle to the downtown are and lots to do within walking distance. Rooms are typically Holiday Inn, clean and comfortable. You can tell that this hotel caters to the fans of the games at nearby Vanderbilt Stadium, but they do have a large influx of business travelers inbetween. I would happily stay here again.PROS:Been here 3 days, paid $104 on Vandy nursing school rate, staff EXTREMELY friendly and helpful!! rate is locked is in until 8/2014 for nursing school students, no Vandy ID check, 750kBs download wifi or ethernet, free parking onsite, directly in front of Vandy football stadium, McDonalds directly across street with numerous other good food and drink within easy walk,. free shuttle within 3miles  6A-11P, free washing machines and dryers each floor, laundry soap 50cents,mattresses good but not rotated, all rooms have balcony, good water pressure, new 45" HD-TV w/HDMI, RCA,  PC/SVGA(DB15),and SD card inputs, 6 cf refrig and microwave with turntable in  room, plenty of A/C( thru the wall unit with local controls), outside 97deg@ 54%RH, in room 67deg.: SWEET!!!!, Onsite food and drink(PRICEY!!)CONS:Phone cord won't reach by bed without unplugging and moving phone,Getting kicked out thurs. because of first  vandy football game of season on thurs. night(rate more than doubled)!!!,  no free continental breakfast(free coffee until onsite restaurant open at 6A), chintzy on towels, remote batteries dead (AA), alarm clock backup battery missing (9V), no chairs for balcony, east(stadium) side rooms won't assess vandy VPN, AND LAST AND EASILY THE MOST IRRITATING, 15 WATT  FLUORESCENT TWIST TUBES IN ALL LIGHTING FIXTURES!!!WRAP-UP:Easily the best deal in the neighborhood all things considered!!! BAR NONE!!!! I've stayed in all of these hotels thru here over the years and this get's 4.5 stars.just bring some regular screw in light bulbs with you and you'll enjoy the place, also bring some folding chairs for the balcony if you're into that. Bring phone cord extension!! BEWARE, YOU CANNOT SET ON THE BACK BALCONY AND SEE THE FOOTBALL GAMES, EVEN THE TOP FLOOR IS NOT HIGH ENOUGH TO SEE THE FIELD, IT'S AN OPTICAL ILLUSION !!!, THE BUILDING IS NOT TALL ENOUGH TO WATCH THE GAMES LIKE YOU CAN FROM SOME OF THEIR MUCH HIGHER PRICED NEARBY COMPETITION!!!!!!!!!.DO NOT BOOK A ROOM ENDING IN #19 or #21(219,221;919,921;1019,1021;1119,1121, etc.), THOSE ROOMS BACK-UP TO THE ELEVATOR SHAFTS, VERY NOISY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Close and safe location for tourists. Lots of chain type restaurants nearby and literally right in the heart of the University of Vanderbilt. The staff got us right in after having a terrible experience at another hotel. Best part of this hotel was the staff there, they were super friendly and accommodating. Shuttle is easily accessible and will take you right downtown.I should be fair and honest up front. High marks go to the staff that helped me with the issues that continued to present themselves during our short stay. I believe they did their best with the resources they had. That said, I am forced to suggest that you avoid this hotel for one huge reason - amazingly filthy floors in the rooms. I can honestly say they were so dirty I felt that there might be a health risk. More below...I choose to book this hotel based on high reviews on Trip Advisor. Since we were travelling with our 11 month old so, when booking I requested three things that were needed: a fridge, a tub and a king bed. We booked an executive room and these items were confirmed in my reservation. Upon check-in I immediately noticed that we only had a shower stall, so I reported that and we were moved to a new room. Not on the executive floor (where the executive lounge/workspace was), but a suitable room. Only a mild inconvenience and short disturbance. Once in the new room, we discovered a toilet that sounded like a jumbo jet's engine when flushed. We were off to dinner so I reported that at the front desk and they said they would have someone look at it while we were out. Upon our return at about 10pm, I checked in with the desk about the toilet. They called and spoke to the repairman who said that it was broken but they did not have the part necessary to fix it. They asked if I wanted to moved again, but they could not find a suitable room while I was waiting. It was already past my son's bedtime and we needed to give him a bath and get him down, so I said I would call them shortly from the room and in the meantime, I asked that they try and figure something out. Once back in the room, my wife found the tub to be dirty (pubic hairs from a prior guest). Our frustration level was rising, but we had to get our son to sleep, so she washed the tub herself and I knew I would mention it when I called down. When my wife picked up our son for his bath, we found his hands and feet to be black. We considered the day, where we had been, where we might have put him down, etc. and were confused. Then we considered the room. I grabbed a white wash cloth from the bathroom and a simple, light swipe across the floor revealed it to be filthy. A black streak was on the cloth. I checked multiple places in the room and found the same condition. Finally, I called the front desk. At this point, I explained, we had been given the wrong room and a new room with a broken toilet, a dirty bathtub and a floor so dirty we could not bring ourselves to take our socks off, much less put our son on the floor. My room was comped at that point, without hesitation I must add, and I was offered another room. My concern now, however, was that no one knew anything about a carpet cleaning schedule - I wanted to avoid the same issue in a new room or just leave that night. It was suggested that a go into the other rooms with the person in charge of housekeeping and choose my room. She escorted me into three different rooms, all of which I found to have dirty carpets as well (I used the same cloth test in each room).It was after 11pm and I knew we would not complete our 3 night stay at this hotel, but did not wish to uproot my now-sleeping family. When morning came, we packed up and left this hotel. I must again say that the staff was very helpful and understanding. In fact, a few offered that they were as disgusted as I was. Of the number of people that helped me, thank you to Tiffany and Theresa (I might be confusing this as actually being one person - whomever seemed in charge behind the desk that night) and the rest of the desk staff, and Bertha, the housekeeper. However, no amount of customer service can clean a carpet or get my to put my son on the floor of that hotel ever again. I should add that we wondered how often this floor condition might be the case in other hotels and we just never noticed. Well, our trip included two more hotels, neither of which had this issue at all.First visit to this hotel for a meeting. Parking lot was torn up and the smoker's ashtrays are too close to the front door. I don't like having freshly showered and being forced to walk through someone else's smoke. Bathrooms had not been cleaned in at least 24 hours. Our meeting room was nice and the breakfast service was adequate. They could improve the experience by paying attention to some of the small, but important details.The staff was amazing from beginning to end. I had an interview and when I woke up I realized my nail polish looked atrocious and that I needed to take it off. I called downstairs and to my surprise they had a bottle of nail polish remover to my room in less than 5 minutes. For a small fee of course. I was visiting schools during the fall and out of the 3 comparable hotels I stayed at this one had the best bathroom. The room was adequately clean and so was the bathroom. I loved the free shuttle service to the college. My problem was the bed size. I had the same problem at another hotel where I ordered two queen beds and got two fulls.Here I requested two doubles and I got something much smaller. This was a problem for me because it was the three of us and there was no way two people could have slept on this bed. We ended up ordering a pull out bed which irritated me because of the extra charge but after I got my check out bill I noticed they didn't charge me for it. I would stay at this hotel again. If you are interviewing at Vanderbilt you should definitely stay here, the proximity to the school is amazing.It's a tired property. Rooms are horribly outdated. Carpets feel dirty and lighting in rooms is poor. Cheap mats in lobby and general chaos and amateur feel in lobby. However, the staff is pretty responsive and diligent but they are working with a very tired property. Rooms don't feel clean. I wouldn't recommend or stay here again no matter the rate.The location is wonderful for visiting Vanderbilt parents. Everything is clean as should be expected for a nice hotel chain. The outdoor pool was also well tended, though unheated and a bit heavy on the chlorine.    Our room was similarly clean, though a bit musty smelling, and the walls are slightly thin.   A decent choice, and less pricey than the nearby Marriott or Loews.This is a well located hotel - but - it is very compact in rooms and the least comfortable bed in the entire city.  Great service and a really fun "Writers night" downstairs in the Commodore Lounge.Home away from home. Everyone goes out of their way to make you welcome. Best mocha at the coffee bar!Bed - comfyShower - okCarpet - not soFridge - they forgot to clean it out!This place was clean and nice.  I normally try to stay in holiday inn's because of their consistency and I'm glad once again that we did.  The location was perfect and close to everything.  Not being from Nashville, we were pleasantly surprised to discover we were right across the street from Centennial Park where the Parthenon is located!Gorgeous room, friendly staff..  We were very impressed with room and stay our first night.  We stayed here because we were running the 1/2 marathon in Nashville and wanted a hotel in close proximity to start of race.  We were just coming back to our room after running the marathon, looking forward to a shower, and we see 3 housekeepers in our room with shopvacs trying to clean up the bathroom.  While we had been gone, a sink on one of the upper floors had been clogged and when maintenance had unclogged it, it somehow exploded all the sludge out of our sink and all over our bathroom, including all of our personal belongings that were in the bathroom.  The manager of housekeeping was super apologetic and replaced what they could  for us ( toothbrush, hairbrush, toothpaste, contact case), however my glasses were soiled as well as my breast pump parts which could only be ordered online due to the sizing (specialty of parts).  When we told them about this, they told us to talk to the manager upon checking out for a discount.  When we checked out, the manager was not available and we were told he would call us.  Received no call back and had to call him.  They are now currently working on getting us a free night.  We will see if this happens.  We don't think they would have even bothered calling us back, and would have just let this go.  I understand accidents happen, but you need to take care of your customers.  Having our toiletries/belongings  covered with nasty black bacteria ridden liquid deserves a bit more then a couple free drinks in their hotel bar.  ***** Please see attached photo to see the bathroom*****Small rooms, ok amenities, but if you're going to a football game at Vanderbilt Stadium, this is THE hotel to be in for proximity (stroll from parking lot directly into the game), tailgating, and overall convenience for fans of the visiting teams!  Normally would give this hotel an average 3-star rating, but it gets an extra star for location.The TV shows are $4.99 and they have commercials! What a cheesy way to make money and a sign of a less than classy hotel, particularly when you pay more than $150 a night.  And there is NO complimentary breakfast, just an overpriced buffet, something even the cheapest hotels in California provide.I was actually really impressed with this hotel.  Holiday Inn hotels don't have a great reputation for comfort, they're mostly a cost-conscious choice.  I only payed for one night in a king size room (two large beds and a desk), and the uni picked up the tab for the other 2 nights (total of 4 days).  I didn't have any children eating or rubbing the carpeting, so I don't need something that achieves that standard of sanitation.  I was traveling with an S.O who spent the majority of his time at the room, so the fact that he thought it was tidy and well appointed probably stands for more than my experiences.  The first night we got in late and were a little worried that we should have called to let the hotel know.  They were incredibly nice and friendly at the desk, even though I was totally exhausted after a 13 hour drive.  There was a big basketball game going on nearby, and the hotel parking was being shared for the event, but I was impressed that even with that all going on, we still found a spot quite easily.  Nashville has a lot of open sewage vents that can smell pretty funky if you're downwind, but that's not the hotel's fault -- or anyone's fault -- that's just the city.  Like Paris, I think its just a little stinky at times.  (Actually, a lot of my experience in this city reminded me of Paris:  lots of old run-down parts that were quirky at best, punctuated with modernized attempts at genuine luxury and comfort.)The room was big, with a nice balcony and a very new shower/bathroom area that was clean and modern.  Even as close to the elevators as we were, the room was almost silent, which was pretty impressive to me.  The shower head had a massager setting and was really big, and the tiling looked granite.  I am allergic to feathers, so I definitely appreciated that there was synthetic pillows and bedding available without a fuss.  The room was also super warm when we got in, which was wonderful, since we live in FL and were horrified by the burning cold and snow.  The only real annoyance in the room was the television, which had a un-bypassable menu system before allowing access to the unpaid, normal channels.  All it meant was that we left the tv on mute when we would have otherwise shut it off.  I always wish there are more power outlets.  The towel aviary was awesome.  I totally wish I could do that.The hotel restaurant hosts local musicians, and we went there for dinner on our first night.  The quesadilla I ordered was absolutely delicious and fresh tasting.  The only negative thing I could say was that in the full restaurant of music audience, few people were eating/drinking and I would have liked for those people who were trying to get dinner (like myself) to get a bit more attention than the patrons who weren't ordering anything or were only drinking Bud.  The music was nice, and honestly, if I hadn't been so hungry, I probably would have appreciated the intimacy that our server's absence left us.All in all, the location was great (SO close to my interviews!).  The room was clean and nice, with an obvious effort toward a modern look.  The desk staff were incredibly helpful about things to do and how to get from place to place.Good value, good location and good times in Nashville.  The staff here was very helpful, with advice, storing bags, checking in early...cabs right outside for a $7 trip down to Broadway or a decent amount of spots within walking distance.  (Across the street by Vanderbuilt is a fabulous outdoor bar, very homey, very Southern).  Pool is decent and rooms were nice.Nice hotel. Good location next to Vanderbilt and across from the Parthenon in the Park. Restaurant/buffet OK. Coffee bar in the lobby was good! Very pleasant and helpful front desk staff. I'd stay here again when in Nashville. Good value for the cost.Was disappointed to find out when I arrived at hotel that reservation had been cancelled. It took an hour to fix problem and get my room at the rate purchased. Other than initial incident the hotel empployees were nice and helpful.The room smelled like fast food.  I was there in spring, and there were a lot of loud people.  The staff was nice.The biggest thing I wish I knew before I booked was how the fitness center was dysfunctional.  The elliptical was 15 years old.
review_content_40: Our visit to Nashville involved the Vanderbilt Medical Center, and this hotel offered a special rate for patients.  It also has free parking, somewhat unusual for this part of the city, and a free shuttle to places within a short radius.  The front desk personnel were friendly and helpful, the room was clean and quiet with a nice bed and had free wireless.  I would stay here again and recommend it.

review_content: Luxurious hotel with an amazing staff!!! Jasper at the front desk was so helpful and Edward took care of us at the restaurant. The super nice shuttle drivers will take you downtown or to Vandy (for free!)The pros: very friendly staff, great free shuttle service. Good breakfast (not free), location to downtown. Coffee maker, microwave in room. Decent prices.The cons:With a name like Hilton I expected more. First room they gave us was handicapped accessible and the shower head was terrible and the whole bathroom floor wet after showering. We requested a room change and were moved. Second room sink faucet sprayed like a sprinkler soaking the user...Parking is expensive, hotel rooms look dated. Overall a medium experience and probably wouldn't book again.Brown waterFluid stained wallsFire alarmBroken bedNo housekeeping (go down for your own shampoo and coffee ground refills)This property is in a great location and you can walk to many restaurants and Vanderbilt.The rooms are pretty basic, similar to Hampton Inn, actually I'm not sure what the difference between this property and the Hampton Inn is. The Hampton Inn does include breakfast at no additional cost.The desk clerks were very pleasant and had a great attitude. The elevators were pretty quick.The property was clean.The beds were decent but nothing spectacular.We may or may not stay at this location again. There was nothing bad about the experience.The room and lobby were clean. The valet guy was so animated about hating his job that is was severely off putting. The only thing complimentary with your stay is the slow wifi (I'm currently using data instead). The front desk was alright, room service hospitality was great!Friendly staff and great location, that's about it... Tried to eat dinner in the restaurant the first night and was told by the server we would be waiting a very long time because they were backed up in the kitchen, so we walked somewhere else. Woke up the next morning with an aching back because of the horrible mattress that had a large divot in the middle of the bed. Breakfast was mediocre at best but very expensive ($12.95pp). One reason we picked this hotel was because of the indoor pool, which was closed the entire time we were there... They need to put some money into this place!There are so many wonderful things to say about this hotel:1. Free Wi-Fi2. Free Shuttle Downtown3. Free Snacks4. Cute Greeting (Post Card, Guitar Picks and Goo Goo Cluster)5. Uber Helpful Staff (We had to leave a night early due to weather and they worked with Hotels.com to make sure we weren't charged)Really, how many hotels offer 1 of the items listed above for free, much less 3/3?The room was also very clean and stocked with a Keurig, fridge and microwave. It wasn't anything fancy, but did the trick just fine. The room was what I expected to encounter for a 3 star hotel. Clean, fairly updated and nice enough.The downsides were proximity to a major street and the noise that comes with it and the fact that I couldn't get the TV to work (though I didn't try too hard and we didn't ask for help).I'd go back for the reasons listed above as well as for the proximity to many attractions (Hint-Walk to Hattie B's a couple of blocks away for a tasty and inexpensive meal).This hotel was fine for a night in Nashville. It was within walking distance to many restaurants and bars. It's so close to Hattie B's which is reason enough to stay. We arrived a little early and they let us check in early. We took a lyft from the hotel a couple of times and it was only about $5 to mercy lounge and the gulch. Great location!Great location. Walking distance from Vanderbilt and good dining. Prompt shuttle service to downtown and venues. Pleasant staff who listen and go above and beyond. Clean rooms, good food options in hotel. Lobby is inviting and fun to hang out. Shout out to Betsy, Aimee and Jasper!Amazing customer service! It went to Nashville for my 30th birthday, we onlyMentioned it in passing when we checked i. After a afternoon out we came back to our room and found a wonderful card and 2 awesome cupcakes for my birthday! So kind! Shout out to Kat, thank you so much!Last weekend, I attended my friend's wedding and the reception was held at the Hilton Garden Inn. It was fantastic. While I din't stay there, several of my friends did and we hung out in the rooms the day before the wedding.
