Everything seemed clean and there was room for 8-9 people to sit and talk and catch up, as long as you don't mind multiple people sitting on the bed.The reception space was very nice. It was on the 9th floor so you get a lovely view of the skyline and the hotel staff were friendly and very competent. Hors d'oeuvre were passed smoothly. There were dedicated bathrooms for the space (necessary with such nice bartenders) and a small balcony facing downtown for smokers and just people who wanted to see the sights. The absolute only downside was when the waiter at dinner didn't know if the gravy on my friend's steak had butter (she has a pretty severe dairy allergy) He checked with the kitchen and they said no but after a few bites she felt her mouth starting to tingle and had to stop eating. I wish that she had been provided a dry steak but she's didn't want to ask.If you are planning a reception, definitely consider this space.Very sweet lady at the front desk named Terrica!!! She is a life saver and an angel sent from heaven!!We arrived extremely late and had to book last minute because our air b&b was a no show. The front desk were extremely helpful and friendly. Breakfast is pretty good worth $12. Location at first might not seem as ideal as downtown but right down the road are 4 star restaurants and awesome dive bars where you get the newer Nashville feel. I recommend doing the pub trolley down the road and get a tour of the recording studios only a block away. Perfect location $5 uber or free shuttle ride to downtown tootsies. Definitely staying here next time in town.We were only staying for the night. The concierge upgraded our room when he realized we were first time visitors. They went out of their way to make our visit memorable. Would stay there again if I am ever in Nashville.DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME and pay the extra money to stay somewhere with better employees closer to the main part of Broadway!!!! My friends and I were kicked out of our SUITE when we were in the middle of playing an innocent game of "the bride guesses the underwear her friends got her." We were all sitting around the table/couches in the suite watching our friend guess and we get a knock on our door from a guy named Eric Patten, who I assume is a manager. He kicks everyone out of the suite and says we cannot have a "party" in the room when we are all clearly just sitting around not being rowdy in the slightest bit. Our plan was to open gifts and then head off to Broadway so this "party" was only going to be for an hour, if that. Not only did we get kicked out of the suite, but Eric followed every girl (including the Moms that were there) to their separate room to ensure we were not coming back to the suite. That completely set me off!!! We are not children and Eric acted extremely inappropriately. We then had to proceed to the public lobby area with our X-rated gifts to not completely ruin the bride's night and let her still somewhat enjoy her gifts. On top of this whole night's fiasco, we had to wait at least 30 minutes each time we wanted to get a shuttle. They say it runs every 15 minutes but they also forget to mention that EVERYONE staying in the hotel is also waiting for a shuttle.Anand, the general manager, runs a great hotel. He even picked us up in the shuttle at the airport. They have great live music in the lobby/bar area most nights. Convenient shuttle to many places, helpful staff, quality food and good value.I very rarely leave negative reviews, but my stay at this location was no where near the expectation that I have for this brand. I stay at a Hilton property 3-4 nights a week on average because of the high quality and great service. This hotel did not meet those standards at all. My top problems:1) the hotel rooms are in need of an update2) management did not notify guests ahead of time that there would be maintenance issues like fire alarm testings. The hotel lobby is lovely and looks like it is fairly recently renovated. This made the outdated rooms surprising. They are dingy (obvious patches on wall, gross carpet, etc) and the housekeeping was not well done. Several things were unfinished - pillow cases left on the bed with less than the normal number of pillows, items from a precious guest left in the mini fridge, and items left in the trash can. This may have been an isolated incident, but the lack of organization and communication about maintenance was a much bigger problem.The first maintenance issue was with the cable, so not a huge thing, but still annoying that the staff knew it would be out for an hour for testing and didn't notify anyone. The second was much bigger. The fire alarms and sprinklers were scheduled for testing and guests were not notified ahead of time. This meant the fire alarm strobe lights went off for approximately an hour around 9:30 am. Right while I was getting ready and checking email. Had I know before, I would have made arrangements to go elsewhere to do some work, but because it was unexpected I had to get ready with bright flashing lights. Hello migraine! I called the front desk to inquire and was told that it was routine testing and would be finished soon. I explained that prior notice would have been nice because this was causing a headache. The lady apologized, but neglected to mention that this was not happening downstairs. After about 10 mins I called back to ask how much longer and as I was calling a note was slipped under my door, dates the day before, alerting guests to the testing. So they did know ahead of time and were supposed to notify guests but did not. The lady at the front desk was very nice Nd apologized and offered me a breakfast coupon for the day. Unfortunately she didn't mention that breakfast was closing so I had a very limited selection (which ironically is usually free to HHonors members at other HGIs so I'm not sure why it isn't at this property). Overall this hotel needs a refresh, both of the rooms and the management policies in order to be up to speed with the standard of the Hilton brand.Super clean hotel and VERY friendly desk personnel! The only negative I have about the hotel is the fact it is on a very busy street and it was noisy all night long from traffic below. Otherwise, everything else was fantastic and I would stay there again. I would just probably request a room on the back side not the street side. The valet charge is on the website, BUT it's a little hard to notice. So, the semi-surprise of $28 for valet parking is a little on the higher end of normal.Clean Rooms and bathrooms are the number 1 priority of any place I stay. No exception here!! Super friendly staff, shuttles available for transportation. All the taxes and extra charges are alittle too high but that isn't hotel fault besides $25 a night to park your car! Ouch!Um, these people clearly have been sniffing some happy gas because the staff is ALWAYS happy and cheerful! It wasn't annoying, it was just surprising and the most pleasant experience I have had with hotel staff. This being a Hilton Garden Inn, and with some of the reviews here on Yelp, I was a bit concerned prior to the arrival, but I was pleasantly surprised. We walked in on a very, very bone chilling cold evening, valet took the car, and the hotel staff were welcoming...genuinely so! There were no frills or extras that I can mention, other than the fact that they truly seemed happy that we were there. The foyer was decorated with fun music murals that captured the highlights of Nashville. There is a full service dining room, with a kick-ass breakfast (not included with the room). The staff made recommendations for places to dine, and visit, and also included a shuttle for the 3 mile radius. There is a lot within walking distance to the hotel so this was rarely needed. Since I was in Nashville on business, I used the business services for printing, and the free wifi in the room. I had no probs with any of it, again a shocker. Also wonderful, and should not be overlooked, was the comfy room. Everything was clean, completely furnished, and quiet. Next time I am in Nashville, it won't be a question of where I am staying. This place is it!
review_content_20: Pros: the whole place is non-smoking. The service is fantastic including a free shuttle to downtown. The room is great with a comfortable bed and working hvac. The location is within walking distance of many attractions or take the free shuttle! There is free wifi. Shower was clean with plenty of towels and hot water, even neutrogena products. They cleaned our room later in the early evening because we were napping when they and by the first time. Two free bottles of water to greet you and a keurig for single cups of coffee. Cons: parking isn't free. There is no safe in the room.My friend and I were in town for the weekend and decided to stay here because it was one of the cheaper hotels in the area.  It was a great hotel, had friendly staff, very clean, and housekeeping staff was attentive when we requested items (razor and toilet paper).  The hotel is in a good location, only about a mile or so from downtown if you want to walk or it's about an $8 dollar cab ride.  Overall, I would recommend and stay here again if ever back in the area.The reason this did not get 5 stars is for 2 reasons.  First, the parking per night to stay at the hotel is outrageous at $23/night.  However, I assume most other hotels charge for parking as well so I am sure there is no way of getting around that.  Second, though they did have free shuttle that will take you anywhere in a 2 mile radius of the hotel (GREAT, right??), it didn't work out that well for us.  There is only one shuttle, but tons of guest staying in the hotel so you end up waiting forever.  And if you do even wait for it, most other the other guests just cut in front of you and you are not able to get on the shuttle.  For instances, we had been waiting about 20 minutes for the shuttle at the hotel, only to have a group of 8 or 9 guys come down and cut in front of us and then there was no room on the shuttle.  It happened multiple times while we were there so we ended up always taking a cab downtown.  I suggest the hotel implement a different system for the shuttle as it was pretty useless to me while I was there.We booked 7 nights and were out after the first.  The lobby smelled and the room was old and outdated.  Walls were dirty, light didn't even have a cover, and the beds were uncomfortable.  Room looked nothing like the pictures.  I wouldn't recommend to anyone.My mom came to visit and booked a room at the Hilton Garden Inn. You have to pay $25 a day in addition to your room fee just to park at the hotel, and this is literally the only option since its located downtown. Annoying but something I could get over if the rest of our stay was great.. It wasn't. We checked in and on the way to our room we ran in to an older woman who clearly had Alzheimers and come to find out had wandered out of her room and was lost without a room key. It was pretty late (after 10pm) at this point and so my mom stayed with the woman and I went in to our room and called the front desk to ask if they could send someone up to help. I think I called the front desk more than 6 times in a 45 minute period and no one ever came to help. Luckily the woman had a moment of clarity and found her room and was able to get in, but it seemed like really bad guest service that A. they weren't quicker to help someone who was lost and B. left it up to us to help the older woman when we had absolutely no resources to do so. THEN we get in to the room and realize its a handicap room, which was just plain rundown. Not sure if it was because it was handicap or just happened to be that room but it wasnt good. So I called the front desk for the 10th time (after no one came to our floor to help still) and asked if we could switch rooms and they said they were booked. Luckily, we switched rooms the next night and the non-handicap room was much nicer. But the parking combined with their lack of incentive to help us or another guest left a bad taste in my mouth. Another downside, unless you are a Hilton rewards member you have to pay for wi-fi, seems like they nickel and dime you a bit.Let me start out by saying that for this hotel being still a shuttle ride from Downtown, it was expensive. That being said, there are several places to go get food and drinks around the hotel. The bar in the hotel was pretty lackluster and the breakfast buffet was OK. We did not have a vehicle so we did not worry about parking. The shuttle guys were STELLAR. Especially Chris and Jersey. I still have no clue what Jersey's real name is, but he is from Jersey hence the nickname. These two guys were wonderful and made our trip 100 times more enjoyable. Also, Olga the housekeeper is AMAZING. She was one of the sweetest people we had met in nashville. Make no mistake, if you have Olga for a housekeeper, making friends with her goes a long way. She always stopped to ask where we were going or what we were up to while we passing by.Nice rooms and fair food, but the staff is what really makes this place shine. We came down for my friend's birthday and when we mentioned that to the front desk cupcakes and a card appeared at check in in our room (thanks Andrew and Kat!). Everyone said hello, smiled, asked how our day was and then actually remembered us later. The shuttle drivers were fantastic and personable. Would definitely recommend them.If I had to describe my visit at this hotel I would do so in just one word, EDWARD. The bar tender make you feel right at home, as though you are a part of his family. He is witty, friendly, fun, and warm!! I would say that his service has made me come back to this hotel and if I ever visit Nashville again, I will keep coming back here. If you are a returning guest, he remembers your face and often times, your name. The rest of the staff is friendly too and that's what makes a successful business. Thank you Edward and the rest of the staff for making this my home away from home!!!I stayed here two nights while passing through Nashville. I had read reviews about the sewage smell in the lobby -that's real- but it's only in the lobby/downstairs area, so it was OK. Uh... you have to pay $23/night for parking. That's absurd. The hotel itself was nice and clean. The staff was friendly. Convenient location, not far from downtown or midtown.Everything about the hotel was great except the parking. $20-30 a day for parking is ridiculous, and that alone will keep me from staying there again. There was also an outdoor patio area, but there were ashtrays on all the tables and a bunch of people out there smoking. Wish the hotel had a stronger no-smoking policy. Other than that everything was wonderful. I wish the parking situation was different.For 179 dollars a night i stayed in Chicago downtown last week (at a Hilton).  I had two rooms 2 tv's a couch a lazy boy and it was immensely better room.The room i had in Tn was one step away from a flea bag motel.  Floor was covered in spots of who knows what fluids, all the furniture was banged up.  And the beds that were a selling point are not very comfortable and take an hour to adjust.  The bath tub DID NOT DRAIN (took about 5 min for it to drain but bloody disgusting).  I could have a conversation with my neighbors at barely above a normal voice, the first night i was woken up at LEAST 5 times by an adjoining room.  In addition I could hear people in the hall all night.  The wifi was not adequate (2MBps srsly), i had to tether my phone just to get decent speed.  The gym was not restocked in anything that resembled a timely manner, the treadmills were barely functioning, and in poor condition:  The second night the one closest to the wall TV did not work.  There was a swarm of flies constantly by the front entrance.  AND i was charged 23 dollars a day to PARK!Completely unacceptable.The only nice things about the hotel was that the breakfast was very well put together (pricey) and the staff was amazing.  Do not recommendStaff is wonderful, pool is absolutely outstanding (except it opens at 7 a.m., which puzzles me-why not 5 a.m. or 6 a.m.?).  Restaurant (for breakfast) was great.Coffee is wonderful and available anytime.  Parking is horrible and way over priced ($23?-Where do they think they are?)Room is ok, nothing great, mattress felt good.  Staff was extraordinarily helpful and courteous.Great staff! Everyone was helpful and friendly.The beds have an adjustable firmness control and were really, really comfortable. The room service is above average; good food, accurate and quick delivery.OTOH the rooms were noisy and in my room, the toilet ran and the tub drain was slow and backed up a little. The exercise room is smelly and needs a reno.It's clean and what you expect from a Hilton Garden Inn. They have a shuttle service that'll drop you off and pick you up from various locations in Nashville.  Unfortunately, I arrived on a Sunday night and if you don't know the South, places close early on Sunday. Why? B/c God said so.The shuttle drivers Larry and Anthony were wonderful. The rest of the staff was kind; however, our stay was unbelievably chaotic and stressful. We arrived and were told that they only had rooms with king beds left and we would have to wait up to another 3 hours for a room with 2 beds. We were hospitable, got ready in the lobby bathroom for our conference, and left our bags behind the front desk. When we returned back at 9pm, we went to our room and discovered that it was wrong and only had a king. We had to wait in the hallway for 45 minutes while the front desk clerk tried to find another room. We were then charged for a $50/night insurance without being informed. We were unaware of the fee until we were already charged. We then went down to put the fee on two different cards to make sure that the fee would not bounce and the clerk placed the wrong amount on each  card. The hotel was beautiful and clean; however, we spent much or our time at the front desk figuring out the mistakes.Free internet. Nice indoor whirlpool and pool. The only downfall is that people walking from the parking lot to the lobby and those waiting for the elevator can see you. Fitness center is reasonable.The plush queen mattresses felt great. Very relaxing and an A/C that works well. One downfall about the room is that the TV was too close to the bed. The HD looked pretty grainy and it made you wonder who designed this room and why.Lot of the restaurants nearby close early. My personal choice would be "SatCo" San Antonio Taco Company located about 6 blocks south (heading toward Vanderbilt).The rate here is generally about $20-30/night cheaper than the Embassy Suites next door. The parking facility is better than the nightmare of driving the Embassy Suites structure. The parking rates are negligible when comparing the two.Staff is very friendly and the rooms are clean. However, the amenities aren't as good as another hotel 1 block away for less. Embassy Suites is in the same chain but has better rooms with lower rates, free breakfast, and free happy hour. Hilton Garden Inn charges $11.99 for a breakfast that isn't all that great and charges for their happy hour as well. Also beware, Hilton Garden Inn's Internet speeds are horrible. Dial-up would smoke them. Do yourself a favor and walk the extra block for better rooms, cheaper rates, and free perks.The service was great!  Free (but slow) internet.  $20 parking.  Very clean.  Free shuttle for a 3-mile radius (I think that covers Vanderbilt).  Great plush beds!  Perfect location to the Patterson House!This place wasn't all that bad except I didn't get my platinum treatment I typically get from other Hilton family so was little disappointed.  And there is absolutely no restaurants close by.  So ended up getting a room service and it wasn't all that great.  I would avoid this place if I am ever insane enough to drive from NYC to Dallas again. :PThe staff was wonderful. I was allowed to check in early and they upgraded us to a junior suite for free. I highly recommend this place.Stayed for four nights, and it was great. The rooms were clean and staff was extremely friendly. Only complaint would be the beds which are "adjustable" but seem stuck on the "slow quick sand" setting, causing you to sink into the bed over and hour or two. When you go to roll over in the night, and you can't get out of your body shaped hole very easily.
review_content_40: My friends and I came here for two nights from Chicago. Everyone in Nashville is just super nice! It's kind of weird! Haha.  The rooms were pretty cheap compared to other hotels and they were very clean! I loved the fact that they had a free shuttle that would take you to downtown Nashville. Our driver Larry from Chicago! We love you Larry!!  Also, our bartender took great care of us. Older gentleman, African American. I wish I remembered his name because he was so nice. The only reason I'm giving this place a 4 star instead of 5 was because when we first came in the lady at the front desk had a majorrrrr attitude problem.  Considering everyone is so nice in Nashville maybe she should consider moving to Chicago where everyone else has an attitude problem.  Other than that, I highly recommend this hotel to everyone. It's only a mile away from downtown and a free shuttle? Perfect. We always tipped our shuttle driver though.Check in staff were very friendly and helpful. Really well kept hotel and breakfast staff and food were lovely (ate one and talked to other...you work it out). Room are very clean.There is a great free shuttle each night within a three mile radius from hotel and will pick you up with a phone call (the driver will give you a card). Patience is required though if you are  NOW person. I loved between 5th/Broadway and 2nd/Broadway where the music is for us tourists!Hotel was great, very friendly and helpful staff. Parking charges seemed a bit high ($22/night) though. Pool and jacuzzi were wonderful. Breakfast could have been better for being $11 per personI recently attended a seminar at the Hilton, I had to pay $10.00 to self-park, which I could live with, it is downtown, but the amenities were so poor.  The coffee was lukewarm and later in the day the drink selection was very limited and they were hot.I did not want to go off-site for lunch the first day, so I went to their buffet.  I would have been embarrassed to call it a buffet.  Your entree choices were thin sandy looking catfish or an "oriental" chicken made of bone-in thigh pieces with an odd, oil based lo mien. The salad was soaked in water so all the cucumbers were sort of transparent.  With that "meal" you could eat some small hard rolls or biscuits with chunks in it.  Poor fare for the money.The next date our buffet was slices of beef brisket with a little lean meat among the fat and a tasteless peach cobbler.  You have to work hard to make peach cobbler bad, but they did it.I would strongly suggest anyone considering booking a conference here, to be very careful and think twice.  I doubt anyone felt they got their moneys worth.I travel a lot so a nice, clean hotel in a good location is always a sweet fine. I like this place. The property is newer, so everything is still nice and shiny. The rooms usually range from 120-150, so price is always in line with other hotels in the area. Watch that parking charge though. The staff is usually friendly and helpful. They have a small bar/ restaurant (American Grill) that's synonymous with the HGI hotels. The food and drinks are always solid and the room service is pretty quick. Nice diggs in a good spot in Nashville.I have tried nearly every Hilton chain hotel in the Nashville downtown area and am running out of options.  I travel extensively, spending at least 200 nights per year in hotels, with most of those being the Hilton chain.  I've come to expect a certain level of service.  The Garden Inn at Vanderbilt consistently fails to live up to even minimum expectations as have other Hilton chain hotels in the downtown area (Homewood and Doubletree).  Inept and often condescending front desk staff, awful wireless, bland surroundings and generally bad service.  My team and I will be trying a new hotel brand!Nice and clean! Obviously, it just opened a few weeks ago!  Lots of bugs to work out as with any new or just opened business!  I just wish they would make the bathrooms larger!  But I do like the fact it no longer has a tub shower, a walk-in!  I wish all hotels would do this!  Seriously, how many people actually take baths in those little tubs anyways?  The restaurant is really expensive and I don't suggest it at all!  The breakfast is still good, but they could be a little more creative, after the third day of staying there it gets really old!  But I can certainly recommend this and many of the Hilton Garden Inns across the country, you can't go wrong staying at any Hilton property!  Except the crazy rates sometimes!!  Especially at Hampton Inns.Good location. Indoor pool. Free WiFi.

review_content: Nice place but small rooms. The mini fridge is hidden in some cabinets (ours were by the bathroom). I liked that one of the walls was painted. The bed was super soft and comfy but the shower was small and slippery. We had free internet but got the higher up version for free as well because my dad booked the room with his points. It was fun and I would come again.What a great location.  Right in the middle of it all.  Our team Save  A Horse, Run A Ragnar - stayed here after our 2015 TN Ragnar a few weeks ago.  The check in process was a bit of a hassle as the lady at the front desk (Allison - sp) was not at all accommodating or supportive and a bit rude - terrible customer service.  We arrived to the hotel early, and needed an early check in - the room's were not quite ready so we went to the fitness center to shower.  This was nice.  The rooms were great.  The parking was a hassle.  But the Starbucks inside was also amazing and much needed after not sleeping for days.  I would definitely return to Nashville but not stay here due to the poor customer service.In the heat of it all, I loved this hotel on Printer's Alley. Might have been a tad pricey but ohhhh so worth it. Walked to everything and its in the heart of it all. The staff was so nice, they have a starbucks and bar and a little area for getting a quick bite. The rooms were awesome, and the vibe was great. Can't wait to head back next year and stay here!The staff by the way was all too nice! Everyone from the valet to the lady at starbucks were so nice and helpful!Nice enough building with a nice location. Room wasn't completely ready for us though at 9pm check in. Noise was a issue but if you want to be DT Nashville I don't think this can be avoided. Services and parking are going to be expensive as nothing is included in room cost. WiFi didn't seem to work even.The hotel is very nice looking and the staff is great. I found a bed bug in my room in the morning and was really pleased with how the staff responded initially. They showed up immediately and took swift action to investigate and re-certify the room. I trapped the blood sucker and gave it to them. However, when I called to get an update tonight before I checked into my next hotel the manager was dismissive which is really disappointing. He suggested that it 1) came in on my suitcase (though it was on the other side of the room and I don't have bed bugs at home) or 2) wasn't a bed bug (which is odd that they would go through all that for something they didn't think was a bed bug). I posted pictures here so you be the judge. Either way, I'm not going back based on how poor the customer service was on the back end.This is a great hotel to stay at while you are in Nashville. Being downtown gives you the advantage of being closed everything fun and new! I had a great stay at this hotel and would definitely go back again. The hotel is clean and comfortable and the staff there are incredibly professional and helpful. The manager Trevor went out of his Way to help us through an unexpected turn in our travel arrangements. He was incredibly kind and made us feel well taken care of. Printers Alley is no big deal, there's not much there anymore. However, Broadway Street offers plenty to do with lots of shopping, entertainment, food and fun.I'm hovering between two and three stars, because really, I have experienced better in Nashville, but for all intents and purposes, I suppose this hotel was A-OK.First, great location. Friendly staff - front desk and valet guys especially.Now, the not so great.The clock in the room wasn't set to the correct time. This isn't a huge deal, but it's a pet peeve of mine. After a long day of travel it's nice to be able to walk into your room and know the correct time. All florescent lights in the room. I understand their more eco-friendly, but aren't there some softer more natural options nowadays?Air conditioner was exceptionally LOUD.No ATM.Starbucks on-site, but no complimentary coffee in the lobby or anything. There was an in-room coffee maker (a wannabe Keurig that just didn't make it), but everyone knows those generally suck. Selections in the on-site market for last minute toiletries, snacks, drinks, etc. was pretty minimal.Housekeeping didn't refill body lotion after day two.Shower head was very low (see: water shooting at me, not falling on me.)On-site restaurant food was a solid 2-star experience. It's average. It's clean. It's conveniently located. If that's what's you're looking for, you won't have any problems here.Stayed here for almost a week during a business trip. The location is great. It's very close to Nashville's nightlife and a ton of restaurants. I did not rent a car while I was there, and I didn't need one at all thanks to the location. Every staff member I encountered was very friendly and helpful. The room (a regular double) was nice, but I've come to expect more from the Marriott brand. My biggest complaint was the high level of noise, despite their claim that the room had soundproof windows. Our room was also missing its hairdryer when we checked in, but the staff took care of that quickly. I would stay here again.This is a nice hotel to stay in downtown.  You're walking distance from Broadway and lots of food.My one complaint is parking - there was nowhere to park so I did valet parking and it would take up to 15 minutes to get my car in the morning.Awesome location. It's just a few minutes walk to Broadway, Printer's Alley, the convention centers, etc. The hotel is nice and clean and the staff is super friendly. But.... They didn't give us what we'd booked. The beds were tiny (way smaller than queen sized). The WiFi was not dependable. The noise level is a bit nuts; you can hear everything going on outside. And the parking sucks; $22 a day or $26 for valet. Maybe it's just me but it'd be nice, if you're paying for a room to have parking provided. It served its purpose for a few days.Pretty neat for a courtyard. The rooms look more like Renaissance hotels, I was impressed by the cleanliness. Has a nice lobby with bar and starbucks with its full menu, not just coffee. Had got a suite for $179/night...not bad at all. It's walking distance to most of the touristy spots and music venues. Staff was super friendly. It is easiest to valet park, although there are several public parking lots around the hotel in addition to the hotel parking. 4 stars cuz the bathroom was nothing impressive.What a fantastic location.  We pretty much used the hotel for sleeping but it was a great base to explore the area from.  All of the fun bars are nearby as well as the Ryman Auditorium.  Printers Alley was seriously a block away and that was worth it right there.  If you are looking to be in the action and within walking distance of bars this is the hotel for you.  The rooms were large and clean, the check in service good and we experienced no issues.  The only downside I can see is that they do not have a parking lot or free parking.  I would stay here again if I am ever back in the area.For $350 the rooms are lacking quite a bit! The room was SMALL and do you think we could have something other than paper cups??? There's a Starbucks in the lobby but some crappy coffee in the room. I would say you are paying for the location which was great but come on Marriott!! Step up the amenities!!!This is a nice hotel, but the "high speed" internet is only true if you've time warped from 1999. "Conveniently" they offer upgraded internet speed for a price. Boo!Location is close to the old convention center, but a bit farther from the new one. Not too far if you're ok with humidity.My only real issue is the internet speed. Unforgivable, if you ask me.This hotel is home to some pretty stellar staff. Everyone from the desk staff to the cleaning crew were fabulous. The hotel itself is spotless and the people who work here are just nice. That being said, the major problem I have with this hotel is the noise and the shabby rooms. I was there marathon weekend and ended up waking up several time during the morning hearing doors slam and people talking. I have never been in a hotel that was so loud! Don't get me wrong, I think the people we key'd up for the marathon, however I don't think they were being overly loud. I think the walls and doors are just thin. Along with the noise, the rooms in general were pretty shabby. Some new furniture and a coat of paint would do this place wonders. It would have also made me feel like I was actually getting my money's worth......MONEY REMOVED FROM OUR ROOM.  My husband and I stayed at Marriott Courtyard Downtown Nashville.  We were pleased with the room and the hotel is beautiful inside and the location to downtown Nashville was great.  However, this Marriott does not have safes in their rooms but does have a safe located in the hotel.  There was only one time that we left our room that I did not lock up my purse.  We went to the gym at approximately 8:00 AM and returned around 9:00 AM. When we returned to our room we were met by a housekeeping staff, which was odd because it was so early.   I attempted to ask her to come back but she said, "no english" and quickly walked away.  Also, for the remainder of time we spend there the housekeeping staff never came to our room again until after 11:00 am.  I did not notice the money was missing until we arrived home and I immedialy called the hotel and reported it.  I knew nothing was going to be done but I would have at least like to known the Courtyard would open up an investigation.  I did not receive a call back from the hotel for approximately a week so I reached back out to them and finally was able to speak with the assistant manager.  She said they would check the door entries and send my concerns to the Marriott Claims Office (MCS).  I did not receive a call back but received a letter from Ms. W. from MCA asking me to call her back because she was unable to reach me by phone.  I called  Ms. Rosa Wong and  had to go through the complete story again for the third time.  Ms. W. said they would be sending me a letter within the next few days. I did not receive the letter and called her and she explained to me that occurances of this nature are addressed by the Innkeepers Stature for the State of Tennessee.  In short, a hotel owner is under no obligation for the loss theft, or unexplained disappearance of guest money, jewelry etc. which has not been placed in custody of the hotel for safekeeping.  I understand where they are coming from, I wish the Assistant Manager would have explained that to me... we could have saved each other a lot of time, agree.  Also,  there was no investigation open in my case.  I look at it this away, it's okay to remove someones belongings from their room, because nothing is done.  The saving grace is the person that took money from my purse located at the Marriott Downtown Nashville did not take it all.  And I learned a lesson..make sure you lock up your belongings.  I find it had to believe that this hotel does not have safes.  We will never stay at another Marriott that does not have a safe in the room.  And I have shared my experience with many many people and associates I work with.  Shared this on Facebook as well.  Also,  I guess the housekeeper needed my money worse than I did.Three stars for the terrific service staff and friendly valet.  I also like that this hotel is a re purposed historic building (opened as a bank in 1927).  But it appears the recent renovation stopped at the lobby and didn't make it to the guest rooms which was a bit of a surprise for me.My room was located on the 6th floor and while I expect odd room configurations in renovated buildings that usually have no view (my room although it had three windows- looked out at another neighboring building) I do expect my room to feel clean.  This was not the case here as the sheer draperies on the windows looked grimy.  They should just take them down and start over.The room also had very poor lighting.  I turned on every light in the room and it still was dark.  And I hate hotel configurations that have the sink out in the middle of the bedroom instead of in the bathroom.   The whole set up was a bit "hodge podge" and for $215 a night I expected more (especially given I had just stayed at the Sheraton down the block for half the price and a better room a few months ago)But you can't beat this place for it's location and proximity to Printers Alley and Broadway.  And the free Internet, free coffee, in room refrigerators and renovated lobby are also nice.I had a drink at the bar in the main lobby and with the soaring ceilings from the historic building as well as the friendly service behind the bar, it was a nice place to start my evening.  If your drive- valet will run you about $22 a night - just pull up on the 4th street side of the hotel and the VERY friendly valet will take your car.I also loved the service that I got from the front desk staff.  Not only were they quick and efficient- they took the time to remember my name so that when I came back down to purchase some water, I was called by name . . .a nice touch but one often found in more expensive hotels.If you like to swim- know that there is no pool at this hotel- however they do have a reciprocal agreement with it's sister hotel, The Renaissance, located a couple of blocks away so you can get your laps in there.I wanted to love this hotel, but I didn't.  And given the room I was in, three stars is generous.  But the friendly staff who went out of their way to make me happy deserve at least that.If you are looking for hospitality this isn't the place. The room sucked as well and I'm currently staring at a cement wall outside. We were told before we arrived that because we are elite status and they were making up for a prior mishap, they would upgrade us to a suite. Well that didn't happen when we arrived, but they did say that two of the three days we were here we would have two adjoining rooms.  Surprise surprise when we found out later the first day that they have that room to someone else. After staying here for two days we had enough with the place so we tried to cancel and go somewhere else, but again to our surprise they told us we couldn't cancel because it wasn't 24 hours in advance. You would think at this point they would at least be understanding and would allow us to leave. Awful all around. Do yourself a favor and find a better hotel in the area around the same $300 a night price.Definitely a good option when visiting downtown Nashville, the Courtyard Nashville Downtown is in a great location & in walking distance to Broadway & the other main event places in downtown Nashville. Granted, I'm from Chicago so "walking distance" is anything under 15 city blocks or so, but it was only 5-10 minutes from Broadway & that surrounding area.Check-in was quick & rather painless... the first room we were sent to was on the 2nd floor right across from the gym, but the room was not finished being cleaned, so I called to the front desk & they quickly reassigned us to a different room on the 6th floor. Honestly, I was glad we got moved because I just didn't like the idea of staying right across from the gym with people going in & out constantly. The room was large, 2 double beds, and the window we had faced right on Printers Alley. There was a mini fridge & coffee maker in the room, as well as a human-sized hair dryer (I hate those little standard hotel hair dryers, I always fry them & then have to wait 20 minutes to finish drying my hair!) so that was exciting for me. My only gripe about the room itself is that the sink area is really small & poorly lit. Since our window was right above Printers Alley, it was definitely a bit noisy/bass-heavy around the 1:30 a.m. mark when I returned to the room, but luckily I had A) just the right amount of beers in me to knock myself out and B) always travel with earplugs & an eye mask, so I passed right out into the super-soft mattress & slept the night away. I didn't hear doors slamming or people yelling in the halls, so that's always a bonus, too. Sidebar, the water pressure in the shower will exfoliate you like nothing you've ever experienced. I love that.The hotel has valet for $20 (if I remember correctly), which is more than I'd normally pay but we needed to get in & out a few times, so it was easier just to do that... the valet guys were super friendly & quick. All the other staff I encountered were really nice as well... I'd definitely stay here again if there are rooms available on my next trip!Solid four, could have been a five if not for a couple of things...Starting with the good, though.  The staff were all VERY nice and helpful.  Big shout-out to the valet crew-- you guys were super.  Location was fantastic-- a short walk from Broadway and many other parts that made downtown Nashville a great visit.  Room was of ample size, well-maintained, and clean.Here's where I dinged this place from getting five stars:In our room was CONSTANT noise from a strip club in Printer's Alley.  It wasn't enough to keep us from falling asleep, but it was loud enough you could always hear it, which was annoying.  Light sleepers may have issues with this.  PLEASE NOTE-- if your room isn't on the Church Street side of the property, I don't see this being a problem.Second thing that slightly downgraded my rating-- the lighting in the bathroom/sink area was poor.  Needed to be much brighter.  Shaving, for example, was difficult, because I couldn't see well enough to make sure I wasn't missing a spot.These two negative points notwithstanding, there's now doubt that yes, I WOULD stay here again.
review_content_20: Nice location. Right downtown. You can walk to broadway for good music and good food. The staff is so nice. Every time you walk in and out, they say hello and welcome you back. The rooms are average the beds are nice. They also have conf rooms if you need to book a meeting.Great location, great staff, clean, starbucks coffee fresh daily,  excellent Courtyard more like a small J.W.  Room was plenty big for 5 of us.......one of us had a Cot.!! Room service really deserves a bonus as location is ideal for anyone visiting Nashville. Adjacent to all the 'hot spots'.Broadway, restaurants, bars, shops  only a few steps away. And yes, PUCKETTS every morning for breakfast 1/2 block down the road.As far as amenities go no pool or jacuzzi :(However as far as customer service goes TOP NOTCH... front desk housekeeping and even engineering were superbWould give you ten stars if we could!!  Such an excellent crew at the front desk no matter what time of the day or night it was.  Nathan and Aisha (spelling!!) took great care of us, they "get" what customer service means!! The Valet associates are a close second with nice help at check-in and check-out.  Mike in Engineering - great historical review of hotel and customer service too. Excellent location to music and museums. Keep up the great work!!No platinum members lounge.   No breakfast.   Clean rooms but walls were too thin.  Could hear conversations in adjoining roomsIt's a Courtyard... so you should already know what to expect.  But this one is just steps from the bar & restaurant scene in Nashville... at a decent rate.  Extra star for location.This hotel was a true disappointment. Rooms were dirty, sheets not changed.Some front desk members were rude and indignant, totally screwed up our bill, the housekeeping manager was doing check out.The Bistro was extremely over priced. The only good thing was the location.Would not recommend.Great location, staff were very helpful...perfect spot for a group staying the weekend in Nashville.This is a nice hotel with a friendly desk staff. It sits in the center of downtown Nashville, so it's easy to get to the stadium to watch the Titans play or all the downtown country western themed bars that the city is known for. You can walk most places tourists like and cabs are plentiful as well. My only beef with this place are the valets are lackluster. You have to wait for a little while and often no one is manning the valet desk. The valet's doubled as bell hops as a need not added service.  Since the hotel has no adjacent lot, all cars have to be valeted. Also the hotel sits at the corner of an intersection, and the only way to check in and unload is to pull into the small valet lane on the left of the street. This can be tricky on a high volume traffic day. Passengers on the right of the car be warned.I just returned from a business trip to Nashville, staying at the Courtyard by Marriott Downtown for 6 nights.  Everyone on the staff that I encountered was extremely nice and helpful and the room was spacious and clean.  The sink area is a bit small, but the bathroom was large and had a tub/shower combo.My room was a double (two full/qeen?? beds) and faced Church street.  Overall it was pretty quiet considering the busy corner.  There was a bit of "base" noise from somewhere at times, but other than that, it was fairly quiet.  I didn't hear the normal everyday traffic, but did (of course) hear a couple of emergency vehicle sirens.  I will say that I kept the air conditioning fan on 24/7 so that probably acted as "white noise" where the traffic was concerned.  I only heard other guests one time in the hall, and other than that I heard nothing...not from the rooms above me or below me or on either side of me.The room amenities included a mini-fridge, a full sized ironing board and iron, a full sized hair dryer (though I preferred my own), lots of towels/wash cloths, internet (both wired and wireless), an alarm clock radio, flat screen TV, a chair and ottoman, a desk with desk chair, a couple of telephones.  The closet was a decent size, but wish there had been more hangers.  There was a small shelf in the closet which helped with some of my non-hanging items.  There were four small drawers in a dresser which acted as a TV stand, and there was a nightstand between the two beds with a very small drawer and a "cubby" space beneath that.My one MINOR wish was for more electrical outlets, especially by the second bed so I could sit in bed with my laptop plugged in.  There was an outlet by the other bed which was against one wall.The location was fantastic...1 block from my office and an easy, short distance from the rest of downtown.  There is a tiny grocery store just a few steps away which seemed to have a bit of everything.  I am allergic to gluten, and they even had some gluten-free items (a loaf of bread, gluten free burrito, etc.)  There is a nice sized cafe in the lobby area which is open for breakfast and dinner.  It's more of a "fast-food" type place where you order at the counter and they bring you your food.  They do have eggs and bacon/sausage type meals as well.I had an early flight out on my last day, so the front desk ordered a taxi for me the night before.  The staff was extremely helpful in giving directions and offering suggestions for places to eat/shop etc.Do not stay here!  We had a very bad experience with this hotel.  Let me start by saying that we reserved a room for our wedding night.  The next morning we had a very early flight to Montego Bay so we checked out of our room around 5:30 a.m. the next morning.  We actually had no complaints until we tried to use our debit card on a large purchase in Jamaica on our honeymoon and it was denied.  OK, this special time that only happens once in your life.... was completely ruined because this hotel charged our account 3 TIMES for the room amount at a whopping $240 a pop. We only left a small amount in our checking account because we were travelling out of country (just in case something happened and someone got our card number or something).  After getting charged $19.99 per MB to check our bank account using data on my cell phone, we discovered this MESS that Courtyard put us in.  We had planned on a couple's massage by the beach in Jamaica but that couldn't happen!  Plans on our honeymoon were ruined and I am still very upset!!!After getting back into the states on a Saturday evening, I called the hotel to try and figure out what as going on.  I was told that a manager would have to speak with me and she would not be in until Tuesday.  I was forwarded to her voicemail and left a message.  The manager finally got back with me and she stated that she had no idea what was going on.  I explained to her my process through booking: I am a Marriott Rewards Member so I just logged into my account and booked a room.  After realizing that I would not be about to check into the room at check in since our wedding was at 4pm I called the hotel and added my husband to the account so that he could check into the room.  I also asked about how much the deposit for the room would be since Marriott usually charges a deposit in case of any charges.  The lady told me that it varies per hotel and I told her that I needed to know (since we were only transferring a certain amount into our checking).  She called the hotel and then finally got back on the line with me... she said that the deposit would not be more than $50.  When he went to check in he told them he wasn't sure what name the reservation was under it could have been either one of our last names. They found the reservation and got him checked in.  We checked out at 5:30 a.m. the next morning and that was all we knew.  The manager had then figured out what had happened: They created a new reservation for my husband and then charged me for a NO SHOW on my reservation.  The third charge was the pre-authorization that showed $220!  Let me re-cap:  They charged me 2 TIMES FOR THE ROOM and screwed up the check in.  THEN... they neglected to let us know that the pre-authorization and the room cost would be charged in the same amount on the same day of check in!  They also charged us for parking!  We had already parked our car in a parking garage and did not park with them!   The manager acted as if it was my husbands fault for creating a new reservation.   I assured her that he absolutely knew that we had a reservation and wouldn't have created a new reservation that it must have been her staff that messed up!  She credited my account for the no-show, told me that the pre-authorization takes 7 business days to fall off of the account, and then credited me for the parking.  She did credit back all fraudulent charges to our account!  However, she can never replace what we lost on our honeymoon all because of their screw ups and neglect in informing us about the pre-authorization and room charge on the same day!  (Basically it showed up twice in one day right after another... which makes no sense... usually a pre-authorization is charged to hold the money and then the balance is updated... like when you leave a tip at a restaurant... not two separate charges!).Ridiculous!!I stayed here for one night on a business trip and I was not disappointed. Big, clean room... comfy bed... 10.99 all you can eat breakfast buffet... and close to everything downtown. Really, no complaints and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.Stayed here 2 nights over Labor Day weekend using Marriott Rewards points.Good location, clean room seemed to be nicely updated for it being advertised as being in a "historic setting." Appreciated the free (plugged in) internet. I'd stay here again.The Courtyard is nicely renovated hotel from another era near a lot of  downtown Nashville action. The Courtyard Nashville Downtown seems to have it all except FREE breakfast. We were told on the phone while making reservations and at the check-in there would be a FREE breakfast buffet included in the cost of staying here. Unfortunately, when presented with our breakfast bill we informed the staff of our FREE breakfast and no one knew anything about it. We had to speak to the manager, Dennis, before we were finally given what was promised to us from the start. This is no way to run a upscale hotel. Shame on you Marriott Corporation.Three Stars for the hotel room, the lobby and beautiful dinning area and ONE STAR for the bait and switch attempt on our poor little street smart souls.Go there and see if they promise you the same FREE breakfast deal, but refuse to keep their promise until confronted by me. Bow Wow!The only good thing about this hotel is that the staff is really nice.The bad:- The beds are so uncomfortable. You'll sink into them. I hardly got any sleep! - The rooms are institutional.- The bathroom is gross. When you turn on the light, the light would flicker for about five seconds and then makes this annoying buzzing noise. - The lighting makes your skin look yellowish green. - The shuttles to the convention center are usually about 10 minutes late. I don't think the neighboring hotels are much better.The perfect place to stay if you're in town for a Titans game...which I wasn't.  But, as I found out on Sunday morning, the hotel is pretty close to the stadium...so close that most people are parked further away than the hotel.I arrived early in the morning after a redeye flight (with a 4-hr layover), so I was a bit grumpy when they told me no rooms would be available until the standard check-in time.  You can't really ding a hotel for that...since that's what they tell you to expect!  When I did get my room, I found it to be relatively big; the room with two doubles is a large rectangle while the room with a king bed is set-up almost like a suite (I saw my friend's).  The double rooms had enough room for an armchair, ottoman and desk and plenty of walking around room.  The bathrooms were the standard.  (I was a little saddened by the lack of a comforter or heavy blanket in the room...it still gets cold in Nashville!)I was a bit disappointed by the service, particularly the unpleasant front desk staff.  When we tried to check-in first thing in the morning, they were pretty dismissive of our request - no sympathy for us there.  Later in the day, we needed taxis to get to the wedding (I know it was close but it was cold...and we didn't feel like walking), and we asked them to call us three taxis.  When they arrived, we realized they were actually van taxis so they seated five rather than four, so we only needed two taxis.  There was a bit of confusion as we were running out to get the taxis, but I told the front desk that we didn't need the third taxi because the ones that had arrived were bigger than expected, and he gave me an exasperated look (perhaps eye-rolling?) and said, "it doesn't matter now."  Goodness, I was just trying to be nice...The Courtyard Marriott is located in the heart of Downtown Nashville - just a few blocks from Broadway which is filled with bars and restaurants and the Country Music Hall of Fame.  I'm guessing the location is one of the reasons why it is relatively expensive.  For my experience/what I got, I thought the hotel was pretty expensive at ~$170 per night.  I didn't have a ton of choice this time around, but I'll probably choose differently next time - or at least do a bit more research.Location on this hotel is key. You can walk anywhere for food, entertainment, and business. The view from my room was amazing and (strangely) had a jacuzzi near the window just a short hop from the end of my bed and no way connected to my bathroom. The room overall was a little subpar from what I have come to expect from the Coutyard brand. Poor lighting, worn carpets, and old paint made this feel outdated. Everything was clean and up kept, but I feel the price was a little hefty. The staff were awesome and the valets were lightning quick. All I ask is a quick remodel and this hotel will get my repeat business. I heard there was a nice Double Tree a block away that has a Starbucks in the lobby....I was really impressed with this courtyard...especially after reading the mediocre reviews on here.  The staff was wonderful...from the valets to the front desk to the bartenders.  The all gave great advice on where to go and what to do.  You simply cannot ask for a better location.  Less than a 5 minute walk to Broadway...even in heels ;)  The room was clean and comfortable.  Nothing overly exciting as far as decor but not your standard Courtyard.  If you are looking for a great place to stay with friendly staff and an unbeatable location, stay here.  I know I will be the next time I'm in NashvilleNot the best Courtyard I've stayed at. Courtyards are usually my preference when I'm out traveling. The bathtub was starting to peel. The beds were comfy and the rooms were clean. Biggest pro = this place is 5 mins to the airport and has free shuttle service.Great room, very clean will stay again next time I'm in Nashville location location !!
review_content_40: Clean and renovated bathrooms. Bed was just okay.  Stayed  with points; glad I didn't really pay for it or I would have been disappointed. Room was oddly large -- with that much space they could have added a seocond armchair or a sofa. Parking options don't exist : you will pay $22 for valet.I had a decent stay at this Courtyard.  The beds were clean and comfy, I had a great view of Midtown, and everything worked fine.  I really liked that they leave a note saying to call if you need room service if you sleep in.  We woke up at 2 PM one day, and usually hotels will just assume you don't want room service and give up on you.  I like how they leave you a note and tell you to call to request room service so that you're not guessing all day whether your room will be clean when you get back or not.  A negative aspect: the parking garage is poorly designed and cramped.  You have very little room to back up, and if you're leaving while a car is coming, you'll be stuck in an awkward moment where the two of you are trying to coordinate how to solve the problem. To end on a good note: It's in a great area of town: very close to downtown, music row, belmont, Vanderbilt, and some great restaurants.  I guess the ideal place would be to stay downtown so you could never use your car, but this is the 2nd best area you can stay at in my opinion.

review_content: Fantastic! The rooms were clean, beds extra comfy, four pillows to choose from, refrigerator in the room, decor attractive and modern, the bathroom is well equipped, and outlets adequate. Note: no microwave in the room but there is one down in the lobby.The hot breakfast includes oatmeal, bananas, berries, melon, bagels, croissants, toast, muffins, peanut butter, bacon, fried potatoes, and Belgium waffles.There is hot tea and coffee in the lobby.The free shuttle service is amazing and a key draw to this hotel. I saved a ton in cab fees! The driver makes their contact number available so you can call at any time to get picked up with only a maximum of a 15 minute wait (in my personal experience). And the driver is very friendly.The fitness room includes two treadmills, one NordicTrack type, seated bike, full set of Dumbbells, and an adjustable weight machine. Towels, water, and disposable headsets are provided. Some of the machines have a TV and there is another TV in the room. I highly recommend this hotel!I'm a long time Hilton Honors member and whenever possible stay at Hilton branded hotels. I've stayed at their hotels all over the world. Hampton Inns are a good, value priced chain that typically covers the basics and this hotel is no exception.The rooms here have been partially remodeled, the beds and desks are new, the televisions  seem to be reasonably new. The rest of the furniture like the love seat in the photo with my review are old and worn and the carpet is also old, stained and worn. I'm not a fan of either. The art on the walls was also very dated and the tub was old and was bowed in the bottom, it was also extremely slick with not mat or traction surface.The parking lot is good, they do have security that roams through at night. The breakfast is typical of the chain. They do have vending machines as there is no close convenience store.The staff here were extremely friendly and helpful, had it not been for them I'd have likely give this place two stars because of the grunginess of the carpet and furniture. I'd stay here again for sure but I'd hope they'd take care of some of the issues first.This place is A-OK. This place gets a solid 3.5 stars. The Good: It's affordable. In fact, it's one of the most affordable in the area. The rooms are simple and clean. The space is utilized very well. They did bring me a microwave when requested at no extra charge, which was really nice. The beds are comfortable. The gym has the makings for a very good workout. The only thing I'd suggest is some kettle bells and a bosu ball. Hampton has a decent breakfast in the AM, featuring yogurts, eggs, sausage or bacon, potatoes, oatmeal, boiled eggs, and/or a selection of breads and baked goods including waffles. Fresh fruit and a fruit medley area also available.The Bad: Not much in the bad department.The carpets were dirty, as evidenced by our dirty socks. Some of the staff was super friendly, while others....not so much. They had a fire alarm go off at around 0800. We all rushed outside (it was probably close to 30 degrees) but got to go in about 20 minutes later. I guess that there was a leak down in the basement. I think it was pretty awesome that the staff kept us updated, but it really sucked when the water got turned off post-alarm, and I couldn't take a shower after I went to the gym :(The verdict: This is a decent place. It's not fantastic, but it's good enough to lay down your head at night to rest.Rare hotel in Nashville that doesn't charge for parking! I did a detailed research and compared this one to many others on Orbitz. Make sure you tally in the parking costs when you compare this hotel to others because if you have 2 cars @ $20 per day for 5 days, that will cost you $200 just for parking! Yikes. You can take the free shuttle within a 2 mile radius and then take Uber/Lyft back to the hotel for $4-6. I suggest you drive to Parthenon though because parking is free and easy. Also, if you want to go touring after midnight (which I did), it's okay to drive because there is plenty of side street parking for free (especially on 3rd/Molloy). Excellent service! Breakfast = amazing! It gets kinda crowded in the breakfast area but it gets the job done. The servers are quick to refill as soon as something runs out and they are constantly on standby if you need anything else. A lady who was handicap basically had her own personal server (she sat down and made the server do everything for her, she even made the waffles which takes 5-6 minutes). I accidentally spilled an entire jug of ice right in front of the manager/supervisor and she didn't show any sign of annoyance. Instead she took the jug from my hand and said I'll get you more water. You won't see this in Chicago!!! Our pillows/bed were super duper comfy. Extra extra clean. Our thermostat though wasn't quite working. We set the thermostat to 60 degrees but the room temperature was consistently at 70 degrees. House keeping is super quick, but make sure you call early if you want something because I think housekeeping closes at 10ish. The free wifi works well enough to stream movies/music. You will be walking distance from many coffee shops, Pizza hut, taco bell and a bunch of other stuff. I thought this hotel was in a great location overall.I couldnt tell you how this hotel is because after I spent a hour on the phone with customer service making a reservation for the rooms I found online I was transferred to the hotel to "complete my payment" at which time I was told I had no reservation and they didnt have the rooms I needed available. When I called customer service again I spent another half hour on the phone trying to get the situation fixed but they couldnt get me the rooms there, or at any of the hotels nearby for the promised rate. . . waste of timeStayed here early May 2015 while coming into town for a concert.Overall a really good stay with no major complaints. Quality of room was comprable to DoubleTree, though not quite on level of Hilton (Yes, I'm a HHonors member). Our king bed was comfortable, the room spacious, as was the bathroom. Minifridge in room was a plus, except it hardly cooled anything. I was better off just getting ice from the down the hallway. Free WiFi for all guests, no charge for parking either. And parking spaces were ample, even on a weekend. Although I didn't use it, there was a pretty decent breakfast bar, a small fitness room, and pool (though the pool was going through some renovations). My main gripe would be the price. Though I liked the hotel well enough, it didn't justify the 200+ per night. I realize it may be because of the location in a busy city like Nashville, but I've stayed at higher end hotels in bigger cities for less. As for the staff, almost everyone was great. The daytime desk clerks were polite, professional, and helpful. Housekeeping did a good job. My only gripe was the night time desk person. He was rather nonchalant about checking me in, and forgot to give me a parking tag for my car-- I don't want to imagine what would have happened if I got towed without it being my fault.Great location, hotel is dated though. The doors slam, music is blaring at all hours of the night, bathtub didn't turn on (first call to maintenance), sink didn't drain (second call but was 10:30 at night, so I just lived with it). I'm a Hampton gal and while the location is great for Vandy and proximity to restaurants. It isn't great for comfort. Wouldn't stay here again.I was really impressed with this hotel in all aspects. When we arrived, we were met with smiles and friendly staff. The room was perfect! The blankets weren't paper stiff or spongey--definitely the best bedding I've ever experienced in a hotel. We also got GooGoo Clusters with our welcome package and plenty of the necessities, like shampoo, soap, towels, and city information. The shuttle runs in a 2 mile radius, which includes the Broadway strip, so you can easily get to and from the hotel, and the drivers are such sweethearts--full of suggestions and information for out-of-towners. The distance also isn't bad for walking if you're up to it, and you can get to Centennial Park pretty easily from the hotel on a casual stroll as well. The breakfast in the morning is impressive and it's not dried out eggs and pastries--fresh fruit, bagels, waffle maker, yogurts, etc.--all of the things that I'd like to have for breakfast instead of empty calorie meals that won't fuel my tourist walks. The free parking, pool, and fitness center are all wonderful perks and though I didn't have time to check out the gym or pool, they definitely looked clean and well kept. I'll definitely be staying here again.If you're looking for a reasonably priced hotel with a great location with added perks, this is the place for you. If you're looking for a quiet, upscale hotel, this isn't for you. The hotel is a straight shot to downtown and maybe 5 minutes tops. There are tons of restaurants around that you can walk to, including the famous Hattie Bs. They offer a free hot breakfast, free wifi, free parking (almost all surrounding hotels charge for parking), fitness center, and a shuttle that will take you downtown.  That being said, the hot breakfast was pretty impressive for this hotel. They cover all the basics - eggs, sausage, waffles, cereal, yogurt, fruit, pastries, biscuits, bagels, etc. Surprisingly, the biscuits were reallyyyy good. Warm, big, and fluffy. I would expect nothing less in Nashville. The fitness center was above average. There were TVs, treadmills, elliptical, bike, free weights, medicine balls, and a water cooler. I was pretty impressed. The shuttle was non-existent. It was there when we first checked in and then I never saw it again. I wish they would structure this like their Hilton brand partners and have a schedule of every 30 minutes so you knew when to expect it The room was very large and clean. The bathroom was very spacious for a hotel. Housekeeping never got in the way and was very thorough.  Here's the downside: we were located on the first floor, not far off from the lobby.  People were constantly walking by and not using their inside voices. The walls are thin so don't expect a quiet stay. It sounded like their was a family of 40 staying next to us.  Also, in the mornings there was this insanely loud electrocuting sound every 5 minutes and we couldn't figure out what it was. I now know what it feels like to be in a bug zapper. It didn't happen at night or interfere with my sleep so I was less annoyed by it. Overall, we did enjoy the stay. The hotel location and perks outweighed its zoo-like atmosphere and we would stay here again, but just request a quieter room next time.Great experience in Nashville made better by this hotel. The staff are so friendly and accommodating. The women serving breakfast in the morning are so sweet and kind. Room was beautiful and comfy, clean and very large. No complaints at all. Great location near Vanderbilt and mucus row.Price = 4Experience = 4Great location to Nashville fun... consistent Hampton.Excellent location and was a great place to stay the weekend in Nashville. They even have a shuttle down to Broadway. Good restaurants within walking distance for dinner and breakfast.this is a great place to stay. the staff is exceptional from the front desk, breakfast bar, custodians. the only negative point is the workout room. Too small and not enough equipment. but still adequate for a work out. I highly recommend this hotel.I'm not really sure where the 4 star average comes from.  It's decent, good location if you're visiting Vanderbilt. Reasonably close to downtown (not really walking distance).  Staff was fine. Hotel rooms were clean. Older property but reasonably well maintained.   Breakfast room is not good, it's in the basement.  Very small limited food options ( I stay in 1 or 2 hamptons per week,  this is one of the worst with regard to the breakfast room.  Price for room was a bit on the high side for what you get but to be fair, I was in town for a conference and hotels might be high occupancy.   Probably would look elsewhere next time.While on a recent week long vacation in Tennessee, the wife and I stayed exclusively at Hampton Inns, due to the Yelp reviews and locations of where we wanted to stay. I am a little bummed every time I stay, knowing a little bit of my money goes to Paris Hilton in some way, but man, this is a great hotel chain. This hotel was no exception.Check in was a breeze, and the front desk staff was super friendly. The room was amazing. Very roomy and comfortable, with lots of amenities and free extras. The room came with a mini-fridge, microwave, coffee maker, iron & ironing board, flat screen TV, and plenty of outlets for charging your electronics. Bed was super comfortable with clean linens and lots of pillows. Bathroom was spacious with lots of towels and freebies (body wash, lotions, mouthwash, etc.) The free breakfast here is also no joke- fresh scrambled eggs, bacon, yogurt, fresh fruit, bagels & toast, oatmeal with toppings, juice, coffee.... This place even made some bagel bite type meals with eggs, bacon, and cheese on a bagel. Really impressive, and it's definitely worth fighting a hangover at 8 am to go downstairs and get it.The location is nice- right off the highway, and close enough to walk to Broadway to experience downtown Nashville, however you should utilize this hotels free shuttle van. It goes back and forth from the hotel to a certain intersection in Nashville. It's free to guests, I just threw a nice tip at the driver every time we used it- definitely cheaper than taking a cab, and considering the amount of alcohol I consumed in Nashville, the smartest way to go. There's also a few great restaurants and fast food chains right across the street if you want to go out.All in all, I had a GREAT stay here, definitely recommended. Great, clean, comfortable rooms, friendly staff, and a great location. For the money I paid it was worth every penny, and I would stay here again in a heartbeat!I stayed here for 3 nights (Thu-Sat) and I have to say - I was impressed!  I thought it was a little expensive but everything was clean, and well functioning (except for the loose outlet in the bathroom but that just made it homey).  The bed was incredibly comfortable.  Great pillows, and I liked the nice little tray thing with beanbags and elastic so one could read or work on a laptop in bed -- I want one of those things!  The bedding was fantastic - it was very comfortable and distinctly lacking in cat hair (a feature that would have made it more homey).The hotel was well insulated from outside noise.  I could see the cars going by but couldn't hear them! Yay!The staff - Russell, TO, Craig (the shuttle driver) were all incredibly friendly, helpful and professional.The fitness room even has dumbbells!  And towels! And water!The cons - well, I would love it if other guests would be more considerate.  There was more door-slamming and shouting in the hallway than in a freshman dorm the first weekend a bunch of teenagers spend away from home.  And - I'm not talking about teenage guests.  People were LOUD in the hallway late at night and nobody held their door in hand to close it, just let it slam BAM! shut behind them.  Folks were shockingly rude in their noisiness as they walked past where other people were sleeping.I didn't bother to look at breakfast - I'm vegan.  I brought a shaker and protein powder because I don't expect anyone outside the Bay Area or Portland to actually know what vegans eat.  And - no hot tub/jaccuzzi!  There was a tiny excuse of a pool but not even a hot sauna or steam room?  Bummer.  I'd stay there again - but definitely rent a car because sidewalks are inconsistent in Nashville.Stayed here with a group of girls for 2 nights to visit our girl friend who lives in Nashville.  Great location, with plenty of parking.  Spacious room, comfortable, clean bed/room, friendly staff...everything that you would expect from a Hampton Inn.I can go on to talk about the amenities that they had, but we really didn't utilize them to their fullest.  Don't think we used the TV, lapdesk, desk...after all, when you are having a girls weekend, there's no time for that, right?  We did use the mini-fridge, which was actually pretty big and fit a lot of the snacks/drinks that we used for the weekend.If I'm looking for a centrally located hotel in Nashville, again, this will definitely be on the top of my list!My girl friend and I stayed here to explore Nashville for a few days. Nice room, always felt safe. Received lots of information and sight-seeing suggestions from the front desk; they even gave us advice regarding where and when it was safe to walk places (vs take a cab). ALSO I just have to mention the shuttle driver. We utilized this whenever we could, because (a) although it's doable to walk to the district, it was cold and (b) he doesn't quite go everywhere. Just most places. He suggested a few places for us to try; namely, B.B. King's Blues Bar. It ended up being one of my favorite places during the whole trip. Even the other people in the shuttle decided to come in with us! The driver also gave us cards so we didn't have to pay cover, which was great. I'd definitely stay here again. It is also right next to Vandy and very close the Centennial Park.We had 5 rooms there over the weekend.  Very clean, large, and comfortable.  Good coffee in the lobby available anytime.  Super impressed with the rooms and the staff.Stayed while on a business trip to Nashville. Had a problem with my company credit card while checking in, but the staff was very courteous and helpful in getting it resolved quickly. My room was very spacious, comfortable, and very decorated nicely. Bed was very comfortable and the internet connection was very good. I have to say it was one of the nicest rooms I have ever stayed in! The breakfast buffet was excellent with numerous food choices. Everything I had was very tasty. Excellent location close to pretty much everything in downtown Nashville. Just an all around great hotel!
review_content_20: Very happy with my stay here with my mom. The parking is free, there is complimentary breakfast which is surprisingly decent, free wifi, and a free shuttle to take you where you need to go. There is also free coffee and chocolate chip cookies during the day in the lobby. Free computer use as well in the business center. Every one of the staff that I came into contact with was very friendly and helpful. The sheets and duvet cover where nice and clean. There was a mini shampoo, conditioner, and two bars of soap - all Neutrogena brand, which was nice. The hotel room could probably use a few paint touch ups and maybe new carpet but overall it's clean and comfy. The cost of the hotel isn't cheap but I think it is definitely worth it.Great Hampton Inn!!! Very comfortable room, friendly staff and a great location. Breakfast was very good and the hotel is clean and very updated.Every single staff member was so friendly- from the people at the front desk, to the free shuttle driver, to the staff at the complimentary breakfast! The lobby is cozy and the location is close to lots of goodies. The free shuttle will take you anywhere within 2 miles which includes the downtown drag on Btoadway. The bed was incredibly comfortable, good hot coffee was accessible all day and the breakfast was really tasty with lots of options including croissants and really flavorful potatoes.We visited this hotel on our way to Alabama. It was a good room overall. We had doubles and the furniture was phenomenal. I love the espresso look and it was very gorgeous. The location was perfect for those who want to get away from the downtown area. The breakfast was really good as well with a nice arrangement of cereal to take on the way too! I would definitely recommend it. Staff was very nice too.Experienced Around: Jan 11, 2012I go to school at Vanderbilt and my mom came down for 2 nights to help me unpack my storage space.  The Hamilton Inn had the best price for hotels within a half mile radius of the campus.  Its in a good location, across from a lot of restaurants, and close to downtown.Pros- good location, fair price ($120-130/night), friendly staff, free popcorn and coffee/ tea/ hot cocoa in the lobby, complimentary breakfast, free parking, free wifi, very nice renovated rooms, a mini fridge, comfy beds, rooms are spacious, lots of lighting in the room, at night it can either be pitch black or if you want, there is a lot of night lights.
