Quick and easy check in/ out.Cons- the Ac/heater made a humming noise which is not noticeable at day, but when I woke in the morning, I had a migraine.  Also, the wifi is somewhat slow/ bad connection.Bottom line: it wasn't the perfect experience, but I would stay here again.This place is excellent. Unless they added a bunch of extras and upped their price, they can't be five stars. But it the money, you really can't get any better. Everyone was friendly, the place is exceptionally clean, the lobby is well above average, and the room is more than enough for an extremely comfortable and peaceful nights sleep.I have got to remember that I love Hampton Inn! I love a place that feels like they care about good design. Lots of dark wood, and modern design, that has at its focus comfort. I LOVE the fact that through out the entire hotel is black and white photography! So, classy and good stuff! I really enjoyed the stay even if it was for one night! all the little things have been taken care of. (There was even a classic yellow posted note on the headboard of the bed telling me the linens were cleaned just for me! it is a tiny small thing most might not notice... but Hampton Inn gets it! It is the small things that make the difference. The comforter has little bumps in it and gives the  duvet cover a unique look! The bathroom had granite counter tops! The office desk had wheels and could be put anywhere in the room. I highly recommend this place to stay! Great eating right around the hotel also makes this a great location for any one visiting Vanderbilt or the Upper Room/General Board of Discipleship.Pros: GREAT comforting design, from the front lobby to the rooms.Service at the front desk was just fine.Price is great for the classy feel and level of comfort that I have while staying here.free Wi-FI, parking, and breakfast, and hotel van that will drive you around within reason. Cons: air temperature in the hall ways and near the elevators was really bad and very humid.My room temp said it was set for 70 degrees, but there is no way. I had it set to 60 degrees and it took quite a while to get to that temp.Once we got a shower curtain, THIS PLACE IS AWESOME!  We ate the BEST breakfast, jogged on the treadmill, did some laundry IN THE beautifully renovated basement.  We liked the Business area and lobby.  It wasn't crowded but managed to use the computers and drink the coffee - long enough to update this review.  And nice pool.  It had saline water instead of Chlorine - VERY NICE...............We WILL be back.  Our little home away from home can walk to many restaurants and drive to just about anywhere else from here.  Vanderbilt area and the hospitals are within walking distance but the best part is.........Chuy's (I will review that place separately.)  and the BP Station.  What a nice place - very friendly town and excellent location to come and go.  We'd call the Hampton Inn, home again - if Nashville will give us a reason to come back!  :)Stayed here, using points. Pros: quiet! (and the place was packed with little league teams), good water pressure, decent albeit small gym, clean, comfortable king bed, properly cooled (during a horrible heat wave), refrig, coin laundry was good, staff was handling the large volume of inquiries well, kids seemed to love the outdoor poolCons: breakfast did not accommodate GF/DF needs; fruit is not enough- no hard boiled eggs so no protein available,  elevator was slow (people opted for the stairs regularly) and I heard others sharing their stories of weirdnessOdd: Seems there must have been a corner soap holder that did not work out in the shower; big chunk of cement on the two walls became the focal point.EXCEPTIONALLY LOUD! Those two words pretty much sum up our entire experience at the Hampton Inn Vanderbilt. Each night while trying to fall asleep around 11pm/midnight a parade of drunk 20 something's and beyond would decide to continue their partying, drunk conversations, and make out sessions in the hallways, which apparently have paper thin walls and sound as if there are no doors on the rooms. I don't want to deny anyone their partying, especially in a fine town such as Nashville, I just don't want to hear it well past 3 am every night!I understand a hotel cannot always monitor every action of their patron, but they could hire a security guard to patrol the halls and tell people to shut their yaps. Secondly, after barely sleeping from the noise the night before, the hotel staff crew begin their cleaning and daily maintenance around 7 am. Complete with slamming doors, large creaky carts full of supplies and again, unnecessarily loud conversations, the hotel staff begin their day waking up the guests. Not what I call a pleasant wake up call. One person, who perhaps had bad indigestion or who maybe was just particularly rude, went through the halls each morning loudly belching like Barney from the Simpsons. To their credit: the hotel had a great location, free parking and breakfast, the rooms were very clean and in good working order and the desk staff polite. Albeit a bit overpriced, the hotel itself was pretty a-okay. But if you like peace and quite at night and a decent night sleep, look elsewhere. I have NEVER stayed anyplace SO LOUD! And I certainly won't stay here again.Adequate is the word that best sums up this hotel.If most of your stay revolves around the midtown area then you can't do much better than the location here.Bonuses:Free parking. I was shocked by this as it seems to be a rarity unless you are in the burbs.Free Wi-Fi. Another shocking item that is usually a huge upcharge at most hotels. The price point, freebies, and location make this a good option.After spending several days and all of my company's money at Opryland, which was huge and confusing to walk through and excessive, I was really surprised by how much I loved our room here. We switched for the last night to save some money. It was comfortable and the interior design of the lobby and rooms were creative and aesthetically pleasing. The breakfast was quality and nutritious: omelettes with cheese, decent bacon, american potatoes, fruit, hardboiled eggs, yogurt, prepared oatmeal, etc. This is really key for me, as I care a lot about nutritious food. The lobby had nice, comfortable chairs and a fireplace! Our room was beautiful. Gorgeous drapes, soft, comfortable sheets and blankets. The bathroom was updated and just so nice. There is really something to be said about the cleanliness of the room. It was really noticeable how well cared for. And all of the staff were very friendly. If I would have known how nice this place was, I would have stayed here all week and driven to Opryland for my conference. That should really tell you how good this place is.Nice hotel.  The staff was generally nice and pleasant, and I appreciated the ease in getting checked in and out, as well as the continental breakfast.  The room was also nice, with the general amenities one would expect from a hotel like this (shower stuff, coffee, iron/ironing board).One minor gripe: I'm not a big fan of housekeeping calls at 8:15 AM.  It wasn't too bad, as I had been up for the previous 45 minutes, but I was getting into the shower and probably would not have been as enthused.Also the elevators are slow.  Like crawling slow.However, it does seem to be an overall well-run establishment, and a decent place to stay the night if you're doing something nearby at Vandy or elsewhere.Everytime I come to Nashville I either stay here our at the Embassy Suites. Both are excellent hotels. I really like the Hampton Inn because it is centrally located, has amenities like a hair dryer in the bathroom, clean linens and a complementary breakfast. Win! If I am looking for an affordable hotel in this great city that is centrally located (which why wouldn't you want those things??) I will stay here!Pretty standard hotel in downtown Nashville. I stayed here one night on a business trip and found it perfectly ordinary. The hotel is currently undergoing renovations, so there is a lot of construction out front, but I didn't hear any noise from it while I was there.Pluses: Free wifi and free breakfast are always great. The wifi was okay--it wasn't fast enough to download the TomTom app to my iphone, which I tried to do all night, but it was fast enough to check email, browse the internet, and use FaceTime on my phone. The breakfast was also good for a free breakfast. There was a self-serve waffle machine, plus some "cheese omelets" with fake cheese (ew), ham, and potatoes, yogurt, cereal, and various drinks. There was also an outdoor pool that looked nice.Ordinary aspects: My room certainly hadn't been renovated. It smelled kind of musty and had really ugly rough walls. The bathroom was massive, though, and the shower had fantastic pressure. My room looked out onto the main window, but it only had one curtain, and didn't have the thin curtain that lets in light but not prying eyes. So there were two options--no natural light but privacy; or natural light but everyone in the parking lot can see you. Location: The hotel has a central location. It didn't really seem to be within walking distance of anything, though, so you'd either need to drive or take a taxi. Blackstone Brewery was across the street, so I went there for dinner, which was convenient (there's also an Italian restaurant next door to the brewery).Overall: I can see why this hotel is getting renovated: it's starting to show its age. There were no deal-breakers that would prevent me from staying here, it just wasn't very exceptional. I definitely would have been disappointed if this was a holiday for me, but for business it was fine. I think I paid $150 or $170, which is clearly mostly for location. However, it seemed like even if you were going other places in the heart of Nashville, you'd still need to drive, so even the location wasn't that much of a benefit. If I was going to Vanderbilt U or to Music Row, I definitely would have driven from the hotel. So yeah, not a bad experience by any means, but not good enough to return if I'm back to Nashville.This hotel rates five stars because of one if their staff members named Kela. We encountered an issue which she tackled and resolved in an amazing way. Not only did she initiate and follow, she actually sent a card and a box of candy to our room. We travel extensively, and you're lucky to get anyone's attention when you need help. Obviously the Hotel management is of high caliber as their hiring skills are evident. I'll be back!Stayed here for four nights in January 2011, while in town for company meetings. I'm a Hilton Diamond member, so I'm very familiar with the entire chain. Also, I never get to spend four consecutive nights in the same place, so I got to know this hotel pretty well.As far as Hamptons go, this one was probably in the top 25% of Hamptons I've stayed at. The room was on the more recently-renovated end, bathroom was spacious enough (for one person, at least), wireless ran at a decent speed, and breakfast was...free. Can't really complain, I usually just grabbed a bagel and OJ anyway.I got a $139 rate, which wasn't the best I've ever seen (I could have gotten $119 if I'd been willing to non-refundable pre-pay, but company won't allow that), but it was cheaper than the guy who checked in ahead of me, who had a $159 rate. I don't think I'd pay $159 for this hotel, but $139 seemed reasonable. Also, there was a refrigerator in my room (I don't think they're in every room), but no microwaves in any of the rooms. I'm okay with that, but some people like to have microwaves.Overall, I'd stay here again. The brewery and Italian joints across the street are both pretty good, there are other good restaurants on Elliston (within walking distance, even in the bitter cold), and the Hampton mattresses are awesome. Recommended.The first stop on our road trip.  Very accommodating front desk staff who offered suggestions of where to eat and where to go line dancing. Comfortable beds and accommodations.  Offered a shuttle service to downtown until 11PM, we were able to call him to pick us up when we were ready.  Would definitely stay here again.We were here for a concert and a weekend get away among friends and it is good. Service at the front desk was great and the staff is really attentive to the guests needs. I would defiantly stay here again and its close to a few good restaurants and a really good brewery across the street. I gave it 4 only because there are a few minor things in the bathroom such as a few cracks that make it look worse then it is. Other than that I would say all is well.The hotel is very nice, the room was clean, the service in general from all the staff was excellent. Taeffe at the front desk was awesome. She has spectacular customer service especially during this very busy weekend. I loved the fresh popcorn in the lobby each evening- What a treat!Breakfast was tasty and very appreciated. The location of this hotel was walking distance to many restaurants and shops. I'd stay here again!
review_content_40: I have stayed at various hotels in the West Nashville area on business trips, and I would definitely recommend this hotel as the best in its price range.  Comfortable room (incredibly comfortable bed and pillows), courteous staff, and a complimentary breakfast with great coffee to start the day.Great value hotel.   The room was large and clean, with a good sized bathroom.   The hallways smelled a little musty and the breakfast was not good, but what can you expect, it's free.  The staff was very friendly and courteous.  A couple of gripes were that the pool was pretty small and full of Bros and thugs, but what can you do on a weekend?

review_content: Of all the Marriott options, it's never my first choice to stay in a Courtyard, but the Courtyard in downtown Nashville, which is the only Marriott in the heart of downtown, was overpriced the weekend I was visiting. So, I opted to stay in this part of town. And I must say, being in Vanderbilt was awesome. Staying here allowed me to explore a different part of Nashville and got me away from some of the tourist traps I would have otherwise been drawn into downtown.There are plenty of bars and restaurants within walking distance, but you are pretty much right next to the Vanderbilt campus, so expect a younger crowd when you go out. And if you overindulge, you're also close to St. Thomas Hospital as well. If you do feel the need to go downtown, it's only about 1.5 miles away.Check-in here was smooth and the room was clean. The ongoing construction across the street was a little annoying, but that's no fault of Marriott's. The gym is what you'd expect for a Courtyard ... nothing special. Just the basics. Each room also has an outdoor seating area, which for me meant staring into ... well, a courtyard.This is a Courtyard by Marriott. In terms of rooms, bath fixtures, toiletries etc, don't expect the Ritz or JW Marriott, it is what it is--comfortable, clean, predictable and having the amenities that one would expect. There are two things that really make this Marriott stand out.1. The concierge staff at the Front is spectacular. We interacted a fair amount with Gary, Lisa, and Keith. All three were incredibly helpful and really seemed to take joy in trying to make our stay the best we could possibly have, including engaging with the kids, advice on places to see, eat, and driving directions on how to get there--I know in an age of Google Maps and Waze the last part seems less important, but Nashville as of this writing has a lot of construction related road closures on weekends, and their advice really made our lives easier. Really friendly folks that made the stay better.2. The location is great. A short walk from Vanderbilt and Centennial park, and easily walking distance 20-25 min -- or a shuttle ride-- to the bright lights of Broadway and the honky tonks. There are also a number of great places to eat a short walk from the hotel.If you are a single traveler looking for a place with a great onsite restaurant or swanky bar, there are other places that might fit your needs better. If you are the type that does not mind venturing out a bit to enjoy the city around you, this is a great base of operations.I haven't been disappointed by a Marriott yet, and this spot is included. The room was great, the pool was wonderful and the staff was top-notch. I was hoping for a room with a balcony, and didn't get one when I got there. After calling and asking for one, they immediately moved me to a room that had one. And, they were incredibly nice and accommodating when I asked.One small detail I really appreciated was the bathroom. The shower was great and felt like home. Also, the hair dryer was full size instead of one of those little, crappy hotel hair dryers.Before booking a trip to Nashville, I took a look at the downtown hotel prices and about fainted, seriously $350+ night. When I looked on Marriott's site and found this hotel priced at $239, which was still more than I wanted to pay, however the same hotel was listed on Hotels.com for $179 which was far more appealing than the $239 rate by booking directly with Marriott. When booking with an external site other than Marriott you do not get credit towards your Marriott Rewards, but thanks to Marriott's Look No Further Best Rate Guarantee, I was able book the room at the same rate as it was going for on Hotels.com ($179), and to make the deal even sweeter Marriott even knocked the price down by another 25% bringing down my nightly rate to just under $135/night! Seriously a little homework saved me over $200 over my stay!When I first arrived I headed right to the garage, which was a mistake because access to the garage and hotel you will first need your room key. Luckily they were able to buzz me in without having me go back to the main lobby first. The garage elevators are actually shared with Tower 2, with additional rooms above the parking garage. Once inside you will have a short walk down the corridor to the lobby. The check-in process was super easy and thanks to an early check in with the Marriott app my room keys were all set as soon as I arrived. The lobby itself is large and shared space with an attached cafe and tons of seating, there is also a more private seating area with a TV alongside the Tower 1 elevators. My room was large and spacious and very comfortable with more than enough space to unpack and not worry about being cramped. The bathroom was large with a nice shower. The toiletries provided were basic, however they were Paul Mitchell branded which would have come in handy if I had forgot any of my items. The bed was comfortable, however it wasn't as firm as I had hoped but it still provided an enjoyable night's sleep. One major plus was the curtains closed sealing out almost every trace of daylight, which was great when I wanted to sleep in! Internet was free and decent, however it was a little tricky to get going at first as the landing page timed out, but ended up connecting you without the confirmation, however this was only a one time occurrence during my stay so it wasn't a problem.Now as far as the hotel itself, its located closer to Vanderbilt University, and only a short Uber ride to the bars and venues along Music Row. However there are more than enough options around the hotel to keep you busy. Places like Hattie B's Hot Chicken, The Row, Brewhouse, Cookout, Winners & Losers, and more. I forgot to mention that parking is $26/day, however you are within walking distance to a wide variety of restaurants and bars, and a short Uber/taxi ride downtown. So this slight increase will still help you save a considerable amount over a downtown hotel. Overall I was pleased with the value and service I received will staying at the hotel, and would recommend it anyone visiting Nashville.Bedding and bed are poor, did not clean room daily, shower shrieks, keys never work, good location, however will not be back or recommend staying here.Decent hotel in a great location near Vanderbilt. Free shuttle service in a three mile radius, which will get you downtown. Lisa at the reception desk is a wealth of knowledge and will always steer you in the right direction.I'm a business traveller who stays in the road 40-50% of the time.I love driving arriving at the Vanderbilt Courtyard to the valet who knows my name after 3 stays. Then, walking in to meet Gary at the front desk, who greets me like I've been coming there for 10 years. To top it all off there is a shuttle that takes you anywhere you need to go; dining, night life.I frequent many hotels on a regular basis, but none compare to the impeccable service I receive at the Vanderbilt Courtyard!This hotel has it's pros and cons, which I believe the overall pros pushed it slightly from 3 stars to 4.The people who work here are very nice, from the front desk to the people cleaning the rooms and providing service throughout the hotel. I needed additional shampoo and conditioner one day because I love to swim and the cleaning lady remembered and kept me stocked through the week. I love swimming, so my boyfriend picked the hotel based on the outdoor pool. It was quite relaxing and refreshing when we had a chance to go. I didn't get a chance to use the gym, but it looked nice. I usually love those two amenities the most. The room was typical of other Courtyards I've stayed in, but the bed was beyond hard. I ended up with back and shoulder pains every morning. With the millions they spent on the renovations, that should have been key. The best part is the good night sleep away from home, yet I never got it. Other issues were the TV had reception issues, static and channels going out and there was no microwave in the room. The TV had basic cable and no movies for rental which almost every hotel has these days. Then the room key issue, the room keys would deprogram and we would have to go to the front desk. The garage key wouldn't work, so we would have to get buzzed in and then the elevators wouldn't work. Although I never keep the key near my phone and know better, this happened at least 3 times. The best part was the location, the area has lots of great restaurants and bars in the area. We found a lot of places nearby and within walking distance, which made for some fun nights out.I am annoyed. This place seems a bit... Overwhelmed. Not a fan of their customer service. Very patronizing and not solution-oriented when it comes to questions. Will update after my stay but right now, not a fan.Great place to stay! Convenient location with great shuttle service. AGM Keith M. is AWESOME!! He went out of his way to make our stay extra special. All hotel staff are great from the management to the shuttle drivers to the cleaning staff. Stay here --you won't regret it!My husband & I stayed here, we travel for a living so we stay at a lot of these hotel's, we have 2 Vehicle's so when we pulled in, it was tight, also a construction crew was parked out there and inside having lunch, while we took out luggage and went to drop off one car cane back to lobby and get the other Vehicle the manger was there looking for us, to yell at me and tell me it was there busiest time of day, between 1 & 3 and get our 2013 Chevy 3500 out of there!!!!!! He spit on my lip, and was so rude we will never stay there again!!Worst breakfast buffet, nasty bacon, sausage ,cold hard eggs benedict, waited 45 mins for fresh to be brought out, was still terribleMy friend booked three regular rooms and a suite for my bachelorette party and bridal shower. We were staying Friday and Saturday nights. Friday mid morning, my friend checked in to all the rooms. She let the lady at the front desk know that the rest of the guests would be flying in and arriving at various times throughout the afternoon. The lady said all they had to do was give my friend's name and they'd be fine. My friend was unable to stay all day at the hotel as she had setup for the party to complete. The first guest attempted to check in and used my friend's name and was not allowed in to her room. My freon was called to verify this person could be added. At this time, my friend explained the situation and asked of she could give the names of everyone else who would be staying in the rooms since just giving her name as we were told to do was not sufficient. So she did that.Lo and behold, every guest that tried to check in was denied. Every time someone checked in it was a different story. The kicker was that one guest had to put down her credit card and was told it was just for a hold on the room. This is strange because my first friend had already given her card and was told to put all the rooms on it. Upon checkout, they charged that whole room to the guest and not my friend. It was an extremely awkward situation and I went to the desk with her to explain that we need the room on my friend's card instead. They refused to change it and made one of my shower guests pay on her own. I was visibly upset and explained that I was frustrated with every interaction I had with the staff throughout the weekend. I never got any apology or acknowledgment that there was a miscommunication. This hotel is fine for when you're a family checking in to one room. But I would never trust them wither a group event.I am in the midst of booking blocks of hotel rooms for my wedding guests and after this experience will take my business elsewhere. Bad customer service is a dealbrealer for me.I know Courtyard Marriott's are midrange hotels, so I'm not looking at it like it's a Ritz Carlton. I'm a seasoned business traveler and know what I'm getting into. This is a great location as there are tons of restaurants and bars around. This property looked to be newly renovated and smelled new. We arrived earlier than anticipated (around 11:30 am) and were only expecting to be able to have them hold our luggage, but they found an open room for us and let us in (Service Bonus #1). The menu button on our remote wasn't working and the housekeeper was in the room across the hall and switched ours with an empty room, saying she would later replace the bad one for them (Service Bonus #2). Unfortunately, it wasn't the remote, but the TV (it basically had to be pinged by the server). I made a call to the front desk and they sent up Engineering, who said he knew the person who stayed the previous night had TV issues and was waiting for him to checkout before he fixed it, but because the front desk gave us the room, he hadn't had a chance. In exchange for the nuisance, he gave us free movies for the day (Service Bonus #3) and a coupon for a free appetizer (Service Bonus #4).We ate around the corner at the Tavern, which is crazy good (review pending), and came back to the staff welcoming us by name (Service Bonus #5). Before leaving for dinner, I checked on the availability of a cab and they said the shuttle offers free rides within 3 miles (Service Bonus #6).The next day, my wife went out for a run and they recommended a 4-mile loop that took her through Vanderbilt and she said it was an awesome recommendation (Service Bonus #7), even though she got hit by and old guy in a car... not Marriott's fault. During that time, I went to the gym and saw all the equipment was new and the room was spacious, probably 25' x 50'. All the cardio equipment had individual TVs and one large one hung on the wall.Afterwards, I went to the Bistro to get us a few yogurts and waters, but they had closed 10 minutes prior. I didn't realize this and waited for about 60 seconds until somebody showed up. She apologized profusely for not realizing I was there and said they were closed, but was able to ring up my water and then said the yogurts were on the house (Service Bonus #8).Finally, I called for a wakeup call and asked if he could make sure there was a cab available at 4:15 a.m. for us. True to form, we got our call and the cab was waiting when we came downstairs (Service Bonus #9).For those of you keeping track, that's nine... NINE unique service items that the staff went out of their way to do. You may think those are small things, but in this world where so many people don't even lift a finger to help, an experience like this makes you happy you spent your dollars where you did.ROOM (Tower 2, 7th Floor King Bed facing North)FRIDGE (Yes)MICROWAVE (No)COFFEE POT (Yes)IRON & BOARD (Yes)TV (Philips 32" LCD HDTV)DESK (Yes)COUCH (Yes)FOLD OUT BED (Yes)INTERNET (Free WiFi)BUSINESS CENTER (Yes)FITNESS CENTER (Yes)PARKING ($22/day Valet Only)RATE (March, 2013 - $189/night)PROS** TV has inputs exposedJust RCA, SVideo, and USB inputs. ** Fridge has some cool featuresIt's a small mini fridge, but it can hold a good number of drinks, but a takeout container would probably take up an entire row. What's cool, though, is that there're 2 buttons on the fridge: 1) Quick Chill - cools contents faster for 2 hours, and 2) Snooze - essentially turns off the fridge so you can sleep easier (the sound is hardly noticeable though). ** Good # of outletsI probably only mention this because I had to rearrange furniture in the last Courtyard to find some. The lights on each side of the bed have an outlet, and there're 2 open outlets behind the couch. The rest are where you'd expect them to be.** Balcony with seatsIf you don't mind peering eyes (in the CONS section), my room overlooked the courtyard and West End. Has 2 seats and a small table, perfect for drinks.** On premise StarbucksI think it's only open during the daytime, though.CONS** Valet Parking is expensive & required.$22 a day! At least you can have them pull your car out at any time of the day, 24 hours.** North Tower 2 rooms face Tower 1 roomsThis means that you can see straight into their rooms and they can see straight into yours, if you have the curtains open. Oh, and the thin veil like curtains block nothing. I could still see straight into anyone's room if they only covered using that. Being on the 7th floor means you're higher than Tower 1, but Tower 1's top floor can still see in to your room. A little creepy...unless you're into that sort of thing.OTHER COMMENTSVanity area is kinda small, but it's detached from the bathroom, which is nice so that the mirror doesn't get all foggy when you're trying to shave after a shower.Decent location, but there was construction going on in the hotel and in the nearby area making it somewhat difficult to sleep at night. They do provide you with earplugs and a noise machine (if you request one), but for my super quick trip to Nashville, I just powered through it. They staff was super help and there are great amenities at the hotel. No room service made this tired traveler a little more weary, but it's not the end of the world.The shuttle service, provided free, moved the hotel from a two star to a three star.... The driver, Miller, was customer service to the 9! Took me to Walgreens and then wine shop ,) opened my doors each time,) Called before I came and spoke with the sales director, who seemed very helpful - but no luck finding her when I got here! Both receptionist seemed busy and annoyed.... When I asked if I could get a glass of wine, she said no even though I was told by sales director they have lounge and although it yet open, it would be no problem to open and serve before 6pm (which is 7pm est). The room was very nice. But once again, I went back to lobby andRoom is pricey but comparable to the other ones nearby. They charge you 16.00 dollars a day to park your vehicle. They have a free courtesy van to downtown till 10:45pm. Rooms are nice & clean. The free wifi sucks! & they want to charge for high speed which is crazy. Over priced & they charge for all the things that should be included for no extra.We stayed here for one night. The rooms were fine, the beds were comfy, and everything was clean, but man were those shampoo and conditioner bottles tiny! Like doll-house tiny.They charged us $20 including tax for self-parking in the garage, which was a little annoying.Overall, it suited our needs on our trip.Courtyard Marriott did not leave much of an impression on me. First off, I hate staying in hotels. I hate staying anywhere but in my own bed. Usually every hotel has a funky smell. Courtyard did not. I have to say that our hotel room was fresh and clean when we arrived, and I loved the pillows and the feel of the mattress to lay on. This was huge for me. The best translation of what my own bed is like at home. The staff was helpful. I needed shampoo and the front desk was all too willing to accommodate. I had a chance to meet the chambermaids, and they were just as polite. I happened to catch them before they were about to tidy our room and I told them to leave it alone. I have had their job, and it makes no sense that they should have to make my bed for me while I stay there. My friend wasn't around when I talked to them so when we got back from our Nashville adventure he looked upset. I explained but he still seemed a little irritated. In a way, it made me more happy because I don't like it when men think things like this should be done for them at all. Even if they are on vacation. I kept my amusement to myself. I also don't want people I don't know around my things. Even if they aren't important, I don't want anyone to invade my space and so much as move a bag in order to make my bed. I'm glad I was there to stop them. My friend just wanted to jump into his bed like Superman. Apparently you cannot do this on a messed up bed. My only complaint about the hotel would be the bar. They charged and exorbitant amount, $11, for a shot of Grand Marnier to be tossed into my margarita. The mix they used was terrible, and the liqueur makes it taste better. We also tried to order an amaretto stone sour (my childish travel partner likes fruity drinks), and they didn't even have the right liquor to mix it. As far as I knew an amaretto stone sour was a pretty common drink. The bartenders themselves were sweet; but they couldn't mix drinks at all. They couldn't even improvise well when it came down to trying to make up for what their bar lacked. In my opinion, if you're going to charge $11 for a shot of liqueur at all; then you better have the kind of bar equipped to handle all requests. Including mixologists.
review_content_20: What I can say - this is a Marriott. I was given a room with a king bed and a sofa. There is free wifi, but no free meals. This hotel is convenient for those visiting Vanderbilt, as the campus is only 2 blocks away (walkable distance). You can tell in the hallways and the bathroom the hotel has seen better days. It's a bit old and somewhat musty & dingy. If you are going to do the self-parking, let the front desk know so that they can put you in a room in a building closest to the parking garage. I don't know the fee because they didn't charge me. [I don't know what it is with the last three hotels not charging me the parking fee, but I am not complaining!]   Would I stay here again? Probably. It is convenient to where I need to be for work, and there are enough restaurants within the area to explore.We were early to check in, and to our surprise, our room was actually ready. This definitely set the tone for our entire stay. The hotel was clean, and seemed to be somewhat newly renovated. The staff would always greet you and ask how you were. Morale seemed to be high. The hotel is in a good location. 4 blocks max. to get to a decent bar. There's also several food places (not just fast food) around. I would definitely continue to stay here!Typical Courtyard Marriott.Pros: Great locationFriendly StaffComplimentary coffee in the lobby.Cons:King bed seemed to be breaking down very shaky Some might not like $16 parking but no biggie.Pros:Newly renovated facilityNice comfy bedsCentral AC and Heat$5-7 taxi ride to downtownRight across the street from the 1808 grill, which has yummy breakfastFriendly StaffIn the rooms they have Paul Mitchell shampoo (which I love, so it was my pro)Self-parking (free.... I never got charged for parking, so I have no clue if this has recently changed or what, but we did have an employee discount) Valet parking if you want to payGive AAA discountsCons:The shuttle bus broke down on us and was running late a lot. It seemed like everytime we wanted to try taking it, it was already full or it took 20-30 minutes to even get there. I wouldn't rely on this for transportation, but only as a perk if you happen to catch it.I am usually pleased with marriott hotels This one exceptional because of the well trained helpful friendly staff Valet esp friendly.  Man with vacuum turned it off as we passed and spoke.  The little touches can make a place stand outI would not recommend this hotel to anyone. I'm in the 2nd tower and this is the 2nd room I've moved to. I moved because the original room smelled like 70 football players left their socks in my room. The 2nd room smelled the same way. Disgusting. I would never stay here again.Beware of staying here on the weekends if you are planning to sleep.  When we checked in I thought it odd that the were two pairs of earplugs on the desk in our room in the second building of this hotel.  Turns out that our room is facing an open air bar about two blocks away that has live music on its rooftop deck until closing time on Fri/Sat nights.  Would have been a key piece of information to have had when I made the reservation and/or checked in.  No mention on hotel website or from front desk personnel at check inOtherwise, hotel is newly renovated and staff is very friendly.  Would stay here again, but only Sunday through Thursday.I'm a Marriott woman. I am an elite member, I only stay at Marriotts, and I love Marriotts. However, I will never ever stay in this one again. The staff was really nice and that rate was right and it's two blocks from Vanderbilt's campus. However, there were bugs. Not the cute kind, either. The cockroach kind that climbs around on the seventh floor so you know it's bad. And the unidentifiable black bug on your white pillow kind. Totally grossed me out. I'll still stay with Marriott hotels, but not this one.First time in Nashville, stay at the Marriott. Staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and spacious for the two if us. Comfortable bed.My wife and I were in town for the St. Jude Country Music Half-Marathon, and let me tell you, the Courtyard is the business.  They are good.  Damn good.  And when I say they are good, that won't cover it.We encountered zero negative employees.  Normally you can find someone disgruntled at a hotel, or maybe having a bad day, but that didn't happen here.  I kept wondering if I was royalty or something.  We were greeted with swag bags from the happiest front desk staff ever to grace a hotel lobby.  They offered a free shuttle to and from the expo as well as the same shuttle service to and from Broadway.  And one of the driver's knew so much about the city he was like a tour guide!  The morning of the race, they started their continental breakfast at 4:30 a.m.  When we got back from the race, the staff offered their congrats and even had iced bottled water and Gatorade.  When we found out our floor was out of ice, someone brought up two small bags so my wife could ice her knees after the run.Wait, did I mention the bed?  Joker comfortable!  And the pillows delivered upon the wings of angels.  My only complaint, if I could call it that, was the lack of a small fridge in the room.  All of the positives far outweighed that.So you aren't a runner and are just in town, none of this running crap matters to you.  But a hotel that extends that kind of service on a consistent basis will surely extend that to anyone else, runner or not.  The stellar service we received from this hotel was so spectacular that we would not even consider another hotel the next time we are in the area.Its simple: the Courtyard wrote the manual on customer service this weekend and has set the bar pretty high.Valet team was fantastic!This place is fantastic! Cheery staff, helpful & pleasant drivers, great shuttle. I was nervous reading reviews *after* booking, especially during BNI & CMA week. We are very pleased thus far. Apparently the hotel has been updated recently. Will stay here again.I was underwhelmed by this hotel and felt that it was less nice than other Courtyards I have stayed in.  I booked this as my husband was trying to work on his Marriott points and it was close to the event we needed to attend.  I would categorize myself as a seasoned traveler and have stayed in accommodations of all types from very luxurious to youth hostels and everything in between and I feel I have a pretty good idea of what you get for your money in a hotel these days.  This rate was not high to me, but it was very high for the quality of the hotel.  It did not feel clean, it was noisy, and the lobby was always really crowded which made me not want to sit in it.  When we checked in there were a bunch of guys checking in with cases of Bud Light which perhaps explained the late night noise in the hallways?  We stayed in the second tower and the room was tired looking and kind of smelly.  I asked my kids to wash their hands as we were heading out to dinner right away and my daughter dropped the wet bar of soap on the carpet.  When I picked it up it had several hairs of varying colors and textures which did not happen to resemble anything on our heads, unfortunately.  The bathroom tile had yet another color of hair on it, again not ours.  It made me wonder if they ever vacuumed?!  The bed was terribly uncomfortable and after two nights I couldn't wait to get home.  To underscore the rather unpleasant stay, when we got our guest folio the rate was higher than what I had booked.  When I inquired, they told me the government rate had changed as of October 1st.  Since we had checked in the 3rd and I was not made aware of this I felt that the nice thing to do would have been to honor the agreed upon rate.  If I did not have a government rate and they tried to increase it without letting me know there is no way I would have paid it so I am not sure why attributing it to the government increase made it OK to them, but I didn't feel like arguing.  The fact is that they lost a customer, at least at Courtyard locations, over all of the above.  The rate thing was just kind of the cherry on the top of the rest of a marginal experience.  On a positive note, Nashville is a very fun city and we had a great visit despite the mediocre hotel.  I saw that someone else had written that if you have a car there is no need to stay at this hotel and I would agree with that.  Apparently one of their amenities is free shuttle service.  If you don't use that I am not sure what would make anyone stay here. There are plenty of other options.  Oh and if you decide to stay here despite my marginal review of the place, make sure you check your rate again if you book in advance.  I booked far in advance and when I went to double check the hotel address I noticed that they were advertising a much lower rate as the date got closer.this is just OK. nothing great but nothing bad. this place MUST get renovated by marriott in the next few years otherwise its going to look like a dump. had to stay here because nashville was sold out. they have a bar near the lobby but this entire place just looks old, not bad, just old. just gets the job done but not as good as many other courtyards ive been to. also this doesn't have the new food lobby design as many of the newer ones do. good location thoughGreat rooms, friendly staff, great service. As a bonus, there is a pool and jacuzzi area on the 5th floor. Rooms were nothing over the top - but all you should be able to expect in a hotel in a major city. Clean beds and bathroom, serviced daily. No sprawling views of the city as you are closer to Vanderbilt's campus than actual downtown. There is complimentary coffee all day, a shuttle service that runs every 15 minutes that can take you to downtown. Valet is quick, accessible, and relatively inexpensive for a city (think Boston or NYC). Hot or cold continental breakfast is served until 11 for $10 and $7, respectfively. When I go to new places I'm really only looking for a place to lay my head. The friendly and accomodating staff, open pool and jacuzzi, bonus of a shuttle service, and decent breakfast (although NOT complimentary) raised my expectations.Stayed here for the CMAs in November 2010. Overall, I think three stars is pretty accurate.There's nothing wrong with the hotel - I don't have any real complaints. As a business traveler who stays in tons of hotels each year, it takes a lot for me to be blown away by a hotel. The rate here was decent, the staff was friendly, and my room was spacious (enough). The whole setup with the two different sections of the hotel, each with their own elevator bay, was a little strange and confusing, but you get used to it.I'm not a Marriott person normally (I like Hiltons), but my Marriott friends assure me this is probably the worst Courtyard they stay at each year, so I'm not judging Courtyards based on this one. I'd stay here again if I had to, but if given a choice, I'd go one block away to the Hampton Inn.Staff is very accommodating and made our stay comfortable. We utilized the shuttle to get downtown for dinner and bar hopping at night, and getting a cab back was easy. The rooms are typical for a courtyard, but it was worthwhile for us to save some $ by staying here rather than a hotel closer to the bars on broadway.My friends and I stayed here for the Nashville Marathon. Starting at check in, the staff was super friendly and welcoming. The hotel even provided a gift bag for runners as well as Gatorade and water when we got back from the race. The shuttle was a nice bonus to take and pick us up from the expo and restaurants. It was raining race day, and the hotel even had ponchos for us. Courtyard went above and beyond! I will definitely stay here again when I'm back in town!I visited my cousin in Nashville and stayed at this Marriott.  It had the most comfortable bed that I have ever slept in. Ever. I dream of it.  I try to recreate it at home.  It isn't the same.  5 stars for that bed.Definitely one of the best Marriotts I have stayed in. The location is great. Just a very short drive to downtown, around the corner from music row, and easy access to major highways. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Nice view from the 8th floor. And the breakfast buffet rocks - biscuits, gravy, sausage, bacon, eggs, waffles, potatoes, fruit, and the typical continental breakfast fare. Try to book a rate that includes free breakfast. The service is phenomenal. Everyone who works here is super nice. It's the only hotel I have ever stayed at that calls you to make the room is okay and up to your standards after you check in and get to your room. Would not have a problem staying here again.
review_content_40: I stayed here for 1 night back in May, meeting with a friend for lunch the next day and going home to Kentucky after that, I was waited the last minute booking this hotel room, and because I thought I only going to stay one night, I'm not going to spend $200 or$300 for a 4 or 5 stars hotel room, and I wish I did spend that $200 or $300, because this is way lower category Courtyard than I expected. I got there very late on Friday night, the staff is friendly, I checked in without problem, of course I was really tired after working all day and flying over a bad storm and finally landed in Nashville. So I got to my room, which is really dark in there, not much lighting, and my view was a dumb gas station of the lovely BP, which I don't care much for it anyway, it was late, I'm ready to take a shower, eat something and head to bed, unfortunately the hotel do not have room service, so I have to call a locate delivery, the room I stayed at is very old, looks like haven't been update for a long time, the tv is not flat screen, didn't know people still using those big box tv, the bed wasn't that comfortable either, I laid on the bed for a little bit, and I started felling a little itchy on my back, so I got up and check and to make sure they're no bed bugs, which I didn't see any, but I see the bed sheet wasn't really that clean, so I put another sheet to cover it, didn't have much sleep, I was so tired. The next day, I was about to meet my friend at the restaurant approx .08 mile from this hotel, and I was going to call me a cap, but the front desk told me they have a free shuttle van taken people up to 2 miles from the hotel, and she can call and see where he's at, they told me he was only 10 minutes away, 10 minutes passed by, 15 minutes later, I asked, is the van going to show up soon? I'm late for my lunch reservation. 5 more minutes she said. 10 more minutes passed by, still no van, and I asked again, if the van not going to show up, just please call me a taxi cap, I don't care about the money, I just need to get there. Front desk lady called again to the van, and the driver got angry saying he is on the way and will get there when he's get there. I walked outside and looked around for cap, and saw the van pulling up, I jumped in and told him to take me to the restaurant, he don't look so happy, either am I, if you travel to Nashville, and you're on the budget, you probably can stay here, just don't expect what I expect, but if you like more luxury like I am, go to Marriott, is just about 1 mile away or the Hutton Hotel which is across the street, the reviews looked very good

review_content: This location is pretty good for being in Nashville, not too far from all the action but not so close that you can't get some sleep! The staff were excellent and super professional throughout the stay. They get 5 stars on the professionalism of the staff. Other Yelpers have mentioned the greatness of the breakfast available here and I can say that things were not exaggerated. Sausage and eggs. Gravy and biscuits. Fresh Fruit and Yogurt. Waffles and oatmeal. Cereal and pastries. Coffee, tea, juice, milk...it's all here! There are also several times a day when there are other goodies, like cookies, hotdogs, lemonade, and other things.The rooms were clean and comfortable and there is a decent workout facility and a heated pool. Be warned though the price was not cheap around $300 for the night but then again all the hotels there in downtown Nashville are not cheap. I will certainly stay here again when Im back there.Great place to stay.  Lower rates than other hotels in the area.Very clean and friendly staff.We arrived very early from our flight.  Got to the hotel @ 9AM.  We were hoping to drop our bags off and explore.  We were blown away to find that they had our room ready!Simply the most comfy bed of all time.  Massive king with soft pillows to match.Our room didn't have much of a view but the hallway window overlooked the city.Location was key.  We went for an event at Bridgestone arena.  This hotel is literally a block away.  The SoBro bar district wasn't much further.  Plus tons of great restaurants & attractions nearby.Breakfast was unreal.  Biscuits, eggs, bacon, sausage, homemade waffle maker, cereal oatmeal, on and on and on.  Plus they slightly changed it up every morning.  They also would randomly have snacks laid out.  Free cookies and moz sticks!A couple of pretty bad hiccups:The shower was awful.  Water pressure and temperature kept changing.  And I slipped multiple times.  I ate $h1t so bad the last time I fell that my big toe was purple the next day.  There was a bar to hold onto but this was the most hazardous shower of all time.And one of nights past midnight, the fire alarm went off.  No big deal but it took over an hour for them to figure out how to shut it off.  Plus we didn't have power until around 4AM when the lights of course kicked back on to wake you up.  I wasn't overly ticked off but had my flight been the next morning I could see this review going a little different.That wouldn't scare me away from staying again.A pricey stay (parking's not cheap either), but definitely worth it.  Clean, quiet room and very friendly staff.FULL GODDAMN BREAKFAST.  This cannot be undersold - they had basically everything you could want from a hotel breakfast.  The lobby was packed full of German tourists eating it all, but the staff was on top of it - changing out coffee pots, getting more biscuits, everything.  2 short blocks away from all the cool places on Main and Church and all that, so while parking is pricey, you can rest assured your car is safe in an underground lot while you listen to Johnny Cash Impersonator #242.This was a great place to stay. We are diamond members so we got an upgrade to the top floor and you see that round thingie on front? Yeah, that's the balcony that runs all the way from your front "conference room" to your kind bedroom with whirlpool tub and shower. Okay enough bragging about being a cheapass and getting free upgrades. I agree that the front desk seemed slow, but the hotel was clean and nice inside. Breakfast was nice with hot and cold options, waffle maker, etc. etc. Very busy. And this review shall be known as "the one where we find out that we would not thrive in downtown housing." Starting at 5:30am it was train horns, cars, car horns, etc. It's only a six floor hotel so it was especially loud in my opinion. Not their fault, but just be aware that if you're on that nice front round thingie (yeahhhh free upgrade!) you might not be sleeping in.Good hotel but I can hear the banging of construction as I sit here writing this. It's 730a on a Wednesday.If not for that metal to metal clang, this hotel is great. Quieter than the one we stayed at last night. We could hear people talking and stomping around due to thin walls:(Spent 4 nights here while attending a convention at a nearby hotel. I was extremely satisfied with my entire stay.   Everything was very clean. Room was nice and temperature was controlled by individual thermostat so it can be easily adjusted. Towels were high quality and absorbent. No tub; only walk in shower but plenty of hot water. Complementary Full breakfast, including waffles, biscuits & gravy, oatmeal and more!   Also complementary was coffee & tea anytime.  Every evening light snack and fresh cookies were again complementary. Room included a frig, coffee  & small microwave. Staff was very friendly. Would definitely stay here again.Delicious breakfasts and snacks, friendly staff, and very clean rooms.Location location location...very conveniently located next to Omni Hotel and Music City Center.Check-in desk is understaffed...two people working during peak check-in times means long wait time standing in line.  Complimentary cookies in the snack area are a plus...they are tasty!  Flavored syrups are available to try to jazz up the Hampton Inn coffee.  The free breakfast area is jammed in the morning...there is lots of seating, and turnover is quick.  You probably will have to wait in line to make your own waffles though.Standard hotel room was pretty spacious and clean.  The king bed was definitely a feather comforter away from being a Heavenly bed, but it was comfortable and I slept pretty well.  Bathroom had a large shower and large vanity...was great!  The mini fridge did make a buzzing sound all night long, so I listened to music with headphones....which also helps since being in downtown Nashville, street and neighboring hotel guests can also be loud.In this day and age of electronics, there should be an in-room safe.  I felt safer carting my items back to lock up in my car's trunk than to keep it hidden and unlocked in the hotel room.Small parking deck with just two floor...I squeezed my car into the last available spot on the bottom floor, after accessing with a red key card that the front desk gives you....self parking is $19 + tax per night. There is a small elevator that accesses the lobby, but then you have to go to another elevator to get up to your room.  Safety, I guess.Had a great stay here, walking distance from Broadway in downtown Nashville, the Hampton Inn is clean, well cared for and a bit on the pricey side.You do get what you pay for, but be prepared to pay $250 a night.Breakfast buffet was awesome, some days they need more seats than they have but that's a small complaint. Friendly staff, lots of extras and clean, comfortable rooms are the norm.When we booked our reservation here, it was based on price and proximity to SoBro. I will start with my complaint, since I have only one. They charge $19 a night to park in their garage. Now I understand that parking in downtown Nashville is expensive, but hotels should make parking complimentary. With that said, the hotel was way better than expected. The room was typical, clean, nothing fancy. Where this hotel shines is its breakfast. It is amazing and complimentary. It almost balanced out the parking. Eggs, sausage, biscuits & gravy, waffles, fresh fruit, cereals. I actually looked forward to it each morning. The lobby is spacious and comfortable and the location is just a couple of blocks from the honky tonk row and right across the street from the country music hall of fame.Nicest Hampton Inn anywhere, great location and super staff!  I stay in a lot of Hilton Hotels and was extremely impressed with this Hampton Inn.  The hotel was very nice, with a large and interesting lobby designed with spaces to mingle, TV gathering areas and quieter spots to read. The lay out allowing many different groups to have their own space.  The decor was interesting and welcoming - more of a warm feeling than most. The staff was friendly and very helpful.  Rooms were clean, fresh and ready when they were supposed to be.  The breakfast was an expanded, huge southern breakfast style buffet.  This breakfast had many more options than most breakfast included hotels - there was even a make your own pancake bar with a variety of toppings, grits and oatmeal, two types of eggs.  Excellent!  The pool area was very nice as well.  The location is very close to downtown restaurants, offices and events as well as the convention center. I walked everywhere.  Self parking is $20 and valet $24.  The valet was very efficient and friendly.  In a class of its own - you should definitely try out this Hampton Inn on your next Nashville trip!  I will certainly be back!!Excellent locationVery friendly and helpful staffFree breakfast both warm and cold with healthy optionsVery close to walking and running paths2 blocks from the action (still quiet though) and 1 minute off the highway. I would certainly stay here again.I didn't stay at this one, but Don the manager went way out of his way to help me. If you have any issues talk to him.Excellent location and staff was friendly and helpful.  Rooms were clean and well kept.  Breakfast is provided daily with your stay and they have a great setup with an awesome spread of food.  They also have snacks in the afternoon too.  Loved this place.I stayed here with a group of girls for my sisters Bachelorette party.  It was a great location because we could walk to Broadway as well as other attractions downtown.They have complimentary breakfast in the morning, which was clutch for us.My only issue was that they needed to put a charge on someone's card for the room when we checked in.  This was an issue because of the large amount for multiple rooms for a long weekend that would ultimately be split up between all the girls.  I've been to hotels where they'll hold your card or charge you something to be sure the card works but I've not had to put the entire amount on my card before checking out.If I would have known that before, I would have planned ahead.I will absolutely stay here again when I go down to Nashville with friends.Stayed in a king room for two nights in December 2013. The location is great, it is directly across the street from the Country Music Hall of Fame and a few blocks from Broadway making for an easy walk to and from the bars and restaurants.  The staff was helpful and friendly and offered suggestions for dinner.  They have free breakfast in the mornings, and there was a lot of variety, including a waffle maker and grits (welcome to the South!)  They offer self- parking in a garage underneath the hotel but it is a little pricey ($19/night).My only complaint with the room itself was that the sheets kept popping off the corner of the bed, which seems like should not happen in a hotel.  Other than that, it was comfortable and although I wished for a bathtub, we had everything we needed.I am VERY picky about hotels and was very nervous about staying in this hotel. The Yelp reviews helped calm my nerves, but I was still bracing myself for the worst... This place got 5 stars from me almost immediately. They provided great service, a great room & bathroom, and an overall very clean hotel. Their complimentary breakfast is far from continental (waffles, danish, bagel toppers, biscuits & gravy, etc). I kept looking for areas to critique, but I couldn't find anything... even the hotel decor is great. Plus a nice business center with free printing and free wi-fi for guests.To top it off the hotel is located near the heart of downtown Nashville - everything is in walking distance. I was there for 4 days and only used a cab from the hotel to airport. It was a GREAT stay and I plan on staying in this hotel whenever I return to Nashville.Wow, i've got to say that I was thoroughly impressed with this hotel! I'm almost sad that we only stayed here for one night. The beds were super comfy, the rooms were spacious, clean, the shower and tub was large, the showerhead was awesome, the television was nice and modern, breakfast served in the morning--- what more could you ask for? The parking is located right below the hotel in a parking garage and only for guests, therefore parking is easy breezy.Located in walking distance to all the bars and eating spots on broadway. We had a blast, and staying at this hotel made our one-night stay in Nashville a no-fuss quick get away.Would definitely choose to stay here again if I were ever in the area.I would like to give this 4 stars but there is no bar compared to other hotels for around the same money. Reception and check in was uneventful and nice staff and the rooms are nicely done with crisp linens. It's a few minutes walk from the convention center and down town so very convenient.Breakfast is great with a good selection of the usual. The WIFI works really well around the whole hotel and its free. This is a great hotel for your Nashville stay, sometimes it would be nice to get a quiet drink away from the crowds but as I say no bar. If your not looking for that you'll be happy.The staff are great, I didn't use the pool but it looked good.  Enjoy Nashville.Can't beat the price or the location.  It is convenient to walk all around the city.  The amenities are great! The staff was very helpful.  I love that parking was free.  Hot, freshly baked cookies and lemonade in the afternoon as well as a DELICIOUS free breakfast makes this a very comfortable  stay.
review_content_20: I visited Nashville for the first time this week, and I'm so glad I chose this Hampton Inn! I stayed with a friend for two nights, and both of us were thrilled with the quality of the hotel and the  proximity to the downtown area. Our room was clean and comfortable, and the beds were extremely comfortable. We took advantage of the complimentary breakfast each morning, which was delicious and included great coffee, biscuits and gravy, pastries, eggs, and fresh fruit. The to-go cups for coffee were a really nice touch. Although there was construction across the street, the workers seemed to keep the noise to a minimum in the early morning hours. The hotel is a quick walk to Broadway's bars and shops. However, downtown Nashville does have a fair amount of drifters, and we did feel uncomfortable one afternoon as we walked back to the hotel and felt as though we were being followed. As two women who have lived in Boston and New York, we were familiar with being cautious in the city and felt it would be smarter to take a cab for the rest of our trips downtown. We could have been overly cautious, but it was worth the $4 cab ride for peace of mind. This was obviously out of the hotel's control, so it doesn't affect my rating- just a tip!We spent the second half of our trip at the Opryland Resort, and we were much more satisfied with the comfort and value of the Hampton Inn. I will definitely stay here again on my next trip to Nashville!The worst possible experience from a Hampton Inn I've had yet. The atmosphere is that of entitlement. That we are lucky to be staying at their hotel. The food was horrible compared to other Hampton Inn's I've been to, and you had to argue quite a bit to get any help from the front desk. They also charge $20 a day for self parking and you receive over $35 a day just in room taxes. For the exact same amount of money, go literally across the street to the Omni Hotel.This place was awesome. Kid friendly plus fantastic staff. Walking distance to the district and great breakfast3/5 alrightso this is a great spot if you can swing it because it's just 2 blocks from broadway and pretty close to most everything else. the rooms are ok for the kind of establishment that it is. i did like their breakfast offerings, which came with our rooms. ever try whipped yogurt? it's kinda weird.First time staying at Hampton inn. Beautiful hotel and clean! Very good service and friendly staff. Best free hotel breakfast I ever had. Phenomenal!!!!!Convenient.  Staff is excellent, room is nice.However, construction noise starts at 6:00 a.m.  Heater is flat insufficient and fan comes on and off, making sleep impossible.  Comes on and off continuously and room is always cold.Thermostat appears to be limited, which keeps it coldI have several reservations here for future events and I am changing hotels.  This is just too much noise and too cold.Swimming pool isn't open until 8 a.m., which means no morning swim.  I have never seen a pool open this late.Very poor tv channels selection.  A major reason I won't be back.Bad overall experience. When we arrived, they didn't have the suite, we had reserved. The manager fortunately "found" a suite similar to what we wanted. The prices were significantly increased because of the Houston Half Marathon. The biggest disappointment was when we realized how incredibly noisy the place was. We stayed on the 4th floor and had to enjoy every motorcycle, car and partygoer passing down below on the street. We could not understand how it's even possible to get a hotel approved in downtown Nashville where high noise level would require much better insulation.  The rooms were otherwise clean and nicely furnished. Will not go back.4.5 stars actually. Was able to get a room here last minute through Hotwire at a very decent price considering the beautiful accommodations and location. It is a comfortable, highly stylish and super clean hotel just a few short blocks from all the action on 2nd Ave and Broadway. They have the best breakfast spread I have ever seen at a hotel included in the price; different styles of eggs, sausage, delicious fresh hot biscuits, make your own waffles and fruit just to name a few things. We also enjoyed some time in the large indoor pool and hot tub. Our room was extremely nice and spotless, the bed was very comfortable, but the part that knocked the half star for me was that I called and requested a King bed and they assured me I had it and when I got there I did not and they told me none were available. When I contacted customer service when I got home, they never responded.Out sanding everything! Walk into this lodge to wonderful service and a warm atmosphere. The valet gives great tips and directions and the rooms are large and comfortable. Best Part? All the great fun areas of downtown Nashville are within walking distance...bars, restaurants, stadiums, concert venues, everything! I say Nashville is a must visit town for anyone either single or married and this Hampton helped my wife and I celebrate our most memorable anniversary to date!Stay for a short stay over labor day weekend, hotel is in a perfect location 2 blocks from Broadway, across the street from the Country Music Hall of fame.  Hotel was very clean and presentable, rooms were spacious with a large bathroom.  Free Breakfast was a good treat and plenty of items to choose from.  Staff was nice and helpful.  Construction around the area was not an issue.Nice staff. Although we didn't stay there, they let us use the bathroom with no issues.Great location, not-too-shabby complimentary breakfast, and comfy beds = happy stay!If you're looking for somewhere to stay in Nashville and want to be close to everything without being right in the midst of everything, Hampton Inn and Suites is the answer to your dilemma. I loved the room -- super comfy beds but if you're looking to sleep in, keep in mind that the drapes don't close all the way. Hampton Inn and Suites is definitely on my short list of hotels to stay at on any future visits to Nashville!This is why I love yelping places on my phone because I can read reviews before I dare try something out.  On a road trip with my family from VA to CA (SD to be exact) we needed places to crash on the whim that was reasonably price but still comfy.  Never been to TN so obviously we kind of needed help in searching for a place.  Thank goodness for my phone and thank goodness I love yelping.This place is pretty awesome.  The rooms were big and extremely comfortable.  I asked the lady in the front if they have room service and as she mentioned that they did not I felt my heart sink.  We were all tired and hungry from traveling, so I kind of felt let down.  However, after she politely told me they had no room service available she also mentioned that there are plenty of restaurants nearby that deliver to your room.  TO YOUR ROOM! WHHHHA?  How awesome is that?!?  So we were able to chose from a wide variety of restaurants that delivered straight to our door...sometimes I still can't believe it.  I guess I'm not used to that but it reminds me of something that would take place in NY or something.  It's probably cause people around me are lazy or busy but either way I loved the fact that something other than pizza can deliver to your doorstep.For all that we got it was a good price as well.  Especially since we called when we were about 30 mins away asking for a room for the night.  The only flaw was that there was so much construction going on around the hotel and the surrounding streets that it was difficult to maneuver, but we did make it and that's all that matters.  Plus it's not really the hotel's fault that there was construction going on.  I took away a star for the towels that were not as soft as I prefer them and the fact that after I showered the water made a little flood in the bathroom.  No biggie I guess, just used the not so wonderful towel to fix it. :)PERFECT location!  5 minute walk to the main "strip(s)".  Next door to the convention center which is under MAJOR construction but, I didn't notice an noise or disruption at all (our room was on the opposite side of the building from the convention center).Our room was very clean and the bed was SUPER comfortable!!!  Nice bathroom with an actual shower, instead of the cramped tub/shower at many chain hotels.We paid an additional $18.00 for overnight secured covered parking...Well worth the price for the peace of mind leaving our car in downtown Nashville!I didn't have the free breakfast...too busy sleeping, and didn't use any other amenities, but I was very pleased with everything else!!!!On the pricier side for a Hampton Inn, but after staying there...I felt that the price was warranted!Great experience!We just stayed here for a weekend getaway and were thrilled with this Hampton Inn.  From the valet to the front desk and every other staff member we encountered, they were warm and extremely accommodating (we were kind of high-maintenance guests).  We were originally in a room on the construction side and requested a change.  They actually moved our stuff for us so that we could head out and enjoy the city and not have to wait for a room to become available.I always find that Hampton Inn's are just fine.  They are clean and reliable and you usually know what you're getting.  This one was nicer than most, with nice large rooms and bathrooms.  And yet the price was still very reasonable.We will absolutely stay here again if we return to Nashville, and you should, too!We stayed here in October. It was really loud. College kids walking by making a lot of noise kept us up for awhile at night. Then we woke up at 6am to the constuction going on across the street on the new convention center. It was louder than we expected. I wouldn't stay here until the construction is done. Loud beeping, machines--you are virtually sleeping in a construction site. There are other Hilton hotels in Nashville. I accidentally left something in my room--my bad--but the management didn't return my calls, so I didn't know whether or not they were able to retrieve it. After I called corporate to let them know about their lack of reply, their follow up was not professional. Even after the construction is over, I'll stay away from there. But seriously, wait until the convention center is completed before sleeping at this hotel.Clean rooms and friendly staff. We were passing thru town and we had no trouble finding a room at a reasonable price. The complimentary breakfast was awesome!  We will return in the futureThis place was reasonably priced with the perfect location.  We were within just a few blocks of downtown, which was totally walkable.  Our spacious room had two queens which was perfect for three girls.  We had plenty of space to keep our suitcases and get ready without standing on top of each other.  We had rented a car for our trip but we didn't need to visit the Ryman, Country Music Hall of Fame, and the bars on Broadway.  We could also safely walk back to our hotel after a night out which was great since we could save on cab fare.  You could probably find a cheaper place farther out but who wants to worry about parking or catching a cab.  After gorging yourself on delicious Nashville bites and a few drinks ( BBQ and coronoritas in my case), why not get in some heart healthy exercise?My wife and I stayed here in July 2012. We were in the most expensive suite they offer-$300+ per night. Though the suite was roomy there was no glassware at he bar. There was "paper cup ware" and the mattress was worn out, I.e., two ruts on for each sleeper.  Who wants a mixed drink out of a paper cup? The do-it yourself breakfast was ample. Plastic ware, paper cups, and paper napkins were in abundant supply.  I would've given hem one-star BUT the staff was excellent. So the staff get the bonus star. I've stayed places in large cities that were one-fourth the cost with better rooms and with GLASSWARE!Very impressed with this hotel. Great staff, great breakfast, quiet rooms with comfortable beds.
review_content_40: My wife and friends and I have been coming to Nashville and staying exclusively at the downtown Hampton for several years now, and they continue to impress me.  Just a few moments ago we had a potential snafu with booking dates and a certificate redemption.  After speaking with the very polite and friendly Dianne and David, not only was everything all taken care of, but we had a good laugh on the phone and my wife's birthday trip for a Beth Hart concert (rare in the U.S.) is all set!  Thanks again, this is why we stay.I stayed here for my vacation the first week of February. I definitely had a good experience. The people are great, as most in Nashville are. They have free parking and a hot breakfast included. They are very close to Broadway, which is downtown and where the honky tonks are. I am very happy I chose to stay here and would definitely stay here again.This would be the second Hampton Inn that I have stayed at in Nashville.  I make multiple trips here each year.  Since I discovered downtown Nashville as a great place for food and shopping I will not stay out near the Airport again.  This Hampton is priced right, very clean and the rooms are large. a short walk to multiple restaurants and live music!This is a brand new hotel, and it shows.  I've always been happy with Hampton Inn hotels and this one was no different.  We stayed here one night because the water in our house was cut off awaiting a plumber.The parking, underground, was very convenient and was provided with the cost of the stay.  The complimentary breakfast in the morning was the standard Hampton Inn breakfast of fruits, yogurts, etc.  I've always enjoyed their breakfast.The room was nice, with a good layout and a comfortable bed.  My one complaint would be that the heavy drapes wouldn't close over the window and our room looked over a parking lot with its lights shining brightly all night.The staff was friendly and attentive.  Admittedly, I didn't complain about the drapes - maybe I overlooked something...

review_content: The Good:Fresh. Hot. Breakfast....Complimentary. Need I say more? If you know me, you know I'm a breakfast gal. These guys have it down in spades. I also really like how the rooms are split into two rooms. It makes the sleeping area very private and separate, which is a good thing. The decor is pretty dang savvy. I like it. It's classy, like me! I love the happy hour.1730-1930=free drinks. But make sure you tip your friendly bartender. The fitness center is also impressive. It's bigger than most and features a hot tub and a sauna. Too bad I didn't bring my bathing suit :(. Love the bar/restaurant for a nightcap or a quick bite. Oh...and can I mention that the shuttle is awesome? I called down to get a shuttle to Kroger because I thought it was within the 2 mile radius that Embassy serves, turns out...it was 3.5 miles away. They took me anyways...and brought me back. It was super convenient, and I was so happy I didn't have to get an Uber.The Bad:The fridge doesn't have a freezer component. It's just a mini-fridge..and that's it. What in the ?? I bought frozen meals knowing that every mini-fridge has a small freezer portion...but not at Embassy. Wack. I'm sad that they don't have a beer/wine opener in the room..and the hotel I've been staying at in my Nashville adventures has a full fridge and plates, bowls, dishwasher, and utensils. So it was kind of letdown to see that Embassy just had a wetbar and a mini-fridge. Especially when you stay for a week at a time..as I do. The Verdict: I like Embassy. It has the bells and whistles many people like, while I think it's lacking in some areas for long termers like me...but that's because I stay for a week or more at a time. Where it lacks, it makes up for in other areas. Everyone is different and has different tastes...and I think this place meets many peoples wants/needs.This hotel has a major ant problem. There are ants crawling over every surface in our room. I asked another patron about it and was told that they stayed here over New Years and had the same problem. Apparently this is an ongoing issue that they aren't doing anything to remedy. I have also run water through the coffee pot in the room 3 times and each time I end up with black grainy spots in the bottom of the cup. I have stayed at the TownPlace Suites around the corner multiple times with no issue. Will definitely go back to staying there.Let me set the stage...I travel for work, a lot.
