I stay away from the comforts of home a lot. I know a great hotel, a not so good one, and then I know the Embassy Suites in Nashville. I want to believe it will be good, but it just never is. It's like they have sent every misfit Hilton Employee to this location, and every single one of them is missing the mark. Why am I entitled to say such things? Because I, myself am in the hospitality industry and I know what makes a good experience and a bad one. The people make or break your establishment and from the moment I walked into this perfectly situated yet sorry excuse for a dwelling I was ignored, over looked and simply made to feel like the staff didn't care. Check in was rude as rude can be. I was under my boyfriends room reservation, which I asked them to look at, but they insisted I was not added to the room. Yet low and behold when he called in, there I was, listed in the notes. Come on! A little effort and research would have saved both of us time! And first impressions stick with you! From there it just went down hill...Take their little "market" for example. Should your boyfriend get sick at night and need some pepto and a tylenol PM, you should be able to walk downstairs and acquire such items. The boxes were there, on the shelf, looking at me gleaming knowing that its contents was going to save my evening. But alas, the Embassy Suites staff has left two large boxes to sit empty on the shelf. EMPTY MEDICINE BOXES?!? Seriously? And surprisingly, or not, they didn't have any more in the back room. I do not blame the girl on the overnight shift at the front desk, she was very sweet and apologetic, but y'all are a team! Someone had to notice the damn supply was getting low! And frankly, things like this scream "We don't care about our guests." Made to order breakfast was advertised, and when I got there at 8:30, the omelette station and made to order eggs was closed. Y'all breakfast is served until 9:30! GET IT TOGETHER! I'll have a banana and some yogurt I thought, the hell you will said the Embassy Suites! We only serve green bananas to our guests! Serving inedible food says "We don't care!" For the love of fruit if your bananas came in from your supplier that way, run to the damn grocery store and get something EDIBLE for your guests until those ripen! The solutions are so simple and they continually just miss the mark.Attention to detail is a non-negotiable part of being a good hotel. How they are surviving in this part of town with places like the Lowes and Hutton, who aren't that much more expensive, baffles me. I really hope something positive comes from writing this review. I want nothing more than for people to succeed and they could be killing it and taking business from the afore mentioned, but then again, I doubt they have the energy to care about success, let alone read this lengthy review. Thanks Embassy Suites Nashville, you've shown me how little southern hospitality y'all have.This property has seen better days. It needs a face-lift and each room should be renovated and checked out.Check-in was easy and the desk clerk was pleasant. Our room was a basic early 2000 or late 90's style room. The TV was updated but they need to work through the basics to get it to a level where we would want to stay again.We selected valet parking since their lot is a pain to get in and out of plus there was only a $4 difference from self parking.The location is good and you can walk to numerous bars and restaurants. They have a shuttle that goes downtown and that was a definite plus.Breakfast was standard Embassy Suites fare. It opens at 7AM on weekends (I was still on Eastern time when I went down, no wonder they were looking at me funny and mentioned a couple times that breakfast opened at 7... I was there at 6AM. They were nice and let me get some obviously needed coffee).I don't think we'll stay at this property again as there are other updated Hilton properties in the general area in the same price range. Once they renovate we'll be back.I stayed here last weekend so I could watch my son play baseball at Vanderbuilt. The staff was very friendly with the exception of the night manager, I didn't catch his name but he was an extremely unhappy and unfriendly person. He might want to consider a career that doesn't require people skills. The overwhelmed lady working the waffle machine could have used a cup of coffee as well but the valets where amazing! They had recommendations for places to eat within walking distance and offered free shuttle rides all over town. I didn't even have to rent a car. The stand out however was Justin who worked the front desk. He was fantastic. We came in fairly late Friday night. He was by himself and he had a small crowd. He took care of all of us in a timely matter and addressed everyone's issues with a smile and professional attitude. He was very helpful the whole weekend. I found myself waiting to talk to him with any questions I had as the night manager was clearly not interested in helping with anything in any way what so ever. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfy. The cleaning staff were friendly and helpful as well.I would definitely go backClean! Great location to walk to restaurants. Awesome breakfast and cocktail hour. Spacious rooms. Friendly check in. Will be back.The good: Breakfast is pretty sweet; they have most things you can imagine including a few traditional southern favorites and omelets to order. They also have a free happy hour every night until 7:30. The staff is nice, but that might be because this is Nashville and everyone is nicer here than in Connecticut, where I'm from. The bad: This is my second night in this hotel. First night, we noticed our toilet was broken and didn't flush. We know a thing or two about toilets, so we opened the back and flushed it manually by lifting the plunger thing on the chain. We did this all night and requested that they fix it in the morning while we were gone. Got back in the evening and it was still broken. We said to just leave it because we are checking out in the morning .... But then while performing the manual flush technique, the chain in the back broke clean off and we can no longer manually flush it. Pretty annoying (and super gross). This is a nice hotel from the looks of it, but I was pretty disappointed in this stay (stayed once before a year ago and it was fine). Everything seems just a bit worn and grungy this time. Some ripped furniture, some things out of place, and just generally a dirty feeling. Also... Sandpaper pillowcases and towels. So noticeably that they're irritating to skin. And finally, as I lay in bed writing this review (at 11:10 PM), I can hear loud music from a restaurant or bar on the back side of the hotel (my room is located towards the back right). It's audible to the point where I can make out some of the songs being played and definitely very distracting if you're a light sleeper. Overall, definitely not staying here next visit. Disappointed in the service and the quality. Especially for the price.Embassy Suites Nashville - Vanderbilt A few months ago we stayed at the Embassy Suites and it was an interesting experience. We arrived and went to the bar downstairs, our bartender was more than friendly and we loved her! Our room was awesome- you can tell they have taken time to provide clean rooms for guests. The room was the best part. Breakfast is free in the mornings until 10:30 which is a pretty reasonable time. However, since we are gluten free, our options were limited. The eggs were sub-par, the bacon and sausage were pretty greasy but yummy, and the coffee was good! The area to eat downstairs is large and accommodating- we had a large group. The breakfast staff was very friendly at the suites. Our second night at the Ebassy suites took a turn for the worst when we were waiting for the complimentary shuttle to take us downtown. We were informed that we had to be put on the waiting list and reserve the shuttle but we were never offered a list. One of the shuttle attendants (didn't catch his name) was extremely rude. We complained to the front desk- the staff at the front desk is friendly and offers us a $20 Uber coupon and we decide to order an Uber instead of taking the shuttle. After we talked to the front desk, the shuttle attendant (same rude guy) came storming in saying he could have taken care of us but we decided to make other plans in more or less words. We were shocked as he raised his voice to us and got in a verbal argument with us! We were baffled. I have never experienced something like this in a hotel setting. Very unsettling. The next day we had a very late flight around 9pm so we wanted to pay for a half day. The late check out was 1pm and we were informed that a half day would be $125 and we could only stay until 3pm. The lady on the phone was rude and not understanding whatsoever. We definitely will not be staying in the Embassy suites any time soon, this experience totally turned us off.My room was huge and off the elevator. I kept the door to my bedroom closed just to feel intimate in my large bedroom space. The furniture was old fashion, not my favorite look. The staff was very helpful and professional. I would stay again.Just stayed here. Not overly impressed. Breakfast and happy hour was the best part. Service was poor, rooms in need of an update. Over a mile to honky Tonk and shuttle is nice but stops at 10pm. Wouldn't stay at Embassy again.Every room is a suite. It's kind of an Embassy thing.For this right-in-the-mix location of the Hilton offshoot, you get just that. The character and aesthetic are a bit archaic, so the trendy and hip-seeking may scoff at the digs. But the bed is comfortable, the suites are large and supremely clean, and there's a hot buffet breakfast with an omelet station. And for these things, I can forgive the sterile, 1980's Holiday Inn atmosphere.The location can't be topped. Astride Music Row, and in that sweet spot of midtown that puts you across the street from Hattie B's, and a block from Patterson House means dinner and drinks. Every night. Allthenights. Explore Vandy to burn off those unearned calories - that's why most of your suite neighbors are staying here. Pack black and gold.Self-parking in the attached garage (which is a nightmare to navigate) will run you $38 a day. So, load up on that comped bacon before the clock strikes 10am.I like this hotel, we stayed in room 1038. Clean, great omelet bar, great location, free happy hour 5:30-7:30, family friendly, love the ambiance of the atrium. What I don't like is that their beds are very HARD which makes it uncomfortable, but the bed linens are comfortable, including the soft pillows. Late night (after midnight), loud noises outside, screaming yelling, expensive parking $22 a day, despite the few dislikes, overall I like this hotel!This Embassy Suites is located in a great area in downtown Nashville. We really enjoyed being able to just walk out of the hotel and venture to numerous eating establishments without a problem. The Self parking is $18 and The Valet parking is $22. We opted for Valet and the service was excellent!The hotel is nice. They have the standard fare for an Embassy with the Manager's Reception and the breakfast. The room was very clean and cozy. I am not a big fan of noisy rooms and this room was noisy. Loud air conditioning and plumbing. Also, since the room is facing the busy downtown streets it was pretty loud. Our housekeeper was very brassy. So much so that I opted out of cleaning services during my stay. Yes. She was that brassy. Aside from that the hotel is in a good location, convenient if you have kiddos, and great value. It is not luxury by any means, but hey....its Embassy Suites. If you're looking for luxury....uhmmmm....this isn't it. I would stay here again if I was attending another conference in the area and had my daughter (the suite gave her space) but the Cool Springs Embassy is better IMO.I try to stay mainly at Hilton properties. For the price point in and around Vanderbilt and downtown Nashville, this is one of my favorite hotels. The staff is mostly very courteous and the rooms are clean. They have a great breakfast buffet or cooked to order omelettes.It is less than a five minute walk to a lot of great restaurants and only about a 5 to 10 minute drive, depending on traffic, to downtown Nashville and all of the great music on Broadway.The stay itself was great, the room was slightly dirty (first night we found toe nail clippings on the carpet...gross!)House keeping would want to come in at the most random times, two nights they didn't come in all day and then wanted to come in at night around 6.. breakfast was excellent, the nightly rate was average, closer to the high side, but that was fine.I was disappointed with management and the front desk when I had left the hotel. About two hours after leaving I discovered I had let my pillow there (I have a medical condition and purchased this ridiculously expensive pillow via recommendation from my chiropractor) after noticing I did not have it I called right away (we were driving and had been in the car for about 2 hours) the girl working took my room information, home address and said they would mail it to me and charge the card on file. After not receiving in a week or so later I called again. They had not found it, therefore did not send it. I explained I called only 2 hours later; around 9AM...Apparently the girl never even looked or put a note in the computer. I called and left a message with the manager and never received a phone call back. I called (again) and talked to the front desk and explained it was for a medical condition and they said they would ask the house keeping staff...again never heard back. Needless to say the stay was great, the aftermath was terrible, seeing as I come to Nashville about 6 times a year, it is safe to say they lost my businesstripadvisor.com/ShowUser...3 Stars because the staff was so nice and the location was perfect! They have a shuttle that you can reserve that will pretty much take you anywhere and its free (remember to tip!).The rooms were nice,.... except the mattress in our room we noticed on the last day had a GIANT mystery stain that looked like blood. It definitely wasn't wine.... wine does not turn brownish after it dries. It was sooooo gross. We didn't get a chance to try out the restaurant but the breakfast was free which was great but you have to expect not that great of food.Dated decor. Rooms are not soundproof (as in, I was awakened by the alarm set by the person in the room next door). Bed was saggy. Wifi was slow and didn't reach to bedroom, just living room area. Front desk staff was curt and did NOT go out of their way to help.I self parked because the valet didn't know how to drive stick. Breakfast was great! The woman making waffles and omelets had a smile for everyone!We just stayed here. It was very disappointing compared to the embassy suites we've stayed at before. The linens were scratchy. The WiFi was terrible and barely worked at all. The vallets were nice when we arrived. We had used the shuttle but when we needed picking up they didn't know where anything was and didn't even obey traffic laws. The breakfast was alright but cheaply made. Went to omellete and waffle part to get a waffle and they say they don't make those.. Even tho it says they do on the sign and I'm looking at the waffle iron. The complimentary drinks and snacks were nice. This place could use a pool or something to enjoy besides a tiny whirlpool. Pretty disappointing. Also paying $18 to park is ridiculous. Its also very noisy being by the street. Sounded like someone was moving furniture the entire night of our last night. Lots of things to work on. I didn't mind the outdated decor.I came upon this place because the hotel I was going to stay at was in an unsafe area and the reviews were mistaken. So luckily I was recommended this place and sight unseen we booked it. We were on our honeymoon and this place is the place you would expect to stay in on your honeymoon. We had gotten a suite which had 2 rooms in it. You walk into a sitting room with a pull-out couch, arm chair, tv, desk, office chair, small wet bar, mini fridge, microwave, coffee maker with coffee and tea. Then you walk through a small hall past the bathroom with a shower,bath,full vanity and toilet. Then our room had a bedroom with a door, closet, 2 queen beds, tv and makeup vanity with full sized mirror. The beds were very comfy and pillows were great and the sheets were clean. The whole suite was very clean and I am very particular about the cleanliness of my hotel rooms. Hotel itself is great every weekday they have a reception with wine and beer and snacks like chips and salsa for free from 5:30-7:30. It is a great idea but the snacks are kinda sad and they never have enough for the amount of people that show up. The breakfast at this place is unbelievable. They have your normal cereal and milk, fresh cut fruit, yogurt. Then they have scrambled eggs, potatoes, biscuits and gravy, bacon, sausage. They also have a lady cooking made to order omelets and waffles. On the side they have toast, muffins, donuts, english muffins and other pastries. Finally they have juice, coffee, milk, and sodas. They have plenty of room to sit the whole 1st floor is dedicated to eating and lounging. Services they offer are room service, exercise room with sauna and hot tub. laundry and self-laundry, in house restaurant and a small store for snacks and things you forgot. The hotel is also within walking distance from many restaurants and a fabulous cupcake shop. It is a great driving distance from downtown. I only gave it 4 stars because the wallpaper in our room was peeling and patched, the room had an annoying unidentifiable squeak noise and it cost $8.50 for Malibu rum and pineapple juice and the bartender is horrible. Also you have to pay $18 for parking a night and their parking garage is bad it has weird hills in it and the spots are so close together and really close to huge poles.The staff was friendly and the hotel lobby/atrium area was comfortable (love the ginormous fountain). The room was clean and spacious. The complimentary breakfast and happy hour was nice although they promoted "try our happy hour sliders" on screens throughout the hotel every day but it was always just chips and dips and a few veggies. Parking was convenient and we used the complimentary hotel shuttle a lot to get to/from Broadway. The biggest complaint: Our room never got cool in spite of having the air on 60 degrees and the fan on high. I probably wouldn't stay here again because we really needed a pool to cool off after wandering around Nashville but the price was right and it was convenient.
review_content_20: A/C was horrible. Toilet overflowed at  6am and no one could help. No pool. Hot tub was broken. Hotel needs repairs. TV channels weren't coming in. They didn't have quarters for anyone wanting change fir the washer or dryer. Water pressure in the shower was HORRIBLE. Breakfast was good. Carpet in bedroom was sticky. I don't recommend thus one.I stayed at this hotel for the third time the first week of May. When I stayed in February I noticed the internet was working and the tv/cable wasn't working very well. I made numerous phone calls to the front desk about the problem. I told them I had many people staying there in May for my daughter's graduation and since we would be working while we were there, it was imperative we have good internet. They told me they were having a complete overhaul of their internet service and it would be completed before my next stay. I did not change my reservation. What a mistake. I had my whole family arrive and the internet didn't work, or the tv cable system. I asked the front desk and they said that the overhaul had fallen through. We had trouble with the happy hour, the breakfast, the parking garage problems, one room was so hot we put wet washcloths by the bed to cool down, constant problems with one room with the keys, etc. etc. I was not going to stop all the festivities to call downstairs every time something happened because between all of our rooms, that would have pretty much have been all we would have done. My bill for my 2 of the rooms was almost $2000 and it was the worst hotel stay I have ever had at a Hilton hotel. I know alot about Hilton hotels because I am a diamond member and I stay in one almost every week. On my last day, the icing on the cake was when they said I couldn't have a diamond member late checkout. That is when I lost it and told the front desk clerk ALL the problems we had and all he said to me was, "Why didn't you tell us this during your stay?" I told him I wasn't going to put a damper on my daughter's graduation by calling down every 5 minutes but I would definitely want this passed on to a supervisor and have them contact me. Never heard a word from a supervisor. Not even a phone call, email, nothing. Mr. Scott Balmaseda, the General Manager, never contacted me, but finally responded to a negative review on Tripadvisor saying how hard is to get the internet fixed and how they are on a waiting list to get it, but that is not advertised anywhere on their site, plus he didn't address the hot rooms, the fact you had to have someone walk to the valet to get them to use their key to open the parking garage access because the keys didn't work, and the valet employees said it happens all the time and needs to be fixed.  He didn't address the breakfast area closing early on May 10th, even though it was Mother's Day.  He didn't address the cable tv not working, the fact that the evening happy hour had fritos and hot sauce, really?? and wouldn't give you a bloody mary because that was extra. Really?  This place is a rip-off.  As anyone can see from my reviews, this is not my average review.  I review great customer service as well.  I hate to hear of anyone losing their jobs but it is evident Mr. Balmaseda does not have the skill or maybe the heart to run this hotel.  Shame on you Mr Balmaseda.I like the Embassy Suites especially their delicious made-to-order breakfast. During this stay, my family was lucky to get a room tucked away in a corner so it was nice and quiet. The service that we received from everyone was good. The hotel is within a walking distance from Vanderbilt University and many local restaurants. I think I will encourage my son to apply to Vanderbilt just so I can come back here again.Update 7-31-14: as a result of their email survey, post stay, the manager contacted me and "made this right" and even asked if there were additional issues. Well done.  So with that level of customer care I would change this review to 4 stars. He took care of a loyal hilton customer.  I've stayed at this property three times; business and pleasure. This experience was sub par because the tv in the bedroom was crappy. It was fuzzy.  The remote didn't work and it only got a few channels.  They did repair or swap it out. There was a three  inch screw laying in the middle of the floor. And wow. Glad I saw it or it would have hurt like heck to step on.  I wasn't really bothered by the crumbs on the footrest till the other two incidents (tv and screw). So the attention to detail was lacking this trip.  On top of that the parking as others have noticed is ridiculously right be it a ford explorer or a Camry. I was aggravated after the screw and the messed up tv so the extremely tight Parking lot was icing on the cake because with tax this "suite" was just over three hundred bucks for one. Night.  Wow. Expect a little more from a hilton property for premium dollars.I travel frequently for work and try to stay at Hilton properties. In my opinion, this hotel is not up to the Hilton standard. I read reviews and knew the age of the hotel before booking, so I asked for a renovated room due to my severe allergies. There is an irritating smell in the hotel. I think it's chlorine. The suite looks like they have attempted to do a low budget remodeling. The light switch plates are crooked and not attached all the way. There's a long Crack in one wall with a screw sticking out. Neither the bathroom nor furniture has been updated. The beds are very comfortable but the sheets are cheap and appear old. The made to order breakfast is very good, thus the three stars. If you are looking for an upscale hotel, then this one is not for you.I just got home from a whirlwind trip to Nashville. First time and had a blast. Wasn't sure about staying so far from downtown but it ended up being the perfect location. The free shuttle was so convenient and the drivers were great. Hattie Bs is a stones throw away and so worth the line wait. Check out the cup cake shop while you're there. Shout out to Eliu at the front desk. Always helpful and smiling. I bought some cowboy boots in town and he was so helpful in getting them shipped back home. I would stay here again on a return trip. Hilton properties are the way to go for quality and value!The rooms price was reasonable for location, free breakfast and happy hour. The breakfast is also open later each day during the weekend maybe to accommodate for people walking up later. The room we stayed in had a pull out bed and queen size bed. Very comfortable. The staff was super nice. I would definitely stay there again.Update: Quick front desk moved our room for us (6'5" teenager needed a bed not the pull out).  We called and within 5 mins the manager showed up with new keys and a different room.  My wife said, "...okay. That might make up for the bad breakfast and nasty bathrooms..."2.5 stars. Good intentions but poor execution. We stayed here when our son moved into college. Maybe they were overwhelmed with the crowd?  The valet was prompt and attentive, always ready with the car. However, the staff inside the hotel was either distracted or overwhelmed by their responsibilities. Rooms were standard Embassy Suites. Nice setup and functioned just fine. All the other normal benefits of an ES were near nonexistent though. We will be making reservations well in advance to stay somewhere else when we come to visit next time.Breakfast was just plain disgusting unless you waited in the long line for a made-to-order omelet.  Even then, only so-so at best.  The self-serve table with bacon, sausage and potatoes was covered in grease, food, spilled ketchup and hot sauce.  Hard to stomach.  Even the coffee experience was uninspired.  They offer tiny little styrofoam cups and only whole milk creamer. (Is only offering whole milk just a Southern thing I'm unaware of?  I don't think so, but maybe?)Main floor restroom had not seen a cleaning in what appeared to be weeks. As we were headed out for the day (and to get an actual breakfast) I stepped in to use the restroom. It was nearly unusable so I went back up to our room. Looked for a different hotel for our second night but because of all the college move-ins taking place not much else was available. We simply found a good breakfast spot outside the hotel.I think all Embassy Suite hotels are nice.  The valet is a good deal for 20.00 as the self-park is 16.00.  The manager's reception had been picked over, but I came at the tail end, but I got a nice glass of wine out of it.  The room was clean and everything was just right.  Breakfast was good, standard ES fare.  Met my expectations for what ES should be.Maybe I'm spoiled by the California Embassy Suites. The wifi was slooooooow. Couldn't even use it. The Bed was very nice, not much selection on the tv. Location was great about 1 1/2 miles from the Country Music Hall of Fame. The prepared breakfast was nasty. But the cook did a good job on the grill. No indoor pool ~sad face~ gym did have a state of art treadmill Sauna and hot tube were good. YStayed June 2014, traveled with family. I wouldn't stay there again if I didn't have too. Not horrible but not great.Customer service was fantastic. They run a complimentary shuttle in the local area, and they were very nice to take us and pick us up on several occasions. And they wee always very nice about it- never made it feel like it was a burden. I asked for an early morning taxi on the day of my departure, and they had it for me 10 minutes early. The location of the hotel is great- very close to Vanderbilt, and downtown. Definitely made use of the local spots, which includes several great restaurants. The only issue I had during this stay was some weird things in the room. For example, my bathroom sink would fill up whenever the person in the next room would use their sink. Or, the TV was always fuzzy in the early evening hours (god knows why). Their ironing board sucks too (if that's important to you, haha).By far the most accommodating hotel in the area. Celebrated a 50th birthday in Nashville with lots of friends and family and the staff at Embassy Suites made this happen. From start to finish the staff was helpful and amazing. Thank you Scott and Amanda Jacks for all of your help.Comfy and clean hotel. The gym is nice and clean with high tech cardio machines (touch screen with televisions and iPod hookups).The downsides: 1. breakfast for a gluten-free vegan - banana, grapefruit, oranges - everyday. Ugh. 2. The sun deck is located right next to all the hotel fans and generators - it's so loud! Not a relaxing place to hang out.We had a Bachelor Party at this location over the past weekend and it was quite a blast! The staff at this hotel were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were spacious and allowed for some great in room partying. The location is fantastic! Right near music row with about 10 bars surrounding it. It is about a 2 mile trip to downtown Nashville on the main strip on Broadway. The shuttle that runs until 10pm will take you down there for free. The 2 hour free happy hour was great. The free breakfast is also amazing, omelet was delicious. Really I don't have much negative to say. The 'sun deck' is actually just the roof of the parking garage with a subpar view, still great for sunbathing or drinking and cigar smoking though.I actually believe I will returning for a second stay to this hotel in the future.I spent more time in hotels than I do my own home. As a diamond member of Hilton, there are certain expectations for this loyalty. But when I ran out of deodorant on the road, the managers response: "ever since I've been here" we have not given this out complimentary. You'll have to buy it!The hotel is nice and not in a bad area. Pretty close to a lot of restaurants and bars. The first night I checked in there was no hot water. The beds are comfortable. The breakfast is great and the complimentary happy hour is a nice touch. I would stay here again.Comfy rooms, bed was fine. the free happy hour and breakfast are excellent perks. close to Vanderbuilt and downtown.I was very very impressed by Embassy Suites! It was my first time ever staying with them and I really enjoyed the experience. The bed was comfortable, the shuttle took me just about everywhere I needed to go (and  provided entertainment) the shuttle drivers are close in age to me/majority of the people in my group and were very friendly. I loved giving the guy from LA a hard time. The breakfast they served was on point. I loved the fact that they had someone making fresh omelets. I ate one all 3 days of my stay. I also really enjoyed the fact that they offered a complimentary happy hour!! FREE BOOZE!! Who doesn't love free booze?!?!?! It's not the best quality, but it makes you feel good. I would definetely stay here again and I recommend others to as well!We stayed here during a road trip from California to North Carolina. We usually stay at Embassy Suites so I didn't think twice about booking a room at this location. While the hotel itself is impressive, the service was well below average with the exception of housekeeping and the friendly female bartender.Check-in was rough. The gal was not accommodating or even friendly in the least. Valet was unorganized and seemed confused. After coming through Oklahoma and Arkansas I was expecting some southern hospitality. Instead I felt like I was in L.A. minus the emphasis on grooming and aesthetics.There is no pool, arcade or play area so the kids didn't get that added touch so many other embassy suites have to offer. We did enjoy Nashville immensely! What a great city!Very pleased with my stay here, although a bit more expensive than expected. $240.00 per night. First, the location was terrific. Steps from Vanderbilt and a short walk to the District. Happy hour from 5:30-7:30 was a nice touch until they ran out of beer. Complimentary breakfast with omelette station works. Check-in was a breeze. Gym was surprisingly well-equipped with a nice sauna and tiny whirlpool. No pool. Rooms were spacious two-room suites in an atrium style hotel. Shuttle was largely unreliable.
review_content_40: Compared to other Embassy Suites, this location is subpar. The Tampa, FL Embassy Suites' kitchenette was twice as long, and the continental breakfast lasted until 10AM there instead of 9AM here. The front desk staff is pleasant though. Even though they probably only saw me once for check-in, the guy knew my name the next morning.You do need to stay on top of the front desk and housekeeping staff though. I called asking for extra shampoo/conditioner and pillows about an hour before we left, which never arrived. The items never arrived while we were gone for nearly 12 hours either. I was just too tired to call again when we returned.Thanks to the American Outlaws discount (supporters group for the USA Soccer Men's National Team), the room was $124/night. I was told over the phone the shuttle will drive you within a 2-mile radius, including LP Field. Upon arrival, we discovered the shuttle doesn't go across the river. So, even though LP Field is within a 2-mile radius, you can't take the hotel shuttle to LP Field.Also, beware valet parking is $19/night. I don't know what self-parking costs, but I am not sure if this was in the confirmation email. So, when I forwarded my roommates the email, they didn't know about the fee.Wifi is free in the lobby, but not free in the rooms. There are different kinds of wifi to sign up for; I just chose the $5.95 rate. Be aware the wifi is exactly 24 hours, not linked to the time you check into your room. Thus, if you decide to check in early at 10:30AM, but you're not checking out until 11:30AM the next day, there's an hour when you will not have wifi (unless you pay for another 24 hours).We only stayed one night, but I don't know if I'd enjoy this hotel if staying long term. It is quite a walk to downtown Nashville. We ended up taking a cab Tuesday night back to the hotel when it started raining. From Layla's Bluegrass Inn (see my last review), it cost $7.50 for cab fare, which wasn't too bad.  Oh, the most annoying thing of all was housekeeping coming to the door twice on the morning of checkout. It's like they wanted to kick us out 2 hours before noon. Sheesh!Great place to stay! The prices vary depending if there is an event going on. I was here on business and this is a great location! It is close to downtown, west end, Hillsboro area. There is a manager's reception from 5:30-7pm which includes free beer,liquor, and mixed drinks. In the morning they have a wonderful selection of hot and cold breakfast. The big win for me is the cooked to order omelette bar!This hotel is a bit overpriced for the services and the quality of service you normally expect from an Embassy. I think the amenities are better at the Hilton Garden Inn next door (and it's usually $30 cheaper).The Embassy has the nice decor of an indoor view of the breakfast area but the walls are paper thin. You can hear people talking as far as 3-4 doors down if you are watching TV in your living room. During my visit, the ice maker wasn't working.As a Hilton Honors Silver member, I'd expect they would honor my request for a high floor but instead we were on the 5th floor.The breakfast is alright.The shuttle service works well except on Friday and Saturday nights when they are usually booked solid. They are reliable, fast, and know the area pretty well.For larger vehicles, the parking structure is a bit tight as you drive up in the self park garage. It makes you wonder why they have the large pole in the center as you go around each level.I went to Nashville for my sisters wedding last weekend and stayed here for 4 nights, and couldn't have asked for a better experience. The hotel arranged it so all of the bridesmaids rooms were located close together, which made it easy to coordinate car pools, hair and make up. The valet's were wonderful, they always pulled my car around quickly and made sure that everything got packed into the car quickly. Also, the suites have free breakfast every morning, delish! Omlet bar, scrambled eggs and BACON (the most important food) every morning! There were some weird things, like the rooftop patio that was really a fenced off portion of the parking lot with patio furniture, and some of the areas of the hotel seemed warn. However, the friendly service made up for it.Location, fantastic. The hotel comfortable and clean.  I don't think you can beat an Embassy Suites especially if you are traveling with children. The breakfast alone is superior.  The manager's cocktail hour is generous and a good time.  The front desk man, I think he was actually a manager, was professional (of course) but he was also warm and quick witted.  It was simply a good stay.We were guests at the Embassy Suites Nashville/Vanderbilt from Dec30-Jan5.  I traveled with my two young adult kids to move my daughter to college there (from California). We had an amazing experience and are so grateful for all of the staff that we encountered.  I'm not the best at remembering names but Tim at the front counter was top-notch/as good as it gets for customer service.  His colleagues were also very helpful.  From the shuttle drivers, to the housekeeper, to the bartender, to the waiters and the amazing cook-to-order chef - we could not have been treated better.  This is a very guest-focused hotel.  We felt the value for the price was very good considering all hotels increase their prices during the holidays. Plus the price includes a full breakfast buffet and cook-to-order breakfast, as well as nightly appetizers and drinks (alcoholic too).  This property is very conveniently located to Belmont University, Vanderbilt, Music Row, Downtown, LP Field and Bridgestone Arena. It is approx 15 minutes from the airport and Opryland.Review...free booze was a nice first impression at the happy hour. Rooms were fine.  Not over the top great but adequate.   Walking distance to a couple of decent honkytonks.  Honestly, the Hampton at Vanderbilt is much nicer and a better value.I received the worst customer service from this hotel. They raised my rate on my reservation and transfered me 5 times to different people to help me. All either disconnected me, or I received a voice recording without a returned call. I was even transferewd to an out of state call center! We are a member of Hilton Honors, and always stay at Embassy Suites. Conveniently when I tried to post this review the system was down.Pro:  two-room suites, free shuttle within a 2-mile radius, free made-to-order breakfast (much better than the typical continental breakfast), free happy hour, Vanderbilt college bar scene nearby.Con:  have to take a cab to get to the nightlife downtown, have to pay for WiFi (for the price and other free stuff already included, you'd think the internet would be free), the noise from the open central lobby reverberates through the place so if you're a light sleeper it may disturb you, thin walls, rooms do smell a bit musty.I like the property, the staff and the location cannot be beat. The hotel is a bit older, but still well kept. The free shuttle offers a nice way to get around the city if you find yourself taking advantage of the free booze at managers reception at 5:30. The rooms are large so it's perfect for those longer stays. The space helps cut down on the stir crazy feeling I get from other smaller rooms over a week span. The free breakfast is a nice treat and the omelets are usually great. The place ranges form 99-189 per night, so book early and you'll have a great room at a great price, but don't forget they'll still send you away bowlegged with that 17.00 per day parking fee. Also, bone up on your Austin Powers parking skills before heading to Nashville because their parking garage is a freaking rubric cube from hell, and you're bound to kill yourself trying to park.My parents stay here a lot when they come to visit me here in Nashville, and I usually end up hanging out there a lot with them.  It has a great location within walking distance to a very large amount of restaurants and bars.  And when I say 'within walking distance' I mean walk in a 3 block radius and you'll hit about 30 different establishments.  Its also a short cab ride (around 5 bucks) to most of the popular tourist attractions and a lot of local shopping.They have their own parking garage with complimentary valet so you don't have to worry about finding a spot on cluttered city streets.  I love the inside of this hotel.  The center of the building is one large atrium style room full of fountains and cozy places to sit.  The hotel restaurant is an Omaha steaks and the bar inside offers a free happy hour for guests (yes thats right I said FREE happy hour).  They have a great free breakfast including hot and cold items as well as a custom omelet and waffle bar.The rooms themselves are spacious and clean, decorated in your typical hotel room style.  Most of the rooms also host a pretty great view of the city, especially in the evening.While we got a really good deal on a busy weekend, the hotel was not prepared for being fully booked. We stayed two nights and had two separate suites for our family.The biggest issue was housekeeping! While they decorated the beds nicely with our kid's stuffies, they did not clean the bathroom floors or left any bath towels! We called before noon and I got several calls in the afternoon if this issue was resolved, which you guess it, it was not. Finally at like 6:30 someone from housekeeping showed up, was visibly upset said some profanities about his management wiped the floor with some towels (still missed plenty of hairs (Yucky!) left and showed up 20 minutes later with some towels (I hope it were not the same as the ones he used for the floor! The breakfast while free was awful. Everything was basically out all the time, there was nowhere to sit and you waited 30 minute in line for an omelet that was not fully done because they rushed it. For scrambled eggs and bacon the wait was 20 minutes! Oh and did I forget to mention you have to pay for the Internet! Wow! The price was great for an Embassy Suites the service and the cleanliness was more of a motel that you pay by the hour. Oh one positive note the valet guys were super friendly and quick for a crowded hotel and the location is great!This Embassy Suites is pretty bombass for a few reasons.  First off, it has a most excellent location.  Right on Broadway, you can walk to many bars, restaurants, Vanderbilt, shops, and even some tourist areas.  If you are lazy or too drunk, it is very easy to hail a cab out front and even easier to have the valet guy call you a cab.  If you have a car you can park it in the hotel lot for probably a lot of cash or you can park back behind on Division if you can find a spot.  Second, the hotel is clean and nice.  The lobby and breakfast areas were clean and when you ride up the glass elevator you get a good view of the entire atrium.  All rooms are suites (thus the name, Embassy SUITES duuh! hehe) including a nice living area with tv, microwave, fridge, coffee maker, and wet bar.  The couch folds out in a bed if you have more guests than you were expecting. Surprisingly, we found the room to be quiet even though a convention of teenage girls checked in when we did and also a bachelorette party was located two doors down.  Finally, the place has free breakfast and FREE HAPPY HOUR.  You heard me.  And I am not talking JUST BEER - I got liquor.  Yes, TWO rum-n-diets for exactly FREE.  FREE BOOZE.  Stay here, get your pre-party on, then go out to all the bars in walking distance and go from there!This place was pretty much perfect for my husband and I. We did a long weekend in Nashville, and the Embassy Suites had a great price for way more than other hotels offer. You get a two room suite, which is perfect for us because my husband likes to watch TV before bed and I can't stand it, so he has his own special room for that. Free breakfast, which we tried once, was kinda awful. Greasy, weird, flavorless, etc. We decided to skip it the rest of the time and went down the street (about a block away) to Noshville (despite cringing at the name), where they have great breakfasts (if you have the belly for it, get the bagel/lox plate, it was killer).Oh, also: open bar dude! They have a two hour happy hour every night where drinks are free. Wine, beer, select mixed drinks, and some snackies. They have a nice middle area with couches and tables to hang out and have a couple.We got the free shuttle (within two miles) downtown, immediately freaked because downtown SUCKS. Holy new country hell. We slammed down a drink at Merchants and hightailed it out of there. If you are into really touristy, new country kinda loud party places, downtown is the place for you. It is not for me. Husband and I walked about 10 blocks over to the Station Inn, and listened to some lovely and live old country and bluegrass. Sweet relief.I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Nashville; there are plenty of good places to eat/drink around the hotel, but it's just far enough away from the madness (but with a free shuttle to the madness, if that's what you're into).I stayed on a high floor and are extremely thin.  I was able to clearly hear my neighbor's clock radio.  The gym is pathetic.  Skip it.So where did my business travels take me this week?? None other than Nashville, TN, home of all that country music has to offer. So I arrived at the hotel around 4:15 or so, and it was still light outside, so I had thought I would go "sightsee" a bit, since I've never been to Nashville myself. Yeah so that definitely didn't go according to plan, because everything closed around 5:00, but I definitely plan on going to see some of the surrounding sites next time I'm in town, especially since this hotel has such a great location. It's not far from many of the sites, Opryland, The Parthenon, Country Music Hall of Fame.Ok enough about the tourist talk, this review is about the hotel, so I should probably start talking about that......So I arrive at the hotel, and was pleasantly surprised, the inside of the hotel is very nice, and the rooms are spacious as well, they have a bedroom and then a seperate suite that has a sitting area. So it provided me with plenty of space to sprawl my things out. Every evening, the hotel has what is called a "manager's reception", where it's basically like a little happy hour for the hotel down in the lobby. They had some snacks and the best part....a bartender, giving out as many drinks as you want.....Mmmmm....can't beat that!!!  ;)   I tend to get bored traveling around by myself for business and not knowing anyone, so it was nice that they had this, where people from the hotel could mingle with one another and it gives you a chance to meet and talk to other people from all over the country.  (This is if you like to mingle, not so great if you like to just be left alone during your trips....LoL)......Well after the manager's reception, I was famished and was looking for something to eat. Didn't really feel like driving around too much at this point, so I just settled for this Thai restaurant down the street. Next time however, I think I'll plan to give myself some more time, so that I can make it down to Opryland, they have outlet stores there, and some great restaurants from what I heard.Two downers for me when it came to this hotel, was 1) You had to pay for parking whether it was valet or self-park in the garage adjoining the hotel.   2)  You have to pay for internet access in the hotel, otherwise you can use the business center downstairs........these were both bummers for me, b/c I feel as much as you are paying for a room at the hotel you should have those things included rather than be an extra charge.Anyways, all in all, I'd stay here again for business or otherwise, as they were very accomodating and had very friendly staff as well.we chose this spot from reviews on trip advisor. I would not hesitate to stay here again.  I never eat breakfast and the fresh omelets every morning were great. I was also amazed at the happy hour in the evening. not wonderful but I loved being able to take a glass of wine up to my room.  I also liked the suite set up.. much more space.  we would definitely stay here again.I stayed here on business a couple weeks ago. I love ES to begin with. Always good quality common areas and great rooms. The Nashville ES is close to downtown and near Vanderbilt Univ. The front desk staff were very helpful. Natalie who was a trainee helped us find a great place for dinner (Cabana near Vanderbilt...5 minutes drive..excellent atmosphere and food). She waited for us to get back from dinner and had gotten us cupcakes from a cupcake shop across the street for dessert. That kind of service makes you want to write a nice postive review!!OK. not great. Not a great value. I had minor problems the last few times I stayed. Location is great for me. Last time I was there in early July it was the worst. Our room smelled like a sewer a little bit and the place was pretty dirty in spots. Furniture and carpets are worn. I wrote a note and got a nice reply but it turns out those things are 10 YEARS OLD! No wonder. Breakfast was good. Over all quite pricey given everything. Lots of competition in the area tooI really like this hotel. There's a beautiful lobby/atrium area where you can sit any time of day or night. In the evenings they have free drinks and snacks, which I find pretty incredible. Breakfast is fair, but they have oatmeal and fruit among all of the junk-food type stuff, which is nice. The gym is pretty small, with only about 5 machines, and a bunch of weights/props. They're open 24 hrs, though. The great part, is that they have a hot tub and sauna! Open 7a-midnight, and hardly ever occupied. The rooms are nice, all suites as the name implies. A small fridge is in the room. No bathrobes, but they bring as many towels as you need. Overall it's a spacious place to stay, with quite a few services included in the price. It's a really relaxing feeling to get into the room at the end of a long day, grab a glass of wine, go out for some dinner, and come back to the hot tub. A GREAT place to stay!

review_content: First time staying at Embassy Suites. I regularly stay at Hampton properties and saw this location near a conference that was closer and better reviews than the Hampton locations.I have to admit that overall I was disappointed in comparison to Hampton. Maybe my expectations where too high.Check-In process was smooth. Did online check-in prior to arriving.Only real complaint about room was the toilet ran until you lifted the top and reset the inner workings. By the time I discovered it was too late to want to deal with having maintenance look at.I had some difficulty accessing WiFi and had to get assistance from the front desk.Personally I prefer to use stairs for 1-2 floors instead of waiting on the elevator every time. I could not find any staircases near my room other than emergency exits to outside the building.I would stay here again.The location is good, it has been updated except for the rooms , very small for suites . The beds very uncomfortable for the price you pay they should be top notch like all the other embassy's we've stayed. The restaurant that is here is extremely $$$$!!  The rooms are very clean, the sofa pull out you might as well sleep on the floor that's how bad the mattress is on it!I recently stayed at Embassy Suites at the Nashville Airport. Though the suite was was adequate for the cost, unfortunately the customer service was less than desirable. I accidentally left an outfit in the closet of my room. I reached out to the hotel a few hours after leaving and spoke to the night cleaning manager and she told me she would check and took my number but never got back to me. I left a message for the housekeeping manager and sent an email before she responded. When she responded she informed me that my clothes were not in the lost and found, but she would check the closet in the room as well but that was the last time I heard from her. I expected a higher level of customer service from the Hilton brand. I will definitely think twice about staying in another Hilton hotel in the future.Worst customer service ever!!!! I have now been hung up on twice and transferred to someone in Canada... I have now been on hold for over 15 minutes, and all I want is a copy of and invoice emailed to me... What is so difficult about this request??? Get your customer service act together!Always nice when you show up after traveling from California to find that the hotel has been oversold and they are moving you to a different hotel 10 miles away. I spend 100 nights a year in hotels - elite status, all that crap. It means nothing to people who either a) Don't care about their customers, or B) Are too incompetent to count rooms.As per usual for Embassy Suites they go overboard with the food and beverage service and that is awesome.  The accommodations are pretty decent, but the staff appears to he underworked and overtaxed and this makes them a bit absent or overwhelmed when we need them.  All in all I dig this place of couse but may or may not be back with so many options in the area.I travel a lot and like to stay at ES. This one is on the lower end and would not stay here again. the lobby area looks like it has been remodeled. My issue is the room. When going to bed the first night I noticed the comforter had fresh makeup-- lipstick and mascara as well as smelled like BO. It completely grossed me out. Secondly my blow dryer died the next morning. Looked old to begin with. Lastly the roomHad no closet or hanging area and no iron. Very strange not to be able to hang up business clothes?? Lastly lines to reception and breakfast very long and limited parking. Location does not allow for walking.Love it! Clean, friendly staff, free big breakfast, free two hour happy hour, and around the corner from my meeting place. Courtesy shuttle drove me on rainy days which was awesome!!!  Would definitely come back.Tight parking. Small bathrooms for a suite. Couldn't get the room cool enough. I stayed here a night after my flight home was cancelled. Only stayed a few hours so my review is a little light. I did notice that I could hear jets taking off from the airport while in the room. That is an airport area hotel for you. Front desk staff was friendly and professional.So I came here again over a year later. The lobby and bar area has been completely re-worked since the last time I was here when it was a disaster. Friendly service at the desk although they should add a few more people to check guests in to avoid the lines. Wifi was much better this time. My room was also so much better than last time being totally updated with new furniture, TV's etc.. Still, be advised this location fills it's front parking lots quickly and you may be forced to park in the back at the bottom of the hill. Close to airport which is nice.This is by no means the best Embassy Suites I've stayed at, but I can't say it's the worst. EB hotels generally hold themselves above the rest. This particular location needs some updating, but it's not terrible. There is one male employee that can jump in a creek. I met with him over the phone originally and then in person later, he is miserable. Anyways, I felt comfortable at this location and can't speak terribly about it. This is my second stay on location. It is consistent, but needs some heavy updating.This Embassy Suites is smaller than what I am use to. I was spoiled with the amenities at the one in South Nashville on our way through town last time around. The customer service was great through out my whole stay. Had a room on the second floor. Usually being a HHonors member I am assigned to a room on one of the higher floors of the hotel. No big deal as we were just tired and wanted to sleep. The bed was uncomfortable. It felt as if my feet were higher than my head when lying down. The pillows were very fluffy but did not provide much support causing a restless night. Breakfast as always was amazing. They ran out of disposable cups however the lady who looked like she was in charge said I could take one of the mugs with me. It didn't happen but was nice of her to offer. Was an OK stay. As mentioned, customer service was great.OH BOY WHAT A NIGHT! I want to start off by saying that this review would have been a 1, BUT thanks to my tweet and a quick acting constomer service staff, I am giving this place a 4. So we arrive late from a long flight from California. We go to check in and the women tells us we don't have a reservation...that we HAD a reservation for a week ago (the day we made our reservation). We explained that there must be some mistake, why would we reserve a room for the same day we were making a reservation.....The woman shrugged, told us we were charged for the room because we did not show up...and not only that, they didn't have the same room we requested. we would get a smaller SMOKING ROOM. UGH...so, defeated we tried to find the elevators...they are hard to find with all of the construction. We eventually found our stinky room and then decided to get out quickly and have a bite at the hotel restaraunt. The food was surprisingly good and I can't complain about that.That night there was some serious noise going on in the walls (construction?) which woke us up multiple times and finally woke us that morning nice and early. I decided to tweet about the early wake up call, and I was contacted by the Embassy suites manager who I explained the situation (the reservation, the noise etc) HE IMMEDIATELY TOOK CARE OF EVERYTHING! Now that is what I call good customer service!! Although THIS hotel doesn't have much to offer right now with all the construction, I'm glad Embassy suites lived up to their name as being a great company...Perhaps this place will be better once the construction is done!Don't forget anything in your room here!  I realized soon after I had checked out of the hotel that I had left my Ray Ban sunglasses in my room.  I called them immediately and was directed to housekeeping/lost and found.  She went to my room and confirmed that she had the sunglasses and would have them mailed to me.  This was May 29th.  It is now June 21st and I still have not received the sunglasses.  I have called NUMEROUS times and no one can seem to help.  The lady who retrieved them for me confirmed that she gave them to the person in charge of shipping them.  However, this person is never available to speak with me and does not return my calls.  I travel frequently but will not choose this hotel again because of this experience.  I feel that one of these employees is sporting a pair of Ray Bans belonging to me!Ok, this has to be the worst hotel I have stayed at in a long time. Do not get swayed by the brand name or the lobby - the place is tired, old and had horrible customer service. To start, the type room I booked was not available upon check in.  They took the reservation but just could not hold the reservation. So the "upgraded" me to the premium floor which, as far as I could tell, meant it had a free vending machine. But, of course it was empty.  They said they needed to restock it. Then, I go to my room and there are no rores for the TV. After trying to call the front desk ( rang off the hook) I had to go back down stairs to tell them. Over 1/2 hour later, someone showed up. I was supposed to be here for three nights - I checked out after 1. I will risk it but a la Quinta or Hampton would be far better than this.Whenever we travel with the kids, my biggest requirements are an impeccably clean room, a safe location, and enough space for the four of us. This EB met all those requirements with lots of other surprises (it's been updated and renovated) Two room suite with a door to separate the bedroom space from the living space was a plus since the adults had some work stuff to handle and the kiddos needed to get to bed at a reasonable time. Free wifi for Hilton Honors members, indoor pool (with adult time only option), free hot breakfast, free cocktail reception, business services, and lobby restaurant were all pluses!! Lobby area was always well- maintained! Would definitely stay again!"This place still scrapping the bottom of the barrel to get folks to stay here." -- Embassy Suites employee during my stay. Do.Not.Stay.Here. Don't do it. Do not do it. The hotel is under construction. The entire front of the hotel is fenced off with equipment laying around everywhere. The new "reception desk" is moved to under a canopy. The hotel has indoor rooms that wrap around in a square. But in the middle is a large construction area where the restaurant and other stuff used to be. It's all under a large tarp with equipment laying everywhere.Worse yet, the employee's comment was not about the quality of the hotel. Apparently, because the hotel is under construction, and anyone who has any options at all -- which given it's location is anyone arriving before midnight -- stays somewhere else. Which apparently means that the hotel's management has been very aggressive about bringing folks in who would not normally stay in a hotel.And neither of those is the issue I have. My issue is the price. When you book online and you think Embassy Suites in the Airport in a major city like Nashville, you expect a certain quality of hotel. One with a bellhop, a restaurant, business quality rooms. This is a hotel under construction, but priced at one that's not. So you'll pay the same price as you would expect for the brand and in return you'll stay at a work zone filled with folks you would never expect at a business hotel. This literally the worst hotel I've stayed at, and I've stayed at a lot.The rooms are decent, but because so few folks stay here, the linens and interior feel grimy. (I don't suspect that they get royal class treatment.) Worse yet, folks are probably harder on the rooms than most business class customers. In fairness to the employees, they're trying to make the best of a bad situation. But your wallet will be lighter as if you stayed here or any other Hilton hotel. Unfortunately, if you're reading this review, than like me, you booked and had no choice because it was late at night and wondered -- am I the only one that thought this experience was terrible. No. You are not.Which is why others should know: Wait until the renovation is complete or overpay for not knowing any better.I had a wonderful stay here. The room was pristine and the staff was friendly and accommodating. I have to agree with other posters, that parking is tight. That being said, even with the hotel being sold out both nights I was there, I had no issues finding a spot and the lot was well lit which is important when you are a woman traveling alone.I'd stay here again without hesitation.This is a SAD Embassy Suites.  So outdated.  It was like walking back into the 70's.  It fulfilled it's purpose (a place to sleep) and the people were nice, but it is in serious need of some updating.  I couldn't even find an outlet close to the bed, so my iphone (which is my alarm clock) had to go clear across the bedroom.  No hitting snooze for me on this trip! The good:Bed was comfortable.Free breakfast and evening reception like other Embassy Suites.Very nice staff.Extra towels, toilet paper, etc. left on my door when I indicated I did not want housekeeping.Small refrigerator and microwave.Fitness room was adequate.The bad:Lack of convenient outlets.Small bathroom.No comforter, just a thin blanket.My tv was tempermental - sometimes there was sound with no picture.Horribly outdated, which makes it feel unclean.Stayed here this time to try to save the client money (free parking alone is nice), but next time will just spend the extra and stay downtown.  This property did not meet expectations set from staying at other Embassy Suites.I read a lot of the other reviews before posting my own and I would've knocked down another star if I stayed in the room more than I did- 2hrs a day.Checking in: I got in at 12:30pm and tried to check in but of course no clean rooms ready-go figure; there never are before 3pm.  So i left my phone number at the front desk to call me when it was.  I got busy with work and never did get that call but by the time I was able to return which was 5am the next day, the room was tidy and ready for my cat nap thank goodness.  At this point, I didnt care the hotel was under construction but it would've been nice for a heads up since my allergies have been bad and this was a business trip for me.I tried calling for toothpaste several times and never got it.  Went to Walmart and bought one myself-strike there for the hotel.  Super loud during the day.  There was a family reunion going on, along with the construction so if were around during the day, I imagine the noise factor to be quite off-putting so I was glad to always be there after 2am and out by 7am each day.  Parking is inconvenient.  If you end up parking in the back, there is a long, long walk to the nearest entrance.  Did I mention the hotel is on a hilltop??  On saturday morning as I made my exit for the day, the fire alarm went off.  I expected to return to find my belongings soaked in water but luckily that was avoided.  But can you imagine?  If I was here on vacay, I definitely would've done what Alex did and leave to go somewhere else.So the second star is because I liked my room.  It was clean, spacious, and it made me feel safe unlike my experience the week prior in Wichita Falls.  Compared to that... I really am not going to complain.  I refused to shower at the other hotel-yea, thats how bad it was.  I didnt even last 5 hrs at that place- super worthy of a 1star.  This one though, they get 2 stars :)
review_content_20: My recent stay was excellent. Everything is updated although the restaurant staff seemed a little disjointed still. The breakfast was fantastic. Did I mention everything has been updated? If you need to stay by the BNA airport then this Embassy Suites should be on your short list of hotels.I'm a diamond member and will not be back and don't recommend when u go and eat at the restaurant look at the service nobody smiles  the vibe is too seriouse instead of relaxing not goodSpent my Birthday weekend here alot of TSU folks were here made me feel more at home.this hotel is massive yet quiet I always enjoy staying here because it has everything you would ever need and service here is always A+ I only wish all of their hotels were like this one..oh well back to the enjoyment !!Picture says it all! Except the broken door, non-working lights, dead lady bug family on floor by windows, fake rose petals behind the curtains, bloody finger prints on door (what's that you say? How do I know it's blood? Well, found this by the couch!) . First day, we didn't really complain just left the room for a couple of hours to let them fix things. Second day, we really wanted towels and toilet paper... Took 3 phone calls and finally tracked down housekeeping. Hotel has been renovated. Nice pool. Just filthy brand new rooms!We had a great stay. Very comfortable, clean, not noisy (as others have said) and a great breakfast.This place is kind of old and outdated.. actually YES it's definitely outdated. I checked in and somehow my reservation had  been mixed up and put as smoking rooms. There was no unsmoking rooms available. It was a disaster trying to get that resolved. They do have a very nice free cocktail and snack hour with live music!One of the worst Hilton brand stays I've ever had. Awful room on 2nd floor right by elevators. Loud AC and noise from lobby/open area below. Longtime Hilton honors member, and very disappointed in this stay. Would not stay here again and do not recommend.Room floor not vacuumed. Dirty, wet washcloth hanging over the shower. One bed looked like a 6 yr old made it up. Looked like the housekeeper had a fling in the room prior to my check-in, wiped her *ss with a washcloth, hung it over the shower, half made the bed and exited. Definitely didn't have time to vacuum. Nasty, nasty, nasty!!Creepy, dark abandoned restaurant area downstairs.This is now a much improved hotel after the renovation last year I read about in older posts. The atrium lobby where they serve breakfast and the evening reception is fresh and inviting.  Water pressure is good on a high floor and the water warms up instantly during morning peak hours.  The exercise room has treadmills, elliptical machines,free weights and fitness balls.  Adding a weight machine would get a very good instead of OK rating.  The evening reception is more generous than most other Embassy Suites I have stayed at.  The breakfast set up is confusing.  The sign letting you know there are two lines, one for made to order omelets and another for the buffet, can only be seen from one direction.  If you approach from another direction, it is easy to assume there is only the omelet line which can be long and slow.  Parking in the back lot is inconvenient since there is no direct entrance and you have to walk all the way around to the front to get in.  Read the direction to the hotel carefully.  It is not the usual easy on, easy off from a highway ramp and because of the lay of the land, the hotel is not very visible to ground guide you.  All in all, this is an above average Embassy Suites which I would stay at again.Managers evening reception has a star. Her name is Melissa and was serving the drinks. She was friendly and inviting. Food in restaurant is mediocre but drinks are great. Rooms are small for an embassy suites but still comfortable for a short stay.An older Embassy Suites that is definitely showing its age. But I personally like the extra room you get with ES so I have stayed here a couple of times. Their GM is a bit quirky and writes a daily letter for guests that you get when you check in. The hotel staff definitely take their lead from the service oriented GM because they are friendly and go out of their way to be helpful. The manager's reception in the atrium has a live band/artist a few nights a week. Not really my thing, but there were always people down there so some people must like it.Overall, this ES gets a pass. I don't know if I would stay here more than a night or two, but it's close proximity to BNA makes it a no brainer.P.S. If you order room service, try the coca-cola braised shortribs. Totally delicious.Going for it: Free drinks from 530-7pm. Free breakfast, and it's pretty darn good. She Crab Soup....awesome. But very outdated.  Toilets barely flush, lamps on the front room desk did not work for serveral of us. The valet was not very nice, and sometime rude to some coworkers I was with this past week. We had a meeting on Saturday and just down the hall the Southern Music Awards were going on so we got to listen to all their music thumping from pretty much 12-5.  Those who booked our meeting side by side needs some training in common sense.Was not bad. I wasn't wowed by the setup or entry. The room was okay not horrible it was very roomy but the bathroom was small for a suite.  The room was hot I slept with no clothes on and the AC was as low as can be but still not cool enough.  I like the space. It was quite and the bar staff was nice. Also they have a huge gnat problem, not in my room but in the food areas and conference roomsIt was so bad that I packed up and checked into another hotel.I will start this review saying I'm a Hilton Diamond member, have been for years-- I stay at a various Hilton almost once each week.  Because I'm a frequent traveler, I have learned to put up with a lot.  You just have to, or you'll make yourself crazy.   Well, this was bad enough that even I left.  First, the ENTIRE lobby looks like a war zone.  Under construction?  Ha!  How about MAJOR renovation leaving the hotel basically unfit for human habitation?  That would be more accurate.  The place is a MESS with temporary dry wall, plastic sheeting hanging everywhere, industrial construction equipment all around, etc.So anyway- here's my experience from Wednesday night:I land, call for the airport shuttle, wait on hold for 5 minutes, and then finally get through and am told that the shuttle will be there in 10 minutes.  I wait outside at the hotel shuttle spot in the sticky Nashville heat for 20 minutes, then call again.  Wait on hold for 3 minutes.  Am told the driver will be there in 5 minutes.  He is, but close to 30 minutes after I call.  Then I get to the hotel, and the people at the makeshift front desk are friendly enough, but the man at one desk has stains all over his shirt, and the woman helping me rolled her eyes at the shuttle driver and mumbled something to me about not knowing where he was. (Hence the delay in picking me up.)  Fine, whatever, and the hotel it is a DISASTER, as I described above.  I get a room key, go into my room, and it's bad.  EVERYTHING is old, the sheets/blankets are extremely worn, and the bathtub grout is covered in mold/mildew.  The carpet is peeling up at the edges and was really dirty-looking.  Still, I was going to carry on.  I left my bag in the middle of the room, and went down to grab a salad or some fruit from the cafe.  That's under construction, too, and I couldn't for the life of me find anyone to help me.  There were boxes and crates of wine and food sitting in the hall, the carpet was stained, and I was just over it.  I booked a room at a downtown hotel that I knew I could trust, called a taxi, and left.  I think that it's extremely irresponsible for the Hilton corp. to allow this hotel to remain open and operate in these conditions.  As I said, I am a longtime Hilton Diamond, and this experience was just about enough to make me switch to another chain.After crawling into bed, I felt a foreign substance on the blanket that looked to me like some sort of dried bodily secretion.A couple of months ago,Our house's pipes froze and broke. We were looking for a hotel to live in until the pipes were fixed. We went to a different hotel but it smelled bad ad the toilet broke,so we left.when we came here,we saw the construction on the 3rd floor and when we went into our room....IT WAS GREAT! The toilet didn't break,there was a tv with all my kids favorite tv channels,and best of all,there was a pool and an exercise room on the first floor! I didn't rate 5 stars because there was some key problems. First, we lost the keys(actually one of the kids lost it) then,we lost it again,my fault this time. But overall,everything was greatAm here as I am writing this...what a dump. I can't believe Hilton has an Embassy Suites they let get to this state of disaster.  If we had not been driving for 11 hours I would pack it up and move on.   Carpet in room is disgusting, everything is sticky-door handles, etc.-obviously the manager must feel about cleanliness as is the appearance of the hotel.  What a disgrace.   I used points for this and definitely need a refund.I am a HH member and I've stayed at many embassy suites. This location is by far the worst. There is no waffle maker at breakfast at this location which I love about a lot of the others. When we came back into our room after the first night they had serviced the room and things went downhill from there. They took all of the shampoo/soap and left us no towels/washcloths so we had to call to get them to bring up towels & shampoo/soap. The sheets were wet that they put on the bed so it smelled musty so we had to call the service desk again and when we called, there was no apology or concern, just an ok, we will come change the sheets. When they came in to change the sheets, again there was still no apology, she just walked in, changed the sheets, and did not even say a word to us. My stay was definitely not up to par with Hilton standards. With all of that being said there was one staff member that really made this trip an overall good experience. She went above and beyond what would be expected so therefore I am not going to give this hotel less than 3 stars.Buyer beware!!! Booked a king room on premium floor. Arrive at 5 to check in. No rooms available due to housekeeping. Waited 2 hours .was place on 5 th floor. Premium floor was on 9th floor . I had paid extra for the premium floor. When questioned, was told to go up to the 9th floor when I wanted the amenities. Complained due to rate and lack do series . Moved to 9th. Amenities code did not work. Checked out the next day . The following day erroneous charges appeared for 100 dollars. Called no one could tell me why left multiple messages for managers and accounting.  No call back for over a week. Call embassy national customer services to open a complaint.  Told I would hear mack for the gm in 72 hours. No call or resolution . Called customer services back said the hotel said I checked in with 4 kids obviously damages occured. I didn't check in with 4 kids. Told them I didn't and thst this was grossly incorrect as well.  I questioned that if a child was in t he party that it automactically meant there was damanges. No response. Didn't check in with 4 kids. Nobody ever able to tell me what damages were. Told that they would contact the gm again. Requested superior above gm since no response and it is now 17 days later. Told nobody above gm. Questioned that there  was no supervisor in the whole company x 3. Finally told a cs manager would contact me. No contact still. Ready to contact an attorney on principle.Let's make this simple for those in a hurry..... stay away from this hotel until they have finished construction!! Better yet, wait one or two months after construction is done to give them a chance to learn how to manage......Details: Yes, it is convenient if you need access to the airport. The only advantage.Noise is persistent throughout. Hotel design has inside rooms wrapped around an atrium area that is exposed for all floors, so any noises made on the first floor echo throughout the hotel (I assume since they still have no carpet or anything to dampen the noise). Not sure when actual construction started today, but I heard various noises as early at 6 AM. Rooms: We have stayed at 2 other Embassy suites on this trip, this is a distant third in room size, layout and quality. Bathroom is cramped, furniture seems to be strewn around the room and not placed with any play. Floor-to-ceiling drapes are hung about 3 inches too short, so just lay on the floor. Service: Check-in was okay, person was at least friendly. They did have a managers cocktail hour with pretzels and chips/salsa. One person was manning the bar, so there was a 10 minute wait minimum for anything to drink (even Cokes). Yes, they charge full price. No advantage whatsoever, other than airport access.
