I listed a "Pricey" considering what you get for the money........An interesting trip. After two Embassy Suites visits, I was ready to make that our "go to" vacation accommodations. After this, I think other places are in order.
review_content_40: This hotel is under renovation / construction - BEWARE!Stayed in a fourth floor corner suite away from the elevators. At night there were loud bangs, never did figure out where they were coming from.The first thing that hit my nose when I got off the elevator on the fourth floor (every time, all week) was the smell of cigarette smoke. Day, night, did not make a difference. And the fourth floor is a non-smoking floor.Turned the corner to head to my room, there were six or so chairs being stored in the hallway. And someone was nice enough to leave a half-drunk bottle of water on one of the chairs.The room was clean, except for the nearly full pack of marlboro lights in the nightstand. The room did not smell of smoke, but I thought it interesting anyways.Due to the renovation / construction, the fitness center was not available as advertised and there was no warning or notice to that fact before reserving rooms. The hotel staff was nice enough to point out that they had an agreement with a Holiday Inn Express to use their exercise room. They even had a shuttle that would take you there. Upon arriving at the HIE, I was rudely directed by HIE staff to the worst excuse of a fitness room I have ever seen. Two treadmills that were not only in bad shape but in need of repair (one would not raise for an incline and the other needed the tread waxed, even the machine told me so.) Ugh.Twice during my stay at the Embassy Suites I attempted to take a nap. Good freaking luck. The construction noise defeated me both times. Unacceptable.Also, due to the contruction, more than half of the parking lot was unavailable. But you can be darn sure that the contractors' trucks were parked nice and close to the front door.Positives: Clean Room, free breakfast was pretty decent.When I arrived at Airport called for the scuttle and desk clerk told me 15 minutes, well ended waiting 55 minutes for the airport scuttle and no one even cared at the front desk, Requested non smoking room and was told that mine room was non smoking - hmm room stinks , green stripped wallpaper and pink shower tile - Hello Disco days..... There are far better hotels at better price near the airport then this place. I won't stay here next visit.The hotel Manager personally called to apologize and let me know they are working on updating the hotel by Q4,2013 so please try again. I will up them one star, and hope things get better.First time we stayed here it took 2 hours to get into our room because of a 'house keeping' miscommunication. No problem, manager gave us a free night on the house for our next visit. Fast forward 4 months and I call to make a reservation using my gift voucher only to be told there were no rooms available. I call a second time and mention nothing about the voucher and have no problem making a reservation. I show up at the hotel and am given a room with no heat.45 min of engineers coming and going doesn't solve the problem. We get upgraded to available 'governors' suite. Sounds nice until we enter a room that reels so heavily of smoke I could only conclude some sort of illegal gambling operation must have just cleared out. No problem, the manager moves us to another room, this one has heat and decent smelling air. So I settle in. Getting ready to take a shower I see that the shower curtain is host to a large and prosperous colony of gelatin like mold. This will be the last time we stay here, even if they offered me a free night.I wouldn't stay here again... Why, you ask?  Because even though this Embassy Suites has the typical managers reception (Beer/Wine happy hour) as well as cooked to order breakfast, those benefits did not weigh out how out dated this property was.  I have to say that the staff was very friendly and helpful, but even that couldn't overcome the dilapidated condition of the property...If I were just to see the interior of the room and guess what hotel it was, I'd guess Motel 6 or Super 8.  I saw the other reviews on this property before I stayed here, but I didn't believe it was that bad...I was defintely wrong.  There are plenty of other hotels in the area, I wouldn't recommend this one until they did a major remodel.I was in Nashville for work and this location worked well for my colleagues.  It's not a favorite hotel but there are good points:-location-accommodating staff-shuttle from the airport-drinks and appetizers during the managers evening event-friendly bar feel  -with a lot of locals - in the hotel-extensive breakfast buffet - standard with the embassy propertiesI did not love the rooms, but it was fine for a night.  Not a bad hotel by any means.I tried... and tried to hit that third star on this review.  I tried equally as hard to keep the two stars!  But... I am keeping the two stars because the staff here is really very nice and friendly!  However, this place (as you can see from all the other reviews) is SO DATED.  In fact, when I walked into the room, I took a picture with my Iphone and sent it to a friend and told them I was staying in the Brady Bunch's guest room!  Honestly... Hilton should shut this place down and give it a face lift like no other.  I'm no Rookie either.  I'm a Diamond member of Hilton and have stayed at a number of Embassy Suites.  The rooms in this place need help.I want to give this hotel 3.5 stars.I took off 1 star for location and another for a slight stench that comes with having smoking rooms (something we are no longer familiar with in North Carolina).However, if you are doing business in the massive business park that surrounds this hotel, you'd be foolish to stay elsewhere.  Not only is the price right on the money - but the features of this hotel are excellent.Free shuttle with Hayden - Excellent.Breakfast in the lobby - Delicious.Manager's Reception with free cocktails - Obviously Awesome.The "Limo" we got with Rene - Horrible & Overpriced.The pool is great, hot tub is bubbling, and the workout room is a bit tight.The rooms are very comfortable, I love the separation in space you get with a two room suite.  The beds were definitely upgraded as well, very comfortable and large.Most importantly the staff is awesome and handled everything for us quite quickly even though the hotel was packed for a holiday weekend.Next time I'm in Nashvegas I'll probably look for something downtown, but I would have no problem staying at this hotel again and again.Just my two cents.I've stayed at a number of Embassy Suites properties.  This one had all of the typical features: cooked to order breakfast (reminded me of being back in college), managers reception(excellent), open lobby and two room suites.  The staff was great.  This property is in need of renovation.  We had a difficult time working in the room because of the lack of electrical outlets.  The internet also seemed to get slower as you went on the higher floors.The fitness room and pool were in excellent condition.A hotel room is no longer a place to sleep, it has become a satellite office.  Because of this, I'm not able to give this hotel a better rating.Awful, old and outdated. It feels as if the rooms were taken from the set of Mayberry!!! In addition, the customer service is abominable. Television service isn't working and the carpets throughout are filthy. These things are in addition to maze one must travel to get around the hotel due to construction. Finally, the type of room I reserved was unavailable. This place is awful ---pink bathroom tiles, granny furniture, moldy fridge and all.It was nice that I was able to check in at 11:30PM. I booked the room as I left Saturday morning with friends. They live some 2 hours away, so we were going to go for lunch and head back to drop them off. I was going to return Saturday night to stay over and catch my flight out of BNA Sunday. The desk clerk seemed inattentive and distracted and was impersonal. It was somewhat a unpleasant surprise to see him the next morning to check out. I went to give him my key and he received it, but just stood there. No "thank you" or "was everything okay". Aside from the customer service opportunity that Embassy presented with me, the room was fine; bed was comfy, towels soft, and room clean. Two stars for customer service experience.I must concur with the reviews here.  We arrived and and had the linens replaced because they looked wrinkled and used.  Avoid this hotel at a all costs.  The other Embassy on Broadway is a lot better.  There is no contest.Embassy suites is a great step up for minimum cost when you travel for a week long trip.  This location is a little hard to find, but it is close to the Airport and the business I need to get done while in Nashville.  Staff was very nice when I had a late check in.  The two room suites are nice to spread out.  Free breakfast (Full) and managers happy hour is good after a long day of meetings.

review_content: The Omni is one of several major conference hotels in Nashville. You can't beat the location or the access to "music city" the country music hall of fame is across the street and the museum actual is attached in the rear.  The back walkway houses the famous country music poster makers with a museum and display of the classic old opry and other acts.  Nashville is music bars and food. No shortage of any of that!  The lobby bar has some great entertainment and great food.  Bbq (pulled pork sandwich) also quite tasty! Reasonably priced and casual dress. There is a more expensive steak restaurant (Bob's) I have tried it yet. Too much cheap street food and bbq joints nearby too even wanna steakhouse meal   My room is a corner suite. Very nicely appointed with great views. Pretty good service all around. If you are on a business trip or want a high end Nashville hotel I will always choose Omni over other chains.The pancakes and waffles are great for breakfast in the restaurant or room service.Omni Hotels are the only hotels I try to stay at. I have always had great experiences at their hotels across the country. The Omni Nashville is a very nice hotel, and located right in the heart of Downtown Nashville. The room was really nice, upgraded amenities, beautiful pool and gym. From the standpoint of amenities, its a great choice for a stay in Nashville.The reason I am giving them a 3 star, is because of the sub-par customer service. From the check-in with the front desk, to any requests we had while there, the staff handled them more as a task and nuisance than as a guest service. For the premium price paid to stay at a 4-Star hotel with a nice room, good location, room service etc there are plenty of options... But the customer service is why I always chose Omni. For me, the Omni Nashville really lacked in this department. Maybe because we were there over Christmas and the employees were not happy to be working the holiday... I am not sure. Any call to guest services was handled by what seemed to be a very annoyed female that seemed to be inconvenienced by the phone ringing. Getting an additional pillow, or hair dryer took alot of time, and I ended up apologizing for making the request because of how it was handled by the employee on the phone. Asking for bottles of water at check-in, which as a SelectGuest member are supposed to be complimentary, were out of the question, but I was instructed that I could go buy some from Room Service or the gift shop.Dont get me wrong though. There wasnt anything incredibly bad about our time there, but there was definitely nothing exceptional either, which actually was very surprising with the track record I have had with the hotel chain. I will continue to patronize Omni at other locations, but next time I go to Nashville, Ill probably look at other options where my hotel stay doesnt feel like an inconvenience.So THIS is the place to stay in Downtown Nashville. But be willing to fork over a little extra $$$. In my opinion, totally worth it. I was in town for a long weekend with girlfriends for the Taylor Swift concert at Bridgestone area (which is a stones throw away). The location is centrally located which was our main reason for picking this hotel. We had to drive a few times but , overall, you could go a whole weekend and stay Downtown and find plenty to do. Just bring some comfy shoes.There were a few little hiccups. The main issue was that when going to our room , we opened the door to find a room that was NOT cleaned and looked like someone had just checked out. The bed wasn't made and there were pillows all over the floor. Gross, gross, gross and not what a group of gals want to see on their first night in Nashville. Not sure why that happened  but the person at the front desk assigned us to a new room (after many, MANY apologies) and comped WIFI(normally a fee) for us our entire stay . Worked for us.  Our newly assigned room was super spacious for 4 gals to share and the bathroom was rather roomy and not cramped in the slightest bit. One of the cool things about the hotel are all the amenities within walking distance. The hotel is its own playground. There's a Southern style restaurant, Kitchen Notes, right off the lobby. Their bar is open late so that you can order drinks and then venture to one of the cozy areas in the lobby to hang out, gossip and peoplewatch.   Bongo Java coffee is also downstairs to get your coffee fix in the morning. The Country Music Hall of Fame and Hatch Print Gallery are attached to the hotel as well as several gift shops with souveniers and items you forgot to pack!  We also took advantage of the fancy on site day spa, Mokara, which I highly recommend making appointments for months in advance.  There's also a pool and fitness center which is a given.   Valet service is provided and they charge per day (with in and out priviledges) . Only thing I think that doesn't make sense is their big , ornate front entry with the heavy doors. While they are gorgeous, I don't think it makes sense to have when there isn't a regular doorperson and arriving guests have to open the heavy doors while dragging in their luggage. Also, on a bright note, one of my friends misplaced her necklace. She checked with housekeeping and lost and found throughout our stay. Thankfully, someone had found it and turned it in. The hotel handled but they had security oversee and confirm delivery of item, probably more for liability purposes.So, for the most part, we had an exceptional experience. But 1 star knocked off for the first room we were assigned to upon check in. That is a complete NO NO for a hotel of this caliber and a bad first impression. Thankfully, our stay ended on a high note.I most often stay at Marriott's or their derivatives when I travel.  This was an attractive hotel with attentive, friendly staff.  There was a day when our room was not cleaned and on the other days the cleaning was substandard.  This needs to be fixed and if so another star would certainly be warranted.  I was especially enamored with the rooftop bar which will be rated separately but suffice it to say that this is a great amenity offered by this hotel.  Hotel rooms had city views!  The hotel was a pleasant walk away from the convention center allowing escape at the end of the day, nice venues to stop at along the way and convenient access in the mornings.  Plenty of restaurants, coffee shops ... within walking he hotel is also close enough to the Vanderbilt campus to enjoy University amenities and sample nightlife and music unique to Nashville.  Many nice venues near by for music,  all of very high quality!4 night stay. Modern yet inviting.  I love the lobby fireplace and seating area. Clean room, clean bathroom, clean closet, clean furniture. The bed had nice comfy pillows, however the mattress was wayyyy to soft for my liking. I loved the view from the large window. Other than the mattress the room was quite comfortable. The hotel restaurant offers a delicious breakfast, order from the menu or buffet but it is quite pricey.  Hotel staff as well as restaurant staff were friendly and efficient.  A relatively short walk to Broadway. Overall I had a great stay but some will find it's too expensive others will think it's worth it.Beautiful hotel and pool. Enjoyed my stay there very much. And the fried green tomatoes in the restaurant were a delight.My wife and I came for our anniversary and let me tell you... By far the best Hotel experience I've had! It started with the valet being super polite and had outstanding customer service. We check in and they told us they had gave us a free upgrade. Come to find out we go to the 18th floor and walked into our room. They upgraded us to a king suite!!!! The room was AMAZING! Huge living room, huge bathroom with a tub, 2 toilets haha, and the list goes on. I will be saying with Omni in the future, they earned my business for life!Loved this Hotel in the heart of Music City.  Was here for NHL All Stars. Central to all the All Star activities. Beautiful hotel with great restaurants. Kitchen Notes Restaurant  was great for breakfast & brunch. Lovely Southern feel.  Barlines was the house bar with nightly country music. Mexican restaurant with outside eating is where we snacked on tortillas & guacamole & listened to country music.   Country Music Hall of Fame is part of the hotel.  Just walk down hall & U are there.  Mostly friendly staff.  We had a ball Y'All !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!We stayed here during our stay in Nashville. We wanted a place to stay that was close to everything and boy is it! The Omni hit the mark on everything from cleanliness, vibe, service, amenities, atmosphere, view, convenience and location, location, location! We had an incredible view that stunned us every morning and every night, just gorgeous! Our room was very comfortable, functional, and modern with above average amenities.  The hotel overall had amazing music themed decor and a fun vibe. Honestly, I can't say enough positive things about this hotel. We loved our stay here and plan to stay here on our next visit to Nashville.The Omni Nashville is gorgeous, the lobby has high ceilings and a beautiful chandelier, it also has a swanky library-like waiting room that is kinda cool to meet in or hang out in.The location is great if you are going to honky Tonks but also great if you want to have a nice place to return to after those Honky Tonks. The food offerings in the hotel are great, there is a steak house, a bar called Barlines, fresh-farm to fork style restaurant, coffee shop and attached to a museum which has a great taco shop called Taco Sexto or something like that.The rooms are great, the beds are very comfortable and allow you to sleep well.Become an Omni Select member, you get free wifi and a free hot beverage delivered to your door every morning.Also, the customer service is great, i tend to have many many questions and I called the front desk multiple times and they answered all my questions and were always friendly and accommodating.I noticed a Retreat to Romance package on the hotel website, which i thought sounded perfect for my fiance and I! I booked everything online through the hotels direct website and was very excited. When I went back to look at confirmation e-mail I noticed that there was no sign of the package I thought I was getting, which said it's not supposed to expire until December 30, 2016. I called to hotel to inquire about that and was first set up with someone very rude who basically said, "that isn't even something we offer. Do you want to keep the reservation or not?" So I called back again to speak to a different person, just because I want to know what I'm paying for. I spoke to a woman whose name I think was Michelle and she was very, nice, calm and helpful. I don't think she worked at the actual Nashville location, as she put me on hold to "call their front desk and ask about this." She said that the Nashville's location isn't offering this package currently but i could pay for a bottle of wine to be in the room upon delivery. I e-mailed the hotel customer service before any of these phone calls to see about my reservation and I didn't get a single response. I'm thoroughly disappointed in the customer service I received. If it's not something that they're offering any longer, then it should not be on the website and definitely shouldn't let me click and book it with a confirmation number at the end. I'm not even sure I want to keep my reservation after the horrible service I received from the first woman.Wow, what a beautiful new hotel in Nashville.  I normally stay at another chain, but The Omni was booked as part of a meeting and I was pumped that I was able to check it out.First class valet service and a beautiful spacious lobby.  They have a few shops throughout the hotel too as well as a couple of restaurants one being what looked like an upscale steakhouse.  Honestly, I wish I had another night there to properly explore the entire property.  My room was a very nice size and of course modern. I don't get any extra benefits at the Omni and my room was quite nice.The exercise room is the best I have ever seen at a hotel. A really big space with plenty of cardio machines, free weights, weight machines, kettle balls, etc....trust me everything you would need.  They also have a very nice outside pool so bring your swimsuit....This is the tale of two hotels  - or desk help. It was the best of rooms, it was the worst of rooms. I was coming to a conference and arrived with 22 of my people. The woman orchestrating it was seriously dialed in. I arrived late after everyone only to discover that they didn't have a room. Due to the ice storms in the area, no availability until the next day. Seriously? 21 other people set up correctly, I was missed, there's an epic ice storm, and no availability? The woman at the counter was super nice and said she would check with her manager. Came back several minutes later and had a room! Last one and would put me into it. I thought, 1st floor or disabled guest room. I arrived and it was the exec suite. Holy cow it was nice. I felt like I was in the movies it was so epic.Stayed a week, told everyone how I got super upgraded. Then when I checked out I almost wanted to throw up. They charged me top rate for an exec suite. I'm like, this will get me fired! No way the new person said, I'll knock $100 off. Like it was already 7x my companies policy rate. Imagine how that went over as I tried to explain to my COO. With 21 people, I'd have told someone to share a room if I had known that. Counter person #1 led me to believe I was being upgraded. Had I known, I may have even switched later in the week.I still feel gouged. Check your rate if you ever get switched rooms is the moral of the story. And my sign in didn't have a rate! Make sure it's there.Tale of two hotels - or hostesses. Great room. wonderful place. nice people. Stayed for weather. Over charged like a maniac.Very nice, beautiful and modern hotel.  3 restaurants and a bar on location.  Great food for room service!  Free wifi!  All around a great place and great experience.Rooms are beautifully appointed, very classy and elegant - the fiance was impressed. Too bad I didn't get a chance to really utilize the room because I was attending my conference at the very convenient Convention Center right across the street.The front desk and staff were organized and helpful as well as the print center which allowed for complimentary printing of our boarding passes and tickets. Though we didn't use the gym, it was clean and provided towels and headphones. There are restaurants attached, some small shops, many conference rooms and room key activated elevators. Bottled water and wifi was also complimentary in the rooms.The one thing this place is really missing is breakfast. They do not have a complimentary breakfast that would be the cherry on top of this beautiful place.Overall, I would stay here again as it is convenient to everything! A 7 minute walk to the main strip with bars, food and shops, close to the Bridgestone Area, a stop on one of the hop on/off bus tours and only 15 minutes from the airport. We had a nice short, but very nice stay here!Be very careful of the Omni special offer solicitations. I booked a special weekend get away for my wife and I only to find out the package that I thought I had booked was never offered at my location anyhow. I got all the way through the booking process with a confirmation number without knowing I wasn't booking the package that I had selected.  I literally could've shown up with my wife thinking I had booked a special package only to find out I hadn't booked anything but a standard room. I brought it to the attention of management and they were dismissive at best!  Poor customer service!For OMNI's 100th review I must say this hotel is GRAND!!!  This OMNI is sexier than the OMNI DTLA, not bad for my first impression of Nashville Downtown.  I had the pleasure of staying at the OMNI for a business conference so I decided to fly in on Sunday and get settled in before a week of meetings and to explore!  Whoa, just WOW, from the minute my taxi dropped me off, I was greeted by the most pleasant professional bellman (why can't Californians be this polite)? must be a TN thang? The entrance is just marvelous, ample seating throughout,  exquisite chandeliers that are eye catching and how can I forget...you're instantly greeted by the sound of Tennessee country and rock music faintly playing in the background. Check-in was also a very pleasant and speedy experience!  Professional. I went up to my room and continued to be WOW'd by all the charmed detail! Fun artwork, large desk, one hell of a fluffy king tufted bed, pantry with a mini fridge, bottled waters (join their specialty program, sign up online to take advantage of the free perks) a large sexy bathroom with a beautiful walk in shower with glass doors from floor to ceiling, average vanity products (though I ended up donating my products at my conference to a charity project) so I can't speak to the quality. Excellent views of downtown from the 15th floor.  Luxurious robes and slippersExcellent location, walking distance from Broadway, and believe it or not we walked all around town in 35-40 degree weather.  Yep, that's right this Cali gal survived the cold.I tried all of their restaurants since this was home for the week.  Barlines - 4 stars This place was loads of fun (great for pre and post cocktails) excellent space for networking after the conference, live acts playing, some knocked it out of the park and others well lets just say they should keep their day jobs. Nonetheless, entertaining after a glass or two.  Mainly bar type food.  Their pulled pork sandwich was a solid three stars.  Insane whiskey list and decent beer and wine lists.  Great friendly service.Kitchen Notes - 5 stars(review to follow)ORDER THE BRUNCH BUFFET !!!!!!!!!!!!!!! $19.99 Likely one of the best hotel breakfast/brunches I've had in a while, again great customer service, sexy decor and DELICIOUS food.  Nuff said.  Bongo Java Coffee Shop - met all my coffee and tea needs! 4 stars Bob's Steak & Chop House - review to follow  solid 3.5 starsThe hotel is very big, inside is a super cool poster shop called Hatch and a few large gift shops you're sure to find something to meet all your needs.  I fell in love with their mason jar shot glass and guitar magnets!  Nearby the convention center, The Grand Ole Opry and did I mention it's connected to the Country Music Hall of Fame and...the Broadway strip? :) score!So with all the above praise you're probably scratching your head on why the four stars? Well,  I'm your stickler traveler that inspects her room before I even begin to unpack. Yep I pull back all the bedding, inspect the bathrooms, closets etc.  I found my bedding to be stained on both the comforter and sheets and noticed my toilet bowl was not cleaned, if you know what I mean. I immediately contacted the front desk and they rectified  my situation promptly and professionally.  I was offered complimentary wine and cheese plate (pretty standard at hotels when they have a mishap) to which I gracefully accepted.My overall experience was a very good one, including my experience at the conference which was also held on the 2nd and 3rd floors of the OMNI.  We were provided breakfast and lunch on most days and the food and service were just great!  I would definitely return to this OMNI when in Nashville!Attended a conference here, didn't sleep here (rooms were booked). Although the front doors present a grand appearance, they are heavy and quite cumbersome. I don't know how anyone with a suitcase could manage, and many I witnessed could not.  There were valets to help with the first set but you're on your own for the second set. Place was clean and restrooms were kept clean even with the many conference attendees descending on them at breaks. Unbelievably, there was not courtesy coffee & tea in the lobby - something my hotel (across the street) provided. In general, room arrangement for the conference was convoluted and not very well planned out. Based on this experience I would not choose to stay here.Oh Omni, how I wish all hotels were like you. We arrived early Saturday morning and we're able to check in right away. The room was beautiful and had big windows, but the view was not so great. The bathroom was big and has a box shower, toilet, single sink, a lot of counter space and a magnifying mirror. The room had a king bed and a couch. It was decorated very well.Concierge: we spoke with Lauren and Ryan and both were SO helpful. They each gave us so many great recommendations about Nashville and also got us tickets to the Opry for that night. Convenience: there is a car at the hotel which will take you anywhere in the city that's within a 3 mile radius. Our drivers were Joe and Jason and were also so nice and helpful giving us some ideas of where to go and what to do. You just go down to the concierge desk to request the car or you can call a number which they give you upon check in. Within the hotel there is a bar (Barlines) which is very good - I have a review for that place - a cool poster shop called Hatch, 2 restaurants (one steakhouse and the other we went to for breakfast but I'm pretty sure they have lunch and dinner there too), a little food shop and the country music hall of fame. The hotel is very big and open and all the staff we spoke with was very nice and welcoming.First time here at the Omni.  We are on the 21st floor.  What a view!  Beds are comfy.  Showers are nice - with all the products you need for shampoo, etc.  The only minus is their shuttle staff isn't too friendly compared to everyone else.  I would definitely come back!  Oh I forgot to mention the gorgeous library with a large gas fireplace- so comfortable!
review_content_20: This hotel is supposed to be one of the nicest ones around and you would think for the price we paid it would be. But alas no. There was food under the bed. The sheets and bedding was dirty. And one of the days there was even blood on one of the sheets. The shower liner had mildew on the bottom. When brought to the attention of the housekeeper supervision the issues were fixed. But in my opinion when you spend 200+$ a night there should NEVER be an issue. When we check out tomorrow we will let management know about the issues and see what happens. I will update laterThis is a beautiful new hotel in downtown Nashville with one of the only outdoor pools in town. It's a pricey date though, and we had some service issues that I wouldn't expect at that price point. We paid to stream Amazon prime and it cut in and out - when we called for service we got an apology, but no help or reimbursement. Same story on a disgusting housekeeping oversight. The spa is great and the pool is very nice, but I'd wait to visit again after some competition opens and they have to get the service a little tighter, or drop the price.I thoroughly enjoyed my trip to Nashville, and stay at the Omni, for the 2015 Anytime Fitness conference. It was beautiful, we got an incredible suite, and everything was so clean!!Rotten. 1. Thermostats are Motion sensored without an override. So every night you wake up at 3am drenched in sweat from a 10 degree increase in your room temp. If you set it at its lowest setting (65) it doesn't get past 68 no matter what. 2. Fridge in room didn't work. Coldest setting had new milk spoiled within a day. 3. Room didn't get cleaned daily. 4. Despite reservation request no crib in room at check in. Took a couple of hours to get one. Absolutely nothing worth writing home about. Won't stay here again-image tainted for Omni overall.Beautiful hotel,  great staff!   The team is always smiling and eager to assist with any needs.  Will definitely keep this hotel on the list for my return to Nashville!This hotel ranks in our top 2 faves in Nashville. We stayed several days before our children joined us for Thanksgiving in the city unexpectedly. The staff is not only professional, but they all seemed truly interested in making our stay fabulous. They handled a last minute room change to accommodate 4 more with ease and offered excellent recommendations on area events & dining. In room dining was always prompt and the food was above average at a minimum. The hotel restaurants are both top notch, but, the chai at the hotel's coffee shop was probably the worst I've ever had, ever. But, I digress. Kitchen Notes' Thanksgiving brunch was so phenomenal that I'm reconsidering our yearly traditions to accommodate coming back again and again. The suite we stayed in had amazing views from the 15th floor. The beds and bathrooms were both above par for the area. All in all, the room, the front desk and bell staff delivered WOW. Which is exactly what we look for when finding our "go-to" spots when we travel. Omni is now written in permanent marker at the top of our Nashville list.In all fairness, I have to add the couple of downsides I found: 1. Valet seemed to be very unorganized and dirty at times, with trash cans overflowing, etc. It's unfortunate that they are the first and last impression of the hotel because they really didn't match the level of service or presentation found once we walked through the doors. 2. The business center is completely sketchy and I felt like I was breaking and entering when I had to print business docs off after 6pm during our stay. Once inside, the system was so complicated to even access the internet, that I ended up leaving early the next morning and stopping by another hotel to get my work finished. I have 2 college degrees and even the front desk couldn't walk me through the computer home screen. That's just overkill. Minor details, but really disappointing because the hotel has all the right things to be THE best!First off everyone is very professional and accommodating.  Valet, Bellman, Check in Staff all top notch.  The hotel has great views of the city line and is very convenient to Bridgestone.  I found the room to be ample and modern and served our needs.  I have eaten at all of the restaurants and you cant go wrong and they meet all price ranges.  The notes buffet is a good way to start your day!While you pay more, the extras are there and the hotel is still fairly new.  Remember to join their specialty program to take advantage of their benefits!!I am very disappointed with the Omni Hotel! I'm writing this review because I really wanted to get a job working at the Omni. After calling and calling leaving a few messages for the HR Department, I still did not hear anything! My application and resume was very professional and impressive! I applied for the Spa Attendant position and have worked at many spas and salons in my past work history. I have 10 years of customer service experience along with 8 years in retail/sales! I would of been perfect for this position. So, finally I emailed them pretty much begging or an interview, they emailed me back and we set up a phone interview! They never called so I called the HR Department making sure I wasn't supposed to call them instead! I never heard back from them! I am disgusted with how unprofessional they are! I will never go back to the hotel.As a Nashville local, I typically don't stay in hotels here. However, my Wife and I decided to stay there last night and eat at Bobs for dinner. Awesome room! Extremely helpful staff. This will be a regular thing for us. Free wi-fi would be a nice touch.For my first ever visit to Nashville, I could not have asked for a better place to stay!  The hotel itself is gorgeous!  High ceilings, beautiful warm colors and dramatic light fixtures.  The staff is friendly and warm and and access to everything is a breeze.  The Bongo Java coffee shop is great!  the coffee is not your run of the mill stuff and the staff is super cute!  Kitchen Notes is a wonderful dining option as well.  The serve breakfast, lunch and dinner and the space is gorgeous, bright and chic and the food is deelish!  Their unlimited biscuit bar is worth a visit.  Aside from the lobby and restaurants, the rooms are beautiful.  Mine was on the 21st floor and had the most amazing view of Nashville. There was cool art on the wall, cozy robes in the closet and good lighting in the bathroom.  Room service was reasonable and quick and all the electrical outlets and USB ports were super helpful while working an charging up. The location is pretty fantastic and a quick walk from SoBro and Broadway.  It is across from the Bridgestone Arena and the Country Music Hall of Fame (which is also worth a visit)Overall a great property and I look forward to staying here again soon!Celebrating 15 year anniversary in Nashville and so glad we selected to stay at the Omni. We were upgraded to a suite and how sweet it was. The view of Nashville from our room was wonderful and so close to much of what should be seen in downtown.The Omni is a beautiful hotel in downtown Nashville. It's a very short walk to downtown and most tourist attractions. The hotel staff is VERY friendly. On multiple occasions the women cleaning the other hotel rooms would step out and say hello to me. They have late night room service and I ordered a pizza one evening that wasn't too bad (I don't expect much from room service at 3am). I LOVED the bath/shower. Great water pressure! The shampoo and conditioner were really nice too. The lotion has a great scent!My only complaint about the Omni is the television. There are very limited stations to choose from and many of them were not working on my TV. You can purchase movies to watch but it was $12+ even for indie films. Usually I'll bring my Amazon Fire TV or HDMI cable to watch movies and listen to music in my hotel room but Omni is sneaky and doesn't give you the ability to change the input on the TV. So, if you have children who will need to be entertained or want to spend a lot of time relaxing in the comfy hotel bed, this place is not ideal.Beautiful hotel. Great staff. Every need taken care of. What else can I say !Can't wait to visit again.I am a HUGE Omni fan. I stay at an Omni whenever I can. This Omni just doesn't have that "Omni" luxurious and catered to feel about it. It is just missing that "thing" most Omni's have. The Omni is an excellent location and beautiful hotel. I felt like my only option was to valet park. I think there is self parking but it's not very close to the hotel. I didn't like that. I would rather have easy access to my vehicle. Concierge was rude and she came off as talking down to me. When I asked a simple question she acted like I was an idiot. The room was nice and clean. The bed was not as comfortable as I would have expected at this price point. The excellent location is what interested me in the Omni. I will definitely go back to the Nashville hotel I usually stay with (Loews Vanderbilt)on my next trip. It's worth the Uber ride. The Omni would be a close second to Loews Vanderbilt.Whoa!Where did this come from? In fact, where did all this Downtown exuberance come from? You'll have to forgive me: I've been gone for a long while. Things don't look as familiar as I'd thought. When I first heard that I was staying in a hotel in Downtown and I couldn't place the cross streets, I prepared myself for some polite 'mhms' and judging -- even though I knew it was an Omni. I couldn't have been more wrong.This is an Omni from top to bottom. It's just... grand. The exterior of the building creates excitement. There's so much hustle and bustle and the black onyx exterior is just crazy sexy. Walking in, you have no choice but to be overwhelmed (in a good way). The lobby is cavernous. The chandeliers are impressive. The seating is ample. And, THERE'S PINK LEMONADE AT THE READY! Done. Done. I was satisfied from that moment. You had me at 'hello.'Check-in was a breeze and my agent was chatty and kind. Good impressions. I went up to my room and... yes. This was the life I was meant for. My Deluxe King Suite fit me like a glove. The room had multiple defined areas making the 'suite' designation accurate. I was charmed with the ornate bureau, fun (and thoughtful) artwork, solid wood desk, overstuffed bed, butler pantry, luxe robes, vanity products, and sinfully-wonderful bathroom. I would have been happy spending all my time in the hotel and room. Loved it.So, with all this praise... 4 stars? Yes. Unfortunately, there was an incident at the hotel. During my trip, I got my hands on a custom pint glass. I collect pint glasses. I drink lots of beer. I love my pint glasses. I left my glass on my desk near my datebook and satchel. I came back to my room... and the pint glass wasn't there. Was it stolen? Thrown away? I called the front desk... and received indifference. They, eventually, forwarded me to housekeeping... who never returned my repeated calls. In the grand scheme of things... it's a pint glass. But the experience did dull some of the exuberance I had up until then. Come here and enjoy... but keep your items packed/hidden/in a safe?I just attended and worked at an event held at the Omni Hotel. Everything was top notch, first class and outstanding. The staff were helpful, courteous and professional. The food was great the bar service excellent. If you have an event or a function the Omni is the place to go.Nashville has needed a hotel like this for a long, long time.  In general, I have usually stayed close to Vanderbilt and taken a car to downtown if I needed.  The Omni gives me a reason to stay downtown again.  The hotel is great on its own, but the location and proximity to Broadway, the new convention center, etc sure doesn't hurt.  The rooms are nice, well appointed, and decent sized.  Many of the views are great.  The pool during the summer is supposed to be some sort of 'scene', but I looked and only found some people that were in dire need of some rays working on taking corrective action.  That being said, it is a nice pool.  Gym isn't bad at all.  I've been in the suites and they are big and perfect for a group HQ if you are having a fun weekend in town. The staff from the front desk on is great.  I say from the front desk on because I think the valet, bellmen, and doorman situation is something I would expect at a Holiday Inn Express.  Total confusion in the front and not much hustle.  And this was on a Wednesday afternoon.  I basically had to walk inside and grab a bellman to help out my wife....because, for some reason, despite the fact that SHE WAS WEARING A WEDDING GOWN and was getting out of a black car, no one asked her if she needed any help.  Really poor.  I'm not sure what the doorman situation really is, but I have rarely seen that post manned by anyone willing to open a door.  (I have, however, seen a few doorman looking people standing in the lobby talking amongst themselves).  Again, easy to fix, but at this level, it shouldn't have to be fixed, it should just be there, you know?  But, I'm not going to let that take away from the review.  Every time I have been here, the front desk staff has been warm and accommodating when asked.  All the facilities are still nice, shiny, and new.  All this comes at a price, and it seems that the Omni is kind of pushing Nashville rates to a new level, but if anyone can get it, they should be able to.I was here for a conference and was blown away by the facilities. Honestly, I live in Nashville and had never been to this hotel before (didn't really even know where it was, exactly). Everything you see, touch, and smell are super high quality. It's trendy  and comfortable without being too modern (Hotel Indigo), too stuffy, or too overbearing. This a great spot in downtown Nashville.Bonus points: They have a Bongo Java on the first floor. Bongo Java=Great coffee.NASHVILLE, TN: The Nashville Omni is the premiere property in Nashville and is a delight.  The hotel is large and spacious, the rooms are clean and modern, but with some "NashVegas" decor in them.  It pumps appropriate music all day and night in the lobby to get you in the Nashville mood.  The service is good and the location is stellar, right downtown next to the best eating and nightlife.Very nice hotel. Front desk staff and concierge staff were very helpful. The room was always cleaned at a high level. Our folio was emailed to us when we woke up on our check out day. Bar Lines was a great scene with good food, drinks and live entertainment!!! Breakfast buffet was yummy with tons of choices. I would have given them a 5 star review but we went for a convention and the catering/convention department left a lot to be desired:(
review_content_40: Beautiful hotel in a great location. Directly across from Music City Center and walkable to most attractions. Attached to the Hall of Fame. Fun shops (Hatch Printing and Five and Ten). Nice food and beverage choices at Barlines and Kitchen Notes. Nice quiet fireplace area. Friendly staff. The only downside is pretty bad housekeeping service. Left the room at 7:30 AM one day, back at 5, room not cleaned. Another day, bed made, all wrinkled, towels eschew in bathroom, and used barware in the room.Finally, nice roof pool with attentive staff.Stayed here with my wife for two nights. Very nice hotel. Although, I reserved a room with a King bed, I was put into a room with two double beds. The valet was very helpful and nice. It is $30/day for valet parking. The gentleman who assisted us with the luggage was an excellent representative for the hotel.   The first morning the housekeeping crew came through and was a little pushy with my wife in regards to cleaning the bathroom even though she was using it. They set the used coffee cups and a glass outside the door on the floor in the hallway.  These items stayed in the hall all day long. The shower was great. It had plenty of pressure and we were on the 16th floor.  Being that high, afforded us a wonderful view of the city.  We overlooked the Music City Center.Almost everything you'd expect from a five star hotel...*Friendly valet and reception? check.*Spacious lobby and comfortable rooms? check.*Adequate fitness room and pool? check.*Bathroom amenities and robes? check.*Convenient location? check.This hotel is brand new, modern and beautifully furnished... it's clean also.  The one thing missing was a mini bar in the room, which is not a necessity, but nice to have.  They do have several restaurants on-site, but I didn't get a chance to check them out during my two-night stay.  There is something else a bit off, but I can't quite put my finger on it.  Regardless, I had a very pleasant stay here during Yelp's Spring Break and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel or stay here again in the future.  Whether traveling for work or pleasure, you can't go wrong at the Omni Hotel in Nashville!While the Omni isn't terrible, it is incredibly expensive for what you get and I can't imagine coming back.If you have a car, the parking options are bad and overpriced-valet or overnight parking. Despite calling ahead for the car to be ready early the next morning, the valets did not have any records and we were left waiting for 10+ minutes. There's absolutely no vending machines inside; if you want a snack or soda late at night, you're out of luck. Make sure to sign up for the Rewards program to get free wireless internet.Last-check out the Country Music Hall of Fame exhibits tucked behind the elevators. You'll find some cool costumes and the Hatch Show Print Shop.I can't think of one thing I didn't like about my stay at the Omni Hotel, aside from the raucous guests who were partying loudly on night one in the room across the hall from mine (they were kicked out of the hotel, from what I later heard). Okay I lied. There was one slight snafu at check-in, though it was quickly rectified. The woman I checked-in with said my reservation had been cancelled. I assured her that I had not cancelled my reservation as I was there for a work trip. She was able to get me into a room and no further problems were experienced. (I have a feeling the cancellation probably happened when I called a few weeks before the trip to inquire about something to do with my room, though at no point did I say that I wanted to cancel my reservation.) The guest room was large and had everything I needed. I love when the nightstands have outlets built right in - so convenient! The room and bathroom were spacious and very clean. I felt very comfortable staying there for the three nights I was in town.My colleague and I took advantage of the UPS business center and transactions were seamless. I also hit the coffee shop on several occasions which was solid. Finally, the gift shop had a really vast selection of necessities, which was great because it didn't seem like there were any pharmacies nearby.  The location of this hotel really can't be beat. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again!Omni Hotels aren't typically my first choice, but it's definitely the place to stay in Nashville. Between Yelp's Spring Break, 3 weddings and (what seemed like) a zillion bachelor/bachelorette parties this was a happening place last weekend.It's a very large hotel with a grand looking lobby. My room was modern, spacious and clean. My view wasn't anything special, but then again Nashville isn't known for it's scenery.I did make use of their massive gym, which has every piece of equipment you could need to get in a good workout. I also spotted a nice outdoor swimming pool. Note to self: bring a bathing suit next time.Unfortunately, I had to cut my trip to Nashville a day short due to an emergency back home. They couldn't have been more accommodating at the front desk and didn't charge me for the night I skipped.Overall, it was a very pleasant stay and they'd be one of the first hotels I'd look into for future visits to Nashville.Stayed at the Omni Downtown Nashville for Yelp Spring Break! Although I didn't get the special Yelp rate, I did book through a deal website and got a similar discount. I believe it was about 230 a night. I stayed in a double room with 4 girls total. At first I was a bit horrified that 4 girls would be sharing a bathroom and living space. However, the Omni really stepped it up a notch by letting us use the spa facilities to "freshen up" before and after our check in/out. I couldn't believe it! The spa welcomed us with open arms and we got to use their mirrors, lotion, hairspray, sinks and showers. How very accommodating!  Also, the lobby offered us free bottles of water. When we had a mix up and asked for the free water sent to our room and they sent fancy bottled water for $$, they apologized and let us have the fancy water for free! So nice. We had also requested some champagne flutes and forks sent up because we were celebrating a birthday and had cake and champagne. Another amazing freebie was the Omni personal driver. Too bad we found out about it a bit too late, but we loved our driver Justin. They will take you anywhere within a 3 mile radius of the hotel FO FREE. The pool area is seriously awesome. The hottub can easily fit 20 people and I just love the cabanas and how they are first come first served, unlike dumb Vegas hotels where you have to pay for 'em. Loved the gym too with free water and headphones!All in all, I felt the Omni went above and beyond my expectations for a hotel. I definitely recommend it to anyone traveling to Nashville and will hopefully stay here again next time.This hotel had everything we expected and needed. Ample free parking, room was clean and spacious, coffee available in the lobby, friendly staff. We stayed here the night before my friend wedding. Great value for the money.Hotel - beautiful, large, welcoming, comfortable and very clean. The grand entrance had a welcoming committee to greet and open the very heavy large doors, ample seating, a separate conciergeleft of the front desk, a 'library' area which was private enough to read the newspaper quietly or just relax, a car service to bring you anywhere, places to eat, drink, shop and tour. A great location with the Country Music Hall of Fame and Hatch Print Gallery attached to the hotel along with gift shops, coffee shops (Dunkin Donuts next door) a delicious steakhouse (make reservations), lots of shopping, tours and restaurants in walking distance around the main street, Broadway. Each room has a nice work area in front of the large windows and a small refrigerator (so bring your own water). Don't expect a tub in these rooms, stall shower with adequate pressure is what you'll find here. The TV is great, however be prepared to pay for wi-fi. Parking - valet or self park in the building next door. We opted for self park and always found a spot on the ground floor. It's a short walk to the hotel, so be prepared to walk about 1 city block. Staff - very friendly and extremely resourceful!  I wish I could list all of their names, but everyone was professional, knowledgable, friendly, extremely helpful and knew the in's and out's of the city!  I had 2 days by myself in May 2015 while my husband was at a conference and was set up to go on a bunch of tours, 2 of which kept me in the hotel and then I walked to the  Ryman, Johnny Cash museum, Goo Goo's Chocolates and Betty's Boot Shop which are worth mentioning as they were fun things to do alone prior to meeting back up with my husband and driving to the Bluebird Cafe (be prepared and purchase your tickets 2 weeks in advance on-line).  Housekeeping was fantastic and a daily tip didn't seem enough for keeping our room in such perfect order. They even folded my clothes which I had quickly tossed on the bed as we were running late for a show. Southern hospitality rocks!Would recommend this OMNI for the location, staff, comfort (the bed was so comfortable for a hotel, as we were in 6 hotels over the course of 3 weeks and this was the most comfortable), and services. You get what you pay for and it's worth every dollar spent!I was here with 25,000 strong for the 2015 Beachbody Summit, and nothing about this hotel was disappointing. The staff were all very friendly and the rooms were extremely nice and well-kept. There were 4 of us sharing most rooms, and I was in the same boat with two females, one being pregnant, and her husband....needless to say, we weren't always the tidiest being on the go and needing multiple showers after workouts galore, not to mention that comfort was a necessity. This place always had our room turned down and cleaned up daily, our towels changed out and you would never have been able to tell we were a group of smelly, sweaty fitness buffs!! We enjoyed an amazing breakfast buffet every day and even lunch and a few cocktails in the hotel restaurant, as well as room service. The seminars and workouts that were held in the Omni were comfortable and easy to get to. I was sad I didn't get a room booked in time for next year, but the fact that it's sold out within 20-minutes is telling that we all didn't hate the stay!!Great location, clean and modern.  We had a blast in Nashville for the weekend and loved the Omni.  They have a nice rooftop pool, perfect for bachelors and bachelorette stop relax during the day.  Next time I'm in Nashville I know where to stay.The hotel to stay in Nashville is the Omni hotel!My friend and I were treated like queens from the time we arrived for Yelp Spring Break until we checked out a few days later. Our room on the 12th floor was beautiful, clean, the beds were some of the most comfortable I've slept in and massaging shower. I actually felt like I had a back massage after getting out of the shower each day. The hotel is right in the middle of all of the action with the Country Music Hall of Fame, Hatch Show Prints right in the complex. All of their team were extremely friendly, helpful from arriving at valet, check in, staff taking bags to our room, the cleaning staff - perfect stay all around.When I return to Nashville there's only one place to stay The Omni Hotel!Love this hotel! The staff is incredibly helpful & friendly. Large rooms & comfy beds! The pool area is pretty cool-has a lounge deck & pool bar area. The restaurants & museums are great!We stayed here in the month of June on a random weekend getaway. You have the option to valet , but keep in mind you can use the overnight parking a street over which is 18 bucks a day ..We used lots of room service , my fave cocktail was the " bees knees" . And the beds are super comfy.. We didn't need to get back in our cars the entire weekend , we walked to the local restaurants and bars .  The internet service is very slow so I used their wifi which is 10 dollars a day added to your bill.. NoteMy only concern was the Sunday before our departure we went to the restaurant for brunch . I ordered 1 mimosa and it was 50 bucks . Didn't know that until I got ready to leave. I'm assuming I bought a champagne bottle for that rate so my server should've asked if I needed my glass refilled . Other than that all in all my stay was okBEST HOTEL IN NASHVILLE!And here's the pointers: -Rooftop Pool with Bar. Probably the best in the downtown area with plenty of space to relax, swim, and lay in the hot tub. -Complimentary coffee every morning for each person in the coffee shop. You get a card and have to fill out what you want and you can bring the card with you the next day. -Complimentary shuttle with the nicest drivers within 3 miles and all you have to do is call the number on the card or go to the lobby. They will pick you and give you an estimated time of how long it may take. Depending on the time and day, it can be anywhere from 10-30 minutes or no wait time! They will even take you from one place to another in Nashville. -The museum tour begins at the hotel and everything is walking distance. I would stay here again and no place else. OMNI is perfect!Beautiful hotel, great staff, amazing food! Best hotel in Nashville,  and it's close by attractions.  If your looking to relax (like myself) you can do that here. The staff goes put of there way to make you comfortable.Hotel is amazing. The service in the restaurant is despicable. They need a serious management adjustment- especially with Katie. They are losing a ton of business because of who they employ. We came down from NYC to stay at the Omni and our experience was ruined because of Katie and her staff. She should be fired immediately. Her horrible judgement and disgusting attitude is a poor representation of the hotel and customer service in general. Wouldn't return because of that staff.Don't get a room on the bar side of the hotel.Our room was wonderful, with great views.The service was OK.But, really the noise rom the bar was excessive and lasted until after 2 AM!.We called several times, but they couldn't do anything (Its their bar!)We were very unhappy and tired.We will not stay here again until they can fix their own noise issue.The hotel overall was very nice and the room was also good. The location also made it very easy to get to the multiple areas for nightlife and was walking distance. We would stay here again if we traveled back to Nashville.I always love this hotel and this trip is no exception.The shuttle is great - you can get just about anywhere in the city that you need to be quickly.  But the location is such that, at least for most attractions and dining, it is a gentle walk.If you don't have a club card, get one.  They will press clothes, shine shoes and deliver free coffee/water/paper at no cost.  It probably helps with the upgrade when you request on at the desk as well.For this trip I am a flier, but parking is available at the hefty price one could expect.The staff is lovely and very warm.
review_content_60: Very conflicted with this review. Yes, nice hotel, nice staff, good location.But,Don't nickle and dime me for WiFi.Do a better job of answering the Valet phone. And this place is a little noisy...as in you hear people walking and talking in the hallway while you are trying to sleep.But, I really like their bar - "Barlines" which is a combo singer/songwriter stage, dance floor, and sports bar.Yes, I will gladly stay there again...just wish a few of the very minor items were taken care of.The good, the bad, and the ugly.This new beautiful hotel has all the little touches that make your stay that much more enjoyable. Lots of towels in your bathroom, and they aren't wimpy small towels either. Outlets all over the room, even one inches away from your pillow. There is no mini bar in your room but they have a mini bar menu you can order from and they bring it up to you, and the prices aren't crazy high...$2 soda.The Internet costs $14.95 a day for premium to have faster Internet, otherwise I think it's $10 a day. I think it should be free, since I'm paying $179 a night.The one thing that is absolutely driving me nuts right now at 6:30am (after my first night here I'm still on PDT so really it feels like 4:30) is you can hear everything going on outside your window! I'm on the 19th floor (out of 21) and hear loud trucks, the train, and now construction!!! MY STAY WAS JUST ABOUT PERFECT UNTIL I CANT EVEN SLEEP IN! this is probably why I'm giving it three stars otherwise it would be a four. And four because they don't have a shuttle to and from the airport.Great location nice rooms. They could get some scented candles going... Some weird smells in the hallways. But otherwise. Nice.We had a great stay at the Omni, and it's a gorgeous facility. A few highlights:- We arrived early (9 AM) on day of check-in and they gave us a room anyway. Plus, it was a corner room with a great view.- When they were late with our morning beverage (definitely sign up for the Select Guest program), they sent up a full carafe with a tray of treats and a handwritten apology note.- The desk provided numerous supplies, sewing kits, etc. when needed and were super quick.- The location is phenomenal--walkable to anywhere, attached to the CMHOF.- The coffee shop is an actual, good, hip coffee shop.The negatives:- It's pricey, but you do get what you pay for.- The tax is surprisingly high ($40 per night on our room).Great place to stay in Nashville, especially for a special occasion. I'd love to go back.Beautiful hotel with plenty to keep you entertained. The sports bar can be a bit loud as they broadcast from there periodically.. but the band later was spot on.  Good food and drink selection.  They also have a nice bourbon/whisky selectionThis review is for the lobby, the restaurants and the ballrooms. I was recently in Nashville for a conference and some of my team stayed at the Omni. Our team dined here every morning for breakfast at the Kitchen Notes restaurant inside the hotel. Kitchen Notes makes me think of sophisticated country when it comes to decor. There's a very airy at-home feeling to the place. Each morning we sat at a large table for all 10 of us and ate the breakfast buffet. Every day we were there there was fresh fruit, oatmeal, Chobani Greek yogurts, three different types of biscuits made from scratch (buttermilk, sundried tomato and lemon poppyseed), gravy to go with the biscuits or butter and different types of scratch made jams, muffins (gluten-free as well), scrambled eggs plain or scrambled eggs with meat and veggies, sausage and bacon. AND, a pan cake. Not a pancake. A CAKE of PAN. It was like a circular 9-in cake that was a pancake. It was cut into triangles slices, like a normal cake. It was so moist and yummy! I highly recommend that cake of pan-ness. The service was great as well. We had large kettles of coffee, orange juice and water scattered around the table. Condiments were brought to you by request. Free creamer was delivered to our table every morning for our coffee. Empty plates were promptly removed. Everyone was amicable and happy to help. The hotel lobby is big. It reminds me of a Vegas hotel lobby. There's a small area that looks like a gentlemen's club with deep leather seating, bookshelves lining the walls and a long fireplace. Comfortable seating everywhere as well. The entire lobby area was kept very clean. The staff were more than happy to answer questions or point you in the right direction. They also have a coffee bar, a fancy steakhouse and a bar/grill. I had the opportunity to go into their Barlines bar and taste a really funky Long Island IT. I don't think the bartender knew what she was doing, but the entire place was packed to capacity and she was really busy. The first night it rained there and the hotel staff had to create a ferry system to shuttle attendees to and from the Omni to the Music City Center. Employees took umbrellas and walked people from the Omni across the street to the MCC and back. It was really nice since they didn't have enough umbrellas and ponchos to give to the thousands of people there.I got to attend a reception on one of their ballrooms one evening. At first I thought the ballrooms were on ground level, but they were one floor up. There's an interactive maps near the check-in counter that pointed me in the right direction. The food at the reception was very tasty. There was a mash potato bar, where you scoop mash potatoes into a martini glass and put toppings on it such as corn, cheese, bacon, brisket and even shrimp! I didn't think the flavors would mesh that well, but they did. There was also lighter fare offered like fruits and cheeses. The food was constantly being replenished and dirty plates were constantly being removed. I can't attest to the quality of the rooms, unfortunately, but I highly recommend eating here or hosting an event.Amazing business conference hotel perfectly laid out with exceptional restaurants, shops and located close to all the action.  Service is exceptional and my wife and I would jump at the opportunity to come back.  Well done Omni owners and staff!Wow, I'm not even sure where to start.  My brand new husband and I were passing through Nashville on the way home to Kansas City and decided to splurge a little and stay at the Omni.  We originally booked a premier king room online about 2 hours before we arrived that day.  Before we even get out of the car, the valet greeted us with such enthusiasm and eagerness to assist.  We go inside of their beautiful and majestic lobby to check in and were greeted by the clerk.  My husband decided to let her know that we were on our honeymoon and see what we could do for a possible upgrade.  She hit a couple of keys and presto, 10 seconds later she said we were upgraded for no additional charge.And wow did she upgrade us.  We were upgraded to a King Suite Executive room on the 15th floor with a beautiful view of downtown Nashville.  We felt like absolute royalty.  This room has 2 bathrooms, shower and tub, double vanity.  2 huge flatscreen TVs, a sitting area, a beautiful bar and an amazing closet. After we had our bags put in our room by the kindest bellhop ever we decided to check out the Country Music Hall of Fame.  We didn't even have to step outside since the Omni is connected to the Hall of Fame entrance.  After about an hour and a half we come back into our hotel room to be greeted by a bottle of champagne on ice, 2 champagne glasses along with a card congratulating us from the front desk staff.  I can assure you, even if we were not upgraded, this hotel is worth every penny.  I cannot rave enough about the helpful and accommodating staff.  We didn't walk past one staff member that didn't smile and make us feel welcome.  Thank you so much Omni for making us feel special.PS-free wifi when you join their free loyalty program!Omni Nashville has created a wannabe Omni loyalist. You know how it normally goes...you find the adorable boutique hotel, but no gym. The conveniently located downtown high-rise with a view, but no full length mirror. The spot with a cozy bed and solid wifi, but no late-night room service. I kept waiting for the "but" from the Omni - it just doesn't exist. No detail was forgotten when building this expansive and centrally located lap of luxury. From the second you arrive, everyone with an Omni name tag makes it their mission to take care of you. From the head concierge guy (I really wish I had gotten his name!) who got me an immediate ride via the complimentary car service, to the doormen with a sense of humor mixed with just the right touch of professional (shout out to Rich), to Cory at the coffee shop who learned my name and my order after one visit, there was not one bad seed. It's evidence that this passionate culture trickles down from corporate and sticks with their employees (who they must take good care of considering their Pollyanna attitudes.)The gym is a definite plus compared to other hotels. It's practically the size of some stand-alone gyms with ample machines, clean sweat towels, cold water, yoga mats - the works. And, oh, the pool. I spent a solid two hours one morning soaking up the sun and the buzz of Downtown Nashville. It's resort-like. One snafu - I wanted to order breakfast at the pool on my last day so the bartender directed me to the phone ordering station with an in-room dining menu and a sign reading "Please dial 0 for food orders." That 0 took me straight to nowhere. To be exact, it took me to quite the sassy operator who put me on hold twice just to ultimately tell me that I needed to go back up to my room on the 18th floor to order room service or wait 50 minutes for poolside delivery. So, I ate breakfast elsewhere. It sounds super picky, but when a hotel works it's way into the upper echelon of my heart, a bitter ending can kind of bum me out. I know I could've said something to a manager/concierge and they would've absolutely righted the wrong, because they had a proven track record throughout my stay, this was just an isolated incident. That teeny mar aside, I will stay in this hotel again and again on repeat trips to Nashville. To me, there's no reason to stay anywhere else. I'm already talking my girlfriend out of having her bachelorette party in New Orleans, just so we can stay in this hotel, and experience Nashville, of course. I understand there's a price tag associated with service like this, and for the Omni's efforts to ensure their guests are happy, I will always be happy to pay that premiumThis hotel was great!!! Close to all the action, friendly , and clean. Would stay here again !Feels very Hard Rock Hotel -- love the feel, great vibe, clean -- awesome options -- great location -- Excellent addition to Nashville --!Excellent excellent hotel.Best lobby I've seen in some time.Too many things to review. Everything about The OMNI is Class Act.Would definitely recommend when staying in Nashville.If you're main purpose in visiting Nashville is to go to the Country Music Hall of Fame, then you must stay here.  The hotel is attached to the Hall and offers you the shortest walk, all indoors to the museum.  In between are a few shops and you can go to as well.Customer service really impressed me.  Very happy overall.  Great location.  Can't really think of anything that wasn't perfect.  Would love to come back!  Highly recommend.I stayed at the Omni in July while attending a conference. This hotel has a fantastic location directly across the street from the Music City Center. I thought I had been told that the two were connected, however, and I couldn't find any skyway nor did anyone I know find one--so be sure to check weather and take an umbrella just in case.The rooms are very nice and comfortable. I stayed in a queen suite, which had a desk (useful since I was there for work), chaise, and the bed was really comfortable. I don't drink coffee or tea, but there was a coffee pot ready and waiting to serve. I did have room service one night, and it was really quite good, with some good things on their menu.Omni has a loyalty program that you can join and one of the perks is their morning beverage service. That starts immediately, on your first visit, so I took advantage and had a glass of orange juice delivered to my room each morning. The other real plus to the loyalty program is free wifi in the hotel room--that alone is worth joining their program prior to your visit. I believe that without membership, you can use free wifi in the lobby, but you would have to pay for it to have access in the room. Even if I never visit an Omni again--quite possible, since I don't generally stay in hotels this expensive--I'm glad I thought to join before I got there so I could avail myself of those fantastic benefits.The Omni gets major points for having lots of outlets! For some reason there are hotels--and I mean even newer ones, like the Aria where I stayed last year--that have hardly any outlets or put them in weird or hard to reach places. Omni had two outlets built into the desk and the bedside table, too. Thanks, Omni! I was able to keep my iPhone and iPad fully charged and didn't have to keep them halfway across the room.This hotel is also connected to Hatch Show Print and the Country Music Hall of Fame. I didn't visit the CMHF, but stopped into Hatch Show Print; if I had done the tour of one or both of these, it's nice that it was so super convenient. There are also two restaurants in the hotel, Kitchen Notes and Barlines, and both were pretty good. Plus, Barlines has live music!Miscommunication about crucial information on part of the Omni staff. Was degraded and insulted multiple times by the Director of Front Offices when I expressed my concern about policies not being provided prior to booking, particularly when I called in advance for that information. We felt so uncomfortable my husband and I decided to cancel the remainder of the reservation and stay elsewhere. The Director coldly informed us he will be charging us for that evening; we had checked in 3 hours before. It really gave a sour start to our Christmas vacation (the next day was Christmas Eve). It truly was the most disappointing hospitality experience I have EVER had.Excellent location, beautiful pool. I loved my room. The shower was gorgeous and spacious, and the bed was very comfortable. I'd definitely recommend staying here if you have to be in Nashville on business or for a conference.When I entered the doors of the Omni on 5th, I felt as though I was whisked away.  It is magnificent.  It is exquisite.  It is unlike any other space Nashville has to offer.  The sleek lines, the smooth marble, beautiful fixtures all add to an amazing space - and that's just the lobby!  I loved the items hanging on the walls that spotlighted both country music and its stars.  I loved the feel and vibe of this place.  I so want to go when I have a better opportunity to explore.  I have a feeling I could walk around all day and still be missing so very much that it has to offer.  This is the kind of place that even I, as a local, would love to stay to be near the heartbeat of Nashville.  If the rooms are as visually striking as the main floor space, visitors are in for a treat.  I look forward to visiting again and again and seeing more of this enchanting edifice.This is truly a hotel designed with the traveler in mind. I could not find fault with anything about the room, the bed, service, etc. Even wireless access, that Achilles heel of every hotel on the planet, always connected quickly and ran like a rocket. Can't remember the last time I had that experience. The elevators are even great, and the close proximity to the new Convention Center makes this a terrific place to stay for a major convention which was exactly the purpose of my trip. Effortless and a pleasing stay, exactly what I want when traveling on business!Great room.  Loved the shower. Convenient to downtown music and restaurants. Yummy breakfast buffet.  Van Morrison tribute band at Barlines.  Would definitely come back.
review_content_80: SURPRISE TAX!Now that I've got your attention, I recently stayed at this hotel and definitely enjoyed my stay, the hotel is beautiful and the staff is friendly- even the house keepers!! The beds are wonderful and the pillows almost made it home in my suitcase.The only downside, I know a lot of people talk about the cost of the hotel, and yes it is more expensive than others but it is really beautiful and you don't have to wait for an elevator (they are split by groups to avoid long waits) however, after spending 300$ a night to book the room, when you go to check in you also get a nice little addition of $50 a night for tax. I get that tax is necessary but that then makes it 350$ a night instead of 300$! Ouch! But you get what you pay for. I'd still stay here again!Luxury: I have been to Nashville many times and stayed at 5 different hotels downtown. This is by far the most upscale. It is almost out of place in Nashville. I've stayed at a couple other Omni hotels and this blows them out of the water.Location: A couple blocks from Broadway, exactly where you want to be. Price: Honestly it is pricey for Nashville, but you get what you pay for. We lucked out and stayed in a room block for a friend's wedding.  Food: You are better off leaving the hotel. You are Nashville... what are you doing eating a the hotel? This didn't affect the rating; expensive drinks and food at any hotel is expected. Pool Bar: Awesome. This alone is reason enough to stay here. One negative is the bartenders are slow. There is always a line of people waiting to get drinks (which are pricey $6-7 a beer!). They need to be better staffed during peak hours. Honestly it wasn't even the crowd, it was just extremely slow bartending. 10 people online for 20 minutes with 2 bartenders...Gym: I work out everywhere I go. This gym has pretty much everything you would need while on travel. Recommend this hotel. I will be back.PS The most confusing elevator system on the planet. Some elevators only reach certain floors. If you have stayed there you know what I am talking about.Bring your pocketbook!The Hotel   This is a very fancy high end hotel and expect to see really nice cars in the valet parking and people wearing expensive suits. You have to use your room key to go anywhere like the elevator, pool, fitness center, and your room so you know this is a secure place. Pool is on the 4th floor, A hot tub that seats probably 20 people, many nice lounging chairs, and a pool to swim laps (Not to play in). There are 2 restaurants inside both higher end. Expect to find very nice fitness equipment that is very new and well maintained.
