Internet is $15 a day but just sign up for there Free perk rewards and you get a free internet and free beverages in the morning. here is other perks i just cant remember, check the website) Also given you are right in the downtown area, it is safe to walk around during the day/night.  --Location--Right next to the country music hall of fame3 Blocks from the Ryman auditorium2 Block from the Bridgestone Arena (NHL hockey arena)5 Blocks to the Tennessee Free Museum (Its Worth It)6 Blocks from the capitalI recently stayed here during a business conference and was very impressed by the Omni! Check-in was a breeze and the lady at the front desk was very courteous to upgrade me to a higher floor in a corner room at my request. They were out of city-facing rooms, which have the best view, and although I overlooked some construction sites, I did have a nice view of the river and Vanderbuilt University in the distance. As others have mentioned, there are two sets of elevators to separate service to the higher versus lower floors. I don't understand why this is so confusing as the elevators are clearly marked and the front desk managers clearly point this out to you upon check-in; it's not different from any other large hotel set-up. My corner room had two full walls of floor-to-ceiling windows to take in the full view of the surrounding area and take in the beautiful glow from the city lights. My room and bathroom were immaculate and I did not notice any weird smells that others reported anywhere in the hallway (although I was on one of the top floors, which have nicer rooms). My favorite things about the room were: 1) the amazingly comfortable beds (they have different pillow options, too); and 2) lots of easily-accessible power outlets (no having to unplug lamps and move furniture around). The only negative to my stay was the beautiful floor-to-ceiling windows would crack loudly from temperature changes, so if you're a light sleeper you might want to get ear plugs from the front desk.The hotel itself was conveniently situated across from the Music City Center (where my conference was held) and right next to the Bridgestone Arena and Country Music Hall of Fame. The main drag of honky-tonks and bars, as well as the symphony house and Ryman Auditorium were within 2-3 blocks and an easy walk.There are several in-house restaurants, including a steakhouse, coffee shop/cafe, bar/grill and casual restaurant. The steakhouse was very pricey, so I didn't go, but I did get coffee and a small bite at the Bongo coffee shop several times and had drinks and late-night appetizers at Barlines several times, as well. I heard from others that the Kitchen Notes casual restaurant was not good. The coffee at Bongo was always well-crafted by the baristas (if not a little slowly, since they pay great attention to their foam art) and the drinks and foods at Barlines were strong and delicious, accompanied by lively bands each night. During the weekend we did have terrible service at Barlines just because they were so busy, but other than that no complaints. There's also a convenience/souvenir store called the Five and Tenn that sells pricey souvenirs and clothing, as well as various toiletries and electronic gadget accessories in the event you leave something at home.The lobby itself is beautiful, with stone floors, stone-covered walls, large lighting pieces and a small collection of country music artifacts.This hotel is incredibly expensive if you don't get a group rate, but I felt the costs would be worth it if you really wanted a nice place to stay after a night on the town in Nashville.TIP: Register for the Omni Select Guest rewards program (which is FREE) to get free WiFi during your stay and better room upgrades and additional freebies. Also request a room on a higher floor as a lot of late-night noise comes off the streets of downtown.I had to attend a corporate function there today. WTF, who builds a hotel of this scope with no damn parking garage? I had to use a lot across from the CHF, which charge in increments of 1, 2 or 6 hours. So, I ended up having to walk back to the lot and ended up spending $30 for parking. I wouldn't stay at this hotel if the damn room was free.I was very excited to stay at this hotel for a business trip to Nashville. It's a new hotel and is located in the heart of downtown. From day one, I was extremely impressed by the great customer service here. Everyone is extremely friendly, courteous, and helpful. When I checked in, I was super early and my room wasn't ready yet. The front desk took my cell number and texted me as soon as the room was ready, which wasn't long at all (and I had time to go explore the Country Music Hall of Fame while I was waiting, which is connected to the hotel).The hotel itself is gorgeous: very modern yet inviting. It's also huge: almost like a big Las Vegas hotel on the Strip. There are several dining options and a couple of stores in the hotel. The rooms are quite spacious, well-equipped, with lots of amenities (little mouthwashes and shower gels!). I requested a quiet room, and I was placed on one of the top floors, which was pretty quiet and had a beautiful view of the city skyline. The bed was comfy, as were the pillows, although I wish they offered slightly firmer pillow options as well as the squishier ones. A couple of weird things: first, the rooms have central air which is individually controlled by each guest. That part is great. But the central air is LOUD. Every time it kicks on, it sounds like a scary monster is coming to eat you. It took a while to get used to and made falling asleep a challenge. Second, the doors and walls of the rooms seem a bit on the thin side. Even though I had a quiet room in the sense that it's located in a less-trafficked area, I could still hear a lot through the walls and doors. I feel like other hotels have sturdier doors and walls. Finally, there is an occasional odd smell throughout the hallways, and I smelled it in the bathroom at one point, too. Other reviewers have pointed it out. It almost smells like...dry dog food. Very strange. I tried not to think about it: again, it was only there occasionally. And, the WiFi works great, when it actually works. I had to reconfigure the WiFi on my devices at least eight times per day, which is a huge pain, especially when you are paying $10 per day for the service. There were also some concerns about cleanliness. On the day I checked in, my hotel room bathroom had, ahem, multiple pubic hairs on the floor, along with a large footprint on the floor. I also had a towel with big gray marks on it. I called the front desk and alerted them to the issue, and my bathroom was cleaned properly thereafter, but the experience left a sour taste in my mouth. Cleanliness is probably the most important thing about a hotel, and if my room has issues, what else about the hotel has issues, you know? I later found a dirty mark on the bedspread as well. There shouldn't be any dirty marks on things. This is a four-star hotel, and it charges $200+ a night, minimum. There are no excuses. Would I stay here again? I probably would. But I'd be sure to mention these issues to the hotel before I made my reservation. It's a new hotel and hopefully they are still working out the kinks. It really is a beautiful facility, and aside from the cleanliness issues, I really enjoyed my stay here.Great hotel.  The staff were very friendly and my room was super clean and comfortable.  Everything seemed new and updated.  I stayed here for a conference that was across at the Music City Center - so this was super convienient.The parking situation is my only compliant.  As a woman traveling alone, the self-parking at the Music City Center was not a great option.  It was "a block away" as they say - but that was a huge block...where you then have to go into a nearly deserted garage.   Kind of creepy.  I moved my car after a few hours.  Since it was only about $10 more, I moved to valet.   I was quoted by many that it was $30, and only found out upon checkout that they add tax to the valet.  Lame.Overall nice stay....and it was cool that the Hatch Show Print was in the side of the building inside the lobby.The absolute best way to experience Nash-Vegas! Convenient walk to the Bridgestone arena and lots to do within walking distance. Also convenient enough to broad street. The concierge is 5 star and they will hook you with free stuff. All you have to do is ask. If you need a ride somewhere they've got you covered. It's first come first serve and they'll even pick you just make sure you know what time is the latest they offer it. But if it's busy expect a wait. No worries though, just call a cab. It definitely makes for the best experience when visiting Nashville.The location is in a  rough neighborhood. The hotel is gorgeous.  Service is  excellent.  The rooms were beautiful but very small.   Unfortunately I could hear  all sound outside my room . The restaurants in the hotel were very good . The staff were very friendly.  The food at the meeting rooms were not very goodI loved the Omni my husband & I stayed here for a weekend stay in nashville. We wanted to stay downtown & close to the stadium. We drove down and stayed in bowling green, ky on the way to make it cheaper to be able to afford a place like the Omni... Be forewarned if you need coke, etc use the vending machine not the convince store or take it with you! We pulled up at 4:30 for check-in on a Saturday and with a short quick line were checked in and in our room by 5:00. We chose to use the bellboy and he was helpful, friendly, and helped us get all our belongings to the room without any trouble. They cleaned our room while we were out and about on Sunday and it was much appreciated and everything was clean and tidy! Including the bar glasses we brought from home. The bed was comfy and the sheets were soft! I told my husband I can't think of any other place I would want to stay while in Nashville.5 Stars in every way!Make no mistake, you are going to pay for this hotel.  But once you get past the sticker shock and really think about what you're paying for, luxury, exceptional service, location, and convenience, makes this hotel worth every penny!The rooms are swanky with a capital S!  Completely modern and super comfortable (think soft mattress, plush pillows, and giant bath towels).  The service was exceptional.  The hotel check-in was technically 4pm, and we were staying here during one of the busiest weekends in Nashville (NCAA Women's Final Four).   A couple days before our stay I received an email detailing the online check-in process, and proceeded to do so.  It made our stay that much better!  Even though check in was at 4pm, I indicated during online check in that we would be arriving at 2pm.  Given that the hotel was 100% booked, I didn't expect anything, but our room was ready and waiting for us when we arrived 2 hours early!  Not only that, but you don't have to wait in line when you check in online.  Your room key is ready and waiting for you.  Talk about amazingly convenient!The doorman remembered us as we came in and out of the hotel, telling us to enjoy our show on our way out for the evening, which really impressed me considering we found out the hotel was actually over-booked!  The location is prime, within walking distance of everything.Thank you to the entire Omni team for making my fiance and I feel like royalty during our Staycation!Best hotel in Nashville! Rooms well-appointed. Very quiet. Comfy beds. Very friendly and helpful staff. Walking distance to Broadway , honky tonk central, arena and convention center. Excellent bar with live music on site. Great coffee shop for breakfast. An awesome gift shop with real gifts you'd actually want to bring home to friends and family. Bonus of Hatch Show Print being on site too - an even better funky gift stop.My first time in Nashville, and I am here for a business conference. I have attended over 15 conferences with the company I work for, and this is the first time that a hotel has run out of the "block" of rooms reserved at the conference attendee rate. In addition, this is THE FIRST TIME I have arrived at the designated conference hotel, only to wait 2 hours for my room to be ready. This, DESPITE the fact that I took the hotel up on their email offer to check in the day before I arrived. I have not even gotten to my room yet, and I am totally turned off.October 2013. Comfy bed and room. Nice pillows, stylish but not overdone decorating.Great view from our particular room on the 15th floor. Quiet. New. Potential to be very nice after recent-opening tweaking. A pleasant walk to convention center and great location to main shops roads/restaurants.Irritating parking/unloading where they didn't want you to use their luggage carts yourself (so we were told) and where there's no cheaper parking on-site, just valet, they said. (Not a lot of luggage carts either.) Line of cars arriving spilling out onto street, where we were waiting in line close to the intersection.Not very good cell reception (didn't pay for their wifi but could create personal hotspot which was still unreliable and often slow.) In-room TV had some channels with poor reception. Room keys also for use in elevator readers not reliable, and they put instructions in the actual elevators during our stay, whereas no one told us how to use them when we first arrived. Opened room door more quickly. We were told they got a bad batch of cards.Found ice room several doors away from elevator area after hunting when told by staff it was next to the elevator. Fitness room has great view and acceptable equipment, no real mention of it easily found in the literature in-room. Pool appeared to have possible handicap lift (saw through window.) Of 2 glasses in room near ice bucket, one visibly dirty. Open package of cotton swabs in bathroom with one swab gone. Running toilet fixed, within hours of reporting it, while we we out. Wire-type shower holder didn't hold their small bottles or some other things well. Toilet paper holder a little far back for my stiff back. Nice magnifying mirror mounted in bathroom. Bathroom lights didn't seem very bright, and the switches seemed backwards to me, where the first one should turn on the lights at the sink, not in the shower area?Starbucks there had great coffee and fast service. Did not eat in hotel.Last night of conference not correctly charged conference rate on bill but fixed at front desk in person before leaving.We had the best experience at the OMNI in Nashville! The hotel was grand & luxurious and the staff was so friendly and accommodating! The only downside was on our last day.. housekeeping knocked on our door at 9am until I finally got up and asked her to come back later as we were still asleep. (I travel often and haven't had this happen before.) Make sure to keep the sign on the outside of the door. Aside from that there are 3 restaurants within the hotel (all delicious) as well as a coffee shop! And you're within walking distance to everything in the city!! Highly recommend to anyone! This should be the ONLY hotel you stay at if you can get a reservation!!!!My wife and I stayed there due to an event we were having in the hotel. The room was fantastic. Super clean and very comfortable bed and pillows. The views were spectacular and the hotel staff was super friendly and attentive. The restaurants in the hotel are also quite good. Kitchen Notes has a wonderful Sunday brunch special, bottomless mimosas for $5! Would recommend this as a great place to stay if you are looking for a classy and elegant place to stay.Rooms switched. We were confirmed in June 2013 before this hotel was finished being built for two queen beds. Received my confirmation on April 9th for the queen beds and I am sitting in a room with a king bed and a roll away. I said this isn't right at all and then they asked if I wanted to cancel my reservation. Really? After I am already here?They took the experience I wanted for my family away. The Hilton is just as close and BETTER SERVICE I am sure.Well, OMNI, just when I thought you couldn't do any better, you've really outdone yourself here. With a hotel brand that's already among the elite in my book, OMNI Nashville, you just may be the grandest of them all.1) Dear sweet loyalty ambassador Lauren Oliver:You are the best, kindest, sweetest, most diligent, and most enthusiastic loyalty ambassador I have come across among a group of already wonderful loyalty ambassadors at OMNI. First you so generously greet me with a BEAUTIFUL King Luxury suite upgrade that was just fantastic for a most perfect weekend getaway. Then you welcome me some more with some wine and great assortment of complimentary cheeses-- a perfect way to unwind after a travel day. Then you set-up a splendid GHA discovery local experience at the Smith House along with a hop-on-hop-off tour of the city. It was a most marvelous evening of history, fun, and fine dining for my friend and I.  Then you continue with the kind emails on restaurant suggestions and music venues while explaining each option with great detail and enthusiasm and proceed to make reservations for almost every meal and entertainment item on our agenda. Finally you just continue to smile and represent the true essence of extraordinary customer service that really sets the OMNI brand apart from all the others. You made my stay extraordinary. It was the most perfect stay at the most perfect time.2) Dear stunning lobby: Well you are just beautiful. Thank you for the visual pleasure every time I walked back "home"3) Dear Mr Chauffeur: You are awesome!Ma'am would you like to be escorted in an escalade wherever you'd like to go within a 3 mile radius of the hotel?Why yes I would!!How much will that cost me?Why nothing of course! We here at OMNI rent Escalades from Enterprise just to escort our guests around for free4) Dear Dining Services:Thank you for my most enjoyable morning beverage to greet me dailyand for the free red bulls (as a black level guest) to keep me awake and alert to enjoy a jam-packed weekend5) Dear Housekeeping:Thank you for the free pressings, to make sure I was looking sharp in Music City and for the most comfortable, impeccably clean haven to get heavenly sleep6) Dear OMNI Staff:Thank you for the smiles. All friendly. Always welcoming. Clearly you all come from the same school of, let's be amazing and extraordinary to our customers so they can accept no other. You've really made it impossible for me to stay at any other brand. And when I do venture off because I have no choice in that particular city... you keep me running back in appreciation of your exceptional standard of service.7) Dear Bank account:I know I made a dent in you from this trip. But I think you would agree that it was worth every single penny.Brand new hotel in the heart of downtown Nashville. Five star all the way. Rooms are top notch, staff was very helpful and friendly, and the food was excellent as well. If you're looking for a hotel in Nashville, this is it! The only word of caution I can give you is be mindful of parking and consolidate vehicles if part of a larger party. There are not many parking options in the area and the hotel charges a steep $30 daily valet fee. Great stay; highly recommended.The credit card I left on file was charged for more than 1,000$ of unauthorized expenses. Stay at your own peril.

review_content: An overall wonderful experience from top to bottom with this place. Every person I encountered on the staff was warm and friendly - from the valets, front desk, room service, bartender, restaurant staff, Starbucks crew, and housekeeping. Wonderful people! And you can't beat the location for downtown entertainment. AND an in-house Starbucks!The Room - Immaculate. The rooms are updated with a great modern look that is crisp but comfortable. The overall look from the hallways to the rooms was very impressive. The linens had a great light clean smell and felt wonderful, and the beds were amazingly comfortable, so much so that it was tempting to stay put. There are lots of well thought out touches with charging stations and convenient outlets for all your tech needs. Aveda products in the bath!?! Awesome! Simple small coffee maker in the room was stashed in the entertainment center with everything you need for a quick cup of coffee or tea in the room. I wish I had a room in my house like this place!Room Service - I've never had nor had heard of Nashville Hot Chicken until the Uber driver taking me to the hotel mentioned I had to try it while in town. I wasn't sure I was actually going to get to a restaurant that had it while on my trip, but the hotel had it on their menu so I gave it shot. I am a big fan of spicy food. This was CRAZY hot. I couldn't finish it, as it was too spicy for me and left some serious afterburn in the back of my mouth and my tongue was swollen. It still had some nice flavor, but if you aren't into spicy, or even if you are, WATCH OUT. I'm not sure if you could order it not as hot but worth a shot. I also had the Brussels sprouts which were great. Food service was prompt!I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again on a trip back to Nashville. It was one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had!Pros: -close to Broadway-swimming pool and hot tub-staff was nice and tried hard-room was cleanCons:-hotel was a little run down in general-bathrooms were very outdated-loud-even on a weeknight we could hear music from Broadway at 3am-the heavy room doors slam all throughout the night-very expensive rates. For what we paid you'd expect coffee in the room or continental breakfast or something. These were NYC rates for a sorta run down hotel. Wifi, water, coffee, etc, ALL extraIf we returned to Nashville we wouldn't stay here, partly because of the noise and partly because of the condition of the hotel for the rates.Absolutely will not stay here ever again. Drove 7 1/2 hrs to be told they did not have a room. Even though we have had the reservation for weeks and even called half way through our trip to confirm we still had a room. Just ridiculous and will not be back! Might be amazing once you actually get into your room, but being treated that way has lost my business.Two blocks from Broadway and all the honky tonk spots in downtown, you're going to be very challenged finding a better hotel location in Nashville. The Renaissance is what we call a "full service hotel" meaning that it has onsite parking and a restaurant, fitness center, room service, concierge lounge and such.I was upgraded to what they called a "corner room" and though it was on the corner at the end of the hallway, it only had windows on one side of the room. The view, as you can see from my picture, was super awesome. Nice sized room with a work desk (ah, there's where they hid the power outlets) and nice shower. Well laid out with nice decorations and a warm feeling. I opted to put out the little sign that skips room "styling" and earns an extra 500 Marriott points.Very nice concierge lounge on the 24th floor which has a really good breakfast, a solid evening hors d'oeuvres and desserts. Decent coffee up there too, though there is also a coffee shop in the lobby.My main concern is the $38/day valet parking. Even the lot across the street is $20. Yikes!Nice hotel but it is EXTREMELY noisy in the rooms as the hotel room doors SLAM closed every time... With this being close to the Honky Tonk bars and also used for business travelers the doors up and down the halls slammed all night, and all morning... I've been to many hotels with heavy fire doors similar to this and they have figured a way to reduce the noise... This certainly needs to be remedied...So I need to review this hotel from two different perspectives: corporate travel vs. personal travel.From a personal traveler's perspective: I thought that at $250 a night, the hotel was glamorous enough, well tended enough, and large enough to warrant the cost. Most importantly it's a two block walk to some of the best tourism spots off Broadway like Tootsies and the Wild Horse Saloon (if you go bring your key card to this so that you don't need to pay cover). However, I found the $10 charge for internet per day and the $17.95 for breakfast pretty steep on top of my already expensive daily rate. I also thought they could have done a better job replenishing towels on a room they knew had a lot of people in it. From a corporate traveler's perspective: If you have work in downtown Nashville, this is definitely where you want to stay. It's a fun spot and you get to expense all of the things I listed as a detraction above. Favorite part of the hotel: the view as you ride the elevator up 17 floors.I have not stayed in a room overnight, but have been in them for various events and parties, as well as dined and played at the Bridge Bar. Hotel itself is absolutely gorgeous...the food is good..everything is really pricey...Also, I have noticed that any time I have ordered at BridgeBar, there was one amount on my receipt, and another amount charged to my credit card (since I get automatic text alerts every time a purchase is made)...I don't know if it's an automatic gratuity or what...but if, let's say my amount came out to $28.00 subtotal on receipt, my card would text me that $34.00 was actually charged, before I even wrote in the tip and handed it back to the waiter..So my card could wind up getting charged $40 if I added a $6 gratuity...I've asked for an explanation on this a few times with nothing. Staff within hotel is always friendly, but not at bridge bar usually..I do recommend staying here to friends who are visiting Nashville quite regularly if they want to be right downtown.The best customer service I have EVER experienced in a hotel! Every person I encountered was friendly, knowledgeable, and seemed to be genuinely happy with their position in the hospitality industry. I truly appreciated feeling welcome, especially on my first visit to such a wonderful city!!Hopefully I will be back soon :)We recently had a business meeting in the convention center. We inadvertently did not order lunch for Day 1. ("Ooops.") We realized this about 10am day of, panicked because we had 50 people who assumed lunch was scheduled to arrive, and we called Conference Services. A lunch showed up - sandwiches, salads, cakes, drinks - right at noon as if it had been ordered all along. Scrambling for an unplanned lunch for 50 is no easy task, but they made it seem so.A massive space with a great location...just a block off of Broadway. The restaurant is solid and I love how bands just seem to spin through. Nashville is so outstanding that way.I really like the gym...big space with about a dozen of various cardio machines. They have a multi weight rack and just a couple of leg machines. They also have some standard weights with a few benches. You won't get much of a a lift here, but enough to do a quick maintenance day. Focus on cardio while you are here muscle head....hahaThe Club Lounge is nothing special...a bit dated, but it has extended hours so you can always grab waters or a "to go" beer. I love having The Starbucks in the lobby for a quick coffee to go.The rooms could use an update...they are looking a bit tired, but the beds are wonderful so that's a plus. Again, location is outstanding so you really can't go wrong by staying at The Renaissance...I've stayed at many Marriott properties and I was looking forward to a nice girls/bachelorette weekend at the Renaissance Nashville. A couple of us arrived early this past Friday morning (9:00am-ish) and decided we would drop our luggage off and see if it was possible to check in yet. Unfortunately, the girl working at the front desk must never have worked in customer service before because her attitude from the get-go was horrible. She said they were "booked solid" for the weekend and that we had two King rooms for our reservation. Here's the problem: there were 8 of us on the trip, sleeping 4 per room. We explained this to her and she curtly responded "I'm sorry there is nothing I can do." I am 99.99999% sure that "there's nothing we can do" should NEVER be in your vocabulary if you are working in this kind of job. What she SHOULD have said was "I will see what I can do" or "you are welcome to try and check in later to see if anything else becomes available." But no. Completely rude, unhelpful, and unapologetic. Frustrated, we told her we would wait to check in and went to get breakfast. Lo and behold, when we returned around noon with the rest of our group to check in, another girl working the front desk was able to put us into 2 Queen rooms with no problem whatsoever. She even was able to get us 2 rooms right next to each other so we could all be together. She was pleasant and a total 180 from the unfortunate character we dealt with at first. Thankfully, we enjoyed the rest of our stay here once the check-in disaster was over. The rooms are bright and clean and the location can't be beat. We ordered room service pizza late both nights and it was surprisingly delicious... I've had some pretty generic hotel pizzas but this will do the trick if you get some late-night hunger pangs. The Starbucks in the lobby is a nice touch though it does tend to get busy in the mornings, as is to be expected. This was my first trip to Nashville and I will absolutely be back, though my experience with the first receptionist may make me think twice about where I stay next time.Wanted lunch at hotel when we arrived. Grill not working in main restaurant and 3rd floor deli had only a very limited menu. Didn't much matter because as soon as we found that out, the hotel was overwhelmed with hundreds of hungry conventioners on lunch break from convention center next door. Ended up ordering pizza in the room from a local place nearby. So epic fail on feeding your guests, guys.All rooms are apparently the same except slightly larger corner rooms. Seating in room is desk chair and very small side chair. No comfortable spot to relax except bed. Bed and pillows not very comfortable, a bit saggy. Attempts to get foam pillows failed, they were as limp as feather.Tv fixed to wall and wired to block any attempts at changing input, so useless for anything but the hotel's cable channels. Why do some Marriott family hotels have cool input strips for the tv and others block all input? Tv reception was oddly poor.Reasonably cold and dark. Nearby construction will wake up the vacationer by 7 or 8 weekdays. Some really nice views from high floors.Very convenient to Ryman, Bridgestone and general drunken madness on Broadway. A bit more of a hike, but still doable, to new Ascend amphitheater.Got a couple bottles of wine from the bar/deli during the stay for the room, but neither downstairs or third floor bar were anyplace i'd want to hang for a drink.Staff all friendly and helpful. Overall, a meh hotel in an ok location.This hotel was really nice and in a great location. We got a free upgrade to a corner room which had spectacular views of downtown and the river. Our room was clean and had lots of attention to detail things like free to use phone charging dock, AVEDA shampoo and soap and extra towels. There is a Starbucks in the lobby and the hotel bar/restaurant is on this bridge thing which has great views and is very open. It's an easy walk down to Broadway, the public library (which you can access through the parking deck), and Panera is also a block away. I will definitely stay here again when I go back to visit.2 night stay here. Everything was awesome! Staff was very accommodating . Valet was offered and we accepted . Easy to deal with. Starbucks inside the hotel which for me was a big plus. They offer a wonderful breakfast buffet.Rooms were clean and the beds were really comfortable . There's a iPod Dock in the room. I definitely recommend this hotel. It's right around the corner from downtown. Literally one block. Convention center is attached so it makes. It so convenient . I'll be back on the flip side.I stayed here for 5 nights while in town on business and had a pretty good experience. The hotel is in a good central location with close proximity to the popular Broadway Street area.My room was styled well, comfortable and clean. It had everything I needed including a beautiful view of the Music City Center. It was nice to have a refrigerator and safe in the room, which is not always the case with these joints. If I had to complain about something in the room it was that the refrigerator never got really cold, but it did the job so really it's not a big deal.The few interactions I had with the hotel staff were polite and professional. They keep the place very clean and I never had trouble getting service when I needed it.The hotel has a Starbucks, a small bar, a large restaurant and a separate larger bar known as "The Bridge." It also has a nice convenience/gift shop in case you need a last minute item or gift. Prices for each are what I refer to as "hotel high" so prepare to spend money. Since I was here on business this wasn't an issue for me.One thing I liked is that as a Marriott Rewards member the WiFi was free and I was able to earn points by not using housekeeping, so if you want to save on internet and earn points make sure you sign up in advance(marriott.com/rewards/rew...) or when you first arrive.Overall I had a really nice stay here and I would recommend this place to friends and family that are visiting Nashville.*This business is gun carry friendly.I enjoyed our weekend here! Friendly staff ! Loved valet service!! I've used Valet in other places, but this location was the fastest and super friendly! They always greeted you with a smile and friendly hello. Breakfast bar was okay, didn't have all kinds of options, pretty basic, but you can make an omlette! One thing that I loved was the Starbucks in the lobby!!! We stayed on the 23rd floor, great view!Great location- close walking distance to Broadway, Country Music Hall of Fame, Ryman and more! Comfortable room and pleasant staff. If wanting g to be close to downtown Nashville attractions, this is your place. We arrived early with no rooms ready, they ended up preparing a room within an hour when we were expecting 3 or more!Great location, nice rooms, but a few things turned me off... The hotel bar was closed by 11pm. We had been to a concert at Bridgestone arena and weren't quite ready to be done for the night, but it so happened to be the weekend Nashville got hit with six inches of snow, so it was cold & icy and we didn't want to walk back down to Broadway... Disappointed. Luckily, we had a stash in the room. Second thing that really irked me was WiFi was only free in the common areas. You had to pay if you wanted it in your room. What a ploy! Especially, if you advertise that you have free WiFi. Not impressed. Had we stayed more than one night, this would have really irritated me.Nice hotel in downtown Nashville with a very elcectic theme room, very appropriate for where were, in the heart of country music.The hallway carpet was cool with the mural of guitars, pretty awseome.The downside is that it is freezing in the hallway, way too cold for my liking that's the only bad thing I have to say.Two things work in synergy here: lots of elevators and a Starbucks (opens 6am) in the lobby.Of course the hotel is about 4-6 blocks from all the music & bbq on Broadway. Very convenient to walk back from a long night at the bar.
review_content_20: As far as corporate hotels go, this one is about as bland and cheesy as the next. The location is great, though, right by all the honky tonks. The reason I'm inclined to give 1 star is because three mornings in a row, we were woken up by drilling against the side of the building. Every phone call to the front desk was addressed with a "Oh, there should have been a notice". No, there was no notice, not a single day we stayed there. There was no offer to move hotel rooms, nothing. On the last day, and after several complaints across our group, management finally, and BEGRUDGINGLY offered us a free breakfast, but after returning to our room, there was a man peering in doing construction. I literally made eye contact with the guy. Management told us, verbatim, to "close the blinds if it's bothering you". Nashville has so many better hotels with much better hospitality and character, and no wakeup calls via drilling. I'd suggest making this hotel your absolute last option.Where I was born Where I was raisedWhere I keep all my yesterdaysWhere I came back and settled downWhere They'll put me in the groundThis is my townSure it's a song written by Montgomery Gentry but it personifies Nashville and the Renaissance Nashville Hotel.I didn't experience any problem, noise, maid service issues or naked single (0r married for that matter) women attending the plethora of bachelorette parties that supposedly occur in this hotel. If they did... Who's complaining?I love Chelsea up in the Concierge lounge and Sandra as well. Not so much the man that was doing breakfast. He was quiet and not much was "available" at 8:30 when he was working. The front desk staff was extremely helpful and courteous and had an abundance of information and found some of the best eating that Nashville had to offer due to them. The decor was labeled by some Yelp poser as a "hotel trying to be hip and relevant". They are hip. This is Nashville, this is current, this is relevant and this hotel is a worthy return which I'll do. Note to manager.. if you really want the dirty on your bell staff/valet you'd be in touch.Nice place, excellent customer service, clean, modern rooms with very comfortable beds, all located within a couple blocks of the Nashville strip on Broadway.  Book it.Came here for a three night stay. Standard hotel, quite large, reasonably sized rooms. Nothing special. Large lobby area with elevators that took ages to come. Helpful staff. best things about this hotel is the bar on the third floor. The Starbucks had a long line anytime you fancied a coffee. It is a convention hotspot so was always extremely busy. It is conveniently located but I wish I'd stayed at the hermitage a block away which was smaller and cuter!Fantastic hotel, friendly staff, great location for anyone wanting to enjoy all that #Nashville has to offer.  Close to every single activity, event & wow the food. "Acme Seed" is an absolute must with a rooftop deck that is fantastic. Great scene & right on the water.  If you are looking for some really good local fare you must stop in at "Stillery"! Overall the options are endless but recommendation is to avoid the tourist traps at all costs & go for the local & authentic #NashvilleBeautiful hotel just a few block from Broadway. Beautiful rooms, huge spaces for having events, and a delicious hotel restaurant that had the most amazing food. Starbucks inside, beautiful views and friendly people. Can't go wrong with this hotel. A must stay on our next trip.Great location, very central! We experienced very good customer service during a big conference and everyone was so welcoming and helpful. The hotel is in great condition and very clean. Only thing that didn't sit well was that there were only three running elevators which caused a delay in the mornings.I loved this place. We stayed here for MTAC (Middle Tennessee Anime Convention) last Easter (2013) and I spent a lot of time in the room due to catching my sister's illness just as she was getting over it. I had also been here once before for a college church conference. The beds are nice and the entire place is just cool. It's probably the coolest hotel I've ever stayed at and I felt so fancy staying there. I know its unlikely that I will get to stay here again because I'm gonna be a poor broke teacher, but I totally would if I could afford it.Liked: - Citrus CrushI have been starting to fall back in love with Marriott's Renaissance thanks to their re-branding. While it takes awhile for all of the hotels in a given brand to update, I was happy to see that the Nashville Hotel has finally been updated. That being said, I really wouldn't  categorize this Renaissance like others in the brand as it is more of a convention hotel. Pros:+Location- Attached to the convention center if you happen to be attending a convention, and it is conveniently located within 2 blocks of Broadway+Starbucks- Some times you just need caffeine in the morning to function and luckily there happens to be one in the lobby+Staff- They seemed really friendly and nice, especially the doorman and concierge. They were able to provide excellent dining and activity suggestions.+Beds- they were extremely comfortableCons:-Location- Outside of Broadway, you needed to drive to other areas of the city, i.e. Westend, East Nashville/Five Points, the Gulch, etc.-Noise - On the weekends, this hotel attracts a lot of bachelorette parties and during the week, you can get some louder guests as well. The walls are paper thin like others have mentioned and this can get annoying. -Lobby/public space areas- There really doesn't seemed to be smaller than some of the other ones I've stayed at in which you could gather to work with coworkers if need be. -Elevators- They took awhile to call and go up or down to your selected floorThis is a great hotel with so much yo offer and wonderful staff service! I enjoy all that Music City has to offer, and the location is the center of everything.Beautiful hotel in probably the perfect location within downtown Nashville.If you are looking for a comfortable place to stay and walkability is a concern, look no further.   This hotel is within walking distance to almost everything the downtown has to offer.   For those needing to journey away, their concierge service was top-notch and a cab was never more than 2 minutes wait.Lack of 1 star on my rating for the confusing hours of both the coffee cafe and the bar.My husband and I stayed here for one night during our stay in Nashville. Excellent location, very clean and great service. Valet was pretty expensive but there is parking garage almost directly across the street that offers $10 parking per day so thats where we parked. My only gripe with this hotel is we had to pay $10/day for Wi-Fi. Doesnt Motel 6 offer free Wi-Fi? For the price of the room, we were really disappointed about the lack of internet availability when it seems this comes complimentary pretty much everywhere else. Otherwise great hotel and would recommend other than caveat for Wi-Fi.While the hotel is right downtown and has a lot of great modern amenities (Apple charging docks, flat screen TV, etc) I found the lack of soundproofing a bit of an issue.I was in town for a conference and being that this place is right in the thick of all the honky tonks it was hard to sleep because I could hear music ALL NIGHT from the 20th floor.The decor is nice and modern and everything was super clean and well maintained, but I feel the noise makes this hotel impractical for anyone that isn't here to enjoy the nightlife.As good as it gets for a 4-star at this price! Good location - Broadway is around the corner, so are the event centers, and Nissan Stadium is a nice walk. Nice to have a Starbucks down stairs. Especially for the refills. Service is excellent -  inside and out. I hope to have the chance to come back again with my family.I was visiting Nashville for a conference at the adjoining Nashville Conference Center and a stay at the Renaissance meant no morning commutes or long distances to walk. This hotel is located just off Broadway, where all the action in downtown Nashville occurs. Its the perfect location for those attending a conference next door or wanting to be near the honky tonks and other downtown attractions. The hotel itself is excellent. There is a Starbucks on the first floor and complimentary fruit-infused water (apple cinnamon, blueberry orange, etc) for an afternoon pick-up. The Starbucks is a franchise, so don't expect to use your Gold Starbucks Card perks here. I didn't try the bar or restaurant, but the furniture in the lounge across from the Starbucks is both modern and comfortable. Its a great place to watch the World Cup and people-watching, which the bartender will comment on from time-to-time and make you laugh. The concierge service is truly excellent. If you need change for a 5, they will do so and they will also hold your luggage until your 3 p.m. check-in. This is great for those of us hoping to get an extra day of sight-seeing in before our conference starts and occupies the rest of our Nashville stay. They also offered to let me check in early because rooms were available, but I did not take them up on the offer as all I wanted to do was drop my bags and run to the farmer's market for Georgia peaches. The exercise room offers a full set of weights, towels, complimentary earbuds, treadmills, elliptical machines, an outdoor swimming pool, stretching mats, shower and bathroom facilities, and locker room. There is also filtered water, but this machine tends to overflow and leak onto the ground. The rooms are up-to-date, with a large flat screen, leather rolling chair for your desk, and plush beds. This was perhaps the most comfy of beds I have ever slept on, and I had a great night's sleep every night. The bathroom shower head is perhaps my only complaint. It is a single stream, rather than multiple streams of water. Otherwise, there is a sleek bathroom countertop, excellent lighting, a half foot of magnified mirror, and Aveda products. I recommend this hotel for its location and its excellent service. I wish there was free wireless, but it may be purchased at a reasonable rate.I thought the rooms were updated and clean.  I had a great view from my window.  The location is absolutely perfect....two blocks from Broadway -  I would stay here again for sure.Location Location Location! This hotel is right by Broadway and the Predators arena.  Several good restaurants within walking distance.  The rooms are nice.  My only complaint was being told there were no king bed rooms available (eventhough that is what I booked) and that I had to upgrade to a King Corner room if I wanted a king (instead of 2 queens).If you are traveling on business on a Friday or Saturday night then don't stay here. The live band in the bar area is so loud and my room overlooked that area. With the TV on and a sound machine I could still hear word for word of all the songs. I'm there for a work conference and have to get up super early. Called the front desk and they said there is nothing they can do and that the band plays until 2AM. Hotel is sold out and can't even be moved to a different room. Very frustrating. The location is great but I would only stay here again if I was visiting for fun and not business. They should at least tell people about this when they check in. Here's to a sleepless night and a very long day tomorrow. Hotel is decent and clean though!***This Renaissance is nice while the Concierge Lounge is just okay; room rates are very high here so you can find better value outside of Downtown Nashville***I personally prefer Renaissance to Marriott when staying at a Marriott brand full service hotel.  Renaissance's rooms and the hotels themselves are much more contemporary than what you will find at Marriotts.  The Renaissance Las Vegas is surprisingly nice for an off-The-Strip hotel and both the Renaissance Boston at Patriot Place and Renaissance Boulder showcase luxurious rooms.  In several ways, this Renaissance is similar to those properties, but it also falls short in certain areas.My room for the most part was nice.  The room had a good look overall and it featured an exceptionally nice and sleek bathroom sink.  The furniture was contemporary too and I really liked what they did with the flat screen TV by mounting it on the wall as opposed to just sitting it on the dresser like most hotels.  The room was comfortable too though the A/C probably did not get as cool as I would have liked.There were a few areas where my room could have been better though.  The in-room safe was not working and the shower head delivered a straight on blast as opposed to the nice rainfall shower heads that a lot of Marriotts are now using.Outside of the rooms, there were some areas that could use updating. The hallways had a dated look (the doors to the rooms were dated too and had an unattractive light yellow wood color).  The Concierge Lounge for Marriott Rewards Gold and Platinum members is under renovation so they have temporarily moved it to the Ryman Room on the 3rd floor.  This temporary space obviously did not deliver the standard Concierge Lounge ambiance.  There were no couches and no nicely designed and restaurant-like table options.  Instead, the room was boring and banquet hall-esque.  They tried making the room nicer though by bringing in a few flat screen TVs.The food here was not that good considering the high room rate, but there were high points.  For nightly appetizers, there was really good and sweet BBQ pulled pork as well as a great variety of hot and cold options even if a lot of it was in the mediocre range.  This Concierge Lounge offered BBQ pulled chicken, buffalo wings, hummus, chips and salsa, crudite, very standard cheeses, chicken sandwiches, roast beef sandwiches, BLT wraps, strawberries, caprese salad (decent), and rye bread topped with a cream cheese mousse and smoked salmon.Desserts included a wide variety of cake and pie slices including chocolate cake, red velvet cake, apple pie, and really good pecan pie.Breakfast was a letdown as nothing really stood out.  The lounge served scrambled eggs, mediocre sausage patties (though sausage patties or links at Marriott brand Concierge Lounges tend to be below average), muffins, bagels, Danishes, croissants, sliced fruit, whole fruit, hard boiled eggs, cheese, deli meats, oatmeal, individual boxes of cereal, and assorted juices (including overly pulpy orange juice).The fitness center was big and good and this hotel offers an indoor pool.Service throughout the hotel was pleasant.This Renaissance has a pretty good location.  It is right in Downtown Nashville and within walking distance to many key Nashville attractions (very close to the Ryman) though you do have to walk through a few deserted blocks to get to some of these attractions.Room rates are high at this hotel.  I think part of it has to do with just how desirable Nashville is, but you will pay significantly more at this Renaissance than similar downtown hotels like the Minneapolis Marriott and the Denver Marriott.There are definitely good things about this Renaissance, but I think the room rates (coupled with paying a high price for valet parking) are just too high given the good but not excellent quality of this hotel.  Since traffic in Nashville is not that bad, it might make more sense staying outside the downtown area where room rates for Marriott brand hotels are much less.This Renaissance offers valet parking for $32 per night. There is also a city operated parking structure across the street that is $10 per day on weekdays and $5 per day on weekends (no in and out privileges though).This was a great hotel near everything. Everyone was so nice. The rooms were great from the beds to the shampoo :-) Make sure you get the card of the pedal taxi before a night out on south Broadway! Worth the call.
review_content_40: Terrible place to stay.   The hotel staff are friendly,.... Unless there is a problem. I stayed here for 5 nights this week.  On the 2nd night I awoke to a strange pain.  I had a tick attached my skin.  This has never happened to me anywhere!On the 3rd morning,  I awoke with a rash on my right wrist and on my forehead.  I went straight to the front desk to ask for my sheets and pillows to be exchanged.I was told that I must have brought the tick intro the hotel via my luggage and that maybe I had contracted the rash somewhere in my travels.  They brought in a pest investigation company and reported they found nothing unusual,  so my room was fine.  They told me they were closing the case as Marriott was not at fault I am a doctor and do not have ticks or pests in my home, nor has anything like this happened to me prior to this stay.   I was very tactful to the staff, but VERY offended by their rude insinuations.  I requested new pillows and sheets once again and finally received them.   I will NOT stay here againThe hotel was nice.  Great location to restaurants, bars, and sporting events!  Construction is happening next to the property and work starts early during the week so NO sleeping in.I had stayed in this hotel a few years back for a work conference, so when looking at hotels to book for my birthday trip... I knew this place had all of the requirements. Starbucks in the lobby? Check! Walking distance to Broadway and the Ryman? Check! Comfy bed and clean rooms? Check! A word of caution though: I actually booked this, what I thought, was directly through Southwest, as a nice little flight and hotel package. I did eventually find out, the Southwest packages are booked through a third party company... and after I couldn't find the confirmation email a few days before the trip, freaked out and called Southwest who put me in touch with the company. They promptly sent me a new confirmation email so I thought everything was good to go....So when we walk into the lobby to check in.... they can't find our reservation ANYWHERE. I was started to freak just a bit... I did not want my epic birthday plans to be ruined! The front desk guy asked that I email him the confirmation on the spot, so I did. I am not sure what happened, but David at the front desk was very accommodating... gave us a small upgrade and my birthday plans were saved!!! Yay~ This is not a 5 star hotel, by any means, but it is nice, clean and works... especially if you are only staying a few nights. The only thing that was wrong was that it didn't seem the heater in our room was working very well... so it was a bit chilly... but we weren't in there too long and the comfy bed and covers kept us warm when we were. The Ryman is also just right around the corner... takes about a minute.... so if you are flying in for a show or want to get a little honky tonk out and about on Broadway, this place is a great option. PS. Wifi will cost ya about 10 bucks a day.I've stayed for the second time and my stay was even better than the first, nice staff, clean, comfortable beds and a great club lounge! The views are amazing and it I close to bars, restaurants, Bridgestone arena and the music city convention center. I'll stay here every time I'm in Nashville!We did not stay here... this is a review of the entertainment skyway.We stopped in to escape from the Nashville heat and the crowds. There was live entertainment (name escapes me at the moment), good food and great service. The prices were reasonable as well.The entertainment area is located upstairs in the Skyway that crosses over Commerce St. You can people watch, cool off, have a drink and a bite to eat all while listening to live music.Great location. Very poor amenities club level leaves something to be desired compared to other "higher marroit" properties.   Really could use a face lift.  It is so hard to believe this is a category 8 hotel.Fantastic service!  Concierge exceptional.  Had an hour to kill and the concierge actually drove me to a nearby tourist attraction for a quick photo op!  The hotel is beautiful and located in the middle of downtown, a couple of blocks from the famous Nashville music scene!  What a great hotel!Average for a Marriott in most aspects.. The hotel is HUGE and offers plenty of options for conventions, meetings, etc.  The rooms were recently remodeled.. but the bones are still the same.  The walls are paper thin.  You can hear everything from the hallway and rooms beside you.  Someone above, below or beside started their shower as 6.30 am.. I would have thought there was an open air shower beside my bed.Nice hotel, great location. My room was ready so I was able to checkin early which was great. However, the lady behind me apparently hasn't checked out since a hotel employee used his key to open my door to let her in! That's truly unacceptable. I stayed here because the Hilton was full and would again but as my second choice. Room service was good. Clean room, great view. Love the Starbucks in lobby.EXCELLENT HOTEL! Stayed here for a long girls weekend (Thursday-Sunday) with two of my friends and we were blown away with the entire staff! So Nice! The concierge lounge is open during the week for gold and platinum Marriott members and we loved it-Starbucks coffee, fresh fruit, and hot breakfast was a very nice touch. I am a loyal Marriott rewards member and travel a lot for business and can honestly say this is one of the nicest Marriott's I have ever stayed at. The staff made our experience. So helpful! Very convenient to downtown for going out at night or daytime shopping.Great location near everything, a pool to keep the kids happy, a tunnel to the library (again, keeping the kids happy), a really good restaurant/bar area, rooms that were well appointed and cheerfully decorated, and a Starbucks in the lobby.  I kind of wanted to live there.Pros: Location. This place will save you can fair because it's such a short walk downtown, to the convention center, LP field or the arena. Good free weight room. Cons: Price. For a hotel this expensive they shouldn't nickel and dime customers on internet. High speed internet costs $15 extra per day. Parking is $7 self, or up to $25 per day for valet.Think of the Greyhound Bus of hotels, and you're here at the Renaissance in Nashville.  Everything about this hotel, from the  service to decor screams annoying, convention go-ers.  Walking around the lobby without a lanyard and name badge sets you apart from the rest.  The room rate I paid was exhoribitant for the quality of the hotel at $450/night plus valet cost of #39/night and the fact that they charge for wifi is absolutely ridiculous.  The restaurant is like a Denny's, no offense to Denny's, and the food is worse.  The decor of the hotel overall is dated with a 1970s vibe.  Everything seems a bit dirty.  Thank God they had a Starbucks in the lobby, as that was the only positive aspect of this price gouging adventure.  Stay at the Holiday Inn Express instead.Great hotel and the best location in downtown Nashville.  This hotel is directly across from the Bridgestone Arena.  We were able to watch everyone going to and from the Justin Bieber concert.  We attended the Predators Game on Saturday night, it was nice to just have to walk across the street.  And when you are ready to go hit the bars downtown, the hotel is just steps away (the only bad thing is you do have to walk up a slope, which gets a bit difficult after a few drinks :-))The hotel itself wes nice.  The room was spacious, especially the bathroom.  The only negative (well for me) is that it was an "all in one" bathroom, so while I was trying to get ready, I was getting steamed out by my other half showering.  The staff was slow in getting us extra towels and cleaning the rooms.  I am going to attribute that to Justin Bieber and the Nashville Predators being in the hotel.  The hotel was at capacity almost our entire trip there.The concierge lounge was nice and well stocked.  The staff in there were very friendly.Parking kinds of sucks.  We decided to just pay to park in the parking garage across the street, you don't have to walk too far, but for this Floridian, , you had to walk outside it was COLD!  I highly recommend this hotel!Great staff! Bathrooms need updating. No safe in the rooms, no fridge either. It's REALLY noisy! You hear music ALL night, trains, sirens, horns (we're on 17th floor!) and the walls are thin (honeymooners next door...WE CAN HEAR YOU!!!).  The walls shake when doors are are left to close by themselves. Having said all that great location, good room service food, great restaurants and bars nearby.The best part of this hotel is it's right downtown and you can walk to everything.  I also love the beds at Renaissance and the rooms are nice.  My 2 complaints are the elevators - it takes forever to get from your floor to the lobby.  There are multiple elevator shafts but only a few work (maybe this has been fixed now?).  And the second is valet - I'd have to wait up to 15 minutes to get my car.  I'd love to just park it outside of the hotel but that's the price you pay being in the city.Maybe it's the fact that I live in Los Angeles but I found EVERYONE here very helpful, friendly and nice.  We were greeted warmly, our room was a good hotel room, the hotel was well kept and the upstairs bar had good food and a good (not big) selection of wines by the glass.  Fist impressions are everything and the staff here is fantastic.  Close to everything.The good: The beds were super comfy! Roomy was spacious and clean. The bad: Soundproofing could use some work. People/children were running up and down the hallway early in the morning, which made it difficult to sleep. Wifi was $10, which seemed quite high.This has been a very pleasant experience.  Rooms are pretty good.  Beds are comfortable.  Everything is clean.  Great shower head with alternate settings to cater to your preference.  Amenities are pretty good.  Cell service is terrible in the meeting room wings.  I mean really terrible!  Service has been really great!  Concierge desk has been amazing!!  Extremely helpful and always smiling!  Check in was pretty easy.  Parking is a bit of a nightmare and it is a couple blocks walk to get anywhere you may want to eat/drink/hang out.  The restaurant at the hotel is ok.  Menu needs work.  There is a bar on the third floor of the hotel that is pretty cool.  I would recommend this hotel.This hotel is a 1980s eye sore behemoth to begin with.I lived in Nashville last year and visited the Renaissance hotel daily because they have a great Starbucks with wonderful employees.  Unfortunately, it turns out that this is the best aspect of the place.  I stayed here this week while visiting the city and it was not a good experience.During the course of a four day trip, with one notable exception, I met with very poor hospitality service for a hotel in this price range.  On the first night, out heat did not work.  On our second day, the maid neglected to make up the room at all.  When we alerted the front desk, she came but didn't end up making the bed fully (she just pulled the covers back without ordering the sheets).  When this same scenario recurred the following day, the front desk staff recommended that we call each day to ask for maid service and to check to ensure that the maid would come.  It did not occur to me that this burden should be on the customer.A few other notes: the tap water is terrible and they only provide two tiny bottles of complimentary water on the first day of a multi-day stay, the tv selection is terrible.  The place has a shabby feel to it overall.On a positive note, the views are nice from the upper floors and the hotel lobby is pleasant.  One of the concierges was extremely helpful and even changed my mother's watch battery for her.
review_content_60: I am in Nashville for an executive meeting and happened to bring my family with me. The room is nice and clean, the elevators are quick and plentiful, and the shades on the windows cover nicely. That is about all I have nice to say about this hotel. One of my reasons for giving this two stars is because the indoor pool and their policies. Today my wife and two boys were swimming and since I had a break I went to see them. The pool was full of young adults that were drinking. I didn't care for their rowdiness or their language. I asked the person over the fitness center to talk to them. I was told that they were fine drinking in the pool as long as they don't have any glass containers. I told her that my children were in there and her response was that they were monitoring the situation. I then asked my wife to leave the pool area with my children. I did not care for the reactive nature in which she was going to handle the situation. This hotel is not kid friendly.One last point is that people are out in the halls being rowdy all night long and leave their messes behind. Cheese nips covered the floors in the hall this morning. What a surprise. Too loud and the tint on the windows needs to be fixed. The current tint is bubbled and you cannot see through some windows.This hotel is very nice. The staff seems genuinely concerned about your stay and very service oriented. The concierge lounge has one of the better selections that I have come across and I stay in hotel 40 weeks a year. Great spotThis review is for the 3rd floor atrium lounge.  We were looking for somewhere to relax and have a drink away from the craziness on Broadway.  Walked over here, thinking "hotel bars are mellow".  Made our way up to 3, and found Melissa and Tony, great bartenders and conversationalists.  My Manhattans were perfect (stirred, not shaken - how many bartenders even know that any more?) and Tony hand-stuffed bleu cheese into olives for the wife's dirty martinis!  It was a great way to kill an hour or so and another example of the wonderful people of Tennessee.  Great place to stop.Overall a letdown...can't compare to other Renaissance hotels we have stayed at. This, the former Stouffer hotel, is older, though it is being renovated. The lady at the desk that checked us in was very nice and friendly...however, the bellman was less so. He told us where everything was in the room, but didn't bother to put our one rolling duffel on the luggage stand, or even offer to get us ice.  We were "lucky" to be put into one of the newer rooms, a corner room on the 15th floor.  The room had a killer view of downtown Nashville, and looked great with its modern, minimalist decor. However, it felt pretty cramped for the three of us, especially after they finally delivered the crib to our room. Now this is a pet peeve of mine, but I have a list of requests that have been saved to my profile for five years. As platinum elite members! you would think they would actually look at these requests on the reservation. Well, I did get my feather-free bed...they stripped everything away except for a blanket and sheet, and three of those tiny foam pillows on our king bed. No crib, no extra pillows or towels. When we called down to request those thing again, we got an earful of attitude...no, those requests were never made... sigh, OK, they'll bring them up. An hour later, the crib arrives. I have to ask again for the pillows and blankets.  Another hour later, finally the pillows arrive but no blankets...sigh ...OK, they'll do us a favor and get those as well. Ugh. Check the damned reservation...all requests were made a month ago when I made the reservation!The worst part of it, however, was the bathroom...the friggin toilet didn't work right...it couldn't flush anything. Every time we flushed, it barely made it down...we had to call down to have it plunged three times in two days. The piece de resistance, however, was that there was no Hot water...there was lukewarm water from the taps...couple that with a really weak shower head, that equals a miserable cold shower. Management never offered to move us, or even apologize for this lousy experience. And keep in mind, this hotel is not cheap...the going rate was $310 a night plus $32 a night for parking...Not everything was bad...the parking valets were always friendly and amazingly fast...the doormen were helpful as well. The location and views were great. But the room itself...ugh! We'll try the Omni next time.Here for a trade show.. THE BEDS ARE THE BEST IN THE WORLD ! I found myself peeling myself from Broadway ( walking distance to all the amazing bars with non stop awesome music ) just to get back into the most wonderful silkyish sheets i have EVER been in !! The only thing is the price its like $300+ to stay.. prob bc of all the business people.. but if you have the doe .. stay here! Friendly staff .. structure parking on the other side of the bridge sky way.. plenty of space.. great size clean gym with a clean pool.. Love it!.. oh and $10/day wifi.. WTF with prices so high.. we should get it free!!If your traveling to Nashville the Renaissance hotel is a good place to stay. I have staied at this location several times and each time its been a great place to stay. People are nice. rooms are nice and i love the beds here. You are one block from all the action. you can be at many of the local bars in about 4 min.We initially had reservations at another hotel for our trip and it turned out to be a nightmare, but the Renaissance saved us!!They heard our story and offered a free upgrade to a room with a beautiful view.  We even woke up the next day to a personal note from the concierge hoping our accommodations with them were making our trip experience turn around.  When we checked out, another worker offered to drive us to the airport in the hotel Escalade instead of trying to cram into a cab.  Everyone we met provided such great and personalized service.Just blocks from the main drag, very safe area.  The Starbucks in the lobby is a nice addition.  The lobby also has specialized easy and free terminals from which to quickly print your boarding passes.  The only con I can think of is the charge for wireless internet.Overall a fantastic experience, we will absolutely return to both Nashville and the renaissance!A friend and I came to Nashville for a wedding and stayed at this hotel from 1/2-1/5. Upon our arrival, I authorized the agent to charge my card upfront for what she said was the full amount, and is reflected on my receipt (given at check-in), for our entire stay (1/2-1/5). Our stay there included an employee discount, which we thought accounted for the lower rate. After getting an email from my bank today, I noticed that on 1/4 I was charged two additional amounts that were not authorized, along with an additional amount on 1/5, also unauthorized. I called the hotel to try and get clarity on what happened. I spoke to someone named Lee who said that we, for some reason, were charged separately for each of the nights we were there. Apparently that's not how the Renaissance normally does things, according to her, but for some reason, this is how it was done with us. So, the original agent made a clerical error and charged us less. Ok, I understand that, they could have contacted us; she went on to say that someone left a message in our room - no message was ever received or seen. If there was a billing error, they did not try to reach me by phone or email. They could have also locked us out of the room, and that definitely would've have prompted us to visit the front desk.  Instead, they went ahead and charged my card without my authorization, they never informed me, and never provided a final receipt with the additional charges. Aside from this sort of huge thing, the hotel stay was fun. Enjoyed their retro-ish decor. Customer service post-stay, very incredibly unhelpful.Don't get an adjoining room here. Can hear the neighbors clear as day. Namely their TV. And it's not blaring.Great location! Clean. Friendly staff. But I have to warn anyone especially families or people beyond bachelor(ette) party age that there are MANY of these gatherings going on at/or nearby the hotel. The pool is crawling with them. We had an incident while there this weekend that may or may not be a rare occurrence but a bachelor party returned from the bars early morning (3am) and were quite rowdy. Eventually I believe the hotel took care of the problem (we ended up calling security), but I believe it's part of the scene also. Just unexpected.I absolutely loved the Mac and cheese they serve downstairs at the Lobbies Lounge. Made with Gouda and shrimp. Best I've ever had. Also had a chicken sandwich at the Bridge Lounge that was amazing! As far as the room goes, the beds are super soft and comfortable. Has a fridge but no microwave. My view was of a brick wall. They only have free wifi if you are ok the first three floors, otherwise you have to pay for it. The shower pressure was awful. Pretty close to downtown, walkable.Nice hotel. But a few odd things... toilet paper is all the way in the corner. You basically have to get off the seat to reach it. Tub is not deep enough soaks. Club room on 24th floor is tiny. Just basically the size of 2 hotel rooms. And breakfast offered is just okay - eggs, pastries, bagels, fruit. Eggs were a weird texture. They were scrambled but watery. Room service is no better. Ordered soup and didnt get a spoon. Wifi is not free. $10 daily for regular speed. $14 for high speed.We arrived with no problem, had the valet service park our car and went in to check-in.  The front desk was friendly and all was going well until we got our room.  The "Do Not Disturb" sign was on the door which was strange, so we walking in.  It was immediately clear that someone was either staying there or they had not cleaned the room at all.   Neither of the beds were made, there was used hotel soap on the counter in the bathroom along with used towels.  There was also an empty drink bottle sitting on the desk.  I called down to the front desk and asked them if they had by chance double booked that room. They informed me that we were the only people assigned to that room and according to their records, that room had been cleaned.  The lady that I spoke with was very nice and said a manager would call us back.  When she called us back, she told us that they would be bringing us up a key to a new room.  We got into the new room and it was alright.  The only complaint I had with the new room was that small things like the pens don't get switched out.  I needed to use the one in the room, but it had some disgusting white gunk all over it.  Other that it is was a good stay.  Breakfast was ok.  I probably wouldn't pay to stay there again, but the location is convenient.  The valet service was the best thing I had to say about this hotel.  They were awesome, super nice, and very prompt.Nicely appointed rooms-4 stars.  Disaster that is the elevator bank-0 stars.  Complete overhaul needed.  5 elevators that intend to serve the entire hotel?  Doesn't work.  Especially when all elevators access all floors.  For a hotel consistently this busy---a fix should have happened the week after it opened.  Better yet---should have been designed correctly in the first place.I've had quite a few business meetings and lunches here! Staff is always friendly and the food is alway superb! Chef Nick always delights my friends and I with great selections of food choices at The Commerce Street Grille! If you're there and would like to impress your guest for lunch/dinner, call ahead and ask for Jean to be your server if possible!The Renaissance is a nice hotel and us am excellent choice if you are looking to stay in downtown Nashville. If you're a Marriott Elite snob like me, then this location is an added bonus. The parking is typical of any hotel located downtown. It's $29 and change after tax per night. I loved being placed on the 25th floor which could only be accessed with a key. The concierge/executive floor was only one floor below and offered breakfast and evening light fare typical of Marriott hotels. I was really impressed that because I'd my Elite status, they offered me 25% off all meals at any restaurant in the hotel-score! It is also extremely convenient to all the downtown bars, pubs, restaurants and the like on Broadway (the main drag). Morton's, Panera and Subway are all just a few steps from the property. If you have a car though, I would definitely take the short drive to Arnold's for lunch. It's cheap down home cooking that will keep you satisfied for the day. Don't forget to try the chess pie - it's really sweet, but if you have a sweet tooth like me you'll love it.The bathroom left much to be desired. It had a fake renovation look, however, it was clearly outdated in comparison to the rest if the hotel. It was also pretty small. I seemed to get stuck with a toilet that would not flush. Unfortunately, I had to call down to the front desk twice and actually walk down there in order to get it repaired. It's never a good thing when your toilet does not flush. What made matters worse was that the manager seemed annoyed by my request for service. Didn't even bother to apologize for the inconvenience. The toilet was repaired after the third or fourth call. No bueno. I do wish I experienced better front desk service in general. My encounter with Liz at the front desk left a bad taste in my mouth for the property. Sometimes people just have bad day's. She seemed to have multiple.  On a good note, the bed was very comfortable. I could've slept for days. I do wish I experienced better front desk service. My encounter with Liz at the front desk left a bad taste in my mouth for the property. Sometimes people just have bad day's. She seemed to have multiple. The bar area located on the third floor is also pretty spectacular. You can stop there for drinks and a meal. The best part is that it stays open until 1 or 2 am and many nights you'll find people dancing the night away. I was not impressed with the size of the workout facility. For a hotel of this size, they should really look into expanding this space. There were only 3 eliptical machines and perhaps 5 treadmills. The area for free weights, etc was super small, so at 6:00 am you had to fight for space. During my week at the Renaissance, I had to get up at 5:00 am each morning in order to get a machine. If you are not there before 6:00 am you will have to wait for a machine. No bueno!Overall, this is an excellent property and I would definitely recommend it. Just be aware that the valet and front desk service may have several "off" days.The Nashville Ren is a very nice property, I'm not sure that I would pay rack rate but my corporate rate makes staying here a no-brainer when I'm in Nashville.  Everything downtown is within walking distance and you could probably get by without a car if  needed.The hotel has beautiful views of downtown from the higher floors and executive lounge on the 24th floor.  A Starbucks in the lobby is a nice amenity to kick off the day.The pool and fitness center are small for a hotel of this size.  I like to swim laps for exercise when I am on the road but the pool here is too small for lap swimming.The rooms are well appointed with comfortable beds and large HDTV's.  I have no complaints about this property, I'll stay here again when in Nashville!Great hotel downtown, close to everything.  Bonus you get Marriott points!We met some friends at the hotel restaurant for a nice, relaxed dinner just prior to walking over to the Ryman for Santana. We are often scrambling around for a dinner place prior to Ryman concerts and tend to overlook this one as it doesn't show up on Yelp when searching for food. It should. We had excellent drinks, excellent service from Justin and great food. I would recommend several of the pasta dishes, one person enjoyed a very good steak and the salad was also top notch.Being charged $13.95 per day for wireless is a bit 2001, don't ya think? Even McDondald's offers free wifi now. I expected better.  Save yourself $20 a day and park across the street in the parking garage.We also had a nice penis-shaped stain on our carpet to welcome us.
review_content_80: Cool Hotel, great staff, excellent beds, had a great room with a great view.It feels authentic and has been in the area for years.
