The pool is very small, but there is a nice seating area with large skylights. CONS- The shower head was bizarrely low. It was almost too short for me and I am 5'3". Not sure what was going on with that.My typical home base when I'm in Music City.  I keep coming back for the following reasons:1) Location - walking distance to all of downtown.  Yes, it's up a hill, but after eating and drinking to excess, I'm sure I can use the exercise.2) Price - they generally have rooms available at the government rate, which is what I need for business trips.  The rooms aren't anything special compared to other hotels, but they are generally clean.3) Fitness room - multiple machines so you're not waiting forever, and you overlook the street and can watch people go by (as an alternative to the TVs)4) Staff - I wish I could remember her name, but there's one lady at the front desk who always greets me by first name even when it's been months since I've last been there.  She is AMAZING!  And, in general, everyone is pretty nice and helpful5) The cookie!Great customer service - excellent cookies!Super breakfast club service (it is worth it!)I really enjoyed the location and experience at the Doubletree. Only downside is the bellman never got my bags (in and out of the cab) Nor were they able to hail a cab.Also - definitely would not pay more than $150 for a room.I stayed at this hotel for one night on Sunday, October 13, and this was the worst experience I have ever had with a Hilton property based on the incompetency of the staff. I'm a Hilton Honors gold member and this was my wedding night. I've stayed at countless Hilton properties this year, and Double Tree is one of my favorite Hilton properties by far. With multiple options available in downtown Nashville, I opted to go with the Double Tree for this reason. When I chose this location, I had anticipated it being an exquisite experience for my first night as a newlywed. I wanted a special night for my wife. Upon my first arrival at around 1:30 in the afternoon, the valet just stood there when I pulled into the drive; no one greeted my car or welcomed me to the hotel. I should mention that years ago I had worked valet myself, and on this occasion I was accompanied by my Best Man who happens to be a manager of a prominent valet company. We both knew this was unacceptable. The welcome only got worse from there. When I walked up to the front desk, we were again not greeted. We walked up to one of the two people working at the front desk and asked if it was too early to check in. It was before 3:00pm, so we acknowledged that  we arrived before normal check in time, and this was understandable that our room was not yet ready. I asked if I could just run up to the room to drop off a bottle of champagne and some champagne flutes so that they would be in the room upon our arrival later in the night, but the man I was talking to couldn't answer that question. He turned to who I'm assuming was the front desk supervisor, and without looking up she just shook her head annoyingly to say no. I then asked if someone could put the champagne and flutes up in the room with some ice when it was ready, but the desk attendant (who's name was Aaron I believe) again could not answer my question. He again asked the other front desk attendant to see what could be done, and her response to Aaron was, "That's not my problem. I'm about to leave." At this point my Best Man and younger brother, who has worked in the service industry for almost 10 years, stepped in and said, "It's only his wedding night". At that point Aaron said he would make sure the champagne was kept cool and put into the room. The other front desk person still couldn't have cared less.When I arrived later in the evening around 9:00pm to check in with my wife, the valet staff this time welcomed us and so did the front desk staff. However, when we arrived to our room, the champagne and flutes were not in the room as earlier requested even though Aaron had assured me it would be. I called guest services to find out where everything was, and the response I received was a cavalier "Oh yes we have it here. Would you like to come get it or would you like us to bring it up?"I have never been so upset and disappointed with a hotel stay as I was with this Double Tree. It was my wedding night, and this occasion cannot be recreated. My wife and i were both disappointed. I would never recommend anyone to stay here.I stayed here two months ago and had the best experience I ever had a hotel. The staff was polite and super friendly. We joked around about me  being from Chicago and how the cold didn't bother me much. The clerk behind the desk was really helpful and even gave me a pass for breakfast. Shhh don't tell anyone I'm not sure if she was suppose to do it. The girl at the information booth was helpful in finding the Carter house and doing some touristy stuff. Even the waiter at the breakfast buffet was awsome. The second morning he remembered me and asked if I wanted the same drink as the day before. It seems likes small gesture but it was huge customer service in my book.This hotel is in a great location, especially if you are in town for a football game at LP field. It is clean and the rooms are relatively spacious. This place is in need of an update.  Things are a little worn looking, but clean and maintained.   We ate downstairs since I was hungry when we arrived and the food was good. I had a cobb salad and it was fresh and good. Friends got the fried pickles and they were really good.This place sucked!!!! We had a group of 21 people staying in the hotel. The construction is going on but we didn't mind that the front door was unable to be used. Our room's tub would not drain. Taking a shower with water up to your ankles is just plain disgusting. We called for someone and he came pretty quickly. What didn't happen quickly is receiving toilet paper. We had to call FOUR TIMES before they came up. We plugged in the hair dryer and the iron and it blew a fuse. Is this a joke? Another room that was used (a suite) came back to their room to find their toilet had EXPLODED while they were gone. Unexcusable. They were offered to be moved UPSTAIRS to a regular room ( a down grade. No thanks).  The next day, our tub STILL didnt drain and we blew ANOTHER fuse, this time from only the iron.  When calling the front for a manager, he said he would call us back in 20 minutes. 40 minutes later, we went down to the desk to complain. He made us wait another 20 minutes to see him. It was an absolute joke. This is not a cheap hotel so all of these issues should not have happened. The only thing this place has going for them is location. It is a short walk to all the bars and restaurants.Location is excellent. Walking distance to everything downtown. Hotel is clean. Service is quick and pleasant. Bar is great downstairs. Bartenders make solid drinks. Food is actually pretty good. Get the chicken fingers. It is odd that I mention chicken fingers, but they were that good. Lacking a gym and pool and that kind of stuff though. Free breakfast buffet was pretty good. Overall, great stay, will be back.I had a mixed bag of experiences here. For starters I had booked a three night stay here through Expedia and specified Non Smoking as the option for my room. When I checked in I was given a room for smokers complete with ashtrays, yellow stained walls and the smell of nicotine throughout the room.  When I asked about that the clerk told me that Expedia sometimes accepts just any old room that is available. If so Expedia has some serious explaining to do...After my first night here I saw that I needed to add on another night to my stay. When I went down to the desk and spoke to the clerk he said that there were no vacancies for the extra day I needed to stay in Nashville. But he said that I was welcome to ask about vacancies on the morning of my check out. Not a good option seeing that I want to know before I check out if i can stay another day or not. Not too helpful (or smart) on his part! I then went up to my room and did a search on Expedia (yes the same Expedia that was claimed to have wrongly booked me a smokers room), Anyway there I found vacant rooms at this very hotel. Vacant rooms in every possible shape and size for the extra day I needed to stay here. I quickly proceeded to book one and went down to the lobby once again and spoke to another clerk who said that there were several vacancies for the day I needed to stay. He also said that he would speak to the other clerk who gave me faulty info.  The rooms were otherwise nice and clean, great breakfast buffe (although that cost extra and was not included in my booked package). Good inhouse restaurant with excellent entertainment the night I ate there. The location of the hotel is perfect if you plan to visit attractions in downtown Nashville. Short walking distance to everything there, but still with the advantage of not being right on the main strip with the loud  ambient noises you'd get there.I will consider coming back to stay here if I can get a guarantee of not getting a smokers room. Perhaps I'll book through the hotels own website next time and cut out the middle man (Expedia who most likely screwed up my reservation).Meh is the best description I have for my experience at this Doubletree Hotel.  The Superb:  The desk staff were very friendly.  The hot cookies were a nice touch.The Average:  Average bed, bedding, etc.The Horrid:  Slow drains, minimal air conditioning, and a toilet that bubbled and burped smells that were pretty awful.Would I stay here again?  Probably not, especially with the Sheraton within the same walking distance.We were here last week for a convention.Good location.Room was comfortable. Bed was great.It is centrally located in downtown.Easy walkable distance to Ryman Auditorium, the Second Ave. shops, and the Broadway honky tonks.Free Wifi.Free chocolate chip walnut cookies at checkin.Decent catering food items at reception party, breakfasts, lunches, breaks. and farewell dinner.I have sampled egg biscuits with cheese, bagels with cream cheese, blueberry muffin with strawberry jam, cheese and pecan danishes, orange juice, grapefruit juice, various fruit platters, granola bars, various Lays potato chips, oranges, banana, green apple, red apple, pineapple, grapes, coffee, tea, iced tea, Coke, Sprite, Dr. Pepper ,spinach puff, chicken puff, shrimp cocktail, crab mushroom puff, various cheese and crackers, M&Ms ,raisins ,mixed nuts, various  energy bars ,roast beef sandwiches, chicken salad sandwiches, vegetable wraps, chicken medallions stuffed with spinach, pasta primavera, garlic bread, caesar salad, chicken kabobs, vegetable lasagna, mashed potato, various grilled summer vegetables, cheesecake, etc. As you can see, we were well fed.Elevators were OK if a little slow.They have a business center where you could print out your boarding passes.The only problems was loud fan, moldy ceiling, running toilet, and you have to find your own taxi because you could not find a porter.There is a taxi stand across the street.Maids never clean anymore.  I left the "please change my sheets" card on my bed and they weren't changed.  The carpet was not vacuumed.  The bathroom floor wasn't mopped.  Lazy...  Mediocre accommodations for the outrageous nightly rate we paid.  Stay somewhere else.Had to write this review about the great customer service. The team at the check in counter was helpful and kind. Beds were very comfy and the walk to the nightlife only 5 minutes, a shuttle was also available. Recommend to anyone looking to enjoy downtown...in fairness prices will fluctuate depending on the scheduled events so moderate and up is a variable.For the price I paid, I expected a lot more.  The first day we were in our room everything seemed okay, but we didn't spend much time in our room.  The second day, we toured the city all day and when we came back by 3:30pm-ish, our rooms weren't even clean yet.  By that time, we just wanted to rest and didn't want to be bothered.  The third day, the toilet in the bathroom leaked and water was all over the floor.  It took  a while for someone to come and fix it, but it didn't even seem like they completely fixed the issue, just put a patch that solved the leak, but the toilet had a hard time flushing for the rest of time we were there. The fourth day, we needed to get our car at night to get some White Castle and the Valet guy was no where to be found for a 10 minutes.I gave this place 2 stars instead of 1 star because the front desk hooked us up with a bunch of warm, gooey, and delicious chocolate chip cookies every time we asked and there was a Starbucks in the lobby!Room is old and smelly. Service was mediocre. Restaurant has poor service except for breakfast and the older guy in the evening.  I'm so disappointed because I stay at the hilton brand hotels frequently. There was a cockroach in my room. Flat iron steak was nasty. Mushroom pasta was so oily. No bread or sugar with my tea. :( everyday I am continually disappointed.I stayed there for two nights last week and was not happy. The room was small and not very clean to begin with, then the bathroom was not cleaned at all during our stay. I complained to the front desk and they did ask if I needed more towels, but that was it. Overall the room cleanliness was unsatisfactory and not up to what I would consider to be Hilton standard. I have stayed in many Doubletrees and been very happy, so actually sought this one out. I would not recommend this hotel.
review_content_80: Nice room, nice staff, cookie at checkin. Comfortable bed, nice size room. Excellent amenities, great location, good rate, overall excellent place to stay in Nashville.Stayed here while attending a wedding in Nashville.  They have a good bar downstairs with live music, and a great bartender for breakfast beverage recommendations.  The rooms are nice and ours had a great view of downtown.  The bartender and the concierge were great helps for getting around downtown and meal recommendations.  We'll definitely stay here the next time we're in Nashville!Tried to check in early and was told that actually we couldn't check in until 4. Our paperwork clearly says check in is at 3 so was hoping we could get in earlier but the guy kept saying we've changed our check in time to 4 so it's fine if you come in at 3 but we are at capacity and you won't be able to check in before then. After a long flight I think at least someone willing to accommodate or try to check I. On options would have been nice. Annoying!Let me preface this by saying that I'm originally from the Nashville area, and that the city is sorely lacking in quality hotels. My husband and I were going to a charity event and went back and forth on whether we should stay at Hotel Indigo or the Doubletree (both a few blocks from the venue). We went with the Doubletree, even though it was pricier, as I've always been a fan of Hilton brands.From the moment we checked in until the moment we left, the service was terrible at best. None of the hotel employees knew anything about anything--when we checked in they gave us a breakfast voucher and told us if we wanted to use it for room service we could, but when we called later for room service, they laughed in our faces when we tried to redeem the voucher--and the rooms have seen better days. We had a corner executive king, and it was comfortable enough (and BIG), but the doorknobs were rusty, the bathroom was falling apart, and it seemed the hotel hadn't had any updates since the 1980s.When we stepped on one of the elevators with four other people, it slammed and stopped. I am terrified of getting stuck on an elevator, so I immediately got off as soon as the doors reopened. I was stuck waiting another 10 minutes for the next one to come. The elevators there are slooooow (and old).The neighborhood is OK during the week, but I had forgotten that EVERYTHING shuts down on the weekends. We arrived at 3pm and were looking for sandwiches; there were two Quiznos, two Subways and a bevy of other chains in the area. They all closed at noon. ON A SATURDAY. Weird, right? Even the Starbucks inside the hotel was shut.Our room was right near the elevator shaft, and it was so loud--there were people stumbling out of it drunk, yelling at all hours of the night, and we could hear everything through the thin walls. Pair that with the heating unit that hummed and kicked on and off all night long, and it wasn't a very restful night for either of us.But what was worse was the housekeeper busting in our room unannounced at 9am. Now, I spend half of the year living out of hotel rooms and I'm very accustomed to housekeeping trying to usher you to check out as early as possible, but this guy just threw open our door without so much as a knock. AT 9AM. Luckily, I was downstairs getting coffee, but my husband was standing there, fully nude, about to get into the shower. Not the kind of wake-up call you want, if you know what I mean. And then to make matters worse, the guy didn't apologize and was terribly rude to my husband, who wasn't all that jazzed in the first place about some other guy seeing his goods.The only good thing about this hotel was the warm chocolate chip cookies at check-in (a signature Doubletree amenity) and the complimentary breakfast.Overall, I would NOT pay the $206 to stay here again (that's what it came to for a night including the $26 parking fee). I would fork over a little extra cash and stay at the Hermitage or Hutton instead--or just go for one of the more budget brands like the Indigo.We had a fantastic stay at the downtown double tree. Stopped here on a Sunday night, the front desk attendant Kevin was amazing. Since they didn't seem to be very full he upgraded us to a suite on the 7th floor which had incredible city views. They have a complimentary shuttle which takes you around the downtown area. I did have trouble accessing their wifi with my Mac but the room had an Internet cable that worked just fine. The breakfast buffet included an omelette station. Everyone on the staff was friendly an helpful. Plus who can complain about free cookies??It's a nice place to stay and is pretty close to Broadway and all the fun! However, this trip over the weekend and our first experience at this hotel 2 years ago always have mini-mess-ups right when we get there that just frustrate me and are totally avoidable.But overall, we stay here b/c it's a pretty good place to stay. I just hate walking that God awful steep hill at night when you're blasted and just want to get home. Oy to the vey.The front desk staff is always courteous and helpful. PLUS, who can beat their warm cookies???Not worth the price we paid even at a discount. The room smelled like mildew and the carpet was wet for two days outside of the bathroom. The hotel staff was so unfriendly and not helpful. We decided to leave a day earlier than planned.We just returned from our stay for the CMA fest.  The staff was very pleasant, room was clean, and managers present.  I'm not sure if it's because the hotel was so full.  The bathroom was tiny and the shower head was very low.  I'm 5'5 and had to duck to rinse my hair.  The location was great for us and we enjoyed the comp. breakfast ( hilton honors program).   I would stay here again.Lastly would have liked to have wi-fi in the room.  It was only available in the lobby and ballroom.  :(Passing through Nashville we again relied on the iPhone to choose a convenient downtown hotel where we would be able to walk around and see the city and leave the car, which is what we prefer to do. Narrowing to the Doubletree and Courtyard, both on 4th about 2 blocks away from each other we opt'd for the Doubletree and were very pleased with the decision.The staff was all super friendly and the room was incredibly comfortable. The lounge with it's free wi-fi was a perfect place to chill after walking around the city and having dinner. They had a guitar player down there who was quite talented and it made for a nice night.The food and bar were both great and the omelet station in the morning was a nice addition. Of course there are the super-yummy warm Doubletree cookies at check-in :)! I also loved the Nutrogena products in the bathroom since I'm a fan of the foaming face wash.This is more about the on-site restaurant in this hotel. We went there to eat lunch buffet.  They used to have good selection of food, including made to order food, desert...  However, this time, it was really countable number of food are available for buffet.  One of the selection, Fried Chicken, was quite bad.  all grease dripping and were very soggy with no taste but the taste of oil. Some food were quite dry as though it as out for quite some time, even though lunch buffet just has started.  And no single desert to choose from except you pay extra from regular menu.  Empty, dirty plate was not cleared until we asked, drink was not refilled.  The restaurant was not really up to the name of Double Tree. Needless to say since it is in Double Tree, the price is not cheap either or should I say overcharged for the selection of food.Decent hotel. The managers were very good to my wife and I. It was our anniversary and unfortunately we were given a room with a double bed. I asked the manager for a king sized bed and she worked very hard and had a new room for me within three hours. The main problem with the hotel is they do not have a spa, which is huge for me when I travel. Other than that the location is great....three blocks from Music Row. Unfortunately, all the hotels in Nashville have valet parking due to the lack of parking space. $25 a day.I recently stayed in the doubletree, downtown nashville and here is my tried and true good/bad list.  Good.1.  Great location - right near all of the restaurants and strip of bars.  if you can stand to walk a few blocks, this is a fine hotel selection for you.2.  Staff is very responsive - you will never wait a moment too long for someone to ask if they can help with bags, cars, etc.  Bad.1.  The rooms are small - we're talking European small.  You can hardly close the door to the bathroom behind you.  This was not the ideal place to get ready for a wedding or special event.  2.  The television that I had in my room didn't work.  Not cool when you have a husband trying to watch a football game....staff came to mitigate the problem - but failed and we had to live with it.  All in all, if you aren't traveling for business, this is a fine place to shack up for a night of nashville fun.  I would recommend this to a friend.This is a nice hotel, very friendly staff.  My issue is that the valet service removed all the quarters from my vehicle and I had plenty in there.  I keep (kept) an unusually high amount of change in there because I park at street meters daily.I wrote the hotel an email with my concerns in early October and got no response so I have to assume they aren't interested in the overall satisfaction of their guests.Interior of the hotel is ordinary. Congestion is a problem at the entrance, and the path from outside to the desk (or anywhere else in the hotel) is inconvenient and confusing. Parking valets are disorganized and distracted, and either do not adequately watch the cars or are themselves pilfering cash from them. Hotel staff is otherwise friendly and helpful.I don't know whether there is any connection between the management of the hotel and the on-premises Starbucks, but I have been a Starbucks customer for 30 years and at this location was served the worst Frappuccino I have ever had.I will find a different hotel next time I spend the night in Nashville.i had the best stay here!  everyone was amazing.  when i checked in, i was greeted by a front desk woman, Lindsay who was so nice to me and very accommodating.  The lobby was spacious and they had a little gift shop, a bar, a starbucks and a restaurant there for your convenience.I decided to take a trip to Nashville all by myself, and as a woman alone, I was a little weary about public transportation and/or taxis, just because I was alone.  As it turns out, they offer a shuttle that will drive you to wherever you need to go.  The main strip is only a couple of block away, but in 108 degree weather, I wasn't planning to walk there.  The shuttle driver that was on shift was Maria and she was the warmest, nicest, person and I was so happy to meet her.  She dropped me off on Broadway, the busiest area, and I found myself hiding in the Grand Ole Opry souvenir store for far too long because of the amazing air conditioning.  Back on track... I very much enjoyed my stay at the Doubletree and would absolutely recommend it to anyone visiting the area!Check in was great, person at the front desk was nice and helpful and...frosty... We did not receive our much anticipated cookie at check in. Parking Valet was nice and courteous however we were almost broadsided by a valet barreling out of the parking garage while waiting to pull in. Room might as well have been at the budget inn as it was basic (but clean) and a little sloppy with wires dangling down around the TV, behind the desk and around the night stand. After getting out of the ankle deep, slow draining pool of water while showering in the tiny bathroom, we noticed that there was white dust everywhere, we looked up and realized from the bare spots on the ceiling that we were getting showered by the popcorn finish on the ceiling raining down.We booked this on our anniversary weekend because the Renaissance Nashville Hotel was full where we had stayed on our honeymoon for two-thirds the price and ten times the service and room.awesome location! within walking distance of downtown. great customer service! Josh was super helpful & went above & beyond his professional duties to help us out! thanks Josh!! ...breakfast not worth it though.Love cookies and staffI'm a lot like the other reviewers for the DT in the sense that I liked the property but  the area around the hotel left a bit to be desired. It's not as bad as most people on here said, but it's very sparse in terms of restaurants or places to eat. I had no problems walking back from the bars at 3am by myself and I'm built like a lawn dart. I'm not scaring any muggers off. The hotel is nice and the service I received was on par with the Hilton properties I usually stay at. The only nuisance I found was the mandatory valet service. It's a PITA when I have to swing back in for an hour and vallet my freaking car. What sense does that make? They do offer a shuttle service that runs within a 2 mile radius and the shuttle drivers are very nice and informative.  I also liked the Staubucks in the lobby and the bar in the down stairs. The hotel offers everything you'd need and it's right in the middle of downtown. I'll be back!We were here during the Country Music Awards.. it was very busy. The layout of this hotel is somewhat strange, it has a street level entrance that requires you to push your bags through a small door and into an elevator - after a long day of travel, this wasn't what I was looking for..as there are only so many elevators.  Guest reception was a breeze, the clerks were all very professional and helpful.  A nice place to stay, a little dated but nice.

review_content: As a actor I am in Nashville at times filming and booked this suite over the telephone. The manager Valerie was outstanding. The room and furnishings were truly four star. Very clean. Roger and Lana at the front desk are more than helpful and go out of their way to make sure myself and other guests are very satisfied. When I required a limo service Valerie and Lana arranged that for me, The restaurant has very good food and the bar also was enjoyable. Very near bustling downtown. The shuttle when I did use it for the airport was ontime with a very friendly driver. They also have a ATM and a  business center located in the lobby with computers,printers and a fax that is open 24 hours.The fitness room downstairs is a very well equipped gym. Room service is fast.I truly believe they should recieve a four star rating.Thank You Millennium Maxwell House Hotel!!!Antonio LuccheseNew York CityIf I could rate something LESS than 1-star, I would. In fact, Yelp, can we think about negative ratings? Because my stay was (is) THAT bad. I got this hotel based on an Express Deal off Priceline - it claimed to be a 3-Star hotel located downtown. Neither of these statements are true. All the cabs, Ubers and Lyfts I have taken all agree that while saying this hotel downtown is technically true based on streets, it's a stretch to say that it IS downtown. The shuttle the hotel provides that goes downtown is the hotel's only saving grace. And even the shuttle is completely unreliable. The sign for the shuttle claims it arrives every half hour on the 14/45's. Upon arrival, the front desk tells me that it usually runs 15-20 mins off schedule... Which doesnt at all help anyone plan ahead. Good thing for $7Uber/Lyfts downtown. Worth the cost to save the headache of trying to predict shuttle times! I paid for a King room so imagine my surprise when I get to my room and see 2 full beds. When I called down to complain, there wasn't an apology but rather I was told there were no King rooms and I could switch rooms THE NEXT DAY. Finally, after enough ire, they told me I could get a room with a King later that night while I kept my things in the original room they'd given me in the meantime. And then there's the hotel itself. I don't know HOW this hotel gets away with calling itself a 3-star when it's barely a motel. The building, and all its rooms, are beyond dated, which makes everything from the walls to the floors look dirty and rundown. The beds are clean (after inspection) but walking on the carpets gave me the willies (while I usually take my shoes off inside hotel rooms, they stayed on here!). The sink, which is located outside the bathroom, was chipped and the faucet dripping when I arrived. The bathtub has a dip, which makes it feel as if I'm going to fall straight down into the room below at any moment, not to mention the rust around the drain. Most annoying of all is that the walls are PAPER THIN and the doors dont close unless you SLAM them shut, which means doors are slamming at all times of the day. It got SO bad that even though Id prepaid for the room on Priceline, when the opprotunity came up to share a room at another hotel with a friend who was passing through for a night, I jumped on the chance! It was nice to get a decents nights rest, and use a shower I didnt think would break at some point. I saw what this hotel charges regularly and was appalled. Even with the deal I got with Priceline, I feel like I got the raw end of the deal. Not only will I not recommend this to anyone, I will advocate AGAINST this property and will be writing to Priceline about my disappointment.** for the record, a member of their management team did reach out to apologize for this stay, and tried to rectify the situation, which is always greatly appreciated. The property is to be renovated in the summer, perhaps that will solve the remainder of the problems.This wasn't our first choice for a hotel but it was a busy weekend in Nashville and it left us very few options. I felt like the hotel was ok for the price. First impressions; the lobby was nice. The gal at the front desk wasn't overly friendly and advised that no rooms would be ready until after the 4 pm check in (we got there at 3). Fair enough; we dropped our bags off to head for other activities and got a call 10 minutes later our room was ready. Strange it wasn't ready 10 minutes before. The room was ok. The beds and pillows were adequate. I didn't realize they were full beds instead of queens so they were a bit tight for two people. The linens were white and clean, which is very important to me. The bathroom wasn't as clean as I would like, there was a water leak in the shower, but the water pressure was adequate. Sometimes I'm unimpressed with hotel showers but this one was ok. We spent some time at the hotel bar (Maxwells) Friday night, they had a good group for Karaoke. It was a good time. Saturday morning we had the breakfast buffet at Prailenes. It was $12 and was decent. Not the best; not the worst. The elevators were seriously lacking. One smelt of vomit and by Sunday morning, the vomit elevator was the only working elevator out of three. It took quite sometime to leave the floor, which was frustrating. All in all I felt like this hotel was average at best. It was one of the cheaper hotels in Nashville so I felt like I got what I paid for. If you pay more than $250 a night you're getting a rip off for this hotel. It really should be priced lower for the quality.First let me say we are only staying here because we have an event being held here, we would be at a different hotel if that want the case.  (No bellman or valet)So the room rate was suppose to be 129, with the group rate it's actually 159 because we are on the club floor, (club floor at a Sheraton means suite room with complimentary meals in their buffet) with a microwave and a refrigerator(which is hardly cold)  so I tried to say that this is a ridiculous price for a hotel that should be a one star rating based on the out dated condition of the room and facilities.  The door hinges are practically rusted through.  The edges of the carpet haven't been vacuumed in twenty years.  The carpet is dirty and had toothpaste on it.  There are bugs (lady bugs) crawling up the walls.  The door to the room is so thin you can hear everything out in the hallway including the slamming shut of every door down the hall. I tried to complain and the rude front desk minion told me I needed to complain when we first checked in!  I was like we were tired after traveling all day with little kids, and didn't want have to move out 10 pieces of luggage again. He tried to treat me like I was an idiot!  I was like listen to me very carefully we live in Las Vegas I have a complete understanding about the hospitality industry and this outdated, uncaring staff, clearly does not know how to treat their guests and their misrepresentation of the location is ridiculous.  It is in a rundown part of Nashville and really isn't in downtown.  It is also located next door to a women's mental asylum complete with cemetery (totally like American Horror Story).    Three days later and we still don't have a new comforter and the lady bugs are multiplying. Went to the front desk and again attempted to bring this problem to someone's attention.  Adrian asked me to send him the photo of the comforter and apologized and said it would be taken care of.  They gave us breakfast buffet comps (whoopity whoop....sarcasm).I usually don't do reviews but this hotel was so bad I have to say something. This hotel is so outdated. I received terrible service from the front desk when we were checking in and the manager after we complained about it. The air conditioning was not working in the building. To be honest you would think you would need it in February but it was really warm that day. It was 72 degrees and it seemed like 100 degrees in our room. The man who checked us in picked on my wife for filling out the reservation wrong and scolded her. Then when I confronted the manager about it he sided with the front desk and then he scold us. On top of all of that when I got up to our room we found bed bugs. Check back out got our money and went to another hotel. It will never happen again.We just checked in and already I'm sorry. My husband booked this hotel online, and where he booked it, he said the reviews were above average....I'd like to know from what decade they were from.  Certainly not this one, or the previous one for that matter.Nevertheless, he was caught in the same deal as many others were, a non refundable commitment.  They plan it this way, so when you actually get to do your due diligence, like on YELP, you would NEVER book this hotel.  The bathroom was not only moldy, but rusty as well.  One day we ran out of toilet paper.  The maid came in but didn't replace the cardboard roll that remained on the wall. She put the new roll on the back of the toilet!I never saw that...it made me think the maid was a man, not a woman.It's a good thing we only needed this hotel for sleeping, because surprisingly, the bed was comfortable.  However, the bed pillows were bought in Walmart for $2.50, I'll bet.  Don't look for ice, there was none.  Don't look for water in the soda machine at the end of the hall, it's not there.  Don't look for diet soda either, nada....WTF?I looked through the loose leaf showing pictures of the hotel, and it's lobby.  I had to look twice because the pictures in the book were not of the actual lobby.  Chippendale traditional chairs in the book....mismatched worn out, flattened down leather(?), in reality.  My advice for this hotel, besides burn it down and rebuild, at least renovate your bathrooms.  Anyone would gladly pay a few dollars more for a new bathroom.The hotel's low ratings and horrid reviews were quite off-putting, but I was staying here with a friend who had booked the room for a night. Although not extravagant, the hotel lobby was well-kept. The workers at the front desk were friendly and answered our questions regarding the free downtown shuttle. About 1x / 20-30 minutes, the shuttle goes to the Nashville Convention Center and then the airport, it seems. The front desk also gave us extra toiletries when we requested. The hallways and the elevators were fairly stuffy and needed a good airing out. The room itself was tidy and the sheets appeared to be clean. There were the usual little bottles of shampoo, conditioner, body wash, and body lotion. If you happen to need something else, it's likely that they have it in their gift shop on the 1st floor right outside the elevators. The shop has items ranging from typical souvenir items to over-the-counter drugs. Millennium Maxwell House Hotel may not be a 5-star hotel, but it was a decent place to stay at for a night while we explored Nashville.We stayed in this hotel because it was a "secret deal" on Hotwire. After finding out which hotel we had won, I was terrified by the bad reviews and tried (unsuccessfully) to find a way to cancel. Pretty much the whole city of Nashville was sold out, and I felt completely stuck. Here's the thing: the bad reviews are largely exaggerated.The fact is, this is an adequate hotel. Clean enough, nice enough. I think people have an issue with the place because it's basically a Holiday Inn Express (minus the free breakfast) posing as a much more expensive hotel. It's not a bad place, it's just not a good match for its price point.The young man who checked us in kept answering phone calls and only gave us 25% of his attention, but nobody dies from that.We had a quiet night's sleep, and we did not take advantage of the pool, gift shop, or the restaurant, so I can't comment on those. I had to pay $6.50 to use a computer for 2 minutes to print our Grand Ole Opry tickets, which is kind of gross for such a "nice" hotel.You'll be fine here. Just don't overpay. Try to get the best deal possible, and you won't hate it so much. No bed bugs. No mold. No dirty sheets. No big deal.Started reading Yelp's reviews when we arrived and were horrified about roach mentioned in the reviews.Our room turned out to be just fine, albeit not perfect. But for $150(including taxes) a night, you are close to the city center and free (tips will be nice) shuttle to city center, we thought it's not too bad of deal.Mac, the shuttle driver, was very helpful and friendly giving us some nice tips around town and we did not have to wait more than 10 minutes each way.The cleaning crew we ran into always greeted us. We did not saw any roach house in our room nor it's resident-great relief!! I hate bugs!We saw some people by the pool side relaxing, sunbathing, or reading--quite a soothing scene.Location is convenient -close to major freeways.Wow.  This place looked fancy at first, but that quickly went downhill.  As I approached the front desk, I was greeted with the most robotic greeting and zero smile and told "let me have your ID and I will verify it", which was then repeated to me as I looked through my purse to pull out my ID.  That seemed either rude or like she wasn't even paying attention, either way, weird for someone in hospitality.  Night and day difference from my stay at the Hilton Garden Inn in Franklin last night, where I got a smile, pleasant greeting and an inquiry into how my travel went.The room itself is pretty awful.  I ended up booked here on my way back from a work trip, but I'd never stay here again.  It's literally falling apart, the guide references items that don't exist and has one info sheet dated 1995.  The guide tells me to lock the deadbolt in addition to the electronic lock, except my room doesn't have one.As soon as I turned the shower on, the tub started filling up despite the drain being open and the water blasted right through the curtain.  I took a quick, under 10min shower and the bathroom is now completely soaked.  My shade is busted so I guess I'll be changing in my soaking wet bathroom or hiding in the opposite corner.  I'd ask for another room except now that I've read the other reviews, I'm afraid it would be even worse.  Closet doesn't fully shut, dresser drawer is stuck partially out, and the rubber molding at the base of the wall by the door is falling off with grossness revealed behind it.Decent place with a friendly staff. I like the location and easy access to the freeway. Looks like it may need some upgrades or a remodel.Has to be one of the worst hotels I've stayed in. Run down and dirty. The walls are literally PAPER thin. They bizarrely put conference rooms in the middle of the hallway on guest floors. I've never seen that at a hotel. Typically the conference rooms are near the lobby on the main floor.  So now at 1:00am (as I'm writing this) there's currently a group of loud drunk people screaming and singing songs. Not sure 1) Why they have been allowed to stay until 1:00am without anyone enforcing the noise 2) Why are there even conference rooms in the middle of hotel guest rooms 3) IT IS 1:00 IN THE MORNING! WHY IS THIS GROUP EVEN IN A CONFERENCE ROOM BECAUSE THEY CLEARLY AREN'T DISCUSSING BUSINESS Overall horrible experience. Definitely wouldn't stay here again.We just wanted a clean affordable place to stay.  What we got was a very dated, shabby  room. The rug needed to be vacumed,the bathroom door and wallpaper were dirty. On our last day the shower knob for the tub fell off while my husband was showering.  The lobby had a terrible odor.  In a not so nice area of town. Oh and by the way it was not such a great price  either. We booked through hot wire and could not leave early or get a refund.  I have 1 positive, the staff was extremely nice.Its advertised as downtown Nashville, but lets be honest, youre about 7 miles out Maxwell House. The free shuttles running all day til 1030pm to downtown definitely makes up for that. The lobby had a grandma's closet kinda vibe.. No refrigerators in the rooms. No cold water in the showers. WiFi was slow. No continental breakfast. Maid service stopped in around 11:30am, asking them nicely to come back in an hour they never returned. In room coffee is provided, but there should be a sign that reads "STOP: There's a Starbucks across the street."Front Desk was very helpful when asking questions.Close to freeway, so if you dont want the service you expect in a hotel experience and want a clean getaway after you grab McDonalds or Arbys, then this place is top notch.Most of my experience was mild mediocre down to the last drop.The lobby is decent and the maids are sweet. That's about as far as I can go with positives. NO wifi in your room, very overpriced and the bathroom is both unsightly and tiny. If McDonald's and Arby's are what you are looking for, then this is the hotel for you. I would rather stay at a days inn and pay $40 a night. At least you'd have Internet and free breakfast.Also, a hotel under the millenium hotel brand should absolutely have a manager who scours the Internet for reviews and responds to both the positives and negatives and uses them to implement change for the better. Have yet to find one of these kind of responses.Very dissapointed with this stay! Bathroom is very clean and not spacious.We booked on Priceline for a 3-star hotel in Downtown Nashville. In reality on a 4-star hotel scale (whereas yelp is a 5-star scale) this is a 2.5 star tops and it's about 3 miles from downtown, definitely not walking distance. All in all I don't understand the 1 and 2 star yelp reviews I read. It's not a bad option if you don't mind driving.Pros1. Comfortable beds and bedding. Although try to get a king size for a couple. The regular beds are full size, a little too small for two people. We couldn't get a king size.2. Price at $110 per night with free parking is not a bad value for Nashville.3. On site restaurants and lounge.4. Shuttle - they have a shuttle downtown but we never took it, so don't know how convenient it is.5. Air conditioner - worked well and was quiet.6. Hotel staff - everyone was great from the front desk to housekeeping. Had no problems.7. Towels were nice and soft.Cons1. Smells - on entering the lobby, you encounter a light funky sewage smell, somewhat covered up by air freshener.2. No Refrigerator - $10 extra cost per day.3. Bathroom - not terrible, a little grungy, discolored caulk and tile grout.4. Location - nothing in walking distance. This is essentially a conference or overflow hotel.5. Door to hotel room was very beat up and we could hear them closing loudly. Wore ear plugs at night so no big deal.6. Pool - doesn't open until Memorial Day? What are we, in Chicago? Ha ha.7. Really, really, poor in room coffee, but there's a Starbucks down the road.Stay here, it's really fine, don't worry about the bad reviews unless you are looking for the Taj Mahal at $110 per night.This was the first time going to Nashville and my friends picked out the hotel.  I thought the price was steep but was overlooking that if the place was nice and close to attractions.  When we arrived on a Friday evening around 6pm there were no parking spaces remaining.  We drove around for 20 minutes to finally find one by the road.  When we walked in the lobby was nice.  We headed to the bar to meet up with friends and it was a nice place.  Food was ordered and received quickly and it tasted good.  When we got to the room I was not impressed with the size of beds, lights that didn't work, dirty bathroom.  When we took a shower you had to turn the knobs all the way over to cold for the luke warm water to work.  We visited our friends on the 9th floor and when we went to go down the elevator we waited for 20 minutes and ended up taking the stairs because the elevator didn't work.  I used the vending machine and it ate my $1.00.  I wanted a can of pop to drink when I left.  When I went to the front desk they told me I would have to go to the bar and get a drink there which wasn't a can.2 star hotel at five star prices. Front desk had lots of attitude which was very much unwarranted. There was mold in my bathroom, no shower curtain on check in and stains on both the floor and the chairs. I would never ever ever pay to stay there againGreat hotel, great price and great views of the city, the hotel was immaculate,  a little dated, but they make up for it with extras, like flavored water and goo goo clusters in the lobby.  There is also a free shuttle to downtown,  I would recommend.  Any issues this place has had have clearly been addressed.
review_content_20: Ridiculously overpriced and there are definitely inflated reviews on other sites. The worst problem was that the shower backed up and we ended up standing in a few feet of water. Couldn't get into wifi, the check in service was extremely slow, and they incorrectly charged $150 to our card. The whole place smelled like smoke, even the non smoking rooms, and the decor is at least 50 years old. We will never be staying here again. Feel like we were robbed.Stayed here for the 3rd time last week. Have to downgrade my review. First the positives. The beds were very comfortable and the towels were soft. The shuttle service was better than the last 2 times. But, this hotel is in dire need of a make over. We stayed on the 5th floor. There are scratches on the walls. The bathroom needs to be gutted and re-done. And, it basically is just dated and worn out. Will come back after renovations. And my sister was promised free internet in the Lobby. However, even after spending 20 minutes on the phone with tech support, she never got on. After complaining, she finally got one day of free internet ( it's usually $10/day!) Too bad, I really liked this hotel in the past.DO NOT STAY HERE!!!! This is my first time to review anything, ever. I signed up for Yelp to warn you! They are randomly charging the cards of their patrons very large amounts. I heard it at check in, wasn't concerned because my company had paid for my room. Sure enough my personal card was charged for almost $400 after they swore the card was only on file for potential incidental charges. Literally everyone I have spoke to at the hotel since has had the same experience, some people for as much as $800. On top of all that, the hotel is very dated. TVs have the worst reception ever, and they didn't service my room twice out of three nights. I travel for work, stay in hotels almost every night, this was hands down the worst experience ever. DONT STAY HERE!It was an alright hotel for a fair price. Room was clean, but the wifi is really slow. The TV was nice, but the walls are very thin. Didn't eat breakfast or use the airport or downtown shuttle they have but it's available. It was a place to stay that wasn't awful basically.Wifi is pretty much non existent, front desk staff is rude, housekeeping will knock on your do even if the do not disturb sign is displayed, trouble trying to get packages sent to the hotel.I was willing to let most things go until I was disturbed this morning in the middle of a nice dream with housekeeping beating on my door, I got out of bed and asked what the deal was since my dnd was displayed, oh sorry and off she walked, if your staff can't read what good are they, not impressed by anything other than the Speakman 5 shower head.TV picture is terrible and snowy2 months after leaving they start charging my card for random amounts, now fighting with credit card company and hotel, this place is a scamWe absolutely loved staying here. Loved the cocoons!!! Going to make some when we get home!!!! We will stay here next time!If they replaced the doors on the rooms in this hotel it would have gotten 5 star's from me...  The restaurant is very nice food was fabulous and extremely reasonable. they have a buffet they offered with lots of yummy items. Room service was speedy and food was fabulous! Cleaning staff is very friendly and accommodating. ...my daughter was feeling well so we usually got a late start. ..they were quiet and very good at their job. ..sheets were changed daily.When you walk into the hotel a moldy smell hits you. The room is dark nasty carpet and is old. You can hear everything because the was and floor must be paper thin. The bed is uncomfortable and it is really not a nice hotel.How can you f*ck up bacon?We stayed here because it was a recommended hotel for a local music festival. Boy was that a mistake! Instead of telling a story, let me lay out the pros and cons from our weekend stay. I'm sure others will have a better (or worse) experience than we did, but I promise you dear reader, I am not exaggerating or stretching the truth.Pros:1. The water pressure in the shower was phenomenal! I could feel the sweat and grime being blown from my skin.2. The a/c was ice cold. A nice escape from the humid Summer day.3. The shuttle was useful getting to and from our event.Cons:1. Either our sink or shower was causing the room to flood. Several feet of the rug in the room would become flooded, I mean sploosy soaked, whenever we would clean up. 2. When we told the front desk about the flooding, they sent maintenance by the room. He ripped up the carpet, blotted it with towels, and said they'd send a shop-vac up later and will dry the rest. Okay, so I guess the problem will continue.3. The front desk absolutely knew about the leak before putting us in this room. I asked what they were going to do to compensate us and I was told they could move us into a new room later that night. No money would be returned. No help, they were jerks.4. The towels were so cheap I ripped one cleaning my back. Two-handed, swiping back and forth, riiiiiip. I wasn't wiping very hard, either.5. They do not deliver anything to your room. If you want extra pillows or towels, you have to go get them from the front desk.6. There's no continental breakfast, which should be provided for how much I paid. The breakfast provided in their bar downstairs had wet eggs, hard oatmeal, and tasteless bacon. Seriously, tell me how do you f*ck up bacon? Floppy or crisp, it's delicious. This was the opposite.7. They had several hundred parking spots blocked off with a security guard. No explanation, but we had to park on the opposite side of the lot, which sucks when all you want to do is bring in your stuff.8. The toilet paper holder fell off the wall.9. The pool opens at 10am and closes at 8pm. Forget an early swim to wake up or a late night dip to relax before bed.10. Door and window hinges were rusty. Make sure you have your tetanus shot before visiting.11. Almost no power outlets available.I paid $135/night, this place MIGHT be worth $50/night. I would only recommend staying here if your conference is held in the building.In a word... Awful! When I called down to ask if someone could fix my leaky tub.  I was asked by the woman at the front desk "and what would you like me to do about it" the bathroom is gross and full of stains.   There are holes in the walls in the hallways.  Everything about this place maybe me feel itchy and un comfortable. No outlets. No internet. I wouldn't spend 20$ a night to stay here let alone the outrageous price that this crappy hotel chargesThis is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in.  Rooms are dirty and I mean dirty on top of old carpet and furniture.  I had to kill a bug in my room that was HUGE!  The phone was broken in the room I had to call the main phone from my cell to talk to the front desk.  They charged my card twice when I logged in.  While some of the staff are nice the entire team is incompetent and run a poor ship.  Unless you have to DO NOT stay here.Wish I could give it NO stars...that is what it deserves.  Terrible hotel - smells dirty with a bit of cheap spray deodorizer as an attempt to mask the smell.  This place is old, very tired, and NOT somewhere I want to stay.  We ended up NOT staying here the first time.  The room booked through Expedia was a KING Club Room.  We arrived at 5pm, was given a key to double bed room that smelled.  We go back to the front desk -- NO king rooms available.  Really? The parking lot is empty.  It's 5pm for pete's sake. The incompetent person at the front desk was very rude.  He didn't care that we left.  There was NO manager on duty (has not been one on duty each time we called with complaints). They would not refund our money, nor would Expedia.  So...to say that we are upset with both the Craphole Notel-Motel and Expedia is an understatement.So this place had some potential, but ended up being an epic disappointment for us.Let me start with the positive though...free shuttle to downtown, price was good, parking was free, and we were here with friends. I ate breakfast in the hotel one morning and it was pretty good. It was $10, but did include more than what you would get in most hotels.And now the frustrations. 1. Check-in took forever! They only had 2 people working and a line out the door. The process was not efficient.2. My group reserved 5 rooms for a conference. We reserved all King rooms but when checking in were all given rooms with 2 double beds. The people checking us in said they couldn't do anything about it because they were sold out.3. Everywhere you look in the hotel you see maintenance issues. From the carpet, to the walls, and in the bathrooms, the entire place needs some updating.4. Wifi...this is a joke! The fastest speed I ever got was .08 MB download.5. In our room the bathroom was the worst part. The shower did not drain well, likely because the water comes so fast. The hinges on the door were extremely rusty, and the bathmat that is permanently attached to the tub was starting to peel up.I wish this place were better...but, it wasn't.DISGUSTING HOTEL!! My fiance arrived at the hotel about a week before me. The day that he arrived, he walked into the room to find a roach on the chair. He killed the roach and switched rooms. When I arrived to the hotel, the first impression that I received was very dated. The hotel is outdated, it has a horrible smell, and it is not clean. When we walked into the room, there was a roach crawling up the wall (see picture). I even took a video of it, just in case no one believed me. I immediately went downstairs to have our room changed. I asked the front desk lady to put us in a more updated room, and she told me that the floor we were on (9th floor) were the nicest rooms (HUGE disappointment).  While we were packing our bags to switch rooms, I noticed a Roach Motel (it kills roaches) underneath the air conditioner. My fiance told me that he noticed a roach motel in his previous room as well.. So basically, the hotel knows that they have a hug pest problem, however they won't fix it. Instead they put these roach motels in the rooms, hoping it gets rid of the problem, and it absolutely does not. When we checked out of the hotel (the very next morning), I mentioned the roaches and roach motels to the front desk and she said that every hotel in Nashville has a huge roach problem.. That was interesting, because the Sheraton did not seem to have that same problem.In addition to uninvited pests, the food is horrible, and the service is even more mortifying. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!! We only paid $70 for our room, but I wouldn't have paid $10.I'm going to give this 4 stars, but barely.  In my opinion it wasn't as bad as people make it out to be.  Staying in an affordable hotel with a free shuttle to and from the airport and downtown was a huge perk.  That saved us probably $100 right there.  Also- the food is fantastic!  Hotel food, yes! Busy bar on Saturday night, albeit a variety of types.  I like people watching though.Staff is not friendly at all.  They are right about that.  Except the shuttle drivers- they are the only true hospitality experts in that establishment. Room was more like 3 stars.This seems like it should be a very nice hotel, and it could be were anyone paying attention to the details. The $9.95 a day in-room wifi is worthless. A speed test clocked it at 0.02 MB per second. When I complained at the front desk, I was told to come down to use the lobby wifi because it is much faster. This is just an example of the kind of poor management and disregard for guests at this hotel. Others: the sink plunger is broken and the shower handle is backwards, so cold is hot and hot cold. I can't get the ironing board out of my closet because the shelf was installed too close. Etcetera, etcetera. As others have said, the walls are thin and the doors between rooms not insulated. I can hear everything the people next door are doing and saying, even as I sit as far from the door as possible. Despite what the hotel claims, this is not close to downtown. It's a 15 minute shuttle ride through some really run down parts of Nashville. It's essentially out in the middle of nowhere.The hotel was not that great. The CONS1. The bathroom is super dirty and outdated2. The pool is on the smaller side3. No refrigerator4. The door to the hotel room doesn't always close causing a safety issue5. The carpet is very dirty 6. Lighting is not good in the room7. Barley any electrical outlets8. Unwanted BUGSPROS1.Great location- gas station is across the street 2. Free Shuttle bus 3. Free Parking4. Friendly Staff5. Free internet 6. Decent view of town - We were on the 7th floorHotel is clean and staff is friendly. Older needs some updating I would stay here againHorrible. Trash, Kleenex, standing water, hair, and other human debris filled the tub upon arrival. Asked for new room and was denied. I was told that a manager, engineer, and cleaning staff "had to come immediately"; I was able to convince them to allow my wife and I to get dressed before this group came to my room. We dressed and left by 9:15AM. Upon our return arrival at noon (12:00), the only change was the removal of the Kleenex and the drain stopper. The human filth, standing water, hair etc remained. The most telling thing is that after all of these people "had to" get into our room immediately, there was no follow up. No call asking if everything else was alright (it wasn't), no call asking if the tub was ok (it wasn't), not call apologizing for taking our money and giving us filthy and unacceptable room. No further contact was made with either of us for the entirety of our 4 day stay.Further, the sink leaked all over the counter and floor, bugs (roaches?) were seen in sleeping area and bathroom, food trash was left around bed from previous "guest", and the air conditioner/heater was not working correctly. When I brought up these issues, woman at front desk (Keenu?) hung up on me mid-sentence. Also, someone in adjoining room attempted entry through shared door. As they had a top-to-bottom Happy Birthday sign allowed to be put on their door, I'm sure it was while they were drunk or otherwise impaired. That's even scarier. None of these issues met this hotel's requirement for assigning different room OR refunding the remainder of my charges so that I could find a cleaner, safer place to stay in the city.I decided that even though we were unable to shower at all in the hotel (and had to go to a family relation towards the end of our trip to use a shower), barely got any sleep, and were thoroughly disgusted at both the state of our room and the way that we were treated, it was a lesson learned that you need to trust online reviews. A quick search would have revealed the many, many horrible reviews of this place (in addition to the reviews that were obviously written by staff or a paid agency).ON TOP OF ALL OF THAT, after cleaning the room ourselves before checkout they have the gall to charge us an additional $155.89 (on 3 separate transactions) without explanation. And that is just so far, as these new charges are coming up hours apart. If these are legitimate charges (they are not) why would they not come in all as one? Also, as we left Saturday evening, they have charged us these bogus fees within 24 business hours, while we were forced to stay like squatters for 4 days. It's criminal that they're this fast with bogus charges, yet refuse to address the real safety concerns of their guests.I have photos that show some of this ridiculousness.We had a good experience here for the price (Priceline bid). Only an 8 minute shuttle or cab to downtown Nashville. The club king room ($20 upgrade per night and included a free breakfast for two) was nice and we had a view of the downtown skyline.
review_content_40: We used a website while on the road to find a place in Nashville that was close to the areas we wanted to see, and this popped up.  Had no idea it was tied to the coffee, but that was neat, and there was a small display by the bar, etc.The hotel itself is large and fairly modern.  When we arrived our online details were still up in the air, so the desk clerk sent us to the bar for free drinks.  Heck yeah!  I had a Hap and Harry's, a local beer that was great.  When we were finally ready to check in, the clerk offered us free coupons for breakfast but couldn't print them out. Sadly, though she left a note, the morning staff did not provide these so we ate elsewhere.The room was great.  Large, a comfy bed, and decent views.  We would definitely stay here again.Front desk staff are rude and discourteous. Phone in room didn't work, and they really did not care. Actually laughed when I asked for a small credit on the bill for the issue.....like having a working phone was a perk. Bathrooms are extremely dated and have moldy tile, and peeling wallpaper. Beds were amazing. Wait staff at the bar were great. Witnessed other guests complaining to the front desk staff about issues. All the while, the staff clearly could not have cared less. And my #1 PET PEEVE..... Charging for wi-fi. Come one people......buy a $50 router and let the guests use the Internet. Nothing says #cheaphotel like a $10 per day charge for wi-fi. Clearly shows their desperation to just stay afloat.Not terrible but nothing special. The hotel was hosting multiple loud groups including a professional darts convention which lent itself to very unique groups in every common area. Room was dark and facility in general is a bit out-of-date. They do provide a shuttle to downtown which is very convenient but the driver was bad-mouthing an airline crew that had a late arrival to a van full of other crews.Not the worst place I've stayed but certainly not rushing to return.Ok I have read a lot of these reviews and honestly you are complaining about a moderately priced hotel that is moderately appointed and about 5 min from downtown. My GF and I were just fine with this hotel. The lobby is great, check in was fine and the rooms are half decent I mean they won't blow your mind but what do you expect for 70 bucks!!!!! They kept the room clean, the place was quiet and everything worked. Biggest downfall of this place is the bathrooms. They need some help for sure and we didn't have hot water one morning. Like I said from super 8 prices the place is not bad. U don't have to pay to park either which is a huge rip off in downtown Nashville. So... Save your money for a nice meal and a few extra beers and stay here. It is close enough to downtown and nice enough to stay in!Warning warning warning. Not happy at all right now. Booked a king room and was given a smaller room. When we told them they said we booked wheelchair accessible and we don't need that so we have to wait till a king room is ready. Check in starts at 3 and it is almost 5. We can not cancel our reservation without loosening out money and now we get to sit and wait. I will NEVER come here again. Took us 11 hours to get here, I want to shower and get ready to go out and can't. Stay away from this place.Front desk staff are  the worst I have seen in a hotel of this size.  I would have canceled my reservation if I had the time.Workout facility is pathetic!  I have no idea where they found the equipment but I guarantee the newest piece of equipment is 15 years old.Never know what you are going to get from a Hotwire hotel but this was nice.  Free parking and free shuttles to and from downtown.  Beds were comfortable and I haven't had shower pressure this good since college.  I'd recommend this Hotel to someone looking to save money from staying downtown.To start off you get what you pay for and it's why I give this hotel 3 stars. To start we arrived at 3:30pm and the room wasn't ready, we waited 35min before our room was ready. That was a real turn off! Since we had driven 600 miles and wanted to relax. Fast forward to the room you get what you pay for, nothing fancy. Since I seen a lot of theft reviews I decided to not have my room service through out the week. We did have plenty of towels, the water pressure was great, but the bed SUCKED!! I will bring a bed top and pillows next time. A second turn off was the fact that you had to pay $10 for wifi and $10 per day to have a fridge or microwave In your room. Really wow, no thank you!One thing we appreciated was the shuttle ride. They took you to downtown and back and any other places within 5miles of the hotel which was a relief.  The drivers were very friendly and were always willing to give a good review on good spots.Showed up to check in and were told our Queen rooms that we booked in April were given away.  We were then told we were getting comped breakfast and free drinks. Got a voucher for A breakfast and A drink when we are here for 3 days.  Rooms were smelly and not together. Were hassled about paying a deposit of $50 per day for incidentals.  Shuttle service ends at 10:30 pm when lightlife is ALL night.Just the absolute worst. The sad thing is it doesn't have to be. The majority of the bad taste comes from the entire staff going out of their way to be rude. From the gift shop to the front desk. I could not begin to type every experience because it would require transcript of every encounter weather it was asking for the cab number, buying a water or calling to ask a question about wifi. When I checked in the concierge did not even look at me during the entire transaction. And for maid service they don't change your sheets? The blankets are ripped? I met a custodian named Evette that was very very nice. She was the shining star, I can't imagine the strength it takes for her to smile given the work environment.I am nice person that always smiles and known as a polite young adult. I am from the service industry and never ever encountered this bad of a collective staff.My stay at this hotel last week was to say the least, underwhelming.  It is an old and outdated hotel that needs a renovation DESPERATELY.  There is no FREE WiFi in the room ($10 per day PER DEVICE charge), and even if you pay for it, your connection will be tenuous at best.  Even the free lobby wifi disconnects constantly.  I was attending a group event and the food we were served at our meals was cold and tasteless.  When we took the shuttle downtown, we were told that pickup would be hourly on the 1/2 hour.  We waited over 45 minutes past pickup time and called the hotel desk twice asking where the shuttle was.  We were told it would be arriving in 5 minutes borh times we called.  By the time we gave up waiting and took a $14 taxi ride back to the hotel, there were 12 people waiting for the bus which only holds 11 people!  SPEND A FEW DOLLARS MORE FOR A HOTEL ROOM SOMEPLACE ELSE, PEOPLE.....you will be happy you did!!!I have never stayed at the Millennium Maxwell House Hotel - this review is strictly for the ballroom.  If you ever find yourself in the market for a party space, then this will be useful for you.  Otherwise, probably not.So our work Christmas party was here.  It is conveniently located close to the office and since our party is during work hours in the afternoon, that's what they wanted.  When you go into the lobby, there's not very good signage to show you where to go so we just wandered around lost until we happened to find it down a long hallway.  The room was big and the tables were set nicely.  The entire place just seemed a little dated....like it was a really grand, regal ballroom back in 1983 and now it just looks a little fusty.  The food was set up buffet style and was actually decent for hotel food.  Sound system was OK but I think it was actually the guy they hired to play saxophone.  Like Kenny G Christmas up in there!  I thought the staff did a decent job clearing off tables and getting beverages, nothing over the top bad or good.What's the bottom line?  If you need a big room and you don't care about the fact that it is totally dated, then you can have your party here.  If you want something more modern and classy, this probably is not going to be your thing.We stayed here one night on our way out West. The hotel itself is pretty and we got a nice room on the ninth floor with a great city view. We spent some time in the hotel bar and then retired for the night...    We were woken up sometime around 5:30 in the morning by loud voices and banging in the hallway. My husband stood up to go see what the commotion was and stepped into pooled water all over our hotel room. He asked them what he should do because we couldn't get back to sleep and nobody was answering the phone at the front desk. They told us to gather our things and go downstairs because they needed to work in our room as well.   We went down to the desk and stood around in our pajamas along with some other guests who had been forced out of their rooms by the flooding and men working. When we finally got to the front of the line, the woman at the desk had no answer for us so she said to just hold on. We waited for around an hour, and were finally told that there was not a room for us to move to. Eventually we decided that there was nothing more we could do, so I found a bathroom and changed out of my pajamas and we checked out so we could start our long drive, because at this point I was so upset that I probably couldn't have gotten back to sleep if I tried.   We told the woman at the front desk that we were going to check out and she simply said "Okay." No apology, no solution. So upset and exhausted, we grabbed our bags and left. Apparently this particular hotel doesn't put a lot of focus on customer service, after paying full price for the room and trying to contact them, We have gotten no response.  I understand that unforeseen things happen, but the fact that they have done nothing to make up for what happened is extremely disappointing.There was nothing special about this place.  On the other hand, it wasn't horrible either.  For some reason, they checked us into a handicapped room (neither of us are handicapped), but whatever.  The shuttle that takes you to the downtown area was nice and the most we had to wait was about 20 minutes.  It obviously would have been easier and faster to just stay somewhere downtown but we booked on Hotwire and this is what we got.  The room itself was okay.  Fairly clean and comfortable.  We actually ate at both Praline's and Maxwell's (the 2 restaurants in the hotel) and the service at both was atrocious.  The food was good which saved both experiences.  I probably would not stay here again but that is 90% due to the location.  Oh, the shuttle back to the hotel from downtown ends at 9:30 so you need to pay to cab it back if you stay out past then.  Lame.Sitch: So this was a 1 night stay for the purposes of doing some touristy stuff in Nashville, after a 3 hour drive down from KY.  Also, i've worked in a hotel so knowing the plight of the hotel worker, my opinion has changed over the years. The location is GREAT, right off the freeway, close to downtown but NO annoying city traffic, and has a huge lot with a roomy round-a-bout to drop of your stuff.  The lobby is large and throughout the first floor there's a LOT of neat history everywhere. Hinting at the fact that, yes, this place is older, BUT they've updated where it counts (for me). The front desk staff was a little vacant, but helpful and knowledgable. Room (we went with a Club Level 30% off deal (Expedia), comes with WIFI and a breakfast buffet - WORTH IT! )  Could tell it was older, the only thing not really updated was the bathroom, old tile from a 70's movie, but clean and got the job done. The CD player in the clock radio at the bedside was hilarious, almost went out to the truck and grabbed some CD's.   They had a nice big Flat Screen TV and a shelved mirror with hooks above the desk. Handy for someone I'm sure, if you ever find a use for those hooks, leave a comment please.  One real downer in the room was the fact that the comforter on the bed was more a thick bed sheet than anything else. Shuttles leaving every 15 minutes to the city are CLUTCH, very convenient. Overall, if you're looking for a nice, interesting place to crash for a night or two, this is your place.   if you need all the plush comforts and homey feel of a Westin, go stay in a Westin.Most disgusting hotel I have ever stayed at.  Lets start off with the housecleaning, they dont change your sheets, they do not vaccum your room and are completely rude when you ask them to do anything. Food here is horrible, room is scary, staff is rude, store in hotel the people that own it are rude!! The cream of the crop is when I got home from staying at the millenium I had a COCK ROACH in my suitcase! Disgusting dont ever stay here!!!!The room was nice. I'm not a fan, though, of rooms that have the toilet and bathtub in one room and the sink outside in the room. We didn't get to the bar during the time live music was available, but it was a nice bar, with reasonably-priced bevearges. The hotel restaurant was about average. The breakfast buffet was basic.Really 2 and half stars. Decent customer service. Had some major issues with wifi. Finally this morning they moved me to another room. 2nd room wasn't much better finally after having to get upset they changed me to a 3 rd room. Finally it worked. Hooray!! Once I got settled again things were a little better. Great view of the city. Across the street is a couple fast food joints and a gas station. Our airport pick up service was prompt but I did hear some people complain this afternoon about having to wait so long to go back to the airport. It's an older hotel but you can see they are trying to maintain it. It's not the worst hotel but not the best. Blackout curtains aren't the best. Room doors are loud whenever anyone in the hall shuts them and the grout in the shower looks like its time to be replaced or deep cleaned. Workout room had a little of everything.I arrived around 11PM on a Friday night. The staff was friendly and rowdy. The hotel bar was drowning in karaoke and beers, and in the hall I encountered bachelorette, birthday and bachelor parties! Nonetheless I slept well on my king size bed like a queen!**Shuttle: Convenient and complimentary. Takes you to the airport (extended hours) and to downtown from 10AM to 1030PM. It'll drop you off/pick you up at BROADWAY and 5th Ave N. at the corner of the World Famous Legends and kitty-corner to the Bridgestone Arena. Make sure to coordinate with the front desk a time for the shuttle drivers to pick you up. **It's on a first call basis.Room: Large, clean, simple. I lucked out with a beautiful view of the Nashville skyline.Decor: Definitely gives off a Nashville feel. It's themed with music inspired art at perhaps 1950-1980s. Gave an old time feel, which was different yet pleasant.Don't stay here if you need to get work done. The internet system is abysmal. The hotel facilities and staff are nice enough, but I lost 3 hours of my morning to dealing with the internet connection, which was never resolved. The internet connection is managed by technicians offsite - the best they could do ultimately was send a recommendation to investigate the situation further and send me a ticket claim number. It was so unbelievably frustrating - no one at the hotel could do anything about the situation. I can't recommend anyone stay here who travels for business, it's simply too unreliable.
review_content_60: Not impressed at all with this place.  I'd have to agree with some of the other reviews regarding the service staff...not very friendly/helpfull.  Bed's not very comfy and room's dirty and outdated.  Spend a few extra bucks and go elsewhere.Love Shannon P's review..."Sell this place off to Super 8".The location in the city was great!
