So you can either completely expose yourself to everyone in the lobby at all times or shut your curtains. Also the hotel pipes awful saxophone easy listening all day and evening. As soon as I got into the room, I called and said it was loud in my room too, so they said they'd turn it down. I then asked then do they turn it off at night? I was told 10 pm. (It's now 11 pm and they are still playing it, FYI.) Anyway they did turn down the music, although I could still hear it, and then I noticed I could hear every single conversation in the lobby and every single glass clinked, plate dropped, etc. I finally asked to move rooms, and they were great about that.Then I got an exterior room, so I heard trains all the time. With horns. But I am sure glad I moved rooms because it's still better, and they had this 300-person reception in the lobby this evening. That would have been awful to deal with in the old room.Anyway given the other reviews I see here, there are even worse places on this building so I advise you not to stay here. (Staying again tonight--will see how it goes.)
review_content_60: As to not sound redundant about how the hotel is cooler than an igloo in its architectural grandeur, let's talk about the fact that this hotel is in my top 5 hotels ever and my fave in Nashvegas.The valet attendants were attentive and is worth the money since the cars are located so close to the entrance.  They also dashed to hold the door.  The front desk was cool especially when I was comped a night's parking worth $26.  Sweet. On Saturday night, there was a gent playing guitar that pleasantly echoed throughout the lobby.  Cheese, pecans, and crackers were served with infused beverages from 5 to 7.  We also were allowed to take said cheese into the bar.  Double sweet.The bar was really proper with an enormous wine cooler that was quite interesting with bartenders that were talkative when prompted.  The prices for the alcohol were pricey, but that was to be expected.So, here was the clencher for this hotel not to have received the fifth star.  For some of you, this may be silly; but for me, I am serious about my...ironing abilities.Yes, I am quite particular about having my clothes, my shirt at the very least, being pressed.  When you pack in a suitcase, you will have wrinkles.  That being said, the ironing board's pad did not fit and was so thin that it left crosshatch marks that a grill master would be envious.  I had to use a towel to prevent this.  While I am more than thrilled to stay here again, I must admit that hotels, especially high-end ones, need to invest in a very inexpensive amenity.The breakfast was great, and I received 20% for being an Elite Rewards member.  Triple Sweet.  I would rather end on a good note since I was so impressed with the property.Just spent two days staying at this Marriott property.  This is in the old Union Station which is truly a beautiful building that does live up to its' historic designation.   The lobby is grand and beautiful.... and having a drink at their lobby bar is where I would recommend ending your visit. Unfortunately the rooms do not live up to it's designation and definitely not the price charged.  Upon checking in the room looked OK, nice appointments, color and layout.  The first issue we had was we could not get the temperature of the room below 75 degrees. The second issue...the beds are double bed size.  This doesn't mean there are two beds, as in most Marriotts, it means it's just one double bed.  I can't remember the last time/ever staying in a hotel in a double bed.  I believe another name is a 'full' size bed.   Quite small for two people.  But that wasn't the worst part...what was terrible was that the bed was very old and completely caved in the middle.  My husband and I were sucked into the middle.  I love him but when the room is hot and you are trying to get a good nights sleep, it doesn't work.  The other issues were the very old sheets that were maybe 200 thread count at best, very rough, and pillows that were made of shredded sponge or pilled up stuffing.  I am currently a silver status member, just loosing my gold status this year, so I have stayed at MANY Marriott properties over the years.   I can say without a doubt this property does not measure up as far as their beds, bedding and sleeping experience to Marriott standards.We brought this issue up to Guest services and they were very pleasant and switched our room. It seems this is a common complaint of their beds because they were ready  with a board to place between the mattresses.   The second room did have good air conditioning so fortunately we had a good nights sleep our second night.I have never complained before about a hotel stay, but after staying at this location, spending over $600 for two nights, and having such a poor sleeping experience, I feel compelled to warn others to be aware and know this before staying.Review on the barIf someone asks for a house gin and tonic, it would be a kindness on your part to mention to them that well drinks start at $11. After buying a round for my party I received a very large bill for a bar I was only at due to relatives in town.It's a pretty hotel, I will give you that, but that bar - no.. that's more than I was paying in New York.Absolutely Useless Hotel.  Service is bad.  Rooms are unacceptable for price point.  Restaurant is boring.  Please don't stay here. Stayed here for a wedding Oct 4.  Will never stay here again.Hubby and I decided to spend the weekend in Nashville to celebrate our very first wedding anniversary.  I wanted to find the perfect hotel, someplace special, someplace that didn't feel like a hotel that I would stay in for work.  Union Station Hotel seemed to fit the bill.  The website made it look incredibly gorgeous and super sexy.You can see the hotel from several blocks away, and it is quite impressive.   It is a grand Victorian style building with amazing arches, stained glass and a soaring clock tower.  It completely stands out from the rest of the downtown Nashville skyline.  I was so excited!  We valet parked because we didn't see any other options for parking, and I must say the parking attendants that we encountered during our stay provided the best service of any of the hotel staff that we interacted with.  They were enthusiastic and friendly and helpful.  Everyone else we dealt with, from the font desk staff to the waiter at Prime 108, had absolutely no energy and seemed to have little desire to be there.  The lobby is beautiful.  As their website indicates, "65-foot barrel-vaulted ceiling of 100-year-old, Tiffany-style stained glass, gold-leaf medallions, and rare bas-relief sculptures."  If I had been staying somewhere else, it would be worth coming in just to take a look around.  Our room on the 5th floor, a king room, was disappointing.  It looks very different than on their website.  It didn't feel high end to me, it felt like a hotel I would stay in for work (fail).  Yes, it was clean and the bed was comfortable.  But for the price we paid, I expected more than clean and comfortable, ya know?  I was expecting a level of luxury and attention that was severely lacking form this hotel. There were no special touches in this room to surprise or delight you.  Our bathroom was a very poorly lit cramped space, and our closet was a curtained off corner of the bathroom.  The bedroom part of our room did have 20 ft. ceilings, but they didn't really do anything to take advantage of the height of the room.  The walls were pretty much blank.  The floor to ceiling windows were cool, but overlooked a busy street and the valet parking lot on the other side.  Don't get me wrong, I don't mind spending top dollar for a special experience.  That's why I chose this hotel in the first place, over so many other options in Nashville.  But for $320 a night, valet and taxes included, I expected more from our stay.  For this hotel, you are paying for the historical significance of the building, and I wish I would have known that up front, I would have taken my business elsewhere.We chose this hotel for our small, intimate wedding in one of their main rooms off the lobby and it was everything we could have asked for and more!  The staff gave attention to every detail, the wait staff was excellent, we made several changes and the hotel was quick to accomodate them all.The hotel is gorgeous, but you know that already.  The rooms are NOT impeccable masterpieces... they are small, but impeccably furnished, and the minor wear and older finishes are there for a reason.  It's nearly 100 years old, they want that to show.  If you want modern perfection, go to the Opryland Hotel.  If you want a genteel nod to a more elegant age, then this is where you want to be.Food was top-notch as well.  We really can't say enough great things about it.  Thanks Angie and everyone else who made our wedding such an amazing success!This is my 4th Autograph Collection (formerly Kessler Group) hotel and it doesn't disappoint. With it being centrally located it allows for ease of access to the Nashville downtown area.Can't give enough accolades for this hotel. Amazing lobby. Great location, and the customer service was superior to any hotel I've stayed in during the past year. Don't expect spacious rooms in this boutique hotel, but they are adequately sized and very charming. We had several breakfasts and one dinner at the restaurant. The food was very good and moderately priced.This was a life-saver of a hotel. After having almost literally run away from the Holiday Inn up the road, this hotel was a saving grace, granting us ultra-early check-in for no extra charge (though, they do get you in one HUGE way * ).This historic location is very impressive and beautiful. We were only there two nights, and in the huge lobby for a fraction of that time, and yet I ran across two bride-to-be's getting a tour of the location. The restaurant is very nice as well, though like most hotel restaurants, pricey. However, here it was probably worth it. Since we were traveling with my 11 month old son, we required a king bed, tub and fridge. All accommodations were made prior to our arrival. The room was very large and very clean. However, we were given a funny room - when you walk into the hotel there is a large window above the front doors - that was our room window, only 1 floor right about the hotel entrance. Thankfully the hotel is not really much of a walk-in joint, so the noise level never became an issue. If you wanted to get here, you drove or took a cab, and I imagine that prevents a lot of lookie-loos. As nice as the place was, there were some faults. For one, it took 40 mins to get two extra bath towels. We discovered at the end of a long, hot, muggy day that were short towels in the room. It took two phone calls and visit to the front desk to get two extra towels. In the end, it was the manager that went a got them for me. Also, we phoned ahead for the bellhop to come when we were checking out. For me, 10 minutes is as long as I will wait for that service unless forewarned.  I moved the bags myself most of the way. Considering we were right above the front door, that took way too long.* They have a ridiculous charge for parking. CRAZY. $22 a night. They lost 1/2 a star right there. I know that hotels do it (though the Holiday Inn I had just come from did not), but it will always count against a hotel for me unless its located in a seriously crammed metro area. But Nashville? There is land... especially around this hotel. Not to mention that the valet staff were the least pleasant I'd dealt with on this 11 day vacation. This is a very nice hotel and we had a very nice stay. It was far from a a 5 star experience, but I'd consider coming back......Though there are a few other modern hotels nearby that I've read good things about that will likely earn my business first.What a gorgeous historical landmark, hotel, and event space... oh my!This restored railroad station (turn-of-the-century) is centrally and very conveniently located in the bustle of Downtown Nashville. Neighbors include The Frist and Cummins Station which is not too shabby. I was very impressed by the impeccable service that I received today when I attended a special event during the day from the staff that ranged from the valet to the concierge. The event was situated in the main lobby and adjoining lounge area but even with my limited access to the hotel, I was impressed by the beautiful Romanesque architecture.The Union Station Hotel is a stunna!I would definitely recommend hosting an event or suggest booking a room to out-of-towners. TIP: The flagship dining option onsite is Prime 108 and although I have not dined there as of yet, they had stellar representation (AKA tasty bites!) at today's Savor Nashville Chef Competition. I have it bookmarked on my hit list now.The decor in this place is so beautiful.  I wanted to take every chair home with me.  Love the architecture and the history behind this place.  The bar looked very nice as well.We had a great experience at this hotel. Jimmy was so helpful. The location is great for getting downtown. Rooms are nice and service was pleasant.We stayed here for our honeymoon (yes we went to Nashville for our honeymoon). The hotel is absolutely gorgeous and every person we came into contact with was super sweet and courteous. I even asked the valet what his favorite BBQ place was and he gave us an amazing recommendation! The location is good to go to the frist, the gulch, and about a five minute walk to the honky Tonks. Our few issues with the hotel were minor. We were given vouchers for the continental breakfast (for our marriott status) but it was only good for a plate of the same thing every day (not a buffet with multiple things to choose from). But, the breakfast did include muffins of the day, fresh fruit, and a yogurt parfait. Not too shabby. Also, in the bathroom (we were on the 5th floor) there is an air conditioning vent directly as you walk out of a hot shower or blowing on you while you're on the toilet. Not ideal, but not horrible. all in all, we were very pleased with this hotel.Great place! The worst part is their gym or lack thereof. Only thing from giving it 5 stars. Great service! Clean and beautiful.I was showing my hometown of Nashville to my boyfriend for the first time. I wanted to stay at a hotel, rather than with family for one night, a lovely, iconic place for us to come back to after a night on the town.I opted to book a room at this historic former train station since it is legendary, astoundingly grandiose and ridiculously gorgeous. And it was only about $30 more to stay here than at the Holiday Inn across the street.The rooms are breathtaking. Really, I am not overstating things. Our fifth floor room was huge and it overlooked the famed lobby. As in one of the walls was completely made of glass--only a heavy curtain separated you from the ornate walkway overlooking the gargantuan lobby. It's a terrific feature that makes you feel like the you are being watched--because you are--til you pull the curtain closed.The decor is modern and stylish, the bathrooms amenities plush, the service top-notch, complete with Southern charm. If you want to impress, this is your hotel. Not quite luxury, but a really classy, stunningly attractive hotel that is worth every penny.Some things: -No parking, you must pay to valet every day for $22. Kinda pricey and a bit of a pain, but the valet staff makes it as painless as possible.-Go to the Frist Art Museum next door.-Take home all the lotion, it's the bomb.-Spend more than one night there, a single evening was not enough for us.The lobby of this hotel is kind of marvelous.  Okay, it's just downright marvelous.  The photos do it no justice.  It is ginormous and grand and oozes class.  I wanted to shove one of those maroon lamps into my duffel bag when I was leaving.  It would have looked simply fabulous residing in its new home in my living room.I stayed here for a work-thing and was given a standard double bed room.  It exceeded my expectations.  The bathroom was adorable.  White subway tile, Tiffany blue walls and matching blue floral shower curtain.  It would have made Vern Yip proud.  The room itself was just as pleasant. The bed was divine.  As soon as I laid down in it, it reached out and hugged me.  It was oh so very difficult to get up in the morning- and forget about checking out, that pained me as well.  I had floor to ceiling windows in my room, which overlooked the christian book store.  I couldn't get over how high those ceilings were.  The only complaint I have is the same as everyone else- the parking.  Ridiculously pricey!  I was informed it is $24 per day to valet, where you can come and go as you please.  The other option was a lot behind the Flying Saucer that cost $15 per day or per exit/entrance- whichever happens first.  That could get a little high if you plan on driving around Nashville.  I would definitely stay at this hotel again, it was very clean and the staff was very accommodating.  I'll just have to start socking change away to pay for that parking ticket.  Ouch!LOVED our stay here!  Definitely wish we could have stayed another night.  As everyone else has said, the lobby is magnificent. It was especially pretty since it was decorated for Chirstmas as well. Each employee we came in contact with was very friendly.  Our room was on the 5th floor and it was beautifully decorated and the extremely high ceiling was a plus.  I can't even find a good enough adjective to describe how comfortable the bed was.  I did not want to get up!  The bar area was small but well appointed and busy the night we were there. We didn't have a chance to try the restaurant but I've heard it is excellent. Can't wait to stay here again!This is a beautiful hotel inside and out!The rooms are really cute, clean, and comfortable. The lobby is gorgeous and surprisingly fun to hang out and eat cheese in (they have a really cute drink and cheese plate table.)Very close to a lot of the attractions and a reasonable cab ride to the rest. Great hotel!I am not clever enough to come up with the amount of nice things that I would like to say about this place so I'll let the stars do the talkin'!I thought this place was gorgeous and well-decorated. But for having such an expansive space and open lobby, I was surprised at the size of the room.. it could barely fit a full-size bed. But the ceilings were enormously high and the bathroom was really nice, albeit with some stains in the tub.The hotel has a great location, although valet parking ($25 after taxes) is a little too much in my opinion. However, my boyfriend and I managed to get this hotel for $80 a night for a weekend on Priceline so we didn't complain too much. The concierge was also very nice and accommodated us with anything we needed. They immediately moved us to a room away from the train tracks when we asked.It's a great place to spend time with your significant other; very romantic!
review_content_80: Had my hopes up.  I got an executive king suite for my wife, my son and I with valet parking and was disappointed.  A little nook in the bathroom was our closet,  we were put in a handicap room when we are not!  The ceilings being 20 feet high was not a problem but the climate system could be freezing one instant and you'll be dripping sweat 10 minutes later with no change from your part.  The living room of the suite was nice with 2 chairs, a couch and a TV but no telephone, both were in the bedroom?The room was cleaned but the used glass was left there as was the ice container with water covered up and left there?!I'm nitpicking but when I pay $300 a night in Nashville, I believe it should be at a reasonably good hotel but the Union Station?  I'm not going back.  Ever.Loved my time at this hotel! The staff was amazing and so friendly! The only issue I had was the train noise!Hidden Gem!  This place has the power to hold so much magic.  Wether you are attending an event or just walking through the doors; prepare to take a trip back in time.Places like the Flying Saucer that are attached are also great venues to soak up some history while making new memories.I recently had family visit; including my cousin's 9 year old son.  He had recently seen a "Program" on Old Train Stations and to this 9 year old brain, there is NOTHING cooler.  Upon leaving the Station (after seeing a few unexpected Freight Trains come and go and exploring inside) he said, in a very meaningful tone "This has been the best day of my life."Its easy to forget about buildings we may pass everyday; keep in mind, the magic is there for the taking.  :)I suggest a trip inside!Let me be clear, I didn't stay at the hotel.  I only went to see the lobby and get a drink at the bar. The lobby is beautiful and I can only imagine what the hotel is like.  But, we were just here for a drink at the bar.  The decor in the hotel bar was southern gaudy.  I can't stand it.  Feathers, brocade, faux leather, hot pink...must I go on? $13-$15 martini, but pretty good.  Would never go back though.  It's not worth it and I would probably have an aneurysm.Great service in a charming setting. One of the most amazingly beautiful lobbies I have ever seen. Definitely worth a return trip to Nashville.Really liked the hotel.  It is a short walk to all the Honky-Tonks (6 blocks) the lobby and staff are fantastic the rooms are spacious and beds are great.  The only thing keeping it from getting 5 stars are the trains that go by all morning which makes it hard to sleep in after going out.  But it is an old train station so what do you expectI love this hotel. It's dynamic, amazing, historic and a true staple to the wonderful city of Nashville. Not only did I celebrate an amazing birthday here, but I also got engaged here!  This place will always hold an extra special place in my heart. Overall, it's a stunning hotel, great staff and the food at the hotel restaurant was delicious too!!One of the best decisions we made...staying here for one night while in Nashville.  Gorgeous! Excellent care by the staff.  Perfect location...short walk to music scene and across from an art center.  Fitness center is small.  The corner room stunning and had the most comfortable beds, tall ceilings, and updated pretty walk in shower.  Minus a star for lack of staffing during busy hours....yet I was impressed with the teamwork that helped fix the situation.  Wish the room had a tub....was so looking forward to soaking in a bath.  Overall one of my favorite hotel stays.Wow - What a phenomenal building. Restored very nicely as original architecture truly stands out in what was once the Union Station Nashville. Lobby will blow you away as once was the main terminal area highlighted by a stained glass ceiling. Rooms upstairs at one time were the railroad executive offices. High ceilings, gorgeous windows, and bedrooms are wonderfully appointed as the hotel transforms in a Marriott Autograph collection. Bar area is cozy, yet chic and the restaurant has a great reputation. Staff went out of their way to meet, greet, and make you feel right at home.I've wanted to stay here for quite a while and was thrilled when I got the opportunity!  The hotel is very low key, quiet, and is not all abuzz like many other hotels that I've stayed in - that's a plus.  However, there is a grand piano in the lobby that could be put to wonderful use!The staff at the hotel was kind and at our service for requests.  The rooms are spacious and appear to be clean.  However, the sheets and pillowcases  on one of our beds was very thin and smelled of old body odor (which can't be washed out due to the age of the fabric...).  I requested that they be completely changed out on the secobd day and my request was fulfilled.  There were two bottles of water in our room, and a nice ice bucket but no glasses to drink from.  The second day we were given only ONE bottle of water?)  There is a coffee pot in the room, but the paper cups were also not replaced on our second day there (the guests in the next room commented the same).  We were given three towels and three wash cloths.  No more.  Most hotels provide at least 4 of each.  There was only one robe in the closet for two people on both days.  Too bad honey... And last, the water in the shower can only be adjusted to scalding hot or cold - no in between.  This same situation was also confirmed by our friends in the room next door.I guess what I'm trying to say is this... If you want to stay in a place that's full of history with great architecture and a friendly staff, this is it.  However, if you are looking for a boutique hotel with all the little extra amenities at your fingertips - you'll be deeply disappointed in the Union Station Hotel.  You just won't find them there - the attention to details is non-existent!I had a strange experience there this past weekend...We stayed in room 509...I took a really long hot shower..steamed it up really good.  I got out and looked in the mirror, and it read I SEE YOU written there, it wasn't written in steam, you could tell it was written before it was steamed up...I wrote it off to being a housekeeper trying to mess with someone.  But then after leaving and telling a friend, they told that it's rumored there's ghost there... I looked it up and found out that the 5th floor is haunted.  So, I'm glad I found out after I left, I'm freaked out now about it..and I just wonder if anyone else scene it or was it just meant for me.. :(Other than that experience it was exceptional.So there's no question this is one of the most beautiful hotels in town. I must say I expected more WOW from the room. It was nice, but nothing to write home about. Regardless our stay here was quite pleasant and the staff was kind and courteous. I would still recommend it to anyone wanting a little piece of history mixed in to a comfy nights sleep.The staff are so very friendly, especially the bellhops. It is stunning to walk into the lobby! The acoustics are amazing...very quiet. We had a room with windows into the lobby & to outside... It's by the interstate and we couldn't hear a thing...  Our room was very quiet. Breakfast was delicious... With coffee(they serve Starbucks) comes a basket of toast, mini muffins, & mini scones. I ate the scones and the cranberry walnut was very delicious- ended up eating more than one. This is not an inexpensive place to stay... But we felt it was worth it.This is where me and my wife stayed the night we got married!  Beautiful place!  We stayed on the top floor in a King Suite.  Looking down the stairwell.  Looks like a maze!(Reminded me of "The Shining" haha. The room was unbelievable.  Arches over the bed,  Nice big flat screen.  Giant King size bed that sunk your body in. Super clean friendly place.  But still has the Old Depot look in the lobby and around the building.  Breakfast was excellent.  I'm not a breakfast kind of guy.  But it was definitly a gourmet breakfast.  I wish I lived in that building.  Great time.This hotel was one of the better hotel experiences I've encountered.  I will say however tipping here goes along way.  The valet is exceptional, quick, and proficient.  The checkin was quick and the bellmen were great.  The gentleman who brought our room service was the friendliest person of the stay.  He gave us suggestions on what to do that night after the awards and how to get there.  The room was spacious and the bathroom was over spacious.  The only complaint we had during our stay was the cleaning service came in twice the day of checkout before we were ready to leave.  Overall out of any of my hotel stays service here was by far the best.I live in Nashville and just took my boyfriend to the hotel for his 30th birthday. It was a perfect way to celebrate! Everything was great--from making the reservations to the valet to dinner at Prime 108 and finally the room. I loved the style of the room (and the comfortable bed!), the little sitting area, and the nice, clean bathroom. The only thing that was missing was a refrigerator (which we could have used for our leftovers and to keep cold the dessert I brought). The room service breakfast was delicious--we both had the berry pancakes with smoked sausage and would highly recommend it!The trains going by added a nice, unique touch (and they weren't too loud or disturbing) and the whole character of the place was just amazing. It was a wonderful place for our celebration and "staycation."I agree with most that the valet parking is ridiculous--$24/day! I parked in the "unpatrolled" lot for $15 which was fine, but a cheaper option would be nice!I've stayed here a few times after some raucous Christmas parties and it's very nice. Rooms are a nice size,beds comfortable, the location is neat and the lobby is really quite pretty. For those of you who don't know, this used to be the train station. It's a boutique hotel so it definitely feels small, intimate, and unique. It's definitely an options for out of town family that might want to experience some Nashville flavor. I think it's 3 star 4 diamond. Now, as for the rumors about some of this hotel being haunted. I have to say, I didn't find that to be true and I was definitely plenty drunk enough to tap in to my sixth sense.Stunning former rail station with soaring ceilings, stained glass, and lots of nice train-motif touches.  Comfortable and cozy hotel bar (but pricey).  We had a room on a lower floor, which was huge and atmospheric, with one of the original stone arches right outside the window.  The stone arch made it a bit dark in the room, but that was OK with us.  Beds were comfortable, bathrooms were very clean, large shower with floor-to-ceiling glass - no bathtub. Locationwise, it takes about a 10 minute walk to get to the main downtown bar/live music venue area.  Right across the street is the Frist Center for the Visual Arts - basically an old post office converted into a modern art museum.  Even if you don't like art museums, go in the lobby to check out the stunning art deco architecture.  Really lovely hotel - close to the action but not right in it.  If you like historic hotels and don't mind walking a bit, this is a great place to stay.Beautiful hotel, amazing lobby and very nice large rooms, complete with plasma tv, lots of pillows and comfy beds. WIFI available in room.Nice lounge bar in lobby, make sure to stop by for at least one drink, if you are lucky Shad will be working behind the bar!If I was a tourist coming to visit Nashville, I would opt to stay in the beautiful Union Station Hotel over many of the other nice hotels in the city.  It used to be a train station back in the late 1800's and all through the early and mid-1900's.   Years after the trains stopped running through, the Station was fully restored and officially opened as a hotel in the mid-80s.  A few years ago, it went through another renovation, and now has modern amenities such as wireless internet service.  The original architecture has been protected, and remains today--I just love walking into the massive lobby--it really does feel like something out of another time; there is nothing else in Nashville like this!Rumor has it, certain floors of the hotel are haunted, but out of the few friends I've had that have stayed there, none of them have have any ghostly experiences.  So, I would not let that deter you!  It would actually be kind of cool, I think!  Rooms can be on the pricier side, but probably not much more than the Hilton or similar--if you have a choice, please opt for Union Station!  You'll have a beautiful room in a nationally rated historic building, and it's in a great location--just minutes from downtown!

review_content: A great dog-friendly hotel. Courteous staff and good food via in room dining. My dog loved his welcome bag filed with treats, nearby park/vet info and a tennis ball. The front desk staff also offered us complimentary dog bowls and a dog bed during our stay, but our pooch much preferred snuggling in the comfortable human bed during the night.And Molton Brown toiletries? LOVE them!Overall, I enjoyed a relaxing, quiet stay with my husband and fur baby and it certainly won't be our last visit at the Hutton.This hotel was rather pricey but it was very close to where I needed to be and it was late.Indeed it was a very nice bouquet hotel with trendy furnishings and lovely staff.  I basically had no time to take advantage of any of the perks they had, as I basically crashed there late at night and left early in the morning (at the hotel for probably 9 hours total), but the 9 hours I did spend there were great. On one thing, the shower is one of those where it's glass on one side and the person in the bedroom can see the other showering.  I was alone so it wasn't a big deal, and I guess for couples it's probably a plus.  But if you are staying with your kid, or a friend, or some other family, I can see it getting weird.Honeymoon Stay with Complications...Unauthorized charges of $8.70. Two authorized, but excessive, overcharges: $13 for TWO bottled waters--we thought this was part of the honeymoon package. Plumping problems: Sewage smell. Cigarette smoke in room from stairwell. Was moved to another room and sewage/cigarette smell issues continued. AC issues. Floor coffee maker not working. Reported issues to front desk upon checkout--we were given an apology--Is this really sufficient based on our overall experience?I love boutique hotels and was excited to give the Hutton Hotel a shot during a recent trip to Nashville; my business brings me to the area often but I was not familiar with this property. The lobby was beautiful and tastefully decorated and we initially found the staff to be genuinely friendly and accommodating. Upon getting settled into our room, I noticed two pillows were dirty with something that looked like makeup and so we asked the housekeeper in the hall to replace them and she did so happily and promptly. Unfortunately, a few minutes later, my 12 year old daughter stepped on a long, dark metal screw that was camouflaged by the patterned carpet. She wasn't hurt, thankfully, but someone certainly could have been. The next morning, I brought the sharp screw down to the front desk and said I wanted to give them feedback re: our dirty pillows and the hazardous piece of metal my daughter stepped on. I wasn't angry or indignant and I wasn't expecting them to comp or discount our stay, I just needed them to genuinely care about our experience and was, unfortunately, disappointed with a very flat, perfunctory, "Gosh, gee, sorry about that." A response that prompts this "average" review for what would have otherwise been a higher rating. Would I stay there again? Probably. Will I seek it out on my next trip to Nashville? Probably not. Would I recommend it? Sure...but check your bedding for stains and the floor for loose screws.I know, I know, three stars looks bad, but I don't mean it that way: the Hutton was totally OK. But really, just, OK. You get what you pay for in terms of location and a certain level of veneer. But a lot of things about it are just a little bit hard. Navigating the maze from the parking garage into the lobby, for example. Having to sit down and go through the quaint bank-teller chat to check in. After a day of travel, I'm kinda not ready for the extra steps it takes to get into my room.The room and amenities seemed nice enough, but things that were supposed to be fancy were just kinda bothersome. Clear glass sink. Fancy! But immediately -- and "clearly" -- cloudy the first time you brush your teeth (garr). Fun square toilet (fancy!), but TP dispenser broken and hanging off of the wall (garr). Modern-styled and cozy-feeling rooms (fancy!), but kinda dark feeling, and thinnish walls (garr).It's a good-looking place, and in my 20s I think I'd feel like I'd really done well for myself to stay and maybe party here. It'd be great as a place to stay in a block of rooms for, say, a wedding group? But as a grumpy getting older lady, I think next time I'd opt for less pizzazz, and more attention to basic niceties, not unlike the Residence Inn directly next door. Lessons learned. Biased by the Hutton experience? It's hard to say, but, for the one night I was there, it was kind of my impression of Nashville all around. Shiny fanciness slathered over a dose of inconvenient garr, but at the end the swing, I land directly in the middle. It's OK.My expectations for this hotel were high, maybe that's why I was so disappointed. I loved the decor when I first walked into the lobby, but everything else...not so much. The staff here were not as friendly and helpful as I expected for a four star hotel. While my husband was checking in (this took far too long) I decided to ask the concierge for some local recommendations within walking distance that were kid friendly, she looked at me annoyed and asked "well, what do you want to do?" I obviously had a toddler with me and was hoping for some guidance. Luckily my daughter was bored and getting into stuff so I said I'd come back later. She didn't smile or say anything. Needless to say I didn't return. After getting in our room I was again disappointed. It seemed dirty. Hairs on the bathroom floor and in the shower, dust piled on the floor trim and lamp shades, dusty toilet paper dispenser (gross), crumbs and hair between the bed and nightstand. We asked for someone to come clean it, and the sent someone up, but the only thing she did was clean the shower. While she was cleaning we headed downstairs for some food. There was no one at the hostess stand so we sat ourselves since it was pretty much empty. We were there at least 5 minutes before anyone noticed. There was a lot of confusion with the waitstaff and hostess and some disrespectful conversations to each other in front of guests. On a good note the food was really good! (5 stars for the chef!)There were a few other issues that bothered me with this place, but my BIGGEST issue was nosey housekeepers. I took a photo of my luggage before leaving the room for the day, (I highly recommend doing this if you're staying at this hotel) and when I returned later that evening my belongings had been moved around in my bag. As far as I know nothing was missing. But this was the last straw for me. I was ready to get out of there.I am a picky traveler and find fault with most hostelries.  What made the Hutton Hotel stand out amongst the now prolific number of boutique hotels throughout the world is the amazing and well trained staff.  From the moment we drove up to the Hutton, every employee welcomed us with a smile and a hello.  It's a small thing, but so difficult to teach evidently.  There was such warmth and kindness generated from each staff member, that it was contagious.  I found myself smiling and saying hello to folks as I walked through the hotel.We opted for the king suite since we were traveling with our dog and I cannot comment on the regular rooms.  However, the suite was great, not huge, but well worth the expense.  The hotel was kind enough to supply a small refrigerator for our use, and the two room suite gave us "room" to breath.  The shower was fantastic and the bathroom large compared to the suite itself.  The towels were thick and plentiful.Room service arrived quickly, and the food was quite good as I watched my Packers lose to Arizona in overtime.  The bar at the Hutton was fun, poured great drinks and had a fantastic bartender named Josh.  The Hutton Hotel is not downtown, but you are just a few minutes from "Music Row" and "The Gulch," our favorite neighborhood to drink and dine.  The Hutton Hotel is a gem for the city of Nashville.The Hutton is a small boutique hotel that's beautiful inside-out. The staff was prompt, professional, and of utmost hospitality. There are little pieces of art scattered around the main floor, as well as throughout the hallways and in each room. It makes for a clean and homey feel.One of the biggest disappointments I had with Nashville was the lack of environmental consciousness. A small part of me died each time someone threw a plastic container into the trash bin or someone using styrofoam, which was essentially every waking moment outside of the hotel. so as ridiculous as this may sound, I knew I chose the right place to stay when I saw that they use an electric vehicle (Tesla!) for their shuttle services. They'll take you anywhere within a 3-mile radius, free of charge -- and trust me, the only way around town is with a car.Another great feature is that you can press a button next to your door to refuse/request room service! None of that door hanger-nonsense!They make up your room twice a day, no request needed. The cleaning staff was superb at replenishing and my requests for extra towels and q-tips could not have been fulfilled any faster. The (incredibly amicable) manager even gave me the run-down on the numerous features of the room.Molton Brown=amazing! They didn't dry me out or leave a waxy residue in my hair (common with subpar hotel bath amenities).Wi-Fi and gym use are complimentary! This is the other big feature that sets itself apart from those crazy nickel-and-dining chain hotels. I didn't use the gym, but it was nice to know it was available anytime!Also: I'm not sure if this is a feature of the hotel or just the room I was in, but this was the first time I didn't wake up burning like an oven. I usually set the AC to 60 degrees and wake up in a sweat storm, but the Hutton limit is 62 degrees and the temperature was perfect from dusk til dawn!My only complaint is that the room was too darn comfortable! I spent the majority of my trip rolling around on their soft pillows and warm covers, which meant I didn't get as much exploring done as I had anticipated.Thank you for the most pleasant hotel experience ever, Hutton! 143!I have to say the hospitality here is far superior to neighboring hotels. Although the young valet had to be instructed on how to assist a woman with her bags, everything else has been amazing. The rooms fit my technology addiction for sure, the shower is incredible and being able to control the volume on the TV to listen to GMA is a big plus in my book(can't miss steals and deals)! Took a shuttle to a nearby restaurant so I didn't have to trek in my high heels and the driver was awesome. This is definitely worth the stay. Was greeted with a great glass of Pinot from Napa (and not the cheap stuff-trust me I know). The maintenance team even held the elevator for me so I could partake in the happy hour offering. Can you say wow! Customer service is king. If you have the chance to stay here I would totally recommend. Enjoy!Great hotel if you are staying in Nashville. Not a big hotel.  Service is great staff is very welcoming.We have stayed at the Hutton Hotel at least 10 times and have loved it every time.  The rooms are nice, clean and cold!  Love it!   The people that work there are always nice and friendly.  The bar is always fun and ever so interesting!  Great for locals and travelers.Don't now why this hotel is rated 4 1/2 stars. We booked a suite for 4, the sofa bed in the room was broken, they haden't even bothered to check it let alone prepare it for the night. We finally had to move rooms. It's advertised as a 'green hotel'. Indeed, it's so green that the bathrooms in both suits didn't even have any kind of heating. It was Freezing!!! And in the second suite there was still toothpaste on the wall from the guests before us. Staff was friendly though. But I would not stay there again.Love, love, love this place! This is my second time staying here. This hotel is clean, the staff is helpful and friendly and the rooms are a perfect size. I enjoyed the evening turndown service, on-demand movies and an EXCELLENT shower. Both trips I was traveling with very young children and we were all comfortable and well taken care of! We will not only be back, but will be recommending this place to friends!Stay where the B Lister's stay for the 2015 CMT Music Awards.Had a two night stay here for the CMT Music Awards courtesy of my cable company.Nice place. Clean sheets, beautiful glass bathroom sink and shower, temperature control worked in the room, Nespresso machine on every floor, fitness center has more than 10 machines available, free Tesla shuttle car service for a three mile radius on a first come first served basis, green key / light / electricity switch in the room.  I'm a fan.And after the award show, we hung out in the bar and observed Rumer Willis, Victor Espinoza, Norman Reedus, among other presenters at the show, either strolling through the bar or in the hotel lobby. Party like a B Lister at The Hutton Hotel Baby !!!!!!!!!!!!I want to start by saying how torn I am in writing this review.  I have certainly experienced 5 -star worthy service from the Hutton.  Unfortunately, however, I recently experienced less-than-stellar service when it mattered - for my wedding!!  (note that the event wasn't hosted here, but it was our "home base" for the weekend - we had 20+ rooms through a dedicated block, a hospitality suite, and hosted a brunch following the wedding).I'll start with the good: the amenities are top notch.  The rooms are beyond comfortable (OMG that bed - I wish I could sleep there every night!).  Some of the staff goes above and beyond the call of duty of what you would expect, even at a high end hotel.  The gym is nice enough, the concierge is helpful and the shuttle service is useful (and way cheaper than renting a car!).  The Hutton has always been wonderful about the "little extras" like chocolate strawberries & prosecco or wine & cheese for special occasions (though sometimes the timing is a little strange - not often something I want at 10 PM...)So the issues this time...  we had "welcome" bags for our out of town guests (and had coordinated this with the hotel ahead of time) that they failed to give to our guests upon check-in.  They didn't communicate with the cleaning staff about late check-outs that had been arranged with the hotel and, as a result, we lost almost of all of the items that had been in our hospitality suite (and got locked out of our room while all of our stuff was still in it).  Nothing super-awful, but enough to sour the experience and bring this down to a 3-star review.Again, for the most part, I think that the Hutton is great.  Unfortunately, they just didn't deliver all the way.Had a GREAT weekend stay! Weather was a bit unexpected, but the hotel staff was nothing but kind and helpful! Big shout out to Beth and James! Thank you for giving us your recommendations!! You all rock!!!I will first admit I'm a little harder to please when it comes to hotels in comparison to others, but with valid reasons- I worked corporate marketing for hotels years ago, so things I'd notice or be annoyed about the average Joe wouldn't. I clearly do some homework before booking and usually the hotel lives up to my high expectations. My husband and I came to Nashville for the 1st time and loved the idea of this swanky downtown hotel- great reviews, decent price point. I booked on Expedia and confirmed through the hotel for our king, higher floor, city view room ( I even had it in writing). When we checked in, we were given a 4th floor view of a parking garage. Not okay. I called and talked to a guest services rep who didn't seem to care. 10 minutes later we get w call saying they are sold out but could switch our room the next morning to a great room on the 15th floor with a city view (excellent I thought!) next morning rolls around and we pack up and head downtown- they moved our bags into the new room and when we cam back just needed a new key. We get the key and they say we are on the 14th floor (not to be a diva but they originally said 15th. It just shows how they work). The room did have a great view, but I was just annoyed with the promises that were made and not kept in general. We also had decided instead of hitting up another city that we were going to stay an extra night because were enjoying the Nashville music scene so much. I called the front desk and they wouldn't match the rate I had previously booked via Expedia or those in any other channels. From understanding the back end of hotels here that was a dumb move on their part because it cuts the middle man and the cut Expedia receives. They obviously aren't too knowledgeable here and their revenue manager should make sure they are aware of this- it's more money in the bank. I ended up booking via another source and they just added it to my stay. It's nothing to complain about but just was an extra step for me and less money for them.Now for the pros and cons:Pros:Good location to downtownThe best shower I've ever had in a hotelSwanky vibe / nice lobby Complimentary Internet and shuttle downtown ( if you can catch it)Room itself was decorated nicely Cons:Not impressed with staff / check in process. No personality or excitement Promises not kept (a biggie for me)One of the most uncomfortable beds I've slept inSquare toiletsThe first time staying at the Hutton and I must say it was absolutely amazing. Our plane arrived at 6:30 am and check in isn't until 3. We called to try and check in early but they were fully booked so had to wait until check out time. Once a room was available about 12pm they called us and allowed us to check in. They were very nice and accommodating. The nicest hotel staff we have ever come across. The room. Can I just tell you how gorgeous it is! The decor, the shower (best shower ever) and the glass sink and counter. Great lighting for makeup. The bed was so comfortable and turned down nightly! Loved the coffee station in the hallway. Very convenient and good! Kept stocked with delicious coffee. Located close to downtown. They shuttle service was nice to have. The only negative was the price for parking. $25 a night to park the car and the rental car only cost us $10 a day. And the elevators are slow! Those are my only two complaints. Other than that give this hotel a shot. It's worth the price. We will definitely stay there again!Wowza! That about sums it up. We had a great stay at the Hutton. I can't even explain the insanely good customer service here. This place knows what they are doing for sure. Check in was fast and easy. We even got a room early which was nice since we had been on the road all day. The bed was amazingly comfortable too. In town for a conference so we didn't spend much time at the hotel during the day. We did utilize the complimentary Tesla however into Nashville, awesome!!! They've thought of everything. Just when you think you may have forgotten something, ask Hutton, I'm sure they've got us covered. All of the little things are really a nice touch, like the espresso machines on each floor-love!The pictures don't do this place justice. We didn't want to leave. And you want to hear something especially awesome?! It's a pet friendly hotel! I couldn't believe what I was reading when I stumbled upon the literature in the room. Have a dog? A cat? Bring em'! The Hutton will even provide your pet with a bed, food and water dishes, a litter box and a scratching post (for your cat, of course). Isn't that awesome?! I thought so too. Great place, awesome stay, we will be back for sure!Great hotel. Not pricey yet really really nice. 300 a night this stay. 200 a night last stay. Our own fault. We waited to long to book for a conference. Shower is from ceiling like the rain. Nice and hot. Square toilets are interesting, I think I want one for my restaurant. Friendly staff. Valet parking great staff. Don't leave anything in your car just in case..... Maybe had something missing but I would forget my head if it was not attached. Overall ,,, this is a great place!
review_content_20: Couple minutes of driving or a "running distance" to the major Nashville sight: the Pantheon and few blocks from Music Row. Interesting and not very typical hotel with cozy spacious rooms, decorated with local artwork, portraits and CD's of music stars, featuring warm bathrobes and slippers. Unusual shower system, that is all automatic, including temperature settings. Espresso machine is located on the floor. Breakfast or dinner at their nice restaurant 1808 Grille downstairs. The service was a bit slow and awkward though. The gym is pretty tiny, just a couple of cardios, but there is an expresso bike if you're interested. If you're driving by Nashville and want to spend a night or two in a comfortable hotel room- that might be an option.Bummer. This weekends stay was a solid bummer and I'm pretty sure the staff at the Hutton has been replaced by the staff at the Holiday Inn. All of this is staff in the review but the location, amenities and ambience are still amazing and the best in Nashville in my opinion. But couple $200+ a night for a room and you better have a smile on your face. Alas, there were no smiles this weekend.Start with our bartender who was stumped by our drinks twice - negroni is not a genius thing to make for a place with a full bar. And frankly, I'd rather if you were stumped to ask me rather than a couple of the waitstaff. The bartender also refused to come over and take our order and solidly planted himself behind the bar making us come to the bar to order lunch. If you have tables around, you'd think someone would wait on them? He also opted to yell across the bar asking us if things were 'thumbs up'. Because he clearly use to work at Hooters or something where people like being yelled at mid sentence.Add in a decision to rent a movie for $4 on Amazon rather than shell out the $17 (?!) to watch the same using the movie function in the room and a that a kerfluffle with the front desk in the middle of the night and you're getting downgraded big time, Hutton. The front desk was generally unhelpful with everything, but it came to a head when we realize the 'eco setting' on our thermostat that was engaged when we arrived means that even when you set it to 67 degrees (the lowest it will let you), if you don't move in the room, like when you are sleeping, the motion sensor resets your rooms temp to 73 degrees. That is a miserable thing when you have to wake up sweating having no idea what's happening. I called the front desk at 11:30pm asking how I can adjust this setting without waking up my significant other and was placed on hold. The front desk staff got back on the phone and, I quote, said the engineer 'won't talk to you and insisted on coming up'.  He WON'T talk to me??I asked if this is a common thing that could be fixed quickly or do I need to wake the spousal unit up and get dressed for an engineer. The front desk guy genuinely sounded afraid of the engineer saying he didn't ask him. Growing increasingly hot and grumpy, I hang up with him and start google thermostats. Because why shouldn't I be the engineer for the Hutton?The answer is, hold the display button, tap the off/auto button then tap the up arrow. Release the display button and you move into VIP mode and can set and hold the temperature to anything. Because apparently they can't tell you this over the phone. Grrr....+1 Google -1 Hutton HotelGreat and clean hotel. The only thing I would suggest to improve this experience is to not charge so much or at all for self parking. When I'm paying $300 a night it would not be too much to ask for to park for free. The staff was friendly and accommodating. I just wish parking wasn't close to $25. I would recommend this hotel.We were in town for a conference which coincided with our 1 year wedding anniversary so we decided to stay at Hutton the night of our anniversary and I'm glad we did. We could have not picked a better place to stay at for our special night. They brought up a bottle of champaign to complete the celebration. That was a very nice gesture. Almost gave them 5 star but took one off because they allow pets. Modern furniture, clean bathrooms and hallways and helpful and polite staff. They have free shuttle to downtown on a first come first served basis.Very nice hotel in Downtown Nashville. Check-in is a touch different, there are two individual desks set up in the lobby with a couple of comfortable chairs to sit in as you conclude the check-in process. Personable and relaxing.The rooms are very clean and nicely appointed, comfortable beds with nice pillows; not thin at all, but very soft, moldable and mushy, my personal preference.There are plenty of outlets available for your electronics.Parking is either by valet, but there is a self-park option as well. Parking garage is connected to the hotel.Staff bends over backwards to accommodate any and all requests or issues.Nice restaurant, 1808 Grille, is also part of the hotel. I've eaten there and was extremely satisfied with the whole experience.My wife and I have stayed in a lot of hotels, but typically while traveling.  Last night we had a "date night" at the Hutton Hotel, which is only a few minutes from our home.  We got an overnight babysitter, checked into the hotel and had dinner reservations at 1808 Grille, the hotel restaurant.  The evening was absolutely wonderful.  Check-in was easy and painless.  Our room was modern, clean and had a magnificent view.  Dinner was excellent and the service was fantastic.  It was a very pleasant evening which we plan to repeat in the future.  I highly recommend this hotel.I recently had the delightful experience of staying at this hotel. I have very high standards and was skeptical, but found myself so well treated and in such a luxurious room that all skepticism soon dissipated.The beds are beyond comfortable and I have to say that the showers (rain shower style from the ceiling) were incredible (and fun!) the staff went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable - from housekeeping to the valet to the front desk - the epitome of gracious Southern hospitality.Try it out - worth every penny!!Great service.  Rooms have everything you need including slippers, ironing board, wifi, TVs, work desk.  I was upgraded to a suite due to my Expedia Gold status & there were extra perks that came with that.  Unlike the Wynn where the Molton Brown products seem diluted; this hotel provides the best of the Molton Brown line as the bathroom amenities.  Great room service menu too.  Free shuttle service to Downtown Nashville.There are only a few nitpicky issues I had where I didn't give it a full 5 stars (ie couch slightly worn, temperature control shower was confusing)...but I'm high maintenance so....I really enjoyed my stay, and am probably leaning closer to a 4.5, but alas. Pros: The location is super easy walking distance to at least a few food options, and about midway between downtown. I was easily able to taste a little bit of Nashville at Hattie B's and The Row without having to venture far by myself. The hotel is nice, clean, and overall gives a feeling of luxury without being stuffy. Staff was friendly, and the turn down service provided a fairly decent truffle one night, plus a free water bottle. I'm also never one to turn down a rainwater shower head, and the products included were nice and not cheap feeling. The WiFi was easily the best free WiFi I've used at a hotel.Cons: There weren't too many, but the size of the room itself is fairly compact (although the bathroom is huge), and it's pretty dark. Great for sleeping in, not all that welcoming upon arrival. The sink looks nice, but it's not particularly functional as water splashes everywhere.I'd be more inclined to go up the full star if the per night price was what I snagged it for on Hotel Tonight. At regularly over $450/night it falls just a little short of that five stars.Delightful. This is what a hotel should be. Super soft beds, quiet rooms, decadent rain shower. Molton Brown products. Fantastic and friendly, down to earth service everywhere we went. We are local, but I took my pre teen daughters for an all girls celebration and they enjoyed the soft robes and chocolate truffles at the turn down service. The cheeseburgers in the bar were amazing. The mussels and service in the restaurant were quite enjoyable. In the morning, we worked out in the gym after sleeping in and missed breakfast hours. They graciously asked us what we'd like and fixed a breakfast fit for queens. Oh, and they drove us around in a Tesla, gratis.We have stayed at this hotel 3 times. Twice in the winter and once in this summer. All three times we have also had our 35 lb. dog. The hotel services are amazing, particularly for dog owners. They provide walks for your dogs (sometimes for a fee if a package isn't available), which allows you to explore Nashville without running back to the hotel every few hours. Every restaurant the staff has recommended is just amazing and the Tesla shuttle service is so great. The hotel is gorgeous and we are always placed on a floor for dogs and it is so clean. Every staff member goes above and beyond and is so nice and chatty, from the manager to the cleaning staff. You can tell the working culture is great, which makes your guest experience even better. We had an air conditioning issue in our room and the staff handled it so well. We are so happy and would highly recommend this hotel.What a beautiful hotel! The service was excellent and our room was beautiful and spacious. Also enjoyed having a reasonably priced minibar available. Dinner in the hotel restaurant 1808 Grille was excellent, as was breakfast. The bar was busy and the cocktails were good. Definitely would stay here again.4.5 stars. Clean, good service, well decorated, and within walking distance of lots of bars and restaurants.  The 1808 Grille had a good wine list (didn't try the food).  The gym was a typical hotel gym.   We had two TVs in our room, which was interesting but unnecessary.My husband and I stayed at the Hutton Hotel over Memorial Day weekend. Overall, we really liked staying here. It is about a mile from the chaos of downtown and closer to Vanderbilt. The check-in process was quick, but we arrived later at night (around 9pm on Thursday). When we checked in, the front desk gal wasn't the friendliest....maybe she was tired? finishing up her shift? One thing I didn't like was the "upgraded" room they tried to put us in. The gal at the front desk said "we've upgraded you to a 'cardio king' room." Since I had done extensive research on the types of rooms, I knew that meant we would have an obnoxious elliptical in our room. The cardio king room is basically just the king room, but with workout equipment. If I had been on a business trip, I would've chosen that, but we were on a leisure vacation and not interested. She tried selling it further by saying the room was "a bit bigger"... ummm I would hope so since there is a huge elliptical taking up space in the room. I told the front desk gal we wanted the room I reserved and she said "fine." We were on the tenth floor, which wasn't quite high enough to see downtown, but still was a great floor. The elevators were never a problem and the noise that people mentioned in other reviews wasn't an issue for us (maybe because we were there on a weekend?). We did check out the 1808 Grille one afternoon for a quick snack and the staff were fantastic. The gentleman who waited on us was extremely attentive. Housekeeping was good with only one snafu-- we had requested a change of sheets because on of the pillows has a black grease-looking stain on it. When we came back after the day out, the sheets appeared to have been changed, but the stained pillowcase remained on the bed. That was disappointing and I would've expected more from the hotel.The deluxe king room was great. The rain shower was amazing and the Molton Brown bath products smelled amazing! The bed was very comfy and the complimentary wi-fi worked very well, which doesn't always happen at hotels, so that was great. The nightly turn down service was a lovely touch. It includes bottled water, chocolates and the forecast for the next day. Overall, it was a good place to stay. Would recommend it to people who want to be a bit outside downtown and not deal with the chaos and noise down there.This hotel takes care to pay attention to all of the details. It smells so good when you walk into the lobby. I liked the unique check in where you say at a desk with a staff member. Felt very laid back. They surprised us with a complementary bottle of champagne for our anniversary.We are just leaving the Hutton after an amazing first time trip to Nashville.The Hutton is pure perfection: fantastic service and amenities that should be in every hotel. For example, we didn't use a taxi much because we took advantage of their courtesy vehicle... A shiny red Tesla!! They are a cut above the rest and I'd give them 20 stars if I could!I have always enjoyed staying at the Hutton Hotel before. Great location, service, and amenities. Has typically been a little high-priced for not being downtown, since that is the real epicenter of activity (you can get cheaper rooms just as nice downtown), but the decor and amenities support it. My most recent trip however was very disappointing, and unfortunately it's completely beyond the control of the hotel.The Hutton Hotel, for so long, was THE BEST VIEW of downtown you could possibly get. Sadly, since the Spring Hill Marriott went up next door, that has largely changed. The west side of the building is still largely unobstructed, but the east side now has a fantastic view of the new hotel and parking garage, that is, if you choose to open your window blinds, which probably isn't a good idea unless you're cool with the occupants of the corresponding room at the Marriott seeing what you're up to. The worst part is, at least nine of the Hutton's twelve floors are obstructed by this handsome but inconveniently placed monstrosity.Would I stay again? Probably not. The lady checking us in initially did not give us a choice of rooms (1 bed or 2), and was not accommodating toward our request for a higher floor room, which started things off on a sour note. In the end, it ended up not mattering since everything on the east side except maybe the penthouse is all covered up. Great hotel and amenities, and a nice place to stay, but when half the guest rooms are subject to this kind of view in a city that is all about wowing you, it's just not worth that kind of money.I stayed here for a week while traveling to Nashville and had a great experience.  The staff was very nice... almost overly nice.  I just want to check into the hotel and go to my room but the guy checking me in asked about my day and told me about events going on in Nashville.  I would have appreciated that more if I wasn't so tired.The rooms are GORGEOUS.  I mean, you can't get much nicer of hotel than this.  But then again, with the price you pay, you better get a nice room.The location is okay - it's not downtown but being outside of town makes it easier to get in and out.  There are restaurants you can walk to, but you're on a busy street so it's a little bit of an awkward walk, but definitely doable.Hail! to the Hutton, valiantHail! to the hotel heroesHail! Hail! to NashvilleThe experience and best!Hail! to the Hutton, valiantHail! to the hotel heroesHail! Hail! to NashvilleLay your head and rest!As I sit down to recall my recent two night stay in Nashville, for some reason, the Michigan fight song comes to mind.  I am a Michigan alumni and while the Michigan fight song has nothing to do with Nashville or anywhere in the South for that matter, I do have fond memories of time spent at both places!The Hutton Hotel has a tagline on their website: "boutique elegance in the heart of Nashville," which is a really great descriptor.  In addition, I'd say this hotel is classy, clean, fun, and five stars for sure!From the friendly staff (valet and front desk, housekeepers, etc...) and awesome amenities to the central location and more awesome amenities, I can tell that this is not the Hutton's first rodeo ;)Some stand-outs worth mentioning:-a decent sized fitness room-Nespresso machines on each floor-extremely comfortable beds and showers with both hot water and pressure-free wifi that works-turndown service complete with bottled water and locally produced chocolate-1808 Grille / room service - I had lunch upon arrival and it did not disappointAnd while I didn't get to take advantage of it, there is a complimentary wine hour daily!I only hope that I'll get to experience the Hutton again in the future!ONE OF THE BEST IF NOT THE BEST hotel I have ever stayed in. I am a self-proclaimed hotel snob so it can be hard to please me but this hotel did it. I don't think I got a single "no" from anyone the entire time. The GREAT: The fragrance upon entering the hotel is welcoming and invigorating every time you enter. There is plenty of comfortable seating in the lobby and restaurant area. I loved the non traditional front desks. They reminded me of our Jamaica hotel...a more intimate experience. The hotel staff was EXTREMELY friendly, even walking past a staff member they greeted you. Southern hospitality at its finest. The 1808 Grille was OUTSTANDING. The staff was amazing, helpful and overachieving. The food was awesome!! Oh, and half-priced bar menu for happy hour?? Oh yes!! The "Hotel Shuttle" was a red Tesla that whisked my husband and I to Broadway St. downtown and picked us up when we were ready. There was an apple and cranberry drink available in the lobby daily, for consumption. I LOVE espresso and there is an espresso machine on every floor. The ice is also pre-bagged in the ice machines. The rooms are inviting, a nice size and very comfortable bedding. The amenities make you feel special with two robes, slippers, a large rain shower head with shower seating, an oversupply of toiletries and a class sink that is mesmerizing. The housekeepers were very serious about their jobs and cleaned the rooms in a timely fashion, leaving candy and bottled water. It was clear that this hotel thought of everything to help make its guests feel special. I LOVE special treatment!A couple of down sides were that 1) I was accidentally checked out of my room by an attendant who tried to say that I wasn't reserved for my last day. My reservation days were verified. I later got a call from the manager of the hotel who simply wanted to touch bases with me to ensure that I was satisfied. What a great touch of customer service! 2) Upon leaving I reviewed my bill and saw that someone had charged something to my room from the grille. This was not my purchase. The attendant took care of it right away and removed it. I'm glad I checked! However, I will never charge incidentals to my room again. These two incidents are the only reason they are not getting 5 stars from me.
review_content_40: Perfect location and a contemporary hotel. The staff is amazing. The concierge (Laura) actually had a bottle of wine left in my room because my boyfriend said it was my birthday. She went out of her way to accommodate us. Nice that they have a shuttle but reserve ahead of time. Complementary wine in the lobby from 5-6 M-T. They actually let us check in at 9:30am without any issue. Would definitely stay here again!pros: the free car service. if the destination is within a 3 mi radius they'll take you & pick you up. it was convenient. The hotel staff were more than accommodating and polite. They were very nice all around. The cafe had solid offerings. I liked not having to go far for a good breakfast or drink. cons: the housekeeping staff would move my things around. I would keep things lined up and orderly, but apparently it wasn't to their liking. Every time I came back to the room things would be arranged differently. It was very annoying. Leave both the curtains open? Not anymore, now the shear one is closed. the shifting of items resulted in my losing of a piece of jewelry. If I have it neat, why not leave it?The rooms were super clean and spacious. you definitely get what you pay for in that aspect. The bathroom had a sliding door and the lock was broken so I felt like there wasn't much privacy. However, the staff is super attentive and helpful! The bar and restaurant was nice, a little overpriced in my opinion for the quality and the menu is very limited. Overall though it was a great experience and i would definitely stay there again.We've stayed at the Hutton several times and easily give it 5 stars. The best thing about the Hutton? The staff. Everyone at the hotel is friendly, engaging and courteous. They help deliver a welcoming guest experience. We also love the modern/contemporary design and the boutique hotel charm. Oh, and the fact that the hotel courtesy car is a Tesla just tops things off. We look forward to our next visit to Nashville and stay at the Hutton Hotel.I've been using this hotel for every Nashville business trip (even if the company is reimbursing 25 percent of the charge by choosing a non preferred hotel) because I like a few things in a place I stay:Attentive staffComfortable bedsAC that worksEasily accessible internetTimely room service before meetingsA mini bar because I get the munchiesA good gymA robe! I know I know .. That's why I said like and not need ..A restaurant with edible foodClean Non smokingElectronic everything including checkout and ebillsHutton has never disappointed. I've stayed easily 15 times. I had an issue once with an overcharge and getting a room I didnt book. They were completely committed and couldn't fix it. I sent an email and had a response from the manager in 24 hours taking responsibility and making things right.I'm back again and had a free upgrade to a suite, great service and when I checked into a room that had obviously been previously occupied by a smoker, I called down and Alyssa had new keys by the time I went to the lobby. (She offered to have a bellman bring them up but in the interest of time I went downstairs).The only thing I can suggest that they do is look a bit more at common areas and spots that are looking rundown or worn. Elevators, carpets etc. It gives the place a look undeserving of how great it is. Staff is exceptional, rooms are great, gym is great, people are helpful and I will continue to come here unless by some random act all of that changes! Highly recommend.A yelp! find. My family has traveled to Nashville many years in my pre-tween days in the 70s and 80s. We were going back this spring to visit family. Wanted to not only visit family, but to see the city. You know - as an adult? when you pay attention? So we looked for a place like the Anatole/Dallas, except not, because my work pays for that. Not this trip. I hooked up with the Hutton. The minute we stepped in, it was awesome. Service, service, service. Those employees are fantastic. Check-In, Rooms, restaurant, valet, concierge, and even that coffee shop, which I used once, awesome. waitasec. I didn't mention the rooms. Beautiful. Beds. Awesome. We'll be back.Stayed here one nite while visiting Nashville. The maid barged in at 8:30. Followed by constant hammering on some rooms being remodeled. And the final thing was as we were collecting our things to leave there where some very old looking French fries at the base of the bed, gross.There are two types of hotels; Places that provide a bed for you to sleep in while you miss your bed at home, and places that provide an experience and a bedroom you wish you could have at home. The Hutton is the latter. From the entrance to the lobby to the staff, I was already impressed before I got to my room. Then when I heard about the fact that this is a green hotel, I was even more thrilled. The lights in the room operate when you put your room key in a slot at the door. This is brilliant because it helps keep energy costs down for the hotel, but even better, you never lose your key because it's at the door! When you leave your room you simply take it with you. Genius. Other small but important features of this hotel: super, SUPER clean rooms. The linens, the carpets, the fixtures, everything is clean. I also loved the easy access to outlets for charging phones, laptops, Kindles, and whatever else you lug around the country in your bags that require charging. Room service was great, the turndown service included free bottled water and chocolates, the bathrooms offer separate shampoo and conditioner (thaaaank you!) and the soaps and products smell great. I hate the hassle of carrying liquids on a plane and avoid it at all costs. So it's great when a hotel provides above average quality soaps and lotions. I especially loved that the shampoos and soaps are in large permanent dispensers on the wall inside the shower. It looks nicer than the cheap little bottles and I didn't have to pester anyone for extra product after a few days because there was enough in the shower to last months! What else can I rave about?Oh! A full length mirror in the room, free WIFI, marble showers (with a little bench!), updated/modern fixtures, a full-size hairdryer in each room, a lighted make up mirror, bathrobes and slippers in the closet, tons of towels, blackout curtains and awesome pillows. It's like they've run hotels before or something! Every need of mine was totally met and I had a great stay.The only minor issue I had was the amount of noise in the hallways. I'm a light sleeper so I travel with earplugs. And good thing I did because there appeared to be a staff room at the end of the hall near my room on the top floor. 24/7 there was noise. Typically during the day it was loudest, but even at night past midnight and through till about 5am I still heard people chatting in the hallways, doors constantly closing, carts rolling back and forth, and more than twice, hotel employees talking to one another from across the hall. Not shouting angrily, but speaking loudly so as to project their voices so they could be heard by whoever they were speaking to. It was a bit frustrating to say the least. Especially because everything else here was so perfect. Definitely not the loudest hotel I've been to, but if you're a light sleeper I'd consider bringing some cheap earplugs. On a scale of 1-10 though, I'd say it was about a 6. Not so loud I felt like I had to make calls to complain, but loud enough that it woke me up a few times throughout my entire stay.  Bonus - celebrity sightings. I rode in an elevator with a reality star and country music legend!What a disappointing experience for such a cool, boutique hotel. There is major construction surrounding the place and no end in sight. Upon arrival, I asked the employee to put me in a quiet room. Needless to say, none exist. Don't even think about taking an afternoon nap, nor even dream about sleeping in on the weekend. While the "agreement" by the contractors state they won't work on weekends, their construction workers were busy little beavers at 6am on the dot on a Saturday. Imagine a constant jack-hammer sound.The disappointment came when dealing with the front desk staff. The attitude I got was passing the buck and the buck stops with the customer paying $300/night. They didn't show above and beyond care or willingness to help with my accommodations or unpleasant stay. Well, they did offer a free breakfast...my bloodshot eyes were not pleased. It wasn't until I asked for a manager (General Manager) above the manager I was talking to and a phone call that I made until they did the right thing. The first manager said, he could not contact the general manager because it was the weekend. That made no sense. However, once the General Manager got involved it immediately was corrected (thus, saving on stars).
