I feel sorry for the guy, there were many other guests after me with the same bloodshot, sleep deprived look and I'm sure he heard from all of them too.The hotel itself is lovely and in a convenient location minutes from downtown. They offer a shuttle within a 3 mile radius. Complimentary wine service starts nightly at 5pm. The rooms were well decorated and clean. I'd love to give this place another try once all construction is complete, but I don't see myself returning to Nashville.Friendly service and great hotel! Room was huge. There's a couch and television area and then a bedroom. Bathroom is huge and has a electric shower system where you can set the temperature of the water. And they have a pretty good hair dryer and make-up mirror, which is always a perk! There's a gym on the fourth floor. Pretty small, but they have a good assortment of cardio machines (elliptical, bike and treadmill), dumbbells and a couple weight machines. Wish there was more mirrors and space to lay down on mats. Overall, great place to stay if you're ever in Nashville!I'm going to start off this review with an exclamation: Hallelujah! I've found a hotel that *has it all*. I felt so privileged to be staying at this top-notch property and that's pretty remarkable, seeing as I typically have found some fault with just about any hotel I've stayed in.When thinking of how to describe the style of hotel, the words "casual luxury" comes to mind. It doesn't have the glitz & glamah of the Four Seasons, nor is it tragically hip like the W Hotels (read: no glowing Buddhas in the room). Think: sophisticated, yet approachable. No bells & whistles. No parading ducks. No fountains, nor waterfalls. No Buddhas glowing in your hotel room. No dance music in the lobby and no suits on the make in the hotel bar. It actually makes me think of how hotels might have been in the 1960s (though it does not have a consciously retro vibe or look). Classy!!!There's a complimentary wine hour. There's art that's not trying too hard. There's comfy couches and shiny wood floors (slight criticism that they need to avoid the orange oil as I almost took a spill a few times).Not for a minute do they skimp on the amenities you'd expect (bathrobes, killer bath products, amazing rain showers, sumptuous beds), and then some (turn down service with ice, chocolates and bottles of water) Espresso machines in the hallway are a nice touch seeing as I don't like drip coffee (there are drip machines in the room, if you so desire). I hit these up periodically throughout the day. The gym is a step above any hotel gym that I've used before, with complimentary bottles of water, headphones, green apples and towels for your convenience. I used it three times during my five days, which made it AOK for me to indulge in those damn fancy peanut butter cups and chocolate turtles the housekeeper left on my pillow every night. The staff, from front desk to concierge to valet is superb (and I might add, quite easy on the eyes. Hells yes, you can help me with my suitcase, kind sir!) I swear, I did not purposely leave my purse in the cab so that I could rely on the help of the valet to retrieve it for me... *bats eyes*... but I can't say I regretted it either.Hutton Hotel, I can't imagine how you could be better. I want to return to Nashville just so that I can stay here again.This is just a great hotel.  The staff goes above and beyond everyday.  I have scheduled a few meetings here and worked with Adam.  He did everything and more to accommodate our requests.  The location is great too as it is away from the noise and tourists of Broadway.    Lastly, the food and catering staff is fantastic, I worked with Whitney on food and beverage which was outstanding!I had high expectations given that this is one of the Leading Hotels chain and the reviews are high, but was really disappointed.  The service here was unacceptable for so many reasons.  On the first night, we called repeatedly to get linens for the bed and (after waiting for over 45 minutes) wound up going to the linen closet on our floor, hailing down a hotel employee, and getting them ourselves.  The next morning, we left to take the hotel shuttle to go downtown, and the hotel employee driving the shuttle was visibly intoxicated or high.  We reported this to the hotel staff, yet this same employee was still working the next day.  The glasses in the bathroom were not changed throughout our 4-day stay at the Hutton, even though they had toothpaste on the rims and clearly needed to be changed out.   This evening, we asked for turndown service while we were out for dinner, and returned to the hotel at 11:00 p.m. to find that the service never occurred.  We called to request a comforter for the bed, and the linen representative came without the comforter and only with sheets (which we did not request or need).  While the hotel has a card in the bathroom indicating that you have the option of hanging your towels (in which case you would use them again) or putting them on the floor (in which case you wanted new towels), we hung our towels only to find that the hung towels were removed from the bathroom and not replaced with new ones, so we were left without towels.  The pull out couch had springs coming through the mattress.  For a 4-star hotel, this place needs some major help.Would recommend to friends...would book again! Would of given 5 stars if it were not for the construction and wait time for shuttle... Other than that I enjoyed my stay!It's alright. The food was good but the service was downright horrible. It was at least 5 minutes after we sat before we had our drink orders taken. I asked for an aviation, a gin based cocktail dating back over 100 years, and was looked at by their incompetent bartender as if I asked for molten lava. This same disgruntled bartender suggested that he had worked all over the country for longer than I've been alive and never heard of it. Then later he made a joke about putting unicorn tears in my beer to make it better. I guess he thought the aviation was as real as a unicorn or something, idk. But it wasn't as professional as I had hoped and I doubt I'll go back. Those people should treat all their customers like they're important and not just the guys wearing suits.I have stayed at several hotels in and around Nashville and the Hutton hotel is by far the nicest. It is a fairly large hotel with a smaller boutique hotel look and feel. It is close enough to walk to all the downtown shopping and nightlife(about a 15 minute walk) yet far enough away that you do not have to contest will all the people and traffic of downtown. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly. Nightly turndown service with chocolates left on your pillow and slippers and a robe left bedside. They have a free courtesy van/shuttle as well as a new Tesla courtesy car. Rooms are a little small but very nice and the bathroom was big and the shower was HUGE. All of the staff that I had interactions with were friendly and helpful. The hotel restaurant and bar 1808 was nice as well. Very very nice hotel for $300 a night, I have spent far more at other hotels in Nashville and other cities for that matter and received far less.Great place to stay and have plenty of places within walking distance. Stayed in a King bed.  Bed was alittle hard which is why I didn't give 5 stars. Also didn't like how I had to leave my keycard in the slot to keep the lights on. Kept forgeting to grab it on the way out and had to get new ones. Great bar downstairs but a little over priced. Belvedere Martini was about $15. But they did have the nespresso coffee machine throughout the hallways which was nice because the coffee shop in the lobby was not great.I would stay here again just so I can walk over to Hot Chicken a block away.We stayed at the Hutton for the first time this year and we really enjoyed it. The service was impeccable and they were eager to help with anything we needed. They are pet friendly and there were dogs of all sizes staying with their owners. They also have a free shuttle to the downtown area and to other areas within a certain mile radius. The only con was the elevator situation. The elevators stop on almost every floor even if people weren't waiting for the elevator. That sometimes got frustrating. Overall, it was a great experience and we can't wait to go back!!Trendy but comfortable upscale hotel I really liked a short cab ride away from downtown Nashville. 4.5 starsBed: 4.5, shower: 4, service: 4.5, atmosphere: 5Cost to worth it rating: 4 (spendier at $285/night but lived up to it)Return worthiness: yesHighlights:- Artsy decor in the lobby with check in desk with seats instead of the big traditional desk you walk up to.- Room service: 24 hours and friendly and accommodating when my friend wasn't feeling so hot- Toiletries: Molten Brown was great- Shower: big rain one flowing from the ceiling with good pressure. Only con is if you're not washing your hair, you can't avoid getting it wet unless you wear a shower cap- Bed: very comfy- Daily elixir: in the lobby was cool- Local sweet treats: by our bed at night- Bathroom: modern and large- Little waters: free in our rooms - Light notification: system for do not disturb or service room to replace those plastic door hangers- Bar: long bar with some seating. Loved the snack mix that featured guitar shaped pretzels and was a bit spicyMidlights:- Car service: nice to have within 3 miles and nice driver, but only 1 so not often available Lowlights: - Construction on both sides - Had to cab downtown or take a longer walk so would be nicer if was right in the thick of things.Really liked the hotel and would consider staying there again, though the new Omni looks inviting...Hospitality at its best! The Hutton lives up to its AAA's Five Diamond hotel rating. To date, it's the best hotel experience that I've ever had in my life. It's worth every penny!From check-in to check-out, top notch service. I like the kind of boutique check-in experience that they offer - you sit down at a desk instead of the standard bank-teller-esque check-in transaction. The staff were very friendly, extremely helpful, super accommodating, and you feel like they are genuinely concerned about your satisfaction.The room was gorgeous. It's spacious and very modern in design. The room's entertainment system has speakers in the bathroom, so you can listen to music or the TV while showering or bathing. I mention this because the bathroom is huge and stocked with Molton Brown products. It's like a spa up in there! lol. But really, the room was luxurious and beautiful. The bed was extremely comfortable. Plus, this was the first hotel in which I've stayed where turn down service is offered; hotel staff leave these tasty, locally made chocolates on your pillow. For a week after my stay, I would turn down my bed at home and put mini Snickers on my bed. Alas, it was not the same experience.Each floor has a k cup expresso machine. The hotel's restaurant can stand on its own; it is a great restaurant in its own right (you know, some hotel restaurants are just an add on and not really places where you want to spend money to eat). The gym was just as beautiful as the room - with TVs built into the equipment, clean towels (not paper towels, real towels), and cold water bottles and apples. We parked our rental car in the deck, which is accessible through the building, but we also made use of the hotel's shuttle service downtown. Honestly, I will never forget my stay at Hutton Hotel. It was amazing and the stay there was a major highlight of my trip to Nashville.
review_content_60: I felt okay about this place on the whole.  I travel a lot and everyone seemed to recommend this place to me on my most recent trip to Nashville.  I guess it's a big music industry scenester place?Anyway, my stay was good.  The staff was very helpful and kind.  Free wine at happy hour is always a nice touch, too.  The place was clean.  The room service was a bit on the pricier side for what they were offering and the last night options were abismal -- I chose instead to order out/get delivery twice.I think I'll try something else next time I'm in the city.  I didn't love the location of this spot, and the rooms were a little small.My husband treated me with a trip to Nashville for a last minute, child free Spring Break. His travel agent suggested the Hutton Hotel, describing it (rightfully so) as modern and boutique. After valet took care of our luggage and car, we ascended the stairs to the lobby to check in. Complimentary wine was being served, which is always a nice touch!  Everyone was kind and helpful for our entire stay. (And the complimentary wine is served nightly around 5-6)The rooms were nice, with turndown service and 24 hour room service. Billy Joel had a concert while we were there (which was AWESOME!) and his band stayed there for a few days, though we didn't know this until checkout day. (It was even rumored that Billy stayed there in the penthouse, but the staff, ever-so-discrete, could not confirm) We would be hard-pressed NOT to stay at the Hutton next time around! It was a great, memorable week.  ***Oh!!! I almost forgot!!! It's pet friendly!Stayed here 2 nights in early December.  Very friendly staff. Beautiful room and comfy bar/restaurant setting. Close proximity to Vanderbilt and downtown. I'd stay here again.This is a dream of a hotel in downtown Nashville! We chose this place because it is within walking distance from Broadway and the rest of the strip. The staff is friendly and eager to help and best of all the shuttle is free of charge in a 3 mile radius and is none other than a bright red Tesla! It is pet friendly and also a 'green' hotel. Only thing I would skip is the restaurant downstairs. It got good reviews but I was not impressed.Welcome to The Hutton, the Unofficial Bachelor/ette Party Hotel of Nashville.At least that how it seemed. On our own mission of mayhem, we ran into large group after large group of folks also there to celebrate a friend's impending doom...nuptials. I meant nuptials. But I can't blame any of them for choosing the Hutton, because as far as I can tell, this is the best hotel in all of Nashville. All right, this might be the only hotel I've hit up in town,* but I have absolutely no complaints and I'm not sure how it could've been better.** Basically though, they've got everything I want:-Free, fast wireless. Without even the hassle of a username/password.-Clean, well-appointed rooms with outlets everywhere.-The most comfortable of beds.-A modern, gorgeous bathroom with every amenity.-A friendly, courteous staff that was on top of our every need, and didn't even stop the 3:30 am Natty Ice chugging contest that took place on the front steps.***Well, almost everything. They didn't let me extend my checkout time past noon. But I can't really blame them; I would've wanted us out as fast as possible too.____________*The filthy fleabags I slept in during college visits do not count as hotels. **Unless they could somehow find the hundreds of dollars that seem to have gone missing from my bank account at some point over the weekend.***Although, several people who shall remain nameless would've sincerely appreciated it the following morning if the contest HAD been stopped.I stayed here for a week and everyone was so sweet! I felt right at home. Everyone greeted me as I came in and out, was down at the bar/restaurant 1808 grill almost everyday, meeting with friends or just doing work on the computer. They made an effort to remember my name and take the time to remember what I drink or offer recommendations on food and drinks.  Cody VanOrden a bartender at 1808 even altered the "signature" specialty cocktail for me since I am on a low cal diet.  I told all my friends that met me here and even other hotel guests how much I loved it and called it the "Cody Special" by the end of my stay all the bartenders knew how to make it and guests were drinking it.  I recommend it!  Very refreshing!  Dennis Butler another bartender at 1808 in The Hutton hotel, made me always feel welcome.  Recommended new wines and and amazing food, and how I could switch some things out for the other to make it low cal as well.  Dennis also told me the places to go that weren't as "touristy" as most, so glad he did because I found all the hidden dive places that were amazing!  Crickett Gumper, alone the name is amazing, was my first friend here! She welcomed me into 1808 with open arms. Was so sweet and when I told her I was moving here, she gave me here number in case I needed any help with anything.  Such a charismatic sweet girl!  Josh Johnson at 1808 as well was very sweet as well and made my "cody special" when Cody wasn't here to make it. Josh also helped me when I was looking at apartments online on my iPad while having a beverage at 1808, telling me which Neighborhoods were decent and which to stay away from.  My stay at The Hutton, was the most pleasant and surpassed all my expectations.  I travel a lot and stay at 5 star hotels often in Santa Monica, San Diego and NY when I travel, Huntley, Lowes, Grand Hyatt, The Plaza in NY.  I was a bit skeptical about it only being a 4 star hotel and there is only one 5 star in Nashville.  The Hutton should be a 5 star from the valet to the welcoming employees and mangers, room service everything is amazing! Very polite and sweet people. I had an amazing stay here and made new friends that I booked my stay longer and also pre booked for when my friend comes to Nashville to help me move so we can just have a girls weekend.  Rooms are exquisite, the people are too sweet and genuine.  I would recommend The Hutton to anyone it's one of the most beautiful and well run hotels I've stayed in.  I will continue to stay here for a staycation or if I move out of Nashville and come back for a visit.  The hospitality here is amazing!! Especially at 1808 the bartenders are the best!!!Upon arriving at the hotel, the valet is extremely attentive and helpful, so is the bellboy. Check in is friendly and fast.The concierge is there to please and make sure you receive all the info needed.The room is pristine clean, spacious and comfortable.Bathroom is clean with Molton Brown goodies! Pleasant +!!!You Must have brunch at the Hutton! It's delicious! Eggs Benedict with home made corn bread, an absolute tasty dish.I would definitely stay here again!Not stellar. Uncomfortable mattress and pillows. Consistently WRONG information. From concierge (s). U useable toiletries. Hotel was not the highlight of an otherwise fun trip to Nashville.I was so impressed by the way the staff was SO polite!  Clean room and POSH!  Coming from Maryland was a pain and they let us check in way early.  Thanks Hutton!  Loved the shower and they comfy bed.  Slept like an angel.  Will be staying again!A five diamond experience in a four star hotel. The service is outstanding from the bellmrn to the front desk. The fixtures and decoration ate not only trendy but also luxurious. Oh and the bed...to die for.It's January. So. Clearly. Time. For. My. Annual.Hutton Hotel. Review It's quite the coincidence that my third review of the Hutton also falls in January like the previous two. However, what doesn't fall to fate is the consistently fabulous experience that I enjoy here. Whether I host a team of Yelp Community Managers for a week, host a non-profit fundraiser, or even hang out in 1808 Grille, everything is a class act here. I literally send a link to every friend or business acquaintance to the Hutton when they mention an upcoming trip and warn them that there is simply "no other place" to stay while they are in town. The complimentary daily one hour wine happy hour is the stuff dreams are made of and this is also a wonderful sanctuary for those who travel with pets too! A perfect example is even represented last night when the super friendly valet literally cleared off the ice from my rearview mirrors and dash when we experienced some sleet. Did I ask? Nope. Did this prevent him from offering me superior customer service? No way!I should also mention that the "Events" staff is spectacular. I have worked with Curti Hinton for a few years now and he is always on point, professional, and a please to work with. All around, if there was a way that I could afford to live here (hello Eloise), I would. (slow clap)Bravo Hutton. Bravo!Yelp365#12Without a doubt my favorite place to stay in Nashville. Great location, staff and rooms. Hard to top that combo.Amazing find--and I'm a Four Seasons girl. Got immediately upgraded to a suite without asking...I travel a lot and I've never had an easier check- in. Rainwater showers, modern up to date everything, courtesy van to take you around the area. Everyone is super nice and room service is fast! Get the French toast btw. Great hotel and staff, exceeded my picky expectations.Ugh...it pains me to give this place 4 stars for some isolated incidents because Hutton is truly a class act.-Great central location (quick access to all the city's hotspots)-Great valet service-Beautiful, modern decor -Great restaurant in the hotel -Rooms are very well-appointed with all the amenities you could possibly need-Friendly, helpful staff-Pet friendlyA few downsides: -The TV wasn't working--something wrong with the signal because it was cutting in and out; it was annoying when we wanted to catch up on morning news--but not enough of a bother to worry about it-Confusion at checkout; they had us down for another night--had we not checked out formally at the front desk--we could have gotten charged for an extra night-While we were checking out the, we saw some dog poop on the welcome rug and someone had pulled it aside without actually picking it up...so several people walked by and almost stepped in it--not the greatest last impression Those few downsides aren't enough to keep me away though. We'll be back again.I was a solo guest, unexpectedly to say the least and new to the area. The hotel staff was over the top friendly, and was extremely helpful. The accommodations were top notch! The hotel was clean, beautifully decorated and the in hotel restaurant had incredible food! I was sent complimentary champagne for my birthday, and made to feel right at home.This hotel made my stay in Nashville complete, if I am ever in the area again I will definitely be staying at the Hutton.Let's be clear: These people put two different kinds of chocolate on my bedside table. You bet your sweet bippy they're getting five stars. Let us also note:-- The beautiful decor-- The perfectly made up beds-- The wine hour (yessssssss)-- The wifi is lightning fast-- The casual chic restaurant-- I asked for toothpaste, razor and a brush, they were all there within moments-- The staff is happy and welcoming and awesomeAnd also the night watchman let us hang out on the steps and eat and drink in our pajama pants while my friend smoked her lungs away and we dealt with drunk idiots returning to the hotel... or trying to get in the hotel. That guy was awesome. We hung out with him more than our friends. If you get the chance, here's the spot to enjoy Nashvegs!Yelp Regional Week 2012: Nashville! This hotel gets it right every step of the way from arrival to departure, morning to night, and with an eye on reducing waste while not reducing amenities. I enjoyed it so much I plan to relive it step-by-step. If you don't like long reviews, move along. Upon arrival, you are greeted by helpful (and plentiful) valets - one guy was helping me out of the cab while another was getting my bags from the back. The check in experience is excellent as the customer service folks are seated at big desks in the lobby. You can put your bags down and have a seat while they get you all checked in. The beautiful lobby is focused on art, and much of it appears to be local. My favorite piece was the large steel horse - when viewed from the staircase above, you can tell that the piece next to him is actually a large trough with crystals made to represent water - very cool indeed.My room was beautiful and beautifully appointed with wonderful lighting, a large velvet wingback chair and an ample workstation with a fancy chair that was actually very comfortable. My favorite feature is the green lighting system, which I have seen in Europe but not in the states:  you must use your room key to activate the lights and A/C in your room. This serves two functions: you can't accidentally leave a light on, and you are less likely to forget your key. A free wine hour in the lobby serves dual purposes as well: guests are happier and generally more pleasant when some free booze is involved, and it keeps the lobby much livelier and more fun in the evening hours then it would be otherwise: a nice touch that more hotels should look into.The bed was large and highly conducive to wonderfully deep sleep. The room wasn't large, but I don't understand the need for a large room unless you plan to do some entertaining (or have a lot of gear for a convention or something) - for me this room was a perfect size. The bathroom was beautiful with Molton Brown products configured in a way that was designed to reduce waste. In addition to fluffy towels, a robe and slippers were a nice touch. Turn-down service is provided if you're interested, which I suggest since they deliver two complimentary bottles of water (and some sweetie treaties) at that time. A mini-bar and a few treats are stocked should a case of the munchies strike you.In the AM, you can make your own coffee in the room or step down the hall to a push-button espresso/cappuccino machine. (Hint: even if you don't make your coffee here, grab the real half-and-half and sugar to spruce up your in-room coffee. A button in your room lets you select privacy or tells the staff you are ready to have your room made up. Parking is a breeze, adjacent to the hotel - again you use your room key for in-and-out and charges go directly to your room.My housekeeper did all the normal things like making the bed and changing out towels, but she also organized my cosmetics, de-cluttered my dresser and on two separate occasions, folded all my clothes and placed them neatly inside my suitcase, a luxury I am certain I haven't enjoyed since my mother did it for me! She also left me a note thanking me for the tip. I have stayed in hundreds of hotels and I don't think I have ever received a personal thank you note. The two or three times I needed help from the staff, I received friendly, helpful, thorough assistance, and props to them for employing and training such a young staff with so much poise and follow through. I plan to come back to Nashville soon, and will fight for my right to party in such lovely digs.I think Joi B said it perfectly: "I've found a hotel that has it all." It's true.Friendly, affordable, trendy, easy check-in, comfortable rooms, great lighting in the restrooms for proper makeup application, cozy beds, amazing rain shower, the softest hotel towels, a complimentary wine hour in the lobby, espresso machines in the hallway, turn down service - yes, turndown services offering warm cookies, bottled water, tidying up of the rooms. They're pet-friendly, they have a giant steamer (upon request); I actually kept it in my room for the full five days. The entire staff was extremely accommodating - this entire staff deserves a hospitality reward: valet, house keeping, concierge, front deskThe only cons:This hotel is a freakin' ice box. Not bad when it's 99 degrees outside, but hanging out in the lobby for wine hour, in the restaurant for lunch or the conference rooms (the absolute worst of it), you're gonna freeze your nalgas off. I rec, I rec, I rec. I'll be back on my next trip to Nashy - which I hope is soon!!!I love hotels and have been lucky enough to stay in different ones in all of the continental 48.  Over the years, few have deserved five stars.  The Hutton definitely does.While checking in, I was blown away by how nice and professional the girl was at the desk.  I know, most receptionist are, but there was something different.  I was in jeans and a hoodie, yet she treated me like I was in some kind of fancy suit with a minion next to me.The room was immaculate and impressive.  It was very spacious and had all of the amenities.  Most impressive was the bathroom.  Glass counter and sink, volume controls for the TV, and a "rain" shower head made this the nicest bathroom I've ever done my hair in.I'll never stay anywhere else in Nashville... That's for sure.Now THIS is what a luxury hotel should strive to be like.As others point out, the amenities are plentiful and they just make good sense. For example - offering free wi-fi not just in the lobby but in every guest room. I can't tell you how often I pay an arm and a leg on wi-fi services that feel like AOL dial-up, circa 1996!Also, the complimentary courtesy car (available for trips within a 3-mile radius) is such a swell add-on. I used this service at least three times!But best of all, is the wine hour enjoyed in the lobby every day from 5-6pm. This is something I did not miss! The wine is actually really good and runs like water (free + plentiful) much to our group's delight.Of course, the hotel is beautiful from trim to fixtures to the stately but small, elegant rooms. Service is wonderfully southern, and the hotel's conscientious environmental efforts are commendable.Would I come back? In a Nashville heartbeat.
review_content_80: Loved our stay here. They really spoiled us when they found out (via a pre-checkin online survey) that we were coming to celebrate our anniversary. We received a complimentary upgrade to a suite and some delicious gourmet strawberries.While I would definitely stay here again I felt like there were some things that make this slightly less than 5-star worthy because when you start getting into these kind of prices you expect to have no complaints. Mine are minor and no reason to prevent me from coming back.PROS:-Staff is super friendly, professional and hospitable-they made us feel really special-Shower is Ah-mazing-waterfall shower head, digital temperature control, programmable settings for up to 6 different people-Complimentary shuttle within a 3 mile radius-helps you avoid finding and paying parking downtown.-Plenty of restaurants in walking distance-even for someone like me who doesn't do well with walking-They give you two pieces of local chocolates and two small bottles of water each night and they are delicious! This fat kid was in heaven!-Bed was surprisingly comfortable-there's only two hotels I've actually said that about-I actually liked that the air conditioner was loud for sleeping because I require a fan for sleeping for the noise.-Valet guys were great with eating suggestions and directions every time we went out. Even offered us an umbrella for our walk in case it started raining.-Great location, I think Midtown is my new favorite part of Nashville.-Large flat screen TV meant my husband didn't have much to complain about.CONS:-There's no pool, so any down time you have there isn't really much to do. I would have liked a pool while we were at the hotel resting in between outings.-There are no vending machines in the hotel, they expect you to purchase a beverage from the 1808 grille which for a couple like us who like to have a bottled drink to sip on it was a little disappointing. -I wouldn't count on a refrigerator in the room. It's a mini bar so it's stocked with high priced beverages leaving little room for your own drinks.-The air conditioner is loud for watching TV-Room was kind of small for the price- we were upgraded to a suite and when I walked in I thought "my goodness how small is the regular room?"-There's construction going on on both sides of the hotel, while the noise wasn't a real issue they've destroyed the sidewalks so you have to walk in the road until the next blockVery cool hotel. Great vibe and quality. They have a great bar and restaurant called 1808 grill.  The rooms are cool, but small.We'd come back for sure.Love the Hutton Hotel. Great central location for Nashville. They have a van that can take you anywhere nearby. Complimentary wine in the afternoon. My room has an elliptical machine in it for an easy workout and everyone who works here are nice.I spend over 150 nights in hotels each year as a part of my job, so I get to experience different levels of service and accommodations.   The Hutton was a huge disappointment, especially after reading other reviews.  I was expecting something special and had a below average experience.  My room smelled of human urine and I woke-up to bulldozers outside my window.  It took me over 10 minutes to find a valet person to park my car and the hallway to my room was dirty.  Ouch!  I cannot recommend this hotel.Great hotel with lots of character. The staff is very nice and the rooms are nice as well. First hotel I've stayed where they have liquid hand soap, and it isn't just some random soap, it's Milton brown fancy soap. I would recommend it to anyone visiting NashvilleTerrific hotel. Gorgeous modern large rooms, stunning bathroom with centered shower head (good for couples). Evening turn down service where they set out the weather, water bottles, slippers, etc. Free shuttle that will take you within 3 mi of the hotel + cabs are $6 to downtown. Generally lovely and luxurious. Parking garage is a tad confusing, go up to the 3rd floor for self parking spots.I got O stars and two words for you BED BUGS! Yes indeed my husband & our 10th anniversary goes down in martial history as the worst night of our lives! The valet was great he took my luxury SUV complimenting me endlessly on it.  That was great.  I think...NOT! I will get back to that later on.... First, we went to check in, had reservations!! & there is no room available so they tried to give us the handicap room!  I'm like it's our 10th anniversary with all do respect that is not the sexy room I had in mind I'll just wait for my room.  Over an hour later we finally checked in.  Right away we notice the rooms were badly beaten up and there was a hole in the bathroom wall, the bed frame itself was all torn and ratty looking. I took pics! There was a giant glob of hair in the lightswitch by the bed that really took my husband over the edge and when he cut his finger on my cuticle tool on accident (when we unpacked) I called down for bandaids and after an hour waiting, my hubby who had wrapped his finger in tissue, just decided to go down and get them.  He said that while down there he ran into two hookers and that the bar was completely packed with people.  All coming and going outside the front door to smoke on the front steps with the valet guys!  What in the heck??? The next morning when I noticed my hubby scratching at his arm and I realized what it was I thought I was livid then! But, NO, to add insult to injury when they brought my supercharged range rover sport around I couldn't leave fast enough! Then to my surprise those valet guys must have pulled a Ferris Bueller on me!!!!!!!! All my radio stations/settings were changed, there was a small scratch on my black leather seat that was not there b4 and a empty water bottle that was not purchased by me in the back floor board rolling around!!!! They took my beauty for a joy ride!!!!  I know my car every inch!  I wish I would have noticed the millage when I got out the day b4! I will never valet my black beauty ever again and I will never try another "new" hotel in Nashville either! The Peabody in Memphis, The Hermitage in Nashville and the Four Seasons in NYC where I usually stay, also $300 a night, does not have a late night party bar scene but they also DONT have ratty rooms, hookers, and BED BUGS!!!!  Pictures don't lie.One of the best. High end service and accommodations at a very reasonable rate. This hotels equals or surpasses many $500+/night hotels. I wish there were more Huttons around.My daughter and I were passing through Nashville on a road trip and were only there for 1 night but we wanted to stay longer.  If my travel plans ever bring me back to Nashville, I will definitely stay here again.Very nice high end hotel in Nashville.  Modern decor, great service, and nice amenities make it a great place to stay.  Upon arrival, the hotel exterior looks sad and tired - like an old 60s office building.  But upon entering, there is a nice open modern lobby with a variety of low couches and seating arranged for people to mingle, wait, and relax.  Check in has two low desks.  Where you sit down and take a break while you check in.  Hotel rooms are nice.  Plush comfortable bedding.  iPhone compatible alarm clocks. Bathrooms have a wonderful rainshower head, nice terry lined robes, terry lined slippers, great Molton Brown toiletries, and a volume dial if you want to listen to your TV show while you're in the bathroom.  There's a mini bar and snack bar in the room with decent snacks and drinks. Turndown service was a very nice surprise.  You get a really nice locally produced chocolate candy and it's not always the same. There is a driver at the hotel who will take you anywhere within 3 miles of the hotel and also pick you up as well.  There can be quite a demand for this service especially morning and around dinner time. The surrounding area is just okay.  For a break from the hotel restaurant - you can go to Hattie's Hot Chicken and get a taste of Nashville hot fried chicken.Loved this place. Very modern boutique hotel on west end. Rooms are small but well appointed. Best part of our stay was the staff..super friendly and courteous . Free shuttle to downtown . Great location near several of the recommended restaurants including Hattie's Hot Chicken , Noshville eatery and Rotiers. Would definitely stay here again.POOR REVIEW! Unfortunately...- upon arrival, there was no direction as far as what to do with our bags and when they did finally take them they were left on a cart by the busy door unattended for a long period of time.  When I asked the (rude) receptionist what are they doing with our bags, she snapped they will be brought to your room (with a "duh" look on her face.)- the women (dark hair pulled back in a clip) behind the reception counter was not friendly at all and belittled my questions, also - it was stressed and restressed when I called and placed my reservation that the whole weekend was a surprise so please don't say anything about pricing or details at check in. That note was completely looked over and the receptionist said the price of each night and how long we were staying and when she handed me an envelope she said "here is your spa receipt and other info you requested"!!! She apologized after I asked if there were any notes on the account and she saw the info I had specified and stressed prior to check-in! Too late however, the surprise was blown :( - After we got into our room we were not thrilled with what it looked like for the price (we live in Chicago and have no problem paying $300-$500 a night, but the rooms are always AMAZING!) we actually looked  into other hotels online once we saw our room at the HUTTON and experienced the unfriendly staff, however there was a football game in town (Ol' Miss vs. Vanderbilt) and hotels were booked! The sofa was a tweed that looked dirty and worn out, the chair legs were noticeably damaged, the bathroom didn't feel luxury with a standard bathtub and damaged tile, the moldings were chipped, etc. It all just felt very "eh" FAR from luxury more like a Holiday Inn which we honestly would have preferred. Honestly I felt like I wasted $1500.00 but we were in a bind with my boyfriends departure to Afghanistan, so we decided to just try and make the most of it, we had come all that way (that's not how we should have had to feel)- When we got to our room we waited 15min for any sign of our luggage then waited a little longer (we arrived at 4pm and had early dinner reservations so we needed our bags to get ready) I finally called and they were up 15min later.- After talking extensively with the very friendly concierge about how important it was during our stay to just RELAX, she recommended a spa not too far away for a 2hr couples massage - worst massage we've ever had. We felt like we were being punked, we have never stricken out so many times in a row before. It was another bummer and huge waste of money!-We generously tipped the valet guys twice, the baggage guy once (he was very friendly, things were just mixed up he said), the shuttle guy once (he was very friendly) and the room service server... we did make the most of it but it was not at all what we expected and really put a damper on our precious last days together. We are too nice and should have complained, but we didn't want to waste  anymore time being on negative things/ experiences.  The same lady who checked us in also checked us out, same attitude, we just gave her the cash and left.I had never heard of this hotel, so I did not know what to expect. The lobby is like a big living room, warm and modern interior.I was a little confused where we had to check in (no sign), but once we figured it out the check in process was fast and efficient.The rooms are a little small to be called suites, but the modern interior, cleanliness and comfort make up for that. Best part is the shower. Ultra modern technology from Kohler - love it.Service - I worked for Starwood Hotel and Resorts for 15 years and the service at this hotel surpasses that level. The housekeeping, restaurant staff, concierge, bellmen etc provide top notch and friendly service. Note to GM -Keep doing what you are doing! I will stay here again soon.Oh, how I wanted to love this hotel! The first downfall is that there is construction going on right beside the hotel. This means that my room was facing the construction site.  Imagine having worked on a report and presentation until the wee hours of the morning only to have the construction noises begin bright and early around 8 o'clock in the morning! Also, I ordered room service twice and the food was just okay.Housekeeping was probably the worst. Today, I was taking a nap and had my privacy light on when I kept hearing someone knocking on the door stating that they were from room service. "Housekeeping!"  Ok, do you not see the light??? After they continued to persistently knock, I rolled out of bed and went to the door only to have her tell me that she was at the wrong door. GRRRR!!! Okay, back to sleep. About an hour later, room service came knocking on my door again. "Housekeeping!" Out of bed again! This time when I answered, they told me that they received a call for police somewhere on the floor. WTF... Really? Maybe I should have called the police on housekeeping for steadily interrupting my sleep.Later on, when the evening housekeeping staff came, I asked her to change my sheets, as I had spilled coffee on them earlier. I ran out to get food and came back expecting that the bed would be made. The bed was made... true. But the same coffee stain was on the sheets! As I gave her a considerable tip, I really expected that this would be done as she said it would. I found her in the hallway and asked if she changes sheets... She came back to the room and told me she did. When I asked her why the stain was still in the same place on the sheets, she told me that all the sheets come back stained from the laundry! Really??? Okay, get me out of here!Morning of departure: Rough night... little sleep... there was a party on the floor until very late. At least I can get some espresso at the coffee machine on the floor... Nope, the machine is down. I go to another floor and the housekeeping staff tells me the machine is down there too.  Sigh. I will check out early and make it to the airport to get coffee there. I should be able to check out using the state of the art, Eco-friendly checkout system and go... Nope, the system is "temporarily unavailable" so I have to go wait in the long line of inpatient guests waiting to check out. Never again!Nice, nice, nice! All the way around this is a great place to stay in Nashville. The rooms well-kept, clean, and comfortable. The service was as good as can be-- from the valets to the front desk to the bartenders, they are a great reflection of Southern hospitality. ... It's a little bit of hike to the main Broadway/downtown area, but still close enough to walk or an easy cab ride. But there are some nice finds nearby, like Hattie B's almost right across the street. ... All in all, would definitely recommend the Hutton.This place sure is purdy inside.  It's wood and interesting patterns, shapes, and textures in a lot of natural, earthy tones, coupled with some modern flair.  It's fancy but comfortable, which is a hard line to walk, at least I think so.  It kind of smells like Nordstrom.  We showed up without fancy luggage, looking tired out from touring the city and didn't get any weird Julia Roberts in Pretty Woman awkward shopping side-eyes from anyone.  I liked that.We had a lovely room with a big, soft bed, pretty furnishings, and a nice view of the city.  There are just so many features and touches.  I am kind of simple, in that I don't often stay at nice hotels, so I was in awe of the cool key card that also activates the lights, the fact that you can turn a knob in the bathroom and whatever is on the t.v. is piped into the bathroom, sound-wise.  There's a two-part flushing toilet, 1/2, which is largely due to the hotel being a 'green hotel'.  The shower was awesome and they use Molton Brown toiletries.  The robes are soft and the slippers are complimentary.  The mini bar is pretty nuts, expense-wise, but if you're in a pickle, they offer a good selection of treats, including wine and a corkscrew.  I read that they recycle, too.Soft pillows, nice flat screen t.v.'s, free espresso machine down the hallway.  It's $20 to park, which is steep.  But, overall, I feel it's a good value for such a nice room.They also offer a restaurant in the hotel, which we didn't try, but I read that they use local foods when possible.  Instead we brought a rotisserie chicken and hummus in from Whole Foods.  Holla.  It was a good night.First time at the Hutton Hotel and stayed June 27-29th.  Checking in was a breeze and they were able to get us in the room at 11 AM instead of the normal check in time (our plane arrived at 8).  Rooms were very clean and coming from Chicago, this hotel was on par with some of the top hotels I've stayed at.  The made our Anniversary an enjoyable experience and I plan on staying at the Hutton on future visits to Nashville.Wow what a cool place.  Some perks:-centrally located in Midtown-incredibly hip decor-accommodating and friendly staff-coffee bars on every floor-Moulton Brown bath products (woo woo fancy!)-glass-enclosed rainfall showers-super comfortable beds and sheets-free, easy to use WiFi-1808 Grille downstairs (one of the best restaurants in Nashville)-modern art horse statue in the lobby, how can it get any better?Really, check out this spot, it's pricey but very worth it!Top notch accommodations.  It meets my criteria for a great hotel:*  great bed, linens, and pillows*  awesome bathroom (super cool Kohler digital controls for waterfall shower) and toiletries*  great bar (1808 bartenders are fantastic)Highly recommended!I was blown away by the friendly staff and amenities. Highlights that made me smile: 1. Attention to detail by the staff. Example: one bellhop gets off the elevator with his cart and proceeds to the front desk. He sees us heading for the elevator and runs back to the elevator door to hold it open for us. Most people when on the move somewhere don't notice things like that and I was impressed. 2. Check-in was flawless. You get to sit down with your clerk at a desk like a client at a bank ready to open a loan. Felt like VIP status.3. Shampoo, conditioner and body wash all installed inside the shower in pump bottles for ease of use. Rainfall shower head and very roomy shower were also winners. The square toilet seat was big enough to make the husband happy while sitting ;) 4. Lights activate in the room with your key card; way to save energy guys!5. The bed mattress, linens and pillows were extra comfy. 6. Coffee room with Nespresso on ever floor is pretty awesome!7. The mini bar and drawer of goodies was unique with a romance kit, wine and wine opener. Never seen that before!8. Free WiFi!!!!!!9. 1808 Grille downstairs is high end and delicious complete with a bar and generous happy hour!AWESOME!!! My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel this past weekend and it was by far one of the best hotels I have visited. The customer service was good from the time we drove up. We had a couples massage in which he said was the best compared to the other places we've been for massages. Room service was timely and very friendly. I feel the price for the room was very reasonable. The wifi worked very well. I have stayed in other hotels and had problems with the wifi due to so many people being on the network, but not this place. The location couldn't be better. I would definitely recommend  this hotel to others.

review_content: I have been frequenting this hotel for almost two years. I do not always stay here when I travel to Nashville, but the majority of the time I do. If am not staying here, I am downtown at the Courtyard, or in the Gulch staying at the Fairfield. Now, the hotel rooms do have an outdated look, but the beds are comfortable, the restaurant is above average, and the service is impeccable. I quickly made friends with the one and only Hervie at the front desk and he is an awesome host. Even when he is not there to check me in, he has written me a note welcoming me to the hotel, and on occasion included a coupon for a free beer/wine. He always makes me feel special, and I would come back to this hotel over and over again just because of Hervie! I am a frequent traveler (business and personal) and am a Platinum Marriott Elite member.If you like to party like its 1999 this is your place. Rooms are the same orange brown they were my last visit early 2000!!I rarely review but we are all disappointed with Laquinta rooms @Marriott prices. PSGold Elite Over 50 nites Marriott this year. And a uppity front desk. Never again.Here for a conference.Meeting rooms for the conference were comfortable and appropriate size.Breakfast (fresh fruit and pastries), Lunch (Roasted Pork, Mashed Potatoes and Green Beans) and Afternoon Snack (Blackberry or Cherry dessert) were all good.Stayed at this hotel for my sorority convention. The staff from start to finish was so polite, friendly...just over all great. There was never a moment someone wasn't speaking or smiling. The hotel handled us with style and grace. I will say that the rooms gave me and my roommates sinus issues but otherwise the room was fine. Beds smaller than queen size. Free parking. Right near the airport, about 30 min from downtown Nashville.My biggest dislike was that there weren't many dining choices in the immediate area. Otherwise, this hotel was great.Nashville Airport Marriott offers a spacious and elegant accommodations for those who are travelling to the Nashville area.  Conveniently located within minutes of the International Airport, and a short drive or cab ride to a vibrant downtown full of music and entertainment, this location offers business and family travelers alike a convenient, clean, and comfortable place to stay in Nashville.I attended a confrence at  this location but have not stayed the night as I live in town.  This is a higher end hotel and is known in Nashville for hosting large confrences.  The look of the hotel as well as the feel is very mondern and pleasing to the eye.  There is a large parking lot, which is typically very full but there are always spots open further into the lot.  It is located in a good area as well, not shady at all and close to the airport.Excellent! Can't say enough good about the rooms. Have stay multiple times and always a great experience. The top floor, 18, has a magnificent view of the airport and the city. Corner rooms are by far the best. Love the decor and special touches. The restaurant is wonderful and very well priced. Definitely recommend.We had our Nashville Lynch family reunion at the Marriott this past weekend July 16-19th 2015. From the first day of meeting with Melissa, they never dropped the ball. The staff heard our vision and brought it to life in such a beautiful way. The rooms top notch, clean and luxurious. We were 150+ in attendance and not one complaint. I thank each and every person that works at the Marriott you all deserve a raise!!Meh rating due to fact that hallways noisy - you hear people walking and talking - and this is normal voice nothing inappropriate level. Definitely ask for room away from ice machine - they were going off every time I got off elevator !  Smooth service and modern.  As others pointed out, nice indoor/outdoor pool, work out area, sports bar. I appreciated the cool water by doorway - came in handy as temperatures soared during recent stay.Room facing pool side and occasionally heard planes though not too bad.  Not happy with fact that guests pay extra for basic internet - especially with high Room rate.Don't get me wrong - this is a really nice hotel.  I just expected more from a full scale marriot.Heavenly pillows on a very nice, comfy bed - slept wonderful! The place is very clean, beautiful lobby and pleasant staff.  I wish we had time for the pool, it looks fabulous also.Rooms are small but clean and the bed comfortable.  With the exception of a front desk clerk who was rude, (having a bad day perhaps?) everyone was quite friendly.   TV's in the rooms don't get as many channels as the restaurant televisions so we had to go back downstairs to catch the end of the baseball playoff game.I stay here every time I come to Nashville. Never had a problem. This time I woke up to bed bugs! !!!! Totally grossed out! !!! Is this the marriott or an inn somewhere? ?? The clerk completely apologized and told me since my rate was already discounted he could only give me 20 bucks off my room.  He also said to email him when I return and he will see what he can do. I will not be returning!  Bed bugs, rats, roaches are intolerable and to not comp my entire stay is a slap in the face. Marriott last a loyal customer today!***This is not the most up-to-date Marriott, but it is comfortable, offers a reasonable room rate and has some nice pluses like a sharp looking lobby and sports bar***Airport Marriotts are often not the most contemporary Marriotts and that is the case at this Marriott located just outside of the Nashville International Airport.  It does, however, feature an attractive lobby that looks onto their combo indoor-outdoor pool.  The sports bar Champions does not look like the Champions locations at other Marriott hotels.  This Champions showcases a striking and sleek lounge area with modern and upscale tables and chairs (a great dark look too that is Houston's-esque but much more spacious and comfortable).The rooms are okay.  They are comfortable, clean and well maintained, but they (like a lot of Marriotts) lack a contemporary touch.  The bathroom was well equipped with toiletries (even Q-tips, cotton balls and a shoeshine cloth), but it was a little tight. The bathtub featured an amazon rainfall showerhead, which I liked though I imagine some might think the water pressure is too low here.The fitness center is open 24 hours and offers a variety of exercise machines.  This Marriott also has a laundry room with washing machines, dryers and even a couple of arcade games including Ms. Pac-Man. The Concierge Lounge, available to Marriott Rewards Gold and Platinum members, provides food service on weekdays for breakfast; they also offer nightly appetizers and desserts Sunday night thru Thursday night.  And while most Marriott hotels open their Concierge Lounge for nightly service at 5:30 p.m., this Concierge Lounge opens a little earlier at 5:00 p.m.  They had a good variety of breakfast items in the Concierge Lounge including muffins, fruit Danishes, croissants that did not look good, breakfast breads, sliced fruit, hard boiled eggs, and an assortment of individual cereals (both healthy and sugary options).  The hot bar is where this Marriott really sets itself apart from other Marriott locations.  Most Marriott Concierge Lounges offer oatmeal, scrambled eggs and usually one breakfast meat (typically bacon or sausage).  This Concierge Lounge provided oatmeal and scrambled eggs as well as both bacon and sausage links.  They also offered a daily sandwich or wrap.  One day was a southern fried chicken breast biscuit sandwich while the next day offered a wrap of egg whites, mushrooms and cheese.Of the hot items, the breakfast meats clearly stood out. The bacon was a little bit thick and really meaty with a good chew as well as some crispiness.  The bacon was also not the overly fatty bacon that you often get with buffet bacon.  The sausage links were pretty good for buffet sausage links--fairly juicy and not dehydrated or frozen food-esque. The scrambled eggs were dry one day and a little too wet and bland the next day.  The sandwiches and wraps were not that good.  The fried chicken sandwich was particularly dry. Nightly appetizers were okay. Every night offered assorted cheese cubes, crudite and chips with salsa.  For hot items, not that crispy but meaty buffalo wings and coconut fried chicken (overwhelming coconut flavor) were offered one night.  The next night brought vodka sausage penne pasta and surprisingly decent chicken wrapped with bacon (tasty even if the big bite on the toothpick did not have much color).  Desserts included assorted cookies and pecan pie bars as well as alternating bars like lemon bars and brownies. The Concierge Lounge has a very small and crammed area for a lounge.  Most of the seating is for dining including two tops, a communal table and a counter with a view of the rural and green area around the Nashville International Airport. Service throughout the hotel was very good including a noticeably friendly front desk. Room rates are not too bad and unlike a lot of big city airports, it is a fairly short and quick drive to get to the downtown area. The Marriott Nashville Airport is a nice enough hotel even if you are in an unlively area (a Downtown Nashville stay would be more fun given that Downtown Nashville has a lot of energy with lots of live music venues).  This hotel is still a decent option for a comfortable, clean and not too expensive Nashville stay. Unlike most Marriotts, this Marriott offers complimentary parking.  It is easy finding an open space.I originally called this hotel and rates were 140. By the time I had it approved by my company I was told 219. Now this is horribly expensive for such a trashy area. Nashville is ugly, but what is worse is changing  prices as quickly as this place does.This was the hotel that my company decided to use for our recent business trip.  And I hope that this is the last time.  Basically the hotel is designed to empty your money from your wallet.Pros:The staff is very friendly to it's guest.  Most of the time you are greeted as soon as you walk into the door.Check in was fast and easy.Rooms were fairly clean, except for some mold on the shower curtain.Cons:The rooms are very noisy.  Every time a room door was shut, you could hear it slam.Like others mentioned, no free wifi.No free coffee in the lobby, only a Starbucks, which I detest.Signs telling to go green by not having the hotel wash the towels every day.Expensive hotel restaurant.And the big insult, a envelope by the TV so you can leave the maid a tip.This is a nice hotel to stay at if you have a car while staying in Nashville since it's about a 15 minute drive to downtown. However the amenities are very nice and the beds are comfortable so this is a good (and cheap) choice outside of city limits.As a side note, they must have a requirement to have a minimum of 3 door greeters at a time as every time we came back to the hotel, there were no less than 3 hellos exchanged (which is kind of adorable).The decor is nice and there is free parking....This is a Marriott; they do a good job of it. The rooms are a little small, but there were two beds and a desk AND a bathroom. What more can you ask!What sets them apart are the people. The staff was invariably friendly and seemed genuinely happy to assist with whatever was requested; whether 2:00pm or 2:00am. There isn't a lot close around; very long driveway with a Waffle House at the end. You will need transportation to get to food or entertainment. Free shuttle to the airport.Nice hotel and grounds are attractive. Really friendly staff, too. Shuttle, and more!If you just need somewhere to crash for the night, this place works.  Otherwise, there are a lot of nicer hotels where I would prefer to stay.
review_content_20: Horrible! Booked a queen bed given two doubles. Moved to a dungeon with a bed standing there from a scary movie. The room smelled like a hospital, I could hear the guy snoring next door which I recorded I wish I could upload and kids screaming at the pool at 8am. Moved to a better room the next day and talked to manager and would give is marriott rewards points equivalent to $300 for a room. We were given 5,000 points, which it takes 30,000 for one night, so lady lied to us. It only costs $140 for a room on the weekend, so were given a whole $23 equivalent in points. Do yourself a favor and go to the Hilton.Very nice room. The air conditioner was a little loud but the bed was pretty comfy.  The park and fly aspect of the hotel is the best. The shuttle had us at the airport in mere minutes. Very courteous and helpful driver. The shuttle runs regularly and made our travel so easy and even enjoyable.  I will be staying here again!Amost two years later I'm back in Nashville. The property is well maintained, staff are true professionals, and the internet connection still fast and stable. This is my go-to place for Nashville business travel.Nice hotel for a work visit or for a night.  The fitness center is loaded and the pool area looked nice as well. I usually stay at the Marriott near the college when I come to Nashville (twice a quarter) but figured I would try something new. I like this place better as it's easier to get around and the staff is way more friendly. The room at the other is nicer and newer but this place will do.This is an older Marriott property that is in decent shape but doesn't quite make it past 3 stars.The toiletries are the same brand you'd find in a Courtyard property vs. a Marriott hotel.One of the light-bulbs in my bathroom was burned out.Housekeeper did not leave hand towels.  Strange.The desk was small and the outlets in the desk lamp did not work.Small things, I know, but I expect a lot from Marriott.   I had a drink in the bar, it's one of the Champion's sports bar themed bars found in some Marriott's.  Lots of televisions, a decent beer list and the scotch selection was pretty good.  Bartenders and servers were very friendly.I'd stay here again to get the Marriott points and it's pretty conveniently located for business in the Nashville area.When I review a Marriott hotel, unfortunately I am only comparing it to other Marriott properties. It has been a long time since I have stayed at another brand and I spend well over 100 nights every year at Marriott's. This is a VERY GOOD Marriott. The rooms have been updated or refreshed not within the last few years (although they could update their TV's...a little small.) Service is EXCELLENT with the staff being very attentive and friendly. I was a little disappointed that the breakfast in the concierge lounge did not have bacon like almost every other Marriott. As far as location, if you don't have a car you are stuck with eating on the property but I am pretty sure that is the norm in Nashville if you want to stay at a nice hotel by the airport.Very impressed. What a beautiful hotel. And the new breakfast bar is excellent.  Large variety of food options. Hot and cold foods. Plus they serve mimosa's.Overall great hotel to stay. Not too far from downtown but the service and attention to detail is always noteworthy. Has a good in hotel restaurant worthy of visit. Bar has happy hour. Starbucks coffee is in lobby. Continue to check in here and enjoy my visit.I grew up in Nashville and remember when this hotel was built, so I was surprised to find it revitalized and such a positive experience. I won't comment on the specifics other than to say that I loved the room, the amenities, the Bath and Body Works toiletries, and the bed. The restaurant at this hotel rocks. Every dish I had was way above average for hotel food, and not unreasonably priced. The Starbucks coffee option was very affordable and not over priced like most hotels.But one big big complaint. The $14.95 charge for Internet is just silly. Almost every luxury hotel in America, and especially the budget hotels, have removed this charge. Why is this hotel lagging? I'm sorry, but free wireless in the lobby doesn't cut it. This is an hotel by an airport, and it attracts mostly people on business. Get rid of that fee. you're making people pay for something that has become so necessary and basic as a toilet and a bed. It's sooo 2000 to charge for it.Otherwise, a wonderful place, and I recommend it among the airport area options.All and all this is a decent place. The rooms are nice but nothing to celebrate. They are quite and the concierge lounge is better than most. For me they have a some what decent gym and an indoor outdoor pool which brings it to a 4 star over a 3.Typical Marriott airport property. Pretty much know what you are getting. Decor is somewhat outdated but acceptable. Pillows are way too small and tall. Loyal to Marriott or I would have searched elsewhere. Service at Champions Bar in lobby was great. Nachos were average.Had a great 2 night stay here. Staff was extra friendly, greeted us every time we encountered them. Not just front desk but all staff.  Rooms were clean, beds were great, and lunches provided at our conference were delicious. Only 4 stars though as the AC was almost non existent on night one, worked great on night two. The heat in the hallways was almost oppressive, I know it's Feb and cold outside but wow! Overall all excellent and would stay again and recommend to friends. Oh, add some USB ports for charging in the rooms!Will not stay here again. Website lists high speed internet, but they charge $15 for wifi. How much extra is room service? Regardless of any other features this is an insult that will probably steer me away from Marriott properties in the future.Just another Marriott by the airport, basic rooms. But the people who work here are outstanding--they all address you with an authentic "hello," and the dapperly dressed, African American man even checked to make sure I wasn't missing the  shuttle as I sat with my luggage in the lobby. I wish I were a kid & not there on business; the indoor/outdoor pool with the narrow connection looks fun!All in all a nice hotel. The one drawback was the restaurant was closed for a remodel until March.  They used a very plain banquet room in its absence.  I'll be back - after March!In a nutshell, great hotel, extremely clean. Free internet with Marriott Rewards. Adjacent to airport, but cannot hear any airport noise from hotel. Ten minute ride to downtown Nashville. Much cheaper than staying downtown. Well worth it. Will definitely return. Oh! forget the bar/restaurant off the lobby, 'Champions'....food absolutely horrible, undercooked.  Eat downtown lots of choices.My first time in a Marriott! It was a pretty good experience. Nothing to write home about, but for a good night's sleep during a long road trip? Gets the job done.The staff is super nice. We had to park far away because I had a big U-Haul truck, and someone actually came around to pick us up and drive us to the hotel! What a nice service. It was definitely appreciated after driving 14 hours! We'd asked for a single king, but the room they gave us was two twins/queens, so we had to get that sorted out. Nothing too bad. The room was clean, and it didn't smell. There was an ice machine close to our room, and the elevators go up/down quickly. Hallways were also clean, no smell. The food at the lounge was decent too. We had the Marriott burger and a Caesar salad. Burger was delicious (for hotel food), but the Caesar salad was mediocre. I think it was like $11 for the salad and at least another $10 for grilled chicken. IMO, it was DEFINITELY not $10+ worth of chicken. We also had breakfast at 2river Grille. I ordered the Salmon Hash, which was wayyyy too salty. My bf ordered the usual eggs/bacon/toast, and he had no problems. Like many other reviewers, I was disappointed in the $15 wifi charge!! Obviously, we did not use.Overall, it was a good stay. Everyone was kind and welcoming, and the hotel is fancy and clean. Oh, but to get the hotel you have to go up this really windy, hilly road. It was hard on the U-Haul and was kind of dangerous, ha!For an airport hotel, very nice.  Staff is friendly, hotel has all the bells and whistles you need (Starbucks inside, fitness center, pool, restaurant, etc), rooms are clean and comfortable, bed is comfortable, lots of nice pillows, bathroom is decent, killer showerhead and great water pressure, towels that aren't like sandpaper, good breakfast, nice flat screen LG in front of the bed to zone out to, and a carpet you can walk on without shoes with peace of mind.  Luckily, I have a corporate rate that includes wireless and breakfast...otherwise I would say that the $14.95 a day for wireless is highway robbery.  It is too commonplace to be charging that much for wireless these days.Nothing around here but it's an airport hotel, that is to be expected.  You'd probably want to stay IN Nashville if you want bars and restaurants...overall, a good value and a nice stay.The only downside to this hotel is that there are no restaurants/bars/fun within walking distance.  Which is particularly disheartening when you do not have a rental car.  My bad.But.... here comes the good stuff!Front Desk: awesome, smiling, courteous, quick.  no problems.  just what you want.Manager: visible, friendly without being creepy, good conversationalist when sharing the elevatorConcierge/Bell Hop: again, nothing but smiles and hellos. all genuine.  after flying all morning sincere smiles make it all better.Room: loved it. First of all if you've got Bath and Body Works Aromatherapy bathroom stuff... That's a A+ in my book.  Hairdryer was full size! Water pressure in the shower was right on for this long hair and the bathroom was spickinspanclean. The bed was uber comfortable with so many pillows, I wish i could of had a pillow fight. Desk with adjustable comfortable chair made my working time comfortable, lights were in the right places, windows had easy to use curtains, wake up call service was automated easy and accurate.  Definitely would stay here again.Restaurant: Since I was sans car I ate here and had their Crab Bisque and a small caesar salad.  It was fantastic.  the soup was soup-er creamy (you can call me a dork if you want). Service was prompt, courteous and happy. charge it to my room? why not. maybe eating at the hotel isn't such a bad gig.Conference Center: stellar. really. i've dealt with crap conference centers before.  Ladies bathrooms are high class and immaculate! Conference rooms have multiple set up options, good sound system, and staff more than willing to help move tables around.  Coffee was always hot and filled for attendees.  And that extra "bubble room" that you'd use for a wedding reception was perfect for our breakfast, lunch and dinner hors'd ouvres.  The cash bar-tenders did a fantastic job as well.We love this hotel.  Great place to stay when you have an early flight.  Shuttle runs on the hour and on the half hour.
review_content_40: Pretty decent airport.  Not too big with a good number of flights out.  They have redone the bathrooms and some of the terminals so it is looking nicer.  They just need to update the restaurants, the one's that are there now are pretty sub par.A nice airport to travel through but don't spend too much time here.  Not too much to do.About average for a Marriott ap property. Restaurants here were decent, nice bar area. Omelete was a little undercooked but the buffet overall was good.  I would stay here again as the rooms are comfortable and reasonably well appointed.  Good value for the money.This is a great place. Recenly remodeled with a very nice sports bar. The rooms are very clean and modern. The staff is wonderful!!!Internet - $16.95 a day if you want it in your room.  And the free internet in the lobby feels like dial-up.  Not impressed....  I'm here for 24 hours and I will not stay here again.I really liked this hotel. It's very close to the airport but you can't tell because it's designed in a way to block out lots of the airport noise.The lobby is pretty and modern, and the staff are very nice; I didn't notice anything bad about it. The rooms are nonsmoking so I'm not sure why another commenter said it smelled like cigarette smoke.The rooms kind of have a weird layout, but they're refurbished and pretty, and the housekeeping staff are very accommodating of your needs.Very nice pool, relaxing, with nice amenities. Downside: no free wi-fi! Even the less-than-great Holiday Inn in Knoxville had free wifi....For an airport hotel, this Marriott is fantastic. I have been to private events here as well as a hotel guest. Friendly front desk staff and the location is great. Not far from downtown and the hotel van will take you.I had no official intentions on staying, but my flight cancelled and they were the only local hotel that was available; blessing in disguise. Check in process was quick and painless. I made the reservation over the phone, shuttled over, and checked in and was in bed no more than 15 minutes after arriving! While it was pricey and out of budget, for the stay, it seemed fair. WiFi is paid, which could do without having to pay for. Bed and pillows were nice and comfy and the room was so dark it was easy to fall asleep. Four for five because it seemed a little "nickel and dime" like to not throw in breakfast or charge for WiFi.For an airport hotel (though not on-site at the airport), it's good.  Rooms are fine.  Decent sized gym.  Friendly employees.  Very good restaurant and a FANTASTIC morning breakfast including made-to-order omelettes.love this airport and all the music related decorVery nice hotel for company meetings.Hotel is pretty good.  The beds are super comfortable and the staff are really nice.  The maintenance guy was one of the nicest employees...he greeted me like we were friends and he was just walking down the hall.  Then I heard him talking to others in the hotel the same way.  I thought it was great.  I was there for a conference and I am not a fan of their banquet food...eggs were runny and the selection was not great (but it was a banquet breakfast buffet...so hey what can you expect).  They have four treadmills so there was not a wait to get on them in the morning which is a plus.First time at this Marriott.  Just what I expected, updated, fresh, comfortable bed.Issues were room smelled like smoke at check-in; checked outside deck which was loaded with empty beer cans and cigarette butts; hotel took $20 off my room for the 2 nights we were there;  Room was on ground floor, came back that night to find lady bugs all over the ceiling, hotel did nothing. Breakfast buffet was $14.95; Starbuck's in lobby for coffee which also made beverages expensive. Laundry room and workout room were excellent. Location was also a plusGood for a biz traveler working thier way through town. The lobby is gorgeous and the staff very attentive and pleasant. It is away from any restaurants or nightlife, so you will need to travel for those things. The bar area inside the hotel is tiny. I stopped by for my usual drink and dinner while sitting at the bar only to find no space anywhere. Disappointing, so I hoofed it back to my room and ordered room service. Breakfast buffet in the morning is very well done and the restaurant area is very large.....maybe take some restaurant space and convert it to bar space? The concierge lounge is large, on a high floor and had nice service. Not sure if this property is ideal for an extended stay, but certainly is excellent for those folks "passing on through" Nashville.

review_content: Nice hotel in the downtown area. Not far from where the Titans play. Large lobby area and nicely decorated. There's a bar/restaurant right in the lobby. The food and service there was very good. The waitress was very attentive without being overbearing. Food was delicious, especially dessert. The rooms are nice and clean. Uniquely decorated with nice pictures on shelves above the bed. Nicely designed as far as convenient outlets and USB ports. Also a free bottle of water in the room.  Starbucks coffee as the complementary coffee the room. The desk in the room is nicely designed as well for work. Three outlets and two USB ports right on the desktop.The front door staff here were super polite and friendly and I was immediately greeted upon arriving for check in. Not too far from restaurants and bars as well.I would definitely say here again when I'm in the area.Not sure why the reviews are so bad. Does the hotel need a little improvement?  Yes...doesn't everyone?  I was here for a business meeting that occurred at the hotel.  Our flight came in at about 10am and check in was at 3.  They checked the group of us in at arrival time. I found the room very clean. The hotel itself was also very clean. Everyone I can in contact with was very nice.  From the front staff to the cleaning staff.  I wouldn't mind staying here again if I visit Nashville.I opted to stay at this property during my recent visit to see family in Nashville mostly due to recent experience with Sheraton hotels and being a Starwood Preferred member. The location fit our needs perfectly. A short Uber away from Broadway and other entertainment, close to the interstate if you're driving, and close enough to all parts of town. May not be ideal for walking long distances, especially during the winter. As others have mentioned, it is an up hill trek if you're walking back from the bars. The valet parking was a little pricey, but necessary due to the wife's knee injury.The interior was nice and looked as though it was recently renovated. It is obviously an older property, but clean and updated. Our room was large, clean, and had new-ish furniture and TV. Clean with no issues. No real view to speak of...mostly of the office building across the street. The only issue we had was due to the location of the room. We were on the 5th floor facing the open hall to the lobby. If you're staying on a weekend, chances are someone is going to come back to the hotel drunk and yelling at 3 am. Not ideal if you have a 5 am flight the next morning. The door had a fairly large space open under it, which allowed for a lot of the lobby noise to penetrate the room. If the door had been better soundproofed, our stay would have been great.The staff was very friendly and helpful, overall. The valets were great with my wife, who had recently hurt her knee and was moving pretty slowly. The bar/restaurant staff had some good recommendation and made a good drink. We arrived late, so ate our first meal at the bar.
