The burger was pretty good, much better than most hotel burgers I've had.I've stayed at this property about half a dozen times while working in Nashville, On this visit, the desk staff, Nicole in particular, went above and beyond. From check in to several requests I had, she was stellar, friendly, efficient and went out of her way to assist me, even to the point of having the housekeeping staff and general manager search for a computer cable I'd forgotten. The rest of the desk staff was also helpful and a pleasure to deal with. Will be commending them to the SPG. I would have given 4 stars, but the restaurant's breakfast service was again underwhelming in food selection and pricing, although the staff is consistently nice. Go to the corner market next door - they do a very nice breakfast very economically. The bar is like the restaurant, although the drink selection is quite good, the menu (restaurant not open for dinner) is limited, highly priced and unimpressive. Again, the saving grace is the staff, who are all very nice.I have stayed at this property for many years and have always enjoyed the charm and memories I made here. With the management and crew there now, I know this property will continue to be a favorite and a mainstay for Nashville.  I can't say enough about how wonderful this property is. Thanks you Doug!I'm a Starwood preferred member so that swayed my decision to stay here versus the numerous other hotels of Nashville. Uhm, I have no idea what I paid for besides having a bed to sleep in. Seriously, the Sheraton Grand in Sacramento is nicer than this. Oh yeah, and cheaper.I appreciate that they are going green so I could skip the cleaning of my room. I'm not a messy person so I was fine with that. The bar was decent and the people of Nashville are friendly so that's a perk. I was traveling alone for the Rock'n Roll Nashville (half) Marathon in April. I stayed for four days because I wanted to really get a feel for the city. The bar was solid. I had a difficult time getting someone to pick up when I tired to order room service. Minus a two stars for that because let's face it - I like to eat. It also took what felt like an eternity to get my food. A burger. Smh. The hotel staff is good at their job - thanks for being friendly. But really, I probably could have stayed elsewhere and been just fine.So disappointed! The rooms are beautiful and the amenities are great - wifi, free printing, Starbucks. HOWEVER on a Wednesday night there was loud partying taking place down in the lobby past 3AM and NO ONE FROM THE HOTEL WOULD ANSWER THE PHONE! Too bad. I come to Nashville for work monthly and sadly won't be staying here again despite the beautiful renovation. Clean up the drunkards and loud mouths in the lobby! Or at least have someone from guest services answer the phone and pretend to care about my legitimate concerns!!! Or maybe better doors? Something must change.I was worried about this place after booking on Travelocity and then reading Yelp reviews. Well, Yelp was right! Older hotel, very outdated. We didn't have any mold issues but my boyfriend and I were very disappointed. Let me be clear, this hotel is doable. It did not ruin our trip because we were out and about the whole hotel time; however, there are some things I wish I would have known prior to booking.First off, this hotel is "downtown" but it's in the business downtown area. Not where all of the bars and live music are. If you're here for a conference, it's a perfect location. If you're here to party and hear live music, it's quite a walk. It was a few more blocks away than where it claims to be and not only a few blocks but ALL UP HILL BACK TO THE HOTEL! Mind you, my bf and I are runners but sheesh!  Walking up a massive hill, block after block when you thought you booked a hotel in the center of it all is annoying.Another annoying factor, the SHADY price traps. Parking is upwards of $25 a day when parking across the street at the meters is free after 6pm. Another shady trap? $15 per day for wifi. What a joke.  Here's my favorite: as I was getting ready (taking my sweet time) my bf wondered downstairs to check out the breakfast and coffee in the lobby. Coffee was free, but the CUP was $2.50! Are you joking?Another tip: we stayed here 5 days/4 nights and each morning housekeeping showed up before 9am! Good Morning?  Mind you we were also adjusting from California time.This resulted in us denying any housekeeping services which was fine because we're not slobs but we kept running out of towels.  No biggie, I tried to call the front desk to ask for some, oh wait, NO DIAL TONE! This was also quite annoying when we had an eventful day and wanted to relax and order room service. Not! No dial tone, no food for us. We walk downstairs, they have no food to order but told us we could "order a pizza or something from nearby."  We ask for local suggestions, nope!  No suggestions for you either.  Really?  Thank god for google.If you are staying here with some friends and saving some cash this is a great hotel. But when your planning to stay at a nicer hotel to enjoy the amenities and want to be in the heart of what Nashville is known for, stay at the Hilton.This Sheraton is still going through renovation, so don't stay here if you don't like seeing an old hotel transform into something more modern. The posters who gave negative remarks for that are just ridiculous. The Sheraton even served champagne in the lobby to say "sorry for the mess" -- preferably they should lower the prices temporarily to show people what is in store. Been coming here for years and the staff are amazing and my room is clean and spacious with fun design.OK large hotel. Some issues. Very nice lobby bar and very friendly staff. Room was typical Sheraton, good bed, trpical shower, TV, desk, etc. We like the location--but it's a long walk to Broadway on a hot day. So, we wound up taking a cab or Uber a lot. Shuttle was nice when available. Our main issue is that even after the recent remodel, the A/C never got below 75. Hotels need to be able to get every room to 70 degrees in hot summer. Our rate was bit too high this trip, $340 a night, last year was $220. We've stayed here twice and will try the very nice looking Omni Hotel next time to be closer to the action on Broadway. I would only stay here again if the rate was much lower. Pros: - Location- Staff was friendly, especially front desk- Lobby Bar was fun and good serviceCons:- Not that close to Broadway music area, long walk if hot out- A/C was not working right in room- We needed to borrow a DVD player and they said they did not have any... but with conferences there--I think they do and just did not want to offer us one- Rate was high for what you getOK for Business, Friends, family, etc.This is a world class first rate hotel. Exceptional convenience,  service, and accommodations.  We'll worth the money! The bed was so comfortable. My favorite place to stay in Nashville.I really like the food they have, the bar lounge is really nice. They have a really good wine selection The movie selection is amazing, I mean there's things that are still playing at the theaters and the location is really nice because you can walk to all the fun on Broadway Street and you can also call a shuttle and they will go pick you up wherever you are.My fiance and I stayed in the Downtown Sheraton in Nashville, TN this weekend. The parking garage is a bit tight and the cost is about $30 per vehicle to self park. The hotel was undergoing some remodeling of the interior but it seemed to be concentrated around the main lobby area. The room was clean and the comfortable. I really liked the bathroom setup; the electrical outlet/light switch had a small nightlight in it and the option to have the bathroom lights as dim or fully lit. The shower had plenty of hot water and the breakfast buffet the next morning was much larger than I've had at other, more expensive hotels. The food tasted great! I'd stay there again, but I might park on the street somewhere.Bell boy- black gentlemen was really rood! He told us he had a shuttle and he'd be here in 10. It's been 45min. We asked again and he gave me a dirty look. Nice class bell boy!OK, I'm going to admit that price is one of the biggest factors that influences my ratings of hotels.  My husband and I didn't want to chance not finding a room at all in Nashville (based on our previous week's experience trying to find a hotel in the suburbs of this city) so we booked a night at this Sheraton the night before we arrived.  Since it was the night before, we clearly got a fantastic deal on a room that the hotel couldn't rent to anyone else (because of blocks or whatever) and really enjoyed our experience here.  But, let me say again: price is a big factor in my happiness about this place.On Kayak, we booked this place for $169.  That's amazing considering other reviewers paid WELL over $350/night and I just saw rooms on this hotel's website for the last weekend in June are going for $409/night (two queen beds).  WOAH what a steal we got.  The hotel itself has clearly been renovated recently and it shows.  The lobby is new, chic, modern, and has a lot of local touches like sheet music, pictures of country artists, etc. all around that make it feel like Nashville.  Hotel valet was about $25 night, which isn't bad and includes unlimited in/out once you pay.  The restaurant/bar is nice, new, modern and pretty full each evening which makes for good ambiance.  There's TVs, a full bar, full kitchen with breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  Rooms offer room service, too, which is a nice plus if you don't feel like going downstairs.  The second floor restaurant serves full meals in a nice, slightly classy setting (for dinner) and that's where the breakfast buffet is if that's your fancy.There's a small, weird pool and no spa, so skip that area if you're looking for a Jacuzzi.  It was a nice place to swim for a bit but it wasn't super nice or anything to look at so we went in for a dip and left pretty quickly.  The workout room next door was small but did the trick so that's available if you need it.  The rooms were really nice.  Our king room was clearly recently remodeled, a lot of quirky local touches like old-fashioned lamps, photos of Nashville and country album covers, and a pillow shaped like a cassette tape on a blue leather lounge chair.  The bed was incredibly comfortable and boasted at least 8 pillows (which I LOVE).  The dresser/desk was long and sleek, had a nice LCD flatscreen TV and HD TV channels (thanks for springing for that, Sheraton).  The bathroom was small but comfortable and had a lot of shampoo and lotion for your use.  Lots of towels, too.The hotel advertised paid wifi in the rooms but ours was free so AWESOME.  Another little thing that just really, really impresses me and makes me super happy.  Thanks for not charging me $12.95 a day for something that is a given in this new, modern age.I don't know if I would have been as happy as I was with this place if it had cost twice as much, but I was really impressed for how much we paid.  It's definitely worth $150-$200 a night, but it's not really in close proximity to all of the bars on Broadway or even the night spots in Midtown or East Nashville.  It's really only across from the Capitol Building, which is cool, but not much of a sight for more than an hour or two.  Two blocks away there's a Nashville B-Cycle (bike) rental location, so valet your car and go grab one of those bikes for 60 minutes and you can ride all over town and to the restaurants and bars you want to go to.I have to start out this review with a disclaimer, during my stay the hotel was in the middle of a massive renovation, however I was lucky enough to get one of the recently renovated rooms for my stay.When I first arrived I discovered that parking was 38.50/day, way overpriced especially considering the quality of the garage. It was tiny and also under renovation/repair. I personally think a more acceptable price would have been closer to $20/day however that is beside the point.When I first entered the hotel I noticed the bright white interior, in fact I almost felt like I entered a Miami boutique hotel. The new lobby is a very nice touch, complete with a gift shop and a sunken bar on the other side. Check in was easy and the staff was friendly. Once I received my key I headed to the elevators and discovered that the lobby was open to all 27 floors. During my trip to the 17th floor I noticed that the hallway balcony's overlooking the lobby seemed to be awaiting some additional surfacing as part of the renovation. They didn't look bad, just bare, I can only imagine how much better they will look when completed.Once I arrived at my room I noticed that the room itself continued the bright white theme from the downstairs lobby. The room was chic without being overly tacky. The subtle white with the local prints placed above the bed was a great touch and made for a very nice room. The bed itself was comfortable and the room was spacious. The bathroom was nice, yet not too big. Overall the stay here was a good one.Now what didn't I like about this hotel, the pillows were awful and the location wasn't the best. While the hotel is downtown it's on the far end and probably one of the hotels located the furthest from Broadway. And like I said earlier the garage seemed like it too could use some renovation work, especially for the price.Overall this will probably be a great hotel once the renovations are complete, however for those visiting Nashville for the Broadway bars I think there are other options that would be better suited. This would be  great hotel for the business traveler or someone wanting to be close to downtown, yet not right next door to the bars.Despite remodeling, this is 3.5 stars in my book. Common areas, including lobby and bar, are pretty tasteful. Rooms are good sized, clean, decor is adequate. Service is friendly, as everywhere in Nashville. Few things I didn't like: too noisy in the room, isolation can be better. A/C was noisy too. The value is dubious. For $220 plus all taxes and fees I expect more in Nashville.Had to call the Nashville police after front desk manager Robert Dooley would not help after United states army females where harassed by parking attendees, his response was they technically don't work for hotel. I feel our troops deserve more respect and should command a better response from individuals in power when there just visiting family on leave in this instance.This hotel was fine, but I thought it was overpriced.  At $775 (with all those taxes / misc charges that you can't avoid.... three of them) for a basic room for two nights, I was a little disappointed.The rooms looked cool.  Well appointed with art and decor.  Very chic.The staff at the front desk were friendly and knowledgeable.Our bed skirt had stains on it.  It wasn't clear who could use the shuttle and whether it was free.  It's not an ideal location to bustling Broadway in bad weather (ice and rain).  I wouldn't recommend it for a party group that plans on going out unless you want to take cabs to go party.Kind, courteous staff will go out of their way to make your stay memorable. The bar has great drinks, the beds are comfortable and the hotel is beautiful.
review_content_20: Second stay here. They're awesome.  DO take advantage of the free shuttle downtown. Unfortunately, they will not pick you up but they will drop you wherever within a 5 minute radius.  Bell desk and valet on point.  They called me Mam and I LOVED it!!  Our bill was all messed up but they promptly fixed it after I called in. It's been remodeled since I last stayed in 2013.  Great location and clean rooms. I'm a fan!Arrived at hotel prior to checkin time and room was already available.Nice comfortable room with all the ammenities.  The hotel is an easy 10 min walk to Broadway (or you can take the free hotel shuttle). All hallways open to the atrium so there is no echo of hallway noise. The lounge on the 1st floor was nice to retreat to after a day on Broadway. The breakfast buffet is a little pricey but was still good. My only complaint is that the windows are paper thin. We were on the 21st floor and can still hear street construction 3 blocks away. Prob more quiet than if we were at a hotel close to Broadway. Yes we would stay here again.After checking into this hotel for my second week, I feel as if this is an ala-carte experience at best.  Everything that I inquire about has an up-charge.  Lounge access, breakfast, parking, etc.  why am I even paying an exorbitant nightly rate if it doesn't include anything that I need?  I am a Lifetime Gold Starwood member, and this is probably the shoddiest customer service that I have experienced at an SPG hotel in many years of business travel.  I think that I will move my business down to the Hilton or Marriott where I will be appreciated for my loyalty.When I booked this hotel room I thought I was getting a fantastic deal on a great room in a convenient location in Nashville. Upon arrival I was informed that they can change my two bed to a king bed which is perfect, when I finally got to my room after a number of road bumps in the check-in process (that resulted in me feeling like I was not a desired guest and my bank putting a temporary block on my debit card), the room was not actually changed to a king. The room was adequately clean and the view was nice from the 12th floor. The beds were hard, for the price of the rooms I was expecting a much more luxurious bed to sleep in. There was random hair stuck to the top of the comforter but the rest of the bedding was clean. Out of all the USB outlets I could find in the room, only one of them worked. The coffee maker had two cups but only one pod of regular coffee and one of decaf, a double occupancy room should have two pods of each. There was a lack of information in the room regarding hotel amenities, the room service menu was the only information to be found. I was expecting a booklet with information including the restaurant/bar menu with hours and other typical hotel information.The room was paid in full in advance, and as expected at check-in they ask for a credit card to put on file for incidentals, they did not mention that they would be putting a $50 hold on funds. This may have been an oversight but I feel this is information you should be required to tell someone when asking for their credit card. They also failed to mention until checkout that $10 of the "deposit" would be kept for a hotel "facility" fee. For the price of the room, there should not be additional fees like this and everything should be included in the price of the room. I am sure the facility fee is mentioned in small print on the website but it should also be verbally communicated to customers at check-in as well.I am not impressed with the value I got for the price I paid, the service was lackluster. I feel like I would have gotten better service at a Motel 6. Would not book this hotel again.Totally renovated  the Sheraton is better than ever with a new contemporary look and feel.The service at the bar and restaurant is just as good as I remember and the staff are all very welcoming.A great deal on the weekends too and close to everything Nashville has to offer!I booked a double room in advance via the Sheraton website and paid in full at the time of the booking. I called ahead of time to check on a $25 club level upgrade they mentioned in the email, but apparently I was a day late and wasn't able to get the upgrade at that time. There was no mention of this on the booking receipt that I noticed --just said it was available.After what should have been an 8 hour drive, but turned into a 12 hour drive with multiple stops and an emergency room visit, we made it to Nashville. Upon arrival we were exhausted and ready to relax for a bit. Courtney happily (this girl must love her job...it shows!) checked us in in under 5 minutes. When I inquired about an upgraded room, she did so without any hesitation whatsoever. She also gave us a couple recommendations for BBQ. We ended up at Martin's BBQ Joint per her suggestion and it did not disappoint. We actually later saw her walking down the street leaving for the day, and although off duty, she smiled and waved to us. The first room I booked had a bathroom door that didn't lock, but otherwise was nice. It was clean, comfy and had a great view of the skyline from the 22nd floor! I say "first" room because we ended up in a second room, which was in no part due to the hotel itself.At 2:00 a.m. on our first evening, I couldn't sleep due to a loud friend that likes to talk when others like to sleep, and another whom couldn't control his snoring ;) I stumbled downstairs to the front desk and was greeted by Fred and Markeith. I want to first say that I put their names in my phone so I could write this review, because their service was so spot-on that it did not go unnoticed. I rattled off my story to them and we all had a few laughs and then they proceeded to fix a problem that wasn't theirs to HAVE to fix; but they did. These are the kind of people ALL service establishments need to hire, and keep, because it speaks directly to the establishment itself. You can encounter minor problems like a bathroom door that doesn't lock, or a parking garage that is too expensive etc. and not even bat an eye because of the people that work there and make you forget about it by how kind they are. I hope they read this, because I want to personally thank these two - again - for their kindness during a moment where it felt like, to me, that everything that could go wrong, was in fact going wrong.The second room had a bathroom door that was tough to close and no exhaust fan. No biggie, but wanted to throw it out there.The lobby and room decor were clean and modern. Not my style as it's so modern, however it was done well, regardless of my personal tastes.Parking is expensive. The hotel doesn't offer parking but there is a garage that they work with that offers it for about $32 a day with in and out privileges. The hotel doesn't discount it because they don't own the garage, however they can give you in and out access on your room keycard.The hotel is walking distance from Broadway. It's not around-the-corner-close, but you can walk there in 10-15 minutes and for me that was perfect. I didn't want to be in the heart of the District anyway, and preferred this location because it was quiet, but nearby. We saw a show last night at the new Ascend Amphitheater and walked back to the hotel afterwards; took about 25 minutes. If I'm ever in Nashville again, I will, without a doubt, stay here. You should too!This meets or exceeds all the expectations of a hotel in its class, and it is my first choice for hotels in Nashville. The Sheraton Nashville Downtown was renovated recently, and is located in a great area that is walkable to several nightlife areas (not to mention any downtown office). Rates are reasonable, and the lobby bar has some great local/regional selections for craft beer. I travel to Nashville weekly and stay here as often as the hotel has rooms available (it sells out quickly).CAN'T BE TRUSTED WITH YOUR CREDIT CARD INFORMATION. The hotel was nice, but they overcharged my credit card, which is an absolute stopper.   We left before the 11am departure, and received a bill with that time on it, which we paid in full. When we checked our credit card statement at the end of the month, we noticed they overcharged. I called several times, and was passed along with vague and inconsistent answers, and hung up on. I had to keep calling and asking for managers, and finally got a copy of the bill they were looking at.  It was for a 3:07pm check out and in addition to our original bill they added an item we did not get or authorize.  BEWAREHorrible experience: I booked the Sheraton for a nice holiday weekend away with my new husband. Knowing that we would not arrive until late, I called ahead to request a king bed. Unfortunately, when checking in, we were informed that zero king rooms were available, and all that was left were rooms with two doubles. I did not book a four star hotel for a vacation to sleep separately from my husband. Additionally, nothing else was offered as compensation, and much of the lobby was off limits and in poor condition due to some sort of construction, of which we were not notified at booking. Will not return.The hotel is updated & modern.  Rooms are comfy & posh, but the bathroom was shoddy (bathtub clogged, toilet seat was loose).  They are a dog-friendly hotel, but there is a $75 dog fee (yikes)!As I drove up to check in, the valet came up to assist me.  They notified me that only valet parking was available, so I paid the enormous fee for the privileged of leaving my car in their hands.  The atrium is open and you can look up and see all the rooms, kind of like an embassy suite.  My room was nicely decorated and I had a nice view of the state capitol.  Having no idea of where to wander in Nashville, the front desk offered me good advice to walk down to Broadway.  As far as big city hotels, I was happy with the quality and service of the place.  Location wise, I may have reserved a room nearer Broadway, but it wasn't too bad of a hike.  Also, a good hike is the sports arena and the Country Music Hall of Fame.I booked this hotel via a 3rd party site for two nights. It was rated a 4 star hotel. This hotel is a 3.5 star at the very best. Parking is $30 a day. If you are a 4.5 or 5 star hotel, this is normal. For a Sheraton, no thanks. I am a SPG member so I was very disappointed with my stay. The water pressure was incredibly weak and would randomly shut off for a couple of seconds at a time. The beds are comfy and the staff was very helpful.  I won't recommend this hotel and hopefully won't have to stay again.In spite of the mediocre rating, my wife and I decided to stay here when we visited Nashville for a 3 day weekend getaway. From the moment we arrived to the day we left, everything was excellent. The door men are Johnny on the spot, the hotel bar staff are straight up stellar, and the room was clean and well kept. 5 minute walk to Broadway bars, shuttle service if you're not in to walking although the shuttle is limited to about a 1.5 mile radius. The drinks at the bar are fantastic, and the food is on par with the price. We will definitely be looking to book here again on our next visit.I'm not surprised this hotel gets such terrible reviews. I had booked a trip for MDW and called the other day to confirm that they have fridges in the rooms, as I am a nursing mother. The response from the front desk was very curt: "We don't have fridges in the room. We have a few available for medical reasons." I said "I am nursing and need to store milk for my infant so can I reserve one?" Woman said "You can ask for one when you check in...but there are no guarantees." No guarantees? So if I were a diabetic with insulin, I wouldn't be guaranteed a fridge? Or does my breastfeeding not constitute a "good" reason to set aside a fridge. Either way, the policy makes no sense (both for me, or those with "actual" medical conditions) and the delivery was rude, inflexible and unaccommodating.We called again the next day to speak with a manager. The woman who answered rudely said "well, I am the front of the house manager." We explained the predicament to her and the response was the same - curt, snotty and unaccommodating. We cancelled our reservations, and made new one at The Homewood Suites - an equally well-located hotel WITH fridges in the rooms and a nice customer experience to boot.Not only was my experience "bad", but I left feeling discriminated against for being a nursing mom. I really hope, for the sake of the Starwood Hotels that Sheraton Nashville is not a reflection of their business practices and other establishments. They've certainly lost this customer.Remodeled, yes. Better, no. Heat blowing cold air. Parking garage ticket machine non functional. No clean sheets when asking to not be included in the green option. TV constantly turning off or resetting itself to channel 0. Shower blasting water at only one speed, dial broken. Room key constantly reset. Elevator canceling room selection in mid travel. Room semi-clean. Dirty glasses left from previous guest.They have a lot to work through.Good location but fees, fees, fees! Parking fee, valet fee, bell boy fee (and you have to use if you want a cart), facility fee.This hotel was superb! I stayed there in early November 2014 (during CMAs week) and had no complaints. The renovation has definitely done them well. Aesthetically the hotel looks crisp, clean & modern. When I checked it, in was quick and easy. Throughout my stay the staff was friendly and aimed to please. I loved the bar in the lobby and the hotel's proximity to downtown. Theres not much more you can want in a hotel. I'd definitely stay there again.Beautifully remodeled hotel with stylish rooms and comfortable beds.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Great location.I travel a lot for both work and pleasure and have never had an experience as bad as this.I was in town the  previous week for a conference at the Opryland hotel and my wife came out to join me for what we hoped would be a relaxing weekend in Nashville. We booked the Club VIP experience which included access to the lounge on floor 24 as well as WiFi for $339/night.After checking into our room on floor 22, we quickly discovered a number of issues. Below are the problems encountered on our stay.1 - The WiFi code they provided didn't work. We called the front desk and they said it was a known issue and that we should just agree to the room charge of $15/day and that they'd later remove the fee2 - For lounge access, you are supposed to enter your key in a special slot and then press floor 24. However, the card reader in 3 of the 4 elevators was out of service so it was next to impossible to get to the lounge. I reported the issue on Saturday and it wasn't resolved as of the time we left on Tuesday, though they did acknowledge that they were aware of the issue. The front desk manager also said she would remove the VIP charge from my reservation though I'd still be free to use the lounge due to the inconvenience.3 - The ice machines on floors 20, 21 and 22 were all out of service. The front desk was kind enough to remind me that there was cold water available on floor 24 in the lounge, however as I previously mentioned the elevators were broken. 4 - The old school elevators, while charming, are very loud. I had a hard time sleeping as every few minutes you'd hear a loud grinding noise when the cables started pulling the cars.5 - The doors don't close on their own. This is a bit of a pet peeve of mine, however when you leave your room the doors close but don't latch. You have to remember to latch on your own or else you will leave your room unlocked.6 - Checkout went about like I feared. Not only did they have no record of the  VIP access refund, they also had charged me ~60 for Internet usage. After a lengthy debate with the woman at the front desk, they removed the fees however I was not successful in obtaining the partial refund that I was previously promised.Overall, a horrible experience. After spending some time in Nashville I can assure you that there are many superior choices, especially at 300+ per night.The bar staff was very friendly. They hooked it up with free vitamin water before going to bed. Gave us awesome food recommendations and best bars in the city.
review_content_40: This hotel is currently going through a renovation. I can tell you this place is fabulous! The decor has a touch of the rustic combined with a trendy contemporary flare. I am enjoying the crisp clean feel, with a touch of the traditional "Nashville history" paying tribute to the legends in the decor. Kudos to the decorating team that pulled off this collaboration of modern meets "ole Nashville"My boyfriend and I stayed here. We got a decent deal for Sheraton on Priceline however Nashville in general seems to be extremely expensive where hotels are concerned. The room was beautiful and had a really nice view of the capital. The lobby bar as well as the lobby itself was lovely. Nicely decorated. We had quite a bit of a wait to get checked in because the way the line worked was very disorganized with people who just arrived being helped before people who'd been there awhile. I'm giving this place 4 stars due to check in delays and because for $200+ a night I expect the bathroom to be impeccably clean and it wasn't.Honestly - I never take the time to write reviews.  This stay several weeks ago was one of the best trips I've had and a lot had to do with how great the hotel and location was.  The staff - including Greg the manager was very accommodating in helping my friend and I with plans and means of getting to areas.  He have the best advice for what to do at certain times around the city.  Kristi the bartender  made all of our drinks- best tequila sunrise - bloody Mary's I've ever had.  The Sheraton nailed it for our experience as well as everyone that worked thereI recently stayed here again with my wife, and it appears as though the hotel is done or near done with their renovations.  We had a suite just off from the elevators, which was a concern until I closed the door...never heard any noise from the hallway or the elevators, which is what I had expected.The same compliments/gripes are still valid...prices for wine/bar drinks, good attitude of the staff etc. I didn't have a car this time around, so no valet, but everything went smoothly and we were happy.  This will be my go to hotel in the downtown Nashville area.I am a fan because I see potential.  Yes they are going through major renovations.  You will hear large drill sounds at 10:30 AM, You will not go through a beautiful lobby and there is no hotel bar...However, once the renovations are complete all you complainers will take back all those negative things you said.  I loved the decor in the rooms and the beds were rather comfortable.As others have said, the only positive to this hotel is the valets!  They were always quick, helpful and friendly. Really not sure why they are so much better than the other staff. An association I belong to booked this hotel. The meeting spaces were ok except the noise level coming from other rooms totally disrupted our meetings several times. The wait staff was poor to fair in their service. Food was fair. The doors to the conference rooms had big gaps under them and between them, which contributed to, if not caused the noise issues. We understand they recently completed a renovation. We thought they were not done. We even asked one of the employees who came up to our room to repair something that wasn't working, "when are they going to finish". He said they are done. Seriously, it is white on white on white. The only redeeming thing in the hotel is the wood stair case.  They obviously removed a finish from the concrete barriers to the open space in the center (holes clearly visible and they didn't even fill them in before painting.) The hotel appears to be trying to be trendy, but this is a big swing and a miss.  I cannot believe what the rates are for this hotel. I would say its about a $75-100 a night hotel. If you are paying more, you over paid.  I read someone on here paid $360 a night. I would have been livid.  On a scale of five stars (type of hotel), this hotel is a two star. Anyone stating this is a 4 star hotel has never stayed here or been inside!Our room had a funny smell that remained all week. Almost a mildewy smell (like a dirty mop), although we saw no signs of mildew on the walls. It made me think its in their vents and it was worse with the air running. The bath room floor and tub was filthy and had not been cleaned. It also wasn't cleaned the whole week we stayed!  Seriously the floor is maybe 5ft square, how hard is it to take a swiffer wet jet to it?The final straw for us was the cleaning, or lack of. For at least three of the days the maids didn't show up until after 5pm, when we were back in the room. At that point we told them never mind.  The last day they showed up at 9 am to clean!  Our one day to sleep in. Seriously are you trying to push your guests out???When I made a reservation, I booked a king bed. When we checked in he told us they only had two doubles.  That seemed odd for checking in Monday night (since most hotels aren't busy then and the conference started Wednesday!)  We found out that was a lie. A friend of mine who attended the conference booked two doubles and was given a king, and also told they only had kings.    I recommend going to another hotel!We stayed only one night but it was great! Things we liked: checked in quickly, swam in the big pool for a bit, ordered room service, which was very tasty!, room was pretty clean and AC was cold.  I enjoyed the wine, the food, the views from the 23rd floor, and the comfy beds!!I'd love to see a more formal communication for guest regarding hotel amenities, hours of operation for the on-site bars/restaurants, etc.  Parking could be more clear as you drive up also.  But, we had a great evening altogether.  Nicely renovated.I'm a huge starwood fan and always stay at their hotels. Sheraton did not disappoint. The lounge was fun and it has a pool table. The food and drinks were just ok, but we had fun. The room was nice, clean and roomy. We had a good view downtown and club access. Valet was only a few bucks more than self park so we went with valet. Just call 5 to 10 minutes before you head down and they will have your car waiting. I was very happy with my stay and the location was great. I recommend and will stay again if I'm back on Nashville.My husband and I stayed here last night while in town for a show. The hotel itself is attractive and clean - the construction mentioned in previous reviews is either over or on hold, we saw no sign of it. Our room was modernly decorated, clean and comfortable. We didn't make use of any extra amenities but the staff was friendly whenever we dealt with them. I took off a star because I wasn't at all impressed that they ask for $14.95 a day to use wifi, especially after we had to pay them $30 to park. These things should be included - this isn't a cheap motel.I decided to stay here because of a great stay a few yrs ago...epic fail this time...premium rates for royal inconveniences...glad u guys are renovating but guests shouldn't have to suffer the consequences...self park on the 7th flr of parking garage is more than valet and oh yeah...rear entrance is closed and no you can't take luggage cart around the corner of the building...great start to a one night stay...The price for the standard rooms weren't too bad. The price for the presidential suite was a lot higher than expected, but the room was worth it (due to the size of the group). The standard rooms were really nice too. The Sheraton is within walking distance to Broadway. Overall, the customer service was great and the rooms were very clean. If we wouldn't have had to wait a hour to get into our rooms, I'd of given the Sheraton 5 stars.I thought this hotel was really nice! I don't know what it looked like before the renovation but it's cute now. The rooms are nice the bed was super comfortable. I really liked the bar/restaurant too. The food was good, I was very impressed! My dad was a big fan of the veggie wrap and my favorite was the shrimp and grits. They lose a star because $15/day for wifi is just crazy and also because they didn't clean my parents' room one day (even though the do not disturb sign wasn't on the door) and they were a little cheap with replenishing towels.I will never stay here again. The hotel was dirty, the staff charged higher rates than were promised, and "Facility charges" were secretly added to the tune of $15/day. Stay away. Desk Staff is some of the worst in townI picked the Sheraton because it was close to downtown and I am a Starwood member Room- I was put on the 21st floor and had a great view of the city. The room is very modern and remindes me of the W hotels. The look and feel was modern chic with a lot of white accents. The room has a lounge chair and 2 queen beds which are hard as a rock. I now know what Fred and Barney from the Flinstones back must have felt like the next day after sleeping on a rock bed. They do not offer roll-a-way beds if you need an additional bed. The bathroom is a typical hotel bathroom with a shower/bathtub and single sink with a makeup mirror.  The bathroom is not big enough for 2 people to get ready at once. The room does not offer a mini fridge and like most Starwood hotels, they charge for internet per day. Hotel- As stated by others, this hotel has gone through a renovation. The lobby was decorated in modern chic with a touch of Christmas (it was the holidays when I went). The best part of the lobby is the ability to look up from the bottom floor and see all the way to the roof which is 26 stories high. You can also see the elevators going up to each floor and as you are in the elevators, you can look out them and see either the lobby or each floor as you are going up as they are made out of glass. It reminds me of a hotel elevator in Dubai.  The hotel does offer a spa, a pool and a lounge area that offers the game pool and a bar. Last, the hotel has the club lounge. The club lounge is on the 24th floor and has an amazing view of the city skyline and the river. The only negative about the club lounge is it doesn't offer complementary alcoholic drinks like other starwood hotels offer in their club loungeFYI- The hotel did have a restaurant on the top floor that rotated but it is currently closed. Transportation- The hotel has its own shuttle but I wasn't offered it. It turns out the bus was down while I was there. I did use a taxi that charged me $9 to get to downtown Broadway and 5th. Uber is also available but I did not utilize it. Service- I didn't have much interaction with the staff but I did have the valet hail me a cab. When I spoke to the concierge, he was friendly but didn't really help me with what I was looking for. Location- The hotel is located in downtown and across the street from the state capital building. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to Broadway and 5th st. It is also walking distance to the Predator NHL stadium and the country music hall of fame. Next door to the hotel is a mini store where you can buy snacks and drinks. The hotel is in a business district, so on the weekends it is really quiet around the hotel. Overall- The hotel is stunning with its new remodel and the new decor. The things that I do not like about the hotel is the fact that they charge for wireless internet, the beds are hard and the fact that you have to pay extra to utilize the club lounge and the lounge does not offer complementary alcoholic beverages like other Starwood hotels do. Maybe that's the alcoholic in me talking, but hey, that's how I feel.  Overall, the hotel is nice and I do recommend staying here based off of price, location and cleanliness.I have looked forward to this review since I left Nashville.  In town for Yelp Spring Break and we originally were staying at a friends house.  That plan fell apart on Friday and was rushed to get a hotel.  Priceline gave us an express deal here for $111 per night.  With a free breakfast that would compete with some of the finest brunches.  We could not wait for day 2 to have it again.  The hotel was in major state of a reno completion that was supposed to be done right after we left.  The lobby was ridiculously small and when we showed they gave us Prosecco.  My wife's favorite.  That started it off right.  Then we went up to our room.  Fresh as a daisy on the 14th floor and our view was of the state capitol!  OMG, what a deal!  I think I would have given this place 5 star s at full price.  What a huge effort they made during our stay to make us not feel like the renovations were a displeasure for us.  Check in and out were fast.  Room was fantastic!  Food, delicious!.  Location, excellent!  What else can I say except see you next time in town!  The other reviews are really bad. Not sure if before renovation or during but I felt I needed to tell exactly what our experience was so that you could make a choice.  I spoke to many around the Yelp event and no one was able to compare to our deal or experience for hotel stays.  The renovation is just going to make this place even better when completed.  Supposedly this week but probably another week.What I like most about the hotel was the location. It was walkable to Broadway, yet was far enough that it didn't have all the noise outside. I ended up not using the Shuttle service, but it was good to have. Cabs were usually easy to get, thanks to the bell boys.The inside was fairly nice. Not exactly my style, but I could tell it was remodeled recently. The rooms were fairly big - I was part of a group and we got 3 rooms nect to each other that were connected, and it worked out well.Definitely don't book this hotel if you aren't 100% sure you are going to use it. I booked it well in advance for a birthday weekend in Nashville, because I noticed that a lot of hotels were already booked up three months out. I ended up canceling, because I didn't end up needing it, and even though I have a cancellation email and number, and even though Reservations has confirmed for me that the only stay they have on file was cancelled well in advance, and even though I got no emails reminding me of my upcoming stay (which I have been informed I should have gotten), I was charged $454 for a no-show fee. Billing has told me they have nothing in their files indicating I cancelled my stay (even though, as I said, Reservations told me I did), and therefore there is nothing they can do. Apparently there is only one person who can resolve this issue for me, Elliott Stamps, and he will not call me back. Now I have to cancel a Memorial Day trip to visit my family, because I don't have the funds in my account to pay for my rental car, due to the $454 no-show charge the Sheraton has basically stolen from me and refuses to take the time to reissue or even research to get to the bottom of the problem. It's been a really nice birthday present. I will for sure never stay in a Sheraton due to this experience, and I highly recommend others stay anywhere but here. The Hilton Doubletree in downtown Nashville has beautiful facilities and they were extremely easy to work with.Very very nice for the price my girlfriend got on Priceline. Nice pool not far from broadway the main strip. The hotel remodeling is finished the parking garage needs a make over.  The wifi price is just toooo too crazy. High Parking price ($38 for self) is expect Since your downtown. But overall very very nice hotel.     I would try to stay there again and not to far from White Castle.Very nice renovation.  Comparable to the W which we stay at often. Good location to Broadway. Very modern lobby and bar.  One of the top hotels Nashville.The most expensive hotel I've ever stayed at and extremely disappointed. I was not notified about any construction at the hotel prior to our stay. I would never charge anyone those prices when construction was taking place. Lines for elevators, outlets in room did not work (the first day), and couldn't grab breakfast because the accommodations were too small.  Outside the "restaurant" were picked over breakfast muffins on a table unkempt. We wanted to watch a hockey game and when asked if they had the tv station, they said maybe in a week or two. I understand that they were improving the look to the hotel, however the high price of our stay did not match the conditions we stayed in.  Positives: easy check in; easy parking; rooms were niceWe felt ripped off having to spend $390/night when the return from them was sub par by far. For that price, I would've thought a mini fridge would be in our room at least.
review_content_60: Stayed in April 2014. Seriously understaffed. Evacuated twice in one night. Could not get back into hotel after emergency services left and had to climb over rubble at emergency exit. No hotel staff on sight through the whole debacle. Not to mention the worst housekeeping I've ever seen in a hotel. Trash and dirty dishes were not even removed and it looked like our beds were made by a 3 year old. Room service was very slow and then they brought one fork, we had ordered two meals and two drinks so go figure. On the bright side the parking valet guys are great.We stayed here this past weekend on points and another room on cash.  We were very content with the hotel.    The lobby was very warm and open.  It is an atrium style hotel and had a great feel to it.  The lobby bar was fantastic.  We had great drinks there before going out on Friday night.  Have a great selection of booze on the menu.The rooms are adequately sized and the beds are very comfortable.  The bathrooms are nice as well.  It appears the entire hotel has been remodeled of recent as it has a very modern feel.  The hotel has a feel between a Westin and a W...not a traditional Sheraton.  However, if this is the way Sheratons are moving I am very content.  We did not use the lounge as times did not work out for us but would love to next time.The hotel has a large central atrium. Looks cool, BUT, can make for a painful night, especially if you're on the lower floors. There's a bar in the lobby and a dining area on the 2nd floor and the noise travels. There were some rowdy groups chatting away at midnight and by 7am breakfast was in full swing and the sound easily leeched through my 4th floor room. Basically, if you're a light sleeper, make sure they give you a room higher up.Otherwise, the front desk was very professional and helpful. My room was clean and what I expected from a Sheraton. They have in-room internet for $15/day, free wifi in the common lounge, along with a couple of computers/printers.$14 shuttle service (gray line) to BNA that runs every 15-30 minutes. Nearby eateries that are open 24 hours and deliver straight to your room.My partner and I stayed at the Sheraton in downtown Nashville for two nights as part of a large wedding party. Overall, I felt it was a average hotel with some issues, most notably, water pressure. To be honest, we are normally Hilton guests instead of Sheraton, so I don't exactly know how to rate this Sheraton against the rest of the Sheratons in the country. Through the credit card my partner has, we are gold automatically Gold rewards in their reward system. But at this hotel, that accounted for absolutely nothing except free Wi-Fi. (I don't know if that's normal? Wi-Fi isn't free!?) Anyways, the front desk service was negligible, and they forgot to give us our wedding booklet and package, even though we indicated we are part of the wedding party. They ultimately delivered it to our door when they realized the mistake, so that was nice.The hotel itself is huge, with upwards of 24 floors. We were on the 16th floor, which afforded us a nice view of downtown Nashville, even if downtown Nashville is not very pretty. The room was standard, but have a good layout with a two-person couch and table along with a desk. The bathroom was a mess. For whatever reason, I don't know if it's just my hotel room for the hotel in general, the water pressure is abysmal. That is to say, there was none.  The showers were weak, and...let's just say, you have to flusht he toilet upwards of 5 times to flush everything down.  Definitely not something that is acceptable.The main service was very poor.  They made the bed, but other than that, the room was not straightened or cleaned at all.  The location was good.  It's definitely within walking distance of the bars on Broadway and 2nd Avenue, but it's not one of the closest.  Ultimately, I think I would stay at a different hotel if I came to Nashville again. This hotel made me glad I am a Hilton guest.For as much as you pay per night I feel as though the parking should be included when you are staying at the hotel.  When I received my bill I was in complete shock they charged me 42.61 to park one night, Yes that's right one night.  When I called and asked about this they didn't seem to really care and could't even give me an answer as to why I was charged this ridiculous charge. It was 31.68 to park .93 tax and a 10.00 facility fee, what the heck is a facility fee I was already charged a 25.00 fee. Do your research because there are other hotels that do not try to charge you.  I thought this was sneaky and dishonest!!Shitty customer service.  Been waiting over three hours to check in.  Go down the road and stay at the Hyatt.  Worst Sheraton ever!!Not sure why all the negative reviews!  We were very impressed. We got this hotel on a Priceline express deal and we had a wonderful time! The hotel is beautifully decorated. The lobby bar has very good food for a hotel, and the staff is very friendly. The room was very clean as well. We have nothing bad to say about this hotel!I normally don't write reviews but our recent stay at the Sheraton Nashville was amazing.  It is newly renovated and the decor is fabulous. Our room was well-decorated and very comfortable. The lounge and Speakers Bistro had great service and great food, especially the breakfast buffet.  The staff were professional and responsive. Special recognition to Jeremy and Leslieann for their world class customer service, that made an amazing stay even better!Although the room was nice it doesn't make up for all the nickel and dimming they do 10.00 resort fee 10.00 facility fee 75.00 dollars a night for a mini fridge that was needed for medical use. 26.95 for the labor to put the fridge in the room even though they said they would waive the fee. 29.00 dollars for parking. I would not recommend this hotel to anyoneMy boyfriend & I came to Nashville for an extended weekend. We stayed at this hotel because of its proximity to downtown. Our stay was wonderful. We were greeted by bell boys & valet parking who were wonderful. Valet parking is a little bit extra per day (plus tips) but it is so worth it! The walk to Broadway was less than 10 minutes. If you're in town to explore the downtown area, this is definitely the place to stay. The staff were really nice as well. The rooms are newly renovated & more modern. One downside is there is no hot tub in the pool area.. We really enjoyed our stay in Nashville & would definitely stay at the Sheraton again.I love the location of this hotel. The rooms are beautiful and they are dog friendly which makes life so much easier!Being a longtime Starwood platinum customer, I expected to have the same experience that drew me to, and has kept me with, the brand.  We were in Nashville for the 49er's / Titans game, and I chose the location because it's walking distance from the stadium.ProsWalking distance to LP FieldWalking distance to Broadway Street, and a number of great restaurantsConsAir conditioning thermometer doesn't respond to settings, meanings it doesn't stop at 70 degrees setting, so the room gets hotter and hotter.The heating/cooling system is very, very loud.Tubs had obvious signs of rust.The worst part - SERVICE, or lack thereof.  The rooms appeared barely touched when they showed up!  On game day, we left about 10am to tailgate...etc.  After a long day out, we returned around 7pm, to learn no one had cleaned the room.  When I called down, the desk manager seemed less than concerned about resolution.  Her first response was, "what can I do for you?", rather than taking responsibility and offering solutions.  I requested a call from the hotel manager, which I have yet to receive.  No one offered an explanation regarding how such an oversight occurred, and I feel obligated to let future travelers know.Starwood, I was a huge proponent of you, but my last 3 visits in the past 2 months was vastly underwhelming, to say the least.  Think I'm going to go with my other hotel BFF (Hilton) for awhile.There were no king bed rooms ready upon check-in, so I settled for a two-doubles room. It smelled strongly of smoke, even I called the front desk to confirm that not only am I on a non-smoking floor, it's a non-smoking hotel.  Well...somebody's smoking, and it's going directly into my room.  The smell got stronger throughout my stay, and of course, I was busy working so I was already unpacked, and too tired when I got back to my room to do anything about it.  I woke up the next morning with a smoker's cough, a raspy voice, and a ravaged throat.  I also asked for a quiet room...it's away from the elevator, but it's also on a low floor next to the stairwell, so street noise is pretty loud.  My Starwood elite status does pretty much nothing here, other than provide free wifi, which didn't work with my work computer for some reason.  Useless.Ancient parking deck, mixes valet and self parkers, so that I'm going up round and round up multiple levels, in order to find a non-valet spot.Positives? I liked the clean, simple bath/sink vanity. Nice lobby and lounge-y bar area.  It's also within walking distance of the downtown area (Broadway).Stay here if you like:Smoke smell, outdated hotel decor, street noise, watching people walk to their rooms (open hallways viewed via atrium), heights (elevators w/ windows), Nashville.Do not stay here if you like: Working wifi, easy parking, updated hotels.Construction is on going as of 7-25-14. Their web site stated construction is done.  Our room had an odd musty odor. The trek from the $35 per nite plus tax was long and unpleasant. We had to lug our stuff up two flights of stairs. The noise in the lobby area was awful. The ac was struggling to cool the room. Even the ice machine on our floor was broken. To be fit the parking garage you must use your room key. You have to drive to the valet area and go to the lobby to check out. ( this process to about 20 minutes). Awful procedure and the bill was not correct...Ok hotel: close to LP Field and restaurants. However, did not clean room, even after calling the front desk.Evidently this hotel is under new ownership and management. I will say they are undergoing renovations right now and some of the changes are nice, but they were sawing and hammering in the lobby at 1:00 in the morning. I have stayed at this hotel at least 10 times for conferences before and always enjoyed my stay, but this time the staff did not have many of the rooms ready until about 9:00. There were some who did not have rooms at 11:00 pm. It seems the hotel is vastly understaffed as they were cleaning rooms at 10:00 pm. My suspicion is new ownership is trying to run this place on the cheap. On the bright side the valet guys were super nice.  What's sad is they do not disclose the information regarding the renovations on the hotel's website that I could find. Day 2 of our stay I talked to three different people regarding the lack of cleanliness in my room. I even checked immediately behind the housekeeping after she left the room. She had put two towels and a bar of soap in my room. The bed was not made, the hairs in my bathroom not belonging to me were still in the floor. The trash and food crumbs were still on the carpet from whoever the was in the room before me. The trash was not emptied as well. The only bright spot today is the banquet staff.Day 3 The room was finally cleaned thoroughly after asking 4 people the day before. The only complaint I would have had today is the housekeeper moved all of my stuff and placed it in the floor neatly, but still in the floor. My things were not in the way at all and were neatly laid over my suitcase sitting on the suitcase rack. Very strange.Day 4 checkout was the best part of the weekend. I will say parking fees are outrageous. $30.00 per day. I am not sure if our group will return here next year after this experience.Lucky to have stayed here after a major remodel.  The lobby is stunning with very modern furnishings.  The bar to the right as you enter is a bit subdued yet the design reminds me so much of the WiBar in New York.  The newly remodeled room is huge, again with modern furnishings with a very interesting accent chair in a wonderful shade of blue.  Even though I stayed only for one night, had the best sleep with the softest bed ever.  Will definitely stay here again when I'm back in the music city.The staff is very nice. The water pressure is HORRIBLE in shower & toilet all 3 days we stayed. We wanted to take the shuttle many times but was never available even after waiting 10-15 minutes. The rooms are very dark. It is walking distance to Broadway.I stayed here for a conference with my husband and 13 month-old son. The rooms were okay but not up to my standards in cleanliness. With the little guy I'm on the floor playing with him and aware of just about everything especially from his level. Since I was there for a conference and all rooms were booked in downtown I had little options. The cost was high especially since it didn't include basics like wifi and breakfast. The elevators were painfully slow, we were in the 20th floor so it took awhile with only four elevators during rush hour. The water pressure and hot-water supply were unpredictable. The saving grace was the free shuttle and the attentive and knowledgeable bell staff.  Kudos to Omar and Derek. Thanks!The Sheraton downtown changed ownership a couple of years ago. Under the previous ownership and management, I always enjoyed my stay. The renovations that have been done are nice, but some changes were not for the better. I will say that last year the service was horrible as they were understaffed. The banquet staff was much improved this year as they had more people. The housekeeping has improved for that reason as well. The changes that were bad is the garage and parking. You are almost forced to use valet because half the garage is reserved for valet. You cannot pay cash for parking and the rate is $28 a day. Also the valet stand and checkin was moved to union street in front of the hotel create a lot of traffic congestion. This is especially true when large groups are arriving at the same time. . The prices have increased, but that is expected for a newly renovated hotel downtown. Nashville hotels have the highest occupancy rates in the country, expect to pay high prices downtown.
review_content_80: Friendly, clean hotel. We stayed here on Christmas Eve and were really happy with everything. Staff was fantastic and the lounge breakfast was great! Bed was very comfortable. They are remodeling and it will be interesting to see what it looks like next year. Thanks for aGreat stay!The worst Sheraton in the world - you are warned. "Green Option" what a scam. If you choose that you get ZERO  service . No cleaning - bed change - bathroom changes - or eve  taking out the trash  But if you say no to that - and expect full service -- they don't clean you room well , empty trash or add new supplies in the bathManager was sympathetic - admitted customers often cringed when hearing the G word. It's an old 30 year + property -- water system weak -- aging rooms. It needs to be leveled. How about this Green idea. Once demolished,  the Sheraton owners convert the land into a GREEN park?I find it hard to review hotels, because it all depends upon the room. My room was typical, clean enough but not pristine by any means.  It also overlooked the top floor of the parking garage and while the garage seemed empty, unbearably loud noises came from it between the hours of 1am and  3am. I am a good sleeper and I actually prefer some noise when I sleep, but this was way too much.I also had very little information in my room about the amenities in the hotel, nearby attractions, etc.  The only thing provided was a room service menu with two pages ripped out. I would have liked to have known where things were located, what was available outside the hotel, etc. The service was very sweet but sometimes confused. All and all, this hotel was fine but just not worth the money.Bought  "4 star" deal through Hotwire and received reservations at Sheraton. Hotwire would not give us our $ back as they misrepresented hotel. We got here today and were told the hotel was closed for renovations. Nobody even called to tell us! This is unacceptable. No fee comp anything, offer to place us elsewhere. They did verify our booking so that Hotwire could refund our $ immediately. The only reason they got a 2 instead of a 1 star is that the valet Chris was so nice helping us that he sort of saved face? What did I learn today? Never use Hotwire- they are liars and hard to deal with and NEVER stay at the Sheraton NSH again!Bar stopped serving drinks early so the workers could get out early. Unprofessional.I'm an SPG platinum member so I asked for a suite upgrade, instead they moved me to the same standard room but on a higher floor. I called and inquired about this and was told that this is an upgrade because it is on a higher floor....?  I think the front desk was peeing on my leg and telling me it was raining. I told them I want a suite and they said I would have to wait til 8pm for that.This hotel is a bit tired.   It's walking distance to the fun - so a great location.   It reminds me of every hotel I stayed at growing up and going on road trips with my parents.   The rooms face an inner indoor court yard that screams late 70's.   The rooms are "OK" ours had a leaky toilet.  The beds are comfy and the shower hot and strong.   If you don't need a lot of amenities - this place is perfect.I picked the Sheraton downtown for it being close to arena and they has shuttle service. Upon checking in I was informed of the 32 for valet. Totally ridiculous!  I then was told about 10 resort fee , which after reading reservations I see that was disclosed.  Anyway we went to the Charlie Daniels 40 th charity jam with my wife and  two sons. My 5 year olds fell asleep at concert and I had to take him back to room . I called the hotel and gave thenm my name and number and asked for shuttle to pick us up . 35 minutes later now show so I called again and they couldn't find the driver . 10 minutes later he called  saying he just got to hotel and he'd be right there I told him forget it I took a taxi. If you ever had a 5 year old sleeping in your arms for 45 minutes you'd be pissed also.  Staff never asked me how my stay was ! When you spend over 300 a night you expect much better service . I would not recommend this hotel !Based off some of the reviews, I was worried but we really liked ths hotel!  The lobby was cool and the front desk staff was great!  The view from our room was spectacular!  This hotel was clean, centrally located and we would definitely return when we go thru Nashville.I've stayed here each year for the last five years, attending an industry event at the hotel.  It's a great location, close to downtown with good views if you get a room high enough.  That's about the best thing about the hotel.  The staff is nice but their cleaning crew is chronically understaffed so expect to wait for a room to be available.  I sat in the bar for more than an hour and not one person came over to ask if I needed anything.  To make things easier at breakfast (again...understaffed), I chose the buffet - which was $14.  I know hotel buffets are overpriced but they could at least keep it stocked.The rooms are nicely sized but shabby.  The lighting fixture in the bathroom was rusted, the water in the tub (which was pitted and cracked) came out brownish, the soundproofing is non-existent and water pressure is really low.There are four elevators - clearly not enough for 25 floors, especially when one of them was stuck on the same floor for an entire day.  And the FEES!  OMG!  $24 per day for valet parking.  $15 per day for internet.  Really??  They waive this for Starwood members but, c'mon.  Even the lower budget hotels offer free internet these days!I'm actually considering NOT going to this event in future years, specifically because of this hotel. That speaks volumes!If I can give this place 0 stars I would but unfortunately it is not an option. I stayed here for a work event so I had no choice of hotels. When I checked in the staff at the front desk was great but when I walked into the room it was a different story. The room smelled moldy. There were scuff marks on the closet door and wall like someone kicked it. They can at least try to remove it. The carpet was peeling off and the ceiling tiles in the bathroom were stained and ripped. The bathroom towel had hair on it, which was NOT mine because I just walked in and noticed it. Also, as I walked through the room, I found blonde hair on my sock. I have black hair so that was definitely not mine.I ordered room service at 9:00pm and they told me 30 mins.  After 30 mins I called and they said it is on its way.  At 10:30pm I was getting frustrated because I was starving and needed to get up early for work.  I called around 10:45pm and they said I never called for an order!!!!   URGGGGHHHHHH.  They had to make my order even though I called and they said it was on its way.  Finally got my food at 11:00pm and it was NOT good.  I will never go back to this place again.This place is a total disaster. Don't do it. Stay somewhere else. Seriously. The best you can hope for is a subpar experience.This morning, the fire alarm went off shortly after midnight. By 1 am, the Nashville FD gave the all clear and guests shuffled back to their rooms. However, the alarm went off again approximately ten minutes later. The staff managed to turn the sirens off, but the strobe lights in the bedroom and bathroom continued to flash for several more hours.You know... those flashing lights that are a visual prompt to wake you up in the event that you are deaf, or the sound is disabled on the alarm system.By 3:30 am, I'd had enough. I booked a room at another hotel, packed my things, and went down to the front desk to checkout. I also asked the staffer at the front desk to comp my incidentals (i.e. parking) to make up for the considerable inconvenience of being deprived of sleep.The front desk staff advised me that he didn't have the authority to comp my incidentals for the fire alarm. I'd have to speak to his manager. Where was his manger? At home. Most likely asleep. The guests at this hotel should have been so lucky.I get that chaos is a part of life. And when it comes to a fire alarm, precaution is paramount. But, this property is dramatically understaffed and it showed in the lack of attention my room got from housekeeping to the coordination of the evacuation and the subsequent failure to disarm the fire alarm promptly. This property is undergoing a massive renovation and probably shouldn't be open to begin with.The leadership at this property, and Sheraton, should be ashamed. This is by far the worst hotel stay I've ever experienced in my life. I hope the folks who run this hotel never have to experience the fatigue, anxiety and discomfort on their own vacations that I and countless others weathered this morning.For the price, I feel like we should have paid $50 or so more and stepped it up a notch. Walking in, you would expect a little more from the hotel overall. The front desk, luggage storage and valet were all wonderful and helpful anytime I had questions or needed something. I also was asked to join their Starwood Club or whatever it is so I could get free internet - awesome. I had a tough time with housekeeping, though. The first issue was into my 2nd day. I got back to the hotel around 4:30 from a conference to find housekeeping had been there, but stripped my bed entirely but never came back to remake it. My heat was also cranked up to 80 - yuck. I always leave with it around 72. I called down and the front desk was great, Someone was there within 15 minutes to make my bed (I needed a nap!). One would think that the rooms would have been cleaned by that time of day. However, I did not get fresh towels, toiletries, etc. The only thing I really needed was the removed bath mat towel and fresh coffee makings. The 3rd day, which is my checkout day, housekeeping came knocking at 9:30. When I checked in on day 1, I was thrilled when they asked what time I would be leaving so housekeeping would not come knocking. We agreed on 12 and she specifically said  'so I can sleep in'. I was excited about this because no hotel has ever asked. Well, clearly, housekeeping did not get the memo as she knocked and tried my door. It was just plain annoying. All in all, I feel like their site leads you to believe you are getting something you are not. I was not at all impressed with the bathroom from the shower, pressure, products and linens. Substandard. The room was more of a 3 star, but I had tor write about my experience. Location was good. Easy walk to Broadway and good food. PS - Eat at Etch. Amazing.This hotel is terrible.  I checked in and they put me in a room that was infested with mold and mildew.  After going down to the front desk to get a room change they were very rude and made me prove to them the room was in fact a problem.  After waiting for 90 minutes and arguing with the night manager they finally gave me a new room, which was smaller and right by the elevator.  The manager asked that I not discuss this issue at the front desk because other customers could hear my problem.  Yes MOLD is a major problem.  We went back up to the room so I could fetch my belongings and there were two maintenance people putting the room under quarantine.  In fact they removed the room number plaque.  The hotel wouldn't do anything until I threatened to get American Express involved.  Aside from that, the bar and lobby are nice.  The rooms are small and dated, not a four star hotel by any stretch.  I stayed at this hotel because my business trip got extended and I had to check out of the Renaissance (no rooms available).  The Ren is a decent hotel with a great location and good service.The room was nice but there was a lot of construction going on in the lobby at the time of visit. Only one elevator was running. Hopefully when all the work is done it will be as nice as any other Sheraton that I've stayed in. I believe that price was paying for more than the location. I believe we were paying for the construction as well.Pros: Great front desk staff, other staff responsive to e-mail prior to stay, clean rooms, comfy bed.Cons: I know the location is good, but I expect a little more bang for my buck at a $200-$300 a night hotel. I didn't have to pay that much since I was there for a wedding, but I'm going to review this place based off of how much a stay would be under normal circumstances.Specific issues: $20+ a day parking (I used the street instead), WiFi not included in base price, slow draining tub, no shampoo in the room when we checked in (come on now, even a motel will have subpar shampoo waiting for you), no folio in the room that tells you about amenities/breakfast/etc, and the rack to hang clothes on was too low to the ground to accomodate a maxi skirt I was trying to steam. No major issues, but just little things that made my stay just average.During my stay, the property was bustling.  They seem to do lots of events (and perhaps, do them well, based on how busy it was).  This Sheraton is showing its age and didn't seem to get as much love from the bajillion dollar global Sheraton renovation a few years ago.  With that, everything is fine, just not amazing.  Clean, everything works, great Platinum recognition, helpful staff. One of the best fitness centers I've ever seen in a Sheraton!Centrally located and convenient to a lot.   I really appreciated the welcome gift in my room from management (none other than Jack Daniels).The rooms are better than most for a Sheraton, but the elevators are atrocious.  With 25 floors, the 4 of them should be enough.  But every time I stay here, at least two are out of operation.  Getting in and out of the room is such a chore that I swear this place off every time I come.  Apparently, I've yet to learn from my own experience.This hotel is fine but not great.  It's located a few blocks from the state capitol building, and a few blocks from the strip of downtown bars and restaurants in Nashville.  So it's got that going for it, although be ready to navigate panhandlers and homeless people hassling you between the hotel and the bars.  The hotel is a classic 1970's looking concrete structure.  I scored an upgraded top level room which was nice and had a good skyline view.  The room is appointed like every other Sheraton, which is usually above average but not impressive.  The lobby is utilitarian but gets the job done.  The staff was fine but not exceptional, even at the Preferred Guest Gold desk.  As far as value, if you want to stay downtown, this is the place.  Next time I pass through, I may just take a cheaper hotel to stay in the suburbs along the highway.Pros:Friendly, helpful and professional staff in all areas/every encounter.Seared ahi wraps in bar were delicious.Convenient location, short walk to all in downtown Nashville.Cons:The atrium-it just amplifies all sounds.  Even on the higher floors, the whirl of the elevators all night long will keep you up, even with ear plugs.  Same applies for any band playing in the bar.Parking: Yowza-self parking was $28.00 per day.  Park on the street, or the lot next door for much less.Dated/worn interior despite recent remodel.This Sheraton is right on par with others we've stayed at.+ Nice, helpful staff+ Beautiful lobby/atrium with glass elevators that let me peer at the rest of the floor like I am surveying my kingdom+ Great view from our 19th floor room+ Clean, nice room with typical Sheraton amenities+ Walking distance (or very cheap taxi if you don't like walking hills in 1,000 degree nashville summer weather...) to downtown sights - Ryman Auditorium, Broadway honky tonk scene, the river, etc.+ Swimming pool is open until midnight- The bed was not as comfortable as other Sheraton's have been - though it was by no means terrible.- Like all Sheraton's, you have to pay for internet.  I feel this is, in general, a cheap move by SPG considering how much money all of us fork out to stay at Sheraton's and Westin's.  To then be asked to pay an extra $10 for internet I can get free from Starbucks is a bit of a kick in the pants.  Yes, they have computers in the business center I can use, but that's hardly the same as using my laptop in my very nice room.

review_content: This facility is top notch. I walked in without a reservation asking for a room for the night on the spot. The concierge at the desk was welcoming and efficient. I was given my room keys, parking permit, and local map of the immediate area to find some dinner. The room was immaculate and spacious. Can't say enough good things. Would definitely stay again if I find myself in Nashville.Our stay at this hotel started off great but sadly didn't end on the same note. Our flight was early morning so we weren't expecting our room to be ready for several hours. We stopped at the hotel to drop off our bags and were pleasantly surprised when our room was available and we were able to check in at 10am!Our room was clean and had the necessities but the bathroom was in need for some updating. But it was definitely fine for what we needed. On our third day there we came back to our room from getting a coffee to find our power not working properly.
