The lights in the room wouldn't turn on and the outlets didn't work, however everything in the bathroom worked fine. We called the front desk and they sent maintenance to our room. The gentleman was unable to figure out the issue so the moved us to a new room. This new room was supposed to be an upgrade but it was definitely not. It was smaller, louder and had AC issues. It was located right by the elevator so it was extremely loud at night when people came back from their partying. Our AC didn't seem to work right and it was rather warm in the room. We totally wished we had our old room that last night because it was a crappy nights sleep.Breakfast is included in the stay here but don't expect anything fancy. I am gluten free and there weren't any options for me which stinks. My friend said the sausage gravy was decent but otherwise it's standard hotel breakfast.I'd say the location of this hotel is pretty convenient. You're about a 7-8 min walk to all the action downtown but be forewarned it is uphill the way back after a bit of drinking! I'd stay here again but I'd be sure to ask for a room away from the elevators!Obviously, it comes with free breakfast/wifi - rooms are clean - staff is friendly enough, typical Holiday Inn Express. If you're coming to Nashville and plan on partying it up on Broadway, this hotel is in a great location for that. It's within walking distance of bars, which is a huge plus for the party crowd. Unfortunately, because so many people choose to stay here when partying, the hotel can get pretty rowdy. When I stayed here, people were screaming and running throughout the hallways til the wee hours of the morning. I left the hotel exhausted and cranky, not wanting to return again.This is a nice, mid-level, hotel. It's not super fancy, but it works.The lobby area was very nice, accommodating and comfortable. There is even live music much of the time, which is very cool. They put out refreshments each afternoon and that's a nice touch.The rooms are nice and seem to have been renovated in the recent past.This property is in a decent area, but seems to be on the verge of the 'hood. Don't head the wrong direction when you go for a walk, especially after dark, and you'll be fine.I stayed here because it was close to where I had meetings for work. It's in downtown Nashville, but not the nice part of town. The room rate is much more expensive than it ever should be. My room was dirty and had that stale, musty smell to it. The service was great, but the location and rooms, give it a two star rating.We enjoyed our stay here! Right downtown within walking distance of the Broadway area (about a half mile, maybe?) the front desk lady was fabulous to us. Super attentive and kind. And, you can't beat 3D printing your pancakes in The morning. Clean rooms, comfy bed. Housekeeping didn't tidy up but at least replaced our towels. So that would be the one negative. Not like we're pigs or anything but it's nice to at least have the bed made. If this is on your short list of hotels to choose when coming to Nashville you won't be disappointed unless you're first-world picky.This hotel was the perfect location between downtown and other cool neighborhoods. I strongly urge you to check out some of the nearby neighborhoods (ie Westend, The Gulch, etc) lots of off the beaten path restaurants and bars. Lobby, kitchen/dining area, and rooms very clean.Hallways were a bit dingy, carpet needed replaced, and the walls could use new paint, these areas were very outdated.On the second day of our stay, the hallway smelled of throwup and a strong cleaner. Which is not surprising since there were quite a few drunk people stumbling back to their rooms the night before. They immediately cleaned up whatever mess was there, however the smell was very very powerful. They also put a large air purifier in the hall which helped. By the end of the day, the smell was almost gone, by the next day it was gone completely. There was friendly service/staff, but during peak cleaning hours, it was nearly impossible to get an elevator up or down from your room to lobby. The housekeeping big service carts taking all of them. Not very professional but I guess if they have no other elevator what can they do.The free breakfast was decent enough, but nothing to brag about. They had eggs, gravy biscuits, sausage, ham muffins, pastries, yougurt, fruit, juice, milk, coffee, cereal, pancakes, etc. Again this was okay for a day or two but if staying longer, I would suggest mixing in other places to eat.There is a shuttle service that provides drop offs (not sure about pickups) within 2 mi radius of hotel- We used it one day to have them drop us off at Vanderbilt University. It was only about a mile from the hotel, so we just walked home. Which was good because we found a good restaurant along the way. Housekeeping was great about cleaing the rooms, replacing amenities (towels,shampoos, lotions, etc). One day the toilet handle broke- we notified front desk on our way out and it was fixed by time we came back to room a couple hours later.You get free wi-fi in rooms (which seems to be a rarity anymore). There is also a computer service center free of use in the lobby. It was great for me as I was in a pinch and needed to print out some important documents I received unexpectedly for work. It also turned out great for us to print our boarding passes out before leaving the next day.Clean...spacious...close to attractions downtown. Shuttle service was awesome, I strongly recommend staying here when you're in Nashville.Decent hotel in a mid-area location. Free breakfast and free wi-fi is a plus. Room was clean, hotel seems a little out dated but people here are polite and accommodating of any extra needs. Fridge and microwave are very handy to have in the room for a several night stay. Lots of places to eat in Nashville and good to have a place to store leftovers. Recommend for a corporate trip.BUSTED UP HOTEL!!! This place is horrible!!! Not only are you booking a overpriced room, your are getting low maintenance amenities. This hotel is in dire need of a facelift and at the prices we paid, it should have been done a long time ago. The carpets were disgusting and the hallway looked like a cheap bates motel. Stay on the out skirts of the city where the rooms are nice.This is by far the best hotel ive stayed at and the people are the friendliest and most helpful ive met from a hotel staff. The cleaning lady did an amazing job making my room clean again. Next time i come back to nashville it will be this hotel:)Great place to stay in Downtown NashvilleRoom was clean and staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We called and said we were a head of schedule and asked if we could check in early (before 3pm) and they said yes! Usually places make you wait until 3. It was nice we were able to come in and unpack and relax, not have to find somewhere to wait.There's a free shuttle that will take you and pick you back up anywhere within 3 miles which was perfect. We used it several times to go to the bars on Broadway, Country Music Hall of Fame, The Gulch etc. All you have to do is text!!! I loved that.They were very quick and showed up on time when we asked. No need for a taxi to get you to and from the hotel! (FYI Parking was $22 +tax per day to stay in the Garage, but you do have in/out privileges)Love that all you have to do is text the front desk if you need anything. It was very convenient. Great breakfast in the morning, and snacks/live music on Friday/Saturday late afternoon. I'd definitely stay here again and recommend it to those staying in Nashville.This location seems very outdated and our room smelled very damp like there had been water damage. The hostess that checked us in was very friendly however the shuttle driver seemed like he couldn't be bothered to take us to a location within the covered perimeter even though he was just sitting around chatting with the hostesses at the counter. I am very disappointed in this Holiday Inn Express. I hope they remodel this location soon.My wife and I are on a road trip from Austin.. Rolled into Nashville and landed in a crappy hotel we booked online. Wife was not happy... She called over to holiday inn express and booked another room. When we showed up we had the pleasure of talking with Emilie (the manager). You couldn't ask for a nicer person to work with. She hooked us up.. And the smile on my wife's face was priceless...A thank you to Emilie for making our trip that much better!.. Highly recommend this hotel... And if you have a chance to meet Emilie, you won't be disappointed.Thanks again Emilie!The continental breakfast was fantastic! Excellent location to all major attractions. One small issue was that our floor smelled like cat pee at times, but the whole city smells like vomit, so this was relatively negligible.Worst experience.We had a very large bachelorette party staying at this Holiday Inn. We came back early after a short night out and found that one of our bridesmaids did not have her room key (the hotel had only given 2 working key cards for a room with 4 guests). Nighttime front desk attendant, Daniel, had possibly the worst customer service I have ever experienced in any industry, in any country. He refused to allow our keyless friend access to her room because her name was not officially listed on the hotel room. That is okay--we understand he hotel's security policy. But it was late at night, so several of us offered to wait with her in the lobby until the other roommates returned. The front desk guy (1) demanded to see our hotel keys to prove that we were guests, even though we had already told him our names and affiliation with the bridal party, but then he (2) KICKED US OUT OF THE LOBBY, where we were simply sitting quietly. He told us that we (paying hotel patrons) needed to go to our rooms or go outside, and that we were not allowed to sit in the lobby. Again, we were sitting quietly! Their night cop also threatened to physically remove us from the premises if we didn't comply.Can't believe that IHG allows this type of employee to represent their brand.First of all, Valeri at the front desk was awesome. There were three of us sharing a room and she said she'd give us a rollaway at no charge and let us check in about six hours early. We also got late checkout with no problem and ran the poor shuttle driver ragged. Everyone on staff was friendly and helpful. This hotel definitely has the best free breakfast buffet. Fresh fruit, oatmeal, sausage, ham, biscuits, gravy, cinnamon rolls, bagels, juice, yogurt, milk, cereal, bread, and a nifty machine that makes pancakes to order.The only downside was the room was a little dusty and we had one light that didn't work. Other than that, no complaints.Jodi at the front desk was helpful and nice....close to attractions...toilet seats are a little out of date, but oddly comfortable?BAIT & SWITCH! FRAUD! Made reservation on holidayinn.com. Got confirmation email and it was FIVE TIMES the amount that my reservation was. Called hotel and was told basically "we don't care" and they would not honor the reservation amount made on their own website. If you make a reservation, be sure and check your confirmation so they don't charge you 5 times more.Everything you expect from a Holiday Inn Express. I was recently in town for the St. Jude Country Music Marathon. The front desk staff was friendly during the check in/out process. The staff here even went above and beyond and made breakfast available way earlier than usual on the day of the race.
review_content_20: Great location.  Just down the hill to center of town. Rooms are older but clean and good size.  Was on 7th floor.  Front desk great in particular John.  Gift store is high price.  The free breakfast is mobbed especially for those late hung over people. Very impressed. Good job. Hoping to come backStay here for the great location (a couple blocks down to Broadview where all the bars are). Free breakfast is great and extensive too.Rooms are quite dated. The Holiday Inn Vanderbilt is 2 miles up the road but had a lot nicer interior and amenities.Don't stay at this establishment. We were here for a bachelorette weekend, came back later that night & was kicked out on the streets (4 girls I may add) after 15 minutes of being back in our room, had paid for our stay for 3 nights, all because the room across from us was being loud. No warning, just told to get our bags & leave the premises or get arrested. Thank god the cops were understanding or we would be homeless tonight. They took our side & made sure we got a new hotel & kept up with is. But I have never heard of this behavior or have experienced it & no one should have to deal with this situation ever. When we tried to confront them about the situation, they treated us like we didn't have an opinion, because we were 4 girls - one of us is a lawyer & they wouldn't listen to any reasoning before they kicked is out on the curb, at 4am. I would give zero stars if I could.Emilie was extremely helpful and friendly. She provided great customer service by allowing us to head up to our room extremely early and was very accolades tingWe booked here based on price alone but we were very impressed upon arrival. The location is ideal for downtown access. Nice clean hotel. Large lobby with office center, newspapers and fitness center. Best part: Free shuttle anywhere within two miles all day long. This was amazing since we visited while it was 30 degrees. Driver was friendly and even offered recommendations.Great place to stay, very centrally located and very close to the country western best music of this world.Staff super friendly and accommodating. Free breakfast is phenomenal with lots of great choices.Free shuttle within 2 miles comes very handy.Overall high raccomandedWoke us up at 9am to "check who was still in the room". Needless to say we were still in the room.This is a nice hotel in the heart of downtown Nashville. It's an older hotel but it looks like it's been redone lately. The rooms are nice as is the lobby area. Staff is super friendly with one exception.... We went down to the dining area around midnight looking for a plastic fork and ran into a security guard sitting in the dark talking on his phone. I told him I was just looking for a fork but the guy barked at us to get out. I think we startled him, but maybe he should be working instead of sitting in the dining room chatting? Jerk. Anyway, the location of this place is really nice. With walking distance of the broadway music scene and the museum is right across the street. We'll definitely stay here again. But we'll bring our own silverware.Stayed here from December 30, 2013 until January 3rd, 2014 - The hotel itself is ok. Nice lobby, convenient to downtown Nashville and whatnot.  The real problem I had was that the customer service was downright terrible.  I ended up getting sick for the first couple of nights so we didn't really have maid service come but when I finally felt better and left...they STILL never came.  I had to call 3 times over a 24 hour period JUST to get a fresh set of towels.  Why it took nearly 24 hours I will never understand.  It really soured me because really, if you can't send up towels quickly enough than what does that say about your employees.  On top of that, the hotel wasn't even that full while we were there so there's really no excuse for it.  Definitely wouldn't return.Side note - while the Wi-fi was free, which is cool...it was terribly slow.  So it was almost useless for most of the time.This hotel leaves much to be desired. After failed attempt at a much nicer hotel, this is what we were left with.  And expectations did not disagree. Upon getting our rooms (2), we realized that neither had even been cleaned!! When we returned to the desk, no one apologized or offered us any thing for our trouble. Our new rooms were located on a floor that reminded me of a horror film. The walls were sheet rock and "notes" had been written on them. The hallway smelled awful and was scary if not disgusting. Our only night here, we came in late from the concert/bars (the reason we were in Nashville). Not even being loud (4 people hanging out in our room) we had a "manager" come and lecture us on how to behave. We are 36-42 year olds. I was already irritated but that was ridiculous. I will never stay here again and would never recommend it to anyone staying in Nashville.The room was very nice! Lots of space, comfy beds, nice bathroom. No complaints about the room at all! I am docking a star for the rude staff. The people who worked in the lobby constantly glared at me and made me feel very uncomfortable.Location is a 4 or 5 becuase of convenience to all the bats on the strip. However they seem to jack the prices up way too high on the weekend and parking is extra at 22.00 a night. They do have a great continental breakfast. I would stay again if we all plan to drink since its in walking distance.This hotel is in a great location. We stayed there for a week for CMA fest. I only gave it three stars because our room was so hot and humid. We literally took like 3 showers a day and chose to hang out in the lobby where it was much cooler ( and there was good lemonade :) ) they couldn't give us a new room with a king bed so we sucked it up and had an industrial strength fan blowing on us at all times. The maintenance guys were really nice and even came to fix it the next day but it still wasn't blowing cold air. I asked other people how cold their air was and they said it wasn't good but it wasn't too bad so we just kept our mouth shut and took a lot of showers lol ... Also, I'm not a huge drinker but the ADA rooms are a fall risk for those in flip flops sober or otherwise... I tripped at least 4 times on the hill in the room and I wasn't drinking. It was a good trip overall just think the ac needs some tlc and check 214's humidity if you can... It was pretty soupy. Maybe that was due to all the showers we took...that's quite possible. There's nothing better than being in the heat all day and coming in to sleep in a nice cool room... The lobby felt great but our room just didn't cut it. That was the only thing that kept my rating lower.I just returned from Nashville for a girl's weekend and we were impressed with the customer service and the hotel. This was my first time in the great city of Nashville, but a friend of mine was there just this past summer and stayed at this very hotel and said that the hotel definitely had a face lift...the lobby is a beautiful, spacious area where you can easily wait for others in your party,  hang around for shuttle that they offer, or just people watch. One night they even had a hospitality table with delicious pulled pork sandwiches and fresh lemonade...and a cowboy who played and sang in the lobby. It was quite the welcome!The hotel isn't new so there will be inevitable issues with rooms, but any issue that one of my (18) girlfriends had was quickly and kindly taken care of. They are a professional and friendly staff and very accommodating. The pool is nice, but on the small side. But after hearing the stories of the summer before, the hotel decided to make the pool "dry"...meaning no alcoholic beverages allowed. This made the pool area very relaxing, and anyone that was looking for a rowdy time only has to walk a few blocks down Broadway to hit up the awesome bars for entertainment and nightlife. And the icing on the cake: free breakfast that included a wide variety of hearty and light options. Overall we had a wonderful stay at this nice hotel (with a fantastic staff) and we really enjoyed what Nashville had to offer!Loud!  If you stay in any of the rooms facing broadway, don't expect to get any sleep.  The windows are thin and single pane.  Unless you can sleep to the sounds of people yelling, lots of honking, and Harley's all night, make sure you get a room on the backside of the hotel.  The lobby is nice and the rooms are pretty good.  The wifi however is useless and again some sleep would have been nice.Decent hotel.  No bar or restaurant.  You have to walk .3 miles or longer to most food places.  The breakfast was free but not too much on it.  Checking out at 0400 seemed like a good idea until the front desk informed me that the system was running the previous days data.  I thought you would do that at midnight until 0100.  Nashville is not in my top 100 places to stay but if you have to go, like I did this hotel will work.Don't expect much from this hotel. They have a free shuttle, but don't expect it to take you anywhere. After dropping guests off at a restaurant we were finishing dinner at, we thought we would hop on to return to the hotel. The driver yelled no thru the closed window. As we pleaded that we were guests, he refused to roll down his window or talk to us. Clearly that hotel needs to train its employees on customer service. When retuning to the hotel and complaining, the manager on duty listened to our complaint but didn't offer anything in return for the customer service failure. The next day we attempted to take the shuttle around 1pm. The shuttle driver was conveniently  on break until 5pm.  Apparently 4 hour breaks are required for the shuttle driver.This has a good location, and that is all this hotel has. The rooms are tired and thirsty for an upgrade. Next time in Nashville I will stay somewhere where the employees understand the basics of customer service. They aren't worth the rate they charge. At $300 a night you are paying for a good location and nothing more. Take your $$$ elsewhere to a full service location such as the Hotel Indigo or the Hilton.The location of the hotel is unbeatable. It's right on Broadway, so we ended up being able to enjoy downtown for 4 days without having to hail a cab at all. Location, unfortunately, is one of the few things this hotel has going for it.We checked in for a 4 day weekend after booking our hotel through Priceline. Despite booking a suite, we were given a double room instead, a downgrade. Rather than being apologetic or making sure we were satisfied customers, the front desk worker said, "well that's what happens when you book through Priceline." My husband works in hotels, I understand how it works. Being bumped happens, I get it. That doesn't mean you have to be rude or condescending. In our 4 day stay, housekeeping did not come to our room once. If we wanted towels, we had to go to the front desk and ask for more. I would be more understanding if we had asked not to be disturbed or had been occupying the room, but we were gone all day, each day we were there. Still no service. The parking lot is a complete mess of its own. The structure is so tiny and poorly laid out you have to be careful not to get caught in one of the areas that do not have an outlet (but of course there's no warning). The surface lot is tiny as well, and Saturday night there was absolutely no parking for us in any of the locations available for guests. Would I stay here again? Sure, if I could use my husband's hotel discount and there wasn't anywhere else to stay. Again, the location is unbeatable. The customer service of the hotel is pretty terrible and there are plenty of other hotels vying for my business.I stayed here for four nights on business and can say it was enjoyable. My room was clean, front desk staff were incredibly friendly and hospitable no matter the time of day, and the complimentary breakfast was wonderful! The shower was always hot, the room heated and cooled quickly (and not loudly, I might add), the gift shop is nice (but really expensive), and it's far enough away from music row for quiet, but close enough to walk if you don't mind a few blocks. The mattress on the bed was extremely firm, not allowing me to sleep well. I slept in a lesser hotel in Denver on my way home with a much softer mattress. Wish they had a complimentary shuttle to the airport (there shuttle will only take you in a two mile radius) but they told me of one that was $14 one way. Housekeeping was in a hurry for me to leave on my last day; started knocking on my door at 9 am and then again later in the morning (I was so annoyed, I forgot to see what time it was). Was nowhere near check-out time. But they did a decent job cleaning my room while I was there.NOT A SAFE HOTEL!! Two other girls and I stayed at this hotel a few weeks ago. Sunday evening we got home from dinner to find that our room door had been broken through and our room completely ransacked. Whoever broke in made out with a couple thousand dollars worth of our stuff. The hotel staff claimed they didn't hear or see anything. How do you not hear someone breaking through a huge, solid door?? It doesn't help that none of their hallways have surveillance cameras either. At first, they seemed cooperative and said they would do everything possible to help reimburse us and to catch whoever did this. After about a week or so, they tried telling us that not only were they not going to reimburse us for what was stolen, but they were going to charge us for our stay!! I think getting robbed should qualify us for at least a free weekend.
review_content_40: Mixed feelings. Good location and a free hot breakfast, but our room reeked of stale cigarette smoke that bothered my asthma. Because the hotel ran out of nonsmoking rooms due to the Rock and Roll Marathon, we were stuck. You could hear everything from outside the window to from outside the hallways. Luckily, I had brought ear plugs. Other guests on our floor were absolute hillbillies. They propped their doors open to more easily facilitate yelling across the hall to one another at 11pm at night. When my mom opened our door and said "Shush," this grizzled 40 something woman yelled, "I paid for my room just like you did, bitch!" My mom yelled back, "Then get back in it." The next night bin Laden was killed, and at 3am, I awoke to banging in the hallway. The next converstion I hear is:"Are you in there?" "Yeah.""Skeeter, they killed bin Laden. Shot 'em in the head. I got $30 worth of McDonnald's. WOOOOOOOOO!"Nuff' said.Being from the San Francisco Bay Area, we're used to walking. A lot.So, of course, on our first day in Nashville, we decided to walk West End Avenue from 33rd Ave as far as it will go in downtown. We got as far as 7th Ave. In addition to this walk, we also traipsed throughout the Vanderbilt campus and its environs. We realized that after 6 hours of nearly non-stop walking in one of the worst heat waves gripping the nation, we probably had enough.We didn't feel like hailing a cab.We stopped in here and asked the front desk to get one for us. I was embarrassed that we were essentially asking them to get us a cab to deliver us to another hotel (near the airport). But the reception desk gladly called one for us. We don't know if she knew that we weren't staying there. She even asked us to sit down inside their pleasantly air-conditioned lobby.We'll definitely recommend this place to friends.This is another one where I wish I would do 3.5 stars. I pretty much agree with Amanda B, it's very close to Broadway, easy to check in, and it does the job. It's hard to go from staying at the Opry to this, but hey, it worked out great! $18 for parking is absolutely crazy, but I guess you should expect that anywhere down in Nashville. If you are looking for a cheap, quick, decent hotel this would be your place!Best place to stay in Nashville for access to music venues and Ryman auditorium. A quick 5 minute walk down the hill and you are there. Courteous and knowledgeable staff. Rooms clean. Upper floors recently renovated so ask for one of them when making reservations.Great experience. The free breakfast was good and it's within walking distance of all the attractions. I left some property in my room and they were nice enough to mail it to me at home. Very accommodating. I'd definitely stay there again.Amazing staff. Manager Ashley is super helpful. Highly recommendThis hotel is a 3 block walk to the Broadway strip-SO CONVENIENT. The hotel was clean, the people were friendly and the outdoor pool was GREAT! They even had a free shuttle. We stayed in a suite which was more than enough room and everything seemed brand new. We would definitely stay there again!Stayed here for NCAA tournament. Hotel is definitely pricing but paying for the downtown location. You could walk to downtown bars, restaurants, and arena but several long blocks away and coming back would be uphill. They have a shuttle that will drop you off, but doesn't run between noon and 5:00 p.m. You would think on a tournament weekend and games starting at 11:15 a.m. they would change it. Room was average nothing special.GREAT for the price and the location. Dont expect too much though. But come on !Stayed here for a bachelorette party weekend which also seemed to be what every other hotel guest was there for as well. That being said, I would be aware the for the months of April, May and June this hotel likely is home to bachelor and bachelorette parties on the weekends. The hotel staff made efforts to find tow adjoining rooms for us - while we weren't able to get one we still were able to get rooms next to one another. The rooms have all been renovated - comfortable firm beds with various pillow options, lots of space to hang clothes and hangers, iron + ironing board, newer bathroom with lots of counter space, 3 big mirrors total (a plus for females) nearby ice machine. Our room's TV, although a decent flat screen, had a big red band in the center of the screen. Because we weren't in our room much other than to get ready and to sleep, it wasn't that big of a deal, but if you're staying here on business and trying to relax at night it would be annoying. The rooms could use more outlets! Was impossible for 4 people to be charging their cell phones at the same time let alone also blow drying and curling their hair. Our shower drain had some clogs and would back up while showering and take 5-10 minutes to drain which was kinda gross. The bathroom door handle was close to falling off and there was no bathroom fan which made it super hot in there. Other "perks" included were a continental breakfast (nothing special but works if you have a hangover) but the dining area reminded me of college dorms dining halls because of how packed it was on Saturday and Sunday mornings with 20-somethings (so beware). The hotel staff also grilled out hotdogs for us by the pool. While this hotel is one of the only ones in downtown Nashville with an outdoor pool, the pool area is very small and they only have about a dozen lounge chairs! Even though they say the pool doesn't open until 10am, I would get out there earlier to claim a chair if you're looking to enjoy the weather. The pool area can be a little reminiscent of a spring break years ago, but it never got rowdy or obnoxious - just crowded and people day drinking. Also the hotel is located within walking distance to all of downtown Nashville's attractions and is also within walking distance of the Gulch district. The hotel has a free shuttle service which can be hit or miss - it was convenient a couple of times and other times it was easier to just walk or flag down a cab. This is by no means a gorgeous or special hotel to stay at - it purely served as function for 12 Ohio girls having a bachelorette weekend. There are plenty of other hotels in the surrounding area if you're looking for some razzle dazzle.I visited Nashville for two nights with a few friends. The hotel was very close to the downtown/nightlife area on Broadway (about a ten minute walk). Check-in was pretty easy and the staff seemed very friendly. The parking garage underground was a little small and hard to park in at times, but not a big deal. $18/night for parking was a little much, but I think that's about normal.When I had reserved the room, I was told I could not get a microwave and fridge for the price I wanted. However, when we got to our room there was a microwave and fridge, so that was a nice surprise. The fridge, however, was not working so we called the front desk and they sent someone to fix it pretty quickly. The television did not have the clearest picture when we arrived, but the problem seemed to solve itself by that night. After we got settled in we realized there were no towels in the room, so I had to call the front desk again to have them bring some up. Also, the bathroom had no fan in it so whenever someone took a shower it became very hot and the mirror would be fogged from the steam for quite some time. This is a simple addition that makes all the difference!The only other problem I had with the room itself was the lack of outlets. We only found two in the entire room and they were not in convenient locations. It was very difficult for four girls to get ready with hairdryers, curling irons, etc. Plus, trying to charge all of our phones and electronics was nearly impossible with only two outlets. I tried the breakfast one morning and it was decent for being free. They had eggs, sausage, biscuits and gravy, plus various cereals and pastry items. Altogether, we had a good stay at Holiday Inn Express. The location is ideal if you're planning to walk around downtown and go out on Broadway. The price I paid was lower than all the other hotels I looked into. The staff was friendly and helpful. Overall, I'd recommend staying here!Not sure who to blame - the hotel Manager or Priority Club. To be fair: my Priority Club agent was very informative but his boss (if he really asked) was NOT. Paula Oneal was of no help in getting me an exemption but maybe it's not her fault, it's Priority Club's "policy" to no longer ask for an exemption (which just means they don't do it anymore - but it wasn't impossible or an obscene request). I was sent a gold embossed letter by Steven S. Sickel Senior VP of Multibrand and Relationship Marketing of InterContinental Hotels Group thanking me for being in their "...top 1% of clientele across the globe." I practically lived out of Holiday Inns for about 2 years - let's just guess say I spent upwards of $60,000 with them as a ruff guess. I currently have over 180,000 priority points (left of who knows how many I accumulated before I starting cashing in on them) and was Platinum easy and almost Ambassador level (whatever that means and how I was not I'll never know) and now I need a hotel but the hotel "has rooms for cash, but unfortunately for me not for rewards." Also, I paid what looks like a suite price for a double. Again to be fair, it wasn't mentioned that this was a suite and I asked for "a double." They had one night I could use the rewards but the 2nd night had to be cash ($240) to be exact. If I wasn't trying to stay at the same hotel as my family that is flying to town for a wedding and all staying in the same hotel, I would have used my points at another location - no big deal. BUT, I mentioned these things to the 5+ agents I spoke with over 2 days and was told sorry for ya. If this is how someone in your top 1% of clientele WORLD WIDE is treated, I will gladly take all of my business elsewhere. And I'm not a CEO paying for my staff's rooms, I personally stayed in the IHG hotels myself day in and day out across the south region. Therefore, I think I deserve just a tad bit better treatment here. I don't think I'm high and mighty, but what good is a letter of thanks for my EXTREME LOYALTY when it seems to be nothing more than a 10 cent piece of paper? Is it the agents who took my very polite calls fault? No. Is it their managers' faults? Who knows. Is it the hotel's fault? Not if she/he wasn't made aware of my circumstance. It's a BS "policy" issue and whoever thought that would be a good idea without thinking about those of us who practically lived in their hotels ought to be held responsible.It seems that Priority Club cannot take care of their top customers, nor can IHG. Hmmm, I stayed at Marriott one time and received a rewards club card for them, maybe they'll take better care of their loyal customers in the top 1% of their clientele. I'm extremely dissatisfied as they are my points, I EARNED them, and now I cannot USE them. Gee guys, thanks for nothin!(this is going on Yelp.com and anywhere else i can find to voice my opinion - sorry to the hotel itself, as it doesn't seem to be an issue with the hotel or mangers there, it is with Priority Club for being of no help)Easy to check in and the lobby is large. Coffee available all night and breakfast was better than the smaller Holiday Inn Express.The rooms were large and acceptable although old and the bed was a little hard but cant complain to much.The staff were very friendly and it was close to downtown in fact walking distance to all the nightlife and shopping.I would stay there againThe hotel was walking distance from so many attractions. Lot's to do in Nashville and this was a great place to really relax. I stayed here with my family on vacation. The rooms were large-sized and very clean. Free breakfast is a plus and the front desk staff were very helpful in giving advice on places to go. I will definitely comeback! I HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

review_content: I stay almost exclusively at Marriott hotels. The service at the Vanderbilt Marriott is as good or better than any hotel I've stayed at.  The fitness room is excellent. The rooms are nice. The the big thing is that the staff are over the top nice and friendly. When in Nashville this is where I will stay.Good location. Friendly and responsive staff.Clean and comfortableGreat view of Vandy Stadium.  Close to downtownIt's a Marriott.Just expect that they'll gouge you.Ten bucks for wifi.Modern, updated hotel in a convenient location with pretty cool views of the Vanderbilt Stadium from your room...if only the UT vs. Vandy game was on while I was staying here!  The room was comfortable and the staff was very nice too!Lovey hotel with Ritz Carlton top shelf service, look and feel. You will enjoy the breathtaking views from your spacious, clean and comfortable room. The entire staff is readily accessible and caters to your every need immediately.   When traveling to Nashville don't miss the opportunity to stay at this gem of a Marriott. As a weekly traveler I can honestly say that this is the best property in the Marriott portfolio.I stayed at this hotel every week for 6 months while traveling to Nashville.  It's in a great location - you're across the street from a beautiful park, close to a lot of businesses and Vanderbilt, walking distance (or a short drive) from a lot of restaurants, but not right down town so it's a little easier to get in and out of the hotel.There's also a shuttle that will take you within a few files of the hotel until 11pm.The staff is extremely nice and welcoming.This is my first choice hotel when visiting the Nashville area.Nice enough place and friendly staff. The accommodations were absolutely perfect. Bed was big and comfy. Privacy was nice as well. However we were staying here for the rock n roll marathon and the staff was completely unaware of anything going on. They didn't know or have the shuttle running to the start line. Since they were listed on the marathon race site you would think they would have been prepared. We had to drive down there (2 miles) because they didn't know anything at the front desk. Breakfast times were out and ready until after we needed to be gone. Found this out later. It would have been nice if they were more prepared. Again I cannot complain about any of the accommodations as they were absolutely nice. Staff super friendly just uninformed about a major event in the city that any participants stayed at hotel. I'd stay here again if they have better race accommodations.Giving it two stars for the location.  In town for a concert behind hotel at Vanderbilt stadium.  Room was what you expect from Marriott.  The only issue was that the television did not work, but we were not in town to watch TV.  Let front desk know and they never responded to our issue.  My rating is like some of the other reviews.  Nightly rate of $359 for the room and $81 in local taxes.  $36.00 for valet parking.  Add in a couple of bar charges and my bill was close to $1100 for two nights.  This is the most I have spent for a Marriott outside of New York City at the Barclay Center Brooklyn Marriott.  I am a platinum member so I am familiar and used to the Marriott properties rates.  I know people can say you knew the rate going in, but with local tax and valet rate got high quickly.  I just feel that this hotel does not warrant these rates.This hotel has provided me with one of the best experiences of any hotel I have stay at in a long time. From the minute I walked in the door the staff has treated me with such kindness and respect, there are not enough words I can  say of how much gratitude I have for the staff here.  Everyone one was so extremely helpful and kind and always willing to help me no matter what and always with a smile. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone coming to Nashville!  It's the Bomb!!!We came here for the big convention and while our room was clean and comfortable, everything else was sub-par. We should've stayed at a Hampton (way better service). The convention had 70,000 people coming into town and the hotel only had one small shuttle that seats about 11-12. Half of the time the drivers either didn't answer their phones or turned them off entirely. The hotel gave the lame excuse of cell phone issues. Many people complained about this and nothing was done. Some of their guests missed the speeches because of the wait time.The breakfast buffet was absolutely a disaster and the hotel had the audacity to charge $25 for it. It was practically a basic continental breakfast. Nobody wanted to pay the outrageous price so everyone was trying to order from the kitchen. Our server informed us that it would take close to an hour to eat breakfast and we were pressed for time because of the convention.Bottom line...this hotel had years to prepare for what they knew would be a busy weekend and they were grossly inadequate, unprofessional and inconvenient. I would never return here again. It was a disaster to rely upon their services and judgement. The epitome of amateur hour.This vote was overpriced for the service I received . After staying here it is not a surprise it was the only hotel with available rooms on a holiday weekend. I was upcharged for everything from wifi to breakfast. The room was tiny. We were promised a king bed and pull out couch - but they were sold out - even though we made our reservation only an hour earlier ?  The entrance and valet are dangerous and confusing - we watched several people almost get hit by a valet driver. Save your money and go across the street to another hotel!This hotel has an IDEAL location, the shuttle was perfect, and we got a great deal on priceline.  The staff was SUPER friendly and helpful at all times.  This was my fourth trip to Nashville for pleasure, and second stay at this hotel.  I always choose this neighborhood for the location--close enough to the hubbub but in a fun, walkable neighborhood.  Again, the staff made us feel so welcome and attended to at all times--and you can't beat the Jenni's ice cream they have available for purchase in the sundries area; it was an addictive late night indulgence! From the Catbird Seat and Patterson House to Hog Heaven takeout at Springwater Supper Club, this neighborhood is a great place to hang out when you aren't in the mood for the Broadway scene.I stayed at this hotel for a week.  That was a long time for me.  Well I had a conference to attend and I just got back.  I was able to try some of their services.  The shuttle is convenient.  It is free just give them a tip if they drive you.  They can drive you within a 2 mile radius so basically downtown.  I only took the shuttle one time when I was by myself but the majority of times I took a taxi.  There were always cabs waiting outside of the hotel. Downtown is great to go to.  Lots of music and great food. My mom got to Nashville before I did so she was willing to wait for a nice room.  She did get a room with a view of the stadium.  There is always someone in the front or someone in the lobby that can help you.  If you have questions about where to eat then they will offer suggestions.  What I loved about this hotel is it's right across the street from the Parthenon replica.  I wanted to walk there more often but I couldn't wake up since I was on west coast time and we had the conference to attend in the morning.  THe evenings consisted of other site seeing opportunities that I had to take full advantage of.  Overall great experience in Nashville.  I hope to see Nashville again in the near future.I had a great experience here, although I can't speak to their parking situation ($30 for valet, I believe) or the quality of food at the restaurant, since I didn't eat there.I stayed here for 3 nights mid-April. The rooms were very spacious, clean, and comfortable, and one of our two double beds was brand new. Our room (628) offered a PERFECT view of the Vanderbilt football field so if you're in town for a game, you essentially could watch from the comfort of your room!The staff was super friendly, although I wish they would have mentioned the shuttle when we checked in (might have saved us some $ that first day). They offer a complimentary shuttle that goes anywhere in a 2-mile radius, so it's a quick and easy way to get downtown. All of the drivers were really nice, and of the 8-10 trips we took, there was only one time that was more than a 15-20min wait. (Most were around or much shorter than that.) The last run is at 11pm, so if you plan on making it a late night, you'll need to cab it back.Not sure if this is a thing they do often, but they had complimentary OJ & champagne in the lobby to make your own mimosas one night. That was a nice little surprise.There's a Starbucks in the lobby which has free wifi, but you need to pay for it in the rooms. (For some reason, I was able to pick up the signal on my phone in our room, but my cousin wasn't able to on her tablet.)There are a few shops right next to the hotel - Barnes & Noble, Bread Factory, a clothing boutique, and a PF Chang's, too - and lots of chain restaurants on that main drag of West End. Also a quick ride (or a leisurely 30min stroll) from Hillsboro Village, which has a few cute shops and restaurants.Next time I visit, I might stay somewhere a little closer to downtown for the sake of convenience, but if Vandy is your reason for visiting, this place is a great bet.Unimpressed, unimpressed, UN-impressed!   $300 a night and no complimentary breakfast??  $30 to park my car! Bed was uncomfortable, hotel is noisy and the room was mundane.   Go to the Hilton down the street, better service, better room, better price.Would have given this hotel more stars if the had not thrown a surprise parking fee at me. $21.89 for me to park MYSELF, not valet for ONE night. The person checking me in failed to inform me that I would be charged. I found out only when I saw it on my credit card statement. The hotel was otherwise nice and clean. No complimentary breakfast though. Crappy way to treat your customers in my opinion.We stayed here for 2 nights for a business trip with my company. I was very pleased with the location; about 15 minutes from the airport and 10 miles from downtown. They offer a free shuttle that takes you anywhere in Nashville within a 2 mile radius. That worked out great for us because we wanted to see and do alot! The shuttle service itself is worth 5 stars!The room was nice. It was simple but clean. Our window offered an amazing view of Centennial Park and the Parthenon. It was great to peak outside and watch families romp about. The bed was very comfortable and I slept like a baby! 5 stars!Service was outstanding! Everyone was professional and helpful. We did not encounter a single person who wasn't pleasant. 5 stars!However, there wasn't free wifi which just seems wrong in this day and age. They wanted 10USD per day which was ridiculous. 3 stars!Food- Meh. I've experienced better. We had our holiday party in the ballroom, which was, btw, gorgeous. But the food wasn't very good. We also had Sunday brunch here which was pretty expensive for the goods that they served. I was very dissappointed.All in All, Nashville Marriott at Vanderbilt University gets 4 stars! I would definitely recommend this hotel!This review is specifically for some of the staff who demonstrated excellent customer service. We had an especially great experience with Brody at the front desk, JD our shuttle driver, and Nick the bartender. They are all genuinely friendly and attentive. Thanks for the great service!Nice hotel. Very convenient to the University. Really nice that it is right next to a PF Chang's.  For the non-business traveler, there are hotels closer to the Nashville nightlife which are more interesting, more fun, have other guests who are tourists. If you are looking for a vacation hotel, this is definitely not your hotel.  For business it is definitely "OK".We have booked several groups here, some medium, some verging on large and the hotel staff has not been as accommodating as many other hotels where we do the same business traveler booking, including some less than a block away from this hotel. When our business group books here, I will stay here but in spite of my Marriott rewards, will not book business travel here when traveling by myself. Most other hotels I have stayed at in Nashville had some kind of nice little perk. This one has nothing but fee for this, fee for that, and higher room rates.I typically stay at a Marriott on business travel. This one is one of the lesser experiences in my travels. It is not bad by any stretch of the imagination, just that most other Marriott hotel experiences would encourage me to stay at a Marriott again while this one is a solid "meh..."I'm really biased when it comes to hotels - my preferred brand is Starwood.  When traveling for work, I don't really get a choice and I have a budget to keep.I stayed at the Marriott at Vanderbilt University to attend a work conference.  The room was spacious and clean, but nothing that would make me feel like I do when I stay at the W or St. Regis... (yeah, I know...I'll shut up...).The staff is VERY friendly!The rooms could use some updating as they are looking really worn and out of date.  Price was reasonable for the location and they have a full bar and a pretty decent steak salad.
review_content_20: My company recently made the decision to strike a deal with Marriott, so now I have to stay at Marriotts whether I want to or not. So I may be a bit biased because I'm a Hilton girl. I miss my free internet, free bottles of water and even free breakfast depending on the Hilton. This Marriott wasn't giving anything away. Self-parking was 22 bucks or valet for 24 bucks. Internet was 14 bucks. Really? That's a bit preposterous.Ok, so I arrive at the Marriott and find out my Marriott number has not been associated with my reservation. This is not necessarily their fault as it could have been our travel agency, but the young lady checking me in couldn't look it up, which seemed a bit strange. She said she'd do it later, which she did. Also, during check-in, I found out they had decided to downgrade my room to a Double. Lovely. I'm tall and I need a Queen or King, but they gave me a Double because they gave away all the Kings, even though I had reserved a King. So that's what my company's partnership with Marriott gets us? Downgrades at their hotels? Grr. In all my years of traveling, the only hotels that have ever downgraded me or bumped me have been Marriotts. In fact, I have routinely gotten upgrades when staying at other chains. While I was checking in, there was another woman at the front desk complaining that Marriott had bumped her and she had to return to the Marriott, anyway, because she had to pick up packages that were shipped to her there. I felt terrible for her because I know that Marriott threw a major kink in her plans by giving her reservation to someone else. So as if I weren't grumpy enough about the prospect of sleeping with my feet hanging off the end of the bed, the beds in the room were just awful. Hard and lumpy and bumpy. So after getting up at 5:00 a.m., I was still tossing and turning well past midnight because of the miserable bed.Otherwise the room was fine; standard hotel fare with nothing special. The facility was clean and overall seemed to be well-maintained, although there was some badly worn carpeting at the back entrance.Located in Nashville's West End, the hotel sits adjacent to Vanderbilt campus, across the street from Centennial Park. (I could see the Parthenon from the valet and Vanderbilt Stadium from my room!)All the staff were great. The front desk and valet folks exuded friendly customer service and were always ready to assist. This particular property also operates a complimentary shuttle that carries guests anywhere within a two mile radius. One of the operators, Michael, was extremely helpful, recommending plenty of local restaurants with an exceptionally friendly demeanor. Hats off to the valet team. The lobby and cafe were very well designed, clean and aesthetically appealing. The rooms were okay but not the best. You could tell they've had wear and tear but the hotel does what it can to maintain a positive guest experience. Most importantly, it was pretty quiet throughout my stay. (Although, I have to mention it was a Monday and I was travelling on business. I can't imagine what the place is like during Vandy football games!) There is complimentary wi-fi in the room, provided you're a Marriott Rewards member. Guests who are not Rewards members are charged for internet, which can easily be charged to the room.There are plenty of restaurant choices - both chains and local fare - near the hotel, so you're definitely not limited in any way. I didn't get a chance to see the workout room or the pool, but from what others have written, I wouldn't expect much. I did, however, see plenty of runners in the park and around campus. Overall, I'd definitely stay here again and would recommend it to friends. There are a couple of other choices right around there (Holiday Inn, Lowe's, and a couple of others) but the Marriott proves an excellent value.Stay was okay for the price we paid. Extras such as parking, breakfast etc were highly priced.Friendly staff but a little too chatty. Arrived at 10pm to one person behind the desk and a line of 8 ppl in front of meOne-day business meeting on the Vandy campus and we were booked at the Nashville Marriott. Flew in Monday evening this week, checked out Tuesday, and this Marriott gave me a great first impression of the city. I think hotels should really pay attention to that...the first time in any new city, most times one of the first thing you're doing is checking into a hotel, and they can really make or break the visit for you.First, I have to say...I'm from Chicago and immediately, I loved the Southern hospitality. We arrived in the rain, and from the moment the taxi pulled up, we were quickly and politely greeted, doors were opened, and bags were carried...I know this happens at most hotels, but it's just second nature here. Same with front desk check-in. We were personally walked to the elevator and they even pushed the buttons for us. He showed us the restaurant/bar on the lower level where we could get coffee and breakfast in the morning and/or dinner that evening. I could get used to this (well, not really, I'm a control freak, so this would make me edgy after a while).It's a very nice hotel in a great location. Comparable to most Marriott's I've stayed in...just the right amount of 'upscale' to it but not too fancy. We were right on the Vanderbilt campus and near Centennial park. It was raining that evening, but we toured the campus and area in the car and drove by the Parthenon...amazing, btw! It's within walking distance. There are tons of shops along the same street too.My room was spacious and clean. Furnishings were modern, nothing fancy. Extremely comfortable bed (no bed bugs...yes, I checked!), a flat-screen TV, ample closet and drawer space, huge bathroom, and the usual amenities (coffee maker, hairdryer, iron, etc.). I loved the Bath & Body works toiletries (aromatherapy line). But the best part of my room was that it overlooked Vanderbilt Stadium. Too bad there weren't any events going on that night. I did peek out the window several times throughout the night, though, hoping to catch a glimpse of something going on in there.I slept well. It was quiet and perfect since I was traveling on business. This was my first time in Nashville, and when I come back (when, because this city is great!), I would definitely stay here again, whether it's for business or pleasure. Next time, I might ask for a room with a view of the Parthenon. Great hotel, perfect location.I have to start with the good: Well its a gorgeous Marriott in a hip little part of Nashville. Most of the people there were really nice. Especially the Valet. One of the key parts of this location is it's shuttle service to downtown. My sister and I went on a girls trip for my 30th birthday. We picked Nashville because we felt safer with it just being us two. Check in was a little hectic. We found out they over booked and even though we bought it the day prior we may not have a room. There was several people beside us being told they didn't have rooms either. All because of the "tin can festival" (Or because you over booked.... nothing makes your husband feel safer than knowing you are hundreds of miles from home and homeless in Nashville.)So let's get to the shuttle driver who absolutely ruined our evening and I'm so glad to be alive to be able to write this. Your probably thinking we just were stuck with a bad driver. It actually has nothing to do with his driving. Our shuttle driver was an older guy (in his 60s-70s) and we first got in with another group of males. The group of guys were giving us suggestions about good places to go. When the guys went to get out of the car they tipped him a $5 and got out. The driver slammed the van in gear saying "cheap mother f****rs" and he was irate. Then he started talking to us how he overheard that we were from Southern Missouri. He started talking about some girl he dated from Hayti, MO named Charlene and how he could still taste her to this day. I don't want to go into to many details on here because it makes me puke in the back of my mouth. Well my sister who was a little taller than I could see him looking at me licking his lips on a few occasions and when I got out of the van he leaned back to look up my dress. We were so glad to get out of the car when we did that I had him drop us off at the first bar at the strip. We literally felt like one of those people that was going to be raped and murdered any second. We talked to management about this when we got back. They acted concerned. Took our statement but we never heard back. On Saturday night we used priceline and it gave us this hotel again. We talked to the valet and the valet guy said this guy has been reported before but management never does anything. Needless to say we took a cab the rest of our trip. Honestly, the hotel is beautiful. I could see me staying here over and over besides this experience.The worst hotel experience of my life! This might have been circumstantial but the Marriott main of should be ashamed of the service that I received.Long story short, I shut the door behind me with my key inside. Went to the front desk, and they told me it is not a problem. However, the manager that night had an inactivated master key and told me that he could put me up in another room, but they could not let me in to retrieve my stuff until the next morning until maintenance returned to work. After fighting them for the 3 hours they finally decided to call their "engineer". As soon as he showed up I was in my room in 4 seconds. Why wasn't he called to begin with? I will never know. I asked the front desk what would they do if a baby was locked in the room? Their answer: "probably" call the police...They should really have a master key that works, that could have been a serious situation luckily for them it wasn't.After my horrific experience I was then greeted by a dick of a valet the next morning. I gave him a modest tip of $5 dollars considering my experience, a 20 minute wait for the car, and the $26 dollars that I already was billed. The valet had the nerve to inform that there was an ATM inside if I needed more money for a tip. All in all I do have a tip to offer, do not stay at this Marriott and expect the customer service that comes with the Marriott name. If you pretend that this is a red roof inn you will it will exceed your expectations for the shitty service that you receive. Finally, I called the Marriott main office and they said they could not do anything to compensate me for my terrible, experience because this particular Marriott is a franchise.The good -Great location in Nashville's West End. Literally right up against the Vanderbilt University stadium...I wonder what a room goes for on game weekends? I could see 3/4's of the field from the window in my room.Valet area is hectic but pretty efficient. And they always say hello and open the door for you.Staff in various parts of the hotel were very friendly and several times I was asked how my stay was going, did I need anything, etc. Nice touch.The bad - Seems to be a very busy hotel, lots of guests and lots of them seem to be in the mood to party and have fun. I get it....it's Nash Vegas and all, but I got a little tired of all of the noise in the hallway on my floor. I didn't complain to management, but did mention it to them when they asked how my stay had been so far. They said "sorry" but didn't offer to do anything about it. I was staying there for a business trip and needed to get a good night's sleep (I was there 4 nights) so I'd recommend this hotel as a place to stay if you are visiting Nashville for fun, but maybe not for a business trip.The pool is indoors. Fitness room is very small for a hotel of this size.Overall, it's on the "nice" end of the Marriott scale and the location is very convenient. You can walk to many shops & restaurants in the West End and Broadway is a short cab ride away.Would be 5 stars but they charge $30 for valet parking. Everything else about the hotel is great!One of the best Marriotts I have visited. Friendly staff, great food, and clean comfortable room. Great location as well. JChill little spot in Marriott.I had the pleasure of coming into Nashville for about 24 hours, and this is where my company put me up during my brief visit.The Superb: Very helpful staff. The rooms were large and clean with some incredibly comfortable beds. Surprisingly good food available from the bar/room service. Free shuttle to downtown!!The Norm: Rather expensive drinks at the bar (even more than normal for a hotel bar). The Horrid: You have to pay for internet?!?! WTF!?!I still can't get too excited about Marriott's in general, but this place was not that bad.Great staff that is very friendly and helpful. I stay here about every three months. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the rates are decent. Vanderbilt is a beautiful campus and there is a nice big park right across the street. There are good bar and food options up and down the road (West End) and you are only about 10 minutes from downtown via taxi.We wanted a hotel "in" the action, and apparently this is as close as Nashville gets. It's a fine hotel, pretty basic, and all of the staff members we encountered were quite friendly. They've got a little convenience store downstairs in case you forget anything and a fantastic shuttle that'll take you downtown or anywhere you need to go within a couple of miles. The driver was super friendly and I'd definitely recommend taking advantage of it, as the parking situation is not good.The garage is attached to the hotel, but you've got to walk outside to get between. And most of the spots in the lot are reserved for the sleep disorder clinic that happens to be located on the 5th floor of the hotel. Yes, sleep disorders. And yes, we were on the 6th floor and had a bed jumping competition. You can't tease kids at heart with that kind of thing.So, back to the parking garage. It's got a long weird creepy hallway, and good luck if you want to park there when there's a game at the stadium next door, as it looks like pretty much all of the spots are a no-go for the hotel at that point. And at $20/day, well, it's not cheap. They also charge for wireless: $10/day. And you can't have more than one device use it for your room, which is kind of silly. Definitely Priceline this spot: at full price this would be a 2-star.If you are looking to stay close to Downtown but not right in the noise .. stay here .... you are only about 5 minutes away from the Downtown area and right in front of the college campus at Vanderbuilt. It is real close and within walking distance to food and entertainment.STAFF: The staff was so friendly; the valet staff, the front desk staff, the bartenders etc ....ROOMS: The rooms were clean and layed out great, especially if you are sharing a room as I did. The two bed room was roomy and the bathroom was not up in your business. There was enough room to move, lay your bags out, iron your clothes, and still have a walk way. VIEW: I don't know what everyone elses view was but I had a view of The Parthenon!!!!! It was amazing! I got to take a peek at the beautifully lit Parthenon every night before bed!PRICE: The price I paid was on a Friends and Family rate so it was definitely reasonable. I am not sure what the going rate is with no discount, but it would really be worth it. Overall, a great hotel. Clean and friendly staff .. what more do you want.Stayed one night here on a road trip from Dallas to North Carolina. Good rooms, great service and extremely fast (and good!) in-room dining.One of the only Marriotts I've stayed at that got every single personal request right, down to the exact view of the Parthenon that I'd requested. It couldn't have been any better..."It's a hotel room." My husband and I said. Then the surprise came when we opened the curtains to see a full on view of the Vanderbilt football stadium. Super cool. I was surprised when we pulled up that the valet service didn't budge. Being the only car under the port and they just watched me get the heavy bag out of the trunk. Ordered a venti latte at the Starbuck's within and got half foam and only a third of coffee. It's also hop, skip and a jump to anywhere in Nashville from here but plan for the traffic. They are eager to clean the rooms! Service staff came back twice within an hour early. But it was clean and the front desk staff were quick to service. I still say Marriott has the most comfortable beds.This place is really overpriced. Be wary if you book using Priceline or Hotels.com, etc. You get no extras (like the comp breakfast, etc. despite these being listed in the guest book in your room) and you will pay a hefty $21 daily for parking. The staff is hit and miss. While one front desk woman was very helpful and courteous, another front desk man was brusk. Because some people pay more, there are different levels of service and amenities, which left us feeling like steerage class on the Titanic. The parking was a minor mess with three different employees telling us three different things. The parking garage, which is the only available parking in the area, does not accept the card the desk presents to you as a guest, so you have to explain to the attendant what's going on each time you leave. We actually had to argue with an attendant that we were hotel guests and already paying $21 a day. When we presented her with the plastic card the front desk had given us, she said we were wrong and we had to pay. It wasn't until we shut off the car and blocked the exit that she called the hotel. Then, with no apology, she let us through. No apology ever came from the desk either. The room is nice, but I would not stay here again. There are other places that are nicer. It really paled compared to the Regency Legacy in Lexington where we stayed the day before arriving in Nashville. Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere.This isn't a bad hotel, and I paid $75/night for it (priceline.com) normally the hotel went for 159/night. My issues are whenever you go to a "higher scale" hotel you get "up charged" on EVERYTHING! They charge 9.99/day for internet & 14.99/person for a cheap breakfast. Other hotels in the area (such as Drury Inn) give you free wifi - free breakfast - AND a free happy hour. The Drury Inn is normally 85/night (not sure what you could get on priceline (maybe $50???)) but that is a far cry better than the Marriott. Not to forget mandatory valet parking at $22.00/day (free at Drury Inn).So for internet (9.99) + breakfast (14.99) + parking (22.00) equals an additional $46.98/day - something to strongly consider before booking here. While I only got this hotel for $75/night, I would have felt RIPPED OFF if I had paid the $159.00/night!! Don't do it, save yourself and your company a lot of money!Pros: People are really nice -- all around. Great workout room (scale is broke - we called and complained twice about it - with no response given to our complaints).The cherry on top of my Nashville trip! We had Christmas dinner at this hotel bistro and I had the best service I've had in a very long time as well as some of the best food. Despite being under staffed they made up for it in a number of ways like grabbing me a sweet vandy t shirt for finishing my huge steak and topping off our wines!!! A special shout out for Jordan for being extra hospitable! From now on ill be coming to THIS hotel for my Nashville stays! Blown away by such excellent service, more places should certainly take example.
review_content_40: This is a beautiful hotel in an area where there aren't a lot of great hotels to choose from.  Right on a main drag in Nashville, next to Vanderbilt and not far from Belmont University.  To a person, the staff was friendly and helpful, including the valets.  Which brings me to the downside of staying at this place.  Parking.  Because of the shortage of spots in the lot (which the hotel shares with a successful restaurant), the valet service is the main alternative.  Ultimately, we discovered we could self-park in the nearby garage, but that was more expensive than using the valet.  A little inconvenient if you need easy access to your car.I was surprised at how seriously overprices this hotel is given its close proximity to Vandy and that the rooms are actually going to set you back only 20% less than the Hutton or Loews which are FAR better.  They have some cute 'boutique' touches with upscale hall furniture, but the rooms and amenities are not impressive.  You'll be nickel and dimed for wifi, pushed out of your room by a very loud housekeeping staff.  Room air conditioning units are painfully/disruptively loud, the concierge service is pretty much phoning it in and rooms don't have basic upscale items like a sewing kit, bathrobe, make up mirror.  On the plus side, they have a small store in the lobby and an upscale bar.  Food is standard and overpriced, so I would walk the couple blocks to Stony River or across the street to PF Changs.  The best thing about this place is the location.  Parking is pricey - $25/day but you can negotiate somewhat.  There is nothing spa like about this location.  Pillows are uncomfortable and beds are nothing to rave about.  All in all, a disappointing experience.  If you're spending the money, go to the Hutton.  Food is better, service is awesome and beds are heaven.We stay at this Marriott several times a year while in Nashville.  The staff is very helpful and knowledgeable about the area.  The rooms are always clean and comfortable.  The bar area is perfect for socializing and we love the weekend breakfast buffet - especially the great prices if you're a Marriott Rewards member.A nearby hotel overbooked and gave away my prepaid room which kind of ruined my day but I ended up at the Marriott Vanderbilt and I'm so happy I did. The Marriott Vanderbilt offers service that rivals The Four Seasons Hotels which are really the gold standard in hospitality service. Every member of the staff at the Marriott Vanderbilt goes above and beyond to make your stay enjoyable. When I checked in the desk staff really improved my day. I had an opportunity to eat at both restaurants here and the food was top notch as well as a good value. It seems like even the big brand hotels are struggling to provide mediocre service while the staff here are delivering exceptional service every day. I was happily surprised by this hotel and I suspect you will be too.I continue to be disappointed in the Marriott properties, except for Courtyard.  This hotel is overpriced and charges $10 per day for internet.  My room was a little banged up and dusty.  Room service is ridiculous and the portions are enough for 4 people including $9 for a bowl of oatmeal.  So much WASTE.   The best part about this hotel were the valet and bartenders.  The location is good, but I think we'll be staying somewhere else when we visit Nashville again.Great hotel.  Love the location, close to everything in Nashville.  Staff was great!  Love the beds.Was here for a conference and dinner. Everything was very nice, but it's "old money" nice. Meaning: if your wasteful, you must be rich. All guests were given the same 3 course meal. HUGE sized, very rare, medium quality steaks. But no option to take home any left overs. Easily thousands of pounds of beef was wasted in one evening. I guess it means your rich and important when homeless people are literally across the street and you can put a whole steak in the trash. Don't even get me started about the dessert. 10 cheese cakes per table. About 7 untouched per table, all in the trash. Seriously! The facilities are amazing, but I won't be back until they straighten up their wasteful act.This Marriott is great! The people are all very helpful and accomodating. I had to get a package shipped here during my stay, and they made sure it got to me safely. We stayed during the CMA Music Festival, and it was pretty crowded but we were able to get the shuttle almost anytime we wanted it. The shuttle drivers were all so helpful and kind. I will definately be back!I'm a frequent business traveler and this is a WONDERFUL hotel.  The staff are great.  It doesn't take too many regular stays before they learn your name and try to make you feel like home.  Its a great location for business travelers since I can stay here and always be going the opposite way of traffic.  It is close to great restraunts and they also have a convenient shuttle.I told myself I would write a review of this place when I got home. This review is for their customer service. I went there thinking it was the Courtyard and they were not very nice to me. They were actually pretty snooty about it. So I left. Thanks.

review_content: Stay at this hotel!! Staff is awesome.Rooms are very very clean. Breakfast is ok..you can tell hotel staff  takes pride in their jobs and place of business.There is a shuttle and they try their best but some times you will have a 15 - 20 minute wait.Let's talk about SERVICE. A week prior to our arrival in Nashville, I called to inquire about leaving an ice cream cake in a freezer prior to check-in.  Chris at the front desk couldn't have been more helpful. Fast-forward a week and I had the chance to meet Chris in person when we checked in. He was equally nice in person and remembered the conversation though we didn't even use the freezer after all. Then we met Jessica, who wouldn't stop until she found me some hand lotion to soothe my aching hands from the nasty Nashville weather. And Nekaya, who offered to print our Ryman concert tickets from her personal email since the hotel computer wasn't playing nice with Adobe. OH! And, the desk staff who lent us their personal umbrellas since the rain just wouldn't quit?! Throw in awesome shuttle drivers who were ready and willing to take us within a 3-mile radius and you basically have a perfect stay. Did I mention the Belgian waffle maker at the complimentary continental breakfast? The waffles are shaped like Texas, but I didn't care. They were DELICIOUS.  AND the pool-size jacuzzi?!? It's a POOL-SIZE HOT TUB! My only thought might be that the walls are a tad on the thin side. Not a huge deal since most of the clientele are quieter business travelers, but I do wish housekeeping could've kept their conversations a little lower in the mornings.  I hate to even say that, but it's the only negative in an otherwise exceptionally positive experience.Thank you Home 2!I am so impressed by this place. Let me start with the staff. The staff is helpful and accomodating. They are always happy to see you! Jessica checked me in and remembered my name after I haven't seen her in 6 days. Thats impressive! The other staff will ask you how your day is going, and they always have a smile on their face. The room-a nice home away from home. It has all of the essentials you may need for your extended stay. The gym-the best gym I've seen in a hotel. You can do your laundry while you are working out, which is really cool. The workout room has an elliptical, two treadmills, a bike, a yoga ball, multiple weight medicine balls, dumb bells, a mat, and a multiple-workout machine. You can get a decent workout in this place...which is definitely different from most hotels/suites. The food-breakfast was great every morning! They have good coffee (that is hard to come by) and a semi-hot breakfast. It's a really cool idea really. So they have a bin with refrigerated, packaged omelettes, breakfast sandwiches, and scrambled eggs with mixed meats and/or veggies. They have a number on the top. They make it fail-proof because all you have to do is stick it in the microwave and press the number thats on the top of the wrapper. Then voila...you've got a delicious breakfast. They also have several selections of yogurt (including greek and regular), milk and cereal, hot oatmeal, and typical continental bagels, waffles, and OJ/juices. On the weekends, they even do biscuits and gravy. I stayed at this place for 8 days and will be staying here in the future year due to school requirements. I'm looking forward to it. These people treat you like family and the place just has a good vibe about it...plus it's within walking distance to several top-notch restaurants and Vanderbilt hospital and university. I couldn't ask for more!!I was very impressed with this Home 2 Suites. This is the best hotel I've been to in a long time and the funny thing is, it cost less than all the hotels I've been too recently and was the best looking. It has a very contemporary and modernized design and decor. I loved my room and the lobby area was nice also. For breakfast, they had prepackaged omelets. I was a little weary of them but they were actually really good! Only thing is, they did not list that they had pork in them and the pieces were so small that I did not realize it until i was down to the last bite, since I was working and eating at the same time (so I wasn't paying attention).The hotel offers free WiFi...YES!!! And set directly across the street from the building I was training in. Was only a 1 minute walk, super convenient!
