My only complaint is that I wish they had a bellboy because I was stuggling with my luggage! Had to make 2 trips to the car.I'm so glad the Marriott I was supposed to stay at was booked. I would definitely stay here again.Wow, I could not have been happier with my stay at this hotel. By far the accommodating group of professionals I have ever had the pleasure of meeting in a hotel. As soon as we arrived Betty greeted us with a smile and was very helpful changing our arrangements due to the snow storm arriving the following day. During our 5 day stay we got to know the whole crew Mary, Nekeya, Chris, Darryl, Janina and Denita. Even with power outages and 8 inches of snow this group was as nice and friendly as they could possibly be. It didn't matter if we needed cabs, shuttles, bar recomondations, tums or waffles this fantastic group made it happen. This is the only hotel I will ever stay in upon my return to Nashville. You guys rock!!!!The shining star of this hotel is the staff.  Every single person I came across, from the desk clerk to maintenance were fantastic.  Whether they were or not, each person seemed genuinely happy you were staying there and always greet you.  The cost for this location is very reasonable and the rooms are a great size.  It's within walking distance to several restaurant and the hotel has a shuttle with a 3 mile radius. I would stay here again.Very convenient hotel location if you are in downtown. Walking distance to a lot of restaurants. Has a hotel shuttle within 3 miles radius. They have free wifi which is awesome. The front desk staff is very accommodating and friendly. Would definitely stay here again if ever I go back and visit Nashville.What a fantastic little hotel! Aside from being a new Hilton property, the staff really make this place a great hotel to stay in. They are more than happy to go above and beyond - holding/receiving packages for free, loaning out yoga mats from their gym so you can head to a free yoga class, and always keeping a plentiful supply of green apples and Nutella at the front desk for you to snag throughout the day. The rooms were a bit not quite to my liking - the walls were a strange off white/yellow color, something you could find in an older hotel. The furniture and accessories feel a bit retro, but I don't know if that's all part of the design or if it was just me. If you are planning to park at the hotel, I would strongly suggest looking for street parking across from the hotel - otherwise you'll be hit with a $20/night (plus tax) charge at the end of your stay. That's a hefty bill for self parking. Do take advantage of the hotel courtesy shuttle - they'll drop you off and pick you up from downtown, Vanderbilt, wherever you need to go within reason. Be sure to tip your driver.ATTN: they charge you TWICE and THEN take the additional charge off a couple of days later. So if your room was $339.00 for the one night, they charge you $678.00 but they said they would take it off a couple of days later so you only pay the $339.00. They said the first charge is for the reservation and then afterward is the actual charge for the room. They shouldn't be doing this bc people need their money!! Some people can't afford to wait 3 business days to get that $339.00 back. Ridiculous. Other than that it's a fantastic place to stay. It's very expensive but nice.I was going to give 3 stars but they ended up rewarding me with Hilton points and "making it right" despite my frustrations so that made it better for me. However my shower was lukewarm at best every morning, and don't expect nice amenities in the room as this is very bare bones accommodations. Also the breakfast only lasts from 6-9am but I will say the offerings they had were pretty good (Greek yogurt,etc) the shuttle was dirty and smelled weird but I guess I can't complain because it was free right? Also if you need to fedex something be advised that they will send it out for you but unlike originally told they do not have the ability to help you pack your box. Overall this is by far my least favorite of the Hilton brands for me. I would much rather stay at a Hampton over a home2 in the future.I give this hotel 5 stars for their honesty.  I left a box of jewelry in the bathroom on the vanity that included my wedding ring, wedding bands,  two Silpada necklaces, and a pair of earrings.  I did not discover that I had left my jewelry for a period of 48 hours.  When I called to see if anyone had found my jewelry the manager of housekeeping said nothing was turned in, I panicked.  The next morning, the assistant manager of housekeeping, Wesley, called me to tell me he had ALL of my jewelry, thank you to Melissa who turned it in.  About the hotel,  like their healthy breakfast and unlimited apples & Nuttela they provide  throughout the day.  The staff at check in is always super friendly.  They also have a complimentary shuttle that will take you downtown at night. The driver is also super friendly, Ryan.  We like the fact we can bring our dogs and they get a warm welcome!!!We checked in late due to our travel south being late.  The friendly staff was ready for us,including our four legged family.  Clean spacious room.  Taste breakfast with a new twist.  Easy check out.  Would stay again.I absolutely LOVE this hotel. The rooms feel like IKEA showroom apartments and there are a ton of features on property that are unique. - Rooms: perfectly laid out so they are cozy but include tons of counter space, a fridge, dishwasher, disposal, coffee maker, microwave, nice TV, plenty of outlets, shampoo and body wash dispensers in the bathroom, a sofabed, dishes, silverware...- Pool: it's actually a jetted, warmed indoor hot tub. - Included breakfast: oatmeal, breakfast sandwiches (premade that you heat up - but good) cereal, fruits, toast, muffins/bagels, waffles, juice/coffee/tea. There is a main community style table that sets a cheery tone and encourages interaction with other guests. - Gameroom: Xbox and board games. - Laundry: like a laundromat. - Fitness Center: Small but clean.- Grills you can use on the patio outside. - Free shuttle within 3 miles of the hotel. There's likely more I'm missing but these are the amenities we used. Another nice thing is that there is a to. To do in walking distance. As well as try the famous Hattie Bs Hot Chicken!  I would live here if I could :)Awesome stay!!!! My girl friend and i wanted to get away for two days so we decided to stay at this hotel and explore nashville. The staff were awesome and very nice, def will be back!Truly loved this hotel. Loved the room and even thou they didn't find us a room for the second night will stay there whenever we visit our family. Didn't give them 5 stars because the room door didn't clise and when we went out was left open (we thought someone came in) but ut was just the lock. Also tgere is no guest parking, you have to pay but the hotel is not downtown so that shouldnt be the case.Other than that loved itI cannot believe this hotel is highly rated. As a frequent traveler- visiting a hotel with high reviews - that is what I expected. Awful! Never again would I stay here or stay at another Home2suites - not a good acquisition Hilton! Gross clientele. It's obvious many staying here are living here (think extended stay rentals!) Do not like the European vibe/feel. Think IKEA in a hotel! The carpet is so dirty I cannot walk on it barefoot at all without my feet turning black. Bed was comfy. That's all the positive I can say. Do not stay here!Obsessed. That's all I can say. I LOVE this hotel and not even for major reasons. Let's start with how NICE the front desk staff is. Even with a line behind me they were taking the time to get to know you a little bit. Other hotels I have felt rushed or that I'm just another person paying. They allow pets which is awesome! I believe it's $60 a night but they knocked it down to $20 for us. (We had a small cat and a puppy)The room was super nice! Very simple but new, spacious and very clean. The shower has massive shampoo and soap dispensers. Very environmentally friendly - two flushing options on toilets, power saving light switches along with a master switch to make sure no lights are left on, recycling everywhere. The hotel is home to suites and they really did a great job of making it feel a little more like a home verse a hotel room. Breakfast is provided and they only really have one massive table and a few smaller. I loved this because everyone was sitting together and conversing about why they were in town. The beds. Ohhhhhh, the beds. Amazing! So comfortable - it feels like they use an updated, foam top bed. Their sheets are so soft and amazing that they actually sell them! The front desk said so many people were requesting where they got them that they starting providing a way to purchase them for your own home! This hotel is in a great location right in the middle of midtown. Parking at the hotel is an extra 20 a night. Overall - fantastic experience! Not only will I stay here again if I'm ever in Nashville but I'll look for H2S hotels during other vacations!Very clean hotel with excellent service and staff. Love to see the Hilton brand expanding. This is a very wise venture, and I look forward to seeing more of these. Very convenient to downtown/Broadway...easy shuttle service until midnight on the weekends...or a $10 cab ride. Excellent hotel!!Paying for parking in addition to the room was irritating. We stopped here to spend the night in Nashville on our way aback from visiting family over the holidays. (2000 mile trip round trip) we did not have a do "not disturb"sign in our room to their defense, but after making such a long drive, all we wanted was to sleep in. The knocking from housecleaning began at around 9am. We were woken up a total of 6 times. Check out was at noon, the seventh knock came at five til 12 (after I had called the front desk to explain the situation.) Now we are driving back to Dallas irritated and tired. I don't think we'll be staying here next time we are passing through.Stayed her on a business trip and was very impressed with my stay.  Staff is super friendly (actually the nicest staff I have ever met).  This place has everything you want, microwave, dishes, cups, dishwasher, fridge, big tv, and internet.  Location is great as well, next to Music Row, and about a 10min walk to Vanderbilt.  And a 20 min walk to downtown.They also provide a free shuttle within 3 miles.They do provide a small breakfast with fruit, hard boiled eggs, and waflles.  (if you want go next door to the Hilton Garden Inn for a $12 breakfast buffet).Oh, and they do have a small (but nice) gym and self service laundry area.I didn't check out the pool, but I heard it was nice.
review_content_20: This was my first stay at the Home2 line by Hilton.  As I've stated before, I'm a Hilton girl all the way - the consistant quality of customer service, soft towels and sheets, modern decor never lets me down.  The staff at the Nashville Home2 was excellent - going above and beyond to provide us with tips and info on where to go on our short stop over.  I had asked the valet attendent a question and when I came back out, he had gotten a map and highlighted a suggested route with additional information of things to see in that same area.  The kitchen area in the room, although I did not need it on this trip, was fully stocked and would make for a great room for longer stays.We will be staying here the next time we are in Nashville.This place was wonderful.  We were very nervous because this was our first time in Nashville, but everything worked out wonderfully!Airport:There is no shuttle from the airport to the hotel.  However, it was extremely easy (practically in-your-face easy) to find the taxi stand after baggage claim.  The taxi driver knew exactly where our hotel was, and it was a flat rate from the hotel of $27, and about a 10 minute drive.Check-In:The customer service was unbelievable.  The desk clerk let us check in when we got there (and gave us the room keys - we were EXTREMELY early) and gave us very good tips on the city.  There is a great free breakfast every morning too!Hotel:Perfect.  In your room you get a small kitchen, which we used to eat-in one night, then a mini living room, and finally your bed!  The bed is a little small if you are used to a king, but it was very comfortable.  Free wifi is nice, and the restaurant in the hotel next door delivers.  You are also just steps away from the Gulch, which from what I understand is one of their names for a neighborhood.  There are a lot of nice restaurants to try out!Downtown:There is a free, yes, free, shuttle that runs from the hotel to anywhere downtown!  You just call the guy and he picks you up in minutes!  The guys who drove the shuttle were so nice and the shuttle was always clean.  For our first trip down there, the driver even gave us a tour!We could not have ask for a better hotel. I highly recommend staying here!  It was the best price with the best location. The room we very nice, clean, with anything thing you could need. The employees were very nice and helpful.Fantastic option.  NICE 1 bedroom apartment-type accommodations.  Very modern, very IKEA.  The kids loved it.  Local restaurants will deliver to the room.  You do have to pay for parking, but they'll do a free shuttle around the area.  VERY clean.  There was a mix up with the room when we got here, but they took care of it right away.  We will definitely stay here again.  VERY reaonable prices.You can bring your pets!  Even have a dog exercise area.  $75 for the entire stay.Good value, clean, studio apartment type rooms. Staff is SUPER friendly and courteous!My wife and I stayed here twice on a road trip through the south. Two nights when we arrived in Nashville and one night when we got back to Nashville 2 weeks later. They remembered us and even gave us the discounted rate I booked 2 weeks earlier.The place seems new and everything is clean and in good shape. The rooms we reserved had plenty of space, a kitchenette, a couch and the linens were actually softer and more comfortable than the ones I have at home. They have a gym and a pool. Wifi is free. Breakfast is included and they have a pretty good spread with fresh fruit, granola, breads, bagels (they have a toaster), waffles, yogurts, cereals, oatmeal, juices, etc. They allow dogs which is nice for people traveling with the whole family (dog included). I couldn't smell or hear any dog at any time.It's directly accross the street from The Cat Bird Seat and The Patterson House, two really cool places spots for people who care about quality food and drink.It was a comfortable stay and I'd go back if I'm back in Nashville again. I'm only giving 4 stars because they actually wanted to charge $20 a night for parking in their garage (a large garage). They weren't pushy about it or anything, receptionist even told me where to find street parking, but $20 a night is still ridiculous for paying guests.What a great place with friendly staff, comfortable beds, clean rooms and free breakfast. It's conveniently located to downtown Nashville and perfect for a weeks long, or overnight stay. Enjoy!Modern style motif with fun nashville flair. We got the handicap accessible room which doesn't have the pull out couch, but they offered cots.  Free continental breakfast, free wifi, free shuttle within 3 miles of the hotel. Clean, good price, easy check in, superb service, loved this place!Very good value! This is one of the cheaper options in Nashville, but yet is a great place to stay. The room was very clean, and the staff was really helpful and friendly. One complaint was when we got the rate for the room it did not say anything about parking (which was $20 a day), and there were LOADS of random taxes put on our bill which made the room about $50 more per night than we expected. I understand that parking in the city is always an issue, I just wish they would tell you upfront or include the parking in the rate of the hotel. Also, the continental breakfast is cool but EXTREMELY busy. We stayed on a weekend, and went downstairs for breakfast around 9am and there were so many people we were unable to find a seat, much less any food. After waiting for about 10-15 minutes for some clean plates and fresh food, we finally gave up on breakfast and headed back to our room. So my only real suggestion is take the "free" breakfast in stride. But overall the experience was good, and the quality was good for what we paid.The staff is wonderful & the hotel is very clean and well managed! We had an amazing stay here!Property only has one suiteI gave them another star simply because the manager called me after my last stay and that goes a LONG way with me. I didn't ask for a call, but they called based on some feedback. WAY TO GO!I much prefer a full service hotel to this "express version" without a restaurant.   but they do have full service prices:  $3 for a bottle of Dasani water - and make sure you ask how much parking will cost you!  Expensive!   I call it a "big room", not a suite.   The cousin, Embassy, is a suite - Home2 is not.   A big shower curtain separating the little bed from the little couch doesn't make it a suite.And the pillows on the bed are like little kid pillows.   Very disappointing.  I guess the small pillows are supposed to make the bed look bigger.  The decorating is like a dorm room with bad Ikea imitation furnishing.  Another shower curtain over "the closet".   Ugly cheap blind with no curtain.  The plus side:  very friendly staff; wifi is include (as it should be); nice TV but doesn't line up well with the bed; This is my first impression,  I'll update with my post check-out review.Very comfortable, clean, friendly staff, easily accessible location. If you are staying in Nashville and want to avoid constantly eating out, this home style option is a great alternative. I especially liked the separate living, sleeping areas...very enjoyable and relaxed stay.We highly recommend the Home2Suites on Division st. In Nashville, TN. We stayed there almost three weeks and it felt just like a second home. The staff is very kind and helpful. They took good care of us. This particular hotel is comfortable, clean, and convenient. If you are heading to Nashville- you will want to stay here!!!I was unfamiliar with the Home 2 Suites line of Hiltons but stayed here recently. I'm really glad I did. I was traveling for work and was by myself but I think this would be a really good option for families. There was a full kitchen, a sitting area and a bed that you could close off with a curtain. All of the rooms have iHomes and other nice options that make it really comfortable. There's a free continental breakfast with healthy options - cereal, yogurt, etc. The staff was outstanding - they were all helpful, knowledgeable and extremely pleasant.New, modern, clean, and friendly.

review_content: Stayed one night and I was super satisfied with the professionalism of the staff and the layout of our room. My wife and I will return.Cost: $116.00 single bed room.Room: Looks like it has been updated, I enjoyed the large bathroom on the second floor and knowing it's for handicapped guest.  Their bed was super comfortable!Free wifi!!!!!!!!! Super Plus...Enjoyed the bar and free breakfast!Whoever took the promo-pictures for this hotel deserves an award for special effects! This hotel is in a terrible neighborhood up against an elevated interstate an active train track and an industrial tow lot. Everything -- even the trash cans -- have been smashed/scratched/dented. The paper products are thinner than tissue. The floor in the room is filthy, and neither the sink or tub will drain. TV is fuzzy for no apparent reason. Bathroom smelled as if someone had just used it and the toilet would have been running all night had I not fixed it myself. I could go on-and-on... This may as well have been a $39/night roadside motel in a bad neighborhood. Pay the extra cash and go somewhere else. You'll be glad you did.UPDATE: Because I had such a bad experience I thought it best to contact Clarion directly. Instead of opening a dialogue with me about my stay I received a response from the manager who called my honest review an 'attack' on him and his staff. I guess now I know why this place is in such a sad state.Industrial Ghetto. Lipstick on a pig assessment by another user was Accurate. Old building. It smells. Like paint over mold maybe? Carpet glue? Has no bell service. Space feels crammed. Bad neighborhood. Traffic freeway noise. It IS Not downtown as Priceline says. Parking is poor. Security is high. Why? Again: Industrial Ghetto.We came late and had a late checkout. The front desk was friendly and helpful. The bed is very comfortable. The breakfast is ok, nothing special , although the blueberry waffle is delicious. The location is great, close to downtown , probably a good walking.Great decor in lobby and room. Clean room and well stocked with towels. Customer service outstanding and helpful. Favorite part was breakfast! Swimming pool heated and clean. Would definitely stay again!!!Stayed at the Clarion for 5 nights.  Overall excellent experience.   Very close to Titan Stadium and they have a shuttle that runs every 30 minutes to Downtown.   Drops you off literally on Broadway.  On more than one day, the shuttle drivers, Victor and his brother Raul even dropped us off closer to the actual place we were going!  They were great!!!!!  Make sure to tip these guys.  Coming home we usually took an Uber and it was about $4.50.  The hotel was very clean both inside and out.   Looks like the rooms have been updated within the last few years.   Bed was very comfortable but the boyfriend hated the small pillows.   The bathroom looked updated as well however, it looks like a few shortcuts were taken in that remodel.   Shower faucet looked like it was coming apart from the wall and there was actually a gap in he ceiling.  Water pressure wasn't the greatest either!The Clarion did have a morning breakfast buffet.  Don't expect anything too fabulous here but hey, it's ok and it's free!   Make your own waffles, oatmeal, scrambled eggs, sausage, biscuits and gravy (imagine that down South), and some diced potatoes.  They so had bagels, cereal, toast, yogurts, fruit and muffins as well as juice and coffee.  There was no problem parking and they even have a security guard after 10 PM.    We had no problem leaving the Harley there. The lobby was nicely decorated and a small bar with a grill with your basic burgers, quesadillas, sandwiches, etc with everything under $10 was also a bonus.   Free wifi and a free safe in the room.   Also had a fridge and microwave.   Big bonus for me were the amount of electrical plugs in the room including on each side of the bed.  Typically, I have a hard time finding enough to plug in all of our items. Only about 4 hangers in the closet so bring your own if you need more.  The gym was also very clean.   2 TVs, an elliptical, a couple of treadmills, a bike, weights, and a universal weight machine.  Towels and cold water were also in the room.   I loved that there were wipes in the fitness room as well for wiping down the equipment after use.  It does get very hot in there though and they really should a couple fans in there.  Staff were all very friendly.   If you don't mind being off the strip and saving money, this is the place!!This was a filthy hotel that had bugs. Our rooms had dirty socks and other people's nasty belongings on the floors. The walls were filthy and we did not have a wall mirror in our room. The breakfast is one of the worst things I have ever tasted. Do not stay at this hotel.This hotel has is old but definitely been renovated for the better! It was clean, modern, colorful, and inviting! The staff was wonderful, helpful, and fun.  I had a great experience with this hotel!I thought I'd seen it all when it came to dirty hotels, but this was a new level. Booked it at $172/night, I would've paid the extra $30 per night to escape the absolutely FILTHY bathrooms -human blood on the shower curtain?!?!!!- bathroom sink handle that was loose, the toilet that shifted on the floor every single time it was used (& I'm a fit running mama!), the bathroom door wouldn't even close -terrible! The TV pic was super grainy and the bathroom had peeling wall paper, etc. I pulled out my travel Clorox wipes at 1st sight and proceeded to go over things since I couldn't cancel my reservation -the tub faucet, sink handles, light switches, & countertops. They came back brown and grimy after a quick once over -enough for me to lose my appetite and regret not bringing a change of linens. The was always a 5-7 minute wait to get a hold of the front desk too b/c they only staffed it with 1 person most of the time -who was busy eating their lunch behind the counter: super professional for a $200/night hotel charge after taxes and fees. All in all, a regrettable stay.Clean, Nice, Affordable, Comfortable beds... Not much this place doesn't do, would come back.Great location, clean, friendly, and awesome free breakfast. Free amenities just incase you forgot something as well.  The hotel has a free shuttle that only takes 2 minutes to Broadway which is a great bonus. The staff were all super helpful and friendly. Tony at breakfast made my day brighter:) I will stay here again for sure!Pros:-EXCELLENT staff. Every single person was so friendly, sweet, and helpful to us. An extra shout out to  Tony (continental breakfast), Victor (shuttle driver), and Dorothy (front desk) for exceptional service.-free shuttle downtown. It runs every half hour, and it's very prompt. -comfortable beds-great selection for continental breakfast-clean rooms-reasonably pricedCons:-Not in a great neighborhood-could not adjust temperature in the room, and it was way too hot-they didn't have simple things such as band-aids at the front desk-rooms look a bit outdatedOverall, a pleasant experience. I would stay here again.I almost never review hotels on Yelp but I am doing so for this hotel as a public service. This is an infested Pig with Lipstick. Our rooms were dirty as in makeup smeared on walls, bugs on the bed, other people's socks and ponytail holders on the floor. Housekeeping is lacking and they are really loud banging around in the morning. Our key cards had to be rekeyed the third night because they screwed them up.  The whole place was basically new stuff shoddily installed and the whole place was just a disappointment. The breakfast was not good and I had low expectations going on since I often eat at the breakfast bars at their competitor's properties. Would not return here. Way over priced for the level of service and amenities provided. Above all a hotel should be clean. They failed.BEDBUGS!!!!! DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!! We went out of our way to stay here because of a previous good experience. However, I now have over 100 bites covering my body and we found bedbugs all over the bed and crawling on me. We packed up immediately and called the manager. They comped our room but that still doesn't account for the fact that I'm miserable with all these bites, it ruined our vacation, and we had to throw a lot of our stuff away that couldn't be heat treated. Let alone all the stress and anxiety it has caused. A previous reviewer from 2 months ago also got them there so clearly they aren't doing what they need to do to get rid of the issue.Though less than 1/2 a mile from LP field and about a mile from downtown, the Clarion is in really industrial section so there is not much to see just walking around the hotel. Also if there is a game trying to get to the hotel is a nightmare, for some reason the Nashville police block about 80% of the roads in the area and hand direct all street light traffic, the worst! We loved the updated lobby and rooms. We had two queen beds with nice white cotton bedding. The only thing I didn't like about our room was that the bathroom light was connected to the fan, so if you wanted to see you had to have the super loud fan on. Though the fan is obnoxiously loud it sadly did little to take away the steam from the shower.They server a complementary hot breakfast which was ok, as expected. Make your own Belgian waffles, eggs, sausage, eggs, mini bagels and muffins, cereal, yogurt, coffee juice. Oh and terrible diced potatoes!There is a small bar, but its not open until later in the afternoon. The bartender said wine was like $12 which seemed a bit high for the atmosphere.They offer a shuttle until 8pm to downtown but be forewarned you have to sign up for it at the front desk. Raul the driver was nice enough to make a double trip when there were too many people.  Prices change based on demand, but at $440 for two nights it was a great deal for us.This place is terrible. Parking Lot is always full, even if you buy a room here you can not park. You would think this would be a good hotel to stay at while having fun downtown, but the people who work here do not like to have fun. This place is not a "fun" place.On the surface, this hotel appeared to have been recently renovated and generally clean. It's in a convenient location close to downtown and sightseeing area (just $7 cab ride from the bars). However, the staff was not very friendly and, more importantly, our bed was INFESTED WITH BED BUGS. I HAVE DOZENS OF NASTY RED AND ITCHY BITES ALL OVER MY ARMS, SHOULDERS, HANDS, & NECK. Some of the bites are in the tell tail straight lines. I've never experienced something so revolting in my life! Do not stay at this hotel!!!!!Awesome hotel room was clean and nice staff was friendly and helpful breakfast was pretty good for what it is only complaint is the drinking cups at breakfast were the size of a double shot glass  otherwise I would deff stay here again.. We had no issue parking or with anything else I think some ppl expect great views and resort style service ... If you are this is not the hotel for you the view is of the interstate mostly and although the the staff is very friendly and helpful in any way u can imagine this is not a resort don't expect  them to act like it is you will be disappointed ... However if you are looking for a nice CLEAN , safe  not outrageously priced room near downtown Nashville that you don't have to worry about the dea kicking in a door 2 rooms down (yes this can deff happen at some of the other hotels near downtown ) then this is a great find ... Our room was perfectly fine for thatI stayed in the Clarion for two nights this month and overall I wasn't thrilled. Although the property is recently renovated, there are a lot of things they seemed to have missed. For example, for whatever reason, the paint around the trim of the elevator doors was severely chipped and needed a touch up, especially on the 4th floor. The elevator doors themselves were all dinged and scratched -- obviously old or poorly maintained. The hallways were dimly lit and looked like the carpet needed a good vacuum. I also noticed a small gap between the counter top and siding of the bathroom sink.My room appeared clean, but at the same time smelled moist, like there may have been mildew lingering somewhere unseen. However, the mattress and pillows were actually comfortable, and the flat screen television in the room was surprisingly large (bigger than 42", I think). I didn't have any trouble with the cleaning service throughout my stay, but was missing a hairdryer in my room upon check in.The very few staff I encountered were relatively friendly or didn't acknowledge me at all (while passing in the hallway, which is fine), with the exception of the front desk attendant in the early morning. I left to go downtown for a work convention every morning at 7am and the individual I encountered was cordial to me (only because I was being overly nice to her in order to catch a cab -- the hotel's free shuttle starts running at 8am, by the way), but I overheard her make comments to another staff member about a guest that was being "a jerk." Also, the entrance outside of the hotel needs a really good power-washing and a smoker's stand for people to discard their used cigarettes. There were cigarette butts everywhere, and what appeared to be a beer bottle (on a Tuesday morning). Seriously, someone really needs to invest in that.There is absolutely nothing around this hotel to walk to besides the football stadium. So, long story short, the only way this hotel is worth the price (I paid $169 per night) is if you're going to see the Titans.Nice rooms. Comfortable beds and relatively new. Food was good at the bar in the lobby. Breakfast was fine. Walls are paper thin. Cleaning staff screams in the hallways all through the day. Can hear the highway and other noises at night. Close to the stadium and a convenient free shuttle to DT every 30mins.
review_content_20: Friendly staff; great customer service.  Extremely clean & nice room and common areas.  Courtesy shuttle to downtown was a HUGE plus; only a 10 minute ride away.  Complimentary breakfast every morning had a good selection of food.  The only place I will stay if I visit Nashville again!Stayed at The Clarion Hotel Downtown Nashville Stadium for 4 nights with a group of 124 Miami Dolphins Fans. We all had a GREAT time. Everyone in the city was great and the crew at The Clarion were amazing. The Bar crew were friendly and Justin was a comedian that kept us laughing and drinks flowing. His family had a reunion that weekend so he only worked our first night but fear not Toni, Kelly and Lindsey were just as great the following nights. We closed the bar down each night and we all had a great time. The front desk was helpful and polite. Albert, De Andre and Jessica greeted us every time we came in and were helpful when our group had questions about the area. The shuttle busses to downtown made it easy to get around without renting a car and the drivers were great. I would recommend my friends and family staying here if they visit Nashville for any reason. THANK YOU!!!! Marc AngeloI was hesitant to write this review since I can't give 5 stars, but may as well.I stayed here for two nights last month and thought the property itself and the room were great.  The bathroom was fantastic.  Great shower pressure, nice and clean. Room nice and big and fresh looking.  Bed big and comfortable.  Couldn't have asked for more.  Easy ride by hotel shuttle to downtown and then quick cab ride back.  The pool was also fantastic, especially while listening to the downpour going on outside.Here is the one definite negative: front desk staff.  I don't think we were there during an unusually busy weekend or time of day, but I found the staff to be pretty uninterested in greeting guests or properly checking them in.  When I got my key and went up to the room, I found that the room was STILL OCCUPIED!  I went back down to the lobby to let the staff know and it was like no big deal, happens all the time.  They did give me a key to the room directly across the hall, which turned out to be fine, but I was worried someone would walk in on us at some point if keys are being coded and assigned so randomly.  Could have been a simple, one-time mistake but I didn't get that feeling and it clearly affected my experience.And the so-so: elevators.  These things looked and sounded rickety, like the rest of the hotel was refurbished around them and no one thought to consider a tune up.  It was fun chatting with people while waiting for the elevator to arrive though.All in all, I would stay here again but would probably look for something comparable to try out if I could.  Another reviewer has recently reported finding bed bugs, so for the record, while I did find multiple red welts on my arms and legs after I checked out, I did a bed check the first night specifically looking for bed bugs and didn't find any..Can't recommend this hotel enough- friendly staff, helpful room service and the best customer service! Dorothy- I just can't say enough about this extremely welcoming and accommodating woman. Especially after having the worst experience at the scummy hotel next door- the Knights Inn. This place is so nice and worth every dollar! Will definitely come back here!How should I begin .... I found a rather large roach in my first room . The second problem was the shuttle . I was attending a conference at the Omni ( should have stayed there ) . I spent hours waiting for the shuttle from clarion even though it's supposed to run on the 1/2 hour  . I called at one point 4 times and was told he was on his way . He in fact never showed . I was late for several events during my stay because of this . Third , the breakfast was nothing short of terrible . pLEASE don't stay here you will be very disappointed !!!!!!I was in Nashville this past weekend for the Cowboys/Titans game and this hotel was in the perfect location! 10 minutes from the airport, 5 minutes from downtown Nashville and walking distance from LP Field for the game.The room was very clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The bar in the lobby has good sports bar food. After the game on Sunday we decided to stay in the room and watch the rest of the NFL games and just order from the bar. Good chicken tenders, philly cheesesteak sliders and quesadillas. This hotel offers free parking for guests to which is a plus.The ONLY negative I would say is on Sunday morning we left for breakfast and to go to the game about 8:30am and did not return until after the game until 3:30pm. Our room had still NOT been cleaned by the maids. They were still on our floor(3rd floor) cleaning the rooms. So we went down to the bar for 20 min until she was done. Other than that I would definitely recommend this place. Especially if you are attending an event at LP Field or something in Downtown Nashville. Short walk and short ride.Great friendly service and the remodel looks great, I think they forgot to paint all of the doors to the guest rooms? The shuttle service was great and very convenient, Victor was the best driver!!I was really surprised at how great this hotel was!   Formerly the Days Inn, this place has undergone (and continues to undergo) an Extreme Makeover: Hotel Edition-type renovation. The lobby is modern, visually very cool and still comfortable. The rooms have been updated and restyled.  The construction crews seemed to hurry through some parts and did some sloppy work in the rooms with paint and tile, but it didn't take away from the stay. The beds were great and the pillows were perfectly soft!  The TV was large and got lots of channels. The bathroom was huge!  We didn't use the pool, but it's been upgraded too. Their free breakfast was nice, pretty standard but if its free, it's one less vacation expense, right?  The breakfast room is huge, and it looks like they're putting in a bar in the lobby. And the free shuttle downtown: amazing!! The AC was strong, and was one that could have the fan stay on even if it wasn't cooling, so it didn't wake me up going on and off all night.  And free wifi! What really made my stay special was the staff. I did not expect that level of service from this price point or in this neighborhood. From the moment we walked in - late at night minus my luggage as the airline lost it - they took care of us!  I asked for a quiet room after the stress of losing my luggage (and knowing I'm a light sleeper and my ear plugs were in the lost suitcase), and they put us away from everybody else and personally walked us to the room to make sure it was to our quiet-seeking standards.  It did get noisy one weekend evening when the hotel was full - the walls are thin, but they also have a security guard that will tell revelers to hush up.  The staff asked every night what we had been up to, complimented us when we got all dressed up for the Opry, said "Good morning ladies!" every morning and genuinely talked to us, giving recommendations and making sure we enjoyed their city.  Southern Hospitality at its finest! Easy on and off the freeway, convenient to the airport and perfectly situated for those that drove all over Nashville to take in the sites. There isn't much within waking distance though, so know that, but they offer free parking if you rent a car.  If I visit again, I'll stay here again for sure!The hotel was in a good location and a mile from downtown.   We had a family reunion and 29 of us stayed at this hotel.  The hotel was very clean.  They have one shuttle that holds 11 people at a time and that gets booked up very quickly.   Plan ahead if you have dinner plans and want to use their free shuttle service.   If you use Uber downtown it's only $4.00 so nothing to complain about.   Considering the hotel price with the free breakfast, free parking, swimming pool, free internet and free shuttle service you can't beat this location or hotel.    I would definitely stay here again!A nice stay, great price and close enough to downtown.Had a great stay here.Rooms were clean.  Beds were comfortable, I had a good nights sleep.  Hotel was apparently renovated, so it looks pretty new - although there were a few things that seemed to have missed the punch list, but not enough to ruin our stay.   Worst part was we didn't get housekeeping service - we had a do not disturb sign out but that was gone by 10am - but housekeeping didn't come back for a 2nd attempt.  Front desk did apologize and offered to send someone up immediately.   The lobby is nice and comfortable.  Plenty of seating to hang out with fellow travelers.  breakfast was nice - eggs/sausage/biscuits/gravy/waffle machine/cereals/breads/coffee/tea.     Quite tasty - I'm not sure what other reviewers were expecting.I can't speak to noise - our stay was quiet, but the hotel is down the street from a stadium, so if there is a big event there, I can see enthusiastic fans being rowdy.  I might check for stadium events if that is a concern - an event may get you a busy hotel and longer check in/out times.But the hotel's location is the gem here.  While downtown hotels are $400/night, the Clarion is less than half that but still close to the downtown area.   A half hour walk to Broadway, and I felt safe walking even at night.  a $7 cab ride if you'd prefer, and a hotel shuttle will also take you there.  Would definitely stay there again and save my money for a night on the town.I usually only write reviews for the good stuff, this is my first negative review. Stayed here on 8 August 2014, my buddy and I were driving across the country and we needed a place to stay, so we booked this hotel online. As I was lying in bed, I noticed some movement by my face. Turns out my bed had some fat bed bugs in it. I collected three in a cup, which only took a minute to find. I brought these down to the front desk demanding a refund and a new room. Honestly the guy at the desk didn't even seemed to surprised, like it had happened before. Just be warned. Now it's three in the morning, and I am very hesitant to sleep in the new room they gave me.Cute but in rough neighborhood. Security patrols hard. Limited handicapped spots and poorly placed. Have to cut your way through the smoke cloud to enter. Just disgusting!  Monday maid was a nice Hispanic lady who did a wonderful job. Lazy black maid today asked the girls to do half her work. I pay you to do this not to engage by grandchildren to do your job. Holes in ceiling where sprinkler lines are run that are unfinished. Low water pressure. Beds way too high. You need a step stool to enter. Very painful to try to get to and from when on an ecv or Wherlchair.  Yes I had a handicapped room. No flat floor shower. Had to fight over tub walls. Decor is unique and colorful. Could not use pool. Closed first night. Other nights you needed a special code and no one seemed to know it. Front desk always busy socializing with themselves. Breakfast in pretty setting but nothing special. Rubber eggs, potatoes, waffles, pastries, basic cereal, yogurt, juice, coffee, tea and biscuits w/ gravy. Some fresh cooked eggs or scrambled would have been nice. Looks great on the website but will most likely try a different hotel on the return trip.Driving through Nashville and were only there for one night. Didn't want to spend $200 on a hotel downtown. This hotel was about 5 minutes drive to downtown tourist area. Clean and great customer service. Free breakfast. Use to be a days inn which got confusing when we were first looking for it on a map, but it is now remodeled and currently still under construction on some parts of the hotel. Would stay again.This was a great find for us! We had a big van so the free parking was great. They provided a free shuttle to downtown which was really easy! It took about 5 minutes to drive in. The rooms were spacious & clean. Breakfast was great too... Waffles, eggs, sausage, cereal, pastries!! Good value. We would stay here again.THIS PLACE IS AWFUL! I came to Nashville with my family and we stayed there, it was very nice inside. We went out and came back to the hotel and our whole bathroom was flooded!!! The dry wall had came down and leaked water everywhere! We had a suitcase in the bathroom that got completely soaked and ruined with drywall all over it! My brother went and told them and they didn't care at all. The police that was working there even agreed with us and he came and looked at it. He was on our side! We didn't get a new room...we stayed in the hotel with a flooded bathroom all night! We didn't get the room paid for or even any discount! They were extremely rude and obviously didn't care! Not one of the clarion staff members even came and looked at the room!  One of the staff members even suggested that we were all lying when we had pictures and a police offer for proof!! HORRIBLE customer service!!! When we were even letting the manger know, all the staff was so nosey they just stood there and listened but did nothing about the matter! They clearly don't care about their customers. It's nice inside but just remember it may fall apart on you and ruin your things..but don't expect them to care or even do anything to accommodate the situation! My family and I will never be back!Nice hotel for the money. Recently remodeled though old rough edges are showing through. Says it is downtown but not really, is about 1 mile from Broadway. They offer a free shuttle on the hour which is very nice, though you are on your own getting back late at night. I walked back one night but would not do it again, the last 2 blocks are long and in rough area - the $6 cab ride is well worth it! The staff is very friendly and helpful and the rooms are nice and comfortable and everything worked fine including the free internet. Nice free hot breakfast with potatoes, eggs and sausage along with muffins, yogurt and fruit. My only complaints are the $75 hold they place on your card for "incidentals", though you can't charge your dinner meal/bar tab to your room and the bar is only open until 10. I asked and the front desk about the hold and they said it was more of a security deposit for damage or for purchasing items from their market. I made it clear that if they are to do this then you must be able to charge your dinner to the room. All in all was a good stay and I recommend. Other than the $75 hold and the neighborhood this is a very fine hotel for the money.This was my first trip to Nashville and I want betty happy to find out that almost every hotel wad already full so we wouldn't be ankle to stay on the main strip. I was then pleasantly surprised by the clarion. They have shuttles running downtown every hour and when we did take a cab it was only 5 0r 6 dollars to each main spot. Our rooms are nice and clean and the front desk people were very helpful. Is worth it to pay for the cheap can rides instead of paying a few hundred extra to stay on the strip.Over Under Bar: First of all let me say I have stayed at this hotel before and it is much nicer now than it used to be. As far as the hotel experience it was really nice. My real trouble came when I went down stairs to the bar. We had a really nice experience with the regular bar staff. The girl, Marin, made me the best Bloody Mary I have ever had in my life. My wife had actually ordered it so when I went to ask the bartender to make me one like hers the bar manager, Dana,  interrupted me while I was asking for the drink and explained that the bartender was making the drink incorrectly and that she would make me a better one the "right way". First off, I was really irritated at being interrupted and secondly, whether or not she was making it right or wrong I loved the way it tasted and that is how I wanted it. She was so rude to the bartender and frankly was rude to me by interrupting me while I was telling her I wanted the drink the way the bartender made it. I might go back to the hotel but I always go to the bar so if they don't have a new manager then forget it.Love the hotel, loved the updates, right by LP field, Free shuttle and taxi ride with tip under $10! Great place to stay and great breakfest. We will stay there again.

review_content: Extremely well priced! Clean rooms, comfortable bed, soft linen, friendly staff, fair complementary breakfast. Shuttle to Broadway $10 round-trip. Would absolutely stay here again!This place is like a pearl in an oyster shell. It may have a tough looking exterior but inside is something really special. The staff is welcoming and very attentive. The rooms are clean and fresh. A great nights sleep made better with the deluxe continental breakfast. Given the choice of the surrounding options, I'd go Alexis over those other big names.Initially I thought the place to be decent, even with the swarm of ladybugs in my room. Employees were friendly and helpful. My second night, my significant other and I were in the heat of things when someone walked right in our room! I immediately went to the front desk and was told it didn't happen. Called the manager when I returned home only to be told it couldn't possibly have happened. Never in my life have I been so humiliated or let down by a company. I eventually figured out what I think happened - my s.o. never picked up the extra key I left for them at the front desk. Almost positive it was accidentally handed to someone checking in. Seriously - you couldn't check your cameras? There was one RIGHT outside my room. I'm horrified this is the way you treat customers! Outright dangerous.I would rate the customer service of the staff a 5, particularly Billie who was fantastic! I needed a safety pin and she went above and beyond to find one. Our room was huge and extremely spacious. Now the down side, when I went to move the curtains I saw a huge beetle looking big, then found more all over the curtain and window. It took over an hour for anyone to come and when the maintenance team came, they killed the bugs (big guts leftover) and sealed the window with foam. Needless to say I couldn't sleep after that.Great deal! Have stayed here before, friendly staff. Nice hotel, equivalent to Marriott or Hyatt, in style and quality. Ignore the off brand name, great place.My fellow Yelpers failed me! This is not a 4 star hotel! I got this room for two nights on Hotwire $100 a night. Before I snatched it up, I researched it on here... these people must not get out much. Sorry, I'm just being honest. This is one of the worst unclean hotels I've ever stayed at. Yes, it has granite counter tops, that's the only modern thing here. Check in with Princess was a breeze. She suggested The shuttle and said it is $18 to downtown. It ended up being $25, but that wasn't her fault. The shuttle service is Driving Ms. Daisy. I feel the need to mention that I think that I witnessed the driver do a drug deal with us in the van! He said that he needed to make a pit stop because another passenger left their cigarettes in the van. He passed him the box of cigarettes and the dude gave him $20. Could've been just a nice tip... for bringing back a box of cigs. Dang, cigarettes must be outrageous nowadays! There are five floors and one slow elevator for all of the rooms and it was busy, even on a week day. I must be the only one who doesn't like this place. The pictures posted 6 years ago, same decor but now everything is worn, torn and outdated. The bed was comfortable and the only reason that I gave this place a second star. Oh, the breakfast. How could I almost forget to mention the free breakfast?! The lady tending to it snapped at me for leaving the lid off of the biscuits for my husband. She also told him that I should've put the lid on after it got my biscuit. Geeez lady, way to call me out. She should've been more worried about cleaning up crumbs and cereal on the tables and counter. The gravy seriously tasted like Spam. The lady at the table beside me watched me take a bite and said "it tastes like Spam doesn't it".After paying five cab/shuttle fares, I really don't think I saved any $$ by staying on the outskirt of downtown.After reading some of the previous reviews, and seeing previous pics I'm guessing they have updated the rooms since then, flat screens, clean white bedding, comfortable clean room. I would stay here again.The hotel signage needs to be adjusted. The "e" is not lighted in Alexis, which gives a shady first impression (i.e. Al xis Inn). Once inside, the lobby looked accommodating, albeit cheesy. But, everything was clean, which is what is most important. While attempting to open our room, our key was demagnetized, but a hotel employee was on the floor and sprang into action to let us in the room and shortly after our arrival, provided us with 2 newly magnetized cards. The inside of the roomy had a somewhat cheesy appearance as well, but it was all clean. I was impressed by the free toiletries, which included mouthwash, which you don't always get. The beds were soft, the room was quite, and the view was ok. The breakfast buffet was very tasty and included southern favorites such as biscuits and gravy.Overall, good hotel for a good clean night's stay.I stayed here one night when I was in town for business. The hotel is clean, the bed is pretty comfortable and is a great deal for the money. It's about 10 minutes from the airport and 10 minutes from downtown. There's free breakfast in the morning which is always nice.This was not a good experience. I felt extremely uncomfortable, upon entering the elevator, and the feeling continued in the room. It smelled unpleasant, and the carpet was so old it didn't appear clean. The sleeper sofa was ripped (2 nd room). When opened the mattress pad looked as if there were food closed inside throughout. The maintenance brought several sheets to cover it, however they did not have any more pads. I would not recommend this hotel. The suite was large and the staff friendly. You can clearly see the owners are not investing in their business, but riding it until the wheels fall off. :(I enjoyed my stay here when my friend and I took a trip over the summer. $100 for the night and included free breakfast, Wi-Fi, and parking. The hotel was a little outdated, but very clean. Huge variety to pick from at breakfast in the morning and if you aren't feeling their breakfast, waffle house is right by it. The staff was friendly and helpful. If you are driving to Nashville, the location is ideal because it is only about 10 minutes from downtown and 10 minutes from the Grand Ole Opry in the other direction. It is much cheaper than staying downtown. I wanted to stay here for my next trip, but they were all booked! They do a great job!Not a bad hotel for the money, but for about 20 more dollars you can stay next door at the Marriott and earn points. Room was clean and beds were fine. Needs a paint job in the hallways. Staff were friendly.Friendly staff. Clean, quiet room. Free Wi-Fi and breakfast were nice. Some areas could use some fresh paint or cosmetic maintenance, but for an overnight business trip the accommodations were just fine. I booked through hotels.com and got a great price!It was only AFTER we booked our room here that I noticed Candice G.'s review -- had I known that, I would have skipped all the searching on another site with reviews (my bad)... Anyway, Candice was right about the water pressure, this was the polar opposite of the beach we stayed at in Ormond Beach, where the water came out in needle jets that must feel like getting a tattoo to folks with a sunburn. Here, the water comes out so slow you think twice about shampooing your hair, for fear you'll spend all day rinsing...But, other than that and the "Are you kidding? Those aren't eggs!" continental breakfast, this place ROCKS! Not far off the interstates and parkways, close to the airport (like at the end of a runway, I believe), and pretty clean for an older hotel, the Alexis has great prices. We paid just $65... And the room was HUGE. If you are going to Nashville with friends, you could easily put 3 friends in this room -- 8 if you are really GOOD friends!All amenities, like free WiFi, soap, shampoo and hair dryer are there as well... Plenty of free parking. Lots of bachelorette parties seemed to be starting off here, so there must be some kind of male stripper place nearby, I'm guessing. Right?In my world, you can spend whatever you want on a conference, no problem. But, if you set your conference expenses too high, your take-home pay is adjusted downward accordingly. Conferencing by myself, it is difficult to justify $150+/night downtown accommodations. Two of three conference trips to Nashville, I've ended up at Alexis. This time, it was a "three nights for the price of two" deal. So, for about half of what I would have paid downtown, I had a very nice king suite -- living room + kitchenette + bedroom + bathroom (see photos). If your conference starts around 8:00 AM, the real price you pay is fighting traffic, in my case from Elm Hill Pike to Murfreesboro Pike, which becomes Lafayette, to downtown, about 15 minutes each morning. No complaints about the service or the room. Friendly, efficient staff. Clean room with -- as others have noted -- five pillows on the bed. What am I gonna do with five pillows?Worst.WaterPressure.Ever. Seriously like taking a shower underneath an eye dropper. And don't even think about making #2 here-- That's a flush that ain't gonna happen, my friend. I gargle with more water than sits in that bowl and to top it off, the flush power is reminiscent of a moderate home aquarium filter. Just a bad H2O situation overall, I guess. Also, looking at the dank business photos in the listing makes me rethink my star rating in hindsight. I don't remember it being THAT scary looking. Buuut it was only like $60 a night so it's not like I can expect the Ritz, ya know? Positive things to note about this hotel:*Decently comfy beds*Free Wifi*LOTS of pillows*Vanity outside the restroom so I can ready without occupying the barely functioning loo for my guest*Right off the highway*Large+clean hotel entryway*Vanity mirror has nice shot of the bed (eh, eh? Ya get my drift?)*Free mouthwash*Close parking (hint- go for the sides of the building. Closer to the front door and no one thinks to park there)*QuietIf I'd paid a penny over $60 a night for room I might be singing a different tune- especially since the breakfast buffet (less the cake bread) was a major let down. But, for the hotels.com rate I think this place is A-OK. Also, it might not very close to anything cool or happenin' in Nashville but it is just across the street from one of the 83834763483 million Waffle Houses you passed driving into Nashville.This is a great hotel for the money! The staff is friendly and the bed is comfy. The hotel is clean and very close to the airport. We always have our out of town family stay here.Clean, nice hotel. I booked a night through Hotel.com (Use code LNGUYEN271 for $25 credit). Front staff was incredibly nice and upgraded our room to 2 full beds at no extra cost. I also received plenty of advice as to where to go for dinner and drinks. I would definitely come back.Nice clean hotel. Close to airport and extremely friendly staff. Highly recommend. The toiletries are amazing!! I mean seriously the soaps and lotion feel like silk!!! I was very pleasantly surprisedStayed here as an overnight stop on our way to Florida. The good:1. Easy check-in with friendly staff.2. Huge room for a really reasonable rate3. Actual queen beds so lots of room.4. Quiet (Had bachelor party near by and didn't hear them once)5. Easy access from and back to the interstates6. Staff was very helpful with recommending dinner7. Better than average complimentary breakfast (eggs, sausage, biscuits, sausage gravy and waffles along with the other usual continental fare).The bad:1. The pillows. While soft, they are ridiculously small. More like little cubes.2. The beds were a little hard. The Ugly:NoneOverall, the good outweighed the bad and I don't mind a hard bed as long as I don't have to sleep on it every night. The pillows I just kind of molded 2 into one. I didn't have the water pressure problems that others have described on here. If you can handle the 2 bad items, it's definitely worth the price.
review_content_20: If you book online it is cheaper, fyi.We stayed for just over $40/night. That said, it was glorious. The rooms were small but stocked with everything Jill S. said. It was very clean and across the street from a Waffle House.Small issue - the front desk was nice when I called to get information about Nashville however Alexis Inn is not near downtown or the Grand Ole Opry - it is in between the two. The desk made it sound like we could get to downtown for $7, but that isn't totally true. You need to take a cab, the local cab is the same price as "Driving Miss Daisy".The other small issue - i like the fact that there is a free breakfast, however Alexis Inn has the most unhealthy choices you can have for a breakfast. Small issue though because it is free.... but I feel it is important to note there is no fresh fruit, well fresh anything really, on the bar.For $40-ish it is more affordable than downtown (even with the cab ride) and clean. Few small points to note - but if you know it going in, it is a pleasant experience.So here I am, having trekked halfway across the country on two different planes with a toddler in tow to a hotel I randomly picked on hotwire because a) it was close to the airport (aka cheap cab ride cuz I was in too late for the shuttle) and b) a good deal price wise....so I wasn't expecting much.Well whodathunk? From the MINUTE I walked in I was impressed. Not just because the lobby was nice, but because this wonderfully cheery sweet woman greeted me and my daughter like we practically lived there - she knew I was coming, had my keys all ready...engaged my 4 year old in hilarious conversation...when we go to the room my daughter said "she can be my grandma - I like her" lol. Now let's talk about the room....spacious, two queen beds, a side kitchen area with a sink cabinets, fridge and microwave....the air was already set comfortably, the fridge was cold and ready...she even had the door opened a crack so I didn't have to bother with the key and all my luggage. southern hospitality...I tell ya...the beds are comfy...tons of pillows....I then, at 12 30 at night mind you (TN time, as I'm still on California time lol) remember I hadn't eaten yet...now where I come from, after 12 - GOOD FREAKIN LUCK finding food...soooo...I pop over to the front desk (where "gramma" comes out to admire my daughter's footie jammies lol) and ask her, expecting to hear "nothing is open" if something is....and (insert angels singing here) she hands me a menu to a local place that is open til 3 am!!!! (Milanos, but that is a whole other 5 start yelp to come) Oh and did I mention the toiletry tray has EVERYTHING???? shampoo, conditioner, lotion, mother wash and body wash...plus soaps and a shower cap...and free wifi!if they had the nickelodeon channel I'd probably move in...lolSeriously, I stay at a lot of hotels...I was impressed and recommend it highly!We LOVED this place! You just can't beat this place for $69.99 a night. My family stayed here for 10 days back in 2010. We were on a driving adventure that had taken us from Dallas to Sarasota, FL and were on our way up to Lake Michigan when we stopped in Nashville. At this point we'd be on the road a few months and needless to say had stayed in many economy hotels. With that said, we've also stayed at many non-economy hotels with room rates ranging from $125-$350/night for conferences and business trips. We were more than satisfied with this hotel for the price range. We paid $69.99/night for two queen beds and little kitchenette that had a mini fridge, microwave and a food prep area. Most of the "hotels" we've been in that were in this price range were motels. The lobby is a nice spacious area that they've obviously made an attempt to modernize. The staff is as friendly and as attentive as you would find in any high priced hotel. The beds were fantastic! The linens were trendy, beautiful and clean with lots of specialty pillows. I literally uncased the pillow to find out what it was and where I could buy it. Our room was very spacious. I see one guest commented on the room size being small. I'm not sure how you end up with a larger vs smaller room in this place. Maybe you can request a larger one? It is still the largest room we've had in any price range to date. The only bad thing I have to say about this place is regarding the breakfast and even then it's not that bad. As another reviewer stated, there really aren't any healthy choices on the breakfast bar. It is a hot breakfast that includes scrambled eggs, sausage, biscuits and gravy, fresh cooked waffles, various cereals and bagels with cream cheese. The eggs are clearly powdered and possibly microwaved. I added butter and salt to mine to make them palatable. The breakfast really wasn't that good but it was nice to have it included in the price for my family of three. Just eating breakfast could have easily added $30/day to our expenses so because of that our free breakfast was definitely better than paying to feed my family elsewhere.I'm a huge fan of breakfasts, especially free breakfasts.I like it when hotels have something, anything. Even if it's just a carb (muffin/donut/bagel/pastry) and a coffee.This place has buffet-sytle hot food (eggs, breakfast pattie, muffin, gravy), waffle maker where you pour batter yourself to make waffles, instant oatmeal packages, sliced breads and bagels for toasting, 4 kinds of cold cereal, coffee, water, and several types of fruit juice (orange, apple, cranberry). And if you're not a guest and want some of this, it's about $4.99. The room was nice. I like how high the bed is. They give lots of pillows. We didn't get a room with the kitchenette, but we didn't need it. Free wi-fi was spotty. I don't know if a neighbor was downloading a lot of data (*cough*porn*cough*). But if the surfing is slow, you may want to go downstairs to the lobby where the connection seems slightly faster.There is a gym. And actually if you don't like the tap water during the summer, fill up your water bottle from the cooler in the gym.The only negatives I have are from the bathroom in our room: The toilet did not flush very well. I think it works better if you hold down the lever; otherwise, flush a few times when you are done, or be ready to be mortified when the next person sees what didn't get flushed down. Also, the bath tub felt slimy on the floor of the tub. I don't know if it's from having soft water (?).No restaurants on site. I think there is a waffle place across the street. But there is a pretty decent free breakfast in the back lobby!!!Very small rooms, but seem to have been updated recently. Had no problems with the water pressure noted by others. Clean and comfortable enough.Friendly staff, clean spacious rooms, new updates, free buffet with hot breakfast items and all under $80. Within a few miles of Nashville - good bargin and recommended. Would stay here again on another trip.We decided to stay here because we drove by a walk-in rate sign while driving looking for a place to stay. We were extremly happy with the stay so much that when we were driving back from Memphis and decided to stay over another night we went back here. The room we stayed in had great beds and pillows, was clean and nice smelling when we got in and had a little kitchennette area with a fridge and sink. For the 69.00 a night we spent WELL WORTH it. Staff was super friendly and remembered us when we came back by 13 hours later....would recommend this to anyone in the Nasvhille area, only about a 10 minute drive to downtown.Nice clean hotel but the breakfast isn't that great. I would stay again.Inexpensive and clean. Staff are friendly. Free breakfast every morning. Rooms are a bit outdated but as I said its inexpensive.Booked through Booking.com so we got a two queen suite for $46 a night. Side room with mini fridge, microwave, table for two. Free Wifi. Computer connection on the desk lamp was impossible to use unless you tilt the lamp backwards with a book. Very large and clean room, definitely well worth the money. I like having the bathroom facilities (toilet and tub) in a separate room from the dual sinks and large mirror.We stayed here on a trip to Nashville to go to the Grand Ole Opry--so this was the perfect location for us since it was located only a few minutes down the interstate. It also had everything we needed in a hotel--it was inexpensive ($70), quiet, comfortable bed, fridge in the room, free breakfast, fitness center, & business center. Nothing fancy, but it was perfect for our quick stay. I'd stay here again.Very affordable, clean and friendly. Nice work desk and free wifi. The bed is huge and comfy, next time I fly out of Nashville I will be staying here again.

review_content: This is a cute boutique hotel, kinda quirky vibe but not in a bad way. They gave our little doxie a gift bag of dog treats which she loved! Nice touch. The hotel has a bar and lounge, and an onsite restaraunt which provides room service. Room with king sized bed was super sized, plenty of room. Bathroom was modest, nicely decorated but in need of minor clean up on the ceiling....again, nothing bad, just unsightly in spots.Overall this was a pleasant experience, great deal!While The Preston may have been a nice, moderately priced hotel in the past, it has steadily descended onto a full-blown shithole. Sign outside is dilapidated. No water in a single vending machine in the whole hotel. No hot water in the rooms. Staff is useless, and I don't blame them. Their open contempt for the hotel is obvious. DO NOT STAY HERE. Shame on you, Priceline, for calling this a 4-star hotel. It's barely 2. Such a shameUpdate: there are bugs!Cool looking place.That's where the goodness ends.No hot water in the rooms, rude staff, terrible food.The maid staff didn't clean my room over the course of my 2 night stay.For 50.00 a night it would still not be acceptable.For well over a hundred it's a disaster.I really had mixed feeling toward my stay. My room was fine but I happened to find a ladybug in crawling around and the bathroom ceiling wasn't on properly so there was a hole to look at in the shower. Front desk service was friendly and technically the restaurant service was too but they were really slow. The menu was very limited and there was no drink menu but nice atmosphere. Good enough place but I personally thought it was very over priced.Beautiful hotel on the outskirts of Nashville, a mere $6 Uber ride to downtown. Was visiting here and was able to get a room for 2 nights on Priceline on a bid for $85, which came out to $105 per night. Usually the rooms are about $150-$200 a night during this season (per Hotels.com) so Big Win!The Hotel is very modern looking with a bar and restaurant that looked very popular and hip-ster worthy. Happy Hour M-F from 5-7. Check-in was a breeze, the front desk was really nice and the room was clean and modern. The only gripe I had was the slow but free Internet, something that I've noticed other hotels are doing. You can pay extra for faster speeds, but otherwise you get speeds of 500-700 kbps which is fine unless you need to download a large work project or movie. The rooms and vibe of the hotel remind me of Hard Rock Hotel Casino in Vegas, which is the theme I think they're going for.Also, it's located across the street from one of the most inexpensive gas stations I've seen, with Unleaded for $1.99 at this time (in comparison others throughout the region was $2.15-$2.20). They offer free shuttle services to downtown Nashville so it's a good way to get there. Free parking too. Highly recommend!I stayed here for a couple nights. Like many previous reviewers have noted, the decor is, well, interesting. It's eclectic but also a little bit creepy. For some reason, it reminded me of a haunted house. I know some people may like the eclectic look but meh, I'm not a fan. The staff was very friendly and answered any questions we had. Walls were paper thin so we were able to hear everything that our neighbors were doing. It's very close to the airport so if you're traveling, it'll be a convenient hotel to stay at.Clean and comfortable. Convenient location to airport. The staff sets this place apart. Georgia, front desk, was delightful and very helpful. As was the van driver. Complimentary shuttle to local places. The hotel itself is eccentric and funky, which we like. Neat artwork. Beds are very comfortable. Minor thing about the room that could have earned it an extra star, like three of five burned out lightbulbs in the bathroom. They have a pillow menu and inclusive spiritual reading menu. If you are staying longer you can get a lava lamp for your room. This would not be a bad place for a longer stay. Taxi to downtown is $18 and there is not much to do around the hotel, just be aware of this when looking at this area.The rooms are nice, clean, and roomy. The staff is very friendly. Location is great (for me, at least - close to Opryland/Opry Mills, pretty close to the science center, also near the airport, not too far from downtown). Decor is funky and different, setting it apart from most other hotels which tend to look kind of generic and samey.Note: the rooms do not include a mini-fridge, but you can request one free of charge. As long as one is available, they'll bring one up to your room. Also, they're apparently working on updating their WiFi right now so anyone staying around now...if you're experiencing connectivity issues, that's probably why. It was a major annoyance for me the first hour or so of our arrival as I'm in grad school and while I came here for a weekend getaway, I sadly still have schoolwork and need WiFi for school. However, after calling the front desk and going down there once (loads of shout outs to Israel who was super friendly and helpful), they actually sent two tech guys up to the room to see why we could not connect our phones or laptops to the internet. They then set up a router right outside the room and made sure we could connect okay. So awesome.Another complaint I've seen on here is the hot water. It's there, but it takes a while for it to heat up, or at least that's how it was in my room. It's no big deal for me, that's how it is at my house, so I'm used to it. This time of year, I don't take ridiculously hot showers so as long as the water's warmer than tepid, I'm fine.Perhaps the one downside is the mattress. It's not awful or uncomfortable, it just could be more comfortable. I fully admit I'm really fussy when it comes to mattresses so I don't fault them much for this. The mattresses don't seem ridiculously old or anything, they're just not as soft as I prefer. The pillows though are awesome. Super soft, and they have a wide variety of pillows available, including body pillows.There is also a complimentary shuttle available which of course does not take you to downtown, but it does take you to Opryland. Given how crazy the parking is there, that's a huge plus for me. Opry Mills I don't mind, but the hotel is so sprawling...anyway, it's nice to be able to just rely on the shuttle. And the shuttle driver is super friendly, he also doubles as a bellhop. He luckily was right downstairs when we arrived and asked if we needed help with our luggage, he unpacked the car, put everything in our room, and even got ice for us. Super nice.All in all I'd definitely recommend this place and would stay here again the next time I'm in Nashville.Super nice, accommodating staff. I was on a road trip with my 75lb dog and they were so sweet to him. I was greeted with a bag of dog treats and a sign for my door notifying hotel guests and staff that I had a dog inside. They had me fill out an emergency contact sheet for the pet- incase something happened-which I loved. I was able to find a great deal on Priceline. I had such a good experience here I decided to stay here again on my way back and will probably use this hotel for all my trips through Nashville. The rooms are spacious and the parking is secure. Thanks for a great experience!I have stayed here a few times over the past year. A very nice Hotel with some history. Always entertainment in the lounge. Chef Danny does a very good job turning out great food, Take the time to talk to him, he will prepare something special for you.Not impressed with the hipster attempt. The property is old, and they slapped some paint and garish colors around and called it good. The beds are old, the walls are paper thin. There's not a thing about this hotel that we liked. The music could be heard on the 7th floor. If you have the option, look elsewhere. If you end up with it ok Priceline, like we did, sucks for you like it did for usHotel Preston was there for us via Priceline in a last minute crunch with two dogs on I-80. Note: Priceline or any other 3rd party booking site will not disclose the pet fee. Learned this upon check in at a whopping $45 per pet. Sheesh!Check in was smooth, staff was friendly. Priceline booked us in a double double, but the gal at the desk was able to get us into a corner king. Woot woot! Request the same if you can. The extra space, especially if you have pets is totally worth it. Areas that could use a little help:Clean your carpetsDeodorize your roomsProvide more towelsReduce your damn pet fee unless you're gonna use it to actually clean your carpets. Shit is gross. Shoe worthy gross. Really more worthy of 3 stars if you consider that joke of a hotel bar, The Pink Slip. Laughable.I enjoyed the unique decor, big rooms, pillow menu and funky vibe of this hotel.However, both the front desk staff and restaurant were terrible experiences, among the worst I've had in a hotel.The front desk staff that greeted me were confused about corporate bookings.Breakfast took nearly 45 mins on more than one occasion.Steer clear of this place if you're on business, need fast service, or breakfast. Very disappointed.We weren't very impressed with our stay here. I saw a few complaints about the water and yes it was true after our first night. The water barely got warm. The main issue I had here was a bug infestation as soon as we got there. I told them at the front desk that there were bugs all over the ceiling and they never took care of it. The only positive I had was that the location of the hotel is pretty close to downtown.I loved Hotel Preston - great service, great prices, everything about the hotel was just lovely during our stay.
