It's not in the downtown area and there is actually nothing within walking distance, aside from the lounges & restaurant in the hotel. The hotel is right off the highway though so my friend and I had no issues driving ourselves or taking Lyft, plus we saved about $100/night being away from downtown.+Not your standard hotel and I liked that. No lame hotel stock paintings, you have musical legends on your walls! Red cow-ish looking interior on the elevator. All the decor was not the norm giving this hotel a bit of personality.+The price is right, as mentioned above.+I miss Snuggles! Snuggles was our fish for 5 days and I loved him with all my heart! Other guests better be treating him right! Upon request, you can adopt a fish for your stay. You can also get a rubber duckie. As if those eccentric extras aren't enough, you can also get a lava lamp. +Great room service each day.+Friendly staff both when I called prior to our reservation and there in person.+Because it's in the middle of nowhere, don't expect a fancy view from your room.We ended up adding a day to our vacation and they had no issues making the change the day before we were extending.Hotel recommended while in Nashville, so long as you don't mind staying away from the main area.I ended up having Hotel Preston automatically picked for me when using Priceline.The Great:+ Wonderful staff.+ Fun/quirky design and amenities (think fish and lava lamps).+ On-site bar! The Average:o Linens and mattress were average. o Cleanliness was "good enough", but the room was definitely a bit worn.The Poor:- Terrible food options in the hotel (Look for specific reviews).For the price, and proximity to BNA, the value is quite high.Ok here we go. I couldn't get the Internet to work in the room. Called the front desk 3x and still couldn't get connected. Thy finally gave me a VIP password after an hour of this. I couldn't get connected to the business center computers. Had to talk to them about it. Limited to 15 minutes otherwise you have to pay money. You can print a few pages from the printer (5) and then you have to pay money for it. Hotel food menu is not very big and it's expensive for what you get. Nothing spectacular about the rooms but definitely not the worst. The staff was friendly to me. This place gets one star (0 if I could) because I spent an entire afternoon killing ladybugs and other bugs in my room. Absolutely disgusting. I'm an airline pilot and I spend half the year in hotel and this was ridiculous. Same thing in my other crews rooms. They get in through the poorly sealed dilapidated air conditioners on the room. They were like the plague and never ending. It's too bad I can't share a picture here of all the bugs but please let this serve as a warning.Let me preface this by saying that it is never easy to write a negative review. Some probably think that its a piece of cake, but those of us who try to YELP honestly, well, its far from it. It is even more difficult when you are in a city like Nashville where everybody is so nice. That said, the Hotel Preston did not cut it. Far from it.First the positives.... The room was great. Our window overlooked the runway which for me was neat. I got to have my morning coffee while watching planes take off and land and that's always fun. The staff is very polite just like everybody else in Nashville. That overall made for a positive experience. But that's about where it ends..Now the negatives...1. My girlfriend and I arrived after traveling all morning and decided to grab a shower before we headed downtown. There were only two (2) large towels in the bathroom with the rest being hand towels and the hot water can barely be described as anything even remotely close to hot. If it matters, and if anybody is curious we were on the 6th floor.Out of the four days that I showered, only on my third day did I step into a hot shower and on my last morning when I showered at 430am prior to leaving for the airport was the worst. The shower was almost too cool to stand under.So we finished our showers on the first day and went downstairs to leave so I stopped at the desk and asked if they could send extra towels to our room. The person working the desk asked us "Well, can't I just give you the towels to take up?" No.. obviously we're heading out the door.2. Then there was the dining experience. We decided on our second morning to have breakfast in the hotel. We arrived to find that there were 5 tables occupied in a room of 30. It took about 5 minutes (literally) to have somebody come and seat us, and then took another 10 minutes (again, literally) before anybody came over and even acknowledged our presence, all the time with a waiter and waitress walking past us since we were sitting near the kitchen. The food wasn't bad, but wasn't worth the price.3. Finally, the maid service. We stayed in the room a little late and left at about 12:30 on our second day there. I had a bad ankle for the trip so I wanted to rest up before hoofing it around downtown. We flipped the sign on our door to indicate that the room was vacant and received no maid service that day so we were left with our half dried towels that we had acquired from the front desk the day before. I was kind of frustrating. I spoke with the front desk on our last day before leaving asking for service in our room and it was taken care of that day.Finally, and I had no dealings there, their lounge has a very unfortunate name: "The Pink Slip." No, there are no poles but you might think there are with a name like that!It difficult to give this hotel 1 star just because the majority of their staff was so nice. The experience was very lacking. I'm planning on going back to Nashville in the next 6 months or so, and as of now we have scratched the Preston off of our list of possible places to stay.Stayed here for 3 nights and it was full of ups and downs. Computer systems were down for down for 2 days and never got fixed. Elevators were problem too and took days to fix. The staff was good for the most part but then you get a rude bartender or waiter. Average place at best.The elevator had some uhm... was it dyed animal fur on the walls maybe? And also there were things placed around that seemed to be something artsy, but also related to women's clothing, like bras made out of odd things. I dunno. Played chess in the lobby for a while, hung out at the bar and drank local beers, never did figure out if they have a pool or not. Someone also said your car stands a greater chance of being broken into if you park in the back by the high concrete walls. Oh also the rooms have "spiritual menus" where you can get the holy book for the religion you want. Tried to get scientology, buddhism, etc. but they were basically out of everything other than jesus because deep-south bible belt.
review_content_20: Funky hotel! This place is super-convenient to the airport (although beware! It is NOT on Briley Parkway, but on a side street called "Envious." Seriously.) with a free shuttle. The rooms are enormous. My corner room was seriously the size of a small house. Sadly, the space wasn't used as well as it could have been. A fridge and/or microwave would have made this perfect, especially since there's nothing within walking distance except a gas station.The staff was friendly and the bed was comfy. My only complaint is that the internet is painfully slow. At some times it completely drops out and that can beAs a whole the hotel is great, lots of cool little amenities that wouldn't make me want to stay there but when I did they were cool to have. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Almost too friendly. I was a very late arrival (2 Am) and early check out (8 Am). So I didn't need to know all the great things about the hotel, but they told me anyways, which was almost annoying when all I want to do is sleep.As a whole the place seemed nice. Rooms are average, looks like they took an older hotel and try to modernize it but some parts still look old.This hotel is somewhere between a Holiday Inn and The Renaissance. There are little things here and there that need work like chipped paint, better toiletries. But the decor is unique and a lot of interesting freebies like borrowing a pet fish.In reading some of the other reviews, I didn't have any problems like those that others have listed. My room was clean, no odor, water hot, friendly staff, etc. My only complaint is the noise. None of the doors have soft close latches. Anytime someone walks out of their room and BAM!, the door slams behind them. This is exceptionally annoying when people are coming and going in the middle of the night. Also, I stayed in room 218, which clearly must be located directly above where the live band plays. Sound carries right up through the floor- enough that I could distinguish what song they were playing. Did I call down to front desk to be moved? No- as this is my 4th night here and I'm long unpacked and settled in for the week- and it's 10pm and I'm in pajamas and ready for bed.I ended up at the Preston on a week where hotel rooms in the Nashville area were scarce with some kind of conference in town.Let's start with the positive: hotel shuttle from the airport arrived on time, the hotel is very close to BNA and the hotel front desk, extremely friendly and helpful.Negative: The most uncomfortable bed and I am talking about rock hard! Room service: I ordered a main dish, a drink and a piece of fruit, what came to my room was the main dish and a glass of water, but I was charged for my original order. In addition, this hotel is not for business travelers, too few outlets...the hallways/room decor has a "brothel" feel to it.During the east coast blizzard of 2016, I was stranded and decided to stay at this so called hotel. I checked online and reserved a room for $100.00 for one night with Cheap Hotels.com. Again this was during the blizzard which I could understand when the front desk told me their shuttle services was some how disabled in the snow on the highway, but when I arrived the one and only shuttle was parked in the parking lot. Strike one.... Speaking with the guest service specialist I was told all systems were down and that they were unable to give me a key to my room and since I reserved the room online I was unable to obtain a receipt from the hotel but from where I made the reservation. This is understandable because of the blizzard, but why didn't anyone tell me or inform me when the systems were up an hour later, no phone calls or a knock on my door. I had to make blind trip to the cafe and decided to ask the front desk if the systems were back up. Then and only then did someone give me a key to my room. Strike Two. The last and final issue was the room seemed clean but not at all I saw dead lady bugs on the window seal and on the floor next to the heater. The bathroom toilet dispenser was broken so the toilet paper was left on the floor and there was hair everywhere. Please move on to another hotel.....I had high hopes for Hotel Preston. In retrospect, it would seem the pictures and reviews on Priceline.com are a little too generous. Even still, I considered giving this hotel 3-stars but ultimately, I decided the "A-OK" description tends to suggest I would stay here again, and I won't. First off, the PROS:I found the staff to be extremely friendly, attentive and quick to respond. The pricing was decent considering I've paid three times as much to stay downtown.Being able to order a pet fish from room service was quirky and fun.The CONS:That being said, there is no getting around the fact that despite this property having been redecorated well....it's still just a dated hotel with thin walls, adjoining rooms (hate this when not requested), and window units that lose their cool after running constantly (to cover up the sounds of afternoon delight happening next door.)Furthermore, as one reviewer suggested, Mapquest had me driving in large arching circles and despite writing out instructions, I got lost every single time because of the complex changing of highways. (The front desk was not able to give me any tips on a better route either.) One of the few times I decided to forget the directions and just follow the signs to downtown, I was then able to easily navigate myself to my intended destination. However, based on driving and location alone, I would not return. Their intentions are good and though I won't be back to this particular location, I'd be curious to see what this brand would do with a newer property.The hotel is nice! It's like a old hotel that has been updated with some quirky stuff. We love the decor and the room was very nice with a great view of the city but we could see the a/c unit and parking but the great thing its free so thats a point. It's nice that you need the room card to go up The reason Im giving it 3 stars it's the following:-We got there and the front desk guy looked at us like "What? What you doing here?"-The charge for breakfast-Our a/c was soooooo noisy we couldn't sleep good-Kind of far from downtown were we have our family-Price is too high for what its isIt's ok but not awesomeVery accommodating. We were on a pleasure stay and were not disappointed. I've stayed at a LOT of hotels due to military service, both high and low end and this was a refreshing change.Hotel staff were accommodating and friendlyRoom service was prompt and delicious.Hotel bartenders were friendly and can make a drink even if they've never heard of it. Nice googling bartender :) +1Cleaning staff offered to come as late as 5pm to avoid disturbing us in the early morning hours as we recovered from Broadway street ;). Wifi was easy to connect to, just needed last name and room number. Beautifully decorated in an edgy 1920s feel. Only draw backs were no microwaves or fridge but we ate out every night and soaked up Nashville. Great stay!It's like the place is hungover and yet to recover. Poolside looks like The Afghanistan Hilton, the lobby shabby and less than Chic and the room dingy and tired. The Preston needs a cash infusion or a blood transfusion and STAT.The Preston hotel is worth the price ...the customer service and bedding in my room was great ...also it has a nice ambience ... however the bathroom was small but the room was very spacious ...overall a good experience.I stayed at Hotel Preston because they allowed dogs and were reasonably priced for a dog friendly hotel. I was pleasantly surprised at the room. The room was clean unlike other dog friendly hotels I stayed at, and they gave me a bag full of dog treats and a tennis ball. They also have a doggie room service menu. The restaurant and bar downstairs were also good. I would definitely stay here again when I'm driving through Nashville.This place is very cool! They have a lot of quirky details that made the stay memorable for our family. I loved the art throughout the hotel. My children loved the fact that you can request to borrow a pet during your stay...the kids also took advantage of the lava lamp and free board games. The hotel was clean, beds were comfy, the staff was very pleasant, and a good value for the price. It was also a short drive to the he center of Nashville. Our family would definitely stay here again.Described as a boutique hotel. Pictures online are deceiving. Very dark and run down rooms. Also near airport so you can hear the planes regularly. Not really anything close to get good food either. The lounge downstairs does have live music. Overall the rooms and atmosphere I thought we were getting was not the case.Super friendly and accommodating. Extra pet-friendly. Even for big dogs. Came in drunk and 3am and the person at the front desk offered me a late night menu . You will need a cab to get to the main strip with the bars and such- but staff is more than ready to help you with anything you need. Will definitely be staying here again .We checked into the hotel after midnight after getting their complimetary shuttle from the airport which was nearby. My wife back to sit at the reception desk and it was very pleasant, with the clerk asking her if we were hungry as to who was going to be for us to a food place nearby. Once we checked into our room we started a packing, but I noticed two large stink bugs above the bed. I called the guest services and he probably came up and took care of it, finding several more bugs in the room. Mahmoud the night clerk was very embarrassed and apologetic, promptly offered to get us another room which he did moving us to the 11th floor. The rules identical with a better view and nicer beds lol. The only problem with our stay in the close proximity to the airport. My wife was woken up very early with the departing flights from Nashville International. So is airplane noise bothers you you may want to stay elsewhere. We have breakfast downstairs and thats on my other review. Like the other reviews have stated, the service and hospitality here is very nice, very true about southern hospitality.I stayed at this boutique hotel and enjoyed my stay for the most part. The outside needs a facelift but the inside decor in the lobby, restaurant and bar was trendy, cool and vibrant. The restaurant food was delicious and I ate there everyday, the room service pizza did not taste good at all. They offered a shuttle service that we utilized to go to the mall and other places in the area and the shuttle guys were polite and courteous.Average for the price, rooms needed some updating not nor bad. The Price was reasonable and they location was good for our plans we had while in town. The staff was exceptionally nice from the moment we checked in until the minute we left. I would stay again.I was really excited to stay in this hotel because it was a boutique and I like staying in different types of hotels. But I must say we had a really bad service from one particular person named Denny. When we landed we call for the shuttle and it came immediately which was fantastic but then we were told by Danny we would have to wait until later in the day to get a room when there was nobody in the hotel room. We totally understand the rules of checking but if there's nobody in the rooms I feel like it's fair to let us at least put her bag somewhere when we get in at 8 AM in the morning out of courtesy for staying at the hotel. Denny was very hesitant on this but once we actually arrive to the hotel we met Israel who is super helpful and let us check into a room right away. I will say the service at the bar was quite slow and it took us about 10 minutes to even get a waitress to come over to us with four people in the bar but over all the food was good. As far as alcohol goes they were out of every type of vodka except for one and did not have any limes which we found quite odd for a bar to be missing. I believe the turning point first day was this morning when the ice machine wasn't working and we asked Denny at the front desk to have some ice brought up because we didn't want to go from floor to floor in our pajamas. His response was there's ice on every even numbered floor and if you want it you need to go get it. I responded with is this a hotel? I've never stayed in a hotel where I'm told that I need to go do something when their issues are broken. He was extremely rude and his customer service was the worst in the hotel industry I've ever seen and I have traveled for over 10 years staying in different hotels almost every week. I would suggest that the hotel trains Denny and better customer service as the customer should feel important when they're staying on their premises, and taking one minute out of your time to get ice when you're two ice machines are broken should not be a big issue.Well he left me a massage here as well a message in email to contact him called him ten times and guess what no answer. I can see why now the pageant system that im involved in moved their event next weekend. Heard everyone complained.
review_content_40: Cute place.  My 2 year old was given a pet fish for the night along with rubber duckies, dominoes and a lava lamp! The hotel itself was clean (for the most part) and staff was decent.  I wouldn't recommend the restaurant on site.  The waitress was nice but the food was overpriced and kinda blah.Great customer service. Beds are amazingly comfortable. Hotel is close to everything. Only down side is the rooms are a bit humid.This hotel's attempt to create a rock 'n roll boutique is a swing and a miss. As the guest, you definitely understand the theme they were going for but it fell short. Furthermore, the hotel is gross but more on that later. We arrived around 5:00 pm on Thursday evening, seemed well enough upon pulling into the parking lot. We walked into the hotel lobby and was hit with a smell that can only be described as old with hints of cigarette smoke. Which made me worry because this hotel advertises itself as a smoke free hotel. I digress. We check in and the lobby attendant informs us that there is a $35 hold a night. We've stayed in many cities and it's usually a $100 hold for the length of your stay. That's fine - we are not going to wreck the room. We take the elevator to our room and notice a red substance in the carpet - blood perhaps but we will never know. We just wore our shoes around the room. We walk into the bathroom and notice there isn't a fan. There is also ceiling tiles that one would put in their basement - they are absolutely water logged and threaten to collapse while using the facilities. I don't think I have ever showered faster than Thursday evening. Who knows what lays beyond those tiles. We leave the hotel room around 7:00 pm to eat dinner in downtown Nashville. When we return, there are hundred of ladybugs all over the ceiling - this is not an exaggeration. These are things I don't need to deal with on vacation. I go to the front desk and inform her that there are hundreds of lady bugs in my room. She replies that they are having issues with lady bugs and proceeds to call housekeeping to vacuum the room. She arrives about ten minutes later with her vacuum and asks my husband if he can vacuum the room because she is not able to reach all the bugs. Really? You want me to clean my own room. He ends up vacuuming. I proceed to call Orbitz to get me out of here. Unfortunately, all the hotels were booked in the area. So, we stayed the night. No joke, the absolute worst night's sleep I ever had. I kid you not, you can feel every spring in the mattress. Every time my husband moved, I woke up. I probably slept two hours and I was deathly afraid that a ladybug was going to find a home in my ears. Seriously, I would rather stay in American Horror Story: Hotel Cortez than this place. We checked out early and flew home. I could not stay there another night. Luckily, we didn't have to pay for the other three nights we booked. It's creepy and gross.I've never stayed at an independently owned and operated hotel before and you could tell that it is with the interesting subtleties which set it apart from your standard Holiday Inn or Courtyard by Marriott.It's at the three star level on Priceline.The red fur in the elevator makes you want to cozy up there and relax while you wait on your floor.  The room is nice and SPACIOUS and the internet is good.  Free wifi with customer support backup.  I had to call about getting my iMac connected and they manually forced my internet connection through.The pictures on the wall make you feel like you're at a Hard Rock Hotel cousin, specializing in country music.   There's no laundry facility but there are plenty in the area to choose from.  No microwave or fridge either but hey, if you're smart, you'll bring your own microwave and cooler. There's a considerable upgrade fee if you're looking to get a room on the top floor.It's nice to see three star hotels like this one that are pet friendly.  They're also considerate of the neighbors and isolate pets to the second floor.  There is most likely an additional fee for a pet. The doors are a little slammy but ear plug headphones at night with some ambient music on Pandora do the trick.  This hotel is probably concrete frame because although the walls between rooms are thin, I never hear any bumping or banging around in the adjoining rooms or upstairs/downstairs.There's often live music in the bar next to the lobby.  Guitarists love to come here and practice their music in room as well.  I did hear some music when I was in the bathroom but it was a pleasant sound.  I still kept my headphones on because I like my music even more.  :-)This is a great hotel to socialize in and meet new people.    I wish I had pictures to fully portray the feel of this hotel.  You can tell that the front desk staff care about their jobs immensely because the girl at the front seemed upset for me when there was no luggage cart available at check-out.I'd love to give it 5 stars but the noisy doors and lack of microwave/fridge made me think otherwise.If I could give 0 stars I would, I have stayed in better Holiday Inn Expresses. Hotel Preston (HP) has a lot of issues that at first glance you miss because the places is defiantly a little modern with a little edgy, with a touch of creepy... But all of that is just to hide the disgusting flaws! #1 make sure you get a room on an odd floor(if you must stay here) because evens have an ice machine and pop machine directly across from the room (possibly)  no barrier except your door#2 My shower heat never was really right and the shower made a horrible shareable noise and when your here for a week for work!#3&4 The INTERNET First if you have an apple product forget it, there stuff is so antiquated that you have to be on the phone with the helpdesk for 15 minutes your first night, to get set up for Internet! Then the server shuts down if they get too many guess because it gets overloaded... And every night I was there it got overloaded!!! I travel all the time for business this never happens, completely on acceptable! If you're just passing through for the night this place is fine, but if you're traveling on business this is not the place for you, I would recommend going anywhere else!Found a deal on this hotel through the hotel tonight app. Ample free parking. Front desk was decent. Room was ok - cute and eclectic but the beds were not very comfortable. Shower had good water pressure. The location is close enough to get a $10 uber to downtown. Charlie at the hotel bar was friendly and helpful with suggestions. All in all a decent hotel for the price we paid.The lady at the front desk with the blonde hair was extremely rude she had no interest in pleasing her guests and you can tell she forced a smile and a fake attitude. If you dislike your job that much find another. Our first room smelt awful there was a wet mildew smell coming from the ac unit and the guests on that floor were very loud and disturbing not to mention our towels were still dirty when we had arrived!. The guests on our floor (5th) would constantly scream up and down the hallway and had trash (alcohol bottles, pizza boxes etc) all over the hallway floor. (You'd think management would handle this situation) In all honestly if wasn't for Israel (I believe that's his name) (the maintenance  guy) we would've canceled our reservation and went elsewhere. He went above and beyond to help us feel comfortable. The owners and or managers seriously need to rethink how they handle their hotel as it's going down the wrong road for being in such a big city.A nice hotel with a touch of modern renovation however it is still an older hotel with a slight face lift. Not a fan of the carpets or the cleanliness of ceiling and walls in bathroom/shower. Overall it was pleasant but still needs more than a slight faceliftImagine if 3 12-year boys (best friends) grew up and decided to run a hotel....that is Hotel Preston.  Picked for us by Priceline as a 3.5 (more of a 2.5), it is quirky and weird.  From the furry elevators to the boob lamp (think Christmas Story) to odd choice of pictures in the hallways, it was odd.  I also hated the connecting room doors.  The guy next to us decided to knock in the middle of the night.  Odd.But if you like whimsy, you'll love it.   The rooms were "fine" but very worn (holes in the cloth shower curtain).  The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful so that is a plus.  And we did eat breakfast there and they made a perfect poached egg on my eggs Benedict.  (The hollandaise was broken if I were to critique it.)  It is perfect if you need to do stuff on that side of Nashville because you avoid a lot of the horrible traffic.  So if I needed a quick hotel in Nashville that was cheap, I'd come back.  If I were going to Nashville for a "real" vacation, I'd pass...especially a family trip.Just called to grab some details about the hotel and the rooms offered. Wait on hold for 15 minutes and someone came on the phone and I asked if he could explain the different between the executive room and the suite. He said "a suite is a suite". I said I am unfamiliar with what is considered a suite. He said "you don't know what a suite is?" I said "no, sorry" and he said "sorry, I was just asking" and HUNG UP THE PHONE!Definitely not going here. TERRIBLE customer service.This place is very average and a little corny. There was actual fur on the walls in the elevator. The bed was pretty comfy but the white pleather furniture in the room was very stiff. The pool was pretty nice and there was never too many people there, but was small. It was in a great location from the city. It was a short car ride away which is nice because it wasn't in the middle of the city. The restaurant was very good though. Overall, I feel there is nicer, but for the price this is pretty good.People were nice hotel overall is okay however the mattresses are horrible for a "boutique" hotel you would expect better quality! Spent four days there and my back is killing me because the mattress was hard as a rock.First, prepare for smokey rooms, hallways and elevators even though there are signs everywhere saying non-smoking. Your clothes will smell like smoke when you leave. Second, prepare for bad customer service. You'll be put on hold for everything for at least 10minutes. The rooms are dark and dingy, very humid and the AC is old. The bathroom had cracked tiles, old/gross grouting and the electrical socket was falling out of the wall. You can hear every door on your floor slam shut. The location is not good either, a solid 15min cab ride to anywhere. This hotel is by no means downtown. We called to complain and the manager on duty basically laughed at us and told us there's a two night minimum no matter what. The hotel and service were so bad that we actually left and paid the two night minimum on top of the cost of another hotel to salvage our Nashville experience. Overall, I would never recommend this hotel.The hotel decor is quirky and the staff are all really nice, but it's not in the best area. A little research will tell you that; however, it is very conveniently located close to both the airport and a gas station. The food served in the lounge and for room service are nothing to write home about, but my biggest complaint comes from the cleanliness of our room.     While it all looked okay on the surface, I couldn't help but smell urine somewhere around my bed and couldn't figure out where it was coming from. Low and behold it was ON my bed! My husband and I thought it was interesting that the housekeeping kept a flat white sheet over the duvet cover but didn't take it off until we were making our bed ourselves the day before we left. So gross, they were using the flat sheet to cover up a big, huge, smelly urine stain right on our comforter. It didn't even seem to have been washed or attempted to be removed! Needless to say we didn't use the duvet the last night and luckily it was warm enough for that. Pretty disappointed... Also the free wifi available is nice but it's so incredibly slow and they make you re-log in every 10 minutes.Solid 4 stars. I'm here right now, and this hotel is fine. It is an older hotel which was updated, but who cares? I'll start with the great: staff, all 3 I interacted with- and all front desk- thanks! My room is HUGE. I'm at the end of the hall, and it's an L-shaped room, couch, ginormous closet. Also greats: the complimentary fish or lava lamp (cute!) choice of pillow or religious text, delivered to your room is a cute amenity, though I didn't take advantage.The good: the walls are a little thin, the toilet makes a weird pulsing noise when refilling? Temporary. I got a decent deal on Priceline. (125)The bad: location. If you want to party on Broadway on Saturday night. I didn't want to drive, and it seemed far for a cab. The ugly: it straight took me a half hour to actually GET to this place. Your GPS won't be able to figure it out, and send you driving in circles. The hotel should also list it's "envious" road address, which I got after calling the hotel in frustration.. Also, 155 south= briley parkway. Grrrr. I suspect I was given this pimp room by the guy who helped me... I think he felt bad for me! Thanks.Long story longer, for a short term stay, this place is just fine. Thanks!Hotel Preston is a terrible place to stay. It is in a less than desirable section of town, and it has terrible staff. The front desk staff was more interested in their Internet browsing than they were in their customers. It seemed as though I was interrupting their life.The beds were extremely hard and the room had a strange odor, of which I could not identify. The bathroom smelled of urine (before it was used).We could not wait to get out of there any sooner. We left before 6:30 AM. Their website claims they are such a fantastic hotel, but it is wishful thinking or self delusion. I will not ever stay there again.I think I could have overlooked some of the hotel's outdated and tired building deficiencies if they had sought to serve their customers in a professional and courteous manner. I've never seen such rude service, and I spend more than 50% of my time in hotels.You never get a second chance to make a good first impression. And you rarely overcome poor customer service from the front desk.Discrimination at the bar? well it felt like that to me... but it happened to me last Friday. when i ordered a couple of glasses of wine for me and my wife and the bartender with a ring in the nose, asked me to pay  up front  2 seconds after ordering, huh?  I even didn't have the chance to taste it!!! we just arrived to see the Latin show there...and the bartender did the same to every Latin person...but not to the apparent american white people.  My question is, why have a Latin show and display such discrimination against Latin customers?Our overall stay was good. I was disappointed that there wasn't wifi in the rooms (even for a fee), the halls were VERY dark, the water was REALLY cold and then BOILING hot. We had issues with the room next door one out of five nights we stayed with the slamming of the door constantly but we called and they quieted down. There was a short brown haired lady at the bar that was  clueless. Other than her all the staff was pleasant and prompt. Price to stay was affordable.Horrible! Went for a "girls weekend" and booked on Expedia. The pictures looked great from their website. Got to the hotel and there was trash everywhere outside, nowhere to park, and people were smoking right outside the door. Got into the front desk and it looked dark and dirty. The elevator walls were disgusting and made me feel dirty. Went to the second level and the hallways were very smelly. Smelled like animal and nasty body odor. Went into our room and the room was very dark, the bed had stains on it, the toilet was not cleaned, the chair had a dark stain and a white stain, the window had finger prints everywhere. When asked for a refund the manager was not very pleasant and told us "room service already cleaned it". Finally after an hour of hassle he finally gave us a refund but we then had to talk to Expedia as well (not the hotels fault). Overall, not recommended, and the location was terrible! In the middle of no where.I'm from NYC...I've traveled for years and stayed in many many hotels and even a few motels.  In all my travels I've never had such a bad experience as I am currently having here. Where to start....the nauseatingly musty room that made my sinuses stuff up clearly had to be mold-- so I was moved to another room.  It took 3 rooms to find one that didn't stink.  After calling the front desk for a shuttle to the CVS to get Advil for the headache it gave me...they put me on hold and never picked back up -- so I had to call again only to be told they didn't know where the shuttle was. Ok....Tonight they booked a team of teenage tournament players and instead of blocking a group of rooms for them together -- scattered loud boisterous disrespectful terribly behaving teenagers throughout the hotel.  I have a dorm room with kids running all around banging doors, playing music, screaming through the halls.....and every time I call the front desk:  I cannot get anyone to do anything.  I was literally told they are paying guests and management  has to "balance the needs of all the guests".....as if any guest has a need --or a right -- to be loud and disrespectful.   I've called 10 times -- nothing is changing and its a nightmare.    Their only suggestion is to inconvenience me to move to another room yet again.  I made the mistake of transferring here from the Sheraton Music City, wanting a quaint smaller place to stay.  Omg. Mistake.  The Sheraton is huge had so many more rooms - but they took care of my every need and everything was spotless.  Not recommended at all Unless your low income and this is all you can afford.
review_content_60: I stayed here this past weekend to celebrate my mom's 60th birthday. From the time my parents checked in they were treated with such kindness and were extremely helpful. The hotel is definitely older and in need of renovations.  The decor is very unique including a furry wall in an elevator that clucks like a chicken. However the extra stars go to the great staff. One in particular, krystle, went above and beyond. She gave us various options of things to do, places to see, and recs to eat. If she wasn't sure, she looked it up. We forgot something or needed something, she obliged. What they lack in modern things, they make up for in hospitality. Thank you Krystle for making my mom's weekend wonderful. You are a special person. Thank you to all of the people here who were generally nice...and for the fun fish, lava lamp, and rubber duckies in the room. I'd come back.Stayed here during a short weekend visit to the Nashville area as they were dog friendly. Staff was friendly and eager to please. They treated us very kindly and loved Marco! Our room located on the dog friendly third floor was clean and comfortable but a bit dated. We both enjoyed the pink cowhide elevators, lol! We would stay here again.It's very rare for me to stay at a hotel that does not include breakfast but I really wanted to like Hotel Preston. Although nothing about my visit was bad I highly doubt I will be back. Based on the location and price point I got the impression Preston is competing with the Mariott and Hilton mid brand hotel and trying to stand out with quirky features. The staff is great, very helpful anytime I went to the front desk at night, check in lady was nice too as were the people who brought stuff to our room. The lobby is nice decorated but kind of sexy glam - fun here but not what I would want in my home. At night they have a security guard in the lobby and the elevator requires a room key - I felt very safe! The room upon arrival stood out for being spacious. The room was clean minus a small "item" floating in the toilet - easily flushable but make me wonder where else housekeeping might have skipped cleaning. The furnishings and decor look nice and are just like the web photos but upon in person inspection it's obvious they are not as high quality as photographed to look. Definitely a more modern look than your typical chain. However, the bed was most disappointing. The bedding was a standard comforter wrapped in a white duvet - not at all the plush down material the competitors offer. Mattress quality and comfort was on par with a red roof inn. Good service and cool couches can't make up for lacking in the basic reason I stay in a hotel - having a place to sleep. Nearby competitors offer better beds, breakfast and indoor pools at the price point. Unless rooms came down to $50 a night I just don't see myself coming back.Oh my holy mother of Pete!! This is not a four star hotel! I gave this hotel THREE chances, but let's start from the beginning shall we?! We drove 8 1/2 hours from Raleigh after our wedding to get to this "four star" hotel at 11:00PM.  (We called and let them know we were going to be late.) My husband checked in and right away I saw a stain on the right side bed. GROSS! We went downstairs and Shelby changed our room, but before we moved our bags, we inspected the room.  CLEARLY, the cleaning crew isn't really looking at the comforters, and we found a black marking on our sheets that couldn't really be explained but it looked like a foot print. Um, no...not sleeping in a bed with anything on the comforter.  Call me picky but the knowledge of someone else foot or whatever it was on my bed is not comforting. So AGAIN, we went downstairs a second time and Shelby tried to upgrade us into a corner king room. So, this room is not an upgrade!! It's a hallway of wasted space with the same size room we had before with one king bed. This "UPGRADED" room was the WORST one of them all. There were bugs, there was ANOTHER black marking on the bed, and crazy dusty drapes. I have NEVER seen my husband so mad. I know we are newly weds, but I have lived with him eight years...and he was PISSED!! We just wanted a CLEAN bed to sleep in.So, needless to say we just wanted our money back, but there was NO MANAGER on duty to do this. SERIOUSLY?! What four star hotel doesn't have a manager that can handle theses situation even available via phone?! My husband had to call the next morning from Holiday Inn (where we ended up staying) to find out that the manager who can handle the refund was not available until noon. In the meantime, Chaz or Jazz had me send in the pictures for proof of the refund. Proof?! Really?! I understand there are some shady people there, but THREE TIMES?! You think I would make up something like that up?! Thankfully, I was one step ahead of them and I took a picture in every single room we moved to. He called him two hours later to let him know that the money would refunded within two to five business days. The email of the pictures must have been enough to convince them we weren't lying, but no refund of the sort. My husband later called back and found out that since it was a third party we went through that we had to get it back from them. Way to let us know when he called us back to let us know our money would be refunded! This hotel was NOT up to par and even with our money back my husband is STILL so pissed when it comes up. And manager man, there is nothing you can do to change the fact that my husband and I tried to stay at your hotel the day after our wedding and didn't get the four star hotel experience. PERIOD!My wife and I stayed at Hotel Preston after visiting the Opryland Hotel.  We found the hotel to be clean and comfortable.  The staff was friendly and we enjoyed our stay.So this is the hotel that I won after bidding on priceline. We've stayed here before and didn't care to come back. Well the money was already spent so we went ahead and got our room. We always know that when we get to the front desk the clerk is going to stick us in a double bed room regardless if you ask for a king. They always come up with the excuse, "oh I'm sorry we are out" even though we got there at 3:30pm right after check in started. It's like they want to punish you for getting a good deal on priceline. Anyhow, we got a room on the 2nd floor of the hotel. The room was bigger than average. We have stayed in a lot of hotels all over the United States due to travelling as a military personnel. We were in Nashville for the night and didn't stay in the room that long. We went out to dinner and dancing. Got back to the room after 1am. The front desk clerk greeted us and asked if we were hungry. I asked if the restaurant was open. He said no but he has a flyer for somewhere we can order delivery food from, that he allows to come straight to the rooms. That was cool after a night of partying. We went to bed without ordering anything. Morning came and we were awaken by the guest next to us. You can literally hear everything going on in the room next to you. Walls are very thin. I don't know if we were next to the kitchen on the second floor but we can smell the breakfast from inside our room, which was weird. Other than the lobby, the hotel decor is dated. Stuff is fallen apart in the rooms, the tv needed to be replaced. I thought it was snowing while watching tv. Ridiculous! Bugs and rotted doors. Needless to say I would not walk into this place and book a room. Priceline picked it but I'll most likely choose a different location to bid on in order to avoid this hotel.I I would give this place 2 1/2 stars but it doesn't give the half star option so I went with three because overall our stay was okay. We checked in and when we got to our room they had given us two queens instead of a king(as requested) so after we got that straighten out we got to our room and the complimentary dog food and water bowls that were supposed to be in our room were not so I called the front desk and they said they would bring them up ASAP, we waited over an hour but had to leave for reservations and they never showed up. The entire hotel is outdated and has a smell that I can't put my finger on. We only paused 75.00 a night because of a deal online so we weren't disappointed but if we had paid the normal 150-180 we would have been very upset with the overall stay. Will not stay here again.After getting to town and finding that the reservations we had at Sheraton were no good because they were undergoing renovations we began looking for another Place to stay. The hotel is very funky friendly And the rooms kitschy cool - sort if a retro new wave thing happening that's neat. Beds are comfy and the price was easy on the back pocket if you don't want to be downtownIt was a quirky hotel. The service wasn't bad, but wasn't good either. My room did smell like urine and the smoke alarm went off when we turned the heater on. The lava lamp and ducks added a little sunshine to my not so impressive experience. If you get a better room, I'd say it's a fun stay. I'm not staying again because they didn't change our after a 2 night stay in a stinky room.Very interesting hotel absolutely loved the decor and unique room service options and very pet friendly but we were missing items after housekeeping paid a visit and nothing was done about it when we mentioned it to the front desk; kind of sadI'll make this brief. I'm here now trying to get some sleep before an early morning flight. However, sleep will not come due to all the NOISE here. It sounds like someone rolling a huge cart up and down the hallway and someone slamming doors. There is also some guy in the hall either yelling or talking super loud...not sure which just yet. This is quite possibly the noisiest hotel I have ever stayed at in all of my travels. I booked through Expedia because I got a decent rate. Never again. I have stayed at the Hyatt Place near the airport which was way nicer and quieter. This place is off my list of future airport hotels.My parents stayed here last week and absolutely loved it. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. The hotel made a mistake on one of their nights and booked them on the same floor as an entire frat. It was a very loud and obnoxious night for them. But the hotel was quick to admit their mistake the next day and immediately moved them to a new room. They were very happy with their stay and will definitely be using Hotel Preston in the future. Thank you!The first red flag were the shady folks outside this hotel smoking weed and cigs. Felt really trashy.  The hotel felt dirty and no class at all.  My phone and air conditioner in my room didn't work to boot. Will not come back!   Don't get me started on the coffee2 words...NEVER AGAIN!! The only reason I give 2 stars is because they have great staff. Other than that, looks (pictures) are VERY deceiving. My wife and I stayed here for 3 days and it was horrible. We just felt dirty staying there. Yes they have made some nice renovations and the overall look is pretty cool, but this place is grungy. There were a couple spots on the floor in my room that were wet, the bathroom door was rotted at the bottom with a fresh paint job, the complementary robes had stains on them...Need I say more?Was in Nashville for one night and booked the hotel through Groupon. The young woman at check-in was super nice and voluntarily wrote out a list of must-sees and best restaurants, even giving $ notations for price ranges. The hotel itself was nice and clean, after getting over the decor. We felt like we were in a 70s porno or something - very weird vibes. Overall, not a bad experience and only 15 minutes from downtown, so it was very convenient.Well my first experience  with this hotel was getting to wait for over an hour for the airport shuttle. I would not have waited so long if every time I called (4 times) they said the driver was 5 minutes away. Needless to say, I ended up getting in a cab finally. I then asked to speak to a Manager to pay for my cab ride. The manager instead gave me $30 voucher for food/drinks, which was very nice. But this hotel is just a mess. The food isn't that good & there is not enough staff in the restaurant. The room decor is fine but outdated. I also had no hand towels in my room. All in all, it's a fine place to stay for business but NOT for tourists. Very inconvenient. You can't walk anywhere. You have to take cabs everywhere unless you rent a car. I didn't love it at allNot impressed, Hotel Preston. After driving literally for 13 hours straight to get here, I had hoped for a better experience than what I got. Upon first glance online, the hotel seemed chic and all about customer service. Upon arrival, not so much. Exterior of the hotel looks aged. Front desk staff, while friendly, was short and not very knowledgeable. Decor was modern in the front room and lobby, but not too impressive in the remainder of the hotel. Room was clean, but had a slight scent of smoke. Room decor was OK, some modern accents in an otherwise normal hotel room, and a cool headboard. Bathroom was clean and Aveda products were provided. Checkout was uneventful.Problems: hotel service menu is not very organized; presentation looked cheap and it seemed to have pages missing. Room service, while very fast, does not tell you clearly that a $3 delivery charge + 18% gratuity is added to your total, along with tax. The receipt is not itemized so you have to catch it immediately, otherwise you won't know why it cost so much without calling to ask (which I had to). So while my grilled chicken breast and side salad was sort of yummy, it was not worth $23.90 (originally $16) plus the generous tip I added on before realizing how the total was calculated.Details on food: half of chicken breast was tasty while the other half was super dry and hard. Side salad was great, served with a tomato/bacon dressing. Roll was hard on the outside and soft, but dry on the inside (how does that happen?!). Fries were plain and good.I would summarize this place to be a clean and safe place to stay for the night, but not anywhere to be excited about staying even though their website makes you think otherwise.Three stars = A-OK and that totally captures the Hotel Preston experience.  I had a friend come into town for a Gaylord Opryland based meeting and encouraged her to stay at Hotel Preston instead of the chaos that is Opryland. I had heard good hipster buzz on the Preston but have to say, I was underwhelmed. I knew they were going for the 'too hip to care' vibe but the low ceilings and really bad carpets weren't needed.  There are the cute 'pick your own pillows' and lava lamps and a nice bar.  In general, I would stay here if I had to be based around Opryland or the airport (with a car, of course). I'd be sure to score one of the many onlne deals to make this worth your while.This place was mediocre but that's what I get for paying $75 per night, I guess. The first room we checked into had stained sheets (gross); I called and got switched to a new room but the fact that they offered up stained sheets to begin with was a huge turn off. Unfortunately, I had prepaid and therefore was stuck there for two nights. There weren't any other big issues but I was surprised that the front desk staff didn't offer any kind of added response other than to allow me to switch rooms. Another turn off was that when I called up the front desk to ask for a bottle of water, I was told that I could either go to the vending machine (I didn't have small bills) or that I would have to wait until the restaurant opened.Some cool things, on the bright side, were that they delivered a fishy to our room upon request! :)Not a bad place but not worth the price. The hotel had funky and  gothic looking decor. The hallways to this hotel is outdated and it looked creepy. This hotel made me feel like I was on the ghost busters movie. I been to some really bad hotel stays here in Nashville, but this one is so far decent. My cabin was big and was comfortable but still a bit creepy . Everything looked clean and the bed linens were soft. The mattress was hard, my husband was very uncomfortable. The water pressure was great I didnt want to get out od the shower. The room was a bit stuffy but has gotten cold real fast as soon as we turned on air conditioner.  Don't order room service they charge 3.00 delivery fee and you have to pay a 15 percent graturaties on top of what ever you order. The menu is kind of  pricy,  honestly you are better off eating at a restaurant close by for the same price. This hotel is not far from downtown, it took us 15 minutes.
review_content_80: Got a great rate directly via their website. Smooth check in process they had out room ready a little bit earlier than check in time. We found the lobby clean but the elevator was a little stuffy.Our room was clean and a good size! Clean sheets, plenty of pillows. The TV service wasn't very good at all, but we were out of the room most of the day so that didn't really matter. Nice water pressure in the shower our only bathroom complaint was the door was in an odd spot so that it was hard for more than one person to be there at a time. Over all a very good experience and we would for sure go back!Best management hands down! Apon arrival hotel met the expectations mentioned online until we met Willis. He truly showed the meaning of southern hospitality and was very well dressed. We stayed all around the world in some of the best hotels but the staff here was one of a kind and always accommodating. If you want to know where to go at night talk to the night staff and if your looking for activities in the day ask the day staff. Among the many great things about the hotel the best was Willis found an item of mine that I thought went missing, and took the time to wish us a safe trip home. All around pleasant experience would definitely stay here again!!!Staying here for a conference, the hotel was very accommodating for the conference attendees. However, there are many issues with this hotel.First, it's close to the airport--and that's great. But there is a lot of noise from flying planes and there aren't a lot of restaurants nearby. It's a commute or taxi ride to the nearby restaurants. The hotel does have a friendly van service, but location is still key.The hotel's restaurant is /terrible/. I'll review that separately, but paired with the above comment about location--it stinks to stay here for multiple days. Don't eat in the hotel's poor restaurant.The rooms and hotel have been renovated and that's great. But the housekeeping staff doesn't do a great job at keeping things clean. My shower was full of mold and mildew, and the housekeeping staff didn't restock soap in my room, nor refill my toliet paper, nor refill the tissue dispenser (they did at least leave a box for me to replace).The towels were threadbare and falling part about 50% of the time.If you need to stay here for a night, that's fine. But, definitely don't view this as a destination in Nashville.My stay at Hotel Preston is about my fourth. I originally stayed here a couple of years ago when using Priceline to find a hotel. This visit was due to a company function being held at Hotel Preston, so it was convenient. My room was clean and what I needed. I did have a hard time finding a place near the bed to charge my telephone and laptop. (It would be nice to have outlets that are easy to get to other than the desk lamp). I had dinner at the restaurant. I remembered that the food was good, and I was not disappointed. I ordered the balsamic chicken which was amazing. Service was wonderful...a very attentive staff.There is a lounge adjacent to the restaurant, so it gets loud once the band starts so if you are looking for a quiet dinner, eat before the band gets going. I needed a corkscrew so I visited the front desk to borrow one and was directed to the bar. The female bartender was not able to loan me a corkscrew and said I could either bring my bottle to the very busy bar, or to the restaurant which I was not interested in doing either. I went back to the front desk and they were able to find one from the restaurant. I felt as though the bartender just didn't want to bother with me. If I weren't a loyal diamond guest at another hotel chain due to my business travel, I would stay here again. Again, my stay was due to business at the hotel however, I HIGHLY recommend this unique hotel and encourage anyone to try the restaurant.We just arrived and checked in with ease! The Hotel Preston was very very easy to get to from the interstate. The staff are extremely friendly and courteous. The hotel is clean and the property well kept. Our room is on the 10th floor and overlooks the pool. As soon as I grabbed the tv remote, I noticed a hand written note from the front desk manager welcoming us... a very nice touch! The room was nice and cool when we walked in and the room and bathroom are very clean and comfortable. Last week, I sent an e-mail to the GM to ask him if the hotel had a mini fridge available for my wife to store breast milk for our infant son. (I read online that the rooms don't have mini fridges) Thank you Hotel Preston for having the fridge waiting for us in our room. This will be a huge help during our stay! I looked over the restaurant menu and the prices seem appropriate. I peeked into the restaurant and also the bar downstairs and they both looked very clean and inviting. Cons: the hallways are warm.... As long as I don't have to sleep in the hallway, I couldn't give a you know what!Great experience so far!I tried to change my reservation to one night later and pay for an upgrade. The hotel refused to move it. Also, they would not give any refund for cancellations and I paid up front. Overall, the customer service was very poor and unaccommodating. I won't stay here.Definitely NOT a 3.5 star hotel, but apparently Hotwire.com seems to think it is! A/C unit is #304 started smoking when I set to "E/Save", then they only have ice machines on every other floor but don't tell you that until you come all the way down to the lobby after walking the whole floor looking for it. On a more positive note, the 2nd floor smells like a strip club...that's the only reason they get the extra star in my rating!Just got back from a 3 day stay at the Hotel Preston, and I definitely enjoyed it! It's a very nice hotel, close to the airport, close to downtown, the rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable, staff friendly and helpful. I would give 5 stars if our room had a fridge and a fan in the bathroom to pull out the moisture while you're taking a shower, but that's alright, I still really enjoyed my stay, and I would definitely go back there again.We stayed at Hotel Preston for 3 nights. There are better areas to stay in Nashville, such as Downtown or the West End by Vanderbilt, but everything in those areas was booked. I see this hotel/location as more of an overflow place than a destination. Here's the good and bad for Hotel Preston:Good1) Bar Lounge on site had live music every night we were there.2) Free Parking3) Didn't notice any airport noise (they are right next to the airport)4) Front desk staff was friendly.Bad1) Bathroom door was sticky, reported to staff but it wasn't cleaned properly. Maybe it is the paint finish on the door, but still gross.2) Price of $172 per night after taxes was pricey for the quality/location3) No Refrigerator4) Zoneline style AC was noisy5) Towels were like sandpaper6) In room coffee carafe was dirty, I reported and they gave me one that had a chunk of glass missing from it, reported that, and they gave me a stainless steel one.7) Room doors make a loud noise when they close, which is jarring at night, so I wore ear plugs.8) No King size beds available for us.9) Carpet in room had stains.10) Location is not close to attractions or restaurants. No shuttle to downtown, only the airport.All in all, not terrible, but more of an $80 per night place. A shuttle to downtown would have been a big plus.This hotel seems like a fish out of water. It has that rock & roll vibe a la Hard Rock but it's in Texas and near an airport. Yay for free parking and internet wifi. I hate when so-called nice hotels gouge people for services that should be included in the room rate. I'm talking to you 4+ star hotels! Back from my tangent. I love the cute amenities! A free rubber ducky for your bath. Borrow a lava lamp to set the mood. Milk and cookies if you like but it's not free. Temporary fish pet when you need some company. Mines was named Charlie. He was quiet and laid back. Good listener too!The room decor is cool. The walls are a bit thin. I don't want to know what my neighbours are doing. The soaps are nice but nothing to write home about. Bathrobe was nice but don't steal it.The pillow menu was a nice comfy touch. Must be a new trend because I've seen in other hotels too. Now, the religion menu was a hoot! Seriously it covered 99% of world religion even Scientology! I didn't partake but it was entertaining. Charlie and I had a good laugh.One annoying thing (but maybe not for others) was the elevator, it requires your room key every time. I'm sure it for security sake but when it's late at night and you just want a soda....I liked what it had to offer and if I could I'd give it 3.5 stars. But it had annoyances that couldn't justify a 4 star rating. Would I come back? If Priceline gave me another good deal, sure.5 stars to Charlie fish!It's an older hotel that has been redone. It's rough around the edges in places. They will give you a rubber ducky and a fish companion while you are here. Overall not bad really. They need to pay attention to the little details and they would get a higher rating from me!Last Wednesday, my family and I ate at the restaurant at Hotel Preston. Chef Danny made an AMAZING meatloaf plus the meals that my family had. We felt welcome and like family when we couldn't decide if we wanted to eat at the Pink Slip or the restaurant. Well, we tried both places and while both of them were wonderful, it made it easier to have conversation in the restaurant. I know I'll be back there again!This is the best place to stay in Nashville if you're traveling with pets. We take our dog everywhere so my husband and I stay here whenever we are in Nashville. We like it because not only is it pet-friendly but they really make that its "thing." Whenever we come in with our dog, they give her a gift bag with a toy and various dog treats as well as a list of all the dog friendly restaurants and dog parks in Nashville. Yeah, they don't have a breakfast but there's a great breakfast buffet a five minute drive away at Ellendales and we can bring our dog. :)No steve it has not been worked out. Your staff is pretending it has been fixed but it has not.Discuss with them, they seem to have ALL of the answers.2 stars for Reza, the transport valet! While the hotel is OK at best with the static in their "HDTV," Barbara, the crappiest bartender ever, and having NO water for 2 hours when we checked in...Reza was the ONLY breath of fresh air after a four hour drive from race week at Bristol. Without water, there was no shower, no brushing of the teeth, no coffee, no peeing or washing of the hands. Add to that no fridge or no microwave? WTF did we pay for for ONE night? Sadly, we missed out on Nashville for St. Patty's Day.....thanks, JERKS! Wish I had my $315 back!I love the Hotel Preston, and stay there every time I'm in Nashville. I don't know my way around the city, but this seems like a prefect location, five minutes from the Ryman, the same from Broadway and Church, and about fifteen minutes from Vanderbilt. The hotel has kind of a funky, hipster vibe. (I hope youlike red!) There's fun art in the lobby, great pictures in the hallways and in the rooms, and more, if you care to go looking for it. The rooms are very large and comfortable, though they lack mini-fridges and microwaves. Hey, you're in Nashville. Go out and have fun! The staff is very friendly and they know where to point you to maximize your leisure time in Nashville. To cap everything off, the hotel is shockingly affordable. I highly recommend the Hotel Preston.We found a great deal on this hotel through Priceline on our recent stay in Nashville. I must say that the pros definitely outweighed the cons of some people's reviews for us. When I booked the room it actually booked two queen beds instead of a King that I thought it had said in the listing. When we got there and checked in I realized this and asked the front desk if it was possible to switch, I am almost 9 months pregnant and the staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating in switching us to a King suite at no additional charge! The large, comfy bed definitely made a big difference in my comfort level. The room was clean, inviting, and comfortable. The pillow menu was a really cool addition. The only downside was the older wallpaper in the bathroom that was peeling and the drop ceiling in there had some water stains. However I did enjoy the rainforest shower head. As for the airport being close by, I did not find this an issues as planes stop flying in by 9pm and don't start flying out in the morning until around 8 so unless you sleep late and very lightly (the sound is muffled), you shouldn't have a problem.We will definitely stay there again, especially if we can get a great deal like before.My room wasnt anything special but it had what we needed. At first I was thinking the styling of the hotel was very artistic. I liked it. What sealed the deal was the hotels driver james. Not only did he take us wherever we wanted, but he gave us a tour and even took a picture of me and my son in front of the dukes of hazard car. Drove us to the opry mills mall and later picked us up. Great guy. Would definitely stay again. Also we got a lava lamp and beta fish in our room at no charge. Ask for them!Very ugly. Nothing like what the pictures made the hotel out to look like. There amenties were lava lamps and rubber duckies. Really?? My boyfriend and I are 30 something not 10.The bathroom looks good- until you walk in and see the shower where tiles have mold on them and looks like it is in need of an emergency renovation. For $130 we didn't have a refrigerator in the room. Hotel was very rundown and walls were thin, got woke up at 2 am by some partying young adults. The one star is for the comfortable bed. Needless to say we will not be coming back.We found them on priceline and was able to have 2 beds/$62 a night. The trendy hotel has very friendly staff at the front desk who even offered my little dog a treat bag upon our arrival. There's a $45/ pet fee. Plenty of parking is available and it seems they offer a shuttle too. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and glad we discovered them on Priceline.

review_content: Nice hotel. Clean, nice amenities. Staff was friendly, drinks were good at the bar. We didn't eat at the restaurant. Good location.Few issues, which aren't major but were an annoyance. We stayed on the second floor with a balcony, also across from the workout room. When the live music is playing, the balcony is great. Otherwise we had no use for it. The open area atrium lounge/restaurant created noise..both at night and in the morning. So that was a disturbance while we tried to sleep. The room had no alarm clock, or clock. There was no booklet in the room that shows the local info, room service options, etc, which has always been helpful when we stayed at other hotels. Also lacked a Do Not Disturb sign..so we had to seek one out. Heard noise when people were working out..I assume it was from the weights. But that wasn't often.Would stay here again..just on a different floor away from the open air lounge.What a dump this place is. One pole with working parking lot lights should have been a tip off from the outside. I've never spent time in prison but after a night in a room here I felt like I had. Toss in the foul odor carpet glue or epoxy fumes and I was happy to have to leave for the airport extra early. I don't expect the Four Seasons but basic cleanliness, a lit parking lot, and air free of chemicals isn't too much to ask. The staff was friendly at leastThis was not a good experience. The hotel staff was decent but the accommodations were sub par. We had water leaking from our bathroom ceiling and the tub wouldn't drain. Won't ever stay there again.The hotel has a nice lobby. Good live music in the bar but it smells of smoke pretty bad so I didn't stay long. The rooms were clean but in need of a renovation. The tv's are really really old.Exactly what you'd expect from a holiday inn...comfortable bed, clean hotel room, and great service. The only downside is that there is not hot tub, and no breakfast. Overall a very comfortable stay in NashvilleI have been traveling a TON for work. This property is older but is under much needed renovations. If that would bother you then move on. I have never been awakened by noise or chatter. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The daytime and early evening front desk professionals are truly appreciated. They have always been on point with suggestions and make checking in and out a great experience. The restaurant/lounge and possibly kitchen really needs more hands on deck. It is very courteous but slow service. You end up spending a whole lot more time in there than you want to. The food is decent but not a standout. It is priced normally. I would say the property is more than likely well managed. Like all things in life, there are the negatives as well. A couple of middle aged to older overnight and very early morning males I have dealt with there were just plain rude. Being treated like an inconvenience is not anywhere on my list of priorities. And if people deal with the public then their attitude should be pleasant and helpful... not snotty and apathetic. I don't think they represent the IHG brand well at all. If they were my only points of reference to this property I would honestly stay with Marriott who is my other preferred brand. I don't appreciate giving my business to a company that doesn't appreciate my choice to stay there and spend money there. But as I have stated previously, my overall experiences have been good.I will be interested to see the property once all the renovations have been completed. I am giving this property four stars instead of three because currently the rooms are priced extremely low due to the age of the property and current renovations. (That's just my guess) That is a huge plus when you manage an expense account. The daytime and evening (sans the overnight) front desk professionals are top notch. And the restaurant/lounge people are great.Staff was great. Very friendly and accommodating to what we needed and if they could they would! We were booked in a smoking room thinking we could handle it but Wow! It was as if housekeeping had a cigarette lit as they were cleaning our room and it continued to stay at that strength throughout the night. I could not sleep, had to cover my nose and mouth to use as a filter. I wish I was exaggerating but I am not. The room was old too. Stained tile in the bathroom - do not know how you can stain tile but it was! Cigarette burns in the sheer curtain, darkened carpets in the room. We asked if they had any non-smoking rooms available but they were completely booked that night but to come back in the morning. Thank goodness we were able to move rooms but the smoke smell seeped into my clothes and hair already. Our new room was MUCH better! The rooms are older and it looked like they were about to update their hotel. It is close to the airport - about 5-10 minutes away. Couple of exits away from The Opry and about a $20-$25 cab ride to Broadway.Stayed here overnight on the way up to Louisville KY. Renovations are still continuing, and I was assigned a room not too far from where the work was being done. It was finished for the day at a decent time. Despite the noise from the nearby highway, I did get a good nights sleep. Complimentary parking and Wifi. No microwave nor refrigerator. Not someplace I would stay for a long time, but overnight is fine. Good access to SR-155 Briley Parkway, both North- & South-bound directions. It is alright for a short stay and proximity to someplace close is important. I would continue my search for another IHG property.SHAME ON YOU, HOLIDAY INN!!!! Hands-down, the grossest Holiday Inn I have ever stayed at (and I stay at HI or HIE nearly weekly for business travel). It looked decent on the exterior facade, and it was reasonably priced compared to other hotels located near downtown Nashville. Other than that, it was just a bad experience. Checking in at the front desk was an ordeal, I waited minimum 20 minutes.The noise level is horrible, and I did not even bother checking out the hotel restaurant. I will keep it short and sweet, and not wax too much on how awful the accommodations were. My first room was so bad (hairs on the toilet!) and the lights and clock did not even work, that I had to go back down to the desk, wait in line again, and request a new room.The second room was not much better, however the lights did work this time. The beds were horribly made, The cleaning staff must have been drunk or something when they made them. The carpets were so dirty and stained, seriously, they all needed to be ripped out, the rooms fumigated, and the interior completely repainted and re-carpeted. Again, please note the pictures I took of my room. Oh, and the stupid toilet would not even flush. You had to flush it, and hold it down, at least 2 to 3 times (and no, this is not due to some gastrointestinal issue on my part). Hrrrumph.The place was so bad, that suffice to say, I checked out two days earlier than I had originally scheduled. Just a disgusting place, after I left, I felt like I needed to take a boiling hot shower in disinfectant. I totally deserve quadruple or quintriplet rewards points for suffering a stay at this wretched death trap.First visit to Nashville and this hotel. The shuttle was waiting when I got to the airport and he was supper nice Had lunch in the atrium bar kinda weird set up the chicken strips were pretty good and the bartender was friendly and cheerful Had no hot water to take a shower i reported the problem and they sent a repair man while i was at dinner. He left a note to let the water run for 3-4 minutes to let heat up. So wasteful! I did let run for that long and it finally warmed up. The room was ice and the wifi worked great and the bed was comfyOn our was to Savanna stopped here for the night. The front desk staff was very nice. We took the shuttle van to town $10 each round trip. Could have parked cheaper. It worked out just fine. The ice machine outside our room was leaking looked like all day. There was a fan blowing to try to dry it up. At 10:00 they decide to use a industrial wet vac. I call the desk and she wants to argue with me saying that they just found out about it. The AC was very loud too. Bed was comfortable enough. Nashville is a great town this won't keep me from returning.I'm kind of surprised at the poor reviews this Holiday Inn gets. Our room was fine. No stains or grossness. Sure, the decor and building itself seem dated (90's-ish), but when I was there, they were in the process of renovating and updating. In my experience this hotel was clean and comfortable. Although the room did smell a little musty. I thought it was weird that our room didn't have a window to the outside. Instead it had a window (and balcony) that went to the lobby. Very odd and meant there was no natural light. I wouldn't stay at this hotel if I was wanting a luxurious getaway, but as a place to sleep and shower, it was good.A average hotel with gift shop and slightly modernized rooms. Tall green room where breakfast is served. Breakfast is a top off with three separate sections for $4.95 or whole buffet for $14. If you're like us, you can't eat sausage or bacon without scrambled eggs (separated in buffet). No grits. Seems like they have good rates for conventions because something was going on Sunday afternoon and Monday morning.About 6 weeks after my initial stay at this Holiday Inn, my wife came along to do more house hunting. The location of the hotel was my primary deciding factor the first time around, and unfortunately for us I made the same decision for round two. The carpeting in our room was even more stained than the last time. In fact, the whole room felt old and murky. It was functional, but not pleasant.Our tub barely drained. By the time I finished drying myself, put on clothes, and brushed my teeth, only about half of the water had drained from my shower. I also experienced the same water temperature problems as during my prior stay. The bathroom comes complete with a heat lamp, which is great except I rented a hotel room not an Easy Bake Oven.When I stayed 6 weeks earlier, only 3 of 4 elevators were functional. This time, the same elevator was still busted (or at least busted again).The more I examine this place, the more certain I am that it's an old (really old) Intercontinental Hotel that they've rebranded as a Holiday Inn. That would make perfect sense since both hotel chains are owned by the same parent company. Despite its location, I wouldn't stay at this hotel again, nor would I recommend it to anyone else. Awful, just awful.My family and I were in town for a show choir competition this past weekend. The lobby was VERY underwhelming. Even though construction is going on - it was not an inviting space to walk into. The two men behind the front desk were very helpful when we later asked for dinner recommendations.
