Our first room was OK - the hot water didn't work at all. It was one of the newly renovated rooms so it was not dingy, but it looks like they just sloppily finished remodeling the room. We had a mechanic come & fix the room and much to our surprise... when we arrived back at our room later, the mechanics had LEFT THE DOOR OPEN ALL DAY. All of our belongings were still in the room and could have easily been stolen. After housekeeping came on the second day, I found footprints (that were not there when I left) on my pillowcases! We ended up staying an extra night due to the terrible ice storm but went to another local hotel for the entire day to lounge and spend the day and eat 3 meals. No good place to hang out at this hotel unless you stay in your room or go to the dingy lounge/bar that reminds me of a bad 80's movie.This hotel is still under construction, but besides a little rerouting of the lobby, this didn't seem to cause any issues and the new rooms look nice.Most of the desk staff were very kind. Except one. Mai-something? We used points to purchase the room for two nights and were told by reservations that we would have breakfast for $4 per person each morning. When explaining this at check-in, Mai told us that was impossible and that the people who worked in reservations were "just stupid." So no breakfast? Okay. Waffle House it is then.The room was freshly remodeled which was nice. The bathtub did not drain. It took about an hour to completely drain after a shower. The faucets were also backwards (ie hot meant cold and cold meant hot). Until we figured this all out, we had a few showers of standing in 8 inches of ice cold water. Fun. We called down to the desk after the first shower like this and they said someone would be "right up." Two days later, we had yet to see anyone.Finally did get the hotel breakfast on our last morning there, around 9:00am. The hot food was cold and standard. Depressing that we even paid anything for it. This would have been a free breakfast at any other hotel. The hotel gives you the opportunity to help save the environment by hanging a little card on the door that says not to change the linens. Apparently this actually means "do not clean my room at all." The beds were not remade, the trash not removed, the coffee cups not replaced, nothing. Also, that drainage problem in the bathtub noted above? Leaves majorly gross soap scum and piles of hair. Nasty. Never cleaned either.So all in all here, the hotel was incredibly average. Not great, not awful. Probably would choose a different hotel if I ever returned to Nashville.No bottled water available outside of room service hours. All the vending machines are empty and the front desk was not accommodating at all. The "newly renovated" rooms have extremely loud air conditioners, to the point of startling me awake every time it kicked on. I would never pay to stay here... Unfortunately I was stuck here on a work trip.Our stay at this Holiday Inn was so refreshing after a night in an Econo Lodge in Memphis!Here's the deal: we drove from Chicago to Nashville and stayed in Nashville for 3 nights. Since we had a car with us, we didn't want to pay the steep parking fees at downtown hotels. Since we were trying to be reasonable with price, all of the downtown hotels were just too expensive. So I got on Priceline.com, bid on hotels, and got our 3 nights here for $55 (plus tax) per night. I don't know what the price was if I didn't bid, but for $55 this was a DREAM. And parking was free.The location is fantastic! We didn't need to be downtown, all of our destinations in Nashville were a 10 minute drive or less. The room was very clean and our towels were replaced as needed. The beds were comfortable with multiple pillows. The bathroom and decor was modern. I felt totally comfortable staying in this hotel. I would recommend it to my friends and family, or I would stay here again if in the area.My only complaint is there wasn't a fridge or microwave in the room, which would have been helpful for any dinner leftovers. But truthfully, we didn't really need it.Stayed there Oct 2-5, 2014Frond Desk employees were nice and new, but didn't tell about us about room incidentals until after they put a hold on your card. The rate is $30 a night.. Smoking rooms is on the 5 floor should bring a candle, however the room wasn't to bad with smoke smell, but the hallway gave it away that you were in the smoking area.The gift shop way overpriced for everything.. Sunglasses $99, but you can buy them online for $20... Vitamin water was almost $4 which you can buy it for $1.59 in most gas station so stock up on your snacks and drinks.. Check out was a breeze bell boy will come to get your luggage.I am giving this hotel 3 starts because I was lied to by the reservation clerk I told him my flight gets in at 9 he said he would have a room booked for me by that time I get in to the front desk and they tell me I gotta wait until 12 but I was told 9 so I am tired from my flight sit wait on a room
review_content_20: Unlike a few other reviews, you are better off staying somewhere else for the time being. This is an old property that was and is in desperate need of renovation. Yes they are working on it and it is a mess. I didn't check reviews before reserving here on a road trip, looked fine on the outside. Not so on the inside. The staff was very friendly and shuttle driver will take you anywhere. The 10th floor hot water took forever!  Room ok, just old and dated.  Just plain dirty in hallways, elevators, you name it. This is not a $175 per night place. Maybe half of that would be appropriate until it is fixed up.This hotel is a little out dated but they are doing construction. Had a WONDERFUL experience with the staff. They were very nice and accommodating on short notice. Cornelius had wine and complimentary food send to my food because it was my birthday. He went out of his way to accommodate us and to make sure our stay was pleasurable. They gave us an excellent rate on the room and I could not be more pleased! The staff and excellent customer service more than makes up for the outdated rooms. Thank you to the staff and I will definitely be back to see the updates!!!Seems unclean and  very unpleasant,  I have stayed there twice and both times they had been doing renovation work and had the water turned off.  When I went to turn on my faucet it was spraying out grey black water.  The visits were 2 moths apart & the  hallways were  dirty, not vaccumed.  the room they put me in seemed  like the bed was made in a hurry and unkempt.  The first time I was there the staff at the desk wasn't friendly at all.  They told me that the Shuttle driver didn't have time to take me  anywhere.  When I told them my sink was plugged up in my room, they said the maintenance guy had alot on his list and would get to it when he could........Mainly this Holiday Inn seemed dirty.Awful. Bed bugs, horrible front desk, thin walls... the list could go on. DO NOT STAY HERE!They didnt have the king bed we reserved. The first room we checked into smelled like smoke. Tgis place is disgusting, unkept and gross. I searched yhe entire rest of the area for another hotel room but because of the convention we're here for everything is booked.the toilet runs randomly. This place is gross! DONT STAY HEREBed was comfy but this hotel needs a remodel or tear down. Room did not look all.that clean. There was ejaculate on the head board. Gross!We used Hotwire to book our hotel- using the four star hotel filter. While we're disappointed Hotwire selected this hotel (not a four star hotel), we understand rooms were tight since it was CMA's this past week. The room faces an interior courtyard that hosts the pool and the breakfast dining area. It was impossible to sleeping through the noise of children yelling while swimming and families talking loudly. The noise started early, around 6-7 am. One morning we were awoken at 8:45 am by knocking at our door for housecleaning. I've never been waken up that early for housecleaning. If you can avoid staying here, you're better off somewhere quieter.This was my first time using you Global Airport Parking in Nashville and at this location, but not using this type of service. I was very happy with the ease of G.A.P.'s website and the entire Holiday Inn(BNA) Check In+ Out processes.This trip, I arrived during a severe thunderstorm + had left my dome light on.  After 9 days, of course the battery was dead, but within 25 minutes the problem was solved. I WOULD SUGGEST that the Shuttle Driver actually waits for the customer to start their vehicles before driving off...that would been nicer and saved me 20 minutes of walking and waiting in 89 degree weather.  Sadly, I had given the chap a $5.00 tip BEFORE I remembered to ask to have him wait (and he was driving off when I discovered the problem).  I think, that this time, the hotel is not use to the system and have yet to enlighten their drivers.  Work in progress but very glad they are here & will use again.Long term parking at Airport was $11 a day.  A cab from airport to office building on Elm Park a few blocks away $38.00.  9 days using this (with taxes & tips) $42.50.  Priceless!Where to start with this hotel.  Only reason it gets one star is the fact that we were able to get a room during CMA Fest weekend. Room - Always great staying in a hotel that has black mold in the bathroom.  That stuff is toxic and yet it was there both on the ceiling and the floor.  Toilet was old and crusty.  Was scared to sit on it.  Lovely!Maid Staff - Got woken up at 8am not by a knock on a door rather than a loud conversation coming from outside our room by the maid staff.  I guess having the "Quiet Sign" on the door doesn't work from the outside. Lobby -  What is the point of not being able to smoke in the hotel when the designated smoking area is 4 ft from the front door.  At least move it to the right 50 ft and save the healthy guest.Pool Area - Takes you back to the 70s...Really lame area to eat food and catch up on work.Bar - Senior Citizens and not much moreParking - Lots of parking and free.  Definitely a plus!Most uncomfortable bed I have ever slept in!! The bed was hard, you could feel the springs, and it was uneven as well. The pillows they give you are a joke, they were literally the size of half a pillow. The air conditioner barely worked, to keep the room cool we had to shut it off and then turn it back on several times to "restart" the cold air. The room was clean enough and the staff was friendly, but I would never recommend anyone staying here for the simple fact of how uncomfortable it was to sleep here!I stayed here as the conference I was attending was at the Gaylord Opryland resort. This hotel was 60% less than the Gaylord and about 4 miles away. The hotel provided my transport to and from the Convention Center and the Opry Mills Mall which is walking distance to the Convention Center. The transportation by the hotel saved me about $150 in rental car needs.The only reason I did not give 5 stars is the housekeeping was a bit inconsistent. The bath mat was taken but not replaced one day, and the hand towels were a different number each day. The last day an extra roll of TP was not put in the bathroom.If you want bed bugs and slow Internet you come to the right place. I'm in a business where I travel with a team. We've had 3 room changes because of bed bugs and good luck trying to stream anything in your room. I would rather walk to the Waffle House than eat at the restaurant downstairs. My first review ever and I usually don't care but this one pissed me off.Was extremely satisfied with the hotel when I stayed here.  The staff was friendly and accommodating.  The room was clean and the beds were soft and comfy.The only problem I had was that the ice machine on my floor didn't work so I had to go to another floor.  And there was a convention or something in town the weekend I stayed so the elevators were crazy full.The indoor pool and hot tub are WONDERFUL!  They are clean and feel great after a very long day of walking.Not sure about the wifi.  I never really tried to use it but I would suggest if you need Internet that bad you should just buy a wireless hot spot connector.I would recommend to anyone.It is clearly older and well used. The gift shop charges ridiculous prices for things like tums. There are better options out there.I had a wonderful experience staying here. Booked my room directly from their website, it was actually cheaper that way plus I got free breakfast for only $9 more. I chose this hotel because of the free shuttle and in house restaurant and bar. I wanted to make sure I had everything in the hotel. I took advantage of the free shuttle services from the airport, to/from the mall and even to/from restaurants for dinner. I called ahead of time and they didn't promise my room to be ready early, which was fine because they stored my luggage. After lunch at their restaurant, I was able to get my room at 1pm, much to my surprise. I took the shuttle to the mall right after.The room was nice and big. I booked a king bed nonsmoking room. The bathroom was good size, plus the room had a desk and an extra armchair with ottoman, which I thought was a nice touch. I felt the furniture was not outdated and quite comfortable with plenty of room.Everyone here was sweet, amazing customer service, the shuttle guy knew me by name by the end of the day! Had a few good drinks at the bar and a band was playing too.  for breakfast they gave me a $20 voucher at their  restaurant so when my dad picked me up in the morning, we were able to have a good breakfast for free. The man making the buttery omelets in the morning was really funny too!! And thats my only comment: everything has a lot of butter in it, which is probably just how Tennessee is.I will definitely be back here next time I fly into Nashville.My wife and I stayed at the holiday inn in Nashville as part of our honeymoon. As a perk of staying there we were allowed to use their side lot for our car while we were in miami and the bahamas. However due to a badly maintained sidewalk my wife tripped on a cracked area that had lifted up and badly skinned her knee and suffered from some pretty severe road burn. They had no staff trained competently in first aid and it took them several minutes to find their first aid kit. The manager who helped us didn't apply pads or bandages correctly and failed to tape it properly. The bandages were nearly falling off and rather than tape them she put tape directly on the wound. My wife nearly passed out from the pain and their incompetence made it worse. Needless to say we wont be staying there again.Nice hotel but very incompetent staff.  Prepaid hotel and they still charged my card when I checked inFacility is primitive POS. Hallways reek of stale smoke, tube TVs (currently being replaced with flat screen), virtually nowhere in the room to conveniently plug in PC and iPhone for use/charging, no desk chair.Staff very good, amenities OK. Free Internet slow as molasses.You get what you pay for. I didn't like this Holiday Inn. Although she was in training, the staff member who was checking us in kept answering the phone AND LOOKING UP stuff which took her forever. We were cold and tired; don't make the patrons in front of you wait. The rooms are shabby, like they were never glorious and just got worse through the years. I bet there are better hotels nearby for the same price.DISGUSTING!!!!! And DISGUSTED!!!! I can't believe we stayed here even one night. Had to interrupt front desk girl from her cigarette break for service. She may have been drunk!!!! Bugs in the room. Gave us a smoking room and wouldn't switch when they were told we were non smokers. Filthy floors in room. Lastly an unexplained odor beyond the smell of stale cigarettes. If I could this would get NO stars!!!!
review_content_40: Over the five days I was there my wifi connection speed was consistently .05 Mbps down. That's useless.Also, there was no hot water to speak of between about 6 and 8 AM. Overall, the whole place is just terribly outdated.i was given a smoking room. i didnt even know it was legal to smoke in hotels anymore. here for work and went out all night to escape the smell, tomorrow should be an exciting day. room is dirty and quite the group of people on my floor.only reason im giving a 2 is because the front desk staff apologized for the smoking room.. i'll be happy if i get 2-3 hours a sleep with this smell.  rooms are not nice and hote is outdated. Hope ownership reads reviews and considers going non-smoking and updates.. i would never suggest this hotel.When I checked in I asked for a room with a good wifi signal and was told that they've been having problems with it lately ! I travel for work and my companies website " times out " if not in use . The wifi was so weak & slow I was unable to work - which does not reflect too highly on me ! This is an older hotel and is badly in need of an update/remodel . The room had a funky smell to it that reminded me of that old musty smell of my grandparents house when I would visit as a child ! With numerous other hotels in Nashville I'll put this one on the " not if I can help it " list !Another thing ; I'm a priority club member and the picture they have on the website is that of a Holiday Inn express and the hotel is actually an old Holi-dome tower . Very miss leading ! I'm also putting NO for wifi since it was not usable !Hotel is extremely outdated. Barely any outlets in the wall. Outdated furniture. Bed is the only thing which looks like it has been updated in the past 20 years. The pillows are fluffed to look like down pillows but they are just standard pillows. The business center does not have a printer, which we really needed, so you have to email the front desk attendant and they have to print off the document for you. We had to wait in line for a half hour at the front desk just to have a document printed because there was only one attendant and there was a line.  Awful experience.  I made my reservation through Priceline, and when I went to check-in, the hotel stated that Priceline had overbooked them and the only room they had left was a hyda-bed (a couch which pulls out into a bed) room. They actually considered this an option for a room. Not to mention, a parlor room is a room that connects to another customer's room. They treated me like none of this was their problem and I was Priceline's customer and if I didn't like their hotel room options, I needed to contact Priceline. This was at 11:30 PM at night, I had been driving all day, and it was not like I had a lot of options at that point. I ended staying in a hotel room that they were not supposed to rent out (so I didn't have to sleep on a hyda-bed with my traveling partner) They were not supposed to rent it because the carpets had recently been shampooed, so the floors were wet and the room had a smell. Not to mention the bathroom had not been completely cleaned, there was debris on the bathroom counter and hair in the bathtub. Stayed 2 nights and I thought the bathroom would be cleaned on the second night but the same dirt and things were still present.No one wants to take ownership for the problem. Holiday Inn is stating I am not their customer, I am Priceline's customer, and it's their problem. Meanwhile, Priceline is stating Holiday Inn is not willing to process any type of refund; therefore, Priceline won't process any type of refund. It feels like a big game; meanwhile, the customer loses.The hotel facilities are ok especially for the price. The service was quite poor. The staff seemed like we were an inconvenience even though we had 10 rooms and stayed 2 nights. Won't stay here again.The hotel room was itself 3 stars worthy. However Walter their omelet chef was what grabbed the extra star from me. He is a Nashville attraction without a doubt.Came here for a work conference and had a bad feeling when I checked in and they didn't know anything about our conference. Front desk staff were nice and helpful checking us in and getting us to a great dinner place, not the hotel restaurant either. Rooms were ok. Internet is complete crap. They call it Internet lite!  I call it cheap and worthless. No perks! I am missing the Hilton for sure.I would have given them 0 stars if I could. Bathroom door looked like someone had recently put a hole in it and they did a sloppy job of covering up.For the money there's better places to stay in Nashville.  Smoking allowed in the hotel.  Poor Wi-Fi.  Bathtub fills up when you shower.  Bathroom towels have seen better days.  Service is slow in the restaurant with a very limited menu.In writing this review, I will preface the goods with this disclaimer:When you stay at a Holiday Inn, you must understand that you are staying at a very old hotel that has not been renovated in any substantial way.  Hilton and Marriott have "budget" options, like Hampton and Courtyard, but the actual Hiltons and Marriotts are super-nice.  H.I. Express are nice; as a matter of fact, they are much nicer than the original Holiday Inns.So, my room is exactly what I expected.  It had a bit of a fart smell upon entrance, but it either went away or I got used to it.The pillows on the bed were tiny; they were the same size as the throw pillows a a couch:  square, not rectangular.  This was not the most comfortable pillow config.Being a Gold Priority Club member, they gave me a choice of two free drink coupons or two free breakfast coupons.  I took the free breakfasts, which is a buffet.  They have a guy making omelettes, and he is a TRIP!  Very nice, personable, and funny, and a darn good omelette chef.The pool at this place is AWESOME.  It's a huge trapezoid and there are two hot tubs in the same area, all indoors.  It's the largest hotel pool I've ever seen.So, room is OK, A/C worked well, bathroom functioned OK, good shower, great breakfast, two bars and a restaurant, excellent pool.  I'd stay here again, for the price.I was VERY happy with my choice to stay here on this past weekend quick trip to Nashville.  The beds were comfortable, the shower rocked and the staff was great with any minor requests that I had.  The indoor pool and spa were great but the location was ehh....right in the lobby, just kinda freaked me out a tad.  Got a great rate and a nice AAA discount too which made things that much more better!Overall, great choice, and a quick 10 minute drive to downtown Nashville.Stayed here for 6 nights attending a conference at the Gaylor Opryland Hotel. Staff here at the Holiday Inn was very accommodating and professional and God bless 'em for having to put up with cranky guests, they really took a beating from one of them! The only cons for me, weak wi-fi and guests slamming doors in the middle of the night (which the hotel itself has no control over). I would definitely stay here again, rooms were clean and comfortable and the hotel is pretty central to a lot of things.Was here for a conference and the rooms were small and not very nice. Provided lunch was ok. I think there are better hotels around this area.After reading reviews before my stay I have concluded that the freeway noise level is minimal, check-in was friendly, and the room had enough amenities in comparison to other hotel chains. No qualms about my overnight stay at this facility. I only give this hotel 3 stars because it's basic, Internet is not free, and I have been to nicer hotels with friendlier service and more amenities.This place is strange.  I bought one night through the secret hotel section of Travelocity.  I got a great deal on the room.  I went to check in while I waited for my honey to fly into Nashville.  It was close to the airport and a waffle house, so it fit the bill.  I went up to my room to find that the room was connected to the next room by a door.  The door was fully unlocked and the light was on to my bathroom.  When I locked the double door, the guy next door kept yelling...who's there.  How wierd!  Did he think he got two rooms for the price of one?  The pillows are small, square lumpy things.  The hotel was filled with drunk people making a scene.  Love drama in the parking lot.  Drunks smoking right in front of the main entrance.  I would never pay full price for this place.My family and I are members of the Holiday Inn rewards program, and I've gotta say, this was not my favorite hotel. The breakfast wasn't free even though it cost the same to stay there as any other Holiday Inn. Although I was impressed by the sheer size of the building itself, I was not pleased with the amenities (bathroom, accessibility etc...).It was an OLD tower, not the newer building my travel company showed. Also checked some other sites and they had the wrong picture too. Decided to stay here when I had to beat the weather and make sure I was in town the night before I was to fly home. Thought I would save my company some money and not stay in my normal chain. NEVER AGAIN!!.Here are my observations...I was not feeling so well when I arrived. I got a NON-Smoking room. I walked in detected a faint hint of smoke. I was in pain and did not feel like dragging my bags back to the elevator and down to the lobby to get a different room and then drag them back up. Plus I had wanted to drop my rental car off and that required two trips. So I did the one-night-unpack. Walked in the bathroom and BAM!! It smelled like someone had locked themselves in the bathroom and smoked a carton of cigarettes. It was not fresh, but an old smoky smell. It has been there awhile.The room itself also had the faint smell of unsanitary an retirement home. Bad enough to notice and pinpoint the smell.Carpets grossed me out. I left my shoes on the entire time."It is only one night" I kept telling myself...One night.Ordered room service. It was OK and they delivered quickly. Wi-fi was OK, for most of what I needed it to do...check my email.They charged me $2.50 to use my Corporate American Express. I have never had to pay a HOTEL to use the Amex card.Positives?The staff was friendly.They had three coffee condiment packs instead of one.Never again, there are toooo many other hotels close to the airport to select.I got to stay here when I went to Nashville to attend my cousin's medical school graduation. Holiday Inn Select is a standard Holiday Inn which boasts comfy pillows, clean rooms, a well stocked gift shop and ample parking in front. Their location makes them an ideal spot if you are coming into town to visit Opryland. I would've given this location 4stars if not for two things. First off they claim they DO NOT accept debt cards at check-in, however, they took my Mom's debt card and treated it the same as cash at check-in(no backup credit card required). I do not doubt that this was because my Mom is a 60yrs old woman who walked in with her cane. Obviously they were guilty of stereotyping on who would have money on their debt card. Secondly their restaurant is leaves so much to be desired. They only have one vegetarian entree, which wasn't bad, but no one wants to eat the same thing all weekend. Their breakfast menu was just as horrible, the eggs from the buffet were a rubbery mess. Ive had way better FREE HOT breakfast at Embassy Suites. If you want to eat all of your meals out of the hotel and didnt intend on using your debt card this place is a sound bet for a weekend get away.Room smelled , they wanted me to pay for breakfast and the tv didn't work half the time.  I wouldn't recommend this HI to any oneVery nice. I usually stay at HI Express but this HI Select was closer to a conference I attended. The room was very quiet - one of my pet peeves in a hotel. The breakfast buffet was pretty costly but the food was very good. I really enjoyed my stay, the room was big and clean, and the staff was very attentive to my few concerns. Eat breakfast somewhere else and I think you'll be very satisfied.
review_content_60: My wife and I arrived at the Opryland Holiday Inn Hotel the night of 7 October 2010.  This was a day earlier than we had originally planned, but the hotel was able to accommodate us.  However, I was informed on checking in that I had three (3) rooms reserved [in actuality I had two (2) as one was for my sister and her friend].  I cancelled out the  "extra " room.  The next day Dan Neff, myself and my sister all had problems connecting to the hotel's wireless networks.  I spoke to the Sales and Catering representative of the hotel with whom Mr. Neff had negotiated our reunion stay and she gave me the telephone number of the hotel's IT contractor.  I also spoke to this woman about needing some help in connecting my computer (and its external hard drive) to the hotel's PA (amplifier) system inasmuch as I had been tasked to provide music for our banquet dinner.  She gave me the number of the hotel's AV contractor and arrangements were made for he and I to meet at 4:00 PM on 10 October to set up the connection which was to be wireless from my computer to the amplifier with my equipment and that I only needed help in setting up a table (and chair) and plugging the wireless receiver into the amplifier.  Now back to the IT contractor.  After negotiating a lengthy voice-mail process I was told (by a recording) to leave a message and they would get back to me.  I never (to this day) heard back.  There were 3 or 4 wireless networks available according to my computer and one of them specifically had the word "Guest" in its nomenclature.  After trying to connect to this network it simply evaporated into the ether (I never saw that particular network listed again).  After two (2) more unsuccessful attempts to connect to 2 other networks I finally succeeded.  Upon connecting I was informed that the connection was valid for 24 hours only.  You (me or anyone) must re-establish a connection every 24 hours.  My sister was upset with me as when she checked in on 8 October she was told that I had not yet arrived and was given a room on the 9th floor (my wife and I were in Room 1318 and I had left a message at the desk for my sister as well as having requested months ago that our rooms be close together)  When my sister informed me of the situation I checked at the front desk and found out that instead of the erroneous 3 rooms I had supposedly booked and for which I had cancelled out the extra one (which I had never booked in the first place) the night before I now had reservations for 4 rooms.  The "extra" 2 rooms were cancelled out and the hotel did move my sister to the 13th floor.Also on 8 October an Executive Committee meeting was scheduled for 1000 AM for which I had been requested to provide a voice-activated recorder.  Having no place locally to purchase batteries for the recorder, except the hotel gift shop,  and with 1000 AM minutes away I purchased two (2) "AA" batteries in the gift shop for $12.00.  I gave the saleswoman a $20 bill and received back a $5 bill and three $1 bills, but no receipt.  I found out a day later from another reunion member that he had purchased the same batteries for $3.99 in the same gift shop (also without benefit of a receipt).On the night of 10 October 2010, AFPCA had its banquet dinner.  I met the hotel AV contractor at 4:00 PM and (despite the fact that I had earlier requested the hotel staff to set up a small table and chair for me they simply did not do so) together we set up the table and chair I needed for my computer and external hard drive.  After we put a table and chair in place I unpacked my laptop and the external drive and laid the AC adapter cords on the table.  The AV contractor picked up the AC adapter cord for my computer (19 volts) and connected it to my external hard drive (a 12 volt system).  The hard drive never functioned at all after that (I had been using the system in my room and had to turn everything off to bring it downstairs to the banquet).  I had approximately 60,000 songs on this hard drive and am now striving to see if I can recover them.  The hard drive had two capacitors which were blown and the repair facility originally hoped that the computer board on the drive was still intact.  It wasn't.  They then hoped that the drive motor was intact and that they could use the board from another hard drive to get my files transferred.  The board and the hard drive motor are also both blown and my remaining hope is that I can find someone who will be able to transfer my music files to another hard drive. The hard drive as such is toast.  I am still working to transfer my music files to another hard drive. In fairness, the AV contractor was probably only supposed to be with me for a very few minutes (5 minutes should have sufficed to plug in the wireless receiver to the hotel's amplifier (and in fact this system worked flawlessly albeit without real purpose as I had no music to utilize the system).

review_content: My sister and I stayed at the Comfort Inn when visiting Nashville.  For the price and location- this is the best bet.  I landed early in the AM and the front desk allowed me to check in at 10:30 am for no extra charge which was great because I was exhausted from the early flight and it was pouring out.The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable- more comfortable than some higher end hotels that I've stayed in recently.  The free breakfast in the morning was more than we expected with a chef making custom omelettes- we ate there every morning!  There was also complimentary coffee and water bottles in the lobby, a small fitness center with cardio machines and free weights and a laundry room.The hotel is right across the street from a strip of trendy bars and restaurants and only a $5 uber ride away from downtown.  This is definitely a great place to crash if you have a bachelor/bachelorette party or a girls weekend.  There were a lot of groups of young people who were loud late at night so if you are looking for R&R this isn't the place for you.  If I ever go back to the Music City, I will gladly stay here again!My friend and I were passing through Nashville and wanted to make the most of our 12 hours in the city.  This hotel popped up as the most affordable, central to where we would like to explore.For a 2 queen bedroom, we paid $115 including tax.  The room was very clean and the bed was incredibly comfortable. There are a few bars / restaurants right across the street, which was very convienent for two hungry travelers.We wanted to walk and soak up the city, so we decided to walk down to Broadway. It was about 15-20 minutes. On our way back, we took an uber, which was less than $5.In the morning we wanted to check out the complimentary breakfast on the third floor. It was a separate, open clean room and a pretty decent selection of breakfast items. Eggs, sausage, grits, biscuits, cereal, waffles, muffins, hard boiled eggs, orange juice, and coffee.Overall, this is a great location and great hotel to stay at if you want to explore Nashville!Do NOT book here on weekends. There were kids skateboarding up and down the cement walkway by the rooms at 4 am! And when we told the front desk, they said it was their weekend clientele so basically, we have to live with it. Positive note, breakfast is very decent, but there isn't much else to say about this place. Location is why we stayed there. If there were other affordable options nearby, we definitely would never stay here again.Totally loved it! Very affordable and clean. It was nice! Great location. Definitely do it!Good price & good location. We decided to drive down a day early to try to avoid the bad weather & they were very accommodating. Plenty of bars and restaurants within walking distance. Sadly, most were closed due to the 6 inches of snow. We still walked around anyway. The breakfast isn't anything grand... Walk across the street to Just Love for excellent coffee. And the menu looked amazing, but due to weather (stuupid snow) they were light staffed and only serving coffee. But the room was great... Nice size & clean!My husband and I came to Nashville for our anniversary and wanted to stay closer to downtown without huge cost! This was the perfect spot. 10-15 minute Uber ride to 2nd Ave (for all the bars/clubs). Just down the street is Danny McGinnis, which is an AMAZING irish pub with fantastic food! It is one of many bars on this strip. A little further around the corner is The Patterson House - old style bar with the best drinks I've ever had! Cannot beat this location!As far as the hotel goes, check in was easy. Front desk staff was very nice and accomodating. We arrived ahead of schedule, about 2 hours before check in technically began, and Paula (I think) was happy to get us in ahead of time. The hotel as a whole is clean and well kept. The pool area is nice and clean. Wish we had had time to take a dip!The room is a typical king room. Clean and nicely sized. Flat screen tv and mini fridge and microwave in room. Coffee pot too, but we never make in room cofee. Shower & toilet room is a little cramped. If you are a large person, this could be difficult! Shower has great pressure for a hotel, but the temperature was a little tricky to regulate. We were very happy with the space and cleanliness! Carpets were clean, my white socks stayed white & hubby's bare feet stayed clean. Air conditioner was great too, cooled so efficiently we had to turn it back some before bed! We did have to push the closed curtains toward the window to allow the air to work (common sense move to me though so non issue) Even had a full ironing board and iron in room which came in handy when my hubby's dress shirt didn't travel as well as hoped!The included continental breakfast was much better than expected. Nice spread of breads, muffins, and bagels. Hot items were biscuits and gravy, meats, and eggs. Waffle makers were there. Fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal. Milk, tea, coffee, orange & apple juice. Everything we ate was good... not high end, but good! If you want amazing breakfast, a 10 minute walk will take you to Biscuit Love...holy cow wow - but pricy!The only negatives I can think of was the noise from some rowdy neighbors. They quieted down after about 10 minutes though. Had a little "service" noise on Monday morning early (7:30 early), I think maybe a delivery truck or garbage truck. These were really just minor. Only reason I heard the neighbors was I had gotten up to use the restroom, and the only reason I heard the truck was I happened to be up already. I don't think the noise would have woken me out of sleep on its own.Some of the other reviews seemed very critical, but I cannot see why. I know this is a Comfort Inn and not Marriot, so I adjust my expectations to a degree. Everything we needed was here though, the staff was superb, and the room was clean and comfortable. We were extremely satisfied with our stay here and we will most definitely come back whenever we come back to Nashville and need downtown access! Thanks for making our stay so very comfortable!This hotel was in a GREAT location for the price! We were less than a mile from lots of bars and restaurants in the Gulch and Vanderbilt University area. We were able to walk quite easily to lots of cool places, including Third Man Records and two different hot chicken establishments. It was literally right off the freeway, so that was easy to get in and out.The room itself was okay. It was definitely dated, but it was clean enough. We didn't have any towels in our room, but it wasn't a big deal to ask for some. The bed was comfortable, and I liked that we had a mini fridge. People were kind of loud late at night - slamming doors and talking loudly in the corridor, but there isn't much that can be done about that. The pool looked pretty clean. Free continental breakfast with a make-your-own waffle bar! They had those reconstituted egg pucks and sausage, but mostly a lot of carbs. I've definitely had worse though, so I was happy to save money on eating out.I had looked at the Marriott down the street, as it has a rooftop bar and swanky-looking rooms, but after taxes and fees it was almost $100 more than this hotel! Ultimately, I am happy with this choice and would totally stay here again if in the area. Also, parking was included!Great value and proximity to bars and restaurants.  Rooms were clean and had a free breakfast.Stayed here for a long weekend in Nashville. It was convenient enough (close to downtown) and had a lot of nice restaurants and bars close to it. If you want to sleep in, don't stay here. The walls are paper thin, you hear the cars in the parking lot constantly, and garbage collection is at 7 am Monday mornings. The staff was very friendly, great complimentary breakfast, and very comfortable bed. I wish I had known the rooms exited to a parking lot, the safety frightened us a tad. We only paid $103 a night so you cannot beat the deal. Wish I would have known this is a motel, I would have selected an actual hotel in actual downtown Nashville.Our stay here was horribly expensive because an NRA convention was in town at the same time as a wedding, Negatives:bad wifioutdoor access to rooms like a motel, wedding block rate couldn't stay for just one night, they didn't have some of the expected "complimentary toiletries," they gave us two double beds instead of the king we paid for,the desk workers didn't speak english well and wouldn't give us a receipt to check out.  it wasted at least an hour of our time on a wedding weekend.i started off critical, but the further down the list I went, I realized I was unhappy with our motel.  Don't pay more than $75 per night to stay here.I was nervous to book this location because there were some poor reviews, but I have been pleasantly surprised with my stay at Comfort Inn!  It's location in Nashville and the price that I paid for a room are incomparable.  It is only a $5 Uber ride from downtown, and there are several great bars and restaurants right down the street.  Our room is comfortable, clean and well maintained.  I can't attest to the breakfast because I haven't woken up early enough to try it.  Ultimately, this hotel provided me with exactly what I needed during my stay in Nashville- a comfy place to sleep and a short distance to downtown.  Personally, I would rather spend my money exploring all that Nashville has to offer!  Would definitely recommend to anyone who has a similar mentality!Stayed here for spring break and had a good experience. We had a room on the 3rd floor, which was nice had two queen beds, decent TV channel selection and access to a pool. The bathroom was a little small, but it was clean and the water pressure was super strong. The breakfast room was better than I expected. They had all of the typical fixings, eggs, sausage, a self serve waffle maker and all sorts of things. My only complaint was that there were some stains on our first set of towels but not on any other ones we received. all in all we were satisfied with our stay. Customer service was great and they were super friendly and willing to help.We were looking for a place downtown that wasn't going to cost us a kidney.  Great location, clean rooms.  Not the largest in the world, but it did the trick.  Within walking distance of everything we needed downtown.  Worked out pretty well.  Didn't have a lot of interaction with the staff, but check in/out was quick and courteous.  I'll go back if I'm ever in Nashville again.Great location. Good breakfast. Comfy beds. Roaches. If it weren't for that if recommend it otherwise.I booked this property based on the price in the area and it being close to Bridgestone Arena.  I arrived early and couldn't check in early (around 11 am) because they said no rooms were cleaned and ready.  Fair enough, check in isn't until 3 anyway.  Got back around 1:15 pm and checked in.  The lobby area had a rather strange odor to it and the decor was strangely "dated" and old.Got into my room and it was BLAZING hot in there.  I turned on the air, but it didn't do much for the ventilation of the room as the curtains continued to block then vents.  It was incredibly humid and sticky in the room.  Like the lobby, the decor was strangely "dated" and old.  The bed was not comfortable at all.  You could tell there were multiple spots on the walls that had been spackled and repainted over.  The curtains were stained.  The TV only worked on a few of the channels advised.  Bathroom and shower area were TINY.I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and I probably wouldn't stay here again until they made some serious upgrades.Good Location.  Best price for downtown area.  The Rooms are, well, so so.  Im from jersey.  So we are used to the old run down Jersey Shore hotels.  Well, these are the same.  If you are looking for luxury. Then you might want to find another place to stay.   For us it was ok.  We went out every night.  So we were not in the room that much.   Just to sleep,shower and poop. Room had a fridge good for leftovers from dinner just in case.  Bathrooms are tiny.  Just a note, The Bathroom sink is outside the bathroom door.They have a free just above continental breakfast.  Processed eggs. Sausage and biscuits. You can make your own waffle. That was pretty good.  Juice, cereal, fruit. It was ok.  Staff was nice.  Pool was clean.   Overall its ok.  There is a Marriott near by if you want nice.  It's about a $125 more a night.   To each there own.For $109 a night, I can't really complain. This place is dated, but clean and has an okay bathroom. Plus, it has parking and is in a good location within walking distance (or short uber) to downtown. The first room they put us in stank like stale smoke and was super noisy, but they were really good when we asked to move. Only down side is the extremely unreliable WiFi, it must disconnect every two minutes which is insanely frustrating when you are overseas and are reliant on WiFi for a lot. Make sure you ask for a room away from the main road, otherwise it will be really loud.Picked this hotel based on price, availability over a holiday and proximity to the Beaman Toyota service department, as my car decided to have issues while on a road trip vacation. Pros:- Great location and conveniently located next to food and gas etc. - Quick and easy access to the freeway.- Clean enough, minus the filthy carpets. - Decent continental breakfast. Got the job done and cut down on our eating out bill. - Larger mini fridge, cable, wifi and a microwave.- If you have rolly polly sleepers, like we do, you can easily move chairs up against one side of the bed to avoid falling out of bed. - An outdoor pool- Free parking (also, see under Cons).Cons:- Disgustingly dirty carpets. Kiddo had black feet minutes after getting a shower scrub. Bring flip flops to wear around to avoid black feet. -The walls had questionable stains on them but I didn't let my mind go there. - Shower gets clogged a little but hardly a    big issue. - Not enough hooks to hang towels.- Slow wi-fi. - No closets just a medium sized wardrobe. - Taking the elevator is like walking on the sun, I imagine.... Hot! It was 30 seconds of death. Next time, I will just throw my bags over the balcony or sit on them and ride them down the stairs.- Not sure what the smoking laws/ regulations are in Nashville or The Comfort Inn, but I saw someone sitting in the doorway of their room smoking. There was also a lot of smoking in stairwells and walkways. "Why you gotta be so rude?"- Holy hell! Not a single person parked within the lines at night. Jacked up all the other parking. Try to get a room facing the pool. If not, you'll be stuck with the freeway or construction side. All in all... Good place to stay.Horrendous. I flew out from NJ with my bf for a wedding. We booked this hotel based on location, price, and good reviews. We checked in and I was impressed from the exterior appearance and the lobby. Well we get our cards to check into the room and as I'm wheeling my bag across the parking lot I see three large cockroaches just hanging out. This was a dead give away that they are everywhere. Roaches usually don't come out and definitely not in groups. So we go to look for our room and it's a ground floor. I called the front desk and told them I was concerned bc I saw roaches and refused to sleep on the the ground floor. He seemed shocked and moved us to the top floor.The room was moist and smelly. It smelled like cigarette smoke was just embedded in the walls and carpet or a pet odor. It got worse when the air conditioner was running. I mentioned it to my bf once and let it go. We were both exhausted. I went to take a shower and grabbed a towel. I started drying off and noticed the towel was dirty. It has light gray/brown smears all over it. Ok, fine. I grabbed another towel. Then as I was getting off the toilet I noticed a large and wide blood smear across the front of the toilet, where my legs could have essentially touched.  I was disgusted. So that was more than 3 strikes. I sucked it up bc we were only stayed there for one night. I did check the mattress and bedding for bed bugs. Luckily I found none. And I also searched high and low for roaches. I kept my bags securely closed and on the table. I would never stay there again. Breakfast for free was awesome but after seeing the condition of the building there no doubt in my mind that the food may have been cooked in a roach infested kitchen. Don't stay here. I don't know what rooms deserved 4 or 5 stars. Must be the wrong comfort in.This is a generous two star rating. The rooms were pretty small and ours was facing a construction site that must have started up work before 7am.The shower clogged up within a few minutes. The outside doors were just painted, I think to cover up all of the footprint marks from people trying to kick them down when they found out where the person was who owed them money. The elevator smelled like a cheap whore's perfume. For the record, we all kind of liked that part.Lastly, there was no HBO.Just kidding. I didn't use the TV. I have no idea.
review_content_20: I chose this hotel because of the location, availability and the price. My friends and I made a road trip out of a conference we were attending last week. We stayed at the Comfort Inn before moving on to the hotel our conference was at. We were looking for something close to downtown that was cheap. The rooms were not overly nice, but they were clean and functional. The staff was kind and helpful, and even provided us with a roll away bed. The location is great and you can easily walk to downtown, if it is warm! Being from Florida, we walked half way and then had to call a cab - we were freezing! The motel's continental breakfast was better than I had expected it to be.I had a terrible experience with this hotel. I booked a room, for one night, for business travel. On the day I was supposed to arrive, a large ice storm hit Nashville and EVERY flight into and out of the city was canceled. I immediately contacted the hotel to let them know I would not be able to make it for my stay. They claimed that it was past the cancellation deadline so they could not cancel my reservation.I called the hotel 14 times in the next 2-3 weeks. Each time, I was told that the manager was busy, but would call me back right away. I did not, and have still not received a call from the management of the hotel.I was charged for the room, that I did not use, on a day when nobody was able to reach the city of Nashville. I'll never book a reservation with a Choice hotel again. It's not worth the risk.This place is a dump. The only reason I stayed here was because it was close to a bunch of bars and it was the cheapest. Avoid this crap hole. staff may be friendly, but that quickly is shadowed by the smell of cheap chain smoking hookers once you open the hotel room door.Stayed here during the Bonnaroo weekend!What a gem! When everything was almost 200 bux a night we found this gem for almost 75 dollars cheaper. For a room and a bed to stay in, I think this was a great deal.The concierge was polite and was very helpful. Although the rooms need a little love, for what it's worth...it's good enough (no bed bugs). Television was working, bed was made and the washroom was a little run down but clean enough for a cheap hotel.The breakfast was basic. Bread, juice, sausage and waffles. Nothing extravagant but bonus nonetheless. There was also a pool and the location was a couple minutes from downtown. With bars and restaurant up front.If I am ever in Nashville, this will be my go to restaurant no doubt about it.Rooms extremely small, not very clean - could see toothpaste spatters on the mirror and woodwork around the sink, bathrooms so ridiculously cramped that some in our party chose not to bathe at all. Claustrophobics beware!!! Continental breakfast was inconveniently located, but once found it was a nice room. The waffles were good, but not the biscuits, gravy or sausage. No shuttle service to downtown Nashville or anything else. Crappy wifi connection. Stay somewhere else unless you're really desperate.Where do I start...Upon check-in, my husband and I were informed that we would be charged an additional $25 to park a second car in their lot. We booked the room on the Internet on discount but the room was still expensive. However, the pictures made the hotel look 'worth it'. Myself, my husband, our twin teenagers and our two cats literally crammed into a room with two queen beds. There was barely room to walk anywhere in the room. The shower area was awful in that I could not open or close the door when the bath mat was on the floor, I could not dry off outside of the shower because there was not enough room to stand while the shower curtain was closed. We arrived back to the room late after exploring the city only to discover disgusting linens on the beds. Stained towels, sheets, and pillows. An added bonus was the amount of extra hair that was left on the bed and pillows for us. The only reason I did not sleep in my car was because I did not want to upset my husband and kids. The AC unit sounded like gale force winds blowing and whistling all night long. We paid lots of money for the worst hotel experience possible. On the bright side... They had free breakfast and the pool didn't look bad.If I could give it 0 stars I would. There is no way this is even a 3 star hotel, unless there's a completely different hotel on the other side of this property... This is a cheap motel: nothing more.First inconvenience was a receptionist who barely spoke English. Secondly we were hit with a $25 parking fee. Note: this is a Tuesday. No conventions in Nashville, and there's ample parking. We were told the first car was free. However, when I mentioned we booked with a AAA, they dropped the price of the second car down to $10, but then ADDED $10 for the first car. So, still have to shell out $20/day just to park in their mostly-empty lot.The room itself: tiny, very old. Dirty bathroom, chips, cracks, and stains on almost every piece of furniture. Another commenter noted their furniture looked like it was purchased at a garage sale- this is SO TRUE! They have all seen far better days- very beaten up, and barely functional.I've never been to a more run down hotel, and I have never been treated as awfully as the front desk staff. Absolutely avoid!This hotel was a big disappointment. Good location, but not up to par. I signed up for yelp just so I could give it a review. Note that I did not use any of the amenities like the gym or pool so this is specifically about the rooms. The room we started in was a handicapped room that faced the interstate (we are not handicapped). Besides a lot of noise from traffic, the room looked like it was never cleaned. The towels were old and had spots on them even though they were hanging up like they had been replaced. The sheets weren't much better so we asked for a new room. The second room was much better but still not perfect. The towels looked old (at least not used this time) but this bathroom had been renovated. It seems that the king size sheets don't fit on their king size beds so that makes it look like their beds aren't fully made. There was a spot of lipstick on one of the pillow cases which we just threw on the floor and ignored. Unless you are looking for dirty laundry and a cold shower, I would not recommend this place!And adding to this after the fact: check out is not til noon and the maid just walked into our room before 11 without even knocking. Our dog almost ran outside. Add stupid staff to the list.we had a very nice stay at the comfort inn until the last morning of our stay we discovered bugs, look a lot like bed bugs from google images. Front desk staff was very kind in offering to move us to another room & pay for our clothes to be laundered, but we were too grossed out & starting to get itchy, we just wanted to leave to go to the airport early. Front desk staff requested us to send him the pictures we took of the bugs & looked at our bites on our arms and legs so that he could communicate with his manager & a pest control company that we on their way to the hotel; he also promised to call us regarding the results from the pest control company, in which he did several hours later. We took precautions that you would take with bed bugs per our research and have completely decontaminated our belongings prior to taking them into our houses, steam cleaned our luggage, frozen our unwashable belongings & sent other items to be dry cleaned with chemicals; it has taken hours upon hours, making an end to our wonderful trip a nightmare. In the front desk staff's voicemail he said that he pest control guy believes that the bugs are "bat" bugs not bed bugs, but a similar species that feed off of bat blood not human blood (A. why are they in our bed and not by where bats are, B. why do we have bites everywhere on our bodies). 24hours later management called us stating that they are sending another pest control person the next day & that they have gone in the room and have seen no signs of bugs. Maybe if they had come with us to our room the first day we discovered them they would be there(and not trusted that we are honest people and completely horrified by what we had discovered upon waking up), or maybe cleaning staff has already gone in the room to clean. Per this conversation, they offered assistance with medical treatment, in which I told him we are currently treating our itchy bites with over the counter anti itch cream, he then offered a free stay at the hotel, in which I told him that I will never be staying at their hotel again & then he offered a reimbursement for our stay (we stayed 3 nights). The next day we received an email stating that they were only going to reimburse our most expensive night & also offered a 20% discount on a future 2 night stay (what part did he not understand when I said that I will never stay at their hotel again). At first I was frustrated with the lack of communication and now I'm just angry (and getting itchier.) I then called him back to request a full refund of our 3 night stay in which he replied that he could not honor, so I called their corporate offices. Choice Hotels International also has horrible customer service as well & claims that they can only encourage the hotel manager to rectify the situation as Comfort Inn is a franchise. We then later received a second email from the comfort inn management stating " I can confirm that there are NO visible signs of any existing bed bug infestation in the room that you stayed in. These bugs definitely seem to be travelling & I would like to know where did you stay prior to arriving here/ and or travelled. I have also heard about these things travelling in greyhounds and airplanes with people and their clothing. As per pest control guy, looking at the size of bugs in the picture, it would be impossible not to notice them even 1 night." He is now suggesting that we potentially brought the bugs with us from our travels or our homes (offensive) & I asked him to clarify what he meant by greyhounds (he meant the dogs, none of us own greyhounds or dogs for that matter.) He is now saying that there are no bugs but that the first front desk staff & pest control person did find bugs ("bat" bugs) the day we left. He is now also suggesting that the pictures of the bugs we took couldn't possibly be bed bugs because you aren't able to see them with the human eye (that's crap and the camera was completely zoomed in, in one of the pictures we didn't even realize that there was a second smaller bug in the top left corner when we took it, so true the bugs are really tiny but you can still see them which is how we discovered them.) After all of this back & forth for days, I've been very disappointed in the way this hotel management has handled things, I have become itchier and the bites have gotten bigger and have confirmed with my doctor that these are in fact bed bug bites. I forgot to mentioned that during both my calls with the "manager" he continued to cut me off and speak over me, so clearly he did not listen to anything I said and then when I asked him to not cut me off, he said that I had been cutting him off. There's a phrase in the business world called "the customer is always right" & clearly the management here has not been educated with that business mindset. I am 100% disgusted & embarrassed for this hotel & also Choice Hotels International that they would allow this behavior from a hotel manager. (see pictures)Comfortable beds and clean rooms! Very good rates for the location. Close to some great little bars to go to at night that have good drink specials! Also a few minutes from downtown and right by the highway.This place is the WORST!!! Went for a bachelorette party - we found cockroaches, bed bugs, and all sorts of disgust. Hotel claimed they had exterminator come and it wasn't bed bugs but everyone woke up with the bites all over them. They lied to us about the exterminator report and we are now in a war about getting a refund back. I do NOT recommend this hotel even to the filthy animals of the world. Worst hotel and even worse managementI would NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN. I wouldn't even call this a hotel, because it is actually a motel. The doors are outside. From my window, I could see the barbed wire fence that blocked us from the highway.Check-in was actually the best part of my night long stay. The front desk staff was very polite, giving us our key and parking pass. We went to our room expecting it to be clean... well it wasn't. The cleaning man told us "10 minutes", our room was ready 25 min later, after I saw the cleaning staff sneeze on the pillows they left for us.Our room was sub-par. The bed was not comfortable, the tv had minimal channels, and the bathroom was disgusting. Shower and floor were dirty. The toilet was in the room with the shower/tub and there was no room to even open the door. I could hear every person walk by on the outside and I could hear cars passing all night long. Overall, the only good part was the location. I would spend the extra money to be in a hotel that is clean and I actually feel safe in.....This hotel is a good location, but it is not well taken care of. Our towels and linens were yellowed and didn't look clean. I didn't like like the style of this hotel with the rooms going directly outside because the noise level all night is ridiculously loud. Not one of the ice machines worked throughout our stay. The rooms have huge furniture (desks, cabinet, and tv stand) the walkway between those and the beds are about a foot. The rooms are incredibly over crowded. Also the seal on the fridge in the room was broken and when we got into the room the ice from the freezer was melted and made the floor wet, also since the seal was broke nothing stayed cold. When the front desk was contacted they couldn't of cared less, there was nothing they would do. I would stay elsewhere next time, this place is too expensive for what you get.Bed bugs.There, I said it.You can complain about construction, tiny rooms, thin walls, broken elevators, and inconsiderate staff all you want, but when it comes down to brass tacks, my room had bed bugs. I got a refund from Priceline, but it was still hell, and it was not conducive to relaxing my daughter the night before her cardiac procedure at Vanderbilt, and it was horrid trying to find a new hotel to stay in on such short notice.Avoid at all costs.Probably the worst hotel (motel?) I've ever stayed at. Even though it is branded a 'Comfort Inn,' it is far below the quality of any Comfort Inn I've previously stayed at. So where do I begin? Have you ever walked into a room and immediately knew it wasn't safe to touch anything? If I would've had one of those fancy CSI blue lights, I'm sure the entire room would have glowed blue. yelp.com/biz_photos/HI8C...There were cigarette burns in the mustard yellow bedspread. Layers of dust on the dented base of the standing lamp. yelp.com/biz_photos/HI8C... All 3 lampshades were different. The plastic drapes didn't close all the way but luckily a previous guest had left a bobby pin attached to a drape so I was able to close the curtains for privacy. yelp.com/biz_photos/HI8C...The furniture looked like it was purchased at a garage sale. yelp.com/biz_photos/HI8C... I saw the housekeeper and there wasn't a broom or mop on her trolley. There were grey stains on the tile in the bathroom. I'm sure the carpet and tile hadn't been cleaned in quite some time. By the way, the housekeeper changed the TV channel from the Olympic station I had been watching to channel 15 for old black and white movies - that's probably why she didn't have time to clean!Did I mention that for a mere $80 I could have purchased the bedspread with cigarette burns? That would have made an interesting souvenir! yelp.com/biz_photos/HI8C...I wore shoes and socks the whole time I was in this hotel room. I slept with all my clothes on and it was 100 degrees outside with high humidity. I just felt dirty being in this room. Yuck!There is a music club right across the street that plays music till quite late. Wednesday night was a Rap type band with heavy bass till midnight and Thursday night the band was more Rock-n-Roll, but played until after 2:00 a.m. And the noisy bar crowd didn't dissipate until 3:00 a.m. So don't plan on getting any rest while you're here. I wouldn't have minded some good Jazz or R&B... The pool looked nice but I didn't swim in it since this was a busy business trip. And I also opted out of the daily complimentary breakfast just because I was creeped out by how dirty the kitchen could be! I will be visiting Nashville again but I will make sure I do not stay here. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. Unless I hated them. LOLI specifically got a yelp account just to write a bad review for this motel, because IT IS THAT BAD! To start with the room has a dirty feel. I actually wore my flip flops in the shower and when walking around the room. The pillows smelled terrible and the comforter had a cigarette burn in it. To top it off there were flies and gnats sharing the room with us! Considering that the room wasn't clean we opted to not eat the continental breakfast either.There was essentially no room to walk around in the room either. The bathroom was about the size of a travel trailer's bathroom-it was a struggle just to change in it. The beds were really close together and close to the walls making nearly impossible to move. Finally, when it came time to check out the receptionist at the front desk actually stamped our credit card! This is totally illegal and they can basically reproduce the credit card, so needless to say we will have to cancel it. Comfort Inn should be ashamed that this poor excuse for a hotel is part of their chain.Well, the Comfort Inn on Demonbreun in Nashville is a dump. But it is an expensive dump which can fool you into thinking you purchased something of value. Just when I was almost ok with it, we went to breakfast. The eggs were some kind of prefabricated disks. Thought you couldn't ruin scrambled eggs. And that dish of mystery chunks to go on the biscuits shall go unpraised. Saggy bed, fixtures falling off toilet and shower. Unreliable wifi. Dirty carpet. Like that. We are leaving and staying near the airport!!DISGUSTING!!!! Keep driving, dirty, toilet ran, sink clogged, full of fruit flies. Loud screaming neighbors, smoked in the room. Said they had wifi but it wouldn't work unless you are in the lobby. Called the front desk said someone would be down to help never showed. Just an awful nights sleep more like a half way house. Skip it!Worst hotel and customer service. Besides it being disgusting the front desk person named, sonny, told me to "fuck off." When I tried to get another room. A terrible experience. Totally miserable while I was there.It's nothing fancy, but very competitively priced, offering free breakfast (biscuits, eggs, sausage, etc), outdoor pool, and a safe walk to Broadway Street. I stayed here for a girls' weekend in October, and for another one in June. Some reviews say the service was horrible, but I didn't experience that at all. Staff was very friendly, and even upgraded our two rooms to suites with jacuzzi tub, pullout couch, and a lot more room for girly primping time. I definitely recommend this Comfort Inn to anyone looking for an above average, standard hotel experience.
review_content_40: This was one of THE WORST hotels we've EVER stayed in. The construction on the lobby is SO BAD you have no idea where to go. No signs, no directions or arrows as to where the hell the front lobby is. The check in staff was rude and I can't believe we paid $ 187.00 FRIGGON dollars for that piece of crap room! I think we got seriously taken for a ride. I asked for a military discount and she assured me that it was the lowest price, ONLY to find out when we checked out the next morning, she didn't and the front desk guy gave us a 10 dollar discount.The room had an overall dirty feel to it. Crappy microwave, fridge was barely cold, bathroom was dirty and best of all, it's in the WORST part of town. Really enjoyed the homeless and lowlifes hanging out in the parking lot. My kids were scared and got more so when the police cars starting arriving along w/ the fire trucks at 11:30 at night.Next morning, we couldn't leave fast enough but had to get our "free" breakfast. I'm sure it tasted great when it was cooked 3 days before. As it was, we got leftover, rubbery biscuits w/ gravy that looked like dog food and the rest wasn't much better. This place was so low class from the customer service, to the food, to the rooms, to the building in general. Was so bad it's scarred us from EVER going to another Comfort Inn ANYWHERE. We deserve a refund at the very least "survival" pay for staying there.I cannot understand this place getting any good reviews. It was just so horrible.................STAY FAR AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!!!!!!!!! O and the photo's online or on this site? Doesn't look ANYTHING like what you actually get!Great price and location with a great staff! I needed a hotel that was affordable near downtown for an event and this has been a great find! It was also a bonus to find out there was breakfast included in my stay (and not just a continental breakfast). I also didn't realize there was a great pool until I got there. But the best part are the employees. Everyone is so friendly and super helpful. I had numerous boxes delivered to the hotel for an event and they have helped me pack up my car! And there is a row of cute restaurants right across the street in case the 10 min walk to the other areas is too far.I have a long history with this hotel, and most of it has been very positive. When I lived in Nashville, this is where I put up family and other visitors. I didn't even look anywhere else. Great rates, location, pretty nice rooms and good people. I no longer live in Music City, and I made the decision to stay here while in town with a friend for some recording we were doing at a studio nearby. That was a mistake that nearly ruined the whole weekend. I don't have time to get into great detail, but I'll tell you that my poor experience began a month before arriving when I originally made the reservation. The problem: The price. This is not a $140/night hotel. It's not a $100/night hotel. It never has been, and it certainly hasn't been noticeably updated in the 10 years I've been a customer. They may have painted a few fiddles on the exteriors, but this price point is laughable, friends. My guest, a first-timer to Nashville, had a room with the room number scrawled onto it in Sharpie. And that number wasn't even correct. It's *that* kind of place. The kind of place where you go to turn on their admittedly nice big wall-mounted TVs and the remote doesn't work. And the handle of the fixture in the shower clangs loudly into the bottom of the tub the first time you go to use it.But the main reason for my terrible experience at this hotel is that it's currently (in winter of 2013) basically sitting on top of a construction site. This was not mentioned when booking (at $140/night!), and was mentioned only in passing as we checked in after dark when things had quieted down. Both me and my guest assumed the "construction" the front desk person hinted at (she was comically blaming it on a random guy just hanging out by the desk) was the plywood entryway we navigated to get to her from the lot. We thought they were just re-doing the front facade of the hotel.What ACTUALLY was happening, was they were building an enormous structure right next door. So close, the area used to be the spillover parking lot for the hotel. Just yards away. And this wasn't light construction -- this was explosives and 4-wheeled jackhammers. Below-ground foundation work.Well, at least you've got till 8 or 9am until those trucks show up, right? Wrong. The Reverse-beeping convoys roll in a'rumblin' around 6 o'clock. They don't get at it for real till 8 (when earthquake-like detonations that rock all of the Music Row/Mid Town area also resume), but chances are you won't get back to sleep between 6-8. And there's really no chance at all of sleeping after 8.What does this translate into? Well, for me and my guest that meant by the end of our 4-night stay, we were pretty much zombies. We worked in the recording studio till late, and wouldn't get to sleep till 2 or 3 -- meaning we got 3, maybe 4 hours of sleep a night. As we waited at the gate at BNA for our flight home, my guest turned to me and said, "I feel like I've been in Vegas two days too long." I knew what he meant because I felt exactly the same, and I don't even drink anymore. It was all thanks to the Comfort Inn on Demonbreun. Where sleep is as elusive as that # 1 Country hit.You get what you pay for at this hotel. Actually, you might get a bit more than you pay for. This is one of the cheapest hotels in downtown Nashville. We paid less than half the price for this hotel as we would have paid for a room near the honky tonks and the Country Music Hall of Fame. With that in mind, we were pretty happy with what we got here. The rooms are small, but clean. The bathrooms are really tiny, but again, clean. There's free breakfast every morning, which includes coffee and tea, bagels, eggs, muffins, waffles, cereal, fruit, and more. There's also free coffee and bottles of water in the lobby. The room was quite hot, however, and the AC units had been turned off and there was no way to adjust the temperature. It was like a sauna in the room - hot and humid, especially after using the shower. Someone posted a picture of the pillows, which is pretty funny because my friends and I laughed about them, too. They're little square things, and the hotel doesn't have many extras, because when we asked for more one night, they didn't have any. Parking is free in the hotel's lot, and cabs come frequently. It's a short walk to some bars and restaurants, or you can take a cab to the ones a bit farther away. The hotel is located right between the West End, where Vanderbilt is, and downtown, where the honky tonks and many of the sights are. The hotel is currently undergoing renovations, however, and it's really loud. They were even working bright and early Sunday morning, which wasn't pleasant. The management was nice enough to give us a discount for the inconvenience, though. Don't come here expecting a luxury experience, but you'll get a good bang-for-your-buck.I stayed here through one of those mystery deals on Priceline. It was under construction when I stayed, but they seemed to be assigning rooms that were as far away as possible from the noise. Maybe they've changed things around since some of the other reviewers stayed here, because I had no issues with the cleanliness of my room or the staff. Everyone was pleasant; the staff would offer a "good morning" in passing and were respectful of my stuff when they came through.The breakfast they offer is decent, if not better than other hotels I've gone to. Granted it's no IHOP, but it's free, so it's more than adequate for that. At the end of the day, I came to Nashville to see the city, not stay in my hotel. This hotel will do just fine if you have the same mindset.I would recommend staying here. The location is great. The staff was friendly and helpful. They keep the place immaculate. Breakfast nook is fully stocked. If you are looking for fancy, you are in the wrong place, but if you are looking for a good value, great price, with a wonderful location where you can walk to town, this is it!This hotel was abysmal; the premises are in disrepair, and the rooms are filthy, as our bathroom reeked of urine. There was also a burn mark on the comforter in our non-smoking room. It was freezing cold outside and our heater did not work. Although the individual who made our reservation informed me that the hotel offers federal government employees a discounted rate, they would not honor the discount for me, so we paid $240 for one night for the horrendous accommodations. To add insult to injury, when we went to check out, a car was parked illegally behind our car, almost blocking us into our parking space and obstructing the sidewalk, such that we could barely get our luggage to the car and pull out of our parking space. Upon reporting this to the front desk, they did not seem to care at all. I would not recommend staying at this hotel under any circumstances.This is my first review ever because I feel compelled to warn as many people as possible.Be sure to check the mattresses!!! Overheard a conversation while checking out with a guest and management about finding bed bugs in their room. Most people feel pretty comfortable and are aware of the basic quality of Comfort Inns. This hotel definitely has more of a Motel 6 feel. Not like any Comfort Inn I've ever stayed in. Extremely tiny bathrooms. Rooms are very old and outdated and just feel incredibly dirty. Cigarette burns in the comforters. Construction going on all around. Front desk and management not professional at all. Way over-priced. You are paying solely for the location which is in walking distance to many places downtown.Don't stay here. I only gave it one star because I couldn't give it any less.We booked to stay here through Hotwire and the staff made it clear on arrival they weren't happy that we weren't paying the full-whack.The room was cold and it smelt of cigarettes although it was a non-smoking room. The towels also smelt of mould.My partner accidentally left his jacket in the wardrobe and I rang that afternoon to let them know.
