The lady was rude and unhelpful saying nothing had been handed in so I asked her to check with staff. I called back later and she said she didn't know who had cleaned the room. From the time we were there we had only seen 3 members of staff and they were all family. The manager was only slightly more helpful but told me his staff had probably stolen the jacket as it was no longer there and no one else had stayed in the room. So that was that. Not even an apology.I also asked to use their free internet which was in reception. The lady on the desk grunted and nodded to the computer which I took as a yes. After about 5 minutes she asked me to get off the computer as someone else wanted to use it. This turned out to be a young man came out from behind the desk, presumably another relative.Spend your money elsewhere.Good: Location is great. Very close to downtown and plenty of good restaurants and bars. Beds are comfy and just the right amount of firm. Nice big TVs. Fridge, microwave, coffee pot, iron and board all in the roomBad: Continental breakfast is terrible, though I guess its what you'd expect at a cheap hotel. Coffee is undrinkable. The "fitness center" is a tiny, unmarked room three pieces of cheap and completely broken exercise gear. Treadmill didn't work at all, Elliptical felt like it was going to tip over the moment I stood on it, and the weight machine's pulleys and cables were so wobbly and sticky it added an extra 30lbs or so of drag, and created an unsafe herky-jerky motion when trying to do any exercises. They allow people visiting the nearby bars and restaurants park in their parking lot on weekends, so good luck finding a parking spot near your room on a Friday or Saturday night. Wi-Fi is free, but unbelievably slow. Overall: Stay here for the location. Leave for everything else.We had a wonderful two day stay at this Comfort Inn. We got an amazing deal on Hotwire.com and I'm glad we ended up there. Our room was nice, clean and comfortable, there was an outdoor pool, and they provided us with a crib at no charge. Its located about a half mile from Vanderbuilt and a mile from Music Row.The breakfast merits its own paragraph. This extensive spread is far different from the typical donut/stale coffee duo of most complementary breakfasts. They have a make-your-own waffle station, biscuits and gravy, cereal, oatmeal, coffee, hot cocoa, yogurt, pastries, bagels, oatmeal... Pretty much every option that you'd want. Awesome!When you stay here, don't expect a luxury stay, but expect an amazing value, with great service and all the amenities that you need. I highly reccommend.Worst customer service ever - multiple problems, no follow-up and never once did I hear the words "I'm sorry". Toilet didn't flush properly when we checked in. No big deal, I politely informed the front desk as we were leaving for dinner & they said it would be fixed within a few hours.Next morning, it was obvious the problem hadn't been fixed. As we left the hotel for the day's activities, I informed the front desk for the second time that the toilet valve wasn't working, this time with a definite annoyed edge in my voice. Came back late afternoon, relaxed for 2 hours, then as we got ready for dinner, we realized toilet STILL didn't flush. Third trip to the front desk, seriously pissed off. All they had to say is that they found out the toilet must be replaced and we'd have to change rooms. When asked why didn't they leave a message or a note to that effect, so we could have changed rooms when we first returned to the hotel, their answer was - "we meant to disable your key but we forgot". This is how the management communicates to guests that a room change is required!Changed rooms, toilet works in new room, stayed for the second night. When we returned to the hotel on the afternoon of our third day, the key to our new room didn''t work. So I trekked back to the front desk for the fourth time with a complaint. The manager said when we changed rooms the previous day, they didn't check our departure date before giving us a key to the new room. He shrugged, reprogrammed the key and gave it to me without a word.Three significant errors, and not once did I hear "I'm sorry" or "I apologize". Stay away from this hotel!Don't stay here unless you inspect your room first! My husband and I stayed here while driving through town (on a cross country road trip). When we walked into our room we noticed a strong perfume smell which was quite overwhelming....well as it turns out that strong perfume smell was to cover up the smell of mold! Yes, that's right, there was two feet's worth of visible mold growing on our ceiling! gross, gross, gross. We stuck it out here since we just needed a place to sleep before we hit the road in the morning, but seriously, no hotel should be letting people stay in rooms with mold growing on walls. ewww. Yes, this place is in a very convenient location and inexpensive for Nashville ($100ish), but had I known, I would have paid extra money to stay someplace without a mold issue.This place was better than expected! good comfy place to stay and a short taxi ride from downtown! nothing luxurious but I would stay again for the price.Spir of the moment on a roadtrip, we decided to stop in Nashville for a night just to see the sights. We wanted something under $100, but nice...and Comfort Inn was the first place that caught our eye that seemed that would fit our needs. We stopped and walked in...the lady behind the counter said they had vacent rooms, but the cost would be $90 for the night...wtf, really?! Then she found out that we were from the same part of CA as she was, and she dropped the rate to $80 for the night...that sounds more reasonable. The room was clean. The service was nice. And the pool was refreshing. Also, it's only about 1 mile from downtown...close enough to walk. Fast Food places (Taco Bell, Arbys) is only about 2 blocks away too. Free breakfast as well. I'd recommend this place to any young person that wants a nice, clean, somewhat chep place to stay....A good place to stay for people who are not looking to be pampered, but are wanting to actually spend time in the city. The price is not as cheap as other places, but the hotel is 1 mile from Broadway, and very close to the free bus. The rooms are clean. There is a microwave and fridge in the hotel (one of the reasons I wanted to book it) along with free internet, free parking, and free breakfast. The breakfast isn't that amazing, but free bagels/waffles and bananas are always a positive. Overall, I would stay here again when wanting to visit downtown.We stayed here during our road trip through the southern states. After a long drive from Louisville, KY, we were thankful that the hotel was fairly easy to get to from the highway. Customer service: The front desk employees were cordial, but not really friendly. (Where were the smiles?? Aren't we in the south?) Maybe it was because it was pretty busy. The room: The room was clean and had 2 double beds, a round table, an alarm clock which was plugged in, (surprisingly, a luxury on this trip), a flat screen tv, a refrigerator, and a microwave. It was spacious enough for one person, but not so much for 2 people. The sink was outside of the bathroom, but the bathroom was still pretty cramped. Convenience: The hotel was pretty close to downtown Nashville, should you choose to drive. You also have the option of a brief 2 block walk to the Green Circuit bus stop, which will take you there for FREE and this one runs pretty late. There are 2 other free circulator buses and they don't run nearly as long. Amenities: The pool looked really nice and clean, but it was too cold to get in. We noticed the gym on our way to our room. It looked pretty well equipped with a treadmill and a few other machines. They served a free breakfast, which is ALWAYS nice. The spread was nice: fruit, bagels, muffins, cereal, orange juice (a little watery), tea, coffee, sausage, and some weird eggs circle things, and a waffle maker. I'm warning you to stay away from the waffles though. They had plain and blueberry, which was a green color. I tried both and they had some weird aftertaste to them. I couldn't finish it, so I grabbed some fruit instead.Overall: It's a decent place to stay, so I would stay here again. I got my money's worth. Next time, I would just avoid the waffles. :-)Let's just say I went to the effort of getting a Yelp account just so that I can rate this heap of shit. This place isn't worthy of any stars, in fact it is the black hole of hotels. An abysmal vortex of crappiness that makes the Hans Brinker (hans-brinker.com) seem like the Hilton. On a positive note, I can recommend The Hyatt Place out at the airport. The cab ride to & from the city is reasonable and the breakfast makes the extra miles worth your while.Good: Affordable, clean, and impeccable service.Not so good: Sheets were a bit itchy, vending machine ate my money.After staying here for three days, I was ready to head home, albeit sad because I had lost my camera in a cab the previous night. The guy at the desk, Mac, spends 20 minutes of his OWN TIME to help me phone up a bunch of the cab companies to see if they can find anything. Way to help a brother out, guys!Would definitely stay here again.DIRTY, DISGUSTING. The room reeked of Vanilla carpet powder with an undertone of stale cigarette smoke. There was still a Used bar of soap in the shower and water standing in the tub. There was a cigarette burn hole in the blanket on the bed. This was a "non-smoking' room. Also the curtain was falling off. We could not stay in the room because our lungs burned trying to breath in the room. We had to find another room last minute at another hotel and this made for an exhausting anniversary instead of a restful one!
review_content_60: This place was a disaster from start to finish. To be honest, this could be the opening scene for The Hangover 3 - going from bad to worse. I think that makes sense actually - Las Vegas, Thailand, Nashville...  We booked through a third party, so this possibly led to some complications, but read on to find out what happened. This is a long one, so skip down to the bottom to see my bullet-point list if you are like me and consider the length of this review to be unacceptable* - I have embarrassed myself here to be honest, but I could not edit this at all - I tried!We needed a room for 5, so we booked a double with a crib, and even called a week before our trip to confirm that they could provide the crib - 'no problem, it is guaranteed!' So we arrive, go to our room that was already sub-par (cigarette smoke, not that clean, decor was straight out of 'No Country for Old Men'**) and found no crib. We called to have them bring it up, and they told us they could not provide it.  After a discussion they suggested that they would send up some sheets so that our extra person could stay on the floor 'THE FLOOR!!!??? So this was unacceptable and we let them know clearly, and they kindly offered us another room, no discount, full-price. We suggested that we might leave to find a hotel where they could accommodate us all, and they invited us to do that, but that we would still have to pay for not one, but TWO nights.... What the ......? We were locked into a contract to the death with these guys - is that legal? Were we going to be visited by 'The Family'*** in the middle of the night? While we were on the phone, someone decided to paint our front door - PAINT THE FRONT DOOR!!!??? Congratulations on attempting to improve the decor, but painting the front door ten mins after we checked in was a ridiculous move, and one of us ended up with paint on our jacket. So we went down to chat to them at the front desk, and this didn't go well. They said we were welcome to leave, but they would still charge us for the first night, and because we were less than 24 hours out from the next night (we planned to stay for 3) they would charge us for this. We spoke to management, we spoke to Comfort Inn Head Office, we spoke to our third party and no-one would help. I did't say could, I said would.So bullet point form for those challenged with time;- suggested one of us sleep on the floor- even though they could not accommodate us, they would not refund us- management were super rude - Comfort Inn Head Office were totally unsupportive- started painting our front door 10 mins after we checked in- staff were 'looking' and 'peering' through the windows constantly- we went down for breakfast the next morning and they started cleaning our room before we had removed our luggage or checked-outThis hotel was super expensive, the management were rude, frat boys partied it up until the wee hours, breakfast was disgusting, overall this is a terrible hotel - YELP should offer a negative star review. It is the hotel equivalent to that movie BASEketball**** that the guys from Southpark made a while back, although that gets an unbelievable 6.4/10 on IMDB - we are living in an upside-down world right now!Do not stay in this hotel - you will be disappointed......Unless you would like to see people attempt to work out how to use the waffle machine in the morning. I am surprised they didn't have a Navy Seal operating this thing, it was a tricky little sucker.... Very entertaining - we took a video and will be posting this to YouTube at a later date.Thanks,Lee*the length of this review is far too long, sorry for those of you who didn't intend reading a novel when you searched out a review for this hotel**what am I doing relating this hotel to movies? I am not like this in real life, sorry.***I had to add a third, and this is not talking about a movie called 'The Family' as that sounds great, almost like 'Meet The Fockers', just without the comedy, a pure family movie. I am talking about 'THE FAMILY' like off Godfather or something? Scarface? I dunno, I am out of movie references...****just having a laugh now....Pretty sure this is the best hotel in Nashville ... at least for under $90.  You got the pool, the continental breakfast, and you're only a cheap cab ride away from the real downtown.  If you're old and want quiet, maybe not the best.  But if you're looking to have a beer down by the pool with some cool cats, go for it.This place is an absolute dump. It is a motel, not a hotel.  exterior noise is significant. Bathroom is tiny. You can hardly close the door when you are inside. Room smelled funky and everything was dirty and old. Internet is free but extremely slow. I would NEVER EVER stay here, EVER! If I could give it negative 3 stars, I wouldThis hotel is actually pretty great for the price.  It's probably the best cheaper hotel to stay in town (and by in town I mean within walking distance to popular downtown Nashville bars and restaurants).  It doesn't look run down or creepy like most of the cheaper hotels around, and its in a safe AND convenient location right by I-65.It is located on Demonbreun which means Music Row is a block away and there are several restaurants shops and bars right across the street.  The Comfort Inn is a short $5 cab ride to most of the tourist locations including the Ryman and all the honky tonks on Broadway.The rooms are pretty spacious and very clean although a little dated.  You get free Internet and access to the outdoor pool when the weather is nice.This hotel was absolutely disgusting and infested with COCKROACHES. We complained twice  while we were at the hotel and all they offered to do was spray. At the time we had no idea they were COCKROACHES, but the hotel admitted they knew on the phone later when we called. When we called to complain for the FOURTH time they still refused to give us our money back. ABSOLUTELY DO NOT STAY HERE! We will be calling choice hotels and the board of health to complain.For the price, you cannot beat this Comfort Inn in Downtown Nashville.  We used a Groupon certificate for a large suite and it was very nice.  The staff met every need we had from extra tooth brushes to arranging a great Town Car and driver for transportation.  The downtown location is very good too.  The overall experience was far better than I was expecting for a Comfort Inn.  The large outdoor pool was clean and nice, the room was large and immaculate, and the complimentary breakfast was good.Great place, nice staff, upgraded our room for free. Pet-friendly! and nice flat screen HD TV. Stayed here on our cross-country road trip 1/5/12.Comfortable and easy to get to.  Room was a little on the small side, but we were only there for one night.  Clean, everything worked.  All of the room doors open to the outside, which I think of as a slight negative. Very convenient to downtown, particularly the Ryman.The location is great - in walking distance from food, bars, tourist attractions & other downtown related things.About a ten to fifteen minute ride from the airport.Obviously not a fancy hotel, but a really good deal for the location.The couple who run the place are very nice & helpful.My room was modest but spotless.Free continental breakfast in the morning, free internet, microwave & fridge in room, and standard toiletries.I have no complaints & would definitely stay there again.This place is great, the rooms are agreeable, there is a microwave, fridge, and coffee pot in each room.  The pool was not freezing and very refreshing, a quick trip to the front desk gets you towels.  The internet is a little slow, but it is free with the room so it is great.  Music row is close by, it is pretty much right off the freeway which makes it accessable even for only a night on a drive through.  I have stayed at many other hotels around the same price on my trip cross country and this one so far takes the cake, and i can have my dog with me, which is even better.  It is about a 15 min walk to downtown from here, but if you plan on drinking the front desk  will call you a cab which i am sure will only run you a couple of bucks, I walked it was great exercise and a fun way to see the city.  I will definitely make this my place when i come back to nashvilleAt first we thought, okay hotel for the price. Until 20 frat idiots decided to trash the hotel by throwing junk into the pool and jumping in the pool, screaming all over the place until 5am! Front desk did nothing and told us to call the cops. They told me if I felt I had to leave that was up to me because I booked thru hotwire.  Learned my lesson not to go thru hotwire  or stay here.

review_content: I will update my review to five stars. I had forgotten this was available with American Express Fine hotels. Darn! Now that I think back to my first visit I wasn't upgraded because the room last week was the same as in 2013. Disappointed that front staff indicated they upgraded me in 2013 as I realize in reading my first review again that they didn't. Oh well.I will keep my rating at a 5 since it is based on this visit. I still believe a five star hotel should have free water. The room is very lovely and has a lot of charm (as does the whole hotel). Certainly not a chain. The service was outstanding to include the Capitol Grille restaurant.What was particularly nice this time was my breakfast. For $20 including all taxes and fees you get a large pot of coffee, two eggs, choice of meat, choice of biscuit (yum!) or toast, potatoes and orange juice. And delicious jelly. An absolutely amazing deal! And to package it as $20 total is really smart. I usually skip breakfast because I don't have time and it is so expensive. This one was delivered within 20 minutes and was so inexpensive. The best part though was it was the most enjoyable room service meal I have ever had! It was all FRESH! They have their own garden so it is all farm to table. Amazing. There are a few things they could still do but I will give it a five. It was a delightful experience.The Grande Dame of all Southern hotels. I remember the first time I walked into the hotel lobby, the building had just been purchased by Park Hotels I think it was, and they were planning a $40M refurb. And this property was in great need, you could see the detail, you knew it was special, but the years had not been kind. Much to the amazement of the new owners when they began to dismantle the stained glass ceiling, they found this beautiful artwork underneath a layer of brown cigar smoke that had accumulated over 70 years +. Well here we are after the latest facelift, and I'm still their biggest fan. Just something special about this hotel, I guess 105 years of history will do that for you.The rooms are beautiful and tastefully appointed. Got a great rate on a Junior Suite, very reasonable, made for a fantastic last night in town after the best Christmas ever. The hotel was busy last evening, no executive suites available but thats not unusual because the ballrooms are in constant demand. They look like something you would find at the White House. I'll never forget my parents dragging me here when I was a kid, and over dinner my dad instructing me to "go see the bathroom." I told him I didn't need to go and he insisted..."Go to the bathroom young man." OK, so I went .... 15 minutes later he had to come find me, I was having my shoes shined. LOL I'll bet more ladies have visited this men's bathroom than any other facility on the planet. I know I've toured 5-6 through there, the other guys don't mind, its a right of passage that everybody must experience. The rooms and beds are designed for extreme comfort, we had a direct view of the State Capitol which always makes this a unique experience. Downtown Nashville is pretty compact so you can walk anywhere you want to go from here without breaking a sweat, just valet your car and forget about it until departure. Make sure to check out the Oak Bar and if you make a reservation at the Capitol Grille and go in with no expectations, you'll enjoy yourself. Just wished the Veranda had been open, thats my favorite spot to have a drink just off the lobby, may be a seasonal thing. Anyway, this place is just spectacular, if you're in Nashville for a visit do yourself a favor and come check it out and have a few in the Oak Bar. It should be on everybody's Bucket List.I am in love with this hotel.   When you get at the doors, it's 5 star service right away.  The doormen came out to greet me and take my bags inside.  Walking into the lobby and up the stairs, I was amazed.   The stained glass ceiling and the furniture/decor is just breathtaking.  Throughout my stay I really felt taken care of and valued.  The Molton Brown products are obviously a plus as are the super luxurious bath robes, turn down service complete with mini treats, slippers, and filled ice bucket.  There were treats near the elevator in the afternoon, apples and water at the gym, and water bottles at the door when my morning began. When it rained one day, they provided umbrellas at the lobby entrance as well.   The hotel also has a pillow bar!  Not only are there 4 down pillows on the bed - there are 3 additional options in the closet (memory foam, latex, and buckwheet) and from what I hear, there are other options if you call the front desk.   There is a nespresso machine too (although, I'd prefer coffee maker over espresso). And how could I forget a TV in the bathroom.  Staff was 100% competent and provided a high level of service.  They were also very knowledgable and offered suggestions and directions every time I left the hotel. Hotel is completely worth it.  Put it on your list now... It is a must do. ((on the other hand, oak bar is more take it or leave it, kind of cool, but not imperative to check out))When my friend told me that we were staying at The Hermitage I was shocked. This place has been around for over a hundred years. Valet parking, the staff was very welcoming, someone to carry your bags, the lady that checked us was a little stressed but she did give us some great tips of places to visit. The room was huge, cloth robes were on the bed, the bed was turned down, we had a bottle of champagne waiting for us. We had not just a coffee machine, but and espresso machine. We had a Jacuzzi tub, clear glass walk in shower. King size bed with comfy pillows. If you can afford it, or just even stop in for a drink in The Oak Bar.Beautiful hotel and especially the lobby. What is so unfortunate is the service which I would rate a one if I could. Me and my wife have stayed at 5star hotels all around the world and never had this bad experience with the service without them even try to make up for it. 2 times in a row we have ordered Roomservice and gotten the food 1,5hour after we called (at that point when you don't even want it anymore). Also trying to schedule a massage turned out to be a disaster when they were going to call back and confirm and never did so I called back and asked and they had no idea what I was talking about and ended up getting a completely different massage than what I wanted. I want to point out that the valet is very good and friendly staff.The Hermitage lives up to the 5 star ranking. I loved interacting with the bellmen in tophats. They were very energetic and respectful. The bed was extremely comfortable. I LOVED the lobby. So picturesque. The only problem was an alarm clock set for 530 am that went off the first two mornings we were there.  Cider and cookies delicious. Feel like you've gone into the twilight zone and returned to the roaring 20s. My boyfriend enjoyed walking to all the downtown attractions.My second historic hotel of America was checked off my list in 2013. While indeed normally pricey, I booked late and mid-week and found it affordable and worth every penny. The valets treated my car fantastically, trust me, I watch like a hawk. And they always had an extra umbrella to lend me when we went strolling if there was even the slightest chance of rain.The concierge could not have been more knowledgeable about how to get around while walking, the acts on Whiskey Row that fit our bill and just exuded true southern hospitality.The room was wonderful. Where else do get slippers and a bathrobe and turndown service nightly?The Hermitage will be a regular stay while in Nashville in the future. I hope they have the spotty wi-if repaired by then.Wow. Simply the best hotel experience I've had in a really long time. A stunning hotel with impeccable service. This place rivals any Ritz Carlton. I cannot wait to come back!It was super fancy and the service was very nice. The bar area was old school and elegant.The employees there if you ask will let you peek into the famous mens art deco bathroom. I would definitely recommend this place to everybody!We only came for a drink in the downstairs bar, but it was great! The service took a little while, however it was packed, and when we did order our drinks were great! Be sure to stop in and see the men's restroom. Girls are allowed in there, too!I have only had a few occasions to stay in a historic hotel and this one is definitely one of our favorites.  My wife and I took a short vacation to Nashville in order to do the normal tourist things in a different city in our new state.  The people at this hotel treated us as if we were the most important customers in the hotel and were just so nice and polite.  The room, along with the rest of the hotel was absolutely beautiful and they had made everything so comfortable. It was so great to be able to spend a few days feeling like you are being spoiled.  It is also located in such a great spot that we were able to walk to several places including museums and Music Row. I highly recommend staying a couple of nights here.Stolen Jewelry.My sister and I visited Nashville for the first time Memorial Day weekend. I was so excited to be in Music City and take everything in! Unfortunately, The Hermitage Hotel left a pretty big dent in my impression of Nashville. We arrived back to our hotel room after spending an afternoon in Belle Meade to discover that I had jewelry missing. A gift from my parents, a pair of diamond and pearl earrings, were gone. I filed a report with the hotel and have yet to hear back from them, but I don't really expect to. This ordeal makes it difficult to say I had a great time in Nashville. I loathe the fact that I can't enjoy myself in a brand new city without worrying about who will be in our room going though our things.If I go back to Nashville, I will not be staying here again.Other observations:Pros: The lobby of the hotel is beautiful and that celling is gorgeous!  The bar serves delicious and well-made drinks. (The Tennessee Waltz is amazing!) The restaurant was on point with the food as well.Cons: Our room was okay. For what is cost to stay here, the beds weren't super comfortable and the sheets seemed haphazardly clean.Celebrated my birthday here tonight and I could not have been happier to do so! One of the best experiences of our Nashville trip so far. I wanted to come here because I read Taylor Swift say in an interview once that she took her Mom here for Mother's Day brunch once and fell in love and I had a similar experience. the ambience definitely takes you to a different time period. When we arrived, the staff was very friendly. Our waitress Trisha was very sweet, explained all the menu options in a way that made you want to order everything because it sounded so delicious! She was also very kind and accommodating to my different food sensitives and double checked with the chef which was very caring.  The food is all very consciously-sourced which was reflected in the taste and high quality! I had the double stacked burger with a delicious salad (almonds and sundried blueberries can anyone say YUM!!) my mom got a tasty trout dish and fresh grilled squash and my dad had lamb loin which was cooked to perfection and very pretty (decorated with edible flowers). The ingredient combinations with each dish are inventive and uniquely delicious. We had a slight delay with two of our plates and Tim, the manager was so kind and apologetic to us (even though we didn't mind much!) And he and the chef Garrett comped our entire meal because of the wait! It was clear the chef Garrett runs a very skilled and considerate kitchen and they all really care about their guests. Thank you! It was such a special birthday treat and the staff here is an amazing representation of Nashville hospitality! A true treasure of the city!They call it a 5 star hotel but they sure don't act like one. Service is very disappointing!This hotel is stunning! The only five star hotel in TN, and these guys certainly know what they are doing! Everyone was so friendly and polite, and never seemed rushed to get away from a conversation. The building is historical and beautiful from the lobby to the bathrooms. Great tub with a TV to watch and a separate shower. The rooms are elegant and comfortable.The Hermitage is premium. While it's the nicest hotel in the city, you also pay for it. I've enjoyed staying here my last two trips to the city, I've almost spoiled myself to where nothing else will measure up. Anyways, this is my jam. Slippers are nice and the TV in the bathroom is cool too.My first stay here I was surprised to have a man knock on my door and offer me a complimentary bottle of Champagne. I drank it. And it was good.We loved it! I might go 4.5 stars since the turn-down service was a bit inconsistent.The hotel is lovely, tastefully decorated, and nicely appointed. The beds are comfy and the bathroom is spacious. Frette linens were very comfortable. (Molton Brown personal products ~ not very impressive. Sodium Laureth Sulfate in the shampoo, for example ~ a huge no-no.)The staff were entirely delightful! They made it pleasant every day and seemed genuinely happy.Thank you for the cookies and lemonade each afternoon. :-)Amazing gorgeous hotel. Everyone seems to know your name right away and they address you by name....it's pretty cool.  It's like a stay in a fantasy world where everything is perfect. I left my hotel keys at a nice restaurant tonite, they called the hotel told them and when I showed up .....not able to find my room key, they had already made me a fresh one,Definitely a place to stay!!!!Beautiful hotel! ! Spectacular views !! Great getaway for my husband and I!! Concierge and wonderful service! !! Loved the already ready bubble bath  (once you start running the water ). Perfect location! ! Boutique is perfect for dress shopping! !!  Definitely recommend! !!!!! Definitely a 5 star! !!!!Beautiful, classic old hotel that has been well taken care of. Rooms are nice and spacious and the service is impeccable. From the gift shop to the valets to the front desk to the phone operator everyone was gracious and charming and extremely helpfulStrongly recommend!
review_content_20: For my 700th review, I wanted to write about something absolutely spectacular.  Sunday evening.  First of all, I would like to point out that I have driven through Nashville over 50 times in my life, and I only stopped once- I ended up being encountered by 3 meth heads and got food poisoning.  That left a reallll sour taste in my mouth.  I was driving back home to MEM from SDF (sorry I use airport code, SDF=Louisville).  My car KEPT telling me to get rest.  But I had no idea about any hotels in Nashville.  I kept looking up stuff, and I saw this place.  So I looked at rooms, and saw the place had promise- so I booked a grand deluxe, on a whim, with a AAA rate.  Mind you, I did this about an hour from Nashville.  I got to the city, and I was able to find the hotel fairly easily.  I packed light, with my backpack.  I pulled up to the valet (which should be valet only here), and told them I was checking in.  Very nice.  I walked into the hotel, and was amazed at the old world elegance this place had.  And the fact it was about 10PM on a Sunday night, it wasn't hectic at all.  I gave the gentleman at the front desk my AAA card, my license, and my AMEX.  He asked me if there was anything special going on, and I just told him I needed to relax before my upcoming week of hell.  He told me he had good news for me, that I just got upgraded to the Presidential Suite!  I thought I had gotten punked, but it was for real!  I just wanted some extra space (as the grand deluxe is 590 sq ft).  He gave me the keys to room 812, and the adventure began...I took the elevator to the 8th floor (out of 9), and my room was right there.  I couldn't find the door, (as it was labeled 812)- then I was realized, I had 3 to choose from. I entered, and there was some graceful music playing from a Bose sound system. The pics I took should be self explanatory, but let me tell you what- staying in one of the nicest rooms in the state, was truly a once in a lifetime opp- considering the price I paid.  The view of the Capitol was phenomenal- at night and at day.The actual suite is about 2000 square feet- with the bedroom on the right (marble bathroom tucked away), a huge ass tv area and living area with dining room table for 6, and 1/2 bath there.  On that end is also the mini kitchen with tons of bar stuff and snacks.  I still couldn't believe it.  I could walk from one end of the suite to the other, and honestly get winded- it was that big!  The bathrooms were equipped with Molton Brown amenities, the stuff I currently use to keep my skin clean- I was surely impressed!  I was also surprised to see they had a choice of buckwheat, latex, and memory foam pillows in the closet for your liking- but I just stuck to the 5 on the bed that were already there :).After playing around in the room, I decided to walk around downstairs and soak in the rest of the place.  I started on the Mezzanine level, where the spa, fitness center, and Governor's Salon was.  There were also 3 ornate tables that could be used for chess, overlooking the lobby.I had heard about the famous bathroom here, so I looked.  And when I went into the bathroom, I realized this is really nice- but not the one I had seen in the news (next review on that one).  So I went downstairs to the bar, got some food n drinks, and headed back up to paradise.I had to take a shower, and that thing was awesome.  There were 2 handles, one for a handheld water stream, the other for a nice surprise- a freaking 4 head ceiling shower that felt like a rainstorm.  I fell asleep in the robe that night...Waking up was hard, as the bed was so comfortable and I realized I had to get back to Memphis soon.  So I took another shower, and I was on my way.  Valet got my car in a matter of minutes, and they were as friendly as can be.This place is on the high end, but I tell you what, there was absolutely no complaints here.  If I could give this place 6 stars, I would.  And it gave me an entirely new perspective of Nashville. So for that, I thank you dearly.Cheers!Hermitage Hotel is the only 5 star hotel in Tennessee.Our adventure began this past wknd while at the Yelp Spring Fling wknd festivities. I've lived in Nashville for over 10 yrs and never have i stopped by to tour the place.As you walk in, you walk up these steps that lead you to the main foyer where you can check in and take in the view. To the right was a staircase leading down to the restaurant Capitol Grille and also the Secret Bathroom!i didn't get to tour much of the hotel since that was the extent of my visit but i'm pretty sure the rest of the hotel is just as extravagent as what i saw.This hotel is exceptional; I've been treated like a king! Booked through Amex platinum travel and I received a $100 food and beverage credit which only made this experience better. If you're in Nashville and you're not staying at the hermitage hotel you're doing yourself a disfavor.My new husband and I took a mini-honeymoon to Nashville, and The Hermitage could not have been a better hotel to recover from our wedding. From the moment we pulled up to when we drove away, the staff was so friendly and accommodating-- we never wanted to leave! The room was incredible-- the capitol was framed perfectly through one of our windows, the bathtub was DELIGHTFUL (you can watch tv! while bathing!), and the bed was, literally, dreamy. And as someone who usually yelps to review restaurants, I can't skip all the delicious treats. From a champagne welcome to perfect room service grits to nightly chocolates, we never needed to leave the room. We DID leave the room, however, and were pleased to find that the best of Nashville was right outside the door. Even in wintry weather, we were able to walk right over to Broadway in just about 5 or 10 minutes. Perfect location!In all, we just loved The Hermitage and hope to spend at least a few of our anniversaries there. (if I could, I would take away a half a point because I needed about 25 more packets of the bath salt thingies. I'm serious, I loved that bath tub.)Five stars. This hotel is a gem. We were slightly worried when making hotel arrangements when visiting Nashville (upon discovering that there is not a Ritz-Carlton in this city) but this hotel FAR exceeded any expectations that we had. The room was spacious and we had adjoining suites with the rest of my family and the rooms were beautiful with big bathrooms. They even provide each guest with a choice of 3 different pillows (down, memory foam and barley) so you can pick the one that best suits your preference. There's a 24 hour gym with plenty of machines to choose from.  I should also mention that the lobby is positively breathtaking when you first walk up the stairs. There's a large stained glass mural on the ceiling which creates a beautiful dissipated lighting effect and lots of comfortable sofas and chairs to lounge in while you people watch. The Capitol Grille which is located downstairs on the bottom level is amazing for Breakfast, brunch and dinner (we ate there for each of those mealtimes). Oh and the hotel is pet-friendly--it doesn't get any better than that! We will definitely be staying here whenever we come visit my sister and her husband in Nashville!!!I don't often mingle with the upper crust of society, but this place was certainly the prime cuts of hotels.  The service from entry to exit was phenomenal.  The lobby was already decorated for the upcoming Christmas holiday and it was elegant and gorgeous all wrapped up into one.  In the morning there is complimentary coffee and muffins and in the evenings from 4-7 there was complimentary spiced cider and cookies. (I raided those gingersnap cookies all night!)  My buddy and I explored every inch of the hotel and attempted to use as much cool stuff as we could.  The best part about this hotel was the gym area located on the mezzanine level. Here is why and no it was not because they had a really awesome tiny locker room with a nice shower and toilet area with complimentary toiletries and fine lotions.  This was located right outside the gym area where you can pick up your complimentary bottled water and towels. It was that flavored water son! They had two different flavors; cucumber and mint water and melon water.  This water was so fantastic.  I drank these waters all weekend like a boss!  What is that, you want to match wits with someone and play chess while sipping on a fine beverage? No problem, grab yourself a bourbon beverage downstairs at the Oak Bar or flavored water and go to the front desk and get your chess pieces. Proceed to the mezzanine level and have a seat and play the game with a fantastic view of the splendid lobby.  I also recommend taking a stroll over to the glass case next to the receptions area that contained some of the history of the hotel; it is interesting to see that back in the 40s the hotel rooms were only $10 a night. Real talk on the bathroom.  The bathroom that everyone talks about is pretty neat. Would I travel far and wide to see it, no; would I stop and see it while I was in Nashville, no. Could I see myself filming a rap video in there, hell yes! Check it out, it is pretty cool.The rooms were pretty nice.  The beds and sheets were comfortable.  The robes were also really nice and silky smooth.  The bathrooms had a good size tub, a standup shower, with a TV and dual vanity sinks. Overall, I would definitely recommend staying here and taking advantage of all the perks this hotel has to offer. They have fantastic services and the hotel is in a great location, right near the Ryman Auditorium and the Bridgestone Arena.Beautiful lobby.  Beautiful exterior.  Very expensive hotel---and for the price, the rooms are dated.  I'm not into the antique feel or look, personally.  If you are--you will like it.  The bathrooms are very nice, however.  The gym is really small, and there's no spa, no sauna, nothing really special here to enjoy outside of your room.  It's a nice hotel, just a little too stuffy and boring for my taste.  If you like that scene, this will be for you.  I prefer more modern spaces with more amenities for the price.  We like 5 star amenities, and we look for that wherever we stay, but we ended up walking to other high end hotels to enjoy a more relaxed feel for dinner.  I doubt I'll stay here again.I enjoyed my stay here. The staff is professional and the service is efficient. The rooms are quaint and upscale. They have a nice restaurant downstairs and the coolest men's room I have ever seen in my life. There is a lot of history in its construction and the location is awesome - walking distance from popular bars and nightlife. I would highly recommend if $600 a night is in the budget.Beautiful hotel beautiful rooms.Such a beautiful property. The staff is very polite and professional. What I loved most about the hotel was the huge room! Aside being very spacious, the room was clean, well organized, and very well decorated. The vanities in the bathroom were in great shape. Great shower too. A big closet, a small safe-box. The room had a very comfortable bed. The pillows however were a little cheap but luckily they have three different kinds of pillows in the closet. Their turn down service is great too, although the service never came on the second night (no, I did not have the privacy sign at the door)! Also, the cleaning staff had taken the minibar key on the second night; I just didn't bother asking for another one. Ordered room service a couple of times, the food arrived hot and on time. It was delicious, both times!Great afternoon snacks in the lobby: hot apple cider and homemade cookies on the days I was there!The gym, though small, still provides a great space for a quick workout. I am taking one star off for the breakfast. The breakfast is served at the Capitol Grille downstairs and in the morning the smell of old grease from the restaurant is very overwhelming! The wi-fi is free but the signal is very spotty. Also,  in the middle of the night (3 am) I could hear metal banging and it was very annoying. Didn't hear it on the second night, the noise was back on the third night. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. If I am ever back in Nashville, I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else.Location 5+. Atmosphere 5+. Staff 5+++. I only visit a few times a year but they remember my name!We just came home from a three day stay and absolutely loved this hotel ! They gave spoiled us for the ordinary and I'm quite sure no other hotel would ever be more special. The staff was fabulous and so accommodating ! We were delivered fresh cookies and slippers at night , and they filled our ice bucket. The free cookies and tea in the afternoon was lovely as was our complimentary newspaper in the morning. Just sitting in the lobby was a treat . I can see why it is five star ! Our only complaint  was the water was never hot hot ...more warm for the showers We will be back ! Stop in even if you can't stayWow, loved everything about this hotel!  Spectacular room, comfortable and spacious with fine amenities; excellent, courteous service and central location.   The food and the whiskey list in the Oak Bar are equally impressive.  We will be back!A gorgeous hotel with a very well trained staff ~ Our room was beautiful with a wonderful view of the capital.  The care of the hotel is meticulous.  I hope to be able to stay here again very soon!I really like this hotel. It has a wonderful atmosphere, staff is friendly, its beautifully kept and such a treat because I live in Nashville.My parents visited Nashville and stayed at the Hilton. Well, their hilton experience was rather poor to say the least. They needed a new hotel ASAP that also took dogs (few do in Nashville) so I suggested this place. When they went to check in, they were immediately upgraded to a huge suite AND given a $100 gift card which we used on dinner. Let's talk about dinner in the restraint there. Amazing appetizers. Amazing main course and the most amazing desert. But back to the hotel. The staff are super friendly, the rooms are amazing, clean and homey. All I'd ever as for in a hotel. I trusted leaving my parents here - as some of the other hotels are well, not in the best part of town. Great experience.Stayed there for a girl's weekend and the hotel lived up to its 5-star billing.  Beautiful hotel, spacious bright room with great view, huge bathroom with dual vanity sinks (god bless).  Awesome and attentive staff, helpful concierge, great location walkable to all that downtown has to offer.  They even have alternative pillow options in the closet if that's your fancy - buckwheat, memory foam, latex, or plain ol' regular ones.This is a great place and a true Nashville tradition.  I would highly recommend it to anyone seeking unique experience from yesteryear.  The Oak Bar is great but closes a bit early and the furniture is a little tired but I would pick this place over all the others for location, tradition and old school charm.You get what you pay for. This is the most beautiful hotel in Tennessee.The Hermitage Hotel is a 5 DIAMOND hotel, over 100 years old and knows exactly how to treat guests from the time you pull up to valet parking until you check out.The rooms are elegant, the beds- amazing, linens and towels are Europe's finest. We live in Nashville but have stayed at the Hermitage when my husband and I needed a weekend getaway or for a special occasion.We had our daughters 18th birthday party there hosting a group of about 20 guests. The hotel has it's own event coordinator. After a couple of calls explaining what we wanted, the celebration went exactly as planned. It was a great experience for everyone. The food is unbelievable, service could not be better. If you want to purchase any of the luxury items you'll find in your room, head to the gift shop. They carry what your heart desires. Want to be pampered? Need a special weekend? Want to be treated like royalty?Check into the Hermitage Hotel. You won't be disappointed.Loved the lobby, location and rooms. I'd give it 4 or 5 stars if the reservations hadn't been an ugly hassle. Connecting rooms were at first available, then not, then okay at check-in, then not an hour later. Made our visit stressful instead of pleasant.
review_content_40: Beautiful landmark hotel with top notch service and amenities.Beautiful hotel, great staff and two very good restaurants, how can it get better?  Yes, you're going to pay for what you get, but this hotel is the best of East Coast luxury with a mindful recognition that it's representing Southern traditions.  Oh yeah, the men's original art deco bathroom on the bottom floor is outrageously cool.  Ladies, have your gentlemen ensure it's vacant and sneak in there- how many bathrooms have you been to that are a frequent photo shoot locale?The lobby is beautiful, the rooms are well appointed and the staff is always very helpful.  My favorite part is the Capitol Grille and especially Oak Bar, the best spot in Nashville to hide away and have a great drink and apps.Disclaimer:  I did not stay in any of the rooms here.  I came here for a wedding reception.The Hermitage Hotel is really amazingly beautiful.  Architecture fanatics will appreciate its Beaux-Arts design that sings of old Paris gone by.  Built at the turn of the 20th century the Hermitage is one of Nashville and the South's most well known 5 star hotels.I normally wouldn't stop and write a review of a hotel that I haven't actually stayed in a room at but I did for Hermitage because the hotel staff was incredibly outstanding.  I can't even tell you the last time I was treated with such love and respect by people.  I wish this would be a national standard for any hotel regardless of its rating as the world would be a happier place.The inside area will take your breath away.  This is where the main reception was held for my friend and toward the end of the room they opened up the upstairs area with hot food like prime rib and mashed potatoes.  The food was excellent.  There was an open bar during the reception.  I asked the bar tender if he had any olives to make me a dirty martini and he did not; however without batting an eye he went downstairs to the main bar and got the ingredients to do such.  The customer service was really great.The ballroom area that they have for dancing isn't very large but comfortable enough to put a couple dozen or so small tables and chairs and set up a DJ or band.  I didn't spend any time in the downstairs bar but it reminded me a lot of the very great bar at the Driskill in Austin:  cozy, dark and beautiful.  I have heard a lot of good things about the one at the Hermitage and would love to come back and have another martini.I just want to take a minute and Thank,  Janet Kurtz and staff at The Hermitage Hotel. When we sold our home in Green Hills we wanted to celebrate our success so we decided to check into the best hotel in Nashville. Not only are they "dog friendly" they made special arrangements for us with a handicapped friendly room. From the moment that we arrived to the moment that we checked out it was beyond our expectations. We used room service as well as going down to the Capitol Grille for meals. All was nothing short of perfect.  The little bed that they put in our room for "Harley" was not to be believed and the doggie treats and bottled water put out during "turn down" service made us and him very happy! I cannot recommend this hotel enough to both locals and international travellers! It is one of the crown jewels of the South and worthy of a visit for a night, a weekend or a week....Thanks again for the wonderful service we received during our stay. The personalized stationary that we got was pretty special too!! xoWe had a wonderful stay at the Hermitage. The staff was friendly and accommodating. We had a red eye and arrived at the hotel about 8am. They were able to get us a room in 30 minutes. The hotel itself is beautiful the rooms are large with a large bathroom. The staff was again very friendly and helpful.A friend and I heard about this hotel before we arrived, and decided to have ourselves a little wander here, but not stay, I can only vouch for the beautiful lobby and the tiny boutique in the front of the hotel. What a beautiful space! The furniture, lighting, colors, and smells (they pump the most beautiful smell into the lobby for some reason). We nade ourselves comfortable by the warm fireplace and had ourselves a nice little chat. We did a bit of window shopping in the boutique, which actually had a couple dresses and jewelry that I tried very hard not to buy. It's definitely worth a stop if you're in the area. A bit of history, a bit of beauty.Wow. All I can say is wow. A stay in this place was a complete treat from the curb, to the room, and until I got my keys from the valet to leave. There is nothing that I could suggest they could do to have made my stay any better. I am a sucker for manners in the business place, and (as expected from such caliber of a hotel) everything was yes, sir/ma'am, right away sir. "Have a good day" this, "how was your dinner" that. The room itself was great. Comfortable beds, clean sheets, and the best part of the room was bathroom. Double granite sinks, Tub complete with a bookrest, and a wonderful separate shower. I also enjoyed the mini bar here, as most do not tickle my fancy. The proximity to the Mall and other cool sites around downtown was great, and I will definitely return here when I hear Nashville's beckoned call.Absolutely beautiful historic hotel, impeccable service.  I cannot come up with anything that could have been better!  My husband and I stopped in with no reservation.  Not only were we in luck, we got a top floor corner junior suite overlooking the Capitol.  The room was so nice, we skipped going downtown for dinner and ordered room service.  The bathroom...marble double vanity and shower, separate soaking tub with a flat-panel television, over-sized towels, and separate "water closet" (that would be toilet room for simple folk).  I was saddened to come home to my own bathroom after that.Aside from the usual amenities you expect from a full-service hotel (fitness center, spa, business services, etc), there is turn down service, three additional types of pillows stored in the closet if you don't care for down. luxurious bedding and bath products, afternoon tea (missed it darn it!), choice of newspaper delivery, and the list goes on.  The hotel even offers a bath concierge-they will draw your bath to your desired temperature and allow you to select your salts-or rose petals!  They are so damn service oriented, they might take a bath with you if you ask.  They also take pets and offer special services to them as well.  Crazy!My husband really blew it with this one.  We fly into Nashville about once a year.  He better find discounted plane tickets to make up for my future stays here.  It is expensive, but so worth it.From the moment we walked into the hotel we were always addressed by our names.  The concierge service could not have been more helpful.  Try the in-house restaurant, Capital Grill.  High end service and food ( this restaurant is NOT part of the national chain by the same name). While the room rates are a little pricey, you get old world charm and large suites.  Enjoy!I think the front desk staff could use some customer service training. It's simply not polite for them to answer the phone while guests are waiting. Also, they are quite slow. They should be great for the money they charge.Check out the world famous Men's bathroom! Great for some fun photos! Cool bar too, but it gets PACKED for Happy Hour so get there early. I didn't stay at the Hotel itself but I will for sure next time I go to Nashville!Worth visiting while in Nashville. Have to get a drink at the downstairs bar as well.The Hermitage Hotel was beautiful! It was a great location to the touristy streets (walking distance) which was really nice. The staff was extremely helpful, knowledgeable and and courteous. The hotel was beautiful and they have a really neat little "history" area with tid bits from the past. Here's where I give the hotel 4 out of 5 and not 5 stars. We sat by the fire and had some wine and ordered food as well. The menu was okay, for my allergies there wasn't much for me to choose from. They were really nice trying to accommodate me but compared to their "sister" hotels, the menu was limited. At 2:00AM and 4:00AM there were couples SCREAMING and fighting in the hall. No one came upstairs to stop the fight which was frustrating. Best part of the hotel, the cookies during the day and the muffins in the morning, delicious!!I've had breakfast here twice when in town on business, and dinner once, when my wife and I went to the theater. I found nothing to criticize whatsoever. The staff were attentive without being obsequious. The food was excellent, portions reasonable. The ambience was good, although I would avoid sitting next to a large, noisy party - it's old, there's not any noise cancellation in the dining room. Highly recommend listening to your waitron's opinions, as every one I've had was knowledgeable about the menu, the history of items on it, and the area. I haven't stayed in the hotel itself, but I understand that like most historic hotels, the rooms are mainly small and dark. It's quite expensive for Nashville, too. But I'd come here any time for breakfast.One note. If you are used to East Coast style "iced coffee", be aware that the iced coffee here is more of a milk drink with a dollop of coffee, and some ice in it. I found that a little odd, but I'm sure it's just me, since everyone else in the dining room who was drinking it was enoying it.The "sock sausage" is very smokey, so if you don't like smoked meats, this is not for you. The link sausage is fabulous. The grits are great and they'll add cheese on request - they even brought mine on the side. Fresh juices, too. I'd recommend any time.Southern hospitality at its finest! Close to Broadway, beautiful, spacious rooms, outstanding service, and amazing food (Capitol Grill) - I didn't want to leave!What a beauty!The Hermitage Hotel is not only grand but also very comfortable which is a combination that can be tough to pull off but they do it with such quiet grace. My review is based off of attending the Share Our Strength benefit dinner here last weekend that was executed without a hitch. This is such a spectacular option to hosts small to large scale events such as weddings, special receptions, and fundraisers. The staff is professional and friendly while the spaces within this hotel offer up elegance and sophistication. I truly appreciated the banquet servers too as they were very discreet and accommodating in ensuring that both my date (vegetarian) and my (vegan) diets were honored although the slated menu for the evening didn't reflect those options. I am so impressed that I am tempted to treat myself to a weekend here to unwind and be pampered although it's just a few miles from my home!TIP: This is a solid option to offer up to out of town guests as it is located near many attractions.I have only ever shot weddings here, but the hotel is superb. Very well run, the staff is very helpful, super clean, and I'm assuming is worth the price you pay.This hotel is superior. Very clean and large room and bathroom with tons of amenities, like TV in bathroom, evening delivery of cookies and water to room, luxury towels and bedding, excellent in room coffee, friendly staff, etc. I highly recommend you stay here if visiting Nashville!The Hermitage Hotel is Tennessee's only Forbes Five Star and AAA Five Diamond hotel., this hotel is over 100 years old and was beautifully renovated just a few years ago. Even if your a local, it's worth stopping in just for the historic value. Located smack downtown Nashville, within walking distance to TPAC (Tennessee Performing Arts Center), The War Memorial Auditorium, Tennessee State Capitol, the Bicentennial Mall, Bridgestone Arena and the Nashville Honkey Tonk District, 2nd avenue & Broadway.The Capitol Grille is nestled inside as well as The Oak Room Lounge.What a treat it was to stay at The Hermitage Hotel from the moment you arrive the staff is inviting, friendly & extremely helpful.  I can not imagine visiting Nashville and staying anywhere other than this hotel.  My brother recommended The Hermitage Hotel assuring me that I will love it he was right on.  It was so difficult packing up to leave this gem of a hotel.  Avoid the time & energy it takes shopping hotels book this one immediately you will be so glad you did.Thank you to the fantastic staff you made a rainy weekend in Nashville seem sunny.
review_content_60: Overall: A fantastic hotel experience.Rooms: The room I stayed in had a great view of the Capitol. The bed/pillows were extremely comfortable (trust me, i'm picky) and everything seemed very clean. I consider cleanliness a paramount for hotels right now given the bed bug paranoia out there. The bathroom had a big soaking tub and a separate stand up shower.Food/Drink: I didn't eat at the Capitol Grille but have heard great things about it. It's not affiliated with the national chain. The little hotel bar downstairs is great for a drink/relax session. It's all dark wood/leather chairs. The drinks are expensive, but taste great and I definitely didn't feel cheated out of liquor. I give my thumbs up to the pear martini.Service: Fantastic. The desk attendant was very polite & even opened the little store when we had a last minute need (even though it was midnight!)Location: Far enough off Lower Broadway (where the bars/honky tonks are located) to be quiet but close enough to walk if you're wanting to get the full Nashville experience.Cost: Start at about $260 and go up to $1,500This hotel is the real deal. We stayed a night to celebrate an anniversary and it beat the heck out of past travel anniversary celebrations. The service was impeccable, everyone pronounced our last name right (silent letters - impressive), and the room amenities are a cut above. We had dinner out, but Oak Bar is the perfect spot for a nightcap and breakfast at the Capitol Grille was tasty. The renovations are beautifully done. Worth every penny.Fantastic hotel!!! Extremely charming. Great location and extremely friendly staff. The location was perfect. We were far enough from the main strip so that we didn't hear the noise yet we were in walking distance from all of the fun. The bathrooms were very nice - separate door for toilet, double sinks, tv, and nice bath tub. Rooms were very clean.Again the ever road warrior, I found myself in Nashville this time. Semi lost and arriving way past the witching hour, you can imagine how surprised I was to walk into this outstanding building.I was a) surprised b) in awe.A) Because I knew we never stayed in places this nice for the project I was currently on.B) Aesthetically it was an olympic adventure for my ever so tired eyes. A moment before I couldn't of kept them open but from the time I walked into the lobby I felt as if I had to take it all in.The staff was divine, the rooms were exquisite, and I can't wait to go back. I don't even need a reason, but if you do:Spa bathrooms with traysMolton Brown toiletriesMarble showersTowel warmersPlasmas off tubBuckwheat, Down, or Tempur Pedic pillowsSlippers, Robes, and special arrival packagesI would go on, but you get the idea...The Hermitage Hotel is truly a classic and easily the best hotel in Nashville. The rooms might not be as big as some hotels in this price range but the decor and service more than make up for that. As you may have heard, the men's bathroom in the lobby is really an attraction. The rooms are comfortable, well-appointed, and classy.Like most other high-end hotels, the service is very attentive and accommodating. They help when they can but know when guests don't want help. How many times have you had hotel staff grab a small bag and carry it a few feet then look at you expecting a tip? Won't happen here. That said, if you're cheap, this isn't the place for you - unless you're on an expense account!The location is great too. It is walking distance to many Nashville attractions, including the Honky Tonks, Country Music Hall of Fame, State Capital, State Museum, and even the Colosseum. Upper floors and the rooms on the north side have great views of Downtown or Capitol Hill.The Hermitage is truly worthy of its 5-star status. I've never stayed at a hotel where i really couldn't point a finger at some flaw or another. It's a class act. Some of my favorite details about the hotel included the selection of pillows (buckwheat, memory foam, etc), the luxurious bathrobes, the plasma TV in the bathroom, the super-fast high-speed FREE Internet connection, etc. For dining, the Oak Bar is a great setting for a drink and an app. The main dining room has a wonderful menu and great service. I highly recommend trying both during your visit (I also hear taking Afternoon Tea is also a great experience, but I didn't try that).Lastly, if you think you can't afford this place, try priceline.com during mid-week or off-season and you can definitely find a deal. It's no more expensive than the Hilton, Sheraton, etc. and definitely has a lot more character. Put it on your list if you're in Nashville- you won't regret it.This historic hotel is absolutely gorgeous. The staff is wonderful, helpful and friendly. I didn't stay here, but I did have afternoon tea and dinner here at the Capitol Grille (separate review). Afternoon tea: There's a menu on the hotel's website. Huge selection of hot teas and 5 or so varieties of the iced tea. We had white ambrosia and the iced white ginger pear tea. Delicious! The full spread is $21 per person and you get:* one tea of your choice (with as many refills as you like) * 3-tiered tray of finger tea sandwiches (caprese, cucumber, turkey, salmon)* Chocolate covered strawberries - mini balls of crispy chocolate covered half. Lemon tarts covered in raspberries. Apple pastry. AMAZING!!!!!!! * Scones with Devonshire cream and strawberry preserves Check out the men's art deco bathroom outside the restaurant. It's lovely. I posted a picture of the plaque outside the restroom explaining it's significance.Rarely does a last minute hotel reservation rise to the level of perfection but our stay at the Hermitage did! From the telephone reservation to the bellman , front desk clerk and charming Justin who got us to our room, showed us the views and all we needed to know about the hotel . The hotel arranged massages as we had been driving all day and then made dinner reservations at the Capitol grille. ( the meal was good not perfect) This is a beautiful hotel with an exceptional staff. I would return to Nashville just for a night here!Great hotel in a town that I don't believe has many great hotels. As a matter of fact, this may be the only one.The lobby is really picturesque. It is one-of-a-kind.The rooms were nice, spacious and comfortable all the way around. The walls are a little thin. There was a yippy dog down the hall that was making a lot of noise (dogs don't belong in hotels, sorry!). The bed creaked excessively when you moved. Other than that, it was exceptional.The staff was courteous, attentive and helpful. The girl at reception had an accent (russian?) so thick I understood about a quarter of what she said. Not a problem.I can't see staying anywhere else in Nashville.Smiley face and a star.The nicest rooms and best service in Nashville, and among the best anywhere!They capture the class and sophistication of a bygone era with grace and competence without it coming across as pretentious or arrogant. Stay here if you get the chance!One of my favorite things to do in this town is to take beer in the Oak Bar. The atmosphere is dark, warm and enfolding. They bring you salty snacks. I know, everyone says this ('cause it's true!)~ but the staff is hospitable and you always feel welcome.I've only ever been to three or four other Teas in my life, but the Hermitage Afternoon Tea goes down as my favorite, partly because of the gorgeous lobby. Great tea selection too: the white ambrosia was the unanimous table pick but I liked the black currant. The scones with cream were sublime.Top notch hotel. The lobby is large, yet cozy with many seating areas and a fireplace. Very helpful staff who was there to help with anything we needed. Large room with huge bathroom. Lots of nice touches....coffee and muffins in the lobby in the morning, cookies in the afternoon, free wifi, bottled water to grab on your way out to sightsee....Hope to go back to Nashville and definitely will stay at the Hermitage again!The hotel is stunning and I am disappointed that I only got to visit the lobby. We came here for happy hour and they lead us to this dark, crowded bar which was packed with people who appeared to just get off of work. I had the ruby red cocktail and it was on of the best cocktails I ever had. Our bartender was super nice and kept us supplied with ranch popcorn and tomato flat bread. I am really glad I got to try the place but was really surprised by the happy hour prices as they seemed pretty high. I was also disappointed to learn that they didn't offer the cava, or any wine flights, by the glass. I guess I am lucky to be in California because that is never a problem here. but that is a minor complaint for such a great place.The best! The service and rooms were gorgeous, large bathroom and great tub. We had a very relaxing and fun getaway.I have stayed here many times on business and once on a vacation. It does not get better than the hermitage. The staff is amazing - i think the room service attendant even knows me by name, the bellman give great restaurant suggestions - basically everything is top notch. I love the bathtubs and the molton brown bubble bath - nothing compares. I moved to Nashville now and I am sure I will make it to the oak bar for the onion bisque very soon.I cannot comment on the lodging, as I did not stay in the hotel. I attended a business dinner here, and the food was terrible. I can't even explain how disappointed I was in this meal. The hotel itself is beautiful and historic -- that's the only reason I'll put 2 stars in this review. As for the food, the service was quite slow and nothing was remotely close to hot. The salad wasn't very fresh, and the dressing was too bitter. The mashed potatoes serving was literally no more than a Tablespoon. The beef filet was an excellent cut of meat, but served as rare as I've ever seen meat served. Normally when you serve a large audience, you would serve the meat medium. I could even see medium rare for this cut of meat. If it's really great service they may take individual preferences. But there was no choice offered, and it was beyond RARE! The veggie sides were cold and also maybe 2 bites worth. Desserts were also tiny little cups and nothing worth writing about -- and the coffee was served about 15 minutes after we asked for it with the dessert. I'm glad I didn't pay for this meal, although I did have to pay a babysitter $25 since my wife attended with me that evening. We didn't get our money's worth.What a beautiful place. My favorite part of the hotel is the nice big comfortable rooms. Very nice rooms.This is a beautiful property. We called requesting a handicapped room specifically a roll in shower for my father, I was assured this was available. Our room had a tub shower not roll in - not what we were told. The hotel told us we could move to another room and I could sleep on a rollaway. Really - a rollaway for 300 a night? We moved to another hotel.Beautiful room!! Amazing customer service. Great in house restaurant and bar!! Had one of the best hotel stays of my life here. Service was second to none. Can't say enough about all the little touches that made it an amazing tripMy husband and I recently got married and I will say that by far the best wedding decision we made was to get married at The Hermitage Hotel in downtown Nashville! Every aspect was top notch, from the planning to the ceremony and reception, down to the ease of checking out the following day. We received the 5 star service you would expect at a much more reasonable price than you may think. It was worth every dime! Kimberly is a dream to work with and everyone on staff makes sure your experience is peaceful. They think of everything so you can fully enjoy the most wonderful day of your life! And, it is a GORGEOUS venue!
review_content_80: Surprisingly, a limited menu, especially considering this is a 5 star hotel!! Just goes to show what hotel dining is all about.I give them 5 stars because they are the only 5 star hotel in town. If you are looking for old world Southern hospitality mingled with some amazingly beautiful historic architectural detail than this is your place. I am mostly here to mention the Menes bathroom downstairs. I really hate public bathrooms and I can't think of much I find more repulsive than the men's public restrooms but my god this place is something. It has a shoe shining stand in it. More importantly when the hotel was restored the kept the art deco design motif that's been in there for ages. This is where they say dignitaries including presidents conducted business in this very bathroom. It's been featured nationally on the travel channel. If you are looking for an off the beaten path thing to show an out of town guest that captures the history of Nashville then I say take them for a drink and a peruse of the Hermitage bathroom.The architecture is wonderful. The fact that this hotel is 100 years old and has housed so many well known people is amazing.  The Oak Bar is something to experience, cocktails and apps par excellence!! You never know who you might run into.This is reputably the best and most luxurious hotel in town and it's not hard to understand why.  The Hermitage has been around for about a century and still stands as richly elegant and beautifully articulated as it did when it was built.  It was purchased and renovated in the early 2000's, mostly updating the guest rooms.  The lobby is covered in the Italian marble it was originally built with and the detail work on the architecture is astounding.  It's a bit pricey to stay there, you're looking at rooms going for about several hundred dollars a night depending on the season and how booked they are, but if you're bank account will allow it, I wholeheartedly recommend staying here.  Even if you are short on funds, you should at least go visit the hotel.  It's one of the more beautiful buildings in Nashville, both inside and out and it's regularly featured on the Travel Channel.It's located in the heart of Downtown just up the street from the Capitol, and is in convenient walking distance to a lot of cool sights and happenings in Nashville.  They have a fantastic restaurant in the lobby called the Capitol Grille that's great if you're looking for a fancy place to have a date night or even somewhere to impress your business client.  They also serve holiday buffets here, which is a great way to experience the hotel and its amenities without having to stay the night.A stunning hotel. The lobby took my breath away. The ambiance was very nice, the lighting perfect, and the restaurant immaculate. The menu was slightly limited, but had attractive options. My Coq Au Vin was surprisingly overcooked. The staff kept confusing my friend and I for each other. A hostess greeted my friend as me and we were both given the wrong meals and our validated valet tickets were reversed. See what I remember from the evening instead of how wonderful the reason we were celebrating was? Oh...and they have a really really hot doorman.I LOVE it here!  Definitely one of the nicest places I have ever stayed, and it spoiled me.  We stayed here during our honeymoon, and it was certainly one of the highlights.Staff is SO friendly and kind to everyone.  For breakfast at their restaurant, they made me a special vegan plate that left me feeling full (a tall order at most places for breakfast!).Our room was beautiful, so elegant and spacious.  Like Heather C., we stayed in the room as much as possible, because we didn't want to leave.  I loved Nashville before, and I love it even more now.The best.  I loved this hotel.  It's just awesome.  One of the most luxurious  places I have ever stayed.  Walked to the nightlife, restaurants, and the country music hall of fame.  The Oak bar was great. Had dinner there and should have shared with my wife because we each could not finish our meal, so much food and delicious. The staff gets 5/5 stars, as they were spectacular.I was fortunate to stay here four nights a few years ago during a conference.  It's awesome.  The beds are so comfortable and the rooms were very clean.  They left warm cookies next to my bed each night with a little note telling me "sweet dreams the weather tomorrow will be .... " and warm sleepers and robes too!  It was quite magical.  Since then I have returned to the hotel for a special event once a year (not staying there unfortunately) and the place has not lost a step.  Catered food is great.  The scotch selection downstairs was great too.  I hope some day I can afford to stay here again!Fabulous hotel.  Very comfortable.  Everything was 6 stars! Expensive, yes; but worth it.You have to forgive my hard scoring.  It is partially a reflection of my own bad decisions.  You see, this place is VERY expensive.  But I was unfamiliar with the city, and wanted to be sure the place I went to was awesome.  And yes, it is everything you'd ever want.  All the good things said about this place are true.  But I overpaid, and I will take it out on them in their rating.  So, in a sense, it is a 5.  But you can certainly have just as good a time at the many other places, only a few blocks away, at a third of the cost.  Easily.We stayed here two Easters ago for a long weekend. Our room was really spacious and we loved coming "home" every evening to a fully turned down room, complete with bedside cookies and waters and classical music softly playing in the background. We also enjoyed the afternoon refreshments in the lobby and found the valet parking guys out front to be very polite, even though we were constantly in and out. The bathroom was very large and had Molton Brown bath products.We also ordered in room service for Easter sunday brunch and everything was delivered quickly and cooked well. The biscuits were great.I've never eaten here, I've never stayed here, but I have been in the men's bathroom. (Say Huh?) And yes, I may have a bi-gender name, but I am female. The men's bathroom located in the hotel's restaurant has two very interesting and noteworthy amenities. First off all, there is an entrance to a tunnel that supposedly leads to the Capitol building across the street.
