I'm sure those parents were trying their best to explain the unfortunate group of girls who looked like they l wanted to die...Stayed her for a long weekend for a baes Bach and had a blast . We were in walking distance to a liquor store , all the bars on the main "strip " and everyone in the south is of course so nice .My reason for the deduction of a star is Our rooms weren't cleaned once during our weekend stay. I was totally fine without my bed being made but our trash can was over flowing. You also couldn't get the room service delivered it had to be picked up I mean this is America..... SadnessThis is probably one of my favorite hotels I've stayed at. It was really clean and is located very close to the live music venues on Broadway. The staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. We checked in with Amanda who was friendly and personable. We were traveling for a special occasion which Amanda asked about, upon returning to our room after dinner we found a bottle of champagne and two glasses along with a note stating the champagne was from Dave and Zoe. At breakfast the next day Jermaine came up to our table and asked what we were doing that day, when we told him we were headed to the Jack Daniels Distillery he told us a little bit of history and told us about a couple things to look for. I liked that he made it a point to talk to us and gave us an extra bit of history we wouldn't have gotten anywhere else. If you are staying in Downtown Nashville stay here. It is walking distance to Bridgestone Arena, The Country Music Hall of Fame, Broadway and the Johnny Cash museum. It is also really close to The Gulch.Great place to stay. The fruit infused waters are great, with alternating selections everyday. The rooms were very nice and clean. The staff was super helpful to all our needs. The breakfast was great and the chef even made me a special breakfast sandwich since they had no vegetarians sit out, also wanted to know how long I was staying so he could have them ready. Free WiFi worked flawlessly. Great bar downstairs with live music. No complaints about this place, would stay again.I was lucky enough to spend one night here last week. I really loved the hotel and it's proximity to Broadway and other tourist attractions. If you have any interest in the Country Music Hall of Fame, this is your spot. It's just around the corner.Our rate was through Priceline Express and even though it was more than I normally like to spend, I feel like we got our money's worth. The staff was incredible, the beds were comfortable and our room was a decent size (sometimes they give you the smallest room available when you book through Priceline or Hotwire.) Other pros: fridge and coffee pot in the room, nice sized pool, easy access to parking lot, and free wi-fi. Cons: no bath tub, parking is not included ($20+tax per night), "free" breakfast is only pastries and coffee with a bowl of fruit--not a ton of healthy options.All the cons were minor and didn't outweigh our love for the hotel. We wouldn't hesitate to come back next time we're in Nashville.This hotel was a great choice. Beautiful southern decor when you walk in. Large clean rooms. We are here for a conference that is two blocks away, next to the Country Music Hall of Fame. If you go two blocks up the street you are on Broadway. That is where the party is at! Live music everywhere, flannel, beards and fun. This is a great choice for a stay. The free breakfast is awesome, your normal choices plus breakfast sandwiches, open faced bagels with egg cheese, spinach and ham. Great coffee. The bar is beautiful with a southern cow hide decor vibe. When we checked in, Terri helped us. Wow. Top notch. She gave us a map, told us where to eat and go to hang out. She gave us coupons, cab numbers, everything we need. Above and beyond. Thanks for a great stay!!This Hyatt Place is fantastic.  Yes, it's not a high-end hotel, but is nice and well-maintained.  And that staff is great--super friendly and more than willing to help in anyway possible.  And they were so sweet to send a little birthday gift to the room for Stacey M.I do recommend asking for something as soon as you need it--I asked late in the day (afternoon) for the makeup lamp to be fixed, and it was not fixed until the next day.  Speaking of makeup, we had the unfortunate luck of staying while a Mary Kay convention was in town and that was annoying as hell, and I'm not just talking about the bad makeup.  But, the staff was so great, that it outdid any challenges due to the influx of saleswoman. I didn't love the continental breakfast, though it wasn't awful.  I just really don't eat anything offered at continental breakfasts.  Beds were comfy and rooms are decently-sized.  Besides the staff, and the awesome location (so close to Broadway and in nice weather, you could walk to The Gulch), I loved the fruit infused water, because I'm bougie like that, and also, they had a strawberry version. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. In fact, if ever visited Nashville again, I wouldn't even look anywhere else.This place is just perfect, location, clean, modern, highly recommended for a downtown Nashville stay!An easy 5 stars. Meets & Exeeds.A first class property just 2 blocks from all the entertainment and dining activity in Nashville that delivers something for everyone from the business traveler, tourist or even for a getaway weekend.Great service.  Very attentive,  detailed,  friendly and a staff that overtly shows their sincerity. Lobby is extremely well appointed.  A 24/7 contemporary cafe is there no matter when you call. Even with an early departure like mine at 5am, I was able to order a geeat cooked to order breakfast sandwich.The rooms are splendid. Mine was modern, comfortable, roomy, well appointed with incredibly plush King bed and a huge, comfortable sectional sofa instead of the typical obligatory hotel room chair. The bathroom is fantastic.  Bright, roomy, clean clean clean and an awesome shower.Awesome place to stay if you want to be in the heart of Nashville. Walking distance to everything! Very clean hotel. They have fresh infused water  when you enter (perfect for hot days). Breakfast was better than the normal, they have egg white and normal breakfast sandwiches that were delicious. Local artist play at the bar, both nights we sat and listened either before going out or on that back from dinner. If you want a quick snack with a cocktail in the afternoon, their hummus plate is awesome with 3 generous servings of different hummus. Staff super friendly. When visiting , I will stay here again !Everyone here was amazingly helpful and super nice. The Starbucks/bar/limited menu in the lobby was great. Best lobby I have had in a hotel, live music every night, lots of tables, comfy chairs. Rooms were spacious, will agree with the other poster that the vanity is crazy deep so make up is hard to apply especially with the standard low lights in hotel bathrooms. Great breakfast buffet and well trained staff, highly recommend. Location is awesome all downtown is easy walking distance and anytbing out if town is only a $5-7/Uber/lyft ride. We would definitely stay here next time.Stayed here for a Thursday-Sunday in late January. The hotel was lovely. Fruit infused water in the lobby (seemed to be a thing in the area), continental breakfast, friendly staff. The continental breakfast was more than the average continental breakfast of stale old pastries. They had lots of options hot oatmeal, egg sandwiches, french toast. A free 24 hour fitness center was an excellent plus, though on the small side. The day I used it got there at 5:30 and it filled up within the hour. Pool was nice and the day and time I used it was empty. The best part was on Saturday which was my 30th birthday. The hotel sent up a birthday card and a bottle of champagne. I can't remember the brand but it was very good. Queen size beds were comfyMy only complaint was the key cards. You had to use them to get up the elevator and it was a bit of pain especially as my hands were always full.We like it very much. Great staff, and the breakfast is very good. Bar area is not loud, except for when there's local music. Rooms are good size and the decor is slightly modern. Only downside are the beds. The couch is more comfortable and I slept there after the first day. The mattresses are hard and thin.Good clean workout center with treadmills, cycles, weights.Great place to stay! First time to Nashville and didn't know what to expect. Staff was always friendly and helpful. The hot breakfast was the best! We were there for 3 nights and the breakfast varied over the 3 days. Clean with modern decor. We worked out in the gym that had sufficient equipment for many people and towels were provided. The free fruit infused water was so refreshing and wonderful. Great location because we walked to everywhere in downtown. Totally recommend staying here. I would definitely stay here again.I spent last night at Hyatt place downtown Nashville. The check in process was easy and the staff were so nice and helpful. They even gave us a handwritten thank you note and a gift bag with water and goo goos! Our room was clean and spacious and comfortable. Breakfast was delicious snd when I told them it was my birthday they gave me a red velvet cupcake! Yay!!! I hope to spend more birthdays here! The proximity to Nashville downtown entertainment is a big plus as well.Great new hotel in downtown Austin. Very clean, modern rooms, safe area, close to bars and indoor parking. We will be coming back on our next trip.
review_content_20: Nice new hotel. Great breakfast buffet offering that comes with room.  Staff is very nice and helpful.  Location is perfect to Broadway, Riverfront, dining, and Titan Stadium.  June 2015 there is a bit of construction to look at and hear but it was not distracting enough to be concerned.Friendly staff, but problem rooms and horrifying coffee. WHY do these redesigned hotels insist on installing sliding bathroom doors that don't actually close, and with a glass door? C'mon. Really?Also: nice continental breakfast had the most awful coffee I have ever had in a hotel. That bad.This is a great business Hotel - great staff, modern, spacious rooms with a sitting area, desk, nice beds, flat screen TV's - the rooms are very comfy.  Free Wi-Fi, a really great breakfast - one of the best complimentary spreads I've seen at a business hotel.  In the evening there is live music in the lobby / bar area.  I would stay here again - any other hotel would charge you for Wi-Fi and breakfast. They have computers that are easy to access and a printer in the lobby - this hotel has everything for the business travler - or the tourist.  Oh - nice touch is the infused water in the lobby - today it's cucumber, lemon / Orange and a berry water.I come to this hotel at least once a month. On every visit I am welcomed with smiling faces, and a willingness to make each stay here the best one yet. The rooms are clean and well layed out. I love the big couches and large tv to veg out to as soon as I get into the room. The food is pretty good and available 24/7 also. The location is great. You are right next to the Listening Room and walking distance to Broadway.This was my first time staying at the Hyatt Hotel in downtown, Nashville. The Hyatt employees, Dave and Kelly N., definitely helped smooth the check-in process upon arrival. They were very friendly, eager to help, and social with us, so you definitely get a warm and welcoming vibe when you arrive. We even were surprised with a celebratory bottle of champagne with nice glasses to help kick start my birthday in the right direction! I felt so special since no other hotel has done that for me before, thanks guys! The hotel is well maintained, very clean and has wonderful modern decor. There is also a lounging area on the right side with comfortable couches, TV's, and even a mini office-looking computer station (free-wifi). I booked a room that had 2 queen beds and 1 couch. The couch is actually a pull-out couch so it could comfortably sleep two people. Every room, ours included, has it's own refrigerator. The safety of the hotel is top-notch. The elevator requires you to scan your key-card (room key)  prior to entering your floor level to ensure you are a guest at the Hyatt. The location itself is very safe and in the heart of downtown so everything (bars, restaurants, nightlife, shops) is literally less then 5 minutes walking distance. Parking: A bit pricey. $25 to self park over night & $28 to valet over night. They have their own parking garage which is convenient since it is connected to the hotel, but the only downside is that it's a little small. We drove around a few times to find a spot until someone left. There's a lot of parking spaces and lots near the hotel tho (literally across the street), so you don't have to look far. Overall, my friends are I were VERY pleased with our stay at the Hyatt. The hotel as well as staff definitely made a great lasting impression on us and we will be returning! I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone! Whether you're looking to book for vacation, business trip, bachelorette, or bachelor party, the hotel will NOT disappoint. The location is perfect and one to two blocks away from Broadway Street which is where you wanna be, the staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms are very clean, the place has it's stuff together aka it's very presentable. If you read my previous reviews on other hotels which I stayed at ...you'll know I'm not kidding, I'm giving it the credit it deserves.What a great place this is.    This is one of the larger Hyatt Places I have stayed.   The service has been exceptional.   The larger family room and dining area has been a real plus.  They just ran a fedex package up to my room.   The location is right in the heart of all of the sites.So after an 11 hour drive, this hotel absolutely made us all feel better.  The front desk was warm and smiling even at 930pm.  The rooms were beautiful and for once the pictures didn't do them justice.  Wow!While the hotel was a little pricey, I am glad we booked it.  The room was very nice and larger than a traditional 2 bed room and it had a very nice free continental breakfast included.  It is also conveniently located downtown and the staff was always very friendly.  I would definitely recommend staying in this hotel while visiting Nashville.Loved staying here. The location is wonderful. So close to downtown and fun things to do. An easy Uber away from all other parts of town. Very close to a wonderful walking/bike paths on and across the River. Great staff. Wonderful views. They even had live music to keep in line with the downtown Nashville feel. Not a lot of crowd, but it was a slow weekend. I bet it's a blast when there is something big happening and the hotel fills up.Solid 3.5 starsPros: -updated rooms-gym/pool available-free breakfast (that's much better than other reviews give it credit for)-Close to downtown and music city center-clean-friendly managementCons- -The extra security measures to allow you on to a floor are somewhat of a pain and don't offer that much more security-the bed wasn't hugely comfortable, but that's a personal preference type thing-the front desk staff rarely acknowledged me unless I was standing right in front of them and that was strange to me. Overall, this is a great business hotel and it's in a great location. I would return, but don't expect 5 star treatment here.Two words: FRAT. HOUSE.The Hyatt Place Nashville Downtown is a boot-tappin', ye-hawin', rabble-rousin' time, y'all!  Management knows it--this is the only hotel I've ever stayed in that comes with earplugs on the bedside table.  It's also the kind of place where you might walk home from the bars on Broadway to find a lil cowgirl puking her brains out in the parking lot while your own going out companion offers her a hair tie.  (Purely hypothetical, of course...)I booked the Hyatt Place via Expedia and still plunked down $408/night.  Exsqueeze me?!  For this price, I expected a little more swag.  While there is a late night menu at the bar, they do not offer room service.  My fellow boot-tappin' ye-hawers also had frequent trouble with their key cards malfunctioning.  Not a deal breaker, but definitely a nuisance.  Not suggested for a business trip or family vacation, but (if you can find a good deal) this just the sort of spot you might want to invite 23 of your closed gal-pals for a weekend of civilized binge drinking.Really nice hotel. The room I stayed in was very spacious. Very modern and clean. A plus was the black out curtains, more like black hole curtains, let no light in. Loved it for getting to bed early in the evening. Or sleeping in... The only thing I didn't like is that sound in the hallways traveled very well. I could easily hear people having normal conversations all the way down the hall late at night, sort of irritating but it would never hurt to get some sort of sound dampening wall hangings or something. Great location with great staff. But please do something about the poor free coffee in this hotel in the morning, seriously... It's sort of bad, even though it's free. I would totally stay here in the future.Came here with a group of ladies for a bachelorette party and we were blown away by what we got for the price of our stay. The Nashville-themed decor was super fun, the staff was impeccably nice, the rooms were gorgeous and everything had that squeaky-clean feeling that you want in a hotel. We loved that Broadway and our favorite bars / restaurants were a short walk away from us, and the breakfast included in our stay was beyond our expectations.I would not hesitate to stay here again and would recommend it to anyone visiting Music City!Clean and new. Great breakfast buffet that is complimentary. Pretty expensive rooms that aren't that impressive, but we're downtown so, what do ya do? Least favorite part: bathroom door is a sliding door that doesn't latch/close. It would be nice to shower in peace. Overall an okay place, but you could probably get better for the same price. Most expensive parking too.From what I understand, this Hyatt is pretty new. Opening in November of 2013, this place still has that "new hotel smell." I stayed here for a conference and thoroughly enjoyed my time here.This place has a very ideal location. About two blocks from the Omni and within walking distance to the Music City Center, The Shermerhorn, the Country Music Hall of Fame, Bridgestone Arena, Broadway Street and so much more! I could easily walk to all my destinations for the conference.The lobby is a bit small, but it's nice. The check-in counter greets you immediately when you walk in and there are really nice seating areas to the left and right of the counter. I didn't get to pay close attention to the details of the seating, but it looked very comfy. The rooms were nice. Very standard, but also very comfortable. Two doubles beds with a small sectional sofa, a desk, a TV, a small wardrobe and a shower/tub combo. We got there around 4pm and our rooms were ready. Everything was crisp and clean when we got into our rooms.I didn't spend much time in my room other than sleeping, but I was more than happy to crawl into that bed when it came time to crash. By the time I reached my room at the end of the day, I was beyond exhausted and the bed was a welcomed relief. I don't know how to describe the bed...it had just the right amount of firmness to it while still sinking into it. The pillows were wonderful. Fluffy, clean and comfortable. The bedding was all simple white, but sooo comfortable. I was so comfortable that getting out of bed in the morning was really hard.Each time I came back to my room the beds were made and the room was tidied up. Hyatt Place considers themselves a "green" hotel in the sense that they won't bring extra towels unless you leave them on the floor. They want you to hang up towels and reuse them - which I do anyway. They also change the bed linens every three days (or whenever you check-out and they get ready for the next guest), but they'll change the linens every day if you ask them. Wifi and breakfast is included with your stay, which was awesome. Being there for work I needed access to the Internet and I had no trouble using their WiFi. It worked throughout the hotel on both my phone and my laptop. I didn't stay to experience breakfast, unfortunately. From what I heard, it's a nice hearty meal. I had to run to the conference and eat the food there instead.The only thing I didn't like is the entrance to the hotel. It's a single automatic door. You have to enter single file and no one can enter or exit at the same time. That can be a hassle if you're getting dropped off via taxi and have a lot of luggage to carry in. And from what I saw, there's only two doors to enter/exit from. One at the front of the hotel and one on the back. And the back door was unlocked when I came back late one night (past midnight).I would highly recommend staying here if you're ever in the Nashville area. Prime location and comfortable rooms make this place nice and the WiFi will keep me coming back.Clean and close to Broadway, perfect spot. $20 for parking.This hotel seems to have nailed everything that millennial business travelers want: great location with easy access to good restaurants and nightlife, a local feel, seamless wifi everywhere, comfortable beds, and places to congregate with other travelers so you don't have to just work from a laptop in your room (with bonus live music).Great gym, nice pool, WSJs galore, mediocre free breakfast (but hey--easy access to good restaurants).  I haven't stayed at a Hyatt in a couple of years. After this visit, methinks that will change.Would definitely stay here again!ProsVery friendly and welcoming staff - always kind and helpful!Great locationClean, well-lit roomsDecent, simple breakfast - suited me perfectlyGood water pressureDespite having a construction-facing window, I rarely noticed any noiseUpdated equipment in the fitness centerNice pool areaFresh apples and fruit water at entryFriendly, quick and efficient maintenance team (we lost a few rings behind a fixed-position dresser - very quickly resolved!)ConsAir conditioning wasn't very effective at night - although I do aim to sleep colder than mostLap swim isn't an option in the pool because of the step placementI considered it over-priced, but in the end I was pleased with the experienceNice location, close to downtown Nashville. But do not eat the food, nachos have cheese sauce not real cheese  and room service isn't actually delivered to your room. The rooms are nice. Drink the Jack Daniels Sinatra.Great staff, clean rooms and live entertainment in the lobby bar in the evenings is a plus. They don't have room service, but their kitchen is open 24 hours. You can call in your order, then go pick it up. It's a little pricey for what you get. They have free breakfast in the morning. The eggs look and taste like they came from a powder, so stick with the great selection of fruits, cereals, breads and the yogurt bar.
review_content_40: Excellent staff. Super friendly and the rooms were very nice with ample space and very clean.I would highly recommend staying here if you are heading to Nashville. Broadway is only a 5 min walk and the view of the Cumberland River from the hotel is beautiful. All of the staff were very polite and friendly. We had so many questions about the area  and everyone was patient and very resourceful. The lobby is amazing. There is live music, a full bar and you can order food anytime. The breakfast was great. They had sausages, eggs, breakfast sandwiches, French Toast, cereal, bagels and biscuits with gravy. Our room was very spacious. We had two queen beds, a foldout couch and a beautiful view. The cordless phones were a neat touch and they had an MP3 player where we could play our iPhone music. We did try to order room service one day after 12pm and they never came. I saw another reviewer had the same problem. It still wasn't enough of an issue to take a star away. I will definitely be back and highly recommend this hotel.The Hyatt is a BEAUTIFUL hotel and the staff are overly accomodating! They do an amazing job. Here are some helpful notes:Lobby - beautiful. The decor is awesome and fits the theme of the city well. The free infused water is awesome.Rooms -The rooms are very clean and well maintained. They have new TVs. The bathrooms are very clean and have great water pressure.Food - The FREE breakfast is awesome. The drinks at the bar are great too! Location - awesome to downtown! It's only like 2 blocks to the bars and main attractions. Staff - so NICE and accomodating!  Everyone! They are great - really anticipate your needs and execute flawlessly. We visited for a bachelorette weekend. They manage groups very well. Katelyn is amazing - the reservations were managed to perfection!  It was a  VERY simple check in process and they even had a few rooms available for early check-in. Check out was also very easy.Also,  FREE Internet.Stayed here for a conference in June and it was A-OK. Here's my breakdown of pros and cons:Pros:-Live music in the lobby at some points during my stay-Free fruit-infused water by the main door (strawberry + kiwi = the bomb)-Free coffee in the morning-Great views (obviously depending on your room - I had a view of downtown from mine)Cons:-Breakfast. I know what you're going to say - but it's FREE! How can you complain about free food? Well, here's the thing: I was here for a work conference and I get per diem for my meals when I travel except in instances where I get them for free. I would rather pay (and get compensated by my company) for a quality breakfast than eat the free one they provide. It's the kind of poor-quality food you would expect at a low-tier hotel: thawed, sad-looking cut fruit; cheap muffins and pastries (I'm assuming they tasted bad but I'm vegan so I didn't try them); sticky tins of jelly and cardboard bread. -It's off the main drag a bit. -Food choices are limited if you're a vegan (they have chips and salsa for $10...oh well, I guess they are hotel prices).The hotel is funny clean with friendly staff. The stay comes a great breakfast selection which is a plus. The location is downtown near Broadway and near the country music center. There are not to many restaurants around the hotel , however , the hotel's bar is open 24 hours. At the hotel they should extend their menu selection. Overall, I had a good stay. Highlight is the complimentary water with fruit infused when entering the building.Awesome location.   But price is set like this is a hyatt grand and it is not. It is a very clean hotel but it is not high end. They have free breakfast which is nice but not what I want specifically from my hotel.  But this is one of the best locations in town and the hotel is very newWhen we arrived there was no self parking so they offered to valet our car for the price of self park, but when we checked out 5 days later they tried charge us 3 days of valet. we didnt move our car and they did not tell us that self parking was available. they argued with my husband about it but did finally remove the charge. Not luxury if that is what you are wanting. We stayed there last weekend for the realtor conference. Totally disappointed. However it was definitely Clean and I liked the room set up and decor.The staff was friendly but seem to have had to training what so ever....AND No room service...what?! Food was inconsistence and slow!One star for clean and nice...but that doesn't make up for incompetence.The Hyatt Place Downtown Nashville is a great place to stay! Just got back from a bachelorette weekend and couldn't have been happier with our stay. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, the rooms were spacious and the complimentary breakfast was delicious! It has great proximity to Broadway and other downtown attractions. Definitely a good choice!This is my third time to Nashville. I've stayed at the Renaissance and the Sheraton on my last two trips (great experiences) My husband and I are here celebrating our anniversary. I have to say we've stayed at other Hyatt's before and had great experiences but I'm very disappointed with the Hyatt Place here in Nashville. No concierge to help with activities, no brochures on activities, our first night here we were at the bar after a long flight and ordered some food at the bar the lady that was cooking was the most miserable employee and made us feel uncomfortable for disturbing her with a food order. Then after a day of activities we come back to our room and either the room is not made up or we had housekeeping walk in while we were napping in the late afternoon. Employees down in the lobby just standing around talking  and are not very friendly. For as expensive as this place is I wasn't too impressed with the rooms. There are so many hotels to chose from in this great city. I won't be staying here again.We rent the conference room every year in this hotel and we couldn't be happier. The staff is incredible, helpful and very friendly. The hotel is beautiful and clean. We will definitely recommend this hotel to others.Best service I've received at a hotel in years. Everyone was friendly. Everyone. From front desk to valet to cleaning crew. Nice rooms. Great location. Walk to Broadway.Stayed at the Hyatt in early May for a bachelorette party. I can't think of one negative comment about my stay. All of the staff were extremely friendly and accommodating - from the valet to the front desk to the cleaning staff and even the maintenance guy. Food was delicious too! Definitely will stay here again whenever I get the chance to visit Nashville again!This Hotel was fabulous.  I cannot say more about how friendly and accommodating the staff was for my stay here.  Every time we walked in the front door we felt very welcome.  I celebrated my 50th birthday here with six of my girlfriends. The staff sent a nice bottle of red wine and a birthday care package to my room, which was really thoughtful.   The free breakfast was good (when we got up early enough to go!)   The hotel is clean and well maintained.  We did have a problem with a clogged toilet one morning, but maintenance arrived quickly with an auger and fixed the problem.  The maintenance worker was friendly and had a great sense of humor!  The hotel is located within walking distance of Broadway,  many great restaurants,  and the Country Music Hall of Fame.  I would definitely recommend this hotel.  Thank you Hyatt Staff for making out stay in Nashville great!Great Staff, Great Location!This is the place to stay. Close to everything and a well -trained staff who great you immediately and know the difference between doing a good job and a great job.We will see you next time!Thank you!Great location, just a 5 minute walk to Broadway where the best bars and night scene is! The hotel was clean and staff very nice. I would definitely come back here next time I am in Nashville.Great location close to everything.  Staff is awesome.  We actually moved to this hotel after spending one night in another local hotel and not being happy.  Everything about this place is top notch.  Would highly recommend to friends.  Morgen and Nina are the best!My girlfriends and I stayed at the Hyatt this past weekend for a little getaway. The staff was super friendly the whole time - the lobby offered live music, free infused waters, snack bar and am extensive free morning breakfast. I gave the Hyatt 3 stars because during our stay, one of the elevators broke which caused a lot of angst getting to and from our room. Although they opened up the freight elevator to the guests, two elevators is hardly enough for a hotel that size. I spent more time waiting for the elevator than enjoying what the Hyatt had to offer.The Hyatt Place Downtown was generally great and I very much enjoyed my stay there. First of all, you can tell the hotel is super new, which I liked. There's nothing like a creepy stain on the carpet to make our old friend Insomnia come barging through the door. This place had none of that. My room was spacious, clean, and even had a couch. A couch! I ended up actually lounging on the couch a ton, which I didn't really expect. A super nice bonus to this room. The bathroom was also great-- bright, clean, modern fixtures. I'd never heard of the amenity brand before, but everything worked decently well, and I'm sorta picky about that stuff.I love that the wifi is free and pretty fast! I've recently stayed at a string of hotels that only had slow, expensive wifi, so this was an extra-welcome amenity.The included breakfast is pretty much your normal hotel continental breakfast, though they have some additional egg sandwiches that were a nice tough.My only complaint is that the service is not suuuuper great if you're calling from the room (it's perfectly good downstairs, in person). One night I called to ask a question about hooking up my laptop to the tv (something that the hotel info card said was possible) and got put on hold forever, then told an engineer would come, then no one ever showed up. When I called down again, the host seemed baffled. I also wasn't able to get a super straight answer about late check-out when I called down, but cleared it up in person. These are pretty minor details to me, so not work a whole star knockdown.Overall, I'd definitely recommend the hotel if you have business that brings you to downtown Nashville.Very nice place. Rooms are very nice, comfortable and clean. Service is excellent. They have their own private parking garage to keep your vehicle safe. They have a pool, but not a hot tub, and a great little workout facility. Live music at night, a solo acoustic artist. Their bar is nice and they had a small, very well presented, tasty and varietal continental breakfast. A short walk from the Broadway strip of downtown bars, food and shops. I recommend, although there are plenty of incredibly nice accommodations in downtown Nashville. This is also located just a minutes walk from the Country Music Hall of Fame.Highly recommend this hotel. We were able to get a room at the last minute despite it being CMA Fan Fest week in Nashville. Staff was super friendly and helpful. Our room was more than I expected. King size bed plus a cozy sitting area. The bar in the lobby is a nice touch.
review_content_60: Just stayed here for 2 nights with our 3 kids and were very happy!  We are sometimes hotel snobs - moving hotels if we are not satisfied and this was not the case.  The room was super clean.  There were 2 queen beds us a pull out couch (which had nice clean bedding each night).  The bathroom was clean and spacious.  Unlike other comments, I thought the free breakfast was great.  Reminded me of a breakfast buffet that you would pay for.  The cook made a special meal for my husband who can't eat cheese.  The staff was super friendly with my kids, showering them with Easter candy.  They even gave us a special treat bag full of goodies for the kids for the day (fruit, granola, raisins).  Plus it's a quick walk from Broadway so a great location.  I would definitely recommend this hotel - a great place for families!We have stayed at a few Hyatts. This one was probably my least favorite. We stayed at the opryland one just days prior and sadly could not get a room there since that location was all book, so this was the next best thing. If you are there for business this is the hotel for you. The beds aren't as comfortable as other locations. The staff wasn't nearly as friendly as I would have liked. If I approach you and you are working the front desk and aren't busy, I shouldn't have to wait for you to speak to me. I was also disappointed to learn that we had to pay for parking, shouldn't that be included in the price of the room?  I think it wouldn't have been such a shock had they told me that upfront but then again when I checked in they basically asked my name and for a form of payment. The lady didn't even tell me the floor number just handed me a key.  This location is nicely located in downtown and within walking distance to everything. The room was clean atleast.  This is definitely not a family friendly hotel in my opinion and that's what I look for for my family.Free parking on the street after a certain time! Great hotel - staff super friendly! A minute walk to Broadway! Loved the live music in the lobby too -  Rooms are modern and very clean, we even had a couch in our room plus 2 double beds!After reading the reviews on yelp and reviewing the hotel website which promoted itself as a luxury hotel, I booked the room for my 3 night stay. Upon arrival, it was disappointing from the moment we stepped into the lobby. I thought I was in the wrong place! It felt like a low end hotel. Cafeteria style bar that doubles as the breakfast area.. No room service but there was basic food and water available! We tried the breakfast and it was barely edible!  McDonald's is a step up from what we were offered. What a treat after traveling all day to your "luxury" hotel. My room was clean... The second day, maid service hadn't arrived by late afternoon and when we returned late that evening, the cleaning was sub par and no fresh wash cloths were left for us.  For $399 per night, I expected  very close to what my colleagues had for accommodations at the nearby Omni at a lower rate per night!  Their rooms cost less and their entire hotel and rooms were indeed luxurious. Unfortunately, they were sold out. I'm giving this one star only because it was a new hotel and didn't have a worn feel yet. That won't take long since the finishes were very low end! We won't return.We had a great stay at the Hyatt in Nashville! We were there their 1st weekend of opening and booked last minute! The hotel has great amenities complimentary breakfast, refrigerators in the room and our double bed room also had a sofa which was a nice plus. The staff was friendly upon arrival and check in was very smooth. The only thing that I could complain about was the abundance of lady bugs in our room! I have never seen that before, I know they are good luck :) however when there are 10 at once it got irritating, we did tell the front desk a couple times and they were still there. It took about 5-7 desk encounters & phone calls to get it taken care of by our 3rd night there. I do give them the benefit of the doubt since it was their 1st weekend and prime lady bug season! The Valet guys would not let you park for 5 minutes and run to the room which was frustrating, not so friendly except 1 named Mohammed we met on our last day. Broadway Street is a block and a half away which was great too! We would definitely stay there again if we return to Nashville!Driving cross country from New York for 2 weeks and this is still one of my favorite hotels ever. Really awesome and authentic, modern decor in the lobby and rooms. Everyone was really pleasant and always greeted us. The prices are a lot better than other hotels that are located directly in Broadway. This place is a 3 minute walk from broadway and is probably nicer than the others. Free breakfast was delicious. Super clean. Awesome place to stay.

review_content: Stayed here Jan 15 - Jan 18th room 727...corner room. LocationThe location of this hotel can't get much better. It's a block from Broadway and everywhere you want to be in downtown Nashville. Our room directly overlooked the Bridgestone Arena which was really cool. We were able to walk everywhere and only a 10 minute ride from the airport. RoomOur room had a separate living room area with two couches and two small tables, a desk and a large TV. We were able to hang out here with our friends before heading out and close the doors to our bedroom which was nice. My only real complaint about the room would be no air vents, WHY!! And second, the lack of counter space, as large as the bathroom was there was only 1 small, tiny, counter top with the sink...ServiceTurndown service was ok. They came every day in the late afternoon, which was fine because we were out exploring. There were a few exceptions...we really didn't have enough small towels...we used the one washcloth we were given, I left it in the shower to dry and they took it away, but did not replace it with a new one! I also used the shower cap, left it hanging to dry, they also took this and did not leave me a new one! That was pretty annoying. We left a pile of dirty towels in the closest and they remained there for our entire stay...we requested a late checkout on our last day and the maid showed up at 8am to clean! We told them we had a late checkout and to come back...so they came back at 10am, my husband again told them our checkout was at 2pm and that was when we would be leaving. AmbianceThe hotel is gorgeous, the atrium is really impressive. On Saturday night they had a pianist playing music, kudos to her for playing some Taylor Swift!Something Really CoolThis was our first time using the keyless entry on our phone, we didn't go to the front desk once during our stay, we checked in on our phone, selected our room, downloaded our key and were able to use that to enter our room each time. This was fabulous!I usually stay at Hilton whether I'm traveling for work or pleasure. This experience has definitely changed that, I am very disappointment. Do not stay here!The bathtub did not drain well, you basically took a bath and a shower at the same time because it filled up so darn quickly. There was no fridge in the room. We had a 15th century coffee maker, with only decaf coffee! When I asked for regular (caffeinated) coffee, the staff replied "I can get you some but I'd have to go all the way downstairs" ummm okay?! And house keeping kept putting Keurig cups in our room, I asked around and apparently everybody else on our floor had a Keurig. Room service knocks on the door every morning, yes even if you have the "DO NOT DISTURB" sign outside your door. It was very annoying, while I'm on vacation the last thing I want to do is wake up early. I am trying to relax but there was nothing relaxing about my stay at this terrible hotel. During check out, our receipt had $30 charge per night for valet parking when we didn't even park our car with them... After asking the front desk to take off the charges they said with an attitude "ugh next time you should notify us before" instead of apologizing. Which is ridiculous, it's YOUR job to charge customers properly not the customers' responsibility. I don't work at the Hilton, thank you. I only give them 2 stars instead of 1 because SOME of their staff was friendly and their live music at the bar was good. You can stay anywhere else in Downtown Nashville (even closer to Broadway) for the same price. The only reason I chose this hotel is because I'm a HHonors member but never again. Also, I am a gold member and I did not receive any upgrade upon check in which is odd considering they do that at most hotels. I'm so disappointed in Hilton right now, my experience was just unacceptable.Self parked when I arrived. The next morning I tried leaving the parking garage and experienced a small glitch at the credit card terminal.  The terminal would not issue me a receipt. I pushed the speaker button requesting assistance and was very quickly answered and helped. I gave them my email address and they assured me I would have a receipt in my email within 15 minutes. After one hour had gone by and still no email I began to wonder.When I returned to the hotel a visited the front desk, I assumed they would have a telephone number to the parking garage management company. No they did not. Front desk sent me to valet desk and they did not have a telephone number either. When I returned to the front desk I was told the only way to contact the parking garage management was to go back to the garage and push the button requesting assistance. So another trip down to the garage, standing there at the payment terminal trying to have a conversation about my problem over a call box !The gentleman I spoke to here at the parking management company finally sent me an email receipt. Which just happen to have their toll free telephone number. The number you would think the Hilton front desk would have access to. I decided to speak to the MOD and share with them my experience and to give them the telephone number they profess not to know. MOD assured me only 5% of their customers self parked and my inconvenience wasn't anything they had anything to do with and they should not be expected to be of assistance to any of their guests that self park. Extremely poor customer service!!I expected better at a Hilton property.What a beautiful hotel!  This quite possibly could be the best location for any hotel in the US! It is surrounded by the Bridgestone arena, the symphony hall , the convention center, country music hall of fame, bars, restaurants, theatres, and then some more bars!  Now let's get real......  No self parking, there is a public pay parking lot but It is not owned by the hotel.  Valet parking is $34 a day plus tax and tip. It is a huge hotel with one set of elevators.  They have no pool, Jacuzzi,or spa for the price we paid I expected more. That is the reason for 4 stars.  Overall I love the location and hotel but they missed the Mark on amenities.I had a great experience from beginning to end. This is right next to where the Nashville Predators play and just a minute from LP Field (where the Tennessee Titans play). I posted pictures of my room (1 king bed suite) and was very impressed. I would definitely recommend if you are coming in for a sporting or music event.Perks:- Valet makes parking easy- Complimentary Wifi (if you are an HHonors member, which is free to sign-up)- Room was clean and fully stocked- Great proximity to many food/recreation areas downtown- Check in/out was super easyQuirks:- A little pricy during special events- Some room windows are attached to the lobby (which when it gets rowdy at night can sort of be heard)- Card key required to take elevator up (so don't lose it)Such a great hotel in a great location within walking distance to Broadway. The hotel is fabulous. My room had a view of Broadway.  I had a suite that was just beautiful. The beds are like sleeping on a cloud. This was such a great stay and experience. Highly recommend! The club room had great appetizers in the afternoon. Valet was super quick too!This is the best Hilton I have visited.  This Hilton is right behind Broadway- where lots of popular bars are.  I stayed here for a conference and they exceeded my expectations. The hotel is beautiful and very open.  When I reached the desk I was efficiently checked in and warmly welcomed to the Hilton.  I booked a room on the 10th floor. It was clean and comfortable.  I was given infused water daily with turndown service and coffee and weather information were available for me near the elevators daily- it pays to be a member of Hilton Honors.Housekeeping was reliable and noninvasive.  The room was quiet and the bath was adequately furnished.  The honors lounge was great.  The breakfast offerings included hot egg dishes, fruit, breads, yogurt, yogurt parfaits, juices, and milk.  Evening offerings included warm appetizers, chips, soft drinks, whole fruit, and other snacks.  Overall service and amenities were great.Location location location!  if you want to take advantage of the Broadway honky-tonk bar hopping scene, then this is the place to stay. Just a short half-block walk from the hotel lobby and you are in the heart of party central. No driving, no parking, no cabs.All the rooms at this property are suites. That means they have a completely separate sleeping area and living area.  Rooms have all been remodeled and have a contemporary modern feel to them.The overall vibe of this lis upscale.The bedding was plush and you are sure to sleep like a baby. We ate casual lunches and breakfasts on the property. They were standard hotel fare - not special.  But then you don't go to Nashville to eat at a Hilton hotel.You'll find it easy to get to this property from the airport, only a $12 fare with Uber. Next time you're traveling to Nashville and want convenience combined with a contemporary upscale property, then staying at the downtown Hilton should be your first choice.It's not often that I travel for business these days, but I had the pleasure of staying at the Hilton Nashville a Downtown for a single night mid-week not too long ago. It's also not often when I find myself wishing I had more time to spend in my hotel room when traveling to new places, but again, this was the case with this place.  The hotel is an all-suite location, so each room has a separate living/sitting/office area. There was plenty of room and I only managed use a fraction of the amenities offered.The bathroom was equally spacious with tons of counter space, which was a huge plus! The bed was super comfortable, which made it extra hard to get up when my alarm rang after my single-night stay.The staff was friendly and accommodating. The concierge/valet staff were very friendly when storing my bag as well.I can't speak to the price of the room as my office picked up the tab (and I never saw a bill), but word to the wise - wifi is an additional $10/day for up to 3 devices (which I still don't understand to be acceptable in 2015).Despite the unacceptable wifi charge, when I'm in Nashville again, I'll definitely plan on staying at the Hilton Downtown. I'm looking forward to it!Hilton hotel is located in the heart of downtown Nashville. Self parking is available for $20 a day or valet parking at $30 a day with unlimited in/out daily access. The hotel is contemporarily designed with a piano playing in the beautiful lobby. The piano is a nice touch but it is LOUD and it plays until 9pm every night. Uggggh which is late. It should stop playing at 7pm. The rooms are neat and tidy with modern fixtures. Nothing extra or special is offered. The bed is comfortable with the same bedding as Hilton Garden.Regarding the amenities:Dear Hilton Management, the Hilton hotel would be a HUGE success if you offered similar amenities like at Hilton Garden. 1) Such as giving free bottled water upon check in versus giving nothing or a silly cookie at the Double Tree. After traveling it is a nice touch to receive the free water. It is also great how Hilton Garden has free bottles of water available throughout the day in the lobby. 2) FREE WI-FI...come on in this day and age WI-FI should be free at every hotel and especially at the high end Hilton hotels. Free WI-FI is a necessity not a nice to have so make it FREE.3) WSJ should be free and readily available, not just USA Today.In the future, I will not stay at a Hilton hotel if there is a Hilton Garden available. As a frequent business traveler the free amenities mentioned above are deal breakers for me especially at the high price Hilton hotel charges, it is not worth it. The days of pay more and get nothing is so dated.Upgraded upon checkin as I'm a gold member. Executive Lounge was great. Good breakfast. Upscale rooms and amenities. Room service was good. I had a wine glass that wasn't dirty but lots of smudges and to much cork in wine (I can handle a little bit). I called and they opened a new bottle in front of me. Very nice. Drinks in bar were really good! They make an excellent "Tennessee Mule". Great area to work in room. Beds so comfortable... even though I work long hours there the beds provide a wonderful night sleep. LOCATION Can't be beat.My experience here has been great, hotel quality is on top, food service is beyond anything I have had at previous suites. Quality of the room is very good, my favorite part were the pillows which I wish I could take home with me, otherwise I recommend staying here it's downtown and close to many bars and restaurants. In the heart of downtown this is one of the best hotels in the area.I have never stayed here but have been to parties.  A nice corporate hotel in a great location.  Best of all it is great for urban hiking potty breaks and a sit down by the piano to rest your feet.  Quiet and no one ever disturbs you.Great hotel. There is one outstanding employee that should be recognized for providing the best service we have ever had. His name is Cliff @ the front desk. He squared us away with our parking situation and spoke to the manager and the hotel covered 1 day valet charge. That's huge. We are from Hawaii and that's what we call the ALOHA spirit, even here in Nashville. The entire staff so far has been very helpful from the valet to the front desk. We're planning on making Nashville an annual vacation spot for years to come. Hilton has been so good to us and we'll continue our loyalty for years to come.I was met by Will when I came in at 1am. He was pleasant, helpful and kind. He accommodated my questions and was extremely patient. Thank you WillGreat location, very nice rooms.  Very nice work out facilities that are open 24 hours a day.  Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.  Attended a conference in the hotel, staff and facilities were both very nice.   Need a key card to operate the elevator which is really a pain in the Butt.   Don't understand why Hilton needs to nickel and dime their guests by charging $10 a day for Internet when rooms run around $250.What a beautiful hotel, the suites are huge and has a great layout. When you walk in it has a huge grand entrance and it's very clean.  It is walking distance to lots of great restaurants and stores so that is a great plus for me.Having worked in hotels for many years, hotels much better than this one, at that, I am appalled at how little this hotel seems to know about customer service. I understand that my family and I stayed there during a very high traffic weekend, but NEVER in my life have I had a manager talk to me the way Jeff did. I managed a 4 star hotel. I understand that the shiz hits the fan on a regular basis, but you cannot think for a second that arguing that you're right is appropriate (amazingly enough, that's completely contradictory to Hilton's satisfaction guarantee...way to go Jeff!! Show me again how little your guests mean to you). Again, having managed a hotel much better than this one in the past, I can't believe that they're surviving with a management team that argues with guests. I shouldn't have to go to corporate to be heard. I shouldn't have to go to corporate to ensure that the room rate I was quoted is what I get charged. You'd rather lose all revenue on two rooms than just some of it? Really? The hotel itself is pretty. The rooms are nice. Obviously the housekeeping department is on point. But their front desk staff and managers on duty need some retraining...especially in reference to the Hilton Brand Promise. If you can't do what's expected of you, don't work in hospitality. Jeff, I think it's time you find another line of work.Limited use of electricity, new to the area. Unable to charge phone, limited / no internet access.Terrible hotel for a conference. The A/V contact had a terrible attitude, was extremely lazy and really had no intention of doing his job. I had to hire a private A/V consultant to come in and help me at which time the live stream for the conference was a total bust. The hotel is beautiful, but the service is poor. Our room was spacious and very classy and the bar downstairs is A+, but the A/V tech just killed the entire experience.
review_content_20: The positives about the hotel: 1. Beautiful inside with a nice lobby. 2. Spacious, nice and clean rooms with a comfortable bed. 3. It is in the perfect spot for most things you would want to do in down town Nashville. Right next to the Country Music Hall of Fame and the bars with live music. Pretty much can walk anywhere. The negatives: 1. Even after you have paid $400+ a night they charge you either $30/day for valet or $20/day to park in their parking garage. A huge rip off in my opinion. 2. When they come to clean your room in between the days of your stay, they clean only what they want to. They left our room service trays and plates where we had left them. 3. I only ran into maybe one friendly person. The rest just seemed cold and unfriendly. 4. Breakfast was included in our stay but it was worthless. Unless you like eating miniature quiches a little fruit and cereal you won't be full or feel like you ate anything worth a darn. I'm not expecting anything grand, but maybe some eggs, meat and potatoes? I still mostly enjoyed my stay but I would come prepared to pay a lot more for parking, etc. the next time.This hotel is great. I love the open model in the lobby. The rooms are very clean and nice. It is so close to Broadway you really can't go wrong.I REALLY really like the Hutton Hotel in Nashville, but I gotta say it's a little too far from downtown. When you can walk out the door (even on an unseasonably cold and dreadful winter day) and be on Broadway immediately, location is everything. This hotel is no dump. Very nice room (ahem- suite) that was much larger than my first apartment with a super nice view of the something or other museum (I don't know my Country Music). Gotta say I really dig the honky-tonk, it's a short walk to Broadway from here. Parking is a little weird here but easy to figure out. Great service, great location, great greatness.Great experience. Well maintained & a lot of attention to detail. The rooms were very clean & well maintained. The only thing missing was a fridge but it was an amazing hotel.I submitted this review on Trip Advisory and it never was posted. I'm not sure what is going on, but I'm determined to let people know what a terrible experience I had and to try to get the Hilton to check up on this hotel. It was poorly managed and dirty. I had a ROACH in my bathroom on the 16th floor. I took a picture and tried to post it over there. I took the stairs to my room (yes on the 16th floor, because the elevators were so sloooooooow. Then I had to scoot around service workers who had staged rolling carts in the stairwells to service a break area - fire safety hazard. Our rooms were not ready at 3pm, check in time, when we arrived. I waited until 5pm. The room was sloppy, not well made beds, etc.. I could go on, but those were the highlights. I'm not writing this again.vAmazing and beautiful place to stay! The staff was extra friendly. The room was huge and very clean. The meals were perfect- the biggest breakfast I've ever seen!  I would absolutely go back in fact I think I could live there!!  Great all around experience!!Awesome views of downtown, and walkable to all the Honky Tonks on Broadway. Great amenities, beautiful lobby, and the staff are accommodating.  We wanted snacks at 4 am (bet you can't guess why) and Rocco was so nice to help us out.  Travel a lot and honestly haven't found a hotel with staff more willing to make you happy.Fairly poor service from this hotel. My husband and I were there for a wedding and valet parked.  We were told it was $10. Not ideal but ok. Went to the front desk and paid w a debit card and went ok to enjoy the wedding. Fast forward 3 days and out bank account reflects $32 charge from the Hilton. What?!? My husband calls to inquire as we only agreed to pay $10. They assure us the remaining $22 will be credited back to us. Another week goes by with no credit and multiple calls to management of the hotel with nothing. $22 may not seem like a lot to some but it is to me. Plus the principle of it is worth more than anything. I hope this is resolved soon. Otherwise the hotel is beautiful. I would just be careful of a bait and switch.Nicely remodeled rooms.  Very courteous and trained staff.  The room rate of 199 per night did not include parking at 30 bucks a day nor triple taxes at another 30-40 per day.  What is very interesting is that there is no complimentary coffee or tea.  Also wait staff need tie clips as their ties were filthy from wiping down tables.  All in all a fair stay and very close to Broadway Honky Tonks.  Make sure your room is on the front side of building. Too noisy on the Broadway side.I've stayed here before and a good hotel for business travellers especially when your out in a 2 days. Easy parking good Staff and Room Service is done right no go backs. I enjoyed the stay here and the rooms are comfortable. Hope to come back.Rooms were nice enough, and the location was very close to Broadway where are the Honky Tonk bars are, which is nice until you want to go to sleep. Sound traveled into the room until 2am. The house keeping kept coming in at 8:30AM, which to me was unacceptable. Way too early for people on vacation.Definitely not worth what you are spending, considering they don't even provide free wifi, or breakfast, or have a pool.booI liked this place, but the service was crap.In the 3 days I stayed, the concierge never answered the phone.  (Triffles, Triffles, I just used Yelp to find a great breakfast, lunch and drink spot.)The location is basically Times Square of Nashville.  Pros and cons there.The rooms/bathrooms were great.  I was in a 1 bedroom suite/king and it was spacious and good.The TV/signal was crap -- about a 3-4 second delay when surfing stations.  The internet is paid -- also crap.  Lastly -- the housekeeping stole my joint (fact), and never brought the extra coffee I asked for/needed.  I mean...so it goes.The staff was super sweet and southern, though.  I was just hoping for better customer service.Stayed here for 3 nights on a recent family holiday to the USA. The hotel has a great location & friendly staff. When I booked online through the Hilton Honors app it advised me that the hotel was currently renovating rooms, a floor at a time. Once we arrived we discovered that the construction also included the pool which was not mentioned before hand, plus with 2 children on school holidays & summer it was an inconvenience that should have been noted when booking.The internet in your room is charged but free in the lobby. Its the 1st Hilton group hotel I have stayed in worldwide that charges honors members for internet.The shower in our room had mould growing on the wall & when wiped over it came off easily which I think is unacceptable. The shower also filled the bath very quickly so after a 5 minute shower the bath was almost full & took a good 10 minutes to drain once the shower was turned off.If I was to visit Nashville again I would stay at the Hampton Inn 300 meters down the road. It has a pool, free wifi in your room, free breakfast  (not that fancy but better than nothing) & the walk in room rate we were quoted for a family room was $100 US less than what we were paying per night at the Hilton.Under construction. Returned from a long workday to obnoxious construction. After 5. I called to the front desk and they reported it will last until 7. So much for that nap. They offered to move me (already unpacked the night before). If a hotel has rooms away from the construction why do they book guests in miserably loud rooms?  Poor customer serviceWe've stayed at the Downtown Hilton several times over the years and this hotel is not quite the 5 star experience it used to be. They've removed the pool because it 'wasn't in high demand', something that my personal experience contradicts.The cleanliness is no more than a B/B-, our room wasn't vacuumed when we arrived, with crumbs from the last guest everywhere.The staff, while they smiled, had an edge to their expressions. We found them to be 'by the book' polite, but not what you would expect from a brand name that at one time was the gold standard of hotels.The room service menu had been pared down to bare bones.The sports bar was rather slow, where as in years past it was adequately staffed. The bar manager, seeing us sitting there for about 10 minutes said, "The bartender will be right with you", rather than taking our order. It was an additional 10 minutes before she came over to us.Next time we're in Nashville, we'll be staying elsewhere, either the Omni or the Hyatt.I absolutely love Hilton. But this particular hotel is in a great location right off Broadway walking distance to the famous Tootsie's, The Ryman and right next door to the Bridgestone Arena.The valet guys are always pleasant and help. The hotel is clean and fresh and the room service is actually good!PROS:The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. They were able to meet all of our needs even with a large group. Clean, decent sized rooms, turn down service, and comfortable roll away bed. The location cannot be beat. CONS:Make sure to get a room facing the front of the hotel. All other rooms are very noisy although you definitely get used to it. The pool was closed when we were there which we already knew but would have been nice to have it.This is about as good as a mid-level chain hotel gets.  Very spacious rooms, with a separate bedroom, two TVs, one in the bedroom, and one in the living room.  Refrigerator and microwave int he room as well as an arm chair and a couch, both comfortable.  Really my only complaints about the room was the lack of outlets near the bed and the expensive ($12 or $14/day) WiFi connection fee. Service was excellent - the bellhop who helped us when checking in was extremely friendly and very helpful with suggestions about his favorite honky tonks.  As others have mentioned, you really can't get a better location than this in Nashville.  You are a few minutes walk from the Country Music Hall of Fame, the Bridgestone arena, and Broadway.  The only reason to not stay here when visiting Nashville is either because it is too expensive or because you are trying to collect points with another hotel chain.Very nice rooms, clean and comfortable. However, the service and management leave a lot to be desired.  The staff seemed to go out of their way to be unhelpful, telling some guests in our party one thing while others something different.  The hotel is also close to several loud bars and music clubs, without adequate sound proofing.  Loud music, traffic, and general crowd noise will be coming straight into your room until 3am.Very nice. Comfortable clean beds. Great service. Close to everything.
review_content_40: I stayed here for three days while on vacation, and I really enjoyed the room and the hotel's location.  We were a minute walk from the main strip and an easy 20 minute drive to any location outside of downtown.  The bed was very comfy, the room spacious and bathroom clean.  I was a little bummed that we didn't have a window facing outside and that you had to pay for WiFi.  Otherwise, I was pretty happy!The staff is incredibly rude. There is no microwave, pool, or breakfast bar. You must pay for the wifi. You would think that after all of the expenses you are charged to stay here that complimentary wifi would at least be included. I am not a fan of this hotel at all. You can easily go somewhere cheaper, that has more accommodations and facilities, who treat you nicer. The staff are just plain rude! This place is all about wanting your money, but not about making you feel as if you are getting something for it.The only good thing about this hotel is the room setup and the restaurant inside, Trattoria il Mulino. We came for business. The room we are in faces the Bridgestone Arena and the noise before and after the hockey game is extremely loud. Music from a local bar has played each of the 3 nights of our stay outside on loud speakers until 2:00 am and later on Saturday nights.   I called the front desk to ask and complain and I was told where the music was coming from and she said, "you are in The Music City after all."  Completely unacceptable!  The hotel needs to put high impact windows in the rooms on the stadium side of the building. After my friend and I arrived at the hotel earlier in the evening we tried calling the front desk to ask for restaurant recommendations and the phone rang 25 times and there was no answer so we hung up. Again unacceptable!    The room set up was nice; however management needs to stroll through the rooms to look at the furniture. Stains on upholstered furniture tends to look pretty disgusting.  Also, no continental breakfast for guests?  Really, you are charging an awful lot for your rooms and I would think you would be more customer friendly to get return guests. Finally, I cannot believe that the hotel charges people $3.50 for wi-fi. This appears to be a huge money maker for the hotel to charge every guest for wi-fi. Shame on you! This will be my first and last trip to Nashville!  If you are coming to Nashville, I would highly recommend someplace other than the Hilton.Great rooms. Great location.  Loud music from Broadway :(. But I you are going to be up late the hotel is perfect.This hotel holds a special place in my heart because this is where my husband and I stayed after he proposed to me :) Paul booked the room and let them know he was asking me to marry him, he also worked with the concierge to have a beautiful flower arrangement waiting for me in our room (of my favorite, Stargazer Lillies). The hotels location to downtown Nashville is perfect for walking to all that Broadway/2nd Ave/Printers Alley has to offer... so if you're planning on exploring all the honky tonks, karaoke bars and great dining Nashville has to offer, this IS the hotel to stay at! To our surprise, upon check in, they had upgraded us, complimentary, to the Penthouse Suite and it was nothing short of spectacular! An enormous bedroom, full luxurious spa bathroom, wet bar, full dining table, ridiculously comfy sofa and another full bathroom... it was the most luxurious hotel I've ever stayed in... on a night that I'll never forget! The flower arrangement the hotel procured for my fiance was over the top... and made our room incredibly fragrant. The concierge also arranged champagne, bubble bath and chocolate strawberries to help us celebrate (and all for the standard room rate.... around $190). The hotels lobby is grand and a piano player truly added to it's elegance. We didn't try out the hotel bar, nor did we visit The Palm (which is attached to the hotel)... but the service, the room, the location, the upgrades were fabulous and over and above anything we had expected. We truly recommend the Hilton Nashville Downtown... for romance, for a night on the town, for anything... this hotel is the best!Nice hotel, but the $99 pet fee and parking fee were discouraging. The staff were exeptionally courteous and informative.  I would definitely stay here again!Great location and nice property.  Our room was spacious, comfortable, clean, decorated nicely and the air/heating system worked great.  The hotel lobby is massive and very nicely decorated.  I did not use any of the hotel amenities so can't comment on that.  The front desk staff were efficient and friendly.  Check-in/check-out was a breeze.  Definitely, will stay here again and highly recommend it if you are visiting downtown Nashville.This place looks beautiful and the location is great.  Unfortunately their customer service sucks!  I work in the hospitality industry so I know good service when I get it.  That did not happen here.  I've stayed in a lot of hotels, I use to live in Las Vegas and stayed at most hotels on the strip.Let me first start off saying that we arrived here on Christmas day/night around 8pm.  We didn't have a reservation, but we did get a room.  When we asked about valet, the front desk clerk said that someone was working but she had to call him to come park our car if we wanted.  So we just said forget it.  The first person told us it was okay to park on the street.  After doing so, someone told us we couldn't park the car there overnight.  They told us about a parking garage we could park in.  It costed us 20 dollars to park there.  All because they didn't want to call valet to come do their job they are getting paid for.  She acted like it was bad on our part to ask her call him to do his JOB!  So of course there was no bell man either.  So we went and got the cart ourselves, loaded it and I pushed it inside.  I didn't even know where the elevators were, so I was wondering around the lobby pushing this cart full of luggage, the front desk clerk saw me and finally came around to POINT me to where the elevators were.  Then she asked me if I need a bell hop.  I stated that it was pointless to have a bell hop now since I got the cart, loaded the cart myself, pushed it through the lobby, and was about to get on the elevator to go to my room.  Why would I want a bell hop to help me after I did all the hard work, why should I have to tip someone when they barely helped me.  We get to the room, the room was very nice, I will say that.  The pillows in the room were feather down and we were allergic, so I called the front desk to ask them to bring regular pillows to our room.  It took over 30 minutes, and when she did come she had two throw pillow size pillows (12 inches square) in her hands!  On top of that she didn't even bring pillow cases!  So I went down to the front desk and told them what happened, she said they didn't have any more regular pillows.  Really???  Upon check out we voiced theses issue we had and the woman apologized but didn't really care.  I asked to speak to the manager and he didn't do much either.  He made excuses that it was Christmas day and they were understaffed.  When we told him about the parking and valet, we asked them to take away the charge for the garage since we had no other option but to park there.  They said they couldn't do it, since they didn't own the garage.  The only thing they offered us was to take off the charge of wifi.  We had already gotten the wifi for free the night before, so they really weren't offering us anything.  When we got the car and packed our own luggage on the cart AGAIN, I dropped the room keys off.  Then the front desk clerk said she would comp the parking garage.  I told her I already paid for it, because she said she could take the charge away.  Guess she wasn't being honest about that.  It is sad that this place is so attractive and in a great location, but the guest services is horrible!!!  We actually checked out and tried another Hilton property why I don't know but we did.  We went to the Homewood Suites by Hilton.  The rooms were not as nice but the customer service was outstanding!!!  I will be writing a positive review about their hotel for sure.  Let me say the pillow incident there was impecable...they had the pillows switched out before we even got to the room.  We actually walked in on the guy exchanging the pillows for real size non feather pillows!  Amazing!What a great location for being in the heart of the Nashville Scene! I really like this hotel.Good central location, simple enough to get to the airport from, lots of dining options available in the close vicinity, comfortable rooms- I think they are all suites-, very striking lobby area and all of the standard amenities that you would expect at a a Hilton. I would definitely come back.This Hilton can be found in the heart of downtown. It's right across the street from the Country Music Hall of Fame, next to the Bridgestone Arena, & half a block away from the convention center. The rooms offer a microwave & a refridgerator (not a mini bar fridge). It also has 2 TVs on the smaller side. The bed however is SO comfy. The gym is small & has numerous cardio machines, but is limited on cable machines. The free weights go up to 50lbs, but there is only one bench to work on. They do also have medicine balls & yoga mats. In addition they have a water cooler. A good sized pool that is up to 5ft deep.I would recommend that you find out the schedule of the Bridgestone Arena as they play loud music on game days/nights & draw crowds at other times for other events. Otherwise you will find it hard to take a nap or go to bed. Request for a location away from the Arena if you find it hard to sleep w/ noise. The same goes w/ sleeping towards Broadway. This is a major party street so it can get loud at times. Word to the wise!Stayed here, as well as attended a friend's wedding, here this weekend. The wedding rate was $149/night and for that this is a 4 star hotel, but the usual rate is over $250 so in that case it's probably more like a 3 star hotel.The good:- Nice sized rooms with a separate living room area- Comfortable beds- A huge bathroom to primp myself for the wedding- Right in the middle of downtown Nashville, as well as across from the country music museum- Plenty of cabs always available even though Nashville isn't actually a cab friendly city- elevators that move at lightning speed- $13 breakfast buffet that I didn't try myself, but my fiance has mentioned what a great deal it was at least 10 times (it's the little things in life that excite him)The bad- unimpressive workout room- pretty gross indoor pool that you couldn't pay me to step foot in- they need to learn how to make a latte...I could hardly drink the one they made for me downstairsFor those of you looking to plan a special event in Nashville I"d also recommend the grand ballroom- my friend had a beautiful wedding here last night! It's a simple, yet elegant ballroom...the type where any decorations will work.  Would I return to the Hilton during my next trip to Nashville (if there ever is another trip to Nashville)? Yes, probably...but it would depend on the price. I would be happy staying here for under $200, but over that I'd seek shelter elsewhere.+1 Central location.-1 Parking problem. Parked in self-parking by accident, and Hilton couldn't bail me out and wasted $5. Did the same problem at the Hilton in Atlanta and they bailed me out with a free card.+1 Continental breakfast is extensive, not your usual cereal and fruit.-1 There is a ridiculous amount of birds in the tree next to the hotel. The next day, the tree was splattered with bird poop and the victims were the valet cars nearby.Overall, very good experience. I just wish they could help out with the parking situation.Great all-suite hotel. Very accomodating great pet policy. Brought our pup here for a long weekend away and there's even a park adjacent to the hotel with doggy pick-up stations. Rooms were large and very comfortable, fixtures were a little outdated but the friendliness of the staff and great location make it easy to overlook.If you're a tourist in Nashville, you really can't ask for a better location to be in the thick of everything that the city has to offer. My friends and I stayed here over Memorial Day weekend for a bachelorette party, and were able to easily take in so much of the local culture by barely having to walk more than a few blocks. The hotel shares a courtyard with the Country Music Hall of Fame, and is directly next to the Bridgestone Arena. Many of the touristy bars are located on the strip directly behind the hotel, and there are amazing, famous but less touristy music venues only a short cab ride away. The hotel itself is clean, the staff is friendly, and the rooms were comfortable and well decorated. My biggest complaint would be that the restaurant was average, at best, as was the breakfast buffet. But what would you expect at a hotel?You absolutely can't go wrong with staying here if you've never been to Nashville!I spent a weekend at the Hilton Suites Nashville-Downtown in January 2011, and the service was fantastic. The valets and front desk staff were really responsive and very friendly. I'm deducting a point for the room - Room 1004 was a little worn - it looked like someone threw kool-aid on one of the walls, and it had never been cleaned up.
