However, housekeeping did a nice job, and the room felt very clean. The suite included a large bathroom, flat screen TVs, and mini-fridge. Amazing location for going out - you can walk to a ton of bars on Broadway in 2 minutes. Be forewarned that if you stay on the side of the hotel overlooking Broadway... you will enjoy music until very early in the morning. As in, 4 AM. And it's loud. So if you're looking to sleep in a quiet room, ask for the opposite side of the hotel. :-)We stayed here on our drive from ATX to VA to MD. Yes, we are moving :( Anyhow we had all our things in the car and needed secure parking. So we chose to stay here. First off, this is a SUITES ONLY. And they charge accordingly. I would have expected it to be better than what I was served.It is noisy, there is no view to speak of, and rooms,...wait I am sorry, suites need a better cleaning.On the plus side:Valet is super helpful which is a welcome surprise. It is within walking distance to many things of interest but my only interest was sleep before heading out the next morning.I am a diamond member and have to say this is one of the nicest Hiltons I have stayed at. Room is very nice and has recently been done. Room service was excellent biggest french dip sandwich I've ever had. The staff is extremely friendly.I would say the hotel was between 2 and 3 stars.  The room was clean, the lobby was clean, breakfast service was fast, but the noise level was yucky...We were on an outside room facing the Bridgestone arena.  The weekend we stayed they had a marathon going on.  We could hear the announcer, band, crowd at 5 in the morning.  In the evening we heard the local bars playing their music.  We did not sleep well at all.  Maybe if we got an inside room it would have been better...I stay here every time I come to Nashville for business and have always been quite happy.  The beds are SO comfortable.  There's a gym with some decent equipment and I love the glass elevator.Food & Beverage went out of their way for me last time to try and get a meal that is more like what I'm used to in SoCal.  The bar attached has really good food and super friendly bartenders.This has a great downtown location and is very cozy for me when I am away from home.
review_content_60: I have always found Hilton hotels to either be hit or miss.  I have to say this was a miss.  As far as location, this is ideal if you want to stay downtown as it is right around the corner from Broadway.  Other than that, nothing special.  Rooms are true suites, but the separation makes the space seem smaller.  Lobby is nice, but nothing memorable.Service was less than I would expect for $269 a night.  We booked and prepaid for a city view room.  We were checked into a room with only a view of the interior of the hotel.  The mistake was corrected, but there was no apology.  We ordered a room service breakfast for two, but they included only one set of utensils and also missed sweetener for the coffee.  Upon checking out, we were asked if the bill was correct.  That would be the bill they failed to slip under our door as well.  I was also peeved that internet access was not included in our rate.On a positive note, the bell service and valet were very courteous.  The hotel also has a musician in the lobby bar in the evenings.  The gentleman we watched was very good and even chatted with us for a bit.  That was definitely the high-point of our short stay.There are many other hotels in the downtown area to consider.  If you can swing it, spend the extra money to stay a few blocks away at the Hermitage Hotel if you are looking for a better experience.Assuming you can get a decent room rate this is one of the better hotels in the area. For 1) all suites...so plenty of space in your room.2) easy walking to all the cool local places3) nice folks all around4) good workout room - if you want cardio and basic dumbbells you are all set. not big at all, but better than most hotels.This was one of the most eligant hotels ive been in for the price. the customer service is amazing. i say is cause im still here. great location great price great people. They do need dvd players in the roons.I really don't think there is a better and more convenient hotel to stay in downtown Nashville than the Downtown Hilton.  All of the rooms are suites and are spacious.  There are lots of good food choices in the hotel or nearby. There is a Palm restaurant conveniently located in the west side of the building.  The hotel sports bar is pretty good and the prices are good too. The meeting spaces are large and the staff is always eager to help.Very nice hotel that's in the middle of downtown Nashville. As others have mentioned it's located by all the bars and restaurants. Most of those places have good variety of bands playing every night. Also close to the home of the Nashville Symphony Orchestra, Country Music Hall of Fame, and Bridgestone Arena. You can't go wrong staying here!Thank you Hilton for using fitted sheets.Stunning place. The lobby is beautiful and we were shocked at how big our room was. Immaculate, great staff.Super location & within walking distance of all the nightlife and sights during the day.  Everything looks new but my room seemed fairly dated based on wear and tear.  Great gym and thought the morning buffet and sports bar were above par as well.  Really enjoyed my stay - though rather pricey as compared to other hotels in the area.Phenomenal location to all things Nashville. Staff was overly accommodating and rooms very smart. Sports bar on property and every honky Tonkin and bar you could want is in walking distance. Next to the arena, across from the country hall of fame, and walking distance to football! No wonder they're sold out mostntimes I call.The Downtown Hilton provides adequate accommodations but the staff is it's Achilles heel.  From an unwelcoming front desk to a housekeeper who opened the door before knocking twice the staff at the Downtown Hilton is lacking to say the least.This Hilton Hotel in Downtown Nashville is equivalent to a W Hotel in any other city.  Not because it's a damn great place to stay, but because there is nothing else in Nashville to compare it to.  I've been to this Hilton Hotel several times for business trips and it's pretty much the best hotel in Nashville for travelers.  It's not fancy or upscale, but it does meet a minimum standard for me, and to be honest, I'm a snob when it comes to travel since I do it a lot.The architecture of this hotel is unique in that you can either get a view of the inside of the hotel or of the street.  Nothing fancy to see from this hotel at all.  Perhaps, you'll be lucky to see the river and the stadium the Tennessee Titan's play in, but that's all.The facility is clean and kept in good working order, while the staff has the typical Nashville politeness and are actually very accommodating especially to city folk that visit.  WiFi and breakfast are free because of my company discount, but if you don't have a discount, they'll charge for WiFi use and breakfast for a minimal fee.Breakfast is usually done at the lobby area but I advise people to keep a careful eye on their luggage or laptop bags when getting food.  My coworker had his laptop bag and laptop stolen in broad daylight while he was getting breakfast.  The breakfast area is close to the hotel entrance and any random individual can walk in and walk out with being noticed.There's really not much to do in Downtown Nashville, especially if you're used to a big city like Los Angeles.  There are the typical country music bars and chain restaurants, but if you're willing to drive, you can find some interesting restaurants around the Vanderbilt area.  One thing I do love about Nashville is that when you dine or drink in groups, all establishments automatically provide individual checks.  I wish LA would do that too!Go Trojans!  Fight On!Came to Nashville for a business trip and had the pleasure of staying at the Downtown Hilton.  Beautiful all-suite hotel, super friendly staff, great room service,  this place surpassed my expectations.   The lobby is beautiful..high ceiling, two staircases leading to the meeting floor, a bar in the middle..  they have live music playing during the night time.   I would pay to watch the saxophonist play again!In-room dining was great, had a lot of healthy options.. seared ahi tuna salad, grilled salmon, fruits (as you can see I'm back to my pesci vegetarian diet).  The service was impeccable.The rooms were clean, well stocked, and had a beautiful view of city.  I highly recommend staying here if you ever have the chance to go to Nashville.p.s.  Did I mention I saw Little Richard here? (picture of his back posted) :pThe location is unbeatable if you are interested in the downtown honkey tonks or seeing a hockey game, all within very close walking distance.  The rooms are comfortable.  Two TVs, a couch, a fridge, a microwave.  The host at the sports bar was very friendly and helpful.  My only complaint: there was a band practicing in the arena across the street, but it sounded like they were in the next room.  Note to self: bring earplugs next time.This hotel is in a great location downtown.  It's a 2 minute walk to Broadway.  The rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff was friendly and responsive.  Loved the pool - it was clean and there were lots of freshly washed towels stocked and ready to be used.  The girls and I ordered room service for breakfast one morning and the food was delivered quickly and it was delicious.   I will definitely stay here again the next time I make it to Nashville.

hotel_name: The Inn at Opryland, A Gaylord Hotel
review_content: At the end of the day, a hotel is basically some place where you put your head down. It's a shelter for you so that you can rest easy and be ready for whatever the next day has in store for you. Whether its business or pleasure, at the end of each and every day, your hotel room is where you ultimately end up.The hotel is a little dated as far as all the other hotels are concerned. Even though its older, it's been kept very well. This hotel does have its southern charm still intact though. The lobby, although a little out dated in the decor, the reception still will still give you the good service you deserve. If you're not ready for it, be prepared to be called ma'am and sir. Yes, this is what they call southern hospitality. The hotel area is designed in the old atrium style type of hotel. In closed in the building surrounded by rooms is the pool and a massive function area. There's elevators that take you to your floor, hallways so you can walk to your door and rooms that have beds in it. In the room, there's also lampshades, a desk, a dresser, a television and a sink. There's also the bathroom, there you will find a toilet and a tub with a shower. The fitness center is pretty good. This is probably one of the strong points of this hotel. Also if you're into shopping, there is a shuttle that'll take you to and from the outlet mall. There you can do some retail therapy, or do some window shopping.The Inn at Opryland is a very nice hotel. Probably not the newest, but still give you a good night stay. I know I did and totally had a restful night. I'm sure I'll stay here again next time.Follow me on Instagram and snapchat: rodtorres3After a somewhat disappointing stay last time, I somehow found my way back to this hotel...should've gone somewhere else. This is a hotel managed by Marriott, but is not on par with Marriott quality. There are two types of room: the ones facing outside with exterior walkway, and the ones on facing inside, with interior walkway and overlooking an atrium. I chose an interior room because the exterior ones are just like a motel. Problem is, not only I hear noises from the walkway, but also from the atrium below (there is a pool and a hot tub....imagine kids and pool or young people with alcohol in the hot tub late at night....yeah, you get the picture). My room was located directly above the on-site restaurant/bar/live music venue, so I was bombarded by loud music, especially from the bass guitar, all night - until 10:00 PM. Yeehaw! I hope y'all like country music!! Room decor looks dated and tired, especially the carpet and hardgoods. Bathroom is annoying, with an extremely small bathtub (I'm somewhat tiny). When taking a shower, either my shoulders almost touching the shower curtain and wall, or I'm starring directly in the curtain/wall. Instead of small bottles of shampoo/conditioner/shower gel, there are three gigantic bottles mounted on the wall. Not sure about you, but I don't have too much faith in fellow human beings that I want to share personal hygiene products with complete strangers. Another annoying thing is lack of complimentary coffee/tea at the lobby, like all Marriott properties. Sure, there's a Starbucks coffee machine - at $3 per cup!!! Nope! I don't think so..... Although the property is located in a tourist area, there is not a single restaurant within 5 miles radius that's ranked in top 40 in Metro Nashville on Yelp...that's pretty sad.I was very very disappointed with this motor inn.It is not a hotel. I took my handicap Mother to Opryland for her 89th birthday.I booked the other hotel at opryland and the booking site reservation confirmation stated for November!!Not October.I phoned Booking.com to tell them of this problem.They stated there was nothing they could do.No rooms available at Gaylord Opryland hotel.I would still be billed for November rooms I cant use!Nonrefundable. I called Gaylord Opryland direct.She had no rooms available but directed me to their Sister hotel "Gaylord Opryland Inn"I booked two days.A king room was all that was available.I noted to them I would need handicap access. When I arrived at hotel the desk clerk suggested I take 2nd floor room with pair of doublebeds.I had to enter motel from rear entrance,down hall to elevator,go down 2 halls,exit double doors and out to exterior balcony hall to locate very disappointing room.All this while pushing my Mother in a wheelchair! There were no rooms available nearby.I should have left.Sheets and carpet felt damp.No handicap accessible anything.Mirrors were warped and distorted.No hook in toilet tub room.Dirt in corners of bathroom.Yuck!!Well...this place is interesting. Uh...that's all I got to describe it. First of all, it has interior and exterior rooms. I had an exterior room and it was a cold day. Struggle. The room was ok until I went to the bathroom. That was the smallest bathroom I have ever been in. The shower was hard to get into as well. However, they did have a shuttle to Orpy Mills mall and good service. This easily could have been 2 star rank. Also, they have an indoor pool that you can smell from a mile away. Nothing like a cup of coffee and chlorine in the morning.This hotel has wonderful staff, whom are attentive and friendly. The room have been updated and have a nice look to them, however the hotel has a major flaw- the original building layout. Half of the rooms are interior, meaning they only open to the inside of the hotel. The major problem with this is you cannot open windows and have no fresh air flowing into the room. While my room was clean, the musty smell was overpowering and unacceptable. Since people walk by your window, the blinds must stay closed causing a dark room. This probably won't bother you if you are just sleeping, but any time spent working at the desk in the room will leave you underwhelmed. The second problem is the lack of a restaurant that serves breakfast- you can only get pastries and light snacks. However, there are several restaurants within walking distance that offer up breakfast. Lastly, there is a restaurant that has live performances, and those can get loud - but they promptly stop at 9:00.After reading reviews online I was a little skeptical of this place. However upon arrival staff was very friendly and the lobby resembled a Marriott property. I had high hopes! Those were crushed as our room smelled of air neutralizer over spray which after leaving and coming back was obviously covering the musty smell. Our room faced the main road and it was like we were sleeping on the Las Vegas strip all night. Very loud, beds were full size and uncomfortable. Great location but definitely felt more like a 'motel'. We were scheduled to stay 2 nights and checked out well before check out time after one night.This is okay if you're going to go to the Gaylord resort. Otherwise, I would skip it. It's far from Broadway and downtown-about 20 to 25 mins drive. There is a shuttle to downtown but it's $20 per person. To get to the Gaylord resort, you have to drive or take their free shuttle.As others have mentioned, the hotel is set up with exterior rooms and interior (atrium) rooms. The atrium has an indoor pool and then a large, empty room. Because of the pool, the hotel smells like chlorine and is loud. Our other pet peeve-they have coffee in the lobby which you pay $3 for.If you do stay here, go to Nashville Palace for lunch and dinner though.Marriott should be ashamed of this property! Half the rooms face the interior and the entire building smells like pool chemicals due to the non-enclosed indoor swimming pool. The other half are accessed through an outdoor hallway. Think cheap hotel from 1995. Every time someone opens/closed their door or rolls a luggage cart or cleaning cart by you will wake up and hear it. The room is decorated nicely. However it feels like a damp, moldy basement. You have to run your AC all the time to combat the humidity. The carpet always feels moist so be prepared to wear your shoes all the time. The shower is so small I kept hitting my elbows. Thing cruise ship shower but worse!!I forgot my toothpaste so I called down to ask for some. I was told that someone would bring me some. I wait 30min and nothing. I go to the front desk and look in their "essentials" shop to buy some and they don't have any. Ask the front desk and they go to look for some. 30 min later nothing. They said someone will bring some to my room. At this point I just go to a gas station and get some. It was my fault for forgetting to bring it, but if the hotel didn't have some they should have just said so. I could have saved an hour of my time. There is a Hyatt place that looks a million times newer and better 100ft behind this property.Marriott and Gaylord should be ashamed to be affiliated with this dump of a 'motel'. I stay at Marriott properties all over the country and when I saw this was 'A Gaylord Hotel' I immediately assumed it would be of high quality because of the Gaylord / Marriott name. This is a trick, because the ACTUAL Gaylord is across the street and this joke motel is simply 'owned' by Gaylord, but nothing even close to Gaylord. The nightly rate for this craphole was absurd. This place was such a DUMP that I checked out 10 minutes after checking in and got my money back. I will never consider staying here and will go out of my way to make sure friends don't book a room here. I am ashamed to be a Marriott Gold Rewards Member and may look at other hotel brands in the future because of this joke of an experience.* Lazy front desk workers* Smoking everywhere* Humid walking through interior courtyard* Loud traffic outside with truckers going byAvoid this place like the plague.If you like motel 6 with mold, then this place is for you. The rooms are about the same size(tiny). We clearly had water damage on the ceiling. It could easily be smelt. The only difference between this place and a motel 6 is the price. This place costs about 2 1/2 times more. Ridiculous. Some people complained about the noise on the inside rooms. Try sleeping in one of the outer rooms on the freeway side. The reason I gave this place a second star is because the staff is friendly.Hotel is nice in lobby but don't get outside room! The rooms are not worth price. You are right next to grand ole opry and opry mills outlets. They have shuttle free to opry and outlets. The downtown shuttle is nice but only one free pass for two day stay? ! You are paying enough to cover that second day bus pass too. It wasn't cheaper on day 2.The rooms are decent with lay out. No fridge or microwave! The problem is ac is hard to control, a slight smell on entering room. But the noise from the road is crazy! You will hear every motorcycle, bus, truck, and most anything else out side the door. I got Room facing main road but even side street had noise issues. So if they can't give you inside room, then go elsewhere. The opry is easy to leave on your own. Downtown places with parking probably best. The drive is not long to get here from downtown. Or stay down the street.This place used to be a Radison owned property and includED Sleep Number beds, they have since taken the SN beds out but for the most part, everything is still the same. The first time we stayed, our room over looked the pool and was quite quaint. This time, our room (3067) over looked the Cracker Barrel and two stories above the restaurant which hosted a very loud country band the room is not sound proof to say it lightly.Pros: location, directly across the street from the Gaylord Resort and convention center.Free parkingAlmost $100 less per night (during the Christmas season, which is when I priced both places)Several dining options onsite or within walking distance Shuttle busCons: shuttle bus to the Gaylord only runs until 7:30 pm even on the weekends. The shuttle bus to downtown is $20 per person.The noise levelPrice is still steep, in my opinion.Small children in the hot tub...I know that isn't the hotel's problem, I just hope that someone will read that part and refrain from allowing their children in the hot tub. Parking is hard to find after 8pm...on the weekends.We stayed at this hotel by mistake. I thought I was booking the large nicer hotel across the street. I'm sure this is how they get most of their business by the names being so close so beware of that. There is nothing wrong with this hotel, the inside is fine, the front desk is nice and the restaurant has pretty good food. I did book the exterior room thinking it would be a nice view but it was just the freeway and a cheap restaurant. If you are going to only sleep here because you are out exploring Nashville (which is about 20 minutes away FYI) then stay here!First thing is the terrible musty odor in the rooms. Figured it was just the fact that the room was empty for a while. We ran the AC for most of the day on high. Still smelled. We requested another room. All the interior facing rooms were booked so they graciously gave us another exterior facing room. Guess what same smell!Housekeeping forgets to empty your garbage, hairs all over the floor. Sleep number beds don't work. Exterior facing rooms are LOUD. From the traffic noises to the guests rolling their luggage. Sounds like it's in the same room with you. One of the worst MOTELS I've stayed in in years. Many others to choose from. Do your homework!!Hotel - definitely not! This is a motel! We stayed there May 2015. The rooms had much to be desired. They were very damp and we had to keep the air on. The shower had great pressure and a tub, but be prepared if you're tall as the shower head is positioned low and you'll have to squat to get under it. The entire vanity area was so small it made it difficult to impossible for 2 people to share the area. The beds were horrible. The idea of putting sleep number beds in a hotel where there are a ton of children who will be anxious to play with them constantly and the percentage of having them not work was very high (like our room with 2 queen beds and 1 didn't work). These were just another poor attempt and gimmick to try and sell a product. The rooms facing inside were battling the constant strong smell of chlorine from the pool and jacuzzi, which was open from 9 am-9 pm. The rooms facing outside were battling the humidity and were extremely damp and needed the air conditioner on constantly. Parking - I have no idea if there is valet parking as trying to find a staff member to greet you is impossible and non-existent. Park yourself and don't bring your bags in until you find out where your room is as you may be moving your car to the rear of the hotel (motel). Staff - if you could find them. The only staff we encountered was at the front desk who were far from resourceful and housekeeping when they were slamming the door to the adjacent room over 4 times within 3-5 minutes in the early morning, so we actually got up and kindly confronted them to ask them if there was something wrong as it felt like an earthquake and they looked at us as if we had 3 heads and couldn't answer us as they didn't understand. It took their supervisor who overheard us asking, as she was also in the room to acknowledge our request to stop the banging of the doors as we were still trying to rest in the early am. We had also asked the front desk staff for information about tours of The Grand Ole Opry (did I mention Gaylord Grand Ole Opry?!?!?) and the front desk staff had NO IDEA! We were stunned and embarrassed for them. I could understand if their name (Gaylord) wasn't all over it and they weren't on the property, but they didn't even use their resources and look it up for us!! Someone needs to train their staff in hospitality 101!Would I recommend this hotel? No. Why 2 stars? It wasn't as bad as a 1 star (which there could be much worse), it was an overall clean room (not comfortable, dry or mapped out well) cheap for our 1 night stay and in a good location for the Opry. Don't be fooled by the photos. I was, and was so disappointed when we arrived. You get what you pay for. Need I say more?!?Stayed here a few times because of the price. Never had a problem except for the smell I always get upon entering the room. Staff is friendly and has shuttles that go to the mall. Not the worst hotel I've been to, but I don't come here expecting a 4star hotel.Oh Inn at Opryland, where do i start...I took my mother to Nashville to fulfill her dream to see the Grand Ole Opry, so, I decided to stay at the Inn. Seemed like a good idea as it was cheaper than the massive Opryland Hotel and much smaller. I made an assumption (bad idea, I know) that because the Inn was a Marriott, there would be great service and good amenities; how wrong I was.The Inn's website said they have an airport shuttle and when I landed in Salt Lake to connect to Nashville, I called the hotel to confirm they had a shuttle. The extremely unfriendly person on the other end of the phone told me it was $30 per person from the airport to the hotel ($40 round trip per person). I was immediately turned off to the idea and, upon further online investigation, I discovered a waiting taxi at the airport would charge a flat rate of $25 per cab to the hotel and back to the airport. We obviously elected to use the taxi, which saved us $30 for delivery to the hotel and return to the airport.The desk clerk was friendly when we arrived and quickly got us to our room. When I entered the room, I noticed incredibly bland decor and an extremely small bathroom. The rooms were so humid the sheets were wet and I can't remember a single time during my stay when I was actually able to dry off after a shower.There is not one place in the hotel to get a complimentary cup of coffee...anywhere. You can use the bland bagged room coffee if you want but I would worry about some surcharge or outrageous charge for using the coffee maker in the room and the cost of disposing of the trash associated with brewing a cup. My poor mother went to the lobby to get a cup, as she had noticed the coffee machine the night before, and it required her to swipe her card and charge her $3 for a cup. The front desk employee elected not to tell her there was a "Starbucks"--loose association with the actual Starbucks, where she could get a real brewed cup for the same price. Inside the ridiculously huge atrium, there was a pool, hot tub and wading pool. After a long day wandering around all Nashville has to offer, I decided to go sit in the hot tub and relax for a while. To my surprise, the pool area is completely locked and evacuated at 9:00pm, leaving myself and several other angry customers with the option of going back to our saunas...I mean rooms...to end the day. I have traveled all over the world and I have never heard of a hot tub closing that early; trivial I know, but just another notch in the headstone.Overall, I was not impressed by this hotel at all. There was nothing stand-out whatsoever and there was nothing that would have suggested this was a Marriott. Service-meh, price-meh, amenities-NONE, style-terrible. I was very disappointed with this particular hotel experience and I would not suggest it to anybody traveling to Nashville. Do yourself a favor and find yourself a nice hotel downtown and grab a taxi to the Opry if you want to go.This hotel is extremely over rated and over priced! We had a horrible check in experience as they couldn't find our reservation and then once it was located we had to wait over an hour for our room to be ready. Once in the room it was not even cleaned. I don't blame the house keeping staff as I'm sure they were over worked and rushed. In fact the only friendly staff were the housekeepers. There was entirely way too much walking to get to our room. Once settled in we explored to find over priced mediocre food and the atriums full of fake looking plants. The room was extremely cold with no extra blankets and horrible pillows. There was definitely much to be desired from this location and I couldn't wait for our stay to end.If your a light to medium sleeper don't come here..A nice place to stay, rooms were comfortable. Several things are right, however, one major drawback is the noise. The hotel is set up with exterior rooms and interior (atrium) rooms. We stayed in an interior room, every noise that was made in the atrium echoed and came in our room. Little noise dampening was on the wall, door and window that separates the room from the atrium. I was woke up at 6 am by people walking by our room having a conversation, additionally this was added to by children screaming in the atrium, I don't know if they were in the pool, it's in the atrium...My company pays for me to stay here but I probably would stay on my own time. The hotel van is a throwback from the 60's- red, gawdy but comfortable. I was more concerned with the location than the appearance and there are tons of places to eat so you won't starve if you're not driving. They have Shoney's, bob Evans, Cracker Barrel and a mcdonalds. There's also a place in the hotel but I ate at the mall.Staff was nice at check in telling is about the amenities of the free business center, and the shuttles that take you to the mall, and downtown. Never heard of a shuttle charging to go downtown but I looked online and there's a city bus that goes as well. The shuttle to the mall was nice but early. Supposed to leave every half but he left before schedule so be ready 10 minutes prior. My room faced the atrium and I heard everything from the water splashing to dishes in the restaurant. Gotta take a star away for that especially since I'm a light sleeper. Elevator is slow and not sure if there is more than one. I've stayed at worse and I've stayed at better but a clean bed and a shower is all I seek and I got that. Bathroom was small but so am I so no biggie and the tv had the channel I needed so no issues there for me.
review_content_20: Stayed here for a medical convention in town, and unfortunately that meant all of the hotels in the area were completely booked (otherwise I would have run screaming from this place).I check in and get put in an exterior room over the freeway, and there is just a horrible smell in the room that hits you as soon as you open the door. I went back down to the registration desk and requested a different room and was basically told "tough luck", and no offer to do anything about the horrible odor. The only reason I ended up staying was that it was 10 pm and there was not an available hotel room within 20 miles (believe me I did a thorough online search). The decor is outdated and overall just shabby, worn carpets, small rooms, no refrigerator in rooms, etc. To add insult to injury when I went to the lobby early the next morning to go to my meetings, I was told that they didn't have any coffee for guests, other than a machine that would dispense a cup of coffee for $3. Just ridiculous. Why anyone would stay here is beyond me.This is the worst Marriott I have ever stayed at as far the room, decor, etc.  Beware when you check in as they will charge you fees and not tell you about it. First off, I asked them to charge my room fee to a CC versus my debit card. They took the card and acted as if they would, but when I checked my bank account an hour later I noticed they did not honor my request. I also noticed an extra $50 charge that I knew nothing about ahead of time.  I found out after the fact this was for incidentals. A few days after my stay, the $50 was credited back to my account but they had added another $30 charge for a shuttle. I did not use a shuttle during my stay. It seems as if they just charge what they want, when they want, with no signature required or any type of identity checks. I am still waiting on the reversal of this fee. I have spent nearly 2 hours on the phone trying to get the correct amount charged for my stay. Also, we stayed here for a soccer tournament with our soccer team. The pool closes at 9pm and not only that, they would not allow the parents and kids congregate anywhere outside the pool area. They told us we had to go to our rooms. 9 pm on a Saturday night, and we had to be in our rooms. I am a Marriott rewards member and I stay at Marriotts throughout the year. Not anymore though. I will be switching over to a new hotel chain after this. I am just hoping that sometime in the near future I will actually get refunded money so I am charged the fee that I was promised when booking the hotel. It has been an entire week and that has still not happened. Do not expect a nice looking hotel like you are used to with Marriott hotels. Make plans to be in your room by 9 pm if you are on site. And use a prepaid card or be prepared for extra charges. Never again. Lesson learned.  Notice by the yelp star rating that I am not the only one who feels this way.This is our 4th and final time to book this hotel. The service and rooms are simply inexcusable in this price range. For $300+ per night we were booked in a room that was small, poorly appointed and had a malfunctioning AC unit that made loud noise all night. The noise sounded like brakes grinding on metal. It was beyond loud and kept waking us up during the night. The room I booked was supposed to have a couch but didn't. The final straw was the valet service when we were leaving. Waited 20 minutes for the car. This was a mid week stay and the traffic was slower than a weekend. The wait was quite frustrating but to make matters worse, 2 of the employees decided to stand in front of the exit lane to chat while I am trying to leave. They kept talking and it took me another 5 minutes to exit after I had already gotten my car. I actually had to honk my horn to get their attention. They didn't move much at all even after I honked the horn. I find this to be ignorant and I have had enough of this high priced low service hotel.The hotel is modern and updated on the inside.  We had an interior room right off the elevator and I never heard it.  The bathrooms are very small, it was awkward to get in and out of the shower.  The room had a safe and a fridge.  Our room had a sleep number bed which if we stay here again I will make sure to request to not have that type of bed.  It's was awkward and kept deflating.  The pool was easily to get to but chilly.  Good location!  We could walk to Gaylord Opryland which was way better than spending over $20 to park,  and numerous breakfast choices around.  Overall, I would stay here again with a few minors requests.  Oh and they have an awesome BBQ restaurant attached to the hotel.This place is a dump.  The room smells, the toilet isn't mounted down all the way, the carpet is torn, and the outside is ugly!I brought 11 girlfriends with me to Nashville for my bachelorette party and we stayed at this hotel. It exceeded my expectations I had read some negative reviews before we went about noise and other things but we were very impressed with our stay. The front desk was very accommodating in making sure that our four rooms were all very close together and were even able to get us two adjoining rooms which was very helpful for the party. We had a great discount for a teacher appreciation deal that I found online. The front desk was very helpful in getting us cabs to go to Broadway. We determined with the 12 of us that it was cheaper to do cabs instead of the shuttle for the weekend. Really enjoyed our stay! Only downside was one of the beds was broken and tilted, my friends found that if they slept in it with her head at the bottom of the bed it was a little more comfortable. Great location for a couple of bars and restaurants and super easy to get a cab to all the fun in Nashville.We were very pleased with the accommodations. Room was very clean and yes the bathroom was tiny but it served it's purpose....LOL We will definitely still there again. We had an interior room next to the elevator and didn't hear a sound. No way I'd get an outside room but that's just for safety reasons no matter where we stay!!Disappointing is the only word that comes to mind about this hotel. For the price and how "lavish" it tries to sell itself to be, this place falls into my top 5 least favorite hotels. Here's why:- Do you like to sleep while staying at a hotel? Well, there's none of that happening here! This place is the best if you want to pay an outlandish amount to stir uncomfortably all night to the sounds of traffic and all the drunk people hanging and yelling out on the railings. They also have these Sleep Number beds, which I had never used before coming here. Turns out, they're completely awful air beds and are very, very small. My parter and I got a room with supposedly two queen beds, but they definitely were more to the tune if just full-sized beds. Each time my 6'4" partner would bend his leg slightly, I would be almost pushed off the bed because it was so small. And because Sleep Number beds are just glorified air mattresses, I would pop up into the air any time my partner would move in bed and the way the bed is inflated makes it feel like you are perpetually going to roll off the edge of the bed. Seriously, these are the worst beds I have ever experienced in a hotel.- Do you like to connect all of your personal devices to insecure wi-fi networks? This is one thing the OpryTM Inn does very well! No password or anything on their wi-fi, so it's wide open to any devious individual who would like to compromise your information while you're connected to this insecure network. Let's hope you have some money left after booking the room, because you may want to pay for a VPN service to securely use this hotel's wi-fi. Oh, and as an added bonus the insecure wi-fi is also very, very slow. Don't except to do any type of work here. - They have flat TVs with cable except the cable package consists of the worst list of channels I've ever seen. Usually when you're stuck in a bad hotel, you can at least salvage part of the stay by enjoying the privilege of watching cable TV, but again, not here. You have every channel under the sun that features pseudo-reality TV shows like Iceroad Looters, Pig Paradise, Wedding Wrestlers, Man vs Boar, Hell's Pawn, and all that junk. They also pull that awful trick where they lock down the back of the TV so you can't plug in a laptop to watch Netflix or play video games - though not like you could use the slow, insecure wi-fi for Netflix anyway. - Do you like continental breakfast? Well screw you, because the Inn doesn't do that here. Enjoy your walk to the Shoney's in the parking lot.- Forgot your toothbrush? Drive to a store! I forgot my toothbrush and even the toothbrush they gave me at the front desk was more than disappointing. If you would have asked me before today what my least favorite toothbrush was, I could not have answered that question. I swear I've had plastic cutlery that was more sturdy than this toothbrush and when I started brushing with it, it literally fell apart in my mouth! I had to pull toothpaste covered bristles out from between my teeth. Sadly I also had forgotten floss. - Bathrooms were not built for the claustrophobic, handicapped, or tall in mind. Good luck closing that bathroom door while on the toilet and let's hope you're not over 6' or else that shower may be hard for you to fit into. - They have a couple areas where you can get water and snacks, but it's super overpriced. A bottle of water costs about $3 and you also don't get a refrigerator in your room so don't plan on saving any food or drinks for later. If you have medications that need cooled, I would highly recommend requesting a room with a fridge or bringing a cooler. - I understand the Grand Ole OpryTM is here, but does everything within this mile radius need to be called opryTM? It almost makes you think they're using the word opryTM like an unregistered trademark so that they can make more money on opryTM merchandise. After this visit, if I never see or hear the word opryTM again I will be a happy soul.UPDATE: The hotel made an error on the bill, but didn't correct it until after we had checked-out, paid, got a receipt, and left. Days later my partner sees a charge on his card for the difference they forgot to charge up previously.I was very impressed with this hotel. It was closest to the attractions and less expensive than others I looked at. Staff was great, room was clean and comfortable. Hotel restaurant was great! Only negative was the very small bathroom.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be on the edge of everything.This app is retarded. I made a mistake. Why can't I delete this review easily? This is not were I stayed. Stop trying to undo my edit!!!!!! Give me a break already. I did not stay at this place. Is that long enough for you? Please delete this review.Driving up to the hotel, I was a bit discouraged from looking outside. The building looked old and blah. But I took the benefit of the doubt, considering it was in a great location. Let me tell you, do not make the same first impression as I did. This place was so clean and beautiful inside! The atrium in the middle was a great sight to see. The pool was also located there, which was also nice. The rooms are clean and spacious, free wifi throughout the hotel, and their hotel bar has live entertainment if you want a taste of Nashville music. Will definitely stay there again as a cheaper alternative to Gaylord.Had an outside facing room which meant that I heard every motorcycle, truck, electric vehicle and raccoon rummaging through trash. Way way overpriced.not to be confused with the Opryland Hotel, and we knew this going in, however, it is now a Marriott property and to our surprise, not up to Marriott standards.  Bed was fair, room and bathroom dated.  For the price, I'd stay somewhere else next time.  Mornings, aside from the lousy one cup coffee maker whatever it is with something called powered cream I ventured to the lobby expecting courteous coffee with real cream and to my surprise they did offer coffee, in a machine to the tune of 3 bucks....Come on Marriott you could at lease provide complimentary coffee to your guest for the rates you charge.  I've had much better experiences at Hampton Inn properties all the way around with free hot breakfast.....Where do I start? We had an outside room. The people in the next room "partied" on the walkway until 4:00 am. So much for 9:00 pm quiet time. You hear everything through the doors. The next night was the same. Called the front desk at 1:00 am and security came and the party finally ended for the evening. The rooms are very small. You have to straddle the toilet to shut the bathroom door. The sleep number beds were broken and very uncomfortable.  No complimentary breakfast. Did like the complimentary shuttle to the mall and Opryland Hotel.The positives are that its a revamped older hotel. It is next door to popular chain restaurants, and across the street from the Gaylord Opryland Resort & Convention Center. The front desk staff was nice and you could expect a warm "hello" from employees throughout the hotel. Now the cons. As you walk past the lobby to the rooms you'll notice the smell of chlorine from the pool located past the lobby and hallway. I had an exterior room which unfortunately was next to the hotels air conditioning units. The noise it made was very loud. Fortunately I spent most of my time away and really only minimal time in the room for sleep, etc. I also can sleep through anything. For those of you that need perfect silence good luck. When I got to my room after checking in I found the tub 1/3 of the way full.Tip- Try booking your stay at the Gaylord Opryland Resort instead.I stayed two nights for business trip. I was happy with the location and shuttle to the Gaylord Convention Center where my meeting was held. The hotel room was clean and well organized. The only and important con to me was that they might use some kind of odor remover in the room which made very bad smell to me. It caused a head ache on the second night.Avoid this place at all costs. It's basically a motel. Right on the highway. And the room smells dank. The phone doesn't work. The alarm clock keeps going off. Horrid.This place served it's purpose... But for the price- it should've had a refrigerator & a microwave at least... & a room safe...???  I can't remember when I've stayed in a hotel room that didn't have a fridge last, & that includes a HoJo... Pretty bad... Beds were comfy tho. This place looks like a 1950s hotel that's been remodeled. All doors on balcony, either inner or outer, pretty sure the inner courtyard used to be open-now enclosed with pool. Who wants to swim in a pool in the cold AC??? Very nice decor, but need mini fridge in room- a must have.  Don't scrimp on the essentials!My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights and before arrival I must admit I was scared of the reviews. Some people are very critical of this hotel. We had a wonderful 5 year anniversary here. The staff was pleasant, the restaurant  on site had excellent food, the singing servers were so talented, the shuttle was extremely convenient, and the beds were really comfortable. We even had an outdoor room and I was very nervous of the noise level...I never really heard outside noise. I also felt extremely safe.. Usually I am a little sketched out by rooms that are on the outside but not in this area, I felt extremely safe. I never tried out the pool but the atrium area was very nice and I did get breakfast there one morning which was very good and reasonably priced. The only one bad thing I would say is that it would be nice if the rooms had a fridge, but we made do and filled a cooler with ice. Thank you so much for such a memorable trip! I will definitely be staying here for my next Nashville trip!There was a yellow liquid on the seat of my toilet as I first arrived! I then went to make a cup of coffee and found a very long hair hanging from the shelf above the coffee pot! My door had to be forced shut and my neighbors were very loud! I went to the front desk with my concerns and asked to be moved to another room or even be moved across the street to their parent property and I would pay the difference. The guy at the front desk told me that the only thing available was a "parlor" room, meaning there was no bed just a sleeper sofa. I then called across the street to their parent property to see if they had any rooms. I was told by them that they had no rooms available and they would connect me with Marriot's customer service. After being connected with them I explained my situation to the lady on the phone and she rudely told me that this was a situation for the hotel and she could not help me but she would connect me to the hotel. I was then connected with a manager and she informed me that they had 5 rooms available! So the first person that I spoke to blatently lied to me! We were then transferred to another room. The bed was a sleep number bed which did not work so we had to get maintanence to come and repair the bed and the pillows were very flimsy! The next day as I went to get on the shuttle I asked the driver if he could wait on my wife who was currently walking through the lobby on her way outside. Maybe a 15 second walk. He proceeded to yell at me and told me that she better hurry! He even threatened me by telling me: "Don't look at me like that!"! When we arrived at our stop he opened the door without warning me and wedged me behind the door! During one of my conversations I was asked if we had stayed at a Marriot recently. We have not and now I remember why! Needless to say I will never stay at this hotel and will think twice before ever staying at a Marriot property again. I'm only giving one star because I am required to rate. This property is not worthy of a star!
review_content_40: The worst hotel experience I have ever encountered anywhere! I will give you only the short version of this nightmare. I stayed at this hotel June 2014 which is where our Servpro Convention was held. I had made reservations for a room with a king or 2 queen beds. Upon arrival, after a long flight from the West Coast, I was informed by the reservation clerk that they did not have a regular room for me, but a Parlor Room. A Parlor Room consists of a sofa bed with the worst mattress. I explained this wasn't an option due to a medical problem I have with my spine. I was advised that it is "hotel policy" to overbook by 20% due to "no shows". After speaking with several supervisors though out the night, I had no choice but to sleep on this mattress. Needless to say, I could hardly move the next day. I called a supervisor again at 6AM  and was assured I would have a regular room sometime that day.  At 3PM, I had not heard from the hotel, so I proceeded back to my room. The maid that been in to straighten up for my next night's stay! I knew I could not physically stay in this room another night. I proceeded down to the Lobby and asked to speak to the hotel manager. I spoke to Eric, the manager and within 10 minutes I a regular room assigned to me. Unfortunately, the damage to my back was already done. Due to extreme pain, I could not enjoy the convention let alone the resort itself. Even though I was grateful for Eric's assistance, the rest of my trip was still a disaster. Once I returned home to the West Coast, I had to seek medical attention for my back and have missed a few days of work and am still dealing with the pain. I would not recommend staying at this hotel to anyone. While the grounds are beautiful, the customer service was extremely poor.Great location.  Complimentary shuttle service will take you to/from Gaylord Opryland, Grand Ole Opry, and Opry Mills Mall.  Several restaurant options in walking distance (Opry Backstage and Caney Fork to name a few).  Rooms are clean and the staff is nice and helpful.  It's probably not worth the price on their website, but it's considerably cheaper than other options in that area and if you do a little searching, you may just find a better deal like me!

review_content: Came here for a conference for work.  It was a nice place.  Nice location.  Nice view to the city on the 10th floor.  However, it all depends on what side of the building you're at.  I was able to see downtown.  The hotel reminded me of NYC rough city edge, but gave that Frisco feel to it.  There was a nice river where I ran in the mornings.I enjoyed my stay.  Clean.Rating:Price:  3 (Expensive, but every hotel in Nashville is expensive.)Cleaniness:  4Ambience:  4Service:  4Overall:  4Loved it here.Let me start off by saying nice property, friendly staff and well within walking distance to broadway and almost everything you'd like to see in the surrounding area of downtown Nashville. However, when it comes to this hotel you pay for location. PERIOD. The bathroom was modern and updated. That's great until it comes time to shower or use the sink. Then you have a flood in your bathroom. The shower leaked uncontrollably during a shower. Had to layer the floor w multiple towels only for them to get completely drenched. Sink had to be turned off while brushing teeth otherwise the same thing would happen. Water everywhere! If you're going to charge higher prices like the other downtown hotels maybe don't cut corners when it comes to renovations and updating. Housekeeping was very friendly and polite however dreadfully slow. We would leave at 7am and by 3pm the room still wouldn't be turned over and I would just change out my used soaking wet towels at the door w one of the housekeepers. In the end this hotel is just OK. When I stay at a super expensive downtown boutique hotel, I have higher expectations. I've stayed at the Clarion across the river and I'd go back there before staying at this hotel again. I was just trying to impress my mom since we were celebrating her 70th birthday for the weekend. Loved our trip not our hotel.I love this hotel. I stayed here for a night with some friends who were visiting Nashville. It reminds me of a hotel that should be in NYC - so modern, beautiful, and elegant! Our room was very clean, beds were cozy (we didn't want to get out of them), and the room was so pretty. It's located downtown so you are pretty much in walking distance to everything that you want/need. The staff was great - helpful if we had any questions/needs. Definitely one of my favorite hotels in Nashville!My friends and I stayed here for a bachelorette weekend. As soon as we walked in, we were taken aback by everyone's politeness, the colorful and modern decor, and live music performances. We had 2 rooms for 2 nights - the rooms were spacious, had comfortable beds, and nice bathrooms. Every time we called concierge with a question or request, the hotel staff was courteous and offered prompt help. Also, after my trip, Calvin was very pleasant to work with while resolving some queries. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a luxury getaway, in the heart of the downtown area!I was back at this hotel again in May, 2015.  Had another good experience.  Good value for the experience and I've stayed at a lot of Nashville hotels.  Rooms are well-appointed, mattresses allow a good nights sleep.  Good location.  Staff are not as well trained as you would find in an upscale hotel but they are well-meaning and helpful.  Ate breakfast--steel cut oatmeal--it was fine.  Bathrooms are modern; the hotel is clean.IHG has really stepped  up their game with the Indigo chain.  Interestingly, right after buying Kimpton Hotels, IHG made another splash with Indigo, and the two are pretty similar.  This is probably the best example of a luxury-boutique style hotel in the Kimpton framework that I've seen yet.  Staff was very friendly and helpful, rooms were large and spacious with great wi-fi access and workspaces, and the location is top-notch for getting anywhere in the greater Nashville area.  When I come back to Nashville, this will be my first choice for lodging from now on.First and foremost the Property is nice and located downtown right next to the outside concert events (its a little park - I forget what its called)Check-in was efficient - I was greeted a s a Platinum member, and received bonus points. The room was nice - comfy beds, and very clean room. The shower was cool one of the open concept showers with great water pressure. Nice restaurant and bar on-site. They had a free outdoor concert when I stayed here and I had a great time at the park across the street. Now the reason for 3 stars... Getting there was a bitch! The road the hotel was on was closed due to the events downtown. The traffic was a bitch as well. There was no way to get to the hotel. I called them and told them where I was at and asked if they could have valet just come get my car on the corner because I have been driving around the block and sitting in traffic for 90 minutes.. They couldn't they said tell the police officers who are blocking the street that you are staying here. I did and they said I couldn't go there.  So finally after 2 hours someone met me on the corner and moved the roadblock and let me in.. Staff was caring in the situation but they could have done this 90 minutes prior to avoid the stress and frustration. There resolution... 2 free drinks at the bar... Ummmmm ok.. better than nothing I guess.Nice older building and very nice upscale hotel in walking distance to everything downtown.Under $160 a nightParking was hard to find. We had to walk up a alley that smelled of old beer and piss. The lobby had that smell floating in. The lobby looks nice, hope the hotel room is better.Overall a nice hotel, but if you're going to charge 4-5 star rates, you need to get the details right. The location is great - walking distance to everything, but in a quiet area so you can sleep at night. Staff was polite and friendly. Rooms and bathrooms were clean. There was a nice wardrobe with hangers and drawers. However...There was no robe or slippers. The floor was uncarpeted, so slippers should have been provided. (Actually, maybe they did have robes & slippers, but because nobody from Housekeeping returned my call requesting some, I assume they just didn't have any.)There was no safe. The clock had not been set. The toiletries were nice, but small. As a solo traveler, it was fine for me. But two people could not have showered and washed their hair, etc with the small bottles provided.I could have paid a lot less and stayed across the street at the Doubletree (where my friend stayed) and been just as comfortable. (Yelp shows the Indigo as $$, when I think it's more like $$$.)The noise of the heating fan in the room is CRAZY LOUD!! Not a monotone humming but a VERY LOUD FAN turning itself on to distribute the heat every 20 min, ALL NIGHT LONG. Not even ear plugs do the trick. It's a hotel, i.e. rent a room to sleep in - GOOD LUCK!SURLY, BRUSQUE BEARDED BARTENDERAn artist friend of mine invited me and friends to his art exhibition in the lobby lounge as part of the hotel's weekly Wednesday evening art events. A different artist is featured each week and the lobby bar offers a $7 special that includes a glass of your selection of house wine and a lovely three-cheese plate with red grapes and pita points. I and two friends sat at the bar, and I ordered the $7 special from the bearded bartender. I waited for my cheeses for what seemed like too long considering the smallish crowd and that another bartender was separately servicing the lobby lounge. The bearded bartender returned from somewhere empty-handed, so I inquired on the status of my cheeses and he curtly answered with a brusk "I'm getting it right now". Soon after, one of my friends at the bar ordered his second glass of pinot grigio, and I asked the bearded bartender if my friend was going to get cheeses, as he mysteriously didn't get cheeses with the first glass. The bearded bartender again curtly gave me a brusk "He didn't ask for it and would have to pay extra." Confounded, I didn't inquire further as my friend said he wasn't hungry. However, I'm standing on principle here and now. After we left the hotel and were discussing the art event over dinner, another friend volunteered that the bearded bartender was "cold." Although I will likely return for the hotel's Wednesday evening art events because they've got a suave vibe with great live entertainment and the $7 wine and cheese offering, I remain confounded by the surly service several of us received from the bearded bartender. I just didn't imagine it possible from Hotel Indigo. Everything else about the event and staff was great.Not a bad joint.  In fact, had I not stayed at the Sheraton Downtown prior to staying here, might give it more props... All very nice staff... They originally wrote the wrong room on the key card slip which caused a little confusion.., especially since we were able to get housekeeping to let us into what ended up being the wrong room.The rooms themselves... Some weird attempt at making cool contemporary space.  The use of stark white walls, expresso colored laminate floors (no carpet), red & brown window treatments & dark graphics consuming one wall are simply uninviting.  Not that most want to hang out in there rooms but I'd expect a $300+ per night room to be geared toward making you feel comfortable & relaxed.Housekeeping staff running around knocking on doors & banging carts on the adjoining walls at 8:55AM was a great way to wake up... Again, something expected at a Motel 6 but not a $300+ room.  This is a party city so one might expect people sleep late & forget to put the D.N.D sign out.All in all; and I know you might not gather this at all by my review; the place is fine... But when I stay at an expensive boutique hotel I have higher expectations... If this was a 90-150 a night Hampton Inn; they'd get a much higher rating & I probably wouldn't mention all the dislikes.Would I stay here again??? Sure.Would this be my first choice??? NoI am a huge fan of this hotel and was incredibly surprised to discover that it is part of a chain, it feels like a locally owned hotel. The staff was incredibly friendly and the receptionist checked us in a little early since our room was ready when we arrived just past noon. She then chatted with us about some of the local hot-spots that were nearby. Being from Austin, we are always happy to hear live music, so we were happy to know that there were plenty of venues nearby. We tend to steer clear of the big tourist attractions when we go on vacation and like to explore some fun local hang outs. Hotel Indigo was a great middle of the city location and we were able to Uber it around easily as well as walk to a few spots. Downstairs has a large seating area and bar. You can also order food (they have a  very tasty Veggie Burger). The bartenders are so nice and were quick to bring food and drinks. Both nights of our stay they hosted a local singer/songwriter, so we were able to also enjoy some live music right at the hotel! I am now a big fan of the Indigo hotel chain and will definitely be staying with them in the future!Beautiful hotel located perfectly, just a few blocks off of the main strip. Friendly staff, free wifi, well maintained building, with secure elevators so people can't just wander throughout the building without a room key. There is live music in the hotel every night night, which makes it feel festive and lively without being too much. Parking garage, conveniently attached to the hotel is way cheaper than the valet (and really easy!)Today is obviously the 7th of Jan 2015; I have yet to receive my refund from Hotel Indigo for charges they billed me, by their admission, incorrectly. I have contacted the corporate offices and was told someone from the hotel would be following up with me within 24hrs; I've done this 3x now. I also contacted the Better Business Bureau; who has attempted to reach the business manager on 2 separate occasions; they also have not been followed up with. It's pathetic to think that legal action is my last option, seriously pathetic. If you value your time and money, stay somewhere else this place is no where near the worth time & stress spent in trying to get ANYTHING handled.Had dinner here. Mediocre at best, not cheap. Had to flag down bar tender several times to get refills on expensive cocktails. Best of all though was walking back inside after taking a stroll around the block after dinner. We wanted to use the restroom, but we were stopped rather rudely by the manager who told us the restrooms were only for guests. Had the same issues of rudeness with the valet who asked us repeatedly about what we were doing there. Apparently, manners and being friendly starts at the top and rolls down to the workers. Here's a hint - The Omni is less money, better style, and greets everyone with a smile. A SMILE ! Remember that. You never know who is walking in to your business. It could be someone who travels the world and doesn't care for 3d rate manners under the pricing structure of 1st rate service. Won't be back. Spend you money at Omni. They know how to smile.I live in town - but if I stay downtown, I stay at the Hotel Indigo. It's my favorite hotel. First of all, their food is absolutely fantastic. I've never had a bad meal there. Second, the staff is SO FRIENDLY. They go above and beyond to help you out, they have great recommendations on what to do around town, and are just absolutely a joy to work with. They also have live music in the lobby (which is so cool btw) and it's always great. I can't say enough great things about this hotel. Stay here - you won't regret it!My husband and I were quite disappointed with this hotel.  Staff was friendly and the hotel was in a good location, but it was nothing special.  The room needed a deep cleaning and the decor was very boring (compared to other boutique hotels).  I expected it to be more like a Kimpton.  The rooms definitely made it feel like it was an old hotel that they had done a few updates to.  Friends staying in nearby hotels had nicer rooms, better amenities and were still within walking distance of Broadway and all the areas that could be walked to.  It was our first and last time at an Indigo hotel.When I booked this hotel, I was under the impression that it was still at the West End location. It took several blinks to realize that things had changed and that HI had moved Downtown. I never went in the old location (I usually stayed across the street) but I think the new digs look good on HI.I am a member of the parent company/group, so points/fast check-in/wifi/etc. was all part of the plan. With the exception of the gentleman working the desk on an early Sunday morning (around 3:30/4), everyone in the front desk group was very helpful, chatty and courteous. I especially had good interactions with Dante, Holly & Brian. The design/decor of the hotel is pretty cool. It's an old bank and the details give a lot of credence to that history. It's charming and adds a nice touch to the hotel experience. The cleaning staff (again, for the most part) went above and beyond to be helpful and make my stay enjoyable. Depending on what time of day it was, look to the lobby for treats. I enjoyed everything from muffins to cookies to infused water to pink lemonade. It's little touches like that which help elevate the hotel stay in to one a traveler wishes to replicates. Additionally, HI is a live music venue and I was stunned to hear the level of talent coming out of a hotel bar. Typically, I thought, I'd have to go to a club to hear such high level of musicianship. It was a good reminder that Nashville is a crazy talented city full of people who deserve big breaks.*As far as the rooms go, that's where I have to ding the hotel a bit. I was, originally, placed on the top floor -- and I appreciated it. Two queen beds, open shower in the bath, large cherry armoire, floating desk, high ceilings, and no real view to speak of. All was well but I was right next to a conference room. The thin walls and screeching people next door made my first night/day pretty unenjoyable. I was moved to a lower floor the following day (and given two comp meals for my troubles). Again, two queens, larger desk, an overstuffed chair, a more complete bathroom, and a slightly better view. Neither room had robes or slippers and, by the end of my stay, I discovered I was surrounded by woo-hoo sorority girls. Yes, that means drunken woo-hoos through thin walls at 2:30 in the morning. Not fun. Not the hotel's fault but just make a note of the thin walls.The Downtown location is much better for tourists than the old West End location. You're close enough to the madness to partake but far away that you're not in the thick of it. HI has a lot going for it and I'd happily stay here again.*Yet the listening public is subjected to being all about that bass, no treble. #epic #notepicStayed here overnight this past weekend. Everything was clean and in good order for our stay. Staff was nice and helpful. Close walking distance to the stadium. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.
review_content_20: I preface my three stars with this - I really did enjoy this hotel, and I would come back again, but there were some things that stood out a took away from a 4 star rating.Let's begin with the positives:1. The decor/Character.  It's awesome - fresh, youthful yet historic, lively, and inviting.  From the main foyer to the room itself.  I liked it - down to the Rochester, NY connection on the old-school mail chutes!2.  Bar/Grill/Live music are a plus. Just walk downstairs and you get to experience Nashville in your own hotel.3.  Staff - AWESOME.  The gentlemen at the front desk were easy on the eyes, attentive, and informative.   The cleaning lady saw us checking out and asked us how things were and if we were satisfied. 4.  Cleanliness - no problems.5.  Location - right downtown! YES!6.  Price - of all the places downtown this was the best deal.7.  Wifi - Free!  Speed and strength were excellent.8. Security - Nifty feature on the elevator allows only people with a room key to access their floor.  I felt safe the entire stay.Ok, now for the needs improvement.I must say that we were placed in a handicap accessible room as all other two-bed rooms were sold out.  I don't know how this compares to what's available in other rooms.1.  Room amenities - LIMITED.  No fridge.  No microwave.  Poor in-room coffee selection for the Keurig.  No real place to set your luggage.  2.  Bathroom - (Bear with me there's a lot to say here)The accessible shower was weird.  Two shower-heads, no shower curtain.  Even if the bathroom door is closed and locked, I WANT A SHOWER CURTAIN.  I reassures me that I have some sense of privacy.  The shower design also led to pooling on the main floor.  The drain dripped and dripped for what seemed like forever afterwards.Towels - they were skinny and weak.Counter space - none.  Women have counter-top needs!Towel bars/hooks - limited.  No place to hang clothes and towels at the same time.  3.  The View - not bad if you enjoying looking at a brick wall.4.  Room size - I can tell that this was a building that had been converted, but the room was small.  There wasn't a lot of space around the beds - just space near the door/entry way.  I suppose this works well for those in a wheelchair, but even for them, I would imagine this room would be a bit cramped.5.  Price - even if this price was the best around town, I feel like we should STILL get more for the price.6.  Parking is in a connected ramp.  Spots can be a tight squeeze, and a little bit pricey.  Better than valet parking, but still a bit of a hassle.  And was there an elevator?  I don't seem to remember one.  Try lugging your over-packed bag down those stairs.I would stay here again, but I would like to see a room with a king bed - something larger.  I'd also like to actually eat in their restaurant, try out their fitness center, and spend more time in the city of Nashville in general.  I'll give it a three stars - but it would probably rank as more of a 3.5, but on not feeling overly generous mainly because of the price.Great place to stay close to downtown. All the staff were really friendly and the restaurant in the hotel was amazing.This is a fabulous hotel.  It's located downtown and an easy walk to Broadway, the Ryman, and great restaurants.  The staff was great.  Special mention for Andrea at the front desk who never steered us wrong when we ask what to see(Hot Chicken Festival was great).  Also Katie, bartender, in the restaurant was exceptional.  She never failed with her friendly demeanor even when slammed.  We decided not to have our room serviced by housekeeping and was pleasantly surprised by a basket of towels and toiletries outside our door.  We were able to see the 4th of July fireworks from our room window since it was downpouring at the time.  We can't wait to come back and visit.This place is a hidden jewel.  So surprised how they treat you from the front desk , dinning, housekeeping. I will return.Very laid back perfect lil place tucked away n downtown Nashville. Had the car valeted and everything you need within walking distance. Went to watch the Titans play at LP field, perfect walking distance from hotel. Relaxing atmosphere. Had room service for breakfast (Music City Breakfast and French Toast) was good. Will visit againHotel Indigo is a gem in the heart of downtown Nashville. I've stayed here multiple times on business and personal trips and have always been made to feel right at home. The valet staff is knowledgeable and friendly, and more than happy to provide directions or suggestions for fun things to do. I'm always greeted with a smile when I walk into the lobby, and it's obvious that the staff truly wants me to enjoy my time at their hotel. On my most recent visit, my housekeeper Nancy was super-friendly and let me know that if there was anything I needed, she'd be happy to help. The hotel is within walking distance of all of Broadway -- Country Music HOF, Bridgestone Arena, Robert's and all the amazing honky tonks. If you're looking for a comfortable stay and good old fashioned hospitality, I recommend Hotel Indigo very highly.I just got back from my stay in Nashville and I really liked this hotel. I found the price to be great for what you got. The building is fabulous, converted old factory and lots of character. I read some reviewers who said their rooms were small. Our room was actually really spacious, as was the bathroom. I guess being a converted building the rooms tend to differ greatly in size so maybe check before you book. The location is really close to the main drag and we were able to walk everywhere, however, it can be a bit desolate at night  so be aware of that. The staff was great, very friendly and they gave us great restaurant recommendations. And we were able to check in early. All in all for the price I was really happy with this place!A beautiful facility and great location is the platform for, what could be, one of Nashville's top value hotel properties - Hotel Indigo. If only....The room was great; comfortable bed, nice bathroom, etc.  However, the customer service needs some polish. The morning of my big meeting which brought me to Nashville, I attempt to take a shower.  No shampoo, just two conditioners.  I called the housekeeping:  "Yes Sir Mr. M., we will bring it right up!".  20 minutes later: "Oh, are you the guy that needed shampoo? Sorry but they cannot locate any in the hotel.  Must have not received our shipment."  WTF!!!  An IHG hotel in the heart of Nashville does not have one freaking bottle of shampoo for a guest to use??  Then you cannot even call the guest back to tell him (I had to phone them again)?  Check-in was another ordeal.  It was as long as waiting at a car rental counter trying to find a mid-size vehicle other than the purple one with white top and 17" mag-rims. Hotel Indigo has work to do if they ever expect to be a 4 or 5 star rated hotel.  IHG social media team:  Are you listening?Love the Indigo! My nr 1 hotel in style , service and location.!! i stayed there during my first trip to Nashville and got impressed about the nice room, excellent bed and live music in the hotel lobby at night... awsome!!Love love this hotel. The staff is awesome. So accommodating and sweet. Very helpful. The rooms are nice. Updated and modern. My only complaint is that they don't seem to deep clean the bathrooms. Edges of the shower are kind of gross and just all the books and crannies (floors, walls, etc) could use a good wipe down. Overall the room was clean though. The thermostat in the room is ridiculous. Makes no sense. I am an intelligent woman with graduate degrees and couldn't figure it out without an engineer coming to the room. He said that every day he visits rooms to show people how to use it. And apparently ours was set incorrectly so he had to remove the frame from the wall and mess with it. Not a huge deal but irritating!The hotel is beautiful. I loved the lobby and restaurant areas. I could spend a few relaxing hours there easily. The food is really lovely as well and well priced. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. The staff is great, the location is perfect - a great trip to Nashville!Hubby and I spend a weekend each December in downtown Nashville.  It gives us the opportunity to become reacquainted with our city and explore some of the nooks and crannies that you only get by strolling around on foot.  Where we stay depends upon where we have points and what is available.  This year's locale was the Hotel Indigo on Union.We had stayed at the Hotel Indigo on West End (before it became an Aloft I believe) and we stayed at this Union Street location last year too.  Last year the hotel was going through a major renovation.  There was scaffolding on the outside and lots of work going on in the lobby.  This year, with renovations complete, the look is fresh, sleek and modern.  On the opposite spectrum, since this is an older building, the elevators are small and creaky.  Let's just say about four people with very little luggage can fit on one at any given time.The entirety of the staff was warm, welcoming and very accommodating.  We were greeted and well received by all.  Our needs were met with courtesy and professionalism.Since my husband has so many points with the parent company of this hotel, we were given a corner suite.  Again, the room was modern and was appointed in a very contemporary, stream-lined fashion.  The hardship with such is that there were not any drawers for us to unpack.  So we quite literally lived out of our suitcases.  My only other qualm was that there was not a fan in the bathroom.  After we each showered, it was a hot mess in there and was as humid as a July afternoon.  Both those issues aside, everything else was quite agreeable.I cannot tell you anything about the bar or food services here as we did all our dining and drinking elsewhere.  I can also tell you it is a very short walk to Printer's Alley and many other amenities in the lovely downtown district of Music City.**WARNING**  This hotel is under complete renovation.  There is no lobby, bar or restaurant.  There is a temporary check-in desk w/ a 15 foot wide path to the elevators.  This is essentially a flop house until it is completed.  Of course you won't find that disclosure anywhere.Service is awful - waited for the valet.  Unpacked my own car and drug my own luggage cart to the desk.  No one offered to take my bags up to my room for me - just pointed me to the elevator.  These are one of those experiences where the 'Indigo' brand name will be off my list most likely forever.The Hotel Indigo was absolutely perfect for my needs. Close enough to the convention center and even closer to the awesome Nashville night life - I am definitely a fan. Very modern decor, super friendly staff. Great bar on site and room service (try the shrimp and crab dip - you'll like it!) Free Wi-Fi, huge TV. Awesome toiletries and HUGE bathroom. K-cup coffee maker in room and Starbucks downstairs.
