Nice and functional business center. Couldn't ask for more - it was a great experience staying here.My ONLY suggestion - set the alarm on your clock and/or cell phone - I requested 2 wake up calls (and unless there was something wrong with the phone in my room) I never received them! Luckily I was up anyway... Still would for sure stay here again if I'm in the area.We stayed in the Hotel Indigo this past weekend for my wife and I's 15 year wedding anniversary.  We wanted to experience a bit of the nightlife downtown had to offer.  The hotel was good for that, being adjacent to the capital complex and just a very short cab ride down to all of the hustle and bustle on Broadway.  Valet parking was expensive at $28, but very quick and convenient.  We arrived about 20 minutes before check in time into a modern lobby with restaurant and bar.  Our room was not ready so we went for a drink at the bar.  We were pleased to find a full bar with several local bears on tap.  We had just raised our drinks when the manager came over just a couple minutes later saying they had a room for us and we were upgraded.  We were allowed to take our drinks with us so we headed up the brass elevator.  The room was small but nicely decorated.  I am not sure what the upgrade was, maybe since it was a corner room with two windows it was considered an upgrade?  No matter we were well treated and happy to have the room a few minutes early.  The bedding was nice.  An oversized flat screen TV was there for the viewing.  The hotel should score 4 stars.  The reason I gave it only three was because of some cleaning issues in the room.  One of the pillows had fuzz and hairs all over it where it was dropped on the floor by housekeeping when they made the bed.  There was one pubic and two long hairs that were plainly visible in the all white walk in shower, and the caulk joints were moldy.  We also found an alligator hair clip was on the tray left waiting for us on the bed with two hospitality waters and ice bucket.  If we had a cleaner room, it would get a four star review.  It was otherwise a nice place to stay.Love this hotel. Comfy room and bed. Great design. I would definitely stay here again. Front desk staff are very helpful and super friendly. Thanks for a great stay!!!I reserved a room for my parents on December 26th. I paid for the room along with valet parking. My parents arrived, valet parked their car, and checked into the hotel. During the course of the evening, their car was severely damaged while parked. The valet company is refusing to take responsibility and pay for the damages.BUYER BEWARE!!!  Yelp says Businesses can't take down reviews..but mine was taken down.  I'm posting again and we'll see how long it will stay.   I booked a room on 6-19-15 and due to a family member being diagnosed with a serious illness I had to cancel the next day.   I booked what they call 'Book early & Save'  Apparently in the VERY small print if you cancel they keep THE ENTIRE booking charge and will not refund a penny of it!!  I called on the 20th (the date I cancelled) and the woman I spoke to said she could refund all but one night but it would take 5-10 days to show up on my card.  After 12 days there was no refund.  I called the hotel and they are saying they will not refund the amount which was $1500!!!  A $1500 CANCELLATION FEE is the most outrageous thing I've ever experienced.  The most restrictive fee I've seen is cancelling within 72 hours NOT 19 days prior notice.  This is criminal. I ran an additional reservation for August for the same dates and the difference in rate for this criminal non-cancelable rate and a 'FREE cancelable rate if you cancel the day before arrival is $25.20.  I would be more than happy and find it fair..to pay the difference for each day.  But they say no..they are keep my $1500.   And I don't see how the hotel benefits from such a policy.  I will NEVER go there and will continue to write about this in every social media site I can find.  Oh...I'm also in their rewards program.  So I won't be staying at this chain ever again which includes Holiday Inn, Intercontinental, Hotel Indigo, Staybridge, Candlewood & Crowne Plaza.Now the end of Nov and I've contacted corp 3x with a promise that the hotel would be following up with me, have my case with the Better Business Bureau filed and I hope to get my money refunded. If not I feel small claims court is my only option.Recently stayed here - hotel said we had queen beds but they were full beds. Wonderful cookies in the lobby - trying them is a must! Valet is helpful -(Trace) was kind. Walking to Broadway is easy.walking distance from all the downtown bars, very clean, accommodating staff and a great lobby bar with live music!
review_content_40: Cheap for a reason! They're located next to a jail bond place? And the people who work here are incredibly rude. The "manager" told us we were delusional when we told them the room looked bigger on the website, etc and they couldn't bring us a cot even though the website had promised us that. The area is horrible with homeless walking around everywhere... Just don't stay here. Pick somewhere closet to Downtown.Pluses:1. Location- short walk to Broadway and even shorter to Printer's Row.2. Staff- everyone we encountered was just plain NICE! 3. Decor- room and lobby were great...bring flip flops, the floors are original stone which looks cool, but I just prefer carpet when I get out of bed. 4. Live music- came home on Friday night to some really mellow singer/songwriter music after being in a smokey/crazy bar on printers row. It was the perfect way to end the night.Minuses-1. Bathroom noises ECHO throughout the room so beware...you might want to run the water while you're working in the bathroom. Also, the drain in the shower drips for a LONG time after you're out. 2. Squeaky bed/felt the springs...I didn't notice the noise too much while in bed, but just enough to mention it. Overall great experience and would come back to Hotel Indigo.My girlfriend Julie & I stayed here from July 3-5. Overall the hotel was beautiful and we really liked our room. The service was exceptional and we never had to wait very long to get our car that we valeted. At night they have singer songwriters who play in the bar area. While enjoying this great free music be sure to sit at one of the tables at the back of the room and check under the recharging ports that are hidden beneath the "covers" on the table.When we go back to Nashville we will stay at this hotel again. It comes very highly recommended.Get the hot chicken appetizer. You will die. Happy. Decent music on Friday night.I liked my stay here and it was updated. I didn't think it was anything special but the bar area in the lobby was I thought the best part with comfortable seating with a few different up coming country artist that performed each night.The elevators were a bit of a pain. You had to press your floor with one hand and scan your room key with your other. The scanner seemed weak and after trying it a few times the elevator finally worked. Can be a hastily with things in your hand trying to operate their security.Overall a good experience.Loved this hotel. Good location. Loved the keureg in the room and the aveda bath products. Easy check in and no hassles during the stay. The rooms have a very trendy, modern, loft feel. The shower in our room was huge. Only thing I would have liked would be a small fridge in the room for our dinner left overs. And despite what other reviews say, there is no starbucks here. All the construction is finished now, also. Would definitely go back.I'll start off by saying that I stay in hotels every week around the country. It's pretty hard to surprise me or make me dissatisfied, as MOST hotels are pretty much the same and have their trade offs. With that said... The room itself is pretty decent. It seems mostly clean (my #1 concern) and the bathroom is spacious. The rooms are cheaper than probably 90% of other hotels downtown.If you're coming to Nashville to party downtown and see music for a few nights, then this hotel might be for you. However, if you are traveling here for work and expect to sleep at all, this is not the hotel for you-- which is the main reason why this hotel gets a crappy score from me. I was in a corner room with 3 windows facing an alley, in what seems like the area right above their music lounge or something. Music was blaring into my room well after midnight. I have never heard so many harmonicas in my life.Aside from that, this hotel fulfilled a few nit picky  peeves: they put a table and chair right next to the end corner of the bed so you can't walk past it without putting the chair somewhere else. There are hardly any outlets in obvious places, so you have to crawl under the furniture and unplug lights.If the Doubletree right down the street or the Sheraton hadn't been completely booked because of the CMAs coming up this week, I would have stayed there instead. If price isn't an issue, I'd recommend going there instead.We were on our way to having a wonderful weekend, however we had items stolen while our bags were at the hotel.  Both my work computer and my friend's iPad were stolen either while our bags were being held by the valet before check in (as we arrived early) or by the housekeeping staff on Saturday.  Unfortunately, another family was filing a police report for stolen items before we filed ours.  There needs to be some serious reflection by the Hotel Indigo staff.  We were incredibly disappointed, as this isn't a hotel where you'd ever expect something like this.  Also, there are no safes in the individual rooms - guests must go to the front desk to leave items in the safe manned by them.  I wouldn't trust this staff with any valuable items.  This is immensely disappointing as the rest of the weekend was wonderful.My wife and I tend to spend long stays when we are on vacation so we get to know the area and see a lot. We just spent 9 nights in Nashville at the Hotel Indigo downtown and it was one of our best vacations ever.The location is great; just outside of the craziness on Broadway but close enough to walk to all the bars, restaurants, shops, the Ryman, Country Music Hall of Fame, etc.The rooms are decent size and clean. Shower and the bathroom were very good. The housekeepers were friendly and always responsive to our needs.The food in the lounge area is surprisingly GREAT! Full dinners, appetizers, breakfast and desserts are the quality of a fine restaurant and a bit of a break from the heavy "comfort" food in most of the local eateries.The live music ranged from good to outstanding, and it was great to have a place to enjoy the local talent without fighting raucous crowds.Best thing: the Indigo staff is the best of any hotel we have stayed at anywhere. Pam, Dante, Ben and the front desk crew were friendly and very helpful (Pam even went upstairs and helped clean our room when we checked in early).The crew in the District Bar and Kitchen (the lounge area) made us feel at home. Specifically, Anastasia and Joe were the epitome of customer service and helped make our vacation special. They are the kind of assets that a great hotel needs to keep people coming back, and we will!I stayed there for a bachelorette weekend and both my iPad and my friends computer were stolen either from my hotel room or the valet and we weren't the only ones! People were lines up to at the front desk complaining! It was a horrible experience!!!!!Stopped to see if they had any rooms available on a whim because this is one of the closest hotels to the Nashville night life. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and courteous which, sadly, you don't seem to find anymore. Room rates are slightly higher than other options but still priced right for the location. The decor is trendy and all the rooms have keurig coffee makers which is a great touch. I even found myself doing valet parking because the valet had such a great attitude and seemed genuinely interested in where we were from and what we were doing in Nashville.  Definitely would recommend this to anyone in for a night or two.This hotel is terrible.  They were still under renovation when I was there and no one on staff knew what was going on - nor did they have any desire to figure it out for you.  The maid service is virtually non-existant.  They would leave cleaning products in my room, they wouldn't change the sheets, trash was left in baskets.  Guests would leave room service plates in the hallways and they'd sit there for DAYS.  The people at the front desk and valet were friendly but they didn't have a clue what was going on, where the business center was in their own hotel, etc.  Also my room card didn't work almost every day.There was one bright spot.  John who is at the counter of the cafe on weekends is probably the most friendly, helpful and wonderful people I've ever met in the service industry.  A+ for him.I had to switch between a couple of hotels when I was in town as rooms were booked solid everywhere. As far as the room goes, this hotel was number 1. I was very impressed. Modern/new feel to it. Excellent service. I worked out at the small gym, which was good enough to get the job done. Location is in the middle of downtown, walking distance to everything.We stayed here after their renovation, and we loved it!  The lobby and restaurant/bar area has a contemporary look and feel, but yet a comfortable appeal to it. They have live music, and the food was excellent!  The room itself was clean with the same contemporary decor as the lobby area.  It also had free wi-fi, a huge mirror on the closet (sorry, probably more important for a female), a Kurig, and perfect sized bathroom.  Overall, this hotel had everything you needed.  Snack area, ATM, full restaurant, bar, office area, and VERY accommodating staff.  The location was also perfect if you're interested in spending time around Broadway.  I had nothing but a very positive experience, and I will stay here again when I'm back in Nashville.This hotel had a modern feel to it. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean.  The location of this hotel is close to a lot. My only scwobble was with the elevator, which was a little scary at times.I stay at a lot of hotels and usually keep it within the Hilton brands but I had to stay here for a work meeting and paid a $189 rate. Getting here is simple with a flat $25 cab rate from airport and it's a good location about half block from Printers Alley, 1 block to Walgreens and maybe 5 blocks to Broadway (touristy, Vegas-feel area of Nashville). The front desk and concierge staff were friendly and great but I got a super sketchy feeling about nearly all housekeeping. To add to that, there was some drama (room entered, money taken) with another guest, which the hotel took accountability for, repaid the person and eliminated that employee. The hotel is nice and clean. (Note: some of the photos here do not represent the current state.) I especially liked that my room in Tower 1 had flooring throughout. The only carpeting was the rug under the bed. My shower was huge and lovely and the beds were nicely plush with some firmness and great linens. The one thing I can say about the room is that it was LOUD between them. I could hear the lady in the room next to me as if she was in my room while she was talking/fighting with her significant other. I turned my a/c on (instead of automatic) to drown out some of that. Mostly, i felt badly for her since I'm a snorer. Internet was free and very good (speed) for hotel but it kept kicking me off so I repeatedly had to re-enter the code. No biggie really.I wanted to send my best friend two bottles of champagne for her bachelorette party because I was unable to attend. The bachelorette party was staying at this hotel, so I called the front desk about ordering champagne and sending a personal note. Both times I talked to women at the front desk who seemed rather annoyed, and the first time I called they had no champagne and the second time they only had one bottle. I was assured multiple times that the bottle cost $40, but after the transaction went through I was charged $60. When I called to complain they transferred me to the head of catering, who I left a message for, and never hear back from. Luckily they did in fact deliver the bottle of champagne and the note I sent, but overall I'm pretty disappointed in the customer service at The Hotel Indigo.Great location. Staff was very nice!  Good bar with great entertainment. Rooms are nice size, clean and quiet.I ck in here on Yelp for the Starbucks coffee.  Guess I can't really comment on the hotel.  I've never stayed her.  However, I would like to ck out their bar one day soon after work or heck maybe even sneak away on my lunch break lol. The Starbucks staff are AWESOME!We recently stayed at Hotel Indigo (downtown) for an extended weekend and reserved 2 rooms since there were 2 couples.  Both rooms were very well appointed with modern and trendy decor that offered a nice break from the typical boring, corporate hotel decor -- perfect for a birthday weekend/celebration. The location is great, just a few blocks and walking distrance to all of the downtown restaurants, bars, honky tonks, museums, the Ryman, etc.  The hotel offers valet parking, for $22/day, but we were lucky enough to find street parking the entire weekend.  Street parking is free after 6pm and all day on Sundays.  There is also a garage nearby but I'm unsure of the price.  Both rooms were clean, bright and cheery with comfy beds and down pillows.  The rooms were also a good size and included a flat screen tv, free wifi, a lounge chair & ottoman and a desk.  The bathrooms were amazing, recently renovated, clean and featured Aveda bath products.  The bathrooms don't have tubs but they do offer a generous sized shower -- I'm not sure if this is the case in all rooms.  It was a scorcher weekend, with temps in the upper 90s and we experienced no issues with the AC.  I'm hot natured and was comfortable, even while blow drying my hair and getting ready.  The water pressure also was fine, we stayed on the 8th floor.We didn't have a lot of interaction with the hotel staff, besides the usual check-in; however, everyone seemed friendly and helpful and the bellman religiously opened the door for us on our way in and out.  In addition, the bartender was extremely nice to fill up our nalgenes with ice and water since the temps outside were brutal -- a nice gesture, especially since Starbucks charged us! The only semi-negative was we attempted to check in a little early, a little after 2pm, but the rooms weren't ready. Not a big deal but it would've been nice.Speaking of, there is a nice and spacious Starbucks adjoining the hotel that has 2 levels.  The upper level features local paintings and artwork.  One downside to Starbucks, while they do offer their typical breakfast breads and muffins, they do not offer the artisan breakfast sandwiches.  If you're staying at Indigo and are looking for a superb brunch that won't break the bank, do yourself a favor and grab a cab and head to the Garden Brunch Cafe, about a mile away.  It is well worth the short drive.Overall our stay was excellent.  No issues and we didn't experience any noise or paper thin walls either. An added bonus, they offer a military discount.  Our room, with tax ended up being $110/night. We will definintely stay here again.
review_content_60: I give this hotel 3 stars but I feel it could be a 4 star once the renovation is complete.  For the positives, the room was very nice and large for such an inexpensive hotel.  The bathroom was also large and chic.  I like the modern decor, art, tv--everything.  And, like I wrote above, the rooms and bathrooms are quite large.The negative is only that the place is doing a revamp so there is no lobby.  Everything other than your bedroom is pretty shabby.  I would definitely give this place a try once it is fixed up.Staff is nice but not wonderful or particularly professional.I never knew it was possible to "catch" insomnia in a hotel room. That, and freeze your tush off each and every shower. For being part of the Indigo chain, this is a major disappointment.I hardly slept here. And it had nothing to do with the street noise. It was just a really hard room to feel comfortable in. Oh, and don't be surprised if your door key fails each day. I had to visit the front desk once a day after realizing my key card failed. Le sigh. The one perk (literally) about this place is being right next door to a Starbucks. And it is a good location if you want to stay near downtown without emptying your bank account at the Hilton.I stayed at the downtown location of the Hotel Indigo on Monday night. I was excited when I checked in to hear live music in the lounge. The girl that checked me in was friendly. I got to my room and I was very happy with the bright colors and the large bed. The bathroom was fantastic. The walk - in shower was fantastic - the hot steamy shower with the Aveda Rosemary and Mint bath amenities made it perfect. I loved the location.The restaurant was good. I had french toast for breakfast which was delicious. I stayed at the Sheraton a couple nights before (downtown Nashville) it was near double the price and not as nice as the Hotel Indigo. I will definitely look for this brand next time I'm in need of a room.They ruined my vacation....I booked three rooms  for four nights under three different last names and got three different confirmation #'s.  Asked that the 3 rooms be near each other and that they each be paid for separately upon arrival....Before I even left New York on Friday....they charged my credit card for the three rooms for the entire four night stay....My credit card was now overdrawn....and I was unable to use it....my personal bill payments were now bouncing....they could not release the funds (my money) to me until Monday.... I spent hours on the phone trying to do damage control with my bank.Ok...mistakes happen....I leave Nashville on Tuesday....try to use my credit card at the airport....it's declined...Hotel Indigo did it again....they charged my credit card for three rooms for four nights....even after being paid by us upon arrival at the hotel.Spent another day cleaning up my credit card mess created by them.  Hotel personal were great except for the invisible manager Mindy ( telephone attitude)....who saw this as know big deal.Called Hotel Indigo/Intercontinental Hotel Customer Care....told me there was nothing they could do it was handled by the invisible manager Mindy.Still trying to get tim to at least pay for all of my bounced payment fees.And just to mention: Hotel has a good location, but that's it. There is a area that is one room which is used as a combination Lobby/Bar/Lounge/Restaurant all disappointing because none of it works and is nothing special....food, nothing special...rooms pretty basic. Walls paper thin you can hear people just having a normal conversation in the room next door.The request for our three rooms to be near each other:   We were on the 8th, 13th and 15th floors.BTW...I got nothing for my credit card trouble or the fees that were incurred...oh yes they told me to call my bank and work it out with them. Gee...why didn't I think of that!I booked this hotel for a bachelorette party, which required me to have multiple rooms for different amounts of days and have girls checking in at different times.  The staff at this hotel were AMAZING.  They handled each of my requests with politeness and friendliness, and made our stay so so easy.  They even put us all on the same floor without us asking!  We were able to check into each room much earlier than the 3 pm check in time which was so fantastic.  The property itself is amazing - very close to Broadway, but far enough away that the foot traffic and noise doesn't bother you at ALL.  Close to a Wells Fargo and a Starbucks.  The property is beautiful - hardwood floors in each room!  And beautifully designed bathrooms with subway tile.  Not to mention the rooms were HUGE.    I just can't say enough nice things about this place.  If I come back to Nashville I will definitely be staying there again.This place is so modern and beautiful on the inside and out! I like to come here for songwriters night whenever I can and sometimes end up staying just for fun. My room was gorgeous and overlooked the court house. The decor in the rooms is fantastic. Also, there is a Starbucks downstairs. Kudos.The hotel looks nice and modern. My room was clean, staff friendly, and internet access was included in the room. I stayed here during a Monday evening and there was a live performance in the hotel lobby. There are live performances in many restaurants and bars throughout Broadway which is the main street with all the activity and is approximately 4 blocks away. The hotel does charge $22 for valet parking service or you can park for free on the street between the hours of 6PM - 8AM. There is a parking garage attached to the hotel, not sure what the rates are. My room rate for a Monday evening was $144 total tax included. The area of improvement for this hotel was the water pressure for the shower. It was not very strong and made the shower time longer because of LACK of WATER PRESSURE.Good location, and the room was perfectly fine.  However, the air was SUPER muggy just about everywhere in the building (including in the room), so staying there wasn't particularly refreshing after a long day of work.  Perhaps the old ventilation/AC system just can't hack it when it is as hot and humid as Nashville gets in the summer.My husband and I decided to stay a night in our own city to celebrate our anniversary.  We usually don't take time to see the sights locally.  We chose the Hotel Indigo for its location, modern decor and we liked the fact it is a renovated older building.  It really was a disappointment.  Upon check in we were "greeted" by a nice, but ambivalent, desk clerk.  We were asked if we used valet parking.  We told him we did not.  He asked me to initial a form stating we parked ourselves, which I did.  We were checked into a wheelchair accessible room, which was fine but not necessary.  The room was very clean and well appointed.  But the shower had no door or curtain.  I thought they certainly designed it so that water would not end up all over the floor.  Wrong!  Despite the fact I tried everything I could to keep water from going everywhere, I still ended up with and inch or more of water ALL over the floor.  I used every clean towel (save for 1 to dry off with) to mop it up.  Not the end of the world, but very very irritating.  After getting ready, I attempted to call the front desk to ask for more towels so my husband could take a shower in the morning.  No answer...after calling several times.  We decided to ask the front desk clerk in person for more towels as we left for the evening.  We went downstairs and I told the same clerk who checked us in about the disaster of a shower.  He nodded as if he'd heard this problem many times before.  He told us he would contact someone to bring more towels up while we were out for the evening.  We went out for several hours and came back to the hotel.  I went into the room and straight to the bathroom to see if towels were brought as promised.  They were not!  And the soppy wet towels were still piled on the floor (no place to hang towels anywhere in the bathroom).  Oh...and when I took my shower earlier it was lukewarm at best.  NO hot water.  I didn't bother calling the front desk again (about the towels) since i was sure nobody would answer and my husband had to skip his morning shower.  Other irritations were the TV never worked properly and the wi-fi was very slow.  In the morning we noticed the bill had been slipped under the door and we took a look at it.  Even though we hadn't used valet, we had been charged $28 for valet parking.  Great.  When we checked out, the front desk clerk (a woman this time) actually thought we were lying about the valet.  I told her I had  initialed a document stating we didn't use valet and she obviously didn't believe we had done that.  After some convincing, we finally did get a credit.  But to make a guest feel like a liar...especially after the service we'd gotten since checking in....was ridiculous.  We won't be back.Pros:  Good location, clean rooms, nice toiletries (Aveda products), modern decor, nice linensCons:  Terrible customer service, no shower doors or curtains in wheelchair accessible rooms, slow wi-fi, no hot waterThis hotel could be great.  What a disapointment.We stayed at this hotel for Vanderbilt graduation, and found it to be appalling.  Looks like a social services room, with no shower door, mildew along sink back, and a bad odor throughout.  We had expected so much better, considering the price.  Would never stay here again, esp. with so many nicer options in Nashville.  My husband says it probably began as a holiday inn and got bought out and is going on reputation.  Stay away!!!We took an overnight vacation to Nashville from KY and stayed here.  The hotel itself is beautiful and the room was very nice, great design, colors, and a comfortable bed.  The only thing I will say is that they were doing some kind of construction above us which began at around 8:00am on a Saturday morning....so much for sleeping in on vacation.  It is within walking distance to Broadway and the employees were very professional and nice.  Would have given it a 3 for the lack of sleeping in but the design, cleanliness & friendliness kept it a 4.Very modern looking decor. The room was clean, beds were comfortable and the staff was friendly and accommodating. Great location!I didn't stay at the hotel - just had drinks at the bar last night with five of the smartest women in Nashville, which of course made the experience better.  But the hotel bar made the experience better - it is not a small dark room like a lot of hotel bars - it is right out in the middle of the lobby, well-lit with high ceilings (a great environment for some meetings, not so conducive to others.....)  John, our bartender, was outstanding.  He was very attentive, very sweet, and fixed my manhattan immediately when I suggested it could use a bit more vermouth.  The live writer's night started just as we were ending the meeting, but we could have kept going.  The sound was not turned up so loud you couldn't hear yourself think, which is so often the case.  And the writers were great.  I recommend it for a great, classy, after work drink meetup!will probably be better when it's not under construction.We stayed here for a week. This is our second time staying in a Hotel Indigo - last year we stayed for a week in the West End location. I very very (very very, very very) very much prefer the downtown location (NOT West End) - we were on the 12th floor here and had no complaints about water pressure. The W.E. location had poor pressure, lukewarm water, toilets that refused to flush, sinks that drained slowly/not at all.. We had none of those issues here. The room was beautiful, modern and clean, our floor was quiet. The hotel restaurant was OK. I had a yogurt "parfait" which consisted of about a quarter cup of yogurt with two small pieces of pineapple topping .... .... ....  and how much did we pay for it? argh!  ..... But the drinks in the bar were tasty and they have nice desserts. The bar hosts writer's rounds nightly, which is a great Nashville touch. The staff is super friendly, attentive and quick.I did wish that we had a fridge/microwave in room, especially since we stayed for a longer period of time. No bathtub either, but I don't mind that so much. The bed was very comfortable (firm, not cushy, which is what I like) and the linens were very clean and fresh. This is a very insignificant thing to complain about, but is a pet peeve of mine: the in-room coffee came with powdered creamer. Not that the in-room coffee was that great to begin with, but powdered creamer just makes my eyeball twitch. A minor complaint, but it makes a difference to have the good liquid stuff, even if the good stuff is still fake chemical-ly milk. TV was fine, lots of channels.The parking blows, 22 bucks a day for valet or 20 for self-park. There is no street parking. They comped us on valet parking, maybe since we were staying with them for a decent length of time, but I'm not sure if that's the official policy or not. Our room was on Union Street, and traffic rarely was noisy enough to be distracting, although there were a couple of ambulances/fire trucks that would scream down the street. We had a nice view of the pretty new City Hall building. The hotel adjoins a somewhat mediocre Starbucks, but there are some decent dining options within walking distance - Varallo's and Provence are reasonably closeby, and then you have some tasties on 2nd avenue (nachos at Buffalo Billiards are my favorite on earth. Also, try the wings at Piranha's or the cozy Beer Sellar.. if you venture down to B'way, there's the BBQ at Jack's.. I could go on forever : ) We lived in Nashville for years before moving to Oregon and I miss the food more than I can communicate in words.) The walk to Broadway for touristy fun is quick and easy.Great experience at the Hotel Indigo downtown!!Awesome location with a very modern feel. Very close to Printer's Alley which I believe has the best bars in Nashville.The hotel is still under construction and only 1 of the 2 elevators to our tower was working. We only stayed one night so this wasn't a big deal for us. Great location and staff seemed friendly. Rooms have mini-fridge and Keurig. Bed was firm but very comfortable and the hotel was very quiet when we went to bed. Nice bar downstairs. There is also a restaurant but we didn't eat there, was a bit too stuffy for us. Overall: clean, comfy, centrally located, and felt safe. Would stay here again.The renovation on the hotel was wonderful. Great location. However there was only one elevator working at the time and during or second day it was not working. All the guests had to walk the stairs to their rooms. Nobody at the hotel ever told us about it or acknowledged the inconvenience. I have also written the hotel and the response I received never included any sort of acknowledgment of the problem. Bad customer service! I will not go back.This hotel was in a perfect location for us travelers.  It was close to all the bars and action.  Inside it was very open and lively.  It's a very nicely designed hotel.  Once again, we were stuck with a king sized bed thru our hotwire booking but we were thankfully able to get another cot.  Air conditioning was controlled by a thermostat which worked well.  The room was very nice and had an expensive feel to it.  What ruins this place was the shower water pressure.  I would rate it 1 star.  Wifi is free here.  Parking is by valet and 20 dollars.Horrible. Do NOT stay here. The toilet ran all night, we couldn't sleep. I called early at 6 am and the desk clerk couldn't do anything except take the information. I had to call back twice for the GM Mindy who when we finally spoke, scolded me for not calling to have our room changed. At 2 am, lady, I'm not really inclined to change rooms. Why couldn't you just apologize that your housekeeper/maintenance staff hadn't heard what you could hear every three minutes: a rush of water in the toilet? Also the impression I got from the overwhelmed waitstaff in the restaurant, and lacksidasical valet and desk clerks, that they were full, and overwhelmed. The nicest, most helpful person there was Miss Donna, a housekeeper.
review_content_80: We were in Nashville for 6 nights, and stayed here the entire time.  We had a very nice stay here, everything was very clean and our rooms were quiet.   John, one of the hotel bartenders, pours the best bloody mary's we had ever had, and those alone would be reason to come back!  If you're looking for a hotel downtown, I would highly recommend it, it is walking distance to most of the attractions.  After visiting all the different parts of the city though, we decided that for our next trip there we would probably stay in the Bellmont/Hillsboro neighborhood, so their Westend location would probably suit that a little better.I stayed here one night to attend a show at the nearby theater. The bar was very nice, the price as expected, the decor, plumbing, bed quality all good. Nice boutique feel, BUT! When I checked out and had driven a couple of hundred miles away I realized I had left an inexpensive but unique ring on the nightstand. I called to ask them to recover and send it. I did not get to speak to a live person except the receptionist. I got no call back. Called again, left message, no call back. Called again, demanded to speak to manager, redirected to housekeeper who basically treated me like a liar looking to chisel on the hotel. I am a 56 year old management professional and I do not intend to get used to such behavior. I emailed and called the chain's headquarters and registered and documented my loss and my complaint over my treatment. Two weeks now, and not a word of apology. These folks have a serious problem with customer service. I cannot recommend them, even though I really rather liked the place. Their cavalier behavior in response to my issue is unforgivable.

review_content: A phenomenal hotel in a great area of Nashville, right near Vanderbilt University.Check in was easy and pleasant, all the employees were beyond friendly.Rooms were extremely clean and nicely appointed, bathrooms as well were pristine. There are plenty of outlets and a nice, big flatscreen TV.The bed is one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in! I felt surrounded and cocooned, and didn't want to wake up! I was fortunate enough to be upgraded to the concierge level and I'll tell you, the amenities this room provides is like from a by-gone era. Fantastic experience all the way around. Easily a 5 star hotel, but my final grade is a 4.5 due to the fact that the one and ONLY detriment to this place are the woefully outdated and SLOW elevators. An upgrade is definitely needed there!Our stay at Lowes was wonderful. The front desk staff really set the tone and we had a great conversation with them. We opted for self parking and it was super easy. The garage was never full and the parking decks have elevators that take you right to the lobby. Our room was nice and clean with a great view of the city. I loved the decor and furnishings in the room. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom and products  (shampoo, soap, etc) were very nice as well. The vanity mirror light in the bathroom was a little dim so I couldn't use it and the carpet and door don't really get along. You essentially have to slam the door shut which, with people coming and going at all times of the night, was a bit of an annoyance. All in all, I would definitely stay at the Lowes again. This is a wonderful place to stay in Nashville.I was surprised to see the 3.5 star overall rating on this hotel.  It was more 4.5 Stars from my last experience...and only losing a star for incredibly slow elevators...like, if you're in a hurry, you're going to be late, slow!We were there for a wedding weekend, and elevators-aside this is a great hotel.  Rooms are large, and nicely appointed.  The staff is incredibly friendly...I mean FRIENDLY!  I can't say this enough.  They really seem genuinely excited you are staying at their hotel.The bar was a pretty happening place, and the restaurant, although expensive (though no different than any other hotel of this caliber), served very good food. I would recommend this Loews to anyone!I arranged a trip to Nashville last minute and the town was busy for the Predators playoff game, marathon and other events that I couldn't get a king sized bed but rather 2 they called queen beds. They could tell I wasn't thrilled and they offered me free appetizers and drinks while I was visiting to help me sleep at night lol. They still can't get their menu together for room service as they changed the menus about a year ago but haven't changed the room menus which I find to be poorly done.The room service was great since I all but trashed the place each night but I put a note and a nice tip to apologize.Overall a great trip and nice stay there.Love this pet-friendly hotel! The staff are so nice and helpful, and the rooms are big and gorgeous.Worked for me. Great service, clean rooms with a good amount of room space and countertop space in the bathroom. The blackout shades worked well for a late night and having Mason's downstairs (which is a step above some hotel restaurant experiences) is a huge plus.Reese Witherspoon stayed in the room next to mine while I was here. That alone is worth 5 stars because OMG Legally Blonde!  She also smiled at my dog, so I know she's just as cool in real life as she seems in the movies, and she seems pretty damn cool in the movies. The hotel staff must have been inspired by her presence because they did a phenomenal job. They were probably the most impressive hotel staff I've ever dealt with. Everyone was incredibly friendly and handled every request very quickly. The room was spacious and comfortable, and the view was great. The evening wine/beer/snacks were also very appreciated, especially the beer. I would definitely stay here again, but preferably not next to Ms. Witherspoon next time. She smelled kinda weird.Good hotel on the Vanderbilt campus. Room was nicely done and the concierge level breakfast was delightful. We ended up hanging out for a few hours waiting for a flight. Lobby was a little noisy, but overall a great experience at the Loews.This hotel is just beautiful. The rooms are clean and spacious. The bathrooms are very upscale. The amenities are very nice. The concierge room is huge and they offer wonderful breakfast and evening appetizers and full bar. The staff are extremely friendly. They go above and beyond. They are extremely dog friendly. I would love to come back anytime.Loews love fest! Last week it was the Atlanta Loews, not the Loews Vanderbilt. Dog friendly, which I loved. Made me wish I still had my little Eastman!Beautifully decorated, great common area to get work done and eat Twizzlers and M&Ms. Received a newly renovated room - sweeeet!Front desk remembered my name, which was nice as I scurried by on my way to a presentation, juiced up on sugar from candy.You must eat  at Mason's, the cool lobby bar. It is wonderful and the food is simply...fantastic! Kudos to the chef and the creative Southern style food choices. Great hospitality and fantastic stay!Loews vandy is..... Heaven. They welcome me and my pit doggie like we are royalty.:). EVERY time this hotel is spot on.I was in Nashville recently to celebrate my birthday and attend a movie premiere and we stayed at this hotel. I had a lovely experience. Everyone was super friendly, helpful, and conversational. I felt welcome and I felt everyone went out of their way to give us the information we needed and to make sure we were happy. Self-parking was accessible and easy. The rooms were clean and comfortable. It was quick and non-problematic to get an elevator in a timely manner. I'd stay there during my next visit to Nashville (and probably will)!If you stay here, WEAR THE ROBE!!! It is SO worth it!! This hotel was GREAT!!! The service was amazing! Everyone from the desk clerks to the housekeepers were so friendly and helpful, I really enjoyed my stay here. When I start making the amount of money it makes to stay here without financially crippling myself, I'm totally going to stay here whenever I can & whenever I go anywhere!!! They even had a Keurig coffee maker with K-cups for you to easily make a nice cup of coffee. This was amazing for me because I was there for interviewing, so it helped to be able to grab a cup of coffee and run to my interviews. It has a great view too!! depending on what side of the building you're on, you could see the top of downtown Nashville or you can see the outskirts of town ! Overall, a very nice hotel. I can't wait to stay here again!!Excellent service, amenities, ambiance, LIES!  We stayed here with our dogs and two nights in a row I saw hotel patrons arrive at a the hotel bar with their dogs.  We decided to watch a football game with our dogs (two well-mannered, geriatric beagles) and were promptly told to leave.  We were informed that the other dogs were service animals.  Upon leaving I approached one of the "service animals" and was told by the owner that it was NOT a working dog (which was obvious to me), and informed the manager of the restaurant.  He shrugged at me like I was an idiot.  I called the desk to tell them what happened.  They called me me back to let me know that the manager "thought it was a service dog" and that the error has been corrected.  Liars.  Cute.  Integrity matters, Loews.Not impressed by this 4 star- for several reasons1- the hotel is under construction.  We were woken up each morning at 7am with hammering from above.  Not the relaxing weekend we were hoping to have. 2-1-2 of the 3 elevators were down/not working throughout our stay3-we found blood stains on our sheets- housekeeping came immediately to change... But....4- our 400$/night view overlooked a wall with workers ladder & tools5- this is small, but trim was recently painted in our room and the blue trim tape was left up. The positive?  Free shuttle within 3 mile radiusStayed at the Loews for a few days. Service was impeccable. Everyone was nice there and the room service food was good too. The bar that they have in there has a great atmosphere as well. Will stay again here next time I'm in Nashville.Enjoyed my stay here so much! The staff are so very friendly and helpful. You are warmly greeted at the curb and helped inside. The rooms are clean and inviting. The bed and pillows are the most comfortable I've ever slept on in any hotel. I will most definitely be staying here again the next time I'm in Nashville. I highly recommend it.We had a number of issues during our stay; however, I must give the highest praise to the manager, Jenny,  who was extremely gracious when I spoke with her and offered a sincere apology.  She also made every effort to remedy my dissatisfaction. I am very grateful to Jenny and she is the only positive that we encountered at this hotel.The hotel staff is, by and large, very attentive.  The facility is lovely and very accommodating.If you have a social function, business meeting, or convention there, please pray that you do not have to deal with the loading dock and the head of security.  He doesn't care how much money your event is spending at the hotel, or what you need to do to accomplish your delivery, he wants you out of his dock space when he thinks you should be done.Nice hotel and relatively friendly staff.  They've done some renovations which are quite nice.  Great location if you don't want to be in the thick of tourists downtown, but close enough to be there in a matter of minutes.  Directly across the street from Vanderbilt University.  A lot of good choices for eating, getting a drink or listening to music.  I recommend the hotel and would definitely go back.
review_content_20: If I hadn't paid a premium for staying over CMAfest weekend, this place would be getting 4 stars.  Being I paid a ridiculous amount for the weekend I can't rightfully love on it.The location of the hotel is awesome if you prefer not to be downtown in the hustle and bustle.  My sister and I easily walked to drinks at South Street before dinner at Bound'ry and at Tavern the following evening.  There is a bellman driven shuttle that will take you anywhere within a 3 mile radius (downtown is roughly 1.5 miles and not a bad walk, maybe a little hilly).The rooms are pretty standard, though I prefer the eclectic Loews look over the generic Hilton rooms I've been in as of late.  Our room was clean and kept up.Fitness facility.  No.  The facility is on the second floor and was once two hotel rooms.  Yes, it is tiny.  New equipment but only our treadmills, four elliptical, two free weight benches, a cable machine, maybe something else, TINY.  No room to move around and you're right on top of the gym user next to you.   That facility needs to be expanded immediately.My sister and I used the self-serve parking for $26/day, and on the second night wondered if we could have found street parking nearby..  You may want to check the street signs before you park in the garage.Not worth the price... Check in was poorly handled. Waited 2 hours for a room with a king bed, but when I opened the door, it was a room with two small beds. My room was not clean and trash was left behind from previous guest.Construction workers left large piles of trash on the roof, which was just outside of my window. This should have been cleared daily, but was left day after day. After the second day, I just kept the curtains closed.Conference rooms smelled musty and others that I was with complained about this as well.I left my business card for management to either call or send me an email so that I could respond with my concerns. No call and no email. Not the customer service that I would expect for such a highly rated hotel.On a positive note, the wait staff in the restaurant and meeting rooms were very nice.Nice hotel and amazing staff!  Picked the hotel because it was pet friendly and sounded like they really cater to our furry family.  Unfortunately, all these goody bags other people were talking about weren't shared with our kitty.  Also, I wish there was a reference system so really clean pets would get one type of room and others would get other rooms.  Ours smelled like a pet friendly room.  The beds were super comfy though and the hotel was in a great location!Hotels are for sleeping....or should be.  At 5:30 am I received a call from security waking me up.  I hadn't requested it.  Went back to sleep and at 5:45 received another call.  Still calling the wrong room and obviously not waking up the right person.   The security officer said there must be a problem with their PBX. I called the front desk and they said they were sorry. Ok---At 6:15 I get another call from a guest that called the wrong room. I call the front desk and ask that all calls be blocked. They told me my only option is to unplug the phone.  That's it. Unplug the phone.Gorgeous hotel.  Was greeted promptly at the entrance by friendly valets (you can choose to valet or self park, I chose valet...both options do cost $).  I was efficiently checked in at one of the three sleek minimal check-in desks.  The entire lobby staff is friendly and very helpful.I was on the club level, and there are the most delicious chocolate croissants available for breakfast in the morning in the two floor club lounge. The room itself was sleek and felt luxurious- comfy king bed with great linens, large desk, and handy plugs with USB ports for easy charging for electronics.  Bathroom was also fairly spacious with a great glass wall shower with big showerhead.  I also liked the Loews hotel toiletries.  Free wifi available throughout the hotel is a bonus, and so was the gorgeous view of downtown Nashville from the huge windows.  The hotel, near Vanderbilt, was just a few miles from downtown Nashville, and was also very convenient to the highway.There's also a lounge on the first floor, along with Ruth's Chris on the lower level.  The lobby is spacious and well appointed, with cushy chairs to hang out on.The Loews Vanderbilt is a great place to stay. It's right across the street from Vanderbilt University, within walking distance of Midtown or Hillsboro Village, and a very brief cab ride (~5-8 minutes) from downtown Nashville. If you're flying in, the hotel is about 20 minutes from the airport and it's a flat $25 fare.Upon arrival, you'll find that the staff are incredibly helpful and polite. During my stay, the lobby employees were frequently happy to go the extra step, whether that meant having the cab ready by the time I completed checkout, or providing detailed directions on what to do in Nashville.The lobby area is nicely laid out; lots of space to hang out or gather with other guests. As other reviews have cited, the multi-screen TV in the lobby bar is great if there's a big game on, and the dimmed bar lighting creates a laid-back ambience. Rooms are well-maintained, comfortable, and plenty spacious; I was especially happy to have a very nice view of downtown Nashville with lots of ambient light. With all that (plus the free wi-fi!) you definitely get the above-average experience and amenities that you pay for at this hotel.Overall, this is a great hotel, and I have no complaints or constructive feedback. As a final note, I'd recommend that if you're coming here to visit Vanderbilt or head downtown, you should check out a few of the other hotels down West End Ave. which also give you walking access to campus for a possibly cheaper rate. Loews is a nice hotel, for sure, but you may want to look elsewhere if you're looking to save.Our association hosted a week-long convention at this Loews. It's a beautiful little hotel. Great ambience, friendly staff. Rooms are updated and CLEAN. I would definitely stay here again given the opportunity. Mason's (the hotel restaurant/bar) is GREAT.The hotel is not as appealing from the outside as it is on the in. First, valet is quick to approach and make sure your vehicular needs are met. The concierge was inviting and incredibly friendly to my dog who may not have taken a liking to them at first. They gave my pup a complimentary gift bag with a bone, bowl and toy, not to mention menu selection for the four legged companions as well. Stayed on the 11th floor which has a social hour section with complimentary beer, wine and hors d' oeuvres . We had nice conversation with other travelers that flocked to Nashville to see the #2 ranked firework display for 2014, just under New York City's display and our hardworking wait staff Joe!   The halls were very clean and fresh, as well as the spacious room. I'm a fan of the modern and eclectic design including the stone tiled stand showers with glass doors. Had a pretty view of Vanderbilt from the window. Two issues I ran into were... if you're going to park on any floors higher than lobby level, anticipate having to take the garage elevator to Lobby level (no further) and hauling your things to the main lobby elevator. Secondly, you always need your room key to make the elevator ride to the 10-11 floors, after a while I got the hang of it. Otherwise, great Hotel in West End Village connected to Ruth Chris with wonderful amenities and walking distance to Vanderbilt, other eateries like Five Guys or Jasons Deli and just a few minutes/10 min walk to downtown. I would suggest staying here any day !There is a lot to like about this hotel.  First, the location is ideal; directly across from the Vanderbilt University campus, accessible to the interstate and great restaurant choices. We are traveling with our 100 lb. dog and guess what?  They allow pets (for an additional fee).  This is very convenient for us, especially since there are many places to walk him around for a little "relief".  The room itself is clean, modern and comfortable.  The beds are VERY comfy and the mattresses feel new.  Look for deals and you can end up with a free breakfast to enjoy as well.The staff was very helpful and friendly.  I will definitely stay here again when the situation requires me to be in Nashville.We stayed here as participants in the Rock and Roll Country Music Half Marathon and it was satisfactory for what we needed and for the price we paid. This is a west end hotel - (NOT downtown) and the walk from the hotel to downtown is separated by approximately 2 miles and a questionable part of town. Thankfully they do have a shuttle that is available on a first come first served basis. This worked out great for us on a couple of occasions and not so well as the hotel got busier. The staff at this hotel were really nice and very accommodating - no complaints in that department! The hotel made available a "carb load" meal (pasta, bread, etc) the night before the event at a reasonable price.  This enabled us to relax and eat in our room so we could rest and ready ourselves for the early morning start of the race on Saturday.  They also made available a choice of a few items on the morning of  the race (bagels, cereal, juice, etc) as well as free water.  This was also a nice touch and appreciated by all runners, I'm sureLastly I would like to mention the beds - really comfortable and the room was very nice.  The entire hotel is well kept and very appealing. The only real complaint I have is the limited amount of coffee they provide for free (once it's gone you have to pay) and the only bottled water they have in the room is at a cost of $7.00 each! $7.00...REALLY? Be sure to stop and get water and snacks or you will pay a hefty price if you get stuck without at the hotel. All in all I would recommend this hotel.The hotel is very nice, but I gave it 3 stars as I recently received my statement from them and found several billing errors - as did several of my coworkers. We were there for a work event a few weeks ago. Several of us were charged for mini bar charges (an $8 cookie, etc) and charged double for valet parking and self parking on the same day. The hotel was nice when I called back and removed the charges, but if you stay here, be sure to check your statement carefully.Nice hotel. There is no governor on the AC so you can make icecubes in your room if you want. The rooms are nice and well appointed. However, they do have a bit of a dated look. I wasn't able to determine why I think that. It could be the room doors that lead to other rooms or the furniture. Not a big deal, just an observation.The lobby is beautiful. You can tell this is where they spend their money. The bar uses fresh ingredients for their drinks. That is a definite plus. The restaurant was pretty good. No complaints there. They have covered parking and the employees are very pleasant. No complaints.This place was great, friendly staff, restaurants withing walking distance.HOTEL IS PET FRIENDLY.  Great to see all the other dogs in the hotel. they do charge a pet fee, but they gave a lowes food bowl, food, water etc for  our dogs.nice extra touchEverybody can't be this nice in Nashville is what I thought, but everyone in the service industry that we encountered was that nice and helpful and accommodating to our needs. We were here for a conference and had the pleasure of staying here. The rooms were very nice and clean. The bathrooms were as well. The service was wonderful. The concierges were always beyond helpful and kind. They have a great shuttle service that will take you and pick you up, up to 3 miles away (to 10 pm) for free. That was great for us. Downtown isn't too far from this hotel so that was a great perk. In summary, this was a great hotel!Undergoing significant renovations but kudos to the hotel for providing perks to hotel stayers as a consolation for renovation inconveniences such as a free in-room movie, discounted dinner room service and half-price parking fees. The room was spacious and well-appointed. The parking garage is tight!!! Big cars/trucks beware!  They're extremely pet friendly.  Your doggies get a complimentary gift bag delivered to the room with a tiny bag of gourmet dry dog food, a food and water bowl, two dog chew/bone treats, a dog tag, water, and city pet magazine! They even have free pet beds you can request for your dogs to sleep on. You can tell that they wash the pet beds regularly. They even have a pet menu!We were fortunate enough to stay on the 10th floor. The service was impeccable. Miguel working the concierge lounge was one of a kind. He was so attentive and very good at his job. This hotel was lovely. We cannot say enough positive things!!!!Great hotel with a reasonable rate.Condition - 4 starsThe room was nicely furnished.  It was clean and overall in great condition.  Didn't eat at the restaurant/use the bar but the common areas were all in great condition and looked very nice.Overall the hotel looked and felt luxurious.Service - 4 starsEveryone was friendly.  Bell desk was efficient, room service (breakfast) was efficient, check-in/out was rather slow with only one out of three desks open.Free use of computer at the business center to print out boarding pass is always appreciated.Price - 3 stars$200/night 'regular' (refundable) rate, which I think was fair for a hotel of this level.Overall this is a great option if you need to visit the Vanderbilt university.I want to take a few minutes to rave about this hotel. The staff was very friendly and professional and genuinely seemed to care about our stay/visit to their hotel. My sister and I attended a concert at The Wildhorse Saloon and upon arrival at the hotel the concierge helped us with directions, transportation and information about the venue. The room and amenities were excellent as well as the location and layout. The morning of our departure we asked for a recommendation for breakfast. The concierge gave us some knowledgeable answers, directions and then went on to suggest that we store our bags and make use of the hotels Mercedes SUV. The driver took us to a local cafe called Noshville and then returned to pick us up. The effort put forth by every member of this staff will not go unnoticed and I fully intend to use this chain again in the future as well as tell everyone else that visits this area. Wonderful staff and excellent hotel!!!!Trust me-- do NOT stay at the Loews Vanderbilt!I was in town for my friend's wedding and she reserved a block of rooms for bridesmaids and folks coming in from out of town. I happily reserved a room for my boyfriend and I at a reduced rate of $149/night. The room was nice...$7 for a bottle of Fiji water, but hey, no surprise there. The room was clean, spacious, and the brunch was spectacular. Got my receipt when I checked out...no surprises at $555 and some change.HOWEVER.I checked my bank account this morning-- pending charge of $732 from Loews!Que?So I called...apparently, they charge $70 a day for "incidentals" if you pay with a debit card. Now, is this an instance of "I'm young and should've known better" or "The hotel should've told me"? When I called to ask about the charges, the hotel acted like I should've known that it was common to charge a fee when one pays with a debit card. However, I personally think that good business practice is to inform your client *whenever you will charge them more than the price you've confirmed.* It's just courtesy to remind people, even if it IS common to charge for "incidentals." Sorry, Loews. Plenty of other hotels in that area to stay if I ever find myself in Nashville again.Loews is happily situated near down-town Nashville, offering shuttle service to nearby attractions.From our arrival on location, the staff were friendly and accommodating. Our bellboy, Rocco, cheerfully offered suggestions regarding local activities for our toddlers.The hotel design aesthetics are bold and attractive, featuring a rustic industrial motif. The lobby bar is fantastic for busy work or mixers--the grid-style television display sells the ambience. The room was well-appointed and basic wifi provided at no additional cost.If you are traveling with children, the "kid menu" food selection from the lobby restaurant is fairly diverse. My own toddlers, who typically share with me, loved their breakfast of bagel with smoked salmon, cream cheese, capers, and arugula.
review_content_40: I really didn't know what to expect from this hotel because the reviews are a bit up and down. I had won a trip to Nashville from a songwriting competition and asked that they book me at decent hotel because I'd be traveling solo for the week. I arrived at the Loews  at about 3:30 pm and the front desk informed me that my room was not ready. After flying all night/day from Honolulu I was very tired so this was not the greatest news. I hung out in the lobby bar which had free wi-fi and a man playing beautiful music on a grand piano.An hour later I headed up to my room which was located on the 11th floor at the very end of the hallway. I'm not sure if all the rooms are this spacious, but my room was pimpadocious! I liked the modern decor and the bed was very comfy. The bathroom was not spectacular and I wasn't stoked on the low shower pressure, but the Keurig coffee maker more than made up for it. I've never used one before and boy did I put it to good use! Every day I made a fantastic cup of coffee for myself and wrote music in my cozy hotel room. I don't have very moments to myself and I soaked up every hour of alone time in my hotel robe.Each day I'd venture out to explore the city and would call my car around from my room. I decided to valet for $26 a day rather than self-park for $21 because I hate walking by myself from parking lots. It's the after effects of watching way too many horror movies while a teenager methinks. The valet were so nice and always quick to bring my car. Before I'd depart they'd ask me if I need directions and wished me a wonderful day. In the afternoons I'd partake in the complimentary sweet tea station set-up in the lobby. I would think to myself "Why don't we drink sweet tea more in Honolulu?!" And as I waited for my elevator back to my room I was always greeted by the men at the shoe shine station. Southern hospitality is alive and well at Loews, and I know that this is where I'll be staying on my next visit to the music city!Yelp 365 Challenge: #215/365 (The Home Away From Home)I didn't stay in a room, but from what I could tell the room was clean and comfy. The snack bar/lounge thing is cool and the snacks are good. I had a drink and some food at the bar for happy hour before going to a show in town. The food is very tasty, and the drink was good too. I had the Patron XO Cafe beverage. I believe our food consisted of wings, deviled eggs, and two other items from the menu. It was all good. My friend ended up paying, so I'm not sure how everything came out price wise. Parking is not bad if you are just there for happy hour. Find a friend to use their room key to let you out of the garage instead:)Overrated! Very expensive for an average hotel.  Staffing was horrible with a long line to check in and only two stations manned at the front desk.  Too bad they don't pay attention to their business.Im giving this hotel 5 stars because I feel like I can get a bit nasty with my reviews sometimes so when I have a good experience I have to be generous.   I'm a BIG believer in customer service and some hotels really just don't make the cut with me based purely on how I am treated by their staff.  However, the employees at THIS hotel go out of their way to help you out and make sure you enjoy your stay, so here's a big thumbs up to them!  The staff here is friendly, helpful, and quick, you will feel well taken care of at this hotel.  Highly recommended if good customer service is as important to you as it is to me.  Side note:Also a great location to run as its located near centennial park.  The concierge will also give you a map for a nice 3 mile loop if you need some extra miles!Drawbacks:No pool and normally they charge for wifi in the room (we got a free pass so this wasn't an issue for me, but looks like it's usually about 10 bucks a day).As some people said, there are a few things that could be updated, but overall, I had a good experience with the Loews, particularly because of the great service we got.  My workplace held a large, week long conference here, and the staff was accommodating and went out of their way to be helpful to our 250ish members and their families.  Marina was the best and was really on top of everything.  Plus she left little presents for us in our rooms.  The food was above average for hotel food and the continental breakfast included some really nice fruit.  Though we did eventually tire of eating in the hotel restaurant, it took a lot longer for that to happen than at many other hotels.  The cobb salad was delish.  I was happy with my room, and even happier with all the puppywatching that comes with staying in a dog friendly hotel.Southern hospitality at its best! Each hotel employee with whom we interacted could not have been nicer. I recommend staying on the 10th or 11th floor for the lounge access. Convenient location directly across from Vanderbilt University.Tennies and faded jeans make me stick out at this mostly fashionistadressedObama victory party in the main Vanderbilt Plaza Hotel ballroom. It wasn't whatit was at the casualdress Cannery Mercy Lounge Obama party four year ago. Adifferent culture and a different time, from the masses to the classes. You knowthe first time is always the best!!! But the Vanderbilt Plaza Hotel has somethinggoing for it as the office home of our environmental leader Al Gore. If its good nufffor Al . . . .  The Vanderbilt Plaza Hotel piano lounge near the ballroom is a primesample of what this hotel is all about. Pianist Bill Ferrari plunks the keys with safevanilla tunes. Waiters are flawlessly uniformed and its scent is one of properupscale southern manners and flora. The victory results are about in and the evening is climaxing at the Plaza. Excuse me while I get another drink and party!!! 4more!!!I have no idea how to rate this place because I didn't pay for it, but I'll give my 2 cents because I have them. We got this room because my dad was playing a private show for a friend and he covered travel expenses. The hotel was definitely much more than I'm used to (my dad too) and we were surprised by some of the perks. I only have a couple complaints, but that's probably because this isn't my normal hotel choice.  I realize this is a luxury hotel and not a business type deal, so there's no gym.  But, at the same time, I was disappointed to find that I couldn't work out there.  Also, the internet restriction struck me, but it wasn't that big of a deal to walk downstairs and use the free wifi. I can understand why you would have to pay for room access...ahem.The location was great and not too bad of a ride or walk to Broadway where we chose to spend all of our nights. Overall, good experience, though a bit of culture-shock at the same time.This is the hotel for anyone who hasn't been to Nashville and is looking for a budget friendly and nice hotel to stay and wants to be close to the Broadway street where all the bars are located.If it weren't for the hotel's construction during the time I was there I would probably give 5 stars. The gym was clean, the staff was friendly and the rooms were great. The hotel even offered a shuttle which was really an SUV to take us wherever we wanted.The location was super convenient for me and my friends. A cab ride costs about $7 to take us to Broadway where the bars are located and if the hotel shuttle was available we just had to pay for gratuity. Would definitely stay here again when I'm in Nashville.The hotel lobby is large and very nice. There are two restaurants and plenty of comfortable seating. The two star rating comes from the fact you pay $27 in parking per night, and the hotel lacks basic amenities. No pool or sauna, no patio or outdoor seating area. The hotel also charges for wifi which was also pretty annoying. The room was clean and looked nice, but was no different than any other hotel that charges much less. Definitely not enough bang for your buck.The rooms are nothing spectacular, but most of all the chef takes absolutely NO PRIDE in his dishes or the food he/she prepares. I stayed here for about 1 month while my house was being remodeled and ordered room service quite a bit. The first couple times, I just ignored that fact that their breakfast is scrambled or fried in some kind of disgusting vegetable oil, instead of butter, and picked through the edible parts out of sheer hunger.  Instead of the pancakes coming with a dollop of butter on top, they had an indentation in the middle where the butter was supposed to be except is was a POOL OF OIL ON TOP OF THE PANCAKES. Really? To make matters worse I had specifically asked them not to use that oil anymore and room service assured me they would not. This just pissed me off and showed me that the chef really does not care about taste or presentation. Even the eggs came SOAKING WET IN OIL. How disgusting! I can't believe they would even serve this kind of food here. What a disgrace. Other than that what more is there to boast about? Food is crap. Room is below average. I even encountered an employee at the front desk who was instructed to leave a room key to another party that was staying here... I told her my first and last name 5 different times, and after trying to call the person who's name the room was under she FINALLY looked at her notes in the system and apparently could not sound out my name. Idiot. What the hell Loews? It's the little things that count so much that make a hotel great! Hospitality is one thing, but it is not going to make up for idiots who waste one's time and crappy food that I would like to see the chef eat himself. Do better please.I was looking forward to staying here after a great experience at the Loews property in Santa Monica, but was very much let down.  This place was probably nice once upon a time, but now feels grubby and looks shopworn.  Room wasn't too bad, but common areas were pretty beaten up: stained carpets, and lots of chips and nicks on the walls in the hallways and elevators.Parking was $22/day-ridiculous!  I parked at the meters across the street, more out of spite and general principles than for economic reasons.Was disappointed to see a CD player rather than an iPod dock in the room.  Who travels with CDs anymore????   Certainly the industry standard for hotels of any reasonable quality is an iPod dock.Staff were nice enough, but the place isn't worth the prices they charge.  Avoid.I stayed here with my wife for a night and loved it. The valet was quick reliable and personable. Check in was very fast even though our card wasn't properly activated the first time. Our room was very nice. The decor was very nice and all the staff was very attentive to all of our needs. Other reviews have mentioned extra fees or charges. There are PLENTY of fees to go around if you do not read. Everything in the room that you want you can buy. Prices are clearly listed and if you don't read and use them you will be charged. There are items such as an umbrella for $30, robs for $85, bottled water for $7, and candy that also cost. It is ALL OPTIONAL! We paid a total of $67 extra at checkout for valet and a room upgrade. The price for valet wasn't listed but I was going to do it either way (valet was $30/night). We had breakfast in bed from Mason's which was great and brought in a timely manner. Also from what we noticed this hotel was VERY pretty friendly my wife didn't like it much but other people did...oh well. There hotel is pricey but definitely worth it. I'd stay there again!My wife and I chose Loews Vanderbilt Hotel as our hotel for our wedding weekend in Nashville.  From the moment we came into contact the the amazing people at the hotel we had a great experience.  The team coordinating the block of rooms was friendly, helpful and very patient with the many requests for additions to the room block.  We were greeted upon arrival and the customer service got even better as the weekend progressed.  The valet team went above and beyond, helping with both loading and unloading of our 'stuffed to the brim' vehicles.  They always had the vehicle ready when I called down for it.  The rooms were comfortable and kept clean. The beds are amazing!  The staff went out of their way to offer congratulations to us on our upcoming wedding.  I felt like a 'high roller' all weekend and it was due to the fine staff.  My wife and I had an incredible weekend in Nashville and the Loews Venderbilt Hotel helped make the experience great.Bed bug complaint!! Do not stay here! I spoke to management, including the General manager of the hotel Tony Phillips and he was beyond rude. I strongly believe I had bed bugs in the hotel and have brought them back to my home. We didn't get them through an airport or taxi. I didn't take any! I asked for a refund of the $300 for the night I stayed with my son so I could recoup some of the huge extermination fees in order to combat this problem early. Tony Phillips was beyond rude and never called me back after saying he would investigate. I was beyond nice and reasonable about this issue and this is the way I was treated. What a huge mistake staying here.The four stars is for their staff--they were awesome, very friendly and did everything right to make our stay wonderful.  This made up for the hotel's lack of amenities (pool, game room for kids, video game you can borrow like the other Loews, better bathrooms, etc.).  The only thing they need to improve on is getting rid of their fleas.  Yup, you read right.  They are pet friendly, so it is not surprising, but I walked away with a few bug bites.  It is probably from the lobby because I did not feel itchy in the room.  The hotel accommodations is probably 2-1/2 to 3 stars.Beds are amazing.  Staff friendly.  I'd come back.Walking in on Friday night, tired from a long day of travel, the Loews was like a glass of sweet tea.  Alex, at the front desk, was incredibly kind and helpful during check-in.  The room was great.  The AC was cranking (and I could have changed it if I wanted to...but I didn't) and the bed was so comfortable.  Little details, like having song lyrics in the elevator, having really great smelling bath products, and providing icy peach water in the lobby made my stay there a treat.Nice hotel was there on business and they took care of us. The beds are comfy and love the huge shower! Only bad thing was they was filming the show Nashville and made getting in and out of the hotel a pain. But nice place to stay little bars and eateries around it within walking distance.I had a very nice experience at this Hotel.  What a nice surprise.  The room service was delicious, the room was clean and up to date, and the bathroom was in very good shape...will stay there again.
review_content_60: I didn't stay here, but I took a nap in their bed while I waited for my mom to finish packing from her trip!  Super comfy bed!The only encounter with staff that I had personally was with the valet staff, who was always right at my wheels and ready to park my car, although I never did need their services.My mom received a $50 credit to spend at the hotel, which I thought was great.  So after humming and ha-ing over the gift shop to find items to total to $50, she made some purchases for friends and family, and charged it to the room.  When she went to check out, they informed her that the credit did not include items from the gift shop, so not only did she have to pay for those items, but she still had this $50 that was going to go to waste!She ended up spending it on a fruit/cheese plate and some flat breads from the hotel kitchen, which was really for me (since she was headed to the airport).  So boyfriend and I feasted that night on the hotel, but overall, I'd say my mom got duped out of $50.Kind of a high price to pay for some bread, cheese & fruit.  Not to mention that it didn't seem like the hotel was living up to the standard, considering the cost of a room.  Overall, I probably wouldn't recommend this hotel to friends/family.
