I felt it was generally overpriced, and you could get more bang for your buck at one of the many other hotels in the area.We stayed here during construction and they took good care of us.  Free continental breakfast if you stay on the 9th floor or higher.  Its a nice lounge over looking the college.  Rooms were very clean the people very nice.  Cabs ready to take you anywhere in Nashville.  We will go back.Comfy and clean but would probably stay downtown next time due to hassle of not being able to walk anywhere. Plus had to pay for wi-fi in room.THIS HOTEL WAS A TOTAL DUMP WITH HORRIFIC CUSTOMER SERVICE.  I made a reservation two months in advance for double beds. I showed up and the manager said they only had a king reserved. Then she said she didnt give the room away.  I asked her how she didnt give the room away if it is not reserved now. No response. Then she said she will give a discount, which of course I said I need the night free. Hallways were really dirty.  Overpriced garbage. DO NOT stay here. For the money, stay at the Hutton. It is a much better place. That's where I moved over to.Beautiful luxury hotel. Best benefits besides Pravda filled store on the lobby level is the accommodations for traveling pets. As a tour manager for a number of years, I often travel with my babies as well as clients' furry children and the Loews never disappoints. They feature special accommodations for furry visitors, I.e. furry guest food room service and special maid and valet services -- not to mention the in-room bar also houses treats for the wary little furry traveler. All room service items are also served on the finest China and Waterford crystal water bowls. How can any furry visitor ever complain. Of the thousands of hotels and motels visited, this one is far more accommodating to the other road warriors besides the human variety.For humans, there is luxurious accommodations which features spa tubs, big and fluffy robes, as well as a bed that can make one sleep for a decade without interruption. The rooms are a good size, clean, well maintained and house an expensive mini-bar. The views (on upper floors) of Nashville are amazing. One caveat for travelers was the expensive phone charges; however, with cell phones, it is possible to never use that expensive item. All in all, the Loews is a good bet especially when traveling with pets.This rating should be more of a 3.5. One of my friends was holding her wedding at this hotel, which is why we ended up staying here.  They gave us a really good rate for such a large group. Overall my experience at the hotel had been positive. Very friendly service, clean rooms, comfortable beds, This hotel would of gotten 4.5 stars from me if it wasn't for the fact that we came back to our room and it wasn't cleaned. (We had been gone from the room from 10am to 3pm... and we didn't forget to take out the do not disturb sign) I personally think that's unacceptable for a higher end hotel. Then the maid shows up at 4pm and was asking to clean the room. I told her to come back at 6pm because we were getting ready for the wedding and she said 6pm was too late. What? Seriously?! Eventually she agreed and when we came back later that evening, our room had been cleaned. Needless to say I was surprised and not very happy by that particular incident.Hotel is beautiful and the staff is beyond amazing and super friendly.  The southern style food is delicious and comforting. Great place to have a conference!Absolutely hideous hotel.  Overpriced, horrific service.  For my first 24 hours I had to be let into my room by the valet.  My room key never worked.  We went through 6 sets of new keys.  I spent all my time riding up and down the elevator and standing at the desk!  No manager contact ever.  THEN FiNALLY they switched my room....we went up and the key didn't work!,  I missed the dinner that I had come to town for and I couldn't get into my room to shower and change!  Still no manager!!  Nothing!!  So they switched me to yet another room.  I had to pack up and drag everything to the new room, all while I was supposed to be at a dinner! That had begun an hour earlier. Just silly. Never seen anything like it.  All in we made 8 different attempts to get into my room.....8!  I was told earlier that engineering had come and fixed the lock....got new keys....rode the elevator....again....keys didn't work!  Unbelievable. Still no manager!  One star is too many.Very nice hotel --  BUT very surprised that the add $70.00 per night to the charges for potential amenities - assume it is refunded if you do not use them?   Also $21.00 per day for parking was a huge surprise.  Entry from 2nd floor garage is really not up to the standards of the rest of the hotelSpacious room!  Wonderful bed!  Friendly service!  $10 cab ride (with tip) to Broadway bar scene. $30/night self park was a bit expensive.  Right across the street from the beautiful Vanderbilt campus. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance. Very easy to get to, right off interstate 40. Would stay at Loews again!I had a great stay, but that was because I was staying in an executive suite that I wasn't paying for. It was spacious, with two bathrooms, and had a kitchen tucked away on the end. We especially loved the soft bathrobes that were hanging in the closet. Their rates are on the high side and they do charge you for extras like the internet. My room included access to the Concierge Lounge, where they serve a continental breakfast and evening hors d'ouvres. Breakfast was okay, but the hors d'ouvres were just greasy little sandwiches, some olives, and fried pickle slices.My best friend and I were traveling across country and decided to stay at the Vanderbilt on our way through Nashville. We were amazed at how great of a hotel it was; from their staff, to their dining, to the bar. We checked in with a dog, and their pet friendliness was superior to anywhere else I've stayed. 5 minutes after getting into our room, a member of the staff dropped off a doggie welcome bag. The bellman who brought up our bags (no easy fete) got me ice for my stow-away coors lights, and proceeded to help me make room in the fridge as well. The bad tending staff downstairs was exceptional, and helpful. He helped to provide with information about the city and transportation. The best part is everyone who works there is knowledgable about the hotel, not seeming to not be helpful. It makes for such an easy stay when everyone is on the same team in terms of customer service. Definitely will be staying nowhere else other than the Loews when in Nashville, as well as look forward to seeing their brand elsewhere!As many other reviews point out, the amenities are dated, the restaurant is awful (see their menu online; I feel I was warned about this), the prices are inflated, and ongoing construction is a problem. Wireless internet is often too slow to use; I generally gave up trying. The fitness center lacks a pool. The rooms are comfortable and reasonably well-appointed, but not for the price. The breakfast and happy hour available if you stay above the 9th floor are nice touches, and the staff is generally friendly and helpful. It's a comfortable night's sleep. The location is convenient to downtown or west Nashville, and especially to Vanderbilt. It just isn't worth nearly $500/night with parking, internet, and various fees included. There is no gift shop. Need some Tylenol? Feminine hygiene products? A snack? A toothbrush? The front desk will cheerfully direct you to the pharmacy at the far end of campus - hope you drove here, never forget to pack anything, or like long walks. They have plenty of empty space that could be used for a shop, but that was not one of their choices in the indefinitely-ongoing renovations. The concierge service was cheerful but iffy. I called down for directions back to the airport and was told I could come down and look at a map - they couldn't tell me over the phone to take I-40 to which exit, or about how long it took. They gave me incorrect information about how to print boarding passes before leaving, telling me I had to pay for it (the front desk straightened that out). They had shockingly few suggestions for fine dining or live music.  The places they recommended were not very good, in a city with lots of great food and music.  You may want to do your research before traveling.I'd rate the hotel reasonably highly if it were $150 or $200/night. For that price, all I want is a clean room and a bed, a TV, and no frills are required. At these prices, though, one expects the very best in accommodations and service. You won't get that here. If you aren't paying for your stay, want to be in the Vanderbilt area, and nearby hotels are booked (my problem), this wouldn't be a bad place to stay. If you're going to be busy all day and just want a comfy place to sleep, this is fine. But if you're paying, you deserve much more bang for your buck.Came here on a recommendation and a deal from my sister (she knows people) ; ) Overall, I was very happy with the hotel. After my 6.5 hr drive from Chicago, I was able to check in early without hassle. The location is great  -- awesome proximity to downtown, nice accommodations (i.e. comfortable bed and linens, yummy coffee, nice decor), friendly staff members. Also, we had a beautiful view of Vandy's campus from our 7th floor room.  My only complaint is the up charging of EVERYTHING. Parking - $21/day!, Wifi - additional up charge and to top it all off... the room was stocked with treats and bottles of water that I didn't dare open - $5 a for a bottle. I was scared to take the postcards provided on the desk, in fear that I would get an extra $100 charge on my CC. If I'm ever in Nashville again, I'll stay here -- but this time, I hope I'm not paying.I stayed here this weekend with a group of friends while visiting Nashville. While we can say I didn't spend too much time in the room, the accommodations were excellent. We always had fresh towels made readily available, maid service came at a reasonable time while we were out of the room, and everything was left in perfect order. Also, we were able to reserve on the 10th floor which gave us a nice view of the city. Every afternoon, they serve free hours d'ouevres in the 10th floor lounge from 5pm to 7pm and complimentary sodas and water.   The parking was right next to the building and everything connects to the hotel. You can even open and close the garage gates with the room key. If you don't feel like taking the car out for the day, they offer a complimentary shuttle that will take you pretty much wherever you want to go and pick you up as well.I definitely enjoyed staying at this hotel. The pros are that the staff are very friendly and helpful. The location is great; across the street from Vanderbilt. The rooms are nice without being plush. The workout room is large for a hotel, and towels were provided, as well as lemon water. (Watch out though, it's really strong lemon water.)The cons are that the workout room had several broken machines in it. The room wasn't super-clean, although it was overall clean. And there is not free internet in the rooms. I wasn't staying long enough to need it, so it didn't matter anyway.We loved this hotel. It was under construction during our stay which made it tough but it didn't impact us that much. We took advantage of their free 3-mile shuttle service which was great! The staff was friendly and accommodating. There is also a free bus that can take you around town although we didn't use it.I got a great deal on Priceline and was able to stay at this 4-star hotel for less than $100.  That said, there are some add-ons that you need to include, even if you do get a deal on Priceline.Internet is $9.95/day.The connection is pretty good, but could be slow at times.  I had trouble connecting to the server, but I called the Tech Help Hotline and they fixed the issue in a matter of minutes.  The manager sent up his business card, a free small bottle of single malt whiskey, and some chocolate to apologize for the inconvenience.  Classy.  Valet parking is $24/day.If you call down for your car 5 minutes before you go downstairs, they will have the car waiting for you.  Very friendly, quick, and efficient.The hotel is conveniently located near Vanderbilt University.  We had a quiet corner room on the 2nd floor.  The bed was excellent, as were the pillows.  The room was a little on the smaller side, but well furnished.  The shower could stand to be updated, but was clean and functional.I'd say this hotel is somewhere between a Marriott and a JW Marriott in terms of amenities.  There is no pool, but that didn't bother me.  I would stay here again because the room was comfy and the service was EXCELLENT.  I can't say enough good things about the friendliness and professionalism of the staff.We arrived not realizing that the hotel was under rehabilitation. I was nervous. But, from the moment we walked up to the front desk, everyone couldn't have been nicer and more accommodating. Construction is only 9 a.m - 6 p.m. - not when most people would be sleeping. And they give free wifi to guests, discounted dinners and a free movie each night in the room just to make you feel good. The room as spacious, clean and the hotel was much quieter than I could have even hoped. The bed was heavenly. These folks know how to treat guest well!I like the Loews Vanderbilt.  Overall, I'm a fan of Loews hotels, and this was no exception.  I'm giving it a four star, when it could be 3.5 or 3.75, simply because they were smart enough to create a "living social" group coupon deal that made a visit to Nashville worth it.  Two nights, valet parking, and two tickets to the Country Music Hall of Fame for something like $200.  Great deal, good job team Loews.  The amenities were updated (flat screen, big comfy bed, desk and good furniture).  Bathroom was so-so, and overall the room a bit toight.  That said, they've got a Ruth's Chris in the bottom floor, and are within walking distance of some great locations (i.e. Vanderbilt is across the street, plenty of restaurants in the area, etc.).  Speaking of great locations... walk down West End ave to the Hutton Hotel, go into Grill 1808... and get the burger.  It's the greatest burger I've ever had. There ya go... two reviews in one.  Enjoy your stay.
review_content_80: We just checked out of the Loews Vanderbilt and would not choose to stay there again....ever. Our connecting rooms had views of a concrete wall, there was a tylenol left on the bathroom room floor and a can of cleaning spray by the tv. Not so great when you are traveling with a 2 year old. Mold on the ceiling fans, dirty doors, and shower heads that were really more like a sprinkler system. Breakfast was a disaster. Cold english muffins, soupy oatmeal, unrecognizable meat on the egg dish and it took forever. Ick. The bellman never showed up to help all 5 of us with our luggage so we ended up thunder gunning it down ourselves. The front desk staff...rude and the concierge was clueless. Extremely disappointing. Next time we are in Nashville we'll stay at  Union Station. For the $$$$, Loews IS NOT worth it. It felt more like a motel 6. Boo!!!!Excellent service. Friendly staff. great location Right across street from Vanderbilt. The room was large. Had a comfortable king size bed.  The bar downstairs had live music.  Overall quite pleased.I stayed here for a conference last year.  The lobby is very pretty and rooms were nice - the beds were super comfortable. Since I wasn't paying, I wasn't too concerned with the price, but I do think it's a bit much for what you get. The conference facilities were nice, but I had a horrible meal in the restuarant (crappy, overpriced food and horrobel service). The workout room is pretty small and basic, and the hotel itself is kind of far from the main drag with most of the bars and resturants. If I come back to Nashville, I would look elsewhere for a place to stay.Before I moved to Music City, I stayed in the Loews for a weekend.  (Lucky me, I know) It is probably one of the best hotels in town.  Conveniently located across the street from Vanderbilt, it is usually frequented by Vandy parents during game weekends and parent weekends.  CAUTION! Don't even try to book a room during Vanderbilt move in weekend or graduation.  Typically, the rooms are booked a year in advance. When I stayed there (several years ago), they had offered some smoking rooms, however the laws have changed in Nashville, so they may not offer them anymore!Obviously I ordered a Vanderbilt Sunday from room service, and obviously it was awesome!Hotel was really nice and clean.  The lobby was nice, the staff was helpful and friendly.  I enjoyed my stay here and will stay here again.  The location is great as it is right opposite Vanderbilt University as well.We had a very arroyos issue while staying here. I originally made my reservations through a manager named Doug. Upon arrival I left him two message to call my room or my cell, he never did. When I asked I was informed her was on site but "busy". However I got to meet Eli who not only immediately took care of my issue but continued to tell me she understood why I was so upset. Her reaction and her instant response to the very serious situation is what make me give this place a good review.Sometimes you judge a place based on how well they deal with an issue. I got to the hotel late (10PM), but wasn't worried as I had a guaranteed reservation. Of course they were overbooked and didn't have a room. I was "walked" (new industry term I learned) to the "brand new" Hotel Indigo (see my review on that on) 3 blocks away. The front desk was really apologetic, but asked "do you need a ride?" 10 pm. Not from Nashville. Do I need a ride??? I didn't answer.Someone else in our party had been "walked" as well and they were given a rash of hell for this by our CEO. They comped both of our rooms at the Indigo, picked up dinner for 7 Thurs night, sent a nice gift basket to our rooms and issues 3-4 personal apologies. They recovered well.The room was small and a little dated (especially after staying at the Indigo with 2 (two) flat screens in the room). The rest of the facilities (save the restaurant...don't go) were fine. They know how to host meetings well. Bartender downstairs fixed a pretty good martini (gin selection needs work).1 star without the good recovery. 3 for handling it well and addressing it directly.This may have been my favorite hotel that I have been to. The staff was awesome. There was a nice fitness room. I am used to staying in roach motels, so this was a welcome change. It is a very cheap cab ride downtown with plenty of food options surrounding the hotel.We stayed here for convenience; close to children's hospital. Arrived about 4am and didn't want to look around for hotel.  Location and hotel are very nice.  The room was small and expensive, even with discount.  Hooray that wi-fi and parking were free...maybe because it was Saturday? Probably won't stay again.I stayed here on my first ever visit to Nashville, and I can't say i was that impressed. My first reaction based on the price i was shocked at how small the rooms are, and the hotel itself just is nothing to great. I'm not that hard to please I tend to stay at W hotels, or boutique hotels but I have also been in my share of less expensive hotels/motels across our fine country. My feeling is if you are going to spend the big bucks you better get what you pay for.. As for location if you want to be next to Vanderbilt you don't get much closer, if you want to be downtown and hit the strip well there are plenty of hotels down there and I would suggest looking into those. Now the real reason i write this review: Be warned. I got a call from someone claiming to be the front desk at this hotel asking for my credit card number while i was in my room and they knew my name. If this ever happens to you just tell them no and go to the front desk. I was caught off guard, the person who called said my card was not accepted I thought that was odd and at their request i went ahead and gave the card number again, they claimed it still did not work and wanted another card, so i gave them another card number. The second card number I gave was of a card that was new and never used before or since. The following day i got a call from my card company telling me i had about $10,000 worth of charges to my personal card, one charge from a domino's pizza in Nashville (i don't eat domino's) and the rest from different Internet sites. I then checked the other card, the one that I only used once at that hotel, I had an additional $8,000 worth of charges on that card - all from the same Internet sites as my personal card. I called the hotel to explain what happened, they were not very accommodating. Obviously my credit card company will take care of these charges, i just wanted to let the hotel know that they either had someone on their staff stealing card info or more likely someone on the staff was selling the guest info to someone - all they needed to give was name and room number since I'm the one who gave my card number. When i got through to someone at the hotel, this took days, they told me they had no record of my card not being accepted, no record of any of the staff calling me. The person who called knew my room number and name for sure, and with the kind of charges they made they would also need to have billing address- all info the hotel had, and the reason again i have no doubt it was this that caused the charges. 1. I never used that one card anywhere else. 2. the first charge was a local domino's, 3. the person who called me had my room number and name. 3, The hotel says they have no record of the front desk ever calling me. My only reason for calling the hotel to tell them this was so they knew there was a problem, and so this would not happen to others. You would think the hotel would have at least given me some kind of comp, or maybe just an apology - I got neither. I will not be staying here again and I will be more careful when "front desks employees call me"I just got back from spending the weekend of the 4th at the Loews Vanderbilt.  My husband and I decided to take a roadtrip and get out of town last-minute for fun.  But we didn't have arrangments for our dog so our options were limited when searching for dog-friendly hotels.  We found the Loews and quickly made a reservation.  I was hoping they would treat guests with dogs decently but wasn't sure what to expect.I could not believe the service that my pet (as well as us!) received.  As soon as we checked in, a doggy welcome gift basket was sent to our room.  It was filled with dog treats and cookies, gourmet dog food, a food dish and welcome mat.  It was way over the top and beyond what I would have expected.  We valet parked the car for the weekend which concerned me becuase at other hotels, it seems to take a year to get your car any time you need it.  Not at Loews--our car was brought to us consistently in minutes, which really impressed me.  Every time we stopped in or out of the hotel, they were nice to us and asked us how our dog was doing in the hotel.Late on the 4th of July, I needed to do something for work on a computer, but the concierge facility was closed.  They let me use the business center computer at no charge for over an hour.  It's this kind of service I really appreciate above any facilities.  I would absolutely stay here again and recommend it--especially to anyone traveling with pets!If you believe in getting what you paid for, do not visit this hotel. The hotel is a dump for a "4 1/2 star" or whatever you want to believe based on your research.  I don't know where the good reviews come from but if you come in during the PM shift, from my experience,  you will be treated like dirt. The front desk staff was extremely rude. The valet driver's were nice until they realized I didn't want to pay $78 for 33 hrs worth of parking (plus expected tips I suppose). Loews brands themselves as "kid friendly"...I had a 2 1/2 yrd old along and they didn't once mention anything special. There is not even a pool at this location. There was a hair in the bathroom and hair on the bed comforter we did not place there. The building is falling apart. It looks like they did a recent renovation but it was incomplete. The light switch covers are stained and there is wear and tear everywhere. The ice machines are from the 80's maybe and you have to go to an "even" floor to get ice. Some of the ceiling tiles are not placed properly and the elevators smell like mold. This place needs help and I need a refund. Dissatisfied completely. I should have read the reviews before staying - bed bugs....doesn't surprise me. What a ripoff.Yeah, I'm bumping the Loews Vanderbilt Hotel up to four stars... SUPER comfy pillows on the bed, a Keurig coffee machine in my room, and nice smelling travel sized shampoos, etc. Helpful and friendly front desk/valet hotel staff and complimentary candy corns at check-in.If this place wasn't a luxury hotel with fairly expensive rates I would have considered giving it a higher rating.  The hotel staff was very friendly, but after a very tiring day of of traveling (full of delays) we arrived at 3pm (the time of check-in) only to discover that they wouldn't have a room for us until 4:30pm.  Not to mention I had requested early check-in!  Our room was a bit on the small side with 2 full size beds, and the bathroom didn't have a fan, making the whole room foggy and hot and hard to get ready.  And internet was expensive ($10 per day). All that aside, the conference rooms were nice (aside from a time or two when our electronic equipment was not ready), the lobby is beautiful, and their in-house restaurant nice for lunch.
